Info: The Beninese singer-songwriter covers the entire Talking Heads' 1980 album Remain In Light.

Title: House of Sugar
Info: The latest full-length release for the Philadelphia artist features contributions from Samuel Acchione, Molly Germer, John Heywood, Tom Kelly, Jacob Portrait, and Emily Yacina.

Title: Promises
Info: The nine-part project from Floating Points, Pharoah Sanders and the London Symphony Orchestra was recorded in Los Angeles and London.

Title: 50 Song Memoir
Info: Each song represents one year in frontman Stephin Merritt's life in this 50-song, five-disc set from the indie pop band.

Title: Heaven & Earth
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles jazz saxophonist features contributions from Tony Austin, Ronald Bruner, Jr., Brandon Coleman, Cameron Graves, Terrace Martin, Miles Mosley, Patrice Quinn, and Thundercat.

Title: Halcyon Digest
Info: The Atlanta-based quartet's fourth album combines calm shoegaze pop and noisy punk rock to create a dreamy, psychedelic sound.

Title: Dissociation
Info: The sixth and final full-length studio release for the New Jersey mathcore band.

Title: Dark Energy
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Gary, Indiana electronic producer.

Title: The Great White Sea Eagle
Info: The Cardigans' Nina Persson joins the latest full-length release for Scottish singer-songwriter James Yorkston and The Second Hand Orchestra.

Title: Radyo Siwèl
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian-born artist was influenced by her Haitian heritage.

Title: Floreat
Info: The British singer-songwriter's second album produced by Dan Carey was delayed for three years after EMI took over her previous record label.

Title: 'Sno Angel Like You
Info: The Giant Sand leader is backed by an eight-member gospel choir on this 14-track set.

Title: Beautifully Human: Words And Sounds Vol. 2
Info: The soul singer returns with a follow-up to her Grammy-nominated debut.

Title: Welcome Interstate Managers
Info: The New York-based indie-pop band, led by Adam Schlesinger and Chris Collingwood, returns with a long-awaited third LP.

Title: Midwest Farmer's Daughter
Info: The debut full-length release for the country singer-songwriter was recorded at Sun Studios in Memphis.

Title: Assume Crash Position
Info: The Democratic Republic of Congo group releases its latest album featuring such guests as Kasai All stars and guitarist Manuaku Pepe Felly.

Title: Luxury Problems
Info: After two EPs last year, the Manchester producer releases a full-length electronic release featuring the operatically trained vocalist Alison Skidmore.

Title: Space Is Only Noise
Info: The electronic producer who attends Brown University releases the first full-length album of his brand of sub-100-bpm house music.

Title: Midlife: A Beginner's Guide To Blur
Info: The two-disc set contains some biggest hits, band favorites, and rare singles.
Originally conceived for Nike as a workout mix and released on iTunes, the physical release includes three songs previously available only in the UK.

Title: Platinum
Info: The fifth full-length release for the country singer features guest appearances from Little Big Town, the Time Jumpers (a Grammy-nominated western swing ensemble that includes Vince Gill), and Carrie Underwood.

Title: God Save the Animals
Info: After several years of going by the name (Sandy) Alex G, the Philadelphia-based artist returns to his original stage name Alex G for his ninth full-length studio release.

Title: Dogrel
Info: The debut full-length release for the Irish indie rock band was produced and mixed by Dan Carey.

Title: LCD Soundsystem
Info: Hipsters, rejoice! James Murphy, one-half of the in-demand indie-rock production duo The DFA (The Rapture, et al), finally makes his full-length debut as an artist as LCD Soundsystem.

Title: A Kind Revolution
Info: The 13th full-length solo studio release for the British singer-songwriter was co-produced with Jan "Stan" Kybert and features guest appearances from PP Arnold, Madeleine Bell, Boy George, The Strypes' guitarist Josh McClorey, and Soft Machine's Robert Wyatt.

Title: Elwan
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Tuareg blues-rock band features guest appearances from Alain Johannes, Mark Lanegan, Matt Sweeney, and Kurt Vile.

Title: Double Negative
Info: The 12th full-length release for the indie rock trio was produced by B.J. Burton.

Title: The Blade
Info: The second full-length release for the country singer-songwriter (who is also a member of Pistol Annies) was produced by Vince Gill and Justin Niebank.

Title: This Is Where I Live
Info: The first release in 10 years for the soul artist was produced by John Leventhal.

Title: It's Great to Be Alive! [Live]
Info: The three-disc live album collects 35 tracks from its three-night stand at the San Francisco's Fillmore Auditorium in November 2014.

Title: Raven
Info: The second full-length studio release for Kelela features contributions from such artists as s Junglepussy, Kaytranada, LSDXOXO, and Shygirl.

Title: 3 Pears
Info: The first studio album in seven years for the country singer-songwriter features two songs produced by Beck and a song co-written with Robert Ritchie (aka Kid Rock).

Title: Every Bad
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Dana Margolin is its first on the Secretly Canadian label.

Title: Black Sheep Boy
Info: This is the fourth album for the Austin band led by singer-songwriter Will Sheff.

Title: Seek Magic
Info: This is the debut album for Dayve Hawk as Memory Tapes.

Title: Cosmogramma
Info: Thom York, Ravi Coltrane, and Laura Darlington appears as a guests on the experimental producer/artist's third full-length album.

Title: Close Ties
Info: The latest release for the country singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Rosanne Cash, Sheryl Crow and John Paul White.

Title: Koi No Yokan
Info: The seventh studio release for the Sacramento alternative metal group was produced by Nick Raskulinecz.

Title: Shields
Info: The fourth album for the Brooklyn rock band was recorded in New York after a recordings session in Texas was largely scrapped.

Title: Beyond the Pale
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the band that includes Pulp's Jarvis Cocker, Serafina Steer, Emma Smith, Andrew McKinney, Jason Buckle and Adam Betts.

Title: Off Off On
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Kate Stables-led band was produced by Josh Kaufman.

Title: U Kin B The Sun
Info: The third full-length solo release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced with John Raham.

Title: Joy of Living: A Tribute to Ewan Maccoll
Info: The two-disc tribute to the British folk artist features such artists as Paul Brady, Bombay Bicycle Club, Billy Bragg, Paul Buchanan of the Blue Nile, Eliza Carthy, Martin Carthy, Jarvis Cocker of Pulp, Steve Earle, David Gray, Dick Gaughan, The Unthanks, Norma Waterson and Rufus & Martha Wainwright.

Title: LP1
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British experimental R&B artist Tahliah Barnett.

Title: Sound Ancestors
Info: The latest full-length release for the Los Angeles-based hip-hop artist was edited, arranged and mastered by Kieran Hebden (Four Tet).

Title: Diaspora Problems
Info: The fourth full-length release for Philadelphia hardcore band Soul Glo features guest appearances BEARCAT, McKinley Dixon, Kathryn Edwards, Lojii, Mother Maryrose and Zula Wildheart.

Title: Throes of Joy in the Jaws of Defeatism
Info: The 16th full-length studio release for the British grindcore band was produced by Russ Russell.

Title: Stone Rollin'
Info: The soul singer continues his 1960's-inspired music with a fourth album, blending vintage R&B sounds and smooth soul-pop.

Title: What Does It All Mean? 1983-2006 Retrospective
Info: The two-disc set includes the 28-track "Nothing to Fear" on disc two.

Title: Feast of Wire
Info: The Tucson, Arizona-based duo of Joey Burns and John Convertino return with their fourth full-length album.

Title: Soul of a Woman
Info: The final album for Sharon Jones (who passed away in 2016 from cancer) & The Dap-Kings was recorded on eight-track tape in Brooklyn.

Title: Kitchen Sink
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Ben Hillier.

Title: (After) [Live]
Info: The live recording of some of Phil Elverum's songs from A Crow Looked At Me and Now Only performed in a 13th century Gothic church during 2017's Le Guess Who? festival in the Netherlands.

Title: DAYTONA
Info: The third full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Rick Ross and Kanye West.

Title: Phantom Thread [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
Info: The ninth soundtrack from the Radiohead guitarist is his fourth for a Paul Thomas Anderson film.

Title: Present Tense
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British four-piece was co-produced by Lexxx and Leo Abrahams.

Title: Empros
Info: The fourth full-length album for the Chicago instrumental metal band was produced by Brandon Curtis of The Secret Machines.

Title: I See The Sign
Info: The singer-songwriter worked with Nico Muhly on his album of traditional and untraditional songs reworked into folk music.

Title: Harps And Angels
Info: The first studio album for the singer-songwriter since 1999's "Bad Love" was produced by Mitchell Froom and Lenny Waronker.

Title: Fortress
Info: The sophomore album for the post-hardcore/metal band from Whitby, Ontario, Canada.

Title: Chavez Ravine
Info: The guitarist's latest is a concept album about the residents of 1940's Chavez Ravine, a Mexican-American community near downtown Los Angeles that was famously bulldozed to make way for Dodger Stadium.

Title: Boxer
Info: Sufjan Stevens is among the guests on the Brooklyn band's follow-up to their acclaimed 2005 release 'Alligator.'

Title: Some Rap Songs
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based rapper features guest appearances by Navy Blue and Standing On The Corner as well as vocal samples of his parents: Cheryl Harris and (the late) Keorapetse Kgositsile.

Title: Scaring the Hoes
Info: The debut full-length collaboration from rappers JPEGMafia and Danny Brown features a guest appearance from redveil.

Title: Reflection
Info: The second full-length release for the British electronic producer features guest appearance from Baths, Iceboy Violet, Le3 bLACK, Nova, Eden Samara, and Xzavier Stone.

Title: The Candle and the Flame
Info: The eighth full-length solo release for Robert Forster was produced with his wife, Karin Bäumler and his son, Louis Forster.

Title: Simple Songs
Info: This is the first solo release for the experimental artist since 2009's The Visitor.

Title: Popular Problems
Info: The 13th studio release for the Hall of Fame singer-songwriter was co-written with Patrick Leonard, who also produced the album.

Title: White Blood Cells
Info: The Detroit-based "brother-sister" (or, if you don't believe everything you read, ex husband and wife) indie duo of Jack (guitars) and Meg (drums) White continue their stripped-down sound on this, their third full-length.

Title: In Time
Info: This is the first release in nearly ten years from the country rock band from Miami.

Title: Ravedeath, 1972
Info: The latest release for the Montreal-based artist was recorded in a church in Iceland.

Title: American Dream
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the rock band led by James Murphy is its first in five years (seven years for a studio album).

Title: Cee-Lo Green Is The Soul Machine
Info: Like fellow Atlanta hip hoppers OutKast, Cee-Lo has trouble sticking to a single genre, as he mixes up styles throughout this sophomore release. Timbaland, The Neptunes and Ludacris guest.

Title: The Lemon Of Pink
Info: The experimental collage artists combine samples, vocals (courtesy of Anne Doerner) and acoustic instrumentation on this second release.

Title: The Wind
Info: Diagnosed with terminal lung cancer in 2002, veteran singer-songwriter Warren Zevon decided to record one final album. This 11-track effort includes contributions from numerous Zevon friends, including Ry Cooder, Bruce Springsteen, Jackson Browne, Don Henley, Tom Petty, and Dwight Yoakam.

Title: All Hands On The Bad One
We Will Always Love You
Info: The third full-length release for the Australian electronic duo features guest appearances from such artist as Blood Orange, Leon Bridges, Vashti Bunyan, Neneh Cherry, Rivers Cuomo, Perry Farrell, Karen O, Jamie xx, Mick Jones, Sananda Maitreya (formerly known as Terence Trent D'Arby), Johnny Marr, MGMT, Oroño, Sampa the Great, Pink Siifu, Tricky, and Kurt Vile.

Title: Far In
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for Roberto Carlos Lange under the name Helado Negro features guest appearances from Benamin, Buscabulla and Kacy Hill.

Title: Punk
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Japanese quartet that includes Mana, Kana, Yuna and Yuki.

Title: Acid Rap
Info: The second mixtape for the Chicago rapper features guest appearances from Action Bronson, Ab-Soul, BJ The Chicago Kid, and Childish Gambino.

Title: All We Know of Heaven, All We Need of Hell
Info: The second full-length release for the Massachusetts alternative rock band led by Lynn Gunn was produced by Blake Harnage.

Title: Surf
Info: The collaborative debut album from Chance The Rapper with Donnie Trumpet features Peter CottonTale, Nate Fox, and Greg Landfair, Jr., with guest appearances from Erykah Badu, Big Sean, Busta Rhymes, J. Cole, and Janelle Monae.

Title: David Comes To Life
Info: The Toronto seven-piece release a four-act narrative album, as theatrical as it is musical.

Title: Tell Tale Signs: The Bootleg Series Vol. 8
Info: The latest collection of unreleased and rare songs recorded between 1989 and 2006.

Title: Blue Rev
Info: Produced by Shawn Everett, the third full-length release for Canadian indie pop band Alvvays was delayed by a number of issues including the theft of demos, a flood, COVID-19 lockdowns, and finding new band members.

Title: Lost In the Dream
Info: This is the third full-length release for the Philadelphia rock band led by Adam Granduciel.

Title: Smiling With No Teeth
Info: The debut full-length release for the Ghanaian-born, Australia-based artist features folk, funk, pop, R&B and rap influences.

Title: New Long Leg
Info: The debut full-length release for the British post-punk band was recorded in Wales with producer John Parish.

Title: L'Enfant Sauvage
Info: The fifth album for the French metal band was co-produced with Josh Wilbur.

Title: The Underside of Power
Info: The second full-length release for the quartet based in Atlanta was produced by Portishead's Adrian Utley and and Ali Chant.

Title: Gold Record
Info: The seventh full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was recorded with Matt Kinsey and Jamie Zurverza.

Title: Happier than Ever
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Los Angeles pop singer-songwriter was produced by her brother, Finneas.

Title: All at Once
Info: The seventh full-length release for the New Jersey punk trio was produced by Matt Bayles.

Title: Nerissimo
Info: The second full-length release from the collaboration between Teho Teardo and Blixa Bargeld features English, German and Italian.

Title: Way Out Weather
Info: The latest solo release for the Brooklyn-based singer-songwriter finds the guitarist backed by a larger group of musicians than 2013's Time Off.

Title: Haw
Info: The fourth release for the band led by M.C. Taylor and Scott Hirsch, features contributions from such artists as The Black Twig Pickers’ Nathan Bowles, Megafaun’s Phil Cook, and William Tyler.

Title: There is No Other
Info: The collaboration between the Carolina Chocolate Drops member with Francesco Turrisi was recorded over five days in Dublin and was produced by Joe Henry.

Title: The Intercontinentals
Info: On his latest release, Bill Frisell takes an international approach to American folk music, assembling a cosmopolitan group of musicians that includes Malian vocalist/percussionist Sidiki Camara, Brazilian guitarist Vinicius Cantuaria, and Greece's Christos Govetas.

Title: OST
Info: The soundtrack to the fictionalized account of the rise and fall of Manchester's Factory Records includes, somewhat obviously, a generous helping of New Order, Joy Division, and Happy Mondays songs (including the title track by the latter), as well as cuts from A Guy Called Gerald, Durutti Column, and the Buzzcocks. This is also the only album where you'll find the newest New Order single, "Here to Stay," a collaboration with the Chemical Brothers that failed to appear on either group's latest LP.

Title: Ocean's Eleven OST
Info: Much as he did for another Steven Soderbergh film ("Out Of Sight"), David Holmes provides the score for Soderbergh's Rat Pack remake. Much of the album consists of Holmes originals (including "69 Police," which also appears on his 'Bow Down To The Exit Sign' LP), supplemented by songs from the likes of everyone from Handsome Boy Modeling School to Elvis Presley.

Title: The Convincer
Info: The final installment in the 52-year-old Lowe's comback trilogy follows 1994's 'The Impossible Bird' and 1998's 'Dig My Mood.'

Title: The  Weird and Wonderful
Info: The debut full-length release for the British alternative rock quintet formed by two set of siblings was produced by Larry Hibbitt.

Title: untitled unmastered.
Info: The surprise release from the rapper features guest appearances from Bilal, Cee-Lo Green, Terrace Martin, Punch, Jay Rock, Thundercat and Anna Wise.

Title: Poison Season
Info: The second full-length release for Dan Bejar's solo project was produced by John Collins.

Title: When the Heart Emerges Glistening
Info: The second album for the jazz trumpeter from California was coproduced with Jason Moran.

Title: Sick!
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for rapper Earl Sweatshirt features guest appearances from Armand Hammer and Zelooperz.

Title: The Mysterious Production Of Eggs
Info: You don't see many musicians described as a "whistler" but Chicago's Andrew Bird (who is also a singer-songwriter, guitarist, and originally, a violinist) fits the bill. This is his fifth release (and second for Ani DiFranco's record label), which finds him backed by several members of his group Bowl Of Fire.

Title: Shaking the Habitual
Info: The fourth studio release for the Swedish electronic duo includes a 19-minute track.

Title: Lucifer on the Sofa
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Austin indie rock band Spoon was produced with Mark Rankin.

Title: BLACKsummers'night
Info: The first album for the singer since 2001's "Now" is part of a planned trilogy (the next two albums to be named BlackSUMMERS'night and Blacksummers'NIGHT).

Title: Girl in the Half Pearl
Info: The second full-length release for Los Angeles-based experimental R&B artist Liv.e features production from John Carroll Kirby, Aaron Liao, Mndsgn, and Solomonphonic.

Title: Spiral Shadow
Info: The Savannah, Georgia, band's new album incorporates psychedelic experimentalism with heavy riffs and sludgy doom metal.

Title: The Agent Intellect
Info: This is the third full-length release for the Detroit post-punk band.

Title: Knock Knock
Info: The latest release for the German electronic artist features guest appearances from Eddie Fummler, José Gonzalez, Sophia Kennedy, Mano Le Tough, Róisín Murphy, Arrested Development's Speech, and Kurt Wagner.

Title: Bedouine
Info: This is the debut full-length debut for Los Angeles-based artist Azniv Korkejian.

Title: Rook
Info: The Austin-based band cofounded by Okkervil River's Jonathan Meiburg releases its fifth album.

Title: Weather Alive
Info: The first full-length release in six years for singer-songwriter Beth Orton was self-produced.

Title: Nick of Time
Info: The latest full-length release for the British R&B/soul artist was recorded and produced by Bosco Mann (aka as Daptone Records' Gabriel Roth) in California.

Title: Badbea
Info: The ninth full-length release for the Scottish singer-songwriter was co-produced by Sean Read.

Title: Stranger to Stranger
Info: The 13th full-length solo release for the folk rock singer-songwriter was produced by Andy Smith and Roy Halee.

Title: Party Music
Info: Perhaps best known for being the album that depicted the World Trade Center towers in flames on its cover (before the events of September 11 necessitated a last-minute change of artwork), 'Party Music' is the fourth full-length for the ultra-political rappers.

Title: Morbid Stuff
Info: The third full-length release for the Toronto punk band was recorded by Dave Schiffman and Darren McGill.

Title: Life...The Best Game In Town
Info: This is the fifth album for the experimental rock band from Athens, Georgia.

Title: Mr. Morale & The Big Steppers
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for rapper Kendrick Lamar features guest appearances from Baby Keem, Blxst, Sam Dew, Ghostface Killah, Beth Gibbons of Portishead, Kodak Black, Tanna Leone, Taylour Paige, Amanda Reifer, Sampha, and Summer Walker.

Title: Way Down in the Rust Bucket [Live]
Info: The latest archive release from the Canadian rock artist is the live recording from November 13, 1990 at a bar in Santa Cruz, California, where they played some songs from 1990's Ragged Glory for the first time live.

Title: 50 Words for Snow
Info: Kate Bush's first new album in six years is influenced by snow and features Stephen Fry, Elton John , and Andy Fairweather Low as guest musicians.

Title: Mermaid Avenue: The Complete Sessions
Info: Woody Guthrie's daughter Nora contacted Billy Bragg about using some of the songs her father wrote in the 1940s. Bragg in turn, recruited the band Wilco to help complete the project. The Complete Sessions collects the two previously released volumes with a new third volume of songs, and a documentary about the creating the music to go with the folk legend's lyrics.

Title: Fox Confessor Brings The Flood
Info: Members of Calexico and Giant Sand help provide the music for the singer's first studio album in four years.

Title: I'm Wide Awake, It's Morning
Info: 'I'm Wide Awake' is the more country/acoustic of Conor Oberst's twin January 2005 releases under the Bright Eyes name. Emmylou Harris provides vocals on three tracks.

Title: Glass
Info: The latest collaboration between Ryuichi Sakamoto and Carsten Nicolai  was recorded at the Glass House in Connecticut in 2014.

Title: Fires Within Fires
Info: The 11t full-length release for the Oakland-based post-metal was recorded by producer Steve Albini.

Title: New Brigade
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the Danish punk rock band.

Title: Silver Ladders
Info: The latest full-length release for the harpist was recorded over nine days with producer, Slowdive's Neil Halstead.

Title: Malibu
Info: The second full-length release for the California rapper/singer-songwriter features guest appearances from BJ the Chicago Kid, The Free Nationals, The Game, Rapsody, Schoolboy Q, and the Timon Family Choir.

Title: So Beautiful or So What
Info: The veteran singer-songwriter releases his 12th studio album, the first in five years.

Title: Space 1.8
Info: The debut full-length release for London-based jazz/ambient artist features guest appearances from Nubya Garcia, Ahnansé and James Mollison.

Title: Third
Info: The English rock band returns with its first studio album in 11 years.

Title: Holopaw
Info: This Gainesville, Fla.-based five-piece band, which mixes indie rock and alt-country with a bit of electronica, features John Orth, who also appeared on the 2002 release by the Modest Mouse side project Ugly Casanova. Brian Deck produces.

Title: Don't Give Up On Me
Info: The legendary 1960s soul singer, now a young 66 years old, is still going strong with this latest release, featuring brand-new songs penned by an impressive group of songwriters, including Elvis Costello, Brian Wilson, Tom Waits, Van Morrison, and Bob Dylan. No one will be giving up on him after this release.

Title: Didn't It Rain
Info: With the word "blue" appearing in four out of the seven song titles, you get a general idea of Jason Molina's mood as he recorded this sixth proper LP under the Songs:Ohia name. The entire album was recorded live in a Philadelphia studio with Molina backed by a new full band, including co-vocalists Jennie Benford and Jim Krewson.

Title: Daddy's Home
Info: The sixth full-length release for Annie Clark was inspired by her father's 1970s record collection and co-produced with Jack Antonoff.

Title: The Overload
Info: The debut full-length release for the British band Yard Act was recorded with Ali Chant.

Title: ZUU
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Florida rapper features guest appearances from Ice Billion Berg, Tay Keith, Kiddo Marv, PlayThatBoiZay, Rick Ross, and Sam Sneak.

Title: Reality Show
Info: The third full-length studio release for the R&B singer feature a guest appearances from Meek Mill.

Title: Gigi's Recovery
Info: The second full-length release for the Irish post-punk band The Murder Capital was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Bleach: Deluxe Edition
Info: The debut album for the grunge band is remastered and reissued with a 1990 live recording of a concert at Portland, Oregon's Pine Street Theatre.

Title: All My Heroes Are Cornballs
Info: The third full-length studio release for the rapper from Baltimore was self-recorded and features guest appearances from Abdu Ali, Helena Deland and Buzzy Lee.

Title: Sleep Well Beast
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the indie rock band was produced by band member Aaron Dessner with co-production by Bryce Dessner and Matt Berninger.

Title: Everyone's Crushed
Info: The latest full-length release from Brooklyn-based experimental pop duo Water From Your Eyes is its first on the Matador Records label.

Title: Un Verano Sin Ti
Info: The surprise release from Latin artist Bad Bunny (who will also star in a Spiderman spin-off film in 2024) features guest appearances from Rauw Alejandro, Buscabulla, Chencho Corleone, Jhay Cortez, Tony Dize, Bomba Estéreo, and The Marías.

Title: Geist
Info: The fourth full-length release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from Sofia Arreguin, Ben Boye, Devin Hoff, Aaron Otheim, and Ty Segall.

Title: Comfort To Me
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian punk band led by Amy Taylor was produced by Dan Luscombe.

Title: Fire
Info: The latest full-length studio release for British electronic producer Kevin Martin as The Bug features guest appearances from Daddy Freddy, FFSYTHO, Flowdan, Irah, Logan_olm, Manga Saint Hilare, Moor Mother, Nazamba, and Roger Robinson.

Title: Walk Through Fire
Info: Produced by Dan Auerbach, the debut full-length solo release for the British artist features influences from country, pop and soul music.

Title: Christine and the Queens
Info: Chaleur Humaine, the 2014 French language release from the French synth-pop artist is reissued with songs redone in English and additional new songs featuring guest appearances from Tunji Ige and Perfume Genius.

Title: Loyalty
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter Tamara Lindeman was recorded in France.

Title: Murs 3:16 The 9th Edition
Info: The Los Angeles-based indie rapper's second Def Jux disc was produced by 9th Wonder.

Title: Hail To The Thief
Info: Not quite the return to the "rock" side of Radiohead as originally believed (although pretty close), the band's sixth album (produced again by Nigel Godrich) retains some of the experimental electronica elements of its predecessors Kid A and Amnesiac. Note that each of the tracks on the album has an alternate title, as does the album itself (aka 'The Gloaming').

Title: Magnolia Electric Co.
Info: Jason Molina rocks out a bit more on this latest offering, which finds the singer-songwriter backed by the same musicians on the 'Mi Sei Apparaso Come Un Fantasma' live album. Steve Albini produces, and to quote the official press release, "This is the first Songs: Ohia record with more than one song that could be played at a strip joint or monster truck show."

Title: Pause
Info: The second Four Tet album from producer Kieran Hebden (who is also in the band Fridge), 'Pause' is a dense, eclectic collection of a variety of electronic and live instrumentation and found sounds.

Title: I See You
Info: The third full-length release for the British indie pop trio was co-produced by Rodaidh McDonald and Jamie xx.

Title: Midnights
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for singer-songwriter Tayor Swift features a guest appearance from Lana Del Rey and was produced with Jack Antonoff.

Title: Ordinary Corrupt Human Love
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the San Francisco black metal band was produced by Jack Shirley

Title: Laulu Laakson Kukista
Info: This is the latest album for the Finnish rock band.

Title: Helplessness Blues
Info: The Seattle indie-folk outfit return with the harmonious follow-up to their debut.

Title: Mezmerize
Info: Rick Rubin co-produced this first of two planned 2005 releases for SOAD (with 'Hypnotize' coming in the fall).

Title: Purple
Info: The metal band returns from a tour bus accident in 2012 with a new lineup. Nick Jost and Sebastian Thomson take over for Allen Blickle and Matt Maggioni on the fourth studio release produced by David Fridmann.

Title: Beauty And The Beat
Info: This self-produced second album for the Boston-based rapper includes guest appearances from Mr. Lif, Percee P, Dagah and Insight.

Title: Aromanticism
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based artist features contributions from Animals as Leaders' Tosin Abasi, Miguel Atwood-Ferguson, Son Lux's Ian Chang, Ludwig Görannson, Joshua Willing Halpern, Hundred Waters' Nicole Miglis, Rob Moose, Cam Obi, Majical Cloudz's Matt Otto, KING's Paris Strother, and Thundercat.

Title: Pompeii
Info: The sixth full-length release for Welsh singer-songwriter Cate Le Bon was co-produced with Samur Khouja.

Title: Twin Cinema
Info: This is the third album of sunny indie-pop tunes for the acclaimed union of Neko Case, Dan Bejar (also of Destroyer) and A.C. Newman.

Title: Benji
Info: The sixth full-length release for Mark Kozelek as Sun Kil Moon includes contributions from Owen Ashworth, Will Oldham, Sonic Youth's Steve Shelley, and Jen Wood.

Title: For Hero: For Fool
Info: The anticon crew that includes Doseone--and, fortunately, the nearly-killed Dax Pierson--makes the jump to a more major label (EMI/Astralwerks) for the first time.

Title: Juno
Info: The debut full-length for the Los Angeles-based pop artist was co-produced by Jared Soloman.

Title: Bird Songs of a Killjoy
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles-based folk singer-songwriter was produced by Gus Seyffert.

Title: Interplanetary Class Classics
Info: The Village People's Randy Jones, Yoko Ono, Slow Club's Rebecca Taylor are some of the guests featured on the debut full-length release for the band first mentioned in Eccentronic Research Council's 2015 concept release that includes Fat White Family's Lias Saoudi and Saul Adamczewski as well as Eccentronic Research Council's Adrian Flanagan and Dean Honer.

Title: Seasons of My Soul
Info: The debut release for British singer-songwriter was produced by  Steve Brown.

Title: New Moon
Info: The twin-CD set 'New Moon' compiles two dozen rare tracks recorded by the late singer-songwriter from 1994-1997.

Title: The Drift
Info: The legendary singer-songwriter and one-time teen idol re-emerges with his first album in 11 years. Anyone expecting conventional rock or pop should look elsewhere, however, as it is even more challenging than previous release 'Tilt.'

Title: Pray for Haiti
Info: The latest full-length release for the rapper features guest appearances from  Melanie Charles, Keisha Plum, Tha God Fahim, and Westside Gunn.

Title: Working Class Woman
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian electronic producer features influences from Italo Disco and proto-industrial music.

Title: Over and Even
Info: The third full-length release for the Kentucky singer-songwriter features guest appearance from Rachel Grimes and Will Oldham.

Title: The  Budos Band III
Info: The third full-length album for the Staten Island group was recorded live during a 48 hour period.

Title: Streetcore
Info: The former Clash leader was nearing completion of this fourth and final solo album when he died of a heart attack in 2002. It includes covers of Bob Marley's "Redemption Song" (recorded without his backing band the Mescaleros) and Bobby Charles' "Before I Grow Too Old," as well as eight Strummer originals veering from reggae to rock.

Title: Happy Songs For Happy People
Info: Don't let the title fool you; the Glaswegian instrumental post-rockers are just as dour as ever on this fourth studio LP.

Title: Source Tags & Codes
Artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
Info: Following the critical success of their 1999 effort, 'Madonna,' the lengthily-named Austin, Texas indie band signed with Interscope and recorded this, their major-label debut.

Title: Greatest Hits: The Evidence
Info: This 16-track best-of collection includes most of the original gangster's hits, including "I'm Your Pusher," "O.G.," and "Colors," as well as the previously unreleased "Money, Power, Women." However, the disc omits his work with Body Count.

Title: Atrocity Exhibition
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Detroit rapper was produced by Paul White and features guest appearances from Ab-Soul, B-Real, Kelela, Kendrick Lamar, Petite Noir, and Earl Sweatshirt.

Title: Semper Femina
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British folk singer-songwriter was produced by Blake Mills.

Title: Heartmind
Info: The 10th full-length release for singer-songwriter Cass McCombs features contributions from such artists as Charlie Burnham, the Chapin Sisters, Danielle Haim, Shahzad Ismaily, Wynonna Judd, Kassa Overall, Ariel Rechtshaid, and Buddy Ross.

Title: Hannah
Info: The second release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was recorded with her brother Tommy in their Texas hometown.

Title: Transangelic Exodus
Info: The seventh full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Tim Sandusky.

Title: My Favorite Picture of You
Info: The latest release for the Texas singer-songwriter includes songs co-written with Shawn Camp, Rodney Crowell, Lyle Lovett, and Chris Stapleton.

Title: Smother
Info: The British quartet releases its follow-up to its 2010 Mercury Prize-nominated album Two Dancers, produced by Richard Formby.

Title: Have One On Me
Info: The three-disc follow-up to 2006's "Ys" was a mystery as advance copies were not sent until a few weeks before the release date to circumvent any leaks of the songs.

Title: Ultra Truth
Info: The latest full-length release for British electronic producer Daniel Avery features guest appearances from HAAi, Jonnine, James Massiah, Kelly Lee Owens, AK Paul, and Sherelle.

Title: Autofiction
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for Britpop/alternative rock band Suede (aka The London Suede in the US) is said to be their "punk record."

Title: Melt My Eyez See Your Future
Info: The latest full-length release for Florida rapper Denzel Curry features guest appearances from 454, 6LACK, Robert Glasper, Jasiah, JID, Buzzy Lee, Rico Nasty, Bridget Perez, Powers Pleasant, Karriem Riggins, slowthai, T-Pain, and Saul Williams.

Title: If My Wife New I'd Be Dead
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Irish pop singer-songwriter Ciara Mary-Alice Thompson as CMAT.

Title: Seeking New Gods
Info: The seventh full-length solo release for the Super Furry Animals frontman  was inspired by Mount Paektu, an active volcano on the border of North Korea and China.

Title: Good News
Info: The debut full-length release for the rapper features guest appearance from 2Chainz, Beyoncé, Big Sean, City Girls, Da Baby, Lil Durk, Popcaan, SZA,, and Young Thug.

Title: Acoustic
Info: The latest full-length release for the Mali artist features acoustic versions of songs from her 2017 album, Mogoya.

Title: Things Have Changed
Info: The soul singer's reinterpretations of Bob Dylan songs was produced by Steve Jordan and feature guest appearances from Keith Richards and Trombone Shorty.

Title: Ba Power
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Malian afro-rock band that features the ngoni was produced by Chris Eckman.

Title: De Vermis Mysteriis
Info: The concept album for the heavy metal band led by Matt Pike was produced by Kurt Ballou of Converge.

Title: Oceans Apart
Info: This is the third album in three years for the newly-reunited Australian duo of Grant McLennan and Robert Forster.

Title: Veckatimest
Info: The third album for the Brooklyn-based indie-rock band.

Title: I'm All Ears
Info: The second full-length release for the British duo of Jenny Hollingworth and Rosa Walton features production from Faris Badwan, SOPHIE, and David Wrench.

Title: Skinty Fia
Info: The third full-length studio release for Irish post-punk band Fontaines D.C. was produced by Dan Carey and features an accordion on one track.

Title: Quarantine The Past
Info: With the band reunited and touring in 2010, here comes a 23-tracks greatest-hits compilation chosen by the band members.

Title: Pink City
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter features contributions from Owen Pallett and Kath Bloom.

Title: Devotion
Info: The singer who began her career as a guest on SBTRKT and Joker's singles releases her debut full-length album.

Title: Bitte Orca
Info: The latest album for the Brooklyn-based indie band is its first on the Domino Records label.

Title: Amadjar
Info: The ninth full-length release for the Malian Tuareg band features guest appearances from Rodolphe Burger, Jeiche Ould Chighaly, Warren Ellis, Cass McCombs, Michah Nelson, Stephen O'Malley, and Noura Mint Seymali.

Title: Bubblegum
Info: The former Screaming Trees member and Queens Of The Stone Age collaborator returns with his sixth solo album, credited to the Mark Lanegan Band. Guests include Ween, PJ Harvey, Josh Homme, Nick Oliveri and Izzy Stradlin and Duff McKagan.

Title: The Real New Fall L.P. (Formerly Country On The Click)
Info: Yes, as you may have surmised, this is the real new Fall full-length (just one in a very, very long line of releases from the amazingly prolific Mark E. Smith and company). Originally titled 'Country On The Click,' this album was leaked in early stages on the Internet, but has since been remixed and resequenced.

Title: Tenacious D
Info: What started as a series of HBO shorts has turned into a full-fledged band, featuring actor Jack Black ("High Fidelity") and Kyle Gass. Dave Grohl (Foo Fighters) and Steve McDonald (Redd Kross) are among the guest musicians on this, the D's debut album, produced by the Dust Brothers.

Title: Classic Objects
Info: The latest full-length release for Oslo-based singer-songwriter Jenny Hval features songs about places she has been as well as imagined places.

Title: Walking Proof
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Nashville singer-songwriter was produced by ex-Cage the Elephant guitarist Lincoln Parish.

Title: American Kid
Info: Co-produced with Craig Ross, the mostly acoustic release for the singer-songwriter was inspired by her father, who passed away in 2009.

Title: No Dream
Info: The surprise full-length release for the New York punk artist was produced by Jack Shirley.

Title: Life Metal
Info: The Seattle drone metal specialists return with the first of two planned 2019 follow-ups to 2015's Kannon. This four-song set was produced by Steve Albini.

Title: The Soft Bulletin
Info: The Dave Fridmann-produced 'Soft Bulletin' is considered by many fans and critics to be the band's finest album, and found its way onto quite a few Best of 1999 lists.

Title: The Spur
Info: The latest full-length release for Kentucky singer-songwriter Joan Shelley was co-produced with James Elkington and features contributions from Meg Baird, Bill Callahan, Max Porter, and Nathan Salsburg.

Title: Journal For Plague Lovers
Info: The latest album for the Welsh rock band was produced by Steve Albini and features lyrics from Richey James Edwards, who went missing in 1995.

Title: In Cauda Venenum
Info: The 13th full-length release for the Swedish progressive death metal group comes in both an English and Swedish versions.

Title: King Push - Darkest Before Dawn: The Prelude
Info: The second full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Ab-Liva, A$AP Rocky, Kehlani, Jill Scott, Beanie Sigel, The-Dream, and Kanye West.

Title: The Weather Station
Info: The fourth full-length release for Canadian singer-songwriter Tamara Lindeman was self-produced.

Title: Muchacho
Info: The sixth release for Matthew Houck as Phosphorescent was written in Brooklyn and Mexico after his 18-month tour for 2010's Here's To Taking It Easy.

Title: I Am Not Afraid Of You And I Will Beat Your Ass
Info: After two relatively subdued albums, Ira, Georgia and James return with a much more varied effort that at times recalls pretty much every stage of their history. Roger Moutenot again produces.

Title: Clara
Info: The latest full-length release for the Canadian electronic/ambient project of Scott Morgan was inspired by a three-minute composition from a 22-piece hungarian string orchestra.

Title: Wrongdoers
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the metalcore band led by Chris Day and Cory Brandan is its first with three new members: John Finnegan, Jeff Hickey, and Clayton Holyoak (replacing Jake Schultz, Scottie H. Henry, and Chris Raines/Matt Marquez).

Title: Chemistry Of Common Life
Info: The second full-length album for the Canadian hard-rock band.

Title: Stumpwork
Info: The second full-length release for London-based post-punk band Dry Cleaning was produced by John Parish.

Title: I Dont Know Who Needs to Hear This...
Info: The second full-length release for singer-songwriter Sarah Beth Tomberlin was recorded over two weeks in Brooklyn with producer and engineer Phil Weinrobe.

Title: Left Of The Dial: Dispatches From The '80s Underground
Info: This 82-song, 4-disc box set compiles various indie and alternative tracks from the 1980s across multiple genres, and includes music from both the decade's "biggest" names (The Smiths, R.E.M., Depeche Mode, Violent Femmes, etc.) as well as lesser-known artists such as The Raincoats, Green On Red, and The Lyres.

Title: Run To Ruin
Info: Recorded by Steve Albini, 'Run To Ruin' is the New York singer-songwriter's third LP. The Dirty Three's Jim White chips in on drums.

Title: The Meadowlands
Info: The indie rockers took four years to record this third album.

Title: Bob Vylan Presents the Price of Life
Info: The latest full-length release for London-based duo Bob Vylan was self-produced, mixed and recorded with contributions from Laurent 'Lags' Barnard of Gallows, Bobby Bentham of Strange Bones, Josh and Jon Skints of The Skints.

Title: Celebration Day [Live]
Info: The 2007 concert at London's O2 in honor of Atlantic Records founder Ahmet Ertegun featured the remaining original members of the British blues rock band along with Jason Bonham, son of the late John Bonham, on drums, as they performed together for the first time in over 30 years is finally released five years later.

Title: The Girl Is Crying in Her Latte
Info: The latest full-length release from art pop duo Sparks is its first on the Island Records label since the 1970s.

Title: Boys And Girls In America
Info: The Brooklyn-based rockers move to emo label Vagrant for this John Agnello-produced release.

Title: Topical Dancer
Info: The debut full-length release for Belgian electro-pop duo Charlotte Adigéry and Bolis Pupul was co-produced by Soulwax.

Title: Elaenia
Info: The debut full-length release for electronic producer Sam Shepherd features a wide variety of influences including Brazilian classical, jazz, and soul music.

Title: Glitch Princess
Info: The second full-length release for London-based artist yeule features a collaboration with Danny L Harle.

Title: Hell-On
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from Eric Bachmann, Joey Burns, Beth Ditto, Doug Gillard, Kelly Hogan, Mark Lanegan, k.d. Lang, AC Newman, and Laura Veirs, was self-produced with co-production on six tracks with Bjorn Yttling of Peter Bjorn & John.

Title: Pure Comedy
Info: The third full-length release for the singer-songwriter Josh Tillman as father John Misty was produced with Jonathan Wilson.

Title: Two Hands
Info: The second release in 2019 for the Brooklyn folk-influenced rock band led by Adrianne Lenker was recorded live.

Title: Big Inner
Info: The music of the 1970s influences the debut release for the Richmond, Virginia-based singer-songwriter.

Title: Ys
Info: Steve Albini, Jim O'Rourke and Van Dyke Parks lend a hand on this five-song full-length from the folk singer-songwriter.

Title: Coral Island
Info: The 24-track release from the British indie rock band features Ian and James Skelly's grandfather Ian Murray as narrator.

Title: Ode
Info: The first studio release with the new jazz trio line-up of Mehldau, bassist Larry Grenadier, and drummer Jeff Ballard is an album of tributes to both real and fictional people.

Title: Home Video
Info: The third full-length release for the indie singer-songwriter features contributions from Julien Baker and Phoebe Bridgers.

Title: Fossora
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for Icelandic artist Björk features guest appearances from Ísadóra Bjarkardóttir Barney, Sindri Eldon, Kasimyn, and Serpentwithfeet.

Title: The Moon and Stars: Prescriptions for Dreamers
Info: The latest full-length release for the Memphis singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Carla Thomas and was produced with Jack Splash.

Title: Kish Kash
Info: The third album for the house duo of Simon Ratcliffe and Felix Buxton features contributions from Dizzee Rascal, Me'Shell NdegeOcello, JC Chasez and Siouxsie Sioux.

Title: Interstate Gospel
Info: The third full-length release for the country trio of Miranda Lambert, Ashley Monroe and Angaleena Presley was produced by Frank Liddell.

Title: Gave in Rest
Info: The second release in 2018 for the Canadian artist was inspired by her European tour and features contributions from Thierry Amar, Terri Hron, Lisa McGee, and Jessica Moss.

Title: Revolution
Info: This is the third album for the country singer who was a finalist on Nashville Star.

Title: Multitudes
Info: The sixth full-length studio release from Canadian singer-songwriter Feist was produced with Robbie Lackritz and Mocky.

Title: Enter The Vaselines
Info: The two-disc set for the Scottish indie-rock band includes the reissues of two EPs, an LP, several demos, and live tracks recorded in the late 1980s.

Title: The Impossible Kid
Info: The seventh full-length solo studio release for the indie rap artist was self-produced.

Title: Landfall
Info: Hurricane Sandy is the subject of the debut collaboration album from Laurie Anderson and the Kronos Quartet.

Title: This Stupid World
Info: The first full-length studio release for indie rock trio Yo La Tengo in five years was recorded in New Jersey.

Title: Tomorrow's Harvest
Info: This is the first full-length release in eight years for the Scottish electronic duo of Marcus Eoin and Mike Sandison.

Title: Architect
Info: This is the debut release for the Scottish composer features influences from classical and pop music.

Title: This Is Why
Info: The first full-length release since 2017's After Laughter for pop-punk trio Paramore was produced by Carlos de la Garza.

Title: Strange Mercy
Info: St. Vincent, otherwise known as Annie Clark, releases her third album, produced by John Congleton.

Title: Winter Wheat
Info: The second solo release for the ex-Weakerthans frontman includes contributions from his wife, Christine Fellows, as well as his former bandmates Greg Smith and Jason Tait.

Title: Loom
Info: The second full-length release for the experimental artist was influenced by her mother's cancer diagnosis and eventual passing in 2018.

Title: Ecstatic Arrow
Info: The third full-length release for the British duo of Alice Richards and Samuel Pillay was recorded in Switzerland.

Title: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend
Info: This sophomore effort finds the former "Nashville Star" contestant becoming a bona-fide star (albeit from Texas rather than Tennessee). It combines eight Lambert originals with three covers.

Title: Astroworld
Info: The third solo release for the rapper features guest appearances and contributions from such artist as 21 Savage, James Blake, Drake, John Mayer, Frank Ocean, Pharrell, Quavo, Swae Lee, Tame Imapala, Sevn Thomas, Thundercat, and The Weeknd.

Title: Montero
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Miley Cyrus, Doja Cat, Jack Harlow, Elton John, and Megan Thee Stallion.

Title: New Bermuda
Info: The third full-length studio release for the California black metal band was produced by Jack Shirley.

Title: Lucky Me
Info: The debut full-length release for British pop artist Phoebe Green was produced by Kaines & Tom A.D.

Title: I Don't Live Here Anymore
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Philadelphia rock band led by Adam Granduciel is its first in four years.

Title: async
Info: The first solo release for the Grammy-winning Japanese synth pop composer in eight years features David Sylvian on one track.

Title: Bonxie
Info: The third full length release for the British folk-pop band was produced by Gil Norton.

Title: The  Harrow and the Harvest
Info: Eight years after her last release, the country-folk singer releases new material.

Title: One Beat
Info: The acclaimed indie-rock trio from Olympia, Wash. return with their sixth album.

Title: High Violet
Info: The band and Peter Katis produced the Brooklyn-based rock quintet's fifth full-length album.

Title: Miss Universe
Info: The debut full-length release for the London-based singer-songwriter features co-production from Will Archer, Oli Barton-Wood, Jazzi Bobbi, Luke Bower, John Congleton, M.T. Hadley, and the Invisible's Dave Okumu.

Title: This Right Here Is Buck 65
Info: This right here is the American debut for the Canadian country-rapper (born Richard Terfry), who has actually been recording north of the border since the mid-1990s. Apparently he's worth $1.15 more than 50 Cent, although we're not sure if that's in Canadian dollars or not.

Title: Bloom
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Ariana Grande and Gordi.

Title: The Singles
Info: Two new songs are included on this collection of some of Goldfrapp's biggest singles.

Title: Beyoncé
Info: The fifth full-length record for the R&B pop singer was a surprise iTunes release, with a short film accompanying each track.

Title: Cole's Corner
Info: This is the fourth solo album for the sometime Pulp guitarist.

Title: Still Over It
Info: The second full-length release for the Atlanta R&B artist features guest appearances from Cardi B, Ciara, JT, Ari Lennox, Lil Durk, Omarion, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: And Then Life Was Beautiful
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British artist features guest appearances from Adekunle Gold, Lucky Daye, Lianne La Havas, and serpentwithfeet.

Title: Clearing the Path to Ascend
Info: This is the seventh studio release for the Oregon doom metal trio of Mike Scheidt, Aaron Rieseburg, and Travis Foster .

Title: Emeritus
Info: The ninth album for the Texas-born rapper features guest appearances from Bilal, Bun B, Lil Wayne, J. Prince, Papa Rue, Slim Thug, and Z-Ro.

Title: evermore
Info: The second surprise release from the singer-songwriter in 2020 features contributions from Jack Antonoff, Aaron Dessner, Haim, Marcus Mumford, The National, Justin Vernon, and William Bowery (aka Joe Alwyn).

Title: Memento Mori
Info: The latest full-length release from British electronic band Depeche Mode was produced by James Ford and Marta Salogni and is its first without Andy Fletcher who unexpectedly died in May 2022.

Title: Lookaftering
Info: Coming a full 35 years after her debut ('Just Another Diamond Day'), the British folk singer's second LP finds her backed by fans/followers such as Devendra Banhart and Joanna Newsom.

Title: R.A.P. Music
Info: The sixth album for Atlanta rapper Killer Mike was produced by El-P and includes guest appearances from Bun B, T.I., Scar, Emily Panic, and Trouble.

Title: On the Line
Info: The fourth full-length release for the singer-songwriter/actress features contributions from Ryan Adams, Beck, Jim Keltner, Ringo Starr, Benmont Tench, and Don Was.

Title: Pageant
Info: The second full-length release for the pop-punk duo of Liv Bruce and Ben Hopkinsfeatures horns and contributions from Kiley Lotz of Petal, Alex and Noah from Diet Cig, as well as Ben's mother.

Title: This Is Our Science
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Minneapolis-based hip-hop artist was produced by John Congleton and features Tegan Quin as a guest vocalist.

Title: Levon Vincent
Info: The Berlin-based electronic artist released his debut full-length release for free online the day before its official date.

Title: Before Today
Info: Los Angeles-based Ariel Pink releases his first album on the 4AD label.

Title: Amo
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British rock/metalcore band was produced by the band's own Oli Sykes and Jordan Fish.

Title: Wind's Poem
Info: The fourth full-length album for the Washington state-based artist Phil Elverum.

Title: Singing Bones
Info: The husband and wife duo of Brett and Rennie Sparks return with their sixth CD of dark, country-tinged folk-rock.

Title: Fever To Tell
Info: This is the highly-anticipated debut LP for the New York art-punk trio, who have developed a fanbase and generated a great deal of publicity (not to mention a major-label deal) through a series of EPs and live performances.

Title: The Ugly Organ
Info: A bit of a concept album (set as a play about sex and relationships), 'The Ugly Organ' is the Nebraska band's fourth LP, following 2000's acclaimed 'Domestica.'

Title: The Last Broadcast
Info: The Manchester, England band reunites with producer Steve Osborne for their sophomore album, following 2000's 'Lost Souls,' which launched them into stardom in both the U.S. and U.K. "There Goes the Fear" is the lead single.

Title: Ocean Roar
Info: The second release in 2012 from Phil Elverum as Mount Eerie is part of a two-album concept begun on Clear Moon.

Title: Crushing
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian singer-songwriter was produced by Burke Reid.

Title: The Path of the Clouds
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was inspired from watching Unsolved Mysteries episodes during the pandemic lockdown and features contributions from Jesse Chandler, Simon Raymonde, Emma Ruth Rundle, and Amber Webber.

Title: Kaputt
Info: Canadian pop craftsman Daniel Bejar's ninth album combines the glam of David Bowie and the rock and roll of T. Rex into a retro dance soundtrack for disco fans.

Title: Ice, Death, Planets, Lungs, Mushrooms and Lava
Info: The latest full-length release for Australian psychedelic rock band King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard was created from jam sessions.

Title: Dance Fever
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for British indie rock band Florence + The Machine features production with Jack Antonoff and Glass Animals' Dave Bayley.

Title: Yonder Is The Clock
Info: The second album on the Team Love label for the three brothers from upstate New York.

Title: Any Human Friend
Info: The third full-length release for the London-based singer-songwriter was produced by Hackman and David Wrench.

Title: Beautiful Thugger Girls
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper features guiest appearances from Future, Gunna, Jacquees, Lil Durk, Millie Go Lightly, and Snoop Dogg.

Title: Geogaddi
Info: The Scottish duo finally return with a full-length follow-up to their acclaimed 1998 debut, 'Music Has A Right To Children.'

Title: Mental Illness
Info: The singer-songwriter takes on her reputation for acoustic, depressing and dark songs with her ninth full-length studio release produced by Paul Bryan.

Title: Hearts Of Oak
Info: Ted Leo, formerly of Chisel, returns with his fourth album of punk-influenced singer-songwriter indie-folk rock.

Title: Yellow
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British jazz composer/multi-instrumentalist/producer.

Title: Treasure of Love
Info: The first full-length studio release in 12 years for the Texas trio that includes Joe Ely, Jimmie Dale Gilmore, and Butch Hancock was produced by Lloyd Maines.

Title: The Age of Immunology
Info: This is the second full-length release for the London-based experimental psychedelic pop project led by Cathy Lucas.

Title: Is It Going to Get Any Deeper Than This?
Info: The latest full-length release for the solo electronic project of Matmos' Drew Daniel features contributions from such artists as John Berndt, Koye Berry, Andrew Bernstein, Brooks Kossover, Mark Lightcap, M.C. Schmidt, Flock Of Dimes/Wye Oak's Jenn Wasner, Jason Willett, and Nate Wooley.

Title: A Hero's Death
Info: The second full-length release for the Dublin post-punk band was recorded in Los Angeles by producer Dan Carey.

Title: It Won't Be Like This All the Time
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Scottish indie rock quintet was produced by band's guitarist, Andy MacFarlane.

Title: Post Self
Info: This is the second full-length release since the industrial/post-punk duo of Justin Broadrick and G.C. Green reunited after disbanding in 2002.

Title: And Nothing Hurt
Info: The eighth full-length release is the first in six years for Jason Pierce may be his last as Spiritualized.

Title: As Days Get Dark
Info: This is the first new full-length release in over 15 years from the Scottish indie rock duo of Aidan Moffat and Malcolm Middleton.

Title: White Jesus Black Problems
Info: The latest full length release for Grammy-winning blues artist Fantastic Negrito was based on learning his ancestors: an indentured servant from Scotland and an African American slave had a common law marriage in 1750s Virginia.

Title: From Dreams to Dust
Info: The latest full-length release for the folk rock band was recorded at a one-room church and was mixed by Mike Mogis.

Title: Warm
Info: The second full-length solo release for the Wilco frontman was self-produced and recorded.

Title: A Pocket of Wind Resistance
Info: The Scottish singer-songwriter adapted her and Pippa Murphy's Wind Resistance stage show into an album.

Title: Indestructible Machine
Info: The Columbus, Ohio, singer releases her debut album of country punk rock music.

Title: Meshes of Voice
Info: The collaboration between Jenny Hval and Susanna Wallumrød was inspired by Maya Deren's 1943 surrealist film, Meshes of the Afternoon and was originally written for Ladyfest in 2009.

Title: Cool Dry Place
Info: The debut full-length release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter from Texas was produced by Alberto Sewald and Logan Chung.

Title: Singing Saw
Info: The third full-length solo release for the former Woods bass player was produced by Sam Cohen.

Title: Light Up Gold
Info: This is the debut full-length release on What's Your Rupture? for the Brooklyn-based rock quartet from Texas.

Title: 1991 [EP]
Info: The debut four-track EP for the New York rapper includes dance elements.

Title: Electric Dirt
Info: Larry Campbell produces the follow-up to Levon Helm's Grammy-winning album, Dirt Farmer.

Title: Course in Fable
Info: The latest release for the New York-based singer-songwriter was produced by Tortoise's John McEntire and features contributions from Bill MacKay, Nancy Ives, Douglas Jenkins, Ryan Jewell, and Andrew Scott Young.

Title: Serena-Maneesh
Info: This debut album from the Norwegian shoegaze six-piece marks the inaugural release by the new record label from UK website Playlouder. Sufjan Stevens guests.

Title: Flower Boy
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from ASAP Rocky, Anna of the North, Estelle, Steve Lacy, Lil Wayne, Frank Ocean, Rex Orange County, Jaden Smith, and Kali Uchis.

Title: Before the Dawn [Live]
Info: The second live release for the British singer-songwriter is a three-disc album featuring songs from her her month-long residency at London's Hammersmith Apollo.

Title: Seven Psalms
Info: The acoustic seven-movement composition from Paul Simon features Edie Brickell and VOCES8.

Title: Blondshell
Info: The debut full-length release from Los Angeles-based Sabrina Teitelbaum as Blondshell was produced by Yves Rothman.

Title: Impera
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Swedish rock band Ghost was produced by Klas Ahlund.

Title: The Art of Losing
Info: The second full-length release for the Welsh singer-songwriter  Catherine Anne Davies features a guest appearances from James Dean Bradfield.

Title: My Echo
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by her ex-husband Tucker Martine and features contributions from Karl Blau, Bill Frisell, Jim James, and Matt Ward.

Title: The Great Pretenders
Info: The second release for the Californian trio of Michael Shuman, Zach Dawes and Tyler Parkford features guest appearances from Brian Wilson and Alex Turner.

Title: A World Lit Only by Fire
Info: This is the first release in 13 years from the British industrial metal band led by Justin Broadrick.

Title: The Way I'm Livin'
Info: The seventh studio release for the award-winning country singer was produced by her husband, Frank Liddell.

Title: Love's Crushing Diamond
Info: The debut full-length release for solo project for Brooklyn-based  Jordan Lee was recorded while the singer-songwriter toured across the US.

Title: Emily's D+Evolution
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for the multiple Grammy-winning artist is a concept album built around her muse named Emily (which is also her middle name) and was produced with Tony Visconti.

Title: Medulla
Info: What the Icelandic singer's fifth album lacks in instrumentation (although there is a bit, provided by members of Matmos, Mum, and other collaborators), it makes up for with voices--lots and lots of voices. Think everything from beatboxing (including contributions from The Roots' Rahzel), choirs and Inuit throat-singing to, well, Mike Patton.

Title: Blue Cathedral
Info: The psychedelic indie-rockers from Santa Cruz, Calif. make their Sub Pop debut with this third disc. Guitarist Ben Chasny has been added to the lineup, supplementing the original quartet led by vocalist/guitarist Ethan Miller.

Title: Old Ramon
Info: Stuck in label limbo since 1997, 'Old Ramon' finally sees the light of day, thanks to Sub Pop records. It is the first official RHP release since 1996's 'Songs For A Blue Guitar,' although frontman Mark Kozelek released the solo album 'What's Next to the Moon' and appeared in the film "Almost Famous" in the interim.

Title: Mwng
Info: The Furries return with an entire album of Welsh-language songs.

Title: Play
Info: Although techno artist Moby had been on the scene for almost a decade and had released five albums, his fame had chiefly been limited to his club hit "Go" back in 1991. 'Play' changed all that, however, garnering a sea of critical and popular acclaim for the artist. A mix of styles (including deviations into blues and gospel), 'Play' also has the unique distinction of having all 18 of its tracks licensed for use in film, television and advertising.

Title: Complete Mountain Almanac
Info: The debut full-length release for Complete Mountain Almanac, the music project from Rebekka Karijord and Jessica Dessner, about climate change over the 12 months of a year.

Title: Anicca
Info: The third full-length studio release for producer Mtendere Mandowa as Teebs features contributions from Ringgo Ancheta (aka MNDSGN), Daydream Masi, Michael Lundy, Panda Bear, Pink Siifu, Jimetta Rose, Thomas Stankiewicz, Sudan Archives, and Anna Wise.

Title: How Is It That I Should Look at the Stars
Info: The sixth full-length release for Canadian band The Weather Station was written at the same time as 2021's Ignorance.

Title: Apollo Kids
Info: The Wu-Tang member branches out with his own brand of street flow on his solo album of soul-heavy funk sounds and old-school hip-hop.

Title: Cancer4Cure
Info: The third solo album for producer El-P features guest appearances by  Danny Brown, Interpol’s Paul Banks, Islands' Nick Diamonds, and Killer Mike.

Title: Archangel Hill
Info: The latest full-length release from British folk artist Shirley Collins was produced by Ian Kearey.

Title: Midnight Rocker
Info: The latest full-length release for reggae artist Horace Andy was produced by Adrian Sherwood.

Title: Fever Dreams
Info: The latest full-length release for the Irish folk band led by Conor O’Brien was mixed by David Wrench.

Title: Rare, Forever
Info: This is the second full-length studio release for the British DJ and experimental electronic producer.

Title: Forgotten Days
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Arkansas doom metal band was recorded in Texas and was produced by Randall Dunn.

Title: Mama, You Can Bet!
Info: The third full-length release for Georgia Anne Muldrow under the name Jyoti features a guest appearance from Lakeica Benjamin.

Title: Eton Alive
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the British duo of Jason Williamson and Andrew Fearn is the first album on their own label.

Title: Mazy Fly
Info: This is the second full-length release for California-based Tia Cabral.

Title: The Curious Hand
Info: The second full-length release for the Irish singer-songwriter was produced with Leo Abrahams.

Title: It
Info: The final solo release from the Suicide frontman before his death in July 2016 was recorded over six years with his wife, Liz Lamere.

Title: Lovers
Info: The instrumental jazz double-album from the Wilco guitarist features an ensemble of 23 musicians conducted by Michael Leonhart and was produced by David Breskin.

Title: Divided & United: Songs of the Civil War
Info: Randall Poster produced the two-disc set that includes artists such as Loretta Lynn, Vince Gill, Joe Henry, Del McCoury, Carolina Chocolate Drops, Old Crow Medicine Show, Dolly Parton, Pokey Lafarge, Shovels & Rope, Chris Thile, and Lee Ann Womack interpreting Civil War songs.

Title: Sister Faith
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Kentucky noise-rock trio was produced by J. Robbins.

Title: This Is Happening
Info: The third album for the dance-rock band is reportedly James Murphy's last as LCD Soundsystem.

Title: Once Twice Melody
Info: The latest full-length release for Baltimore duo Beach House was self-produced and features a live string ensemble.

Title: Snares Like a Haircut
Info: The fourth full-length release for the duo of Randy Randall and Dean Allen Spunt is its first on the Drag City label.

Title: Donuts
Info: Acclaimed hip-hop producer James Yancey released this instrumental disc shortly before his death at the age of 32.

Title: No Holiday
Info: This is the first new release in five years from the Los Angeles punk rock band led by Kim Shattuck (who passed away on 2 Oct 2019).

Title: The Hex
Info: The posthumous release for the singer-songwriter/producer was recorded over several years before it was completed a month before his death in July.

Title: Black Metal 2
Info: This is the sequel to the British artist's 2014 solo album, Black Metal.

Title: A Celebration of Endings
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the the Scottish alternative rock trio was produced by Rich Costey.

Title: Giants of All Sizes
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the British rock band features contributions from Chilli Chilton, Jesca Hoop and The Plumedores.

Title: The Imperial
Info: The second full-length release for the Portland, Oregon-based country soul band that includes members of Richmond Fontaine was produced by John Morgan Askew.

Title: Etch And Etch Deep
Info: This is the second full-length release for the British trio of Louise Croft, Gemma and Sophie Bakerwood.

Title: No!
Info: This enhanced-CD experience is TMBG's first official album geared toward the younger set, with 17 children's songs with titles such as "Where Do They Make Balloons?" and "I Am Not a Grocery Bag." (Not that the titles themselves make this any different than a grownup TMBG album, mind you.)

Title: Treats
Info: The electro-rock Brooklyn-based duo releases its debut album with Mom + Pop and M.I.A.'s N.E.E.T. Recordings.

Title: Blue Hearts
Info: The 14th full-length solo studio release for the former Hüsker Dü frontman was recorded at Chicago's Electrical Audio.

Title: Constant Bop
Info: The debut full-length solo release for White Denim frontman James Petralli features contributions from his bandmates and ex-Shearwater bassist Kevin Schneider.

Title: Kids See Ghosts
Info: The debut surprise studio release for the collaboration between Kanye West and Kid Cudi features contributions from André 3000, Mos Def, Ty Dolla $ign as well as samples from Kurt Cobain's "Burn the Rain" and Louis Prima's "What Would Santa Claus Do?".

Title: Our Endless Numbered Days
Info: Miami, Fla. singer-songwriter Sam Beam (who moonlights as a cinematography professor) returns with his second album, recorded with Brian Deck (Modest Mouse, Red Red Meat) at the helm.

Title: The Evening Of My Best Day
Info: 'Evening' represents Jones' first album of self-penned material in six years. The roster of guests includes Nels Cline, David Hidalgo, Grant Lee Phillips and Bill Frisell.
The fifth release from the Chicago-based outfit continue their foray into "modern classical" composition using acoustic instruments.

Title: Indestructible
Info: The Bay Area punk band returns with its first album in three years.

Title: Silver Lake
Info: The unique singer-songwriter's 11th LP was produced by Mark Howard (Lucinda Williams).

Title: S.T.R.E.E.T. D.A.D.
Info: Founded in 1996 in San Francisco, this now New York-based instrumental outfit (which shares some members with the band !!!) has previously drawn a bit of acclaim for their vinyl-only releases. This six-track effort represents their first CD release, which showcases their dancier, dubbier, funkier brand of post-rock.

Title: Trouble Will Find Me
Info: The sixth studio release for the Brooklyn indie rock quintet features guest appearances from Annie Clark of St. Vincent, Richard Reed Parry of Arcade Fire, Sufjan Stevens, and Sharon Van Ette.

Title: Full Circle
Info: The first release in a dozen years for the country artist features guest appearances by Elvis Costello and Willie Nelson and was produced by John Carter Cash and her daughter, Patsy Lynn Russell.

Title: Mr. Misunderstood
Info: The fifth full-length album for the country singer was recorded in a month and was a surprise release first to his fan club then to iTunes.

Title: The World Has Made Me The Man Of My Dreams
Info: The seventh album for the German-born singer features Pat Metheny, Jason Lindner, and Robert Glasper.

Title: Ocean's Twelve OST
Info: The British DJ and composer one again provides the score for Steven Soderbergh's caper flick, as he did for Ocean's Eleven.

Title: The Practice of Love
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Norwegian avant-garde artist features guest appearances from Félicia Atkinson, Laura Jean and Vivian Wang.

Title: Let Them Eat Chaos
Info: The follow-up to the British artist's Mercury Prize-nominated release was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Stage Four
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based post-hardcore band led by Jeremy Bolm was influenced by the death of Bolm's mother from cancer and produced by Brad Wood.

Title: Ire Works
Info: The New Jersey hardcore rock band's third album is their first without drummer Chris Pennie.

Title: Mood Valiant
Info: The third full-length release for the Australian quartet led by Nai Palm features a guest appearance from Arthur Verocai.

Title: Fall Be Kind [EP]
Info: The five-track EP is the second release for the year for the rock trio.

Title: ONoffON
Info: This 16-track disc (complete with a brief intermission between 'sets') marks the first studio recording in a whopping 22 years for the Boston-based trio of Roger Miller (guitar, vocals), Clint Conley (bass, vocals) and Peter Prescott (drums, vocals), with production by Bob Weston and Rick Harte and additional instrumentation on two tracks by the band Rachel's.
'2' is the aptly-named second album for the Portland-based indie-pop quartet.

Title: Veni Vidi Vicious
Info: One of the first Next Big Things of 2002, Sweden's The Hives follow last year's media darlings The Strokes and The White Stripes in bringing the rock back to alternative rock. The only catch is that the band has been around for over a decade, with this particular album actually dating back to 2000, when it gained a limited U.S. release on a tiny Epitaph imprint. However, the Swedes were able to benefit from the rush to capitalize on the neo-garage/punk-rock movement by scoring a major label deal in early 2002 and a rerelease of this, their second full-length. (They've got The Strokes beat on length, though, managing to release an even shorter album, at just 27 minutes.)

Title: Gimme Fiction
Info: Mike McCarthy returns as producer for the Britt Daniel-led band's varied follow-up to their acclaimed 2002 outing 'Kill The Moonlight.' Spoon fans will not be disappointed.

Title: Blood Bitch
Info: The latest release for the Norwegian artist was co-produced with Lasse Marhaug and features a blood theme.

Title: Feels
Info: Electric where the mellower 'Sung Tongs' was acoustic, 'Feels' is nevertheless another idiosyncratic outing for the freak-folk four-piece.

Title: Down to Believing
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was influenced by her break up with Steve Earle and the autism diagnosis for her son Henry.

Title: It Is What It Is
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based artist features guest appearances from and Steve Arrington, Childish Gambino, Louis Cole, Zack Fox, Steve Lacy, Lil B, and Ty Dolla $ign.

Title: Tresor
Info: The third full-length solo release for Gwenno features nine tracks in the Cornish language and one in Welsh.

Title: Black Cadillac
Info: The singer-songwriter reflects on the recent deaths of her father, mother and stepmother with this 12-song set.

Title: Western Stars
Info: The first new solo studio release in five years for the rock artist features contributions from Ron Aniello (who also produced), Jon Brion, Charlie Giordano, David Sancious,  Patti Scialfa, and Soozie Tyrell.

Title: Yeezus
Info: Chief Keef, Daft Punk, Frank Ocean, Kid Cudi, King L, Rick Rubin, RZA, and Justin Vernon are some of the producers and artists the rapper worked with on his sixth solo release influenced by such genres as industrial, new wave, and Chicago house music.

Title: Bird Songs
Info: The Grammy-award winning saxophonist's latest album is a collection of Charlie "Bird" Parker songs recorded with Lovano's band, the Us Five.

Title: Last Man Standing
Info: The latest full-length studio release for the legendary country singer-songwriter features 11 new songs co-written with producer Buddy Cannon.

Title: Wildheart
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles R&B singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Lenny Kravitz and Kurupt.

Title: Body
Info: The 20th full-length release for the Australian trio of Chris Abrahams, Lloyd Swanton, and Tony Buck consists of a single nearly 57-minute-long piece.

Title: RE-ANIMATOR
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the British art pop/rock band was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Countless Branches
Info: The latest full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Joshua Henry.

Title: Ephorize
Info: The third full-length release for the Chicago rapper was produced by Def Starz and Turreekk.

Title: Ten [Reissue]
Info: The rerelease of the debut album for the grunge band is the part of a planned rerelease of the rest of its albums, leading up to its 20th anniversary in 2011.

Title: Ga Ga Ga Ga Ga
Info: The Austin band serves up their latest album hoping fans go ga ga over it.

Title: Hope Downs
Info: The debut full-length release for the Australian indie rock quintet was co-produced with Liam Judson and recorded live in a house in the Australian bush.

Title: In My Mind
Info: The major label full-length debut release for R&B singer Bryan James Sledge features guest appearances from such artsts as Big K.R.I.T., Buddy, Chance the Rapper, and Kendrick Lamar.

Title: Empath
Info: The latest solo release for the Canadian metal artist features contributions from Morgan Ågren, Ryan Dahle, Ché Aimee Dorval, Mike Keneally, Samus Paulicelli, Steve Vai, and Anneke Van Giersbergen.

Title: Henryk Górecki: Symphony No. 3 "Symphony of Sorrowful Songs" [Live]
Info: The collaboration between the Portishead singer and the Polish National Radio Symphony Orchestra conducted by Krzysztof Penderecki was recorded live in Warsaw on November 29th, 2014.

Title: Sometimes the Blues is Just a Passing Bird
Info: The latest EP from Kristian Matsson was recorded while he was on tour.

Title: Quiet Signs
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles singer-songwriter is her first recorded in a professional studio.

Title: What's Your Pleasure?
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features production from Benji B, Simian Mobile Disco's James Ford, Midland, Metronomy's Joseph Mount, and Matthew Tavares.

Title: Takk...
Info: Sigur Ros' fourth album is the first to feature songs sung mainly in their native Icelandic, rather than their fabricated Hopelandish.

Title: MCII
Info: The second release for the San Francisco-based rock singer features K. Dylan Edrich and Ty Segall as guest musicians.

Title: Insula
Info: The debut full-length release for the Edinburgh grime producer features everyday sounds like conversations, police sirens, dial tones as well as influences from Japanese video game music.

Title: Inner Song
Info: The second full-length release for the Welsh artist features a guest appearance from John Cale.

Title: The Serpent & the Sphere
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Oregon black metal band was produced by Billy Anderson.

Title: Nomad
Info: The second solo release for Tuareg guitarist-singer Omara “Bombino” Moctar was produced by The Black Keys' Dan Auerbach.

Title: Copia
Info: Portland, Ore. ambient electronica artist Matthew Cooper returns with a fourth album.

Title: The Black Album
Info: The hugely successful Brooklyn rapper worked with an A-list of producers (including Just Blaze, Kanye West, Aqua, Eminem, Rick Rubin and The Neptunes) on what he has stated will be the final release of his career. (Sure it will.)

Title: Lost in Translation OST
Info: The soundtrack to Sofia Coppola's second feature film includes the first new music in over ten years from My Bloody Valentine's Kevin Shields (who scored much of the film), new music from Air, and older tracks from Squarepusher, Jesus And Mary Chain, and Death In Vegas.

Title: Blood Money
