Title: No One Deserves Happiness
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Portland, Oregon-based metal duo of Chip King and Lee Buford features contributions from Maralie Armstrong and Providence's Assembly of Light Choir.

Title: The Miraculous
Info: The third full-length release for the Swedish singer-songwriter features a 9,000-pipe organ.

Title: Servant of Love
Info: The tenth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced with Craig Ross.

Title: Homeland
Info: Laurie Anderson, the performance artist, releases her first album of new material in nearly a decade, which was produced with her husband, Lou Reed, and Roma Baran.

Title: Watershed
Info: The Swedish metal band's ninth album is the first with Martin Axenrot and Fredrik Akesson, who replaced Martin Lopez and Peter Lindgren.

Title: Anarchist Gospel
Info: The latest full-length release for Nashville-based singer-songwriter Sunny War was produced by Andrija Tokic.

Title: New History Warfare, Vol. 2: Judges
Info: The second album from the Polaris prize-nominated saxophonist was recorded solo, live, and in a single take. Stetson employed circular breathing and used approximately two dozen microphones, placing them on the studio walls, throughout his bass saxophone, and on his throat to produce this otherworldly-sounding album.

Title: Gang Signs & Prayer
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from Ghetts, J HUS, Kehlani, MNEK, Raleigh Ritchie and Wretch 32.

Title: The  Electric Lady
Info: The second release for the Atlanta R&B singer continues the story of her alter-ego Cindi Mayweather with guest appearances from Erykah Badu, Big Boi, Cee Lo Green, Solange Knowles, Miguel, Prince, and Esperanza Spalding.

Title: Resonant Body
Info: The third full-length release for Brooklyn-based electronic artist Maya Bouldry-Morrison was recorded in New Hampshire.

Title: Lavender
Info: The second full-length release for the Nandi Rose Plunkett project that includes two of her Pinegrove bandmates was co-produced with David Tolomei.

Title: Life
Info: The third solo release for the Parts & Labor co-founder was written after the birth of his son.

Title: Panda Bear Meets the Grim Reaper
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Animal Collective co-founder was co-produced with Peter Kember.

Title: Weird Little Birthday
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie rock trio was self produced.

Title: ...Like Clockwork
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Josh Homme-led rock band includes Dave Grohl on drums as well as guest vocals from Brody Dalle, Alain Johannes, Elton John, Mark Lanegan, Trent Reznor, Jake Shears, Alex Turner, and former bassist Nick Oliveri.

Title: Yellow & Green
Info: The third studio full-length release from the hard rock/metal band from Virginia was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Sepalcure
Info: This debut album is a collaboration between dance veterans Praveen Sharma and Travis Stewart.

Title: Stonechild
Info: The fifth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by John Parish and features guest appearances from Justis, Lucius and Kate Stables.

Title: Freetown Sound
Info: The third full-length release for Dev Hynes was self-produced and released three days ahead of its scheduled release date.

Title: In Conflict
Info: The fourth solo studio release for the Canadian composer features contributions from Brian Eno and the Czech FILMharmonic Orchestra.

Title: Singles
Info: The Baltimore trio's first release on the 4AD label was produced by Chris Coady.

Title: The Week That Was
Info: Peter Brewis wrote the songs as part of an imaginary crime thriller for his debut concept album.

Title: Bright Yellow Bright Orange
Info: After taking 12 years off prior to 2000's 'The Friends of Rachel Worth,' the legendary Australian indie-pop band is suddenly undergoing a bout of creativity as evidenced by yet another release this very same decade.

Title: Red Devil Dawn
Info: Crooked Fingers is a side project for Archers of Loaf frontman Eric Bachmann. This third album follows in the dark, drunken-blues/Americana tradition of the first two, which drew Bachmann comparisons to Tom Waits and Leonard Cohen, among others.

Title: Blacklisted
Info: Alt-country singer-songwriter Neko Case returns with her third solo album, after last appearing on the New Pornographers' acclaimed 'Mass Romantic" album. Here, the moody, cinematic music is provided by members of Calexico and Giant Sand.

Title: Cookie: The Anthropological Mix Tape
Info: The fifth album (and first in three years) for the bassist/singer features 16 new tracks (including a bonus remix of "Pocketbook" by Missy Elliot and Rockwilder) in an eclectic mix of styles.

Title: Internal Wrangler
Info: This debut LP brought the much-hyped Liverpool band frequent comparisons to (and a tour with) Radiohead.

Title: I Made a Place
Info: The first full-length release of new material from the singer-songwriter in eight years features contributions from Nathan Salsburg, Mike Hyman and Joan Shelley.

Title: Qualm
Info: The second full-length release for the German DJ/electronic producer features less layers and instruments than previous releases.

Title: Babelsberg
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for the Super Furry Animals/Neon Neon member was self-produced and features Stephen McNeff and the National Orchestra of Wales.

Title: How to Socialise & Make Friends
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian trio of Georgia McDonald, Kelly-Dawn Hellmrich and Sarah Thompson was recorded in two-and-a-half days.

Title: Our Shadows Will Remain
Info: The singer-songwriter recorded this fourth LP in New Orleans.

Title: Follow the Cyborg
Info: The debut full-length release for New York-based artist Margaret Sohn under the name Miss Grit features contributions from Stella Mozgawa of Warpaint, Aron Kobayashi Ritch of Momma, and Pearla.

Title: The Theory of Whatever
Info: The fifth full-length release for British indie singer-songwriter Jamie T was produced by Hugo White.

Title: Ramona Park Broke My Heart
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for Long Beach rapper Vince Staples features guest appearances from Lil Baby, Mustard and Ty Dolla $ign.

Title: Blood Bunny
Info: The second full-length release for the Michigan indie pop artist features production and writing from Jake Aron, David Pramik, and Keith Varon.

Title: Superwolves
Info: Matt Sweeney and Bonnie "Prince" Billy reunite after 16 years for a follow-up to 2005's Superwolf features contributions from Mike Coltun,  Souleyman Ibrahim, Ahmoudou Madassane, and Mdou Moctar.

Title: We're Your Friends, Man
Info: This is the 25th full-length studio release for British psychedelic rock band led by Nick Saloman.

Title: Southern Blood
Info: The final release for the singer-songwriter who passed away in May 2017 was produced by Don Was.

Title: Nothing More to Say
Info: Three months before the full-length album for the New York reggae group produced by Victor Axelrod was released, lead singer Dan Klein passed away from ALS.

Title: Luminiferous
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Oakland heavy metal trio was produced by Kurt Ballou.

Title: Nothing Violates This Nature
Info: The second full-length release for the Massachusetts hardcore band including members of Bloodhorse, Converge, and The Hope Conspiracy was produced by Kurt Ballou.

Title: Ty Segall (2017)
Info: The second self-titled (2008's was the first) release for the garage rock artist was recorded as a live band that included Ben Boye, Mikal Cronin, Emmett Kelly, and Charles Moothart.

Title: The Innocents
Info: This is the second release for former Jackie-O Motherfucker member Natalie Mering as Weyes Blood.

Title: Europe
Info: Simon Trought returns to produce the second album for the London-based indie pop band led by Elizabeth Morris.

Title: Forever Blue
Info: The debut full-length release for the London-based artist features guest appearances from Johannes Persson, Fredrik Kihlberg and Tom Fleming.

Title: Dark Matter
Info: The first new studio release for the pop singer-songwriter in nine years was produced by Mitchell Froom, Lenny Waronker, and David Boucher.

Title: Love Streams
Info: The eighth release for the Los Angeles-based Canadian composer features contributions from Kara-Lis Coverdale, Grímur Helgason, The Icelandic Choir Ensemble, and Jóhann Jóhannsson.

Title: Canary
Info: The latest release for the rock band is a concept album about a family going through the Depression in Ohio.

Title: O Monolith
Info: The second full-length release from British post-punk band Squid was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Broken Social Scene
Info: K-OS, Jason Tate (The Weakerthans) and Murray Lightburn (The Dears) guest on the Canadian collective's follow-up to 'You Forgot It In People.'

Title: When I Have Fears
Info: The debut full-length release for the Irish post-punk band was produced by Flood.

Title: Shackles Gift
Info: The second full-length release for the Bristol-based rock band was produced by Andrew Hung of Fuck Buttons.

Title: The Outsiders
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the country rock artist was produced by Jay Joyce.

Title: Nothing Great About Britain
Info: The debut full-length release for the British grime rapper features guest appearances from Jaykae, Mura Masa and Skepta.

Title: Polymer
Info: This is the 10th full-length studio release for the electronic duo of Ed Handley and Andy Turner.

Title: Heaven
Info: The second full-length release for the Toronto-based rock band was recorded in Los Angeles with producer Rob Schnapf.

Title: Viva Las Vengeance
Info: The seventh full-length release for Brendon Urie's solo music project 	Panic! At the Disco was recorded live to tape with Jake Sinclair and Mike Viola.

Title: Glass Swords
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the Scottish producer Russell Whyte.

Title: Woman King [EP]
Info: Sam Beam's latest release is a 6-track EP recorded with Brian Deck.

Title: At Weddings
Info: The debut full-length release for Kentucky-based singer-songwriter Sarah Beth Tomberlin was produced and mixed by Owen Pallett.

Title: Build a Rocket Boys!
Info: The Manchester five-piece alt-rock band's fifth album follows up their Mercury Prize-Winning album, The Seldom Seen Kid, and further showcases their poetic, lyric-driven, atmospheric music.

Title: Stranger in the Alps
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie folk singer-songwriter was produced by Tony Berg and Ethan Grusk.

Title: The  Assassination of Julius Caesar
Info: The 13th release for the Norwegian experimental rock trio was self-produced.

Title: The Waiting Room
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the British indie rock band features guest appearances from Jehnny Beth of Savages and Lhasa De Sel.

Title: Les Voyages de l'ame
Info: The French black metal band led by Neige releases its third album.

Title: Warm Chris
Info: The fourth full-length release for Cardiff-based New Zealand singer-songwriter Aldous Harding was recorded in Wales and produced by John Parish.

Title: Quarter Turns Over a Living Line
Info: This is the debut full-length release from the British duo of Tom Halstead and Joe Andrews.

Title: El Tren Fantasma
Info: Recorded during five weeks of travel by train throughout Mexico, El Tren Fantasma is a sonic portrait of the "ghost train" captured by sound recordist and co-founder of Cabaret Voltaire, Chris Watson.

Title: Sky at Night
Info: Elbow's Guy Garvey and Craig Potter produced the fifth album for the Manchester indie rock trio.

Title: Stand for Myself
Info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Auerbach

Title: Temple Beautiful
Info: San Francisco, the hometown for the country rock singer-songwriter, was the inspiration behind Chuck Prophet's 10th studio album.

Title: Weather
Info: The ninth album for the singer was produced by Joe Henry and features appearances by Chris Connelly and Benji Hughes.

Title: Mesabi
Info: The singer-songwriter's latest album was coproduced by Barry Walsh and features Calexico, Augie Meyers, Van Dyke Parks, and Lucinda Williams as guest singers.

Title: Curse Your Branches
Info: This is the debut solo album for the former Pedro The Lion/Headphones singer-songwriter.

Title: All American Made
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Nashville-based country artist features a guest appearance from Willie Nelson.

Title: Niño Rojo
Info: Nino Rojo, the eccentric singer-songwriter's second release of 2004, was recorded during the same sessions that produced 'Rejoicing In The Hands.'

Title: Stephen Malkmus
Info: The debut solo release from the former leader of indie-rock legends Pavement.

Title: Mad for Sadness
Info: This live recording features 10 tracks, mainly consisting of material from the band's first two albums.

Title: Angels of Darkness, Demons of Light, Vol. 1
Info: The pioneers of drone doom return with part one of its latest concept album (Volume 2 is scheduled for 2012).

Title: Jaguar
Info: The debut full-length release for the R&B singer-songwriter features contributions from Khalid and SG Lewis.

Title: Demon Days
Info: When the comic supergroup's 2001 debut sold an astounding 6 million copies worldwide, a sequel became necessary. Hence 'Demon Days.' Returning leader Damon Albarn (Blur) and new producer Danger Mouse are joined by guests Shaun Ryder (Happy Mondays), Ike Turner, MF Doom, De La Soul and Dennis Hopper.

Title: Football Money
Info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band was produced by Aaron Goldstein and mixed by Holy Fuck's Graham Walsh.

Title: My 21st Century Blues
Info: The debut full-length release for London-based artist RAYE features a guest appearance from 070 Shake.

Title: Sun Racket
Info: This is the first full-length studio release in seven years for the Boston alternative rock trio of Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges.

Title: Don't Lose This
Info: The unfinished recordings from the blues guiatrist was completed with the help of his daughter Mavis Staples and producer Jeff Tweedy.

Title: Immunity
Info: The fourth solo release for the electronic artist/producer includes a guest appearance by King Creosote.

Title: A Love Surreal
Info: Pianist Robert Glasper guests on the Philadelphia singer's jazz, soul, and funk-infused third full-length studio album.

Title: Salad Days
Info: This is the second full-length solo release for the Canadian singer-songwriter.

Title: Radical Romantics
Info: The third full-length solo release for The Knife's Karin Dreijer as Fever Ray features contributions from their brother Olof, Trent Reznor, Atticus Ross and Vessel.

Title: Anak Ko
Info: The third full-length release for Melina Duterte as Jay Som was written after her move to Los Angeles.

Title: The Monitor
Info: The first full-length album on XL Recordings for the rock band from New Jersey was named after a warship that fought during the American Civil War.

Title: COPINGMECHANISM
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for Willow features a guest appearance from Yves Tumor.

Title: The Lookout
Info: The 10th full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Tucker Martin and features contributions from Jim James and Sufjan Stevens.

Title: Wide Awake!
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the New York rock band was produced by Danger Mouse.

Title: Love Will Be Reborn
Info: The latest full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Pierre Marchand.

Title: Don't Shy Away
Info: The second full-length release for the indie rock trio was self-produced except for one Brian Eno-produced track.

Title: Frozen Niagara Falls
Info: Dominick Fernow's latest release as Prurient is a double album produced by Arthur Rizk and Kris Lapke.

Title: Anxiety's Kiss
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Kentucky hardcore trio was produced by J. Robbins.

Title: Tomorrow Was the Golden Age
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based seven-piece instrumental group.

Title: We Get By
Info: The latest full-length solo studio release for the soul singer was produced by Ben Harper.

Title: Wolfgang Amadeus Phoenix
Info: The fourth album for the French rock band was produced with Philippe Zdar.

Title: Arkhon
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for synth-pop artist Zola Jesus was produced by Randall Dunn.

Title: 8 Million Stories
Info: This is the full-length debut for the Ohio-based duo of acclaimed hip-hop producer RJD2 and emcee Blueprint.

Title: Dressy Bessy
Info: This is the third studio album for the Denver-based indie pop band led by Tammy Ealom.

Title: Burn Piano Island, Burn
Info: Known for their loud, angry, and extreme take on metal (well, even more so than your average metal band), The Blood Brothers return with their third album in as many years.

Title: You Are Free
Info: Chan Marshall's first album of new material since 1998 was recorded in Los Angeles with Adam Kasper (Queens of the Stone Age, Foo Fighters, Pearl Jam), who in turn brought in friends such as Dave Grohl and Eddie Vedder.

Title: The Rising
Artist: Bruce Springsteen & The E Street Band
Info: The Boss' first studio album with the E Street Band since 1984's 'Born In The U.S.A.,' 'The Rising' contains 15 new Springsteen songs produced by Brendan O'Brien.

Title: Come Away With Me
Info: Pop/jazz vocalist and pianist Norah Jones, the daughter of Ravi Shankar, picked up 5 Grammy awards for this debut album, produced by Arif Mardin.

Title: Stag
Info: The solo debut from The Indigo Girls' Amy Ray is a bit of a departure from her band's folk sound, instead offering a harder, punk-rock edge. Joan Jett is among the guests appearing on the album.

Title: Our Raw Heart
Info: The eight full-length release for the Oregon metal trio was co-produced with Billy Barnett and written after frontman Mike Scheidt recovered from a near fatal illness caused by the intestinal disease, acute diverticulitis.

Title: Everybody Works
Info: The second release (but first major label album) for San Francisco Bay Area artist Melina Duterte was self-recorded and produced.

Title: Field of Reeds
Info: The third full-length release for the British art rock band experiments with avant garde and classical music elements arranged with conductor André de Ridder and featuring guest appearances by Henry Lowther, Adrian Peacock, Elisa Rodrigues, and Michel van der Aa.

Title: The Renaissance
Info: Q-Tip returns to release his first solo album in nine years with guests such as D'Angelo, Amanda Diva, Norah Jones, and Raphael Saadiq.

Title: Anime, Trauma and Divorce
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based rapper was executive produced by Jacknife Lee.

Title: Sometimes I Wish We Were An Eagle
Info: Previously known as Smog, Bill Callahan releases only the second album under his real name.

Title: Antiphonals
Info: the latest full-length release for the Los Angeles-based Canadian artist was self-produced and mixed.

Title: Limbo
Info: The latest solo album from the Black Dice band member continues his experimental electronic sounds over six tracks.

Title: Heartleap
Info: Said to be the final album from the British singer-songwriter, the third full-length studio release was produced by Joe Boyd.

Title: Broken Hearts Club
Info: The second full-length release for Los Angeles R&B artist Syd features guest appearances from Kehlani, Lucky Daye and Smino.

Title: Rammstein
Info: The first studio release in 10 years for the German metal band was produced with Olsen Involtini.

Title: Shadows in the Night
Info: Produced by Jack Frost, the 36th studio release for the singer-songwriter features pop standards popularized by Frank Sinatra.

Title: Steingarten
Info: Experimental electronica artist Stefan Betke returns with his first full-length in four years.

Title: Hushed and Grim
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Atlanta metal band was produced by David Bottrill.

Title: For All We Know
Info: The debut full-length release for the London singer-songwriter features influences R&B and electronic music.

Title: A Few Stars Apart
Artist: Lukas Nelson & Promise of the Real
Info: The latest full-length release for the country rock band was produced by Dave Cobb.

Title: how i'm feeling now
Info: The fourth full-length release for the pop artist was created with executive producers A. G. Cook and BJ Burton through Zoom calls and asking fans for their preferences.

Title: Guerrilla
Info: The debut full-length release for the Manchester-based Angolan artist was inspired by his visits to his homeland and his father's memoirs about the Angolan civil war.

Title: Midnight
Info: The second full-length release for the Detroit-based indie rock artist was produced by Car Seat Headrest's Will Toledo.

Title: Sirens
Info: The first release for the artist better known as The Bug under his real name was influenced by the birth of his son and the subsequent life-threatening complications that followed.

Title: With Animals
Info: The second full-length collaboration between Mark Lanegan and Duke Garwood was recorded in Los Angeles, Pasadena and Joshua Tree.

Title: Big Machine
Info: Produced by Jim Sutherland, the debut release for the British folk artist and her 12-piece band The Wayward Band features guest appearances from Damien Dempsey, MC Dizraeli, and Teddy Thompson.

Title: All Our Gods Have Abandoned Us
Info: The seventh full-length release for the British metalcore band was produced by Henrik Udd and Fredrik Nordström.

Title: The Most Important Place in the World
Info: The second full-length release from Bill Wells and Aidan Moffat features a theme with the city of Glasgow as a femme fatale.

Title: Do You Like Rock Music?
Info: The third album for the British quartet was produced by Graham Sutton and the band.

Title: Raise The Roof
Info: 14 years after 2007's Raising Sand, Robert Plant and Alison Krauss reunite  for their second full-length collaboration, with T-Bone Burnett also returning to produce.

Title: A Small Turn Of Human Kindness
Info: The Athens, Georgia-based band releases its seventh full-length album.

Title: Good at Falling
Info: The debut full-length release for Amber Bain was produced with BJ Burton and George Daniel.

Title: Chloe and the Next 20th Century
Info: The fifth full-length release for Josh Tillman as Father John Misty was produced with Jonathan Wilson.

Title: How to Live
Info: The debut full-length release for the music project from Mazes/ex-Ultimate Painting member Jack Cooper and Beak>'s Will Young features contributions from Rupert Gillett, Woods' Aaron Nevue and Sunwatchers' Jeff Tobias.

Title: I Was Real
Info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn-based duo of Che Chen and Rick Brown features contributions from Sue Garner, Cheryl Kingan, Steve Maing, and Karen Waltuch.

Title: Before Love Came To Kill Us
Info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter  features guest appearances from 6lack and Eminem.

Title: A Vintage Burden
Info: The Texas psych-rockers led by husband-and-wife team Tom and Christina Carter return with this six-track follow-up to 2004's 'Joy Shapes.'

Title: This Is It & I Am It & You Are It & So Is That & He Is It & She Is It & It Is It & That Is That
Info: The sophomore album for the New Yorker was produced by Zach Hill

Title: Analog Fluids of Sonic Black Holes
Info: The third full-length solo release for the Philadelphia-based artist features guest appearances from Reef The Lost Cauze and Saul Williams.

Title: Sunken Condos
Info: The fourth solo release for the Steely Dan frontman was co-produced with Michael Leonhart.

Title: Labyrinthitis
Info: The latest full-length release for Dan Bejar-led band Destroyer was produced and mixed by John Collins.

Title: Sketchy.
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Oakland-based duo was mostly recorded before the COVID-19 pandemic, but was mixed remotely.

Title: Words & Music by Saint Etienne
Info: The British electronic pop trio return after seven years to work with producers Ian Catt, Richard X, and Nick Coler on its eighth studio album.

Title: Fade
Info: Tortoise's John McEntire takes over as producer from Roger Moutenot (who worked on the band's releases since 1993) on the 13th release from the New Jersey indie rock trio.

Title: England Is a Garden
Info: This is the first full-length studio release in over eight years for the British indie rock band.

Title: Citizen of Glass
Info: The latest release from the Berlin-based singer-songwriter was inspired by a German legal term “Gläserner Bürger”, or “glass citizen,” about the level of privacy we have in the world today.

Title: Too Many Voices
Info: The fifth full-length release for the electronic producer again features the vocals of his piano teacher Alison Skidmore.

Title: Tourist in This Town
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Swearin' co-founder was produced with Jeff Zeigler.

Title: The Great Destroyer
Info: The trio's seventh album (their first for Sub Pop) features production work from Dave Fridmann and an atypically energetic sound.

Title: Ascending a Mountain of Heavy Light
Info: The second collaboration between The Body and Full Of Hell features contributions from Brian Chippendale, Ben Eberle, and Chrissy Wolport.

Title: Burn Something Beautiful
Info: The 12th full-length solo release for the Texas-based singer-songwriter was produced by Peter Buck and Scott McCaughey.

Title: Heavy is the Head
Info: The second full-length studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from Aitch, Burna Boy, H.E.R., Headie One, Ed Sheeran, Tiana Major9, and YEBBA.

Title: Echoes of Silence
Info: This is the third of the Balloon Trilogy mixtapes offered for free via download by Canadian artist, Abel Tesfaye.

Title: The Car
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for British rock band Arctic Monkeys was produced by James Ford.

Title: Essence
Info: Although Lucinda Williams' recording career began in 1979, this is just her sixth full-length release, following 1998's well-received 'Car Wheels on a Gravel Road.' 'Essence' features 11 new trackes penned by Williams and co-produced by Charlie Sexton and Bo Ramsey.

Title: Vampire Weekend
Info: This is the debut album for the quartet of Columbia University alumni.

Title: Vagabon
Info: The second full-length release for the New York-based artist was self-produced.

Title: This (Is What I Wanted to Tell You)
Info: The latest full-length release for the alt-country band led by Kurt Wagner was produced by Matthew McCaughan (who also co-wrote several tracks with Wagner).

Title: Cool It Down
Info: The first new full-length studio release in nine years for New York City indie rock band Yeah Yeah Yeahs features a guest appearance from Perfume Genius.

Title: Gifted
Info: The debut full-length release for the Jamaican reggae artist Koffee features production with JAE5 and Frank Dukes.

Title: Plastic Bouquet
Info: The debut full-length collaboration between Canadian duo Kacy & Clayton and New Zealand singer-songwriter Marlon Williams was recorded in 2019 in Saskatoon, Canada.

Title: From King to a God
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper from Buffalo features guest appearances from Lloyd Banks, Benny The Butcher, Armani Caesar, DeJ Loaf, Elcamino, Flee Lord, Freddie Gibbs, Havoc, Method Man, and Westside Gunn.

Title: On Sunset
Info: The 15th full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was produced with Jan "Stan" Kybert.

Title: The Undivided Five
Artist: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
Info: The fifth-full length release for the ambient duo of Dustin O'Halloran and Adam Wiltzie was recorded at eight different European locations.

Title: Love Songs, Pt. 2
Info: The second full-length release for the London-based Electronic producer is a sequel to his 2013 EP, Love Songs, Pt. 1.

Title: Black Peak
Info: The second full-length release from the duo of Cretan lute player George Xylouris and Dirty Three drummer Jim White was produced by Guy Picciotto.

Title: Male Eunuch
Info: This is the second full-length studio release for the British electronic band.

Title: Health//Disco
Info: The compilation album for the experimental electronic band features remixes by Acid Girls, CFCF, Pink Skull, Narctrax, and Crystal Castles.

Title: The Seldom Seen Kid
Info: The fourth album for the indie rock band features Pulp's Richard Hawley on one track.

Title: Gaslighter
Info: The first new studio album in 14 years for the country trio formerly known as the Dixie Chicks was produced with Jack Antonoff.

Title: OK Cowboy
Info: This is the full-length debut for French techno artist and DJ Pascal Arbez-Nicolas, best known for his 2001 single "La Rock 01" (which is included here).

Title: Map of the Soul: 7
Info: The seventh full-length for the Korean pop band features guest appearances from Halsey and Sia.

Title: After Laughter
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the pop band led by Hayley Williams was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen and band guitarist, Taylor York.

Title: Odds Against Tomorrow
Info: The the sixth full-length solo release for the guitarist features some original songs and was mixed by Chuck Johnson.

Title: Make Way for Love
Info: The second full-length solo release for the New Zealand singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Aldous Harding and was produced by Noah Georgeson.

Title: Wild Mountain Nation
Info: The Portland-based indie band releases its third album.

Title: Parallax
Info: The third studio album under the Atlas Sound name was produced by Bradford Cox himself and Nicholas Vernhes.

Title: Jet Plane And Oxbow
Info: The ninth full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Danny Reisch and features contributions from such artists as Howard Draper, Jesca Hoop, Lucas Oswald, Brian Reitzell, Abram Shook, Cully Symington, and Wye Oak's Jenn Wasner.

Title: Lodestar
Info: The first new solo studio release for the British folk singer since 1978 was recorded in her home and was produced by Ian Kearey.

Title: Pale Green Ghosts
Info: Produced with Biggi Veira, the synth-pop second release for the former Czars singer includes guest vocals from Sinead O’Connor.

Title: Familiars
Info: The fourth album from Brooklyn indie band led by Pete Silberman was influenced by the Eastern philosophy books Silberman was reading.

Title: Sister Cities
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Philadelphia pop-punk band was produced by Joe Chiccarelli.

Title: Cruel Optimism
Info: The latest release for the Australian artist features contributions from Chris Abrahams, Tony Buck, Mats Gustafsson, Thor Harris, Heinz Riegler, and Norman Westberg.

Title: Running out of Love
Info: The first release in over six years for the Swedish dream pop band was influenced by the frustrations at the direction they felt Sweden is heading toward.

Title: Slowdive
Info: The first new release in 22 years for the British rock band was mixed by Chris Coady.

Title: The Monster Who Hated Pennsylvania
Info: The latest full-length release for the singer-songwriter from Seattle was self-produced.

Title: L.W.
Info: The latest full-length release for the Australian psych rock band is the third album in its "Explorations into Microtonal Tuning" volumes.

Title: A Beautiful Thing: Idles Live at Le Bataclan
Info: The first live release for the British post-punk band features the live recording from its 3 December 2018 set at the Le Bataclan in Paris.

Title: Caution
Info: The 15th full-length studio release for the pop singer features guest appearances from Blood Orange, Gunna, Slick Rick, and Ty Dolla Sign.

Title: I Know I'm Funny Haha
Info: The latest full-length release from the Atlanta-based indie folk artist features a guest appearance from Mei Ehara.

Title: Doomin' Sun
Info: The debut full-length release for the project formed by Palehound's Ellen Kempner and Jay Som's Melina Duterte was written and recorded over two weeks in Jan 2020.

Title: Field Report
Info: Before the release of this debut solo album, Chris Porterfield was a member of DeYarmond Edison with Justin Vernon (aka Bon Iver) and Megafaun (Brad Cook, Phil Cook, and Joe Westerlund).

Title: Black Times
Info: The fourth full-length release from the youngest son of Fela Kuti features a guest appearances from Carlos Santana and was produced by Robert Glasper.

Title: Unfollow the Rules
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Mitchell Froom and is his first album of original songs in eight years.

Title: Honeys
Info: The fourth full-length release from the Pennsylvania noise rock band was produced by Alex Newport.

Title: The Magic Place
Info: The Brooklyn-based singer is minimalist in her music, using piano, drums, and her voice to make haunting songs--often drawing comparisons to Enya.

Title: Anywhere But Here
Info: The second full-length studio release for London-based band Sorry was recorded with Portishead’s Adrian Utley.

Title: Fever Dreams, Pts. 1-4
Info: The fourth full-length solo studio release for former Smiths guitarist Johnny Marr was recorded during the COVID-19 lockdown with half of the tracks released on two EPs (Fever Dreams Pt. 1 and 2) in 2021.

Title: Bubba
Info: The second full-length release for the Montreal artist features guest appearancesa from Durand Bernarr, Eight9fly, Estelle, GoldLink, Mick Jenkins, Masego, Teedra Moses, Iman Omari, Ari PenSmith, SiR, Tinashe, Kali Uchis, VanJess, Pharrell Williams, and Charlotte Day Wilson.

Title: Get Tragic
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British alternative rock duo features guest appearances from Clarence Clarity, Ed Harcourt, and The Wytches.

Title: Me
Info: The full-length debut release for Lorely Rodriguez was largely recorded in Mexico and self-produced.

Title: Compton
Info: Released exclusively on Apple Music/iTunes, the third full-length studio album for the rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Marsha Ambrosius, BJ the Chicago Kid, Eminem, The Game, Ice Cube, Justus, Kendrick Lamar, Craig Owens, Jill Scott, Snoop Dogg, and Xzibit.

Title: Africa Express Presents...Terry Riley's In C Mali
Info: Co-produced and mixed by Mouse on Mars' Andi Toma, Africa Express reinterprets Terry Riley's In C Mali.

Title: From Africa With Fury: Rise
Info: The youngest son of Fela Kuti teams up with his father's band, Egypt 80, on this album produced by Brian Eno and John Reynolds.

Title: Fear of a Blank Planet
Info: The ninth album from the British progressive-rock band.

Title: The Ride
Info: The Los Angeles band celebrates 30 years in the music business with this 12th studio recording, the first the band has self-produced. Guests include Café Tacuba, Dave Alvin, Tom Waits, Ruben Blades and Elvis Costello.

Title: Mouthfuls
Info: Yet another experimental indie band to arise out of the Chicago scene, the Fruit Bats are the brainchild of multi-instrumentalist and songwriter Eric Johnson, who has played with Ugly Casanova, I Rowboat, and Califone. On this second Fruit Bats LP, he is joined by Gillian Lisee and producer Brian Deck.

Title: Transfiguration Of Vincent
Info: A former member of the San Luis Obispo, Calif. trio Rodriguez, singer-songwriter M. Ward gained a bit of a following while supporting Bright Eyes on tour in 2002, and has drawn comparisons to Giant Sand, Tom Waits, and Grandaddy. This is his third solo release.

Title: The Coast Is Never Clear
Info: San Francisco's Beulah, part of the Elephant 6 collective of indie-pop bands, returns with a follow-up to their well-received 1999 effort 'When Your Heartstrings Break.'

Title: Dilate
Info: Philly's psychedelic Bardo Pond offer up a 72-minute, ten-track disc. This is their fifth official release, and like its predecessors, it continues the tradition of using a drug reference in the title.

Title: Human Performance
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Brooklyn rock quartet was produced by the band's singer/guitarist Austin Brown.

Title: Grey Tickles, Black Pressure
Info: The third solo release for the ex-The Czars frontman was produced by John Congleton.

Title: True North
Info: The latest release for the artist features contributions from BJ Cole. Sarah Smout, Bridget St John and was produced by Steve Gunn.

Title: Writer's Block
Info: This third album from the Stockholm, Sweden indie-rock trio has attracted critical buzz on both sides of the Atlantic. Victoria Bergsman of the Concretes guests.

Title: Treasure House
Info: This is the second full-length studio release for the British indie rock duo of Rachel Zeffira and Faris Badwan.

Title: Reason in Decline
Info: This is the first full-length studio release for indie rock band Archers Of Loaf since 1998's White Trash Heroes.

Title: J.T.
Info: The latest full-length release for the singer-songwriter features one original written by Steve Earle and 10 songs written by his late son, Justin Townes Earle, who passed away in August 2020.

Title: Muna
Info: The third full-length release for Los Angeles indie pop trio MUNA features a guest appearance from Phoebe Bridgers.

Title: King Of Jeans
Info: The third album for the Pennsylvania hard rock band was produced by Alex Newport.

Title: I'm Your Empress Of
Info: The third full-length release for Lorely Rodriguez as Empress Of was written over two months between tours.

Title: Nighttime Stories
Info: The first full-length release in six year for the Chicago instrumental post-metal band in six years was produced by Sanford Parker.

Title: Honest Life
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Seattle-based singer-songwriter was self-produced.

Title: Time Off
Info: Gunn Truscinski and Justin Tripp join the New York guitarist, who previously worked with Meg Baird, the Magik Markers, and Kurt Vile, on his fourth solo release.

Title: Good Things
Info: The second full-length album for the California-born singer E. Nathaniel Dawkins goes for retro R&B and soul style.

Title: Electrophonic Chronic
Info: The first release in over seven years for Dan Auerbach's side project The Arcs was co-produced by Auerbach and Leon Michels.

Title: See You in the Stars
Info: The first full-length studio album in over 12 years for British rock band Lightning Seeds features songs co-written with The Special's Terry Hall and Coral's James Skelly.

Title: Piteous Gate
Info: This is the debut full-length release for Berlin-based electronic producer James Whipple.

Title: Why Should The Fire Die?
Info: Tony Berg and Eric Valentine produced this follow-up to 2002's Grammy-winning "This Side."

Title: Third Law
Info: This is the third full-length solo release for the London-based experimental electronic artist.

Title: Sojourner
Info: Jason Molina releases four albums from four recordings sessions in a box set that includes a DVD, postcards, and a medallion.

Title: Slave Ambient
Info: The Philadelphia-based group releases a second album of Americana roots-rock.

Title: Nothing Is Still
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the British electronic producer features contributions from Sam Beste, Finn Peters and a ten-piece string section arranged by Amy Langley.

Title: The Kid
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based electronic artist is a concept album about the four stages of life.

Title: These Days
Info: This 43-song, 4-disc set is composed of all new recordings in roughly four different styles (one per disc): rock, country, acoustic bluegrass, and ballads.

Title: De-Loused In The Comatorium
Info: 'De-Loused' is the heavily anticipated debut LP from the group formed by former At The Drive-In members Cedric Bixler and Omar Rodriguez.

Title: Grassed Inn
Info: This is the fourth full-length release for the Australian indie band formed by siblings and a friend in Brisbane.

Title: Father of the Bride
Info: After a six-year break and the departure of Rostam Batmanglij, the New York indie-rock band is finally back with a fourth studio album, produced by Ariel Rechtshaid and frontman Ezra Koenig. Guests include Dave Longstreth (Dirty Projectors), Steve Lacy (The Internet), Danielle Haim, and Jenny Lewis.

Title: One Day I'm Going To Soar
Info: Dexys Midnight Runners returns with the shortened name Dexys for its first studio album in 27 years.

Title: Alphabetland
Info: The Los Angeles punk band returns with its first album in 35 years featuring the original lineup of D. J. Bonebrake, Exenne Cervenka, John Doe, and Billy Zoom.

Title: Ventura
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Southern California artist features guest appearances from André 3000, Brandy, Nate Dogg, Sonyae Elise, Lalah Hathaway, Smokey Robinson, and Jazmine Sullivan.

Title: The Future and the Past
Info: The second full-length release for the Virginia singer-songwriter was produced with Mathew E. White.

Title: Little Seeds
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie-folk husband-and-wife duo of Michael Trent and Cary Ann Hearst was recorded at their home studio in South Carolina.

Title: Furnaces
Info: The seventh full-length release fore the British singer-songwriter was produced by Flood.

Title: Bears, Mayors, Scraps & Bones
Info: This is the third full-length album for the Canadian punk rock band.

Title: Doomsdayer's Holiday
Info: The latest album on the Temporary Residence label for the Oregon quartet.

Title: Electric Version
Info: The Vancouver, Canada indie supergroup attempts to duplicate the success of 2000's 'Mass Romantic' with this sophomore release. Neko Case returns to handle vocal duties.

Title: Point
Info: This is the second international release for Japanese producer/remixer/artist/recording star Cornelius (Keigo Oyamada), following his 1998 breakthrough debut for Matador, 'Fantasma.' A bit less cut-and-paste than its predecessor, 'Point' still showcases a range of musical styles in its 11 tracks.

Title: The Facts Of Life
Info: You take the good, you take the bad, you take them both and then you have... the second album from the UK outfit featuring members of the Auteurs and Jesus and Mary Chain. The title track was a Top 20 hit in the UK.

Title: The Stage Names
Info: The fourth studio album from the Austin, Texas-based band mixes it up with the help of Jim Eno of Spoon.

Title: Sunshine Rock
Info: The 13th solo release for the Hüsker Dü and Sugar frontman was inspired in part by his recent move to Berlin.

Title: Sauna
Info: The double album release from Phil Elverum as Mount Eerie includes a ten-minute song.

Title: Nijimusi
Info: The eighth full-length release for the Japanese experimental rock band is its first with new drummer, Mishina.

Title: Silence Yourself
Info: The debut full-length release for the all-female British post-punk quartet was produced by Johnny Hostile and Rodaidh McDonald.

Title: Overgrown
Info: The second release for the British electronic artist includes a track produced by Brian Eno and another track with RZA as a guest performer.

Title: City of Refuge
Info: The artist combines the sounds of Americana and Asia for her first album on the Rounder label.

Title: Final Transmission
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Massachusetts alt-metal band is its final album with bassist Caleb Scofield, who died in a car accident in 2018.

Title: At Night We Live
Info: This is the first album in over 12 years for the Sacramento rock band who is cited as an influence by such bands as Thursday and Blink 182.

Title: The Magic Position
Info: Quirky, flamboyant, and young, English multi-instrumentalist Wolf makes his major-label debut with this third album of electro-folk-glam-rock. Marianne Faithfull guests.

Title: Mutilator Defeated at Last
Info: The latest full-length release for the San Francisco garage rock band led by John Dwyer was recorded and mixed by bandmember Chris Woodhouse.

Title: Past Life Martyred Saints
Info: Erika M. Anderson of Gowns returns with her debut solo full-length album.

Title: We Shall Overcome: The Seeger Sessions
Info: The Boss' first all-covers album contains 13 tracks associated with folkie Pete Seeger.

Title: Engine of Hell
Info: The latest full-length solo studio release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was written while staying in Wales.

Title: Where You Go I Go Too
Info: The Norwegian producer's album has only three tracks, but one is nearly 29 minutes long.

Title: Lowedges
Info: Named after a suburb of his native Sheffield, England, 'Lowedges' is the third solo release for the Pulp guitarist.

Title: Preacher's Daughter
Info: The debut full-length release for Alabama-based singer-songwriter Ethel Cain was self-produced.

Title: Alligator
Info: This is the third LP for the Brooklyn five-piece fronted by deep-voiced Matt Berninger.

Title: Why Hasn't Everything Already Disappeared?
Info: The eighth full-length release for the Atlanta indie rock band was co-produced with Ben H. Allen, Cate Le Bon, and Ben Etter.

Title: Ultimate Success Today
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Detroit post-punk band was produced by David Tolomei.

Title: Cave World
Info: The third full-length release for Swedish post-punk band Viagra Boys was produced by Pelle Gunnerfeldt and DJ Haydn.

Title: What We Say in Private
Info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian artist was co-produced by Tim Gowdy.

Title: Funeral Mariachi
Info: This is the final album for the rock trio who decided to end the band after the death of drummer Charles Gocher in 2007.

Title: Cut the World [Live]
Info: Antony Hegarty and his band recorded live in Denmark with the Danish National Chamber Orchestra some of the songs from the group's four previous releases with new arrangements.

Title: Universal Audio
Info: The fifth and final album from The Delgados (released on the band's own Chemikal Underground label) was co-produced with Tony Doogan. It ditches the strings of its orchestral predecessor, 'Hate,' to take a much poppier approach.

Title: II Trill
Info: UGK's Bun B sophomore solo album's featured guests include Sean Kingston, Pimp C, Lupe Fiasco, Lil Wayne, Mya, Chamillionaire, and Juvenile.

Title: Shufflemania
Info: The first new solo studio release in five years for British singer-songwriter Robyn Hitchcock features contributions from such artists as Johnny Marr, Sean Ono Lennon, Pat Sansone, Eric Slick Kimberley Rew, and Morris Windsor of The Soft Boys.

Title: Valdez
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Philadelphia noise-rock trio of Mike Polizze, Jason Killinger and Ben Leaphart was recorded in 2014.

Title: Rap Or Go To The League
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Marsha Ambrosius, Chance the Rapper, E-40, Ariana Grande, Kodak Black, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne, Travis Scott, Ty Dolla Sign, and Young Thug.

Title: Fallen Trees
Info: The latest full-length release for the Ukrainian pianist/composer features contributions from David Allred, Anne Müller, and Hatis Noit.

Title: Songs You Make at Night
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British folktronica collective feature the original line-up.

Title: Now That I'm a River
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Slow Club/The Surfing Magazines member was self-produced.

Title: What If
Info: The eighth full-length release for German pianist/composer Volker Bertelmann under the name Hauschka features player pianos (also known as pianolas).

Title: A Cosmic Rhythm with Each Stroke
Info: The debut full-length release for the duet between Vijay Iyer and Wadada Leo Smith was produced by Manfred Eicher.

Title: Cortar Todo
Info: The latest release for the Italian experimental jazz-metal band is its first with new drummer Gabe Serbian.

Title: Impossible Spaces
Info: The second album under his real name combines the sounds of electronic, folk and rock music.

Title: Love Is Overtaking Me
Info: The album features 21 tracks never before released by the late singer/songwriter Arthur Russell.

Title: La Foret
Info: The experimental indie-rockers led by Jamie Stewart return with album number four.

Title: Couple Tracks: Singles 2002-2009
Info: The two-disc collection of the punk rock band's singles plus five unreleased tracks (demos, outakes, and session versions).

Title: Real
Info: The fourth full-length release for the alt-country singer-songwriter was produced by Joe Viers.

Title: Wakin on a Pretty Daze
Info: The fifth release for the Philadelphia singer-guitarist was produced by John Agnello.

Title: Nearer My God
Info: The third full-length release for the St. Louis indie rock band was produced by Matt Bayles.

Title: Asphalt Meadows
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for indie/alternative rock band Death Cab For Cutie was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Panorama
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Michigan post-hardcore band was produced with Will Yip.

Title: Hot Thoughts
Info: The ninth full-length release for indie rock band was co-produced with Dave Fridmann.

Title: Inferno
Info: The seventh full-length solo release for the Australian singer-songwriter was produced by Victor Van Vugt.

The British folk singer-songwriter worked with Steve Gunn, who also produced the album features guest vocals from Bridget St John and a band that includes Nathan Bowles, James Elkington, and Jimy SeiTang.

Title: Film of Life
Info: The tenth studio release for the Afrobeat drummer was recorded in France with the Jazzbastards.

Title: At My Age
Info: His age? 58. And "At My Age" marks the first studio recording for the English singer-songwriter in six years.

Title: Smoke Ring for My Halo
Info: The fourth full-length from the Philadelphian songwriter showcases his ability to weave stories and strings together with his lyrical craftsmanship – comparable to Tom Petty and Bob Seger – and guitar-playing skills.

Title: Dig in Deep
Info: The 20th studio release for the multiple Grammy-winning blues singer-songwriter was self-produced.

Title: Bad Vibes
Info: The second album for Los Angeles producer Henry Laufer is the first to feature his vocals.

Title: Folklore
Info: The moody alt-country band led by David Eugene Edwards returns with its darkest set of songs yet.

Title: Murray Street
Info: Now into their third decade of recording, Sonic Youth offer up a return to form that has more in common with their output of the 80s than with anything they have released in recent years. Multi-instrumentalist Jim O'Rourke, who worked with the band on their previous effort 'NYC Ghosts & Flowers,' is now a full-fledged member of the group.

Title: Asleep In The Back
Info: Often compared to Doves and Radiohead, Manchester-based Elbow is yet another new alternative band to emerge from the British music press hype machine. This debut album was shortlisted for 2001's Mercury Music Prize.

Title: Discovery of a World Inside the Moone
All the Time
Info: The third full-length release for the New York-based Canadian pop artist was again produced with Junior Boys' Jeremy Greenspan.

Title: The Secret
Info: The third album for the son of Ali Farka Toure integrates different musical styles with his Malian music and includes such guest stars as Dave Matthews, Derek Trucks, and John Scofield.

Title: August
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles singer-songwriter was produced with Ty Segall and features contributions from Mikal Cronin, Nick Murray and Segall.

Title: Fear Fear
Info: The second full-length release for British synth-rock band Working Men's Club was produced by Ross Orton.

Title: Sound of the Morning
Info: The second full-length release for British singer-songwriter was co-produced by co-produced by Ali Chant and Dan Carey.

Title: Tara Jane O'Neil
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Chris Cohen, Carolyn Pennypacker-Riggs and Joan Shelley.

Title: Up to Anything
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the indie pop trio from Brisbane, Australia.

Title: No Way There from Here
Info: The fifth studio release for the the country singer was recorded in Nashville and is her first album of original material since 2005’s Humming By The Flowered Vine.

Title: Dig Thy Savage Soul
Info: The second release since the reformation of the rock and R&B band (with new drummer Andy Jody and saxophonist Tom Quartulli) in 2010, is its first on the Bloodshot label.

Title: Condors
Info: Named after a character in Jurassic Park, the British trio releases their debut album, with band member Ayu Okakita's voice as a looped instrument.

Title: Being Funny In A Foreign Language
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for British rock band The 1975 was produced with Jack Antonoff.

Title: There Is Love In You
Info: The fifth album from Kieran Hebden is his first full-length release in five years.

Title: I Walked with You a Ways
Info: The debut full-length release for Waxahatchee's Katie Crutchfield and Jess Williamson as Plains was recorded in Durham, North Carolina with collaborator and producer Brad Cook.

Title: Childqueen
Info: The second full-release for the Los Angeles-based artist was self-produced and mixed.

Title: Hold On!
Info: The fourth full-length release for the R&B/soul singer and his band was recorded live with producer Gabriel Roth.

Title: Heavy Light
Info: The latest full-length release for the solo project for Meghan Remy was recorded live in Montreal with 20 session musicians.

Title: Birth of Violence
Info: The sixth full-length release for the California singer-songwriter was recorded by Ben Chisholm.

Title: Brothers
Info: The latest album for the duo of Daniel Auerbach and Patrick Carney features two tracks produced with Danger Mouse.

Title: The  Dream Is Over
Info: The second full-length release for the Toronto punk band was recorded despite a diagnosis of a possible end of Stefan Babcock's singing career due to a hemorrhaging cyst on his vocal cords if he continued.

Title: Jarvis
Info: Pulp frontman Jarvis Cocker makes his solo debut with this 14-song disc (which includes recent single "Running The World" as a secret bonus track).

Title: Post-Nothing
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the indie-rock duo from Vancouver, Canada.

Title: Pain Is Beauty
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the experimental California singer-songwriter was produced with Ben Chisholm.

Title: Saturation III
Info: The third and final release of the trilogy of albums from the California-based alternative hip hop group.

Title: Zoy Zoy
Info: The second full-length release for the group based in Niger was recorded by Jamie Carter.

Title: Stitches
Info: The seventh release for the indie experimental rock band led by Tim Rutili was recorded in Arizona, California, and Texas.

Title: Wildcard
Info: The seventh full-length release for the country singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Maren Morris and was produced by Jay Joyce.

Title: ATAXIA
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British electronic producer.

Title: Cry Cry Cry
Info: The first full-length release in seven years for the indie-rock band led by Spencer Krug and Dan Boeckner was produced by John Goodmanson.

Title: Primary Colours
Info: The second album for the British rock band was produced by Portishead's Geoff Barrow.

Title: Album Of The Year
Info: The Good Life is a side project for Cursive's Tim Kasher, and this third full-length release (following the 'Lovers Need Lawyers' EP) finds him joined by Stefanie Drootin, Ryan Fox and Roger Lewis.

Title: Venice
Info: Vienna's Christian Fennesz, who creates ambient electronica based on processed guitar sounds, returns with his first solo studio effort in four years. David Sylvian guests on one track.

Title: Haha Sound
Info: This is just the second full-length recording for the Birmingham, England experimental pop outfit founded in 1995. Included here is the track "Pendulum" from the recent EP of the same name.

Title: band red
Info: This is the sophomore disc for the Norwich, England rock band (led by excitable vocalist Nikki Colk) who at times recall a harder-rocking Electrelane or a UK version of the Yeah Yeah Yeahs.

Title: Good Looking Blues
Info: The third release from the trip-hop/indie/rock/electronic/jazz/pop band named after the first dog in outer space.

Title: SIGN
Info: This is the 14th full-length studio release for the British electronic duo of of Sean Booth and Rob Brown.

Title: The Million Masks of God
Info: The latest full-length studio release for the Atlanta indie rock band was produced with Ethan Gruska and Catherine Marks.

Title: Solo
Info: The pianist's follow-up to last year's Historicity, where he worked as part of a trio, is a solo album of originals and covers.

Title: Other You
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the indie singer-songwriter was recorded in Los Angeles with producer Rob Schnapf.

Title: Help Us Stranger
Info: The first new studio release in 11 years for the Detroit rock band features a cover of Donovan's "Hey Gyp (Dig the Slow)" and was self-produced with Joshua V. Smith.

Title: Blood
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter and cellist features production from Jamie xx, Rodaidh McDonald, Skrillex, and Adrian Younge.

Title: Le Kov
Info: The singer-songwriter worked with Rhys Edwards on her second full-length release sung entirely in the Cornish-language.

Title: Sempiternal
Info: The fourth release for the British metalcore band was produced by Terry Date and is its first with Worship's Jordan Fish.

Title: color theory
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Nashville singer-songwriter was produced by Gabe Wax and mixed by Lars Stalfors.

Title: About Farewell
Info: The folk singer-songwriter's divorce from Tom Bevitori was an influence on the John Askew-produced fourth full-length release.

Title: WOW
Info: The fifth full-length solo release from Russian electronic artist/producer Kate NV features contributions from by Andrey Bessonov, OG Lullabies and Nami Sato.

Title: Apollo XXI
Info: The debut full-length solo studio release for The Internet guitarist features guest appearances from Daisy and Amandla Stenberg.

Title: False Readings On
Info: This is the eighth full-length studio release for Matthew Cooper under the name Eluvium.

Title: Honor Found In Decay
Info: The tenth full-length studio album for the Oakland, California metal band was produced with Steve Albini.

Title: Beware of the Dogs
Info: The debut full-length release for the Australian singer-songwriter was  produced by Dean Tuza.

Title: Fading Frontier
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Atlanta indie rock band was produced with Ben H. Allen III.

Title: Turn Up That Dial
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Boston Celtic punk band was produced by Ted Hutt.

Title: Of the Sun
Info: The latest full-length release for the Polish alternative band led by Grzegorz Kwiatkowski was recorded, produced and mixed by Michal Kupicz.

Title: Love Remains
Info: The debut album for Tom Krell, a singer from Germany, includes tracks that were previously released on EPs.

Title: Written In Chalk
Info: Married couple Buddy and Julie Miller release their latest album together featuring guest artists including Robert Plant, Emmylou Harris, Patty Griffin, the McCrary Sisters, and Larry Campbell.

Title: The Midnight Sun
Info: The second full-length release for the Scottish artist was again self-recorded and produced.

Title: Denim & Diamonds
Info: The first full-length release in five years for country artist Nikki Lane was produced by Queens Of The Stone Age's Josh Homme.

Title: Irisiri
Info: The third full-length release for the Queens-based experimental artist Alexandra Drewchin features guest appearances by Moor Mother and Odwalla1221.

Title: The Next Day
Info: In the works for over two years with producer Tony Visconti, this is the first new studio release from David Bowie in ten years.

Title: God Don't Make Mistakes
Info: The latest full-length solo release for Buffalo rapper Conway The Machine features guest appearances from 7xvethegenius, Benny The Butcher, Lil Wayne, Novel, Keisha Plum, Annette Price, Rick Ross, Jill Scott, Beanie Sigel, Jae Skeese, T.I., and Westside Gunn.

Title: Holy Ghost
Info: The third full-length release for the Philadelphia quartet features Jacob Ewald and Brendan Lukens splitting songwriting duties between themselves with production by Hop Along's Joe Reinhart.

Title: Banga
Info: Patti Smith's first album since 2004's Trampin' features guest appearances by her children Jesse and Jackson, Tom Verlaine, and Jack Petruzzelli.

Title: New Multitudes
Info: Unreleased songs from folk legend Woody Guthrie are interpreted by Son Volt's Jay Farrar, Centro-matic's Will Johnson, Anders Parker, and My Morning Jacket's Jim James.

Title: This Land
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Austin singer-guitarist was co-produced with Jacob Sciba.

Title: 10,000 Gecs
Info: This is the second full-length release from Los Angeles-based hyperpop duo 100 gecs.

Title: Never Were the Way She Was
Info: The debut full-length collaboration between Arcade Fire's saxophonist Colin Stetson and violinist Sarah Neufeld was produced by Hans Bernard.

Title: Tirtha
Info: Vijay Iyer collaborates with Prasanna and Nitin Mitta to combine their different styles of music to create this jazz album.

Title: Tramp
Info: The third album for the singer-songwriter was produced by The National's Aaron Dessner, who also guests on the release with fellow band member Bryce Dessner, Julianna Barwick, Zach Condon of Beirut, Matt Barrick of The Walkmen, and Jenn Wasner of Wye Oak.

Title: Get Yer Ya-Ya's Out! The Rolling Stones In Concert [40th Anniversary Deluxe Box Set]
Info: The rerelease of the two-night concert at Madison Square Garden in 1969 features five unreleased tracks and tracks from the opening acts: BB King and Ike & Tina Turner.

Title: Heavy Pendulum
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Boston-based post-hardcore band was produced by Kurt Ballou and is its first with new bassist Converge's Nate Newton.

Title: Not Your Muse
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-born, London-based singer-songwriter who won the BBC Sound of 2020 features production from Josh Crocker, Jamie Hartman and John Hill.

Title: New Breed
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for Dawn Richard was influenced by her hometown of New Orleans and features contributions from Cole M.G.N, Hudson Mohawke and Kaveh Rastegar.

Title: Bellowing Sun
Info: The latest full-length release for Jaime Fennelly's solo project was originally Commissioned by the  Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago and was produced by Tortoise's John McEntire.

Title: Songs In Red And Gray
Info: Singer-songwriter Suzanne Vega fills her sixth studio album with 13 new compositions. Former producer (and former husband) Mitchell Froom is gone, replaced by Rupert Hine, who creates an overall sound that is more like Vega's earliest recordings than her Froom-produced output during the 1990s.

Title: Ivy Tripp
Info: The third full-length release for the New York-based Alabama singer-songwriter Katie Crutchfield was co-produced with Kyle Gilbride and Keith Spencer.

Title: Atlanta Millionaires Club
Info: The third full-length release for the Atlanta-based indie singer-songwriter was co-produced with Drew Vandenberg.

Title: True Meanings
Info: The 14th full-length solo studio release for British singer-songwriter was recorded in just over three weeks and features contributions from Rod Argent, Martin Carthy, Erland Cooper, Connor O’Brien, and Danny Thompson.

Title: Loose Future
Info: The eighth full-length release for singer-songwriter Courtney Marie Andrews features contributions Chris Bear, Josh Kaufman, Dan Lead, Colin Nealis, Sam Owens, Jared Samuels, and Austin Vaughn.

Title: Tears Of The Valedictorian
Info: This is the fourth full-length for the Canadian indie-rock band led by Carey Mercer (also of Swan Lake).

Title: More Faithful
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian indie band led by Jasamine White-Gluz was produced by Jorge Elbrecht.

Title: Shelly's on Zenn-La
Info: The third full-length solo release for the British cellist and producer features guest appearances from Chrysanthemum Bear, Malibu and Kathryn Williams.

Title: Lay It Down
Info: Al Green's latest album includes guests John legend and Anthony Hamilton. It was also produced in part by Willie Mitchell and Ahmir "?uestlove" Thompson.

Title: Aerial
Info: This double-disc set is the influential singer-songwriter's first album in a dozen years.

Title: Straight Songs of Sorrow
Info: The latest solo release for the former Screaming Trees lead singer features contributions from such artists as Greg Dulli, the Bad Seeds’ Warren Ellis, Ed Harcourt, Led Zeppelin’s John Paul Jones, Lamb of God’s Mark Morton, and Portishead’s Adrian Utley.

Title: Lala Belu
Info: The first new release in 15 years for the Ethiopian keyboard and accordion player features contributions from Tony Buck and Mike Majkowski.

Title: Expect Delays
Info: The second full-length release for the London indie rock band was produced by Rory Atwell.

Title: Parting the Sea Between Brightness and Me
Info: Recorded over five days with producer Ed Rose, the second album for the Los Angeles post-hardcore band is its first on the Deathwish label.

Title: Angels of Death
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was written in a 19th century church near Lake Erie.

Title: Chosen Lords
Info: This ten-track album compiles versions of songs first released in 2005 as AFX's "Analord" series of (quite expensive) vinyl singles.

Title: After
Info: The second full-length release for Aly Spaltro as Lady Lamb was co-produced by Nadim Issa.

Title: AJ Tracey
Info: The debut full-length release for the British rapper features guest appearances from Jay Critch, Giggs, and Not3s.

Title: Ungodly Hour
Info: The second full-length studio release for the R&B sister duo of Chloe and Halle Bailey features guest appearances from Swae Lee and Mike Will Made-It.

Title: Onion
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Oakland, California quartet was produced by the Black Keys' Dan Auerbach.

Title: Ojalá
Info: The debut full-length release from Cocteau Twins' bassist Simon Raymonde and Dif Juz's drummer Richie Thomas features guest appearances from such artists as Ghostpoet, Marissa Nadler, Horse Thief's Cameron Neal, The Innocence Mission's Karen Peris, Hilang Child/Ed Riman, ex-Midlake frontman Tim Smith, Sharon Van Etten, and Lanterns On The Lake's Hazel Wilde.

Title: Now You Are One Of Us
Info: The experimental Dallas, Texas outfit led by John Congleton returns with a spooky, noisy fourth album.

Title: Honey
Info: The second full-length studio release for Nashville-based singer-songwriter Samia was produced by Caleb Wright and features contributions from Christian Lee Hutson, Jake Luppen, Briston Maroney, Raffaella Meloni, and Papa Mbye.

Title: When the Wind Forgets Your Name
Info: The latest full-length release for indie rock band Built to Spill features Oruã's Le Almeida and João Casaes.

Title: Somewhere Else
Info: The Ohio country-rock singer is backed by Nick German, Ben Lamb, and Todd May on her third full-length release.

Title: Bark Your Head Off, Dog
Info: The third full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock band led by Frances Quinlan was self-produced and recorded.

Title: TSOL
Info: The latest album for the Canadian rapper was nominated for a Polaris Music Prize.

Title: Love Travels At Illegal Speeds
Info: This is the fifth solo disc for the former Blur guitarist.

Title: 13 Rivers
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was self-produced.

Title: Fever Ray
Info: The Knife's Karin Dreijer Andersson releases her solo album under the name Fever Ray.

Title: AM
Info: Produced by James Ford and Ross Orton, the fifth full-length studio release for the indie rock band includes guest appearances by Josh Homme, Bill Ryder-Jones, and Pete Thomas.

Title: Contra
Info: The second album for the rock band was produced by band member, Rostam Batmanglij.

Title: Get Behind Me Satan
Info: The duo's fifth long-player, destined to be known as GBMS in record reviews everywhere, was recorded in their Detroit studio. While not a total departure from previous efforts, it does find them expanding their sound away from their usual guitar+drums formula.

Title: Paranoïa, Angels, True Love
Info: The latest full-length release from Christine And The Queens features guest appearances by 070 Shake and Madonna.

Title: nature morte
Info: The latest full-length release from Montreal trio BIG|BRAVE was recorded, mixed and produced by Seth Manchester.

Title: Reason to Smile
Info: The debut full-length release from British artist Kojey Radical features guest appearances from Cashh, Ego Ella May, hakka, Kelis, Lex Amor, Knucks, Masego, Rexx Life Raj, Tiana Major9,  Shaé Universe, and Wretch 32.

Title: Consequences
Info: The latest full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was self-recorded and produced.

Title: Love Is the King
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the Wilco singer was produced with Tom Schick and features his sons Spencer and Sammy.

Title: Keleketla!
Info: The collaborative project brought together by Coldcut and Keletetla! Library founders Rangoato Hlasane and Malose Malahlela features appearances from such artists as Tony Allen, Antibalas, Shabaka Hutchings, Nono Nkoane, Tamar Osborn, Afla Sackey, Dele Sosimi, Tenderlonious, Thabang Tabane, The Watts Prophets, and Sibusile Xaba.

Title: UNLOCKED
Info: The eight-track soundtrack to the short film of the same name is a collaboration between Denzel Curry and Kenny Beats.

Title: You Will Not Die
Info: The second full-length release for the South African actor/singer was produced by Ben Christopher.

Title: Dead Magic
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Swedish singer-songwriter features a 20th century pipe organ and was produced by Randall Dunn.

Title: By the Way I Forgive You
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was co-produced by Dave Cobb and Shooter Jennings.

Title: Damned Devotion
Info: The fifth full-length release for Joan Wasser was produced with Thomas Bartlett and Parker Kindred.

Title: Open Here
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British alternative rock band features contributions from Liz Corney, Ed Cross, Simon Dennis, Pete Fraser, Sarah Hayes, Ele Leckie, Jo Montgomery, and Chrissie Slater.

Title: Visions of a Life
Info: The second full-length release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.

Title: Green Twins
Info: The debut full-length release for the New York City-based artist was recorded over a three year period with guest appearances from Jesse & Forever and Onyx Collective.

Title: Play What They Want
Info: The third release for the John Colpitts project features guest appearances by Laurie Anderson, David Byrne, Nick Hallett, Trans Am's Phil Manley, Quince Contemporary Vocal Ensemble, TIGUE, and Yo La Tengo.

Title: IV
Info: This is the first full-length studio release since 2009's Thriller for the British noise rock band.

Title: Closure
Info: This is the 12th and final release for the British collective led by Glen Johnson.

Title: Jardín
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Brooklyn R&B singer best known for being sample on Drake's "Jungle" track.

Title: Bonito Generation
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the London-based J-pop-influenced trio.

Title: Eric Bachmann
Info: This is the second full-length solo release for the former frontman of Archers of Loaf and Crooked Fingers under his name.

Title: If I've Only One Time Askin'
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian alt-country singer-songwriter was self-produced.

Title: Last Dance
Info: The second release of jazz classic from Keith Jarrett and Charlie Haden are from the same 2007 sessions as those on 2010's Jasmine.

Title: Settle
Info: The debut release for the British electronic duo of Guy and Howard Lawrence  features guest appearances from AlunaGeorge, Eliza Doolittle, Sasha Keable, London Grammar, Ed Macfarlane, Sam Smith, Jesse Ware, and Jamie Woon.

Title: Ohnomite
Info: The latest solo album for producer/MC Oh No utilizes sound samples from the soundtracks of Rudy Ray Moore's blaxpoitation films.

Title: Last
Info: The fourth album for the Northumberland folk group was produced by Adrian McNally.

Title: Marnie Stern
Info: The more emotional third album for the New York-based singer/songwriter has a much simpler title than her 2008 release.

Title: Avi Buffalo
Info: This is the debut album for the Long Beach, California-based rock band led by Avigdor Zahner-Isenberg, who also goes by the name Avi Buffalo.

Title: Signal Morning
Info: The second album for the W. Cullen Hart-led indie rock band is its first in eight years.

Title: Help
Info: The San Francisco-based band led by John Dwyer releases its follow-up to last year's "The Masters Bedroom is Worth Spending a Night In."

Title: Cross
Info: The French dance duo known for remixing songs from the likes of Franz Ferdinand emerge with their debut album.

Title: The Mouse And The Mask
Info: This collaboration between MF Doom and Danger Mouse includes voices and skits from Cartoon Network's Adult Swim shows. Non-animated folks like Ghostface Killah, Cee-Lo & Talib Kweli also lend a hand.

Title: Weightlifting
Info: The fourth album for the veteran Scottish band is their first album release in eight years and first U.S. release since 1993's 'I've Seen Everything.'

Title: Movement
Info: This is the second full-length for the Olympia, Wash-based indie-punk trio led by powerful singer Beth Ditto.

Title: Morning Phase
Info: The 12th studio release for the singer-songwriter includes contributions from  Jason Falkner, Smokey Hormel, Roger Joseph Manning Jr., Justin Meldal-Johnsen, and Joey Waronker.

Title: Researching the Blues
Info: The first release in over 15 years for the Los Angeles rock quartet was produced by band co-founder, Steven McDonald.

Title: Capacity
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn indie rock band led by Adrianne Lenker was produced by Andrew Sarlo.

Title: The Inheritors
Info: This is the follow-up to the British electronic producer's 2006's The Idiots Are Winning.

Title: Benjamin Booker
Info: The debu full-length release for the New Orleans based singer-songwriter was produced by Andrija Tokic.

Title: The Talkies
Info: The second full-length release for the Irish noise rock band was recorded at Ballintubbert House.

Title: Life is Good
Info: Mary J. Blige, Anthony Hamilton, Miguel, Rick Ross, Swizz Beatz, and the late Amy Winehouse are guests on the tenth release for the rapper.

Title: RR7349
Artist: S U R V I V E
Info: Fresh off scoring Netflix's Stranger Things, Michael Stein and Kyle Dixon and the other three members of the Austin synth band return with its self-recorded second full-length album on new label, Relapse Records.

Title: Picaresque
Info: Chris Walla produced this third album for the literary Portland, Ore.-based five-piece led by Colin Meloy.

Title: The Ruby Cord
Info: The latest full-length solo release for British singer-songwriter Richard Dawson is the final part of his time-travelling trilogy of albums that began with 2017's Peasant.

Title: Zeros
Info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in Nashville with Jay Joyce and mixed by Spike Stent.

Title: Diviner
Info: The debut full-length solo release for former frontman of Wild Beast was produced by Leo Abrahams.

Title: From a Room, Vol. 1
Info: The first of two releases in 2017 for the award-winning country singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.

Title: Take Me to the Alley
Info: The fourth full-length release for the soul-jazz singer-songwriter was produced by Kamau Kenyatta.

Title: American Dollar Bill - Keep Facing Sideways, You're Too Hideous To Look at Face On
Info: The collaboration between Keiji Haino and Sumac was recorded during improvised sessions.

Title: Civilian
Info: The Baltimore duo, named after Maryland’s state tree, is made up of musicians Andy Stack and Jenn Wasner – a couple of indie rock and folk favorites.

Title: Magic Oneohtrix Point Never
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for Daniel Lopatin as Oneohtrix Point Never features contributions from Arca, Caroline Polachek and The Weeknd.

Title: Fear Inoculum
Info: The long-delayed release of the fifth studio album from the Maynard James Keenan-led rock band comes after overcoming a number of issues between the 13 years since 2006's 10,000 Days.

Title: The Queen of Hearts
Info: The debut release for the music project between Olivia Chaney and The Decemberists features English-Irish-Scottish folk songs and was produced by Tucker Martine.

Title: Scale
Info: Like a more accessible, poppier version of Matmos, UK electronica artist Matthew Herbert likes to record concept albums with instrumentation derived from real-world objects. 'Scale' (which again features Dani Siciliano on vocals) samples 723 items (including coffins and fuel pumps) in its 11 politically-charged dance tracks.

Title: Salutations
Info: The seventh full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter features full-band versions of tracks from 2016's Ruminations (plus seven new songs) with contributions from Pearl Charles, Jim James, Blake Mills, Gus Seyffert, Maria Taylor, Nathaniel Walcott, M. Ward, Gillian Welch, and Jonathan Wilson.

Title: Burst Apart
Info: The Brooklyn band return with a follow-up to their indie-rock landmark album, Hospice.

Title: Kaani
Info: The third release for the Nigerian ensemble was recorded with the help of producer Jamie Carter.

Title: Nuclear Daydream
Info: The singer-songwriter's fifth studio album is the first for his new record label, Lonely Astronaut.

Title: Starting Over
Info: The fourth full-length release for the country singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.

Title: Careful
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Massachusetts-based electronic duo of Jae Matthews and August Miller.

Title: Avatar
Info: This seven-song follow-up to 2004's 'Blue Cathedral' adds a bit more melody and cleaner sound to the band's usual noise assault.

Title: Motion Graphics
Info: This is the debut release for the experimental electronic project of Joe Williams (who also releases albums under the name White Williams).

Title: Blue Smoke
Info: The 42nd studio release for the country singer features duets with Kenny Rogers and Willie Nelson.

Title: Platform
Info: The third full-length release for the San Francisco-based experimental electronic-pop artist features vocals from Claire Tolan.

Title: IGOR
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based rapper features guest appearances from ASAP Rocky, Dev Hynes, Frank Ocean, Playboi Carti, Santigold, Kanye West, Pharrell Williams, and Charlie Wilson.

Title: Your Future Our Clutter
Info: Continuing with the same lineup as 2008's "Imperial Wax Solvent," the British rock band led by Mark E. Smith releases its 28th studio album on new label Domino records.

Title: Punish, Honey
Info: This is the second full-length electronic release for producer Sebastian Gainsborough as Vessel.

Title: Goon
