Info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter features production from Black Keys' Patrick Carney, Ariel Rechtshaid, and Girls' Chet White.

Title: R Plus Seven
Info: The fifth release for experimental electronic artist Daniel Lopatin is his first disc with Wrap Records as Oneohtrix Point Never.

Title: Push the Sky Away
Info: The 15th release for Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds was produced by Nick Launay and is its first without Mick Harvey, who left in 2009.

Title: The Avalanche
Info: The latest full-length release for the Mike Kinsella solo musical project features a guest appearance from KC Dalager and was produced by Sean Carey.

Title: Medicine Songs
Info: The latest release from the Canadian Cree singer-songwriter features two new songs with 11 rerecorded versions of her older songs.

Title: Sea Island
Info: The latest full-length release for Canadian artist Scott Morgan as Loscil features contributions from Josh Lindstrom, Ashley Pitre, Elaine Reynolds, Kelly Wyse, and Jason Zumpano.

Title: Quixotism
Info: The five piece album from the experimental Australian composer features contributions from such artists as Matt Chamberlain, Thomas Brinkmann, Crys Cole, the Icelandic Symphony Orchestra, Eyvind Kang, Jim O' Rourke, John Tilbury, and U-zhaan.

Title: Lese Majesty
Info: This is the second full-length release from the Seattle-based experimental hip-hop group led by Ishmael Butler.

Title: L'Ami du Peuple
Info: The seventh solo release for Mike Kinsella as Owen was produced by  Neil Strauch.

Title: The Violence
Info: The third and final part of the British singer-songwriter's Essex trilogy of albums is about the seventeenth century Essex Witch Trials.

Title: Imperial Wax Solvent
Info: The latest album from the British group is with yet another different lineup from 2007's "Reformation Post TLC."

Title: Fur & Gold
Info: The debut album was nominated for the Mercury Prize for best British album this year.

Title: Christfucker
Info: The third full-length release for the Austin hardcore band was produced by Ben Greenberg.

Title: Wilderness
Info: This is the fourth solo disc for the illustrator and Sea And Cake guitarist.

The debut full-length studio release for the Canadian electronic producer under the name Kaytranada (he has six credited under Kaytradamus) features guest appearances from such artists as AlunaGeorge, BadBadNotGood, Craig David, Little Dragon, Vic Mensa, Anderson .Paak, Phonte, and Syd tha Kyd.

Title: Let It All In
Info: The latest full-length release for the Baltimore folk rock band led by Dave Heumann was recorded by  Steve Wright and features guest appearances from Hans Chew and David Bergander.

Title: Fever
Info: The debut full-length release for the Houston rapper features guest appearances from DaBaby and Juicy J.

Title: Lateness of Dancers
Info: The fifth full-length release for M.C. Taylor features Phil and Brad Cook of Megafaun, William Tyler, Scott Hirsch, and Alexandra Sauser-Monnig of Mountain Man.

Title: Pushin' Against a Stone
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Tennessean country singer was produced by Kevin Agunas and Dan Auerbach.

Title: The  Man Who Died in His Boat
Info: The latest release from Liz Harris contains songs unreleased from her recording session for 2008's Dragging A Dead Deer Up A Hill.

Title: Movement
Info: Using a computer, the Tennessee-born musician manipulated her vocals to form her experimental electronic debut full-length release.

Title: New Leaves
Info: Mike Kinsella's latest solo album under the name Owen was recorded over two years.

Title: I Speak Because I Can
Info: The second album for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Ethan Johns.

Title: You're Not As _____ As You Think
Info: The third full-length release for the Connecticut-based indie rock band led by Cam Boucher was produced and mixed by Mike Sapone.

Title: Sycamore Meadows
Info: The producer/singer/songwriter releases his lastest solo album.

Title: Leaving Songs
Info: Leaving Songs is the Nashville-recorded second solo disc for Tindersticks frontman Stuart Staples, who is joined by Maria McKee on one track.

Title: Moms
Info: The fifth album for the indie rock band is its first as a duo (Justin Harris and Danny Seim) after the departure of Brent Knopf, who left to concentrate on his solo project, Ramona Falls.

Title: Potential
Info: The second full-length release for Brooklyn-based electronic producer James Hinton used vocal samples he found on YouTube.

Title: How the West Was Won
Info: The debut full-length solo release for former frontman of The Only Ones was produced by Chris Kimsey.

Title: Redemption
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Southern California rapper features guest appearances from J. Cole, Future, Jeremih, Kendrick Lamar, and SZA.

Title: Bright Like Neon Love
Info: This debut by Australian Dan Whitford mixes retro-synth pop with some guitars and live instrumentation.

Title: Sprinter
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based singer-songwriter was co-produced with Rob Ellis.

Title: Paramore
Info: Paramour returns without Josh and Zac Farro to release its fourth full-length release produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.

Title: The BBC Sessions
Info: The two-disc set includes track recorded by the BBC between 1996 and 2001.

Title: Monomania
Info: Produced by Nicolas Vernhes, the sixth release for the Atlanta indie rock band led by Bradford Cox includes two new band members: bassist Josh McKay (taking over from Joshua Fauver) and guitarist Frankie Broyles.

Title: All 6's and 7's
Info: Born Aaron Dontez Yates, the Kansas City rapper releases his latest LP on Strange Music, featuring appearances from Busta Rhymes, E-40, T-Pain, and more.

Title: Armchair Apocrypha
Info: The Chicago-based singer-songwriter returns with his tenth album of literate and eclectic indie rock.

Title: The Long Goodbye
Info: The Brooklyn-based Elephant 6-style band (which shares some members with Ladybug Transistor) returns with a second LP.

Title: Lost Horizons
Info: While the first full-length for the English chill-out duo, 'LemonJelly.KY,' was a collection of previously released singles, 'Lost Horizons' represents their first true album, with eight new tracks clocking in at precisely one hour in length.

Title: Turn On The Bright Lights
Info: You won't read very many reviews of this New York band without seeing the words Joy Division pop up, and although there are some similarities, Interpol has something new to offer as well. This debut LP includes the tracks "PDA" and "NYC" from the group's well-received first single for Matador.

Title: The Private Press
Info: The Bay Area's Josh Davis (aka DJ Shadow) finally returns with a proper full-length follow-up to 1996's groudbreaking 'Endtroducing,' which achieved near-legendary status for its imaginative use of samples (a style that would later be adopted by acts such as The Avalanches).

Title: Chemtrails Over the Country Club
Info: The latest full-length studio release for the pop singer-songwriter artist was produced by Jack Antonoff and features guest appearances from Zella Day and Weyes Blood.

Title: The Way Out
Info: This is the first album in over five years for the electronic duo from New York City.

Title: Going Places
Info: This the final album for Pete Swanson and Gabriel Mindel Saloman. The experimental music duo from Portland, Oregon broke up in 2008.
The singles collection for the Brooklyn, New York, electronica duo, which was previously released on the digital music site eMusic, is released physically via Thrill Jockey.

Title: Source
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the British jazz saxophonist was produced with Kwes.

Title: Meet the Humans
Info: The third solo release for the former Beta Band frontman was recorded with producer Craig Potter.

Title: Short Movie
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British folk singer-songwriter was self-produced.

Title: Indian Ocean
Info: The second full-length solo release from the former member of Be Good Tanya features Al Green's back up band, Hi Rhythm Section.

Title: LUMP
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Laura Marling and Mike Lindsay was recorded in London.

Title: McCartney III
Info: The latest full-length release for the Beatles artist was self-recorded and produced during the COVID-19 pandemic lockdown.

Title: I Learned The Hard Way
Info: The fourth album for the funk/soul group from New York was produced by Bosco Mann.

Title: Mutant
Info: The second full-length release for the electronic producer who worked on Kanye West's Yeezus, FKA twigs' LP1, Björk's Vulnicura and Kelela's Hallucinogen EP.

Title: Late Night Tales
Info: Sam Shepherd is the latest electronic producer to add to the Late Night Tales mix series.

Title: Strike a Match
Info: The debut full-length release for the duo of Eilidh Rodgers and Rachel Aggs was produced by Tony Doogan.

Title: 'Allelujah! Don't Bend! Ascend!
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Canadian post-rock collective is its first album in a decade.

Title: Key Markets
Info: The third full-length release for the British duo was self-produced.

Title: Prequelle
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Swedish metal band was produced by Tom Dalgety.

Title: Palo Santo
Info: The second full-length release for the British electronic pop trio led by Olly Alexander features contributions from such artist as Greg Kurstin, Steve Mac, Julia Michaels, Justin Tranter, and Two Inch Punch.

Title: Room Inside the World
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian post-punk band was produced by Nicolas Vernhes.

Title: Saturn's Pattern
Info: The 12th solo release for the British rock singer was produced by Jan "Stan" Kybert.

Title: Recitation
Info: The latest album for the Japanese hardcore rock quintet brings some post-rock styles to its music.

Title: True Story of Bananagun
Info: The debut full-length release for the Australian band features elements of Afrobeat, funk, pop and psychedelia music.

Title: Land of No Junction
Info: The debut full-length release for the Irish singer-songwriter was produced with Cian Nugent.

Title: Shadows
Info: After gaining acclaim for a densely melodic sound that anticipated the coming emergence of grunge, Scotland's Teenage Fanclub return with a harmony-driven album to inspire a power pop revival.

Title: Lie Down In The Light
Info: Louisville-born Will Oldham releases his latest album produced by Mark Nevers.

Title: The Lost Tapes
Info: This compilation collects tracks recorded from 1998-2001 that, for various reasons (and not because they were of inferior quality), were not included on the rapper's albums released during that time.

Title: Warnings
Info: The third full-length release for Swedish duo Maria Lindén and Fredrik Balck was inspired from Lindén watching some of her favorite films.

Title: Systems/Layers
Info: The fifth LP for the chamber-pop trio is a collaboration with the New York-based progressive theater collective SITI Company.

Title: Sunny Border Blue
Info: Another solo release from the former Throwing Muses singer.

Britpop, New Wave, and Kraftwerk-style electronica come together in the debut full-length from Britain's Ladytron (named after a song from Roxy Music's debut album). The album repeats three of the songs from 2000's "Commodore Rock" EP (including the ever-catchy "Playgirl") and adds 12 new tracks plus the 1999 single "He Took Her To A Movie."

Title: Someone To Drive You Home
Info: This is the first LP for the Sheffield, England co-ed five-piece fronted by Kate Jackson. Steve Mackey (Pulp) produced.

Title: Secret Measure
Info: The second full-length release from Scottish duo Cloth was produced by Ali Chant.

Title: Highly Deadly Black Tarantula
Info: This is the fourth full-length release for the British experimental/post-rock group.

Title: Devour
Info: The second full-length solo release for the former Loved Ones frontman includes contributions from David Hidalgo Jr. of Social Distortion, Bo Koster of My Morning Jacket, Scott Hutchison of Frightened Rabbit, Matt Skiba of Alkaline Trio/The Watson Twins, and Bob Thomson of Big Drill Car.

Title: Letters Home
Info: The third full-length release for the Massachusetts hardcore quintet tells the story of the father of the characters introduced in the band's previous albums.

Title: Devils & Dust
Info: Brendan O'Brien produced (and plays bass on) the singer's 19th album, which finds Springsteen backed by a variety of guests. Several of the 12 tracks here have previously surfaced in live performances, including two dating back to 1995.

Title: Three
Info: The 21st release for the Australian instrumental trio of Chris Abrahams, Tony Buck, and Lloyd Swanton features three 20+-minute long tracks.

Title: Torres
Info: The debut album for Nashville's Mackenzie Scott was recorded live to tape over five days.

Title: A Friend Of A Friend
Info: The singer-songwriter's latest album was recorded with the help of Gillian Welch, Old Crow Medicine Show, Benmont Tench, and Nate Walcott.

Title: Magnificent City
Info: 'City' finds veteran underground rapper Aceyalone backed by beats from RJD2.

Title: Atomos
Artist: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
Info: The second full-length release for the ambient duo of Adam Wiltzie and Dustin O'Halloran was a score for a dance piece by Wayne McGregor.

Title: Kannon
Info: The seventh studio release for the Seattle doom metal is a 30 minutes three-track album.

Title: Chemistry Lessons Volume 1
Info: The first new full-length solo release for the Carter Tutti/Throbbing Gristle artist in 17 years was influenced in part by the death of Throbbing Gristle's Peter Christopherson, British folk music and the BBC Radiophonic Workshop.

Title: Ego Death
Info: The third release for the Los Angeles jazz/R&B/soul project begun by Syd tha Kyd and Matt Martians features guest appearances from James Fauntleroy, Kaytranada, Steve Lacey, Vic Mensa, Janelle Monae, and Tyler, the Creator.

Title: The Boxing Mirror
Info: Escovedo's first solo disc since 2000 was produced by John Cale.

Title: Androgynous Mary
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based rock band was produced by Norm Block.

Title: Lost & Found
Info: The debut full-length release for the British R&B singer-songwriter features contributions from Dizzee Rascal, Amanda Ghost, and Tom Misch.

Title: The Sounds of Crenshaw, Vol. 1
Info: Producer Terrace Martin brought together a group of musicians that included Chachi, Robert Glasper, Rose Gold, Trevor Lawrence Jr., Brandon Owens, Wyann Vaughn, and Marlon Williams for this album of music inspired by the west coast jazz, R&B and hip-hop.

Title: The Phosphorescent Blues
Info: The fourth full-length release for the progressive bluegrass band was produced by T Bone Burnett.

Title: Divide and Exit
Info: The follow-up to 2013 release "Austerity Dogs" from the British punk duo of Jason Williamson and Andrew Fearn.

Title: The Money Store
Info: The debut release on Epic for Death Grips is the first of two albums released this year by the Sacramento alternative rap trio.

Title: Paradise
Info: The second album for the indie pop band was produced by Clor's Luke Smith.

Title: Waiting For You
Info: The project consisting of The Bug, Roger Robinson and Hitomi releases its first album together.

Title: Los Angeles
Info: The first full-length album on the Warp label for Steven Ellison.

Title: Fantasy Black Channel
Info: The debut album for the British quartet was produced by Erol Alkan.

Title: Set Yourself On Fire
Info: Boasting a somewhat higher profile after a tour supporting Broken Social Scene, fellow Canadians Stars return with a third LP, produced by Tony Hoffer.

Title: Allas Sak
Info: The seventh release for the Swedish band led by Gustav Ejstes is its first in five years.

Title: That's How Rumors Get Started
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Nashville-based country singer-songwriter was produced by Sturgill Simpson.

Title: Damaged
Info: This is the tenth album for the very large Nashville band led by Kurt Wagner.

Title: Old Flowers
Info: The latest full-length release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter  was written after the end of a long-term relationship and was produced by Andrew Sarlo.

Title: The Obliterati
Info: While the trio of Roger Miller, Clint Conley and Peter Prescott typically wait a few decades between albums, this third LP follows just two years after their second.

Title: The Lion's Roar
Info: Mike Mogis produces the second album for the Swedish sisters.

Title: AmERICa
Info: The first solo release in over ten years for the British rock artist was recorded in upstate New York with contributions from his wife Amy Rigby, Brian Dewan, Jane Scarpantoni, and Alexander Turnquist.

Title: Post-War
Info: The singer-songwriter's fifth release finds him backed for the first time by a full band, which includes Rachel Blumberg (The Decemberists) and Jordan Hudson (The Thermals). Neko Case and My Morning Jacket's Jim James guest.

Title: Carry on the Grudge
Info: The third full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Cenzo Townshend.

Title: Live in Marciac
Info: The two-CD and DVD set features the recording of Brad Mehldau at the 2006 Marciac Jazz Festival.

Title: Med Sud I Eyrum Vid Spilum Endalaust
Info: The fifth album for the group was was co-produced by Flood and its first recorded in less than a year.

Title: Crush
Info: The first full-length in four years for Sam Shepherd as Floating Points features strings and woodwinds in additional to classic electronica synths.

Title: Manipulator
Info: The 17-track release from the California garage rocker was produced by Chris Woodhouse.

Title: Ruff Draft [Reissue]
Info: The second posthumous release from the acclaimed hip-hop producer, this double-disc set is actually a greatly-expanded resissue of his hard-to-find 2003 EP of the same name.

Title: You Are There
Info: Steve Albini returns as engineer for this fifth album from the Japanese post-rock outfit.

Title: Ultraviolet
Info: The first release on the Warp label for the Brooklyn-based composer, producer and multi-instrumentalist features influences from black metal, classical, dream pop, and jazz music.

Title: Hippopotamus
Info: The 23rd full-length studio release for the Los Angeles rock duo of Ron and Russell Mael is the first new material in eight years (not including 2015 collaborative album FFS).

Title: private LIFE
Info: This is the fourth full-length release for the British trio of Alice Merida Richards, Sam Pillay and Christopher Duffin.

Title: Why Make Sense?
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the British electronic band was produced with Mark Ralph. On every CD and LP release, the artwork will feature a color variation of a design due to a bespoke printing technique.

Title: Back To Black
Info: Mark Ronson and Salaam Remi produced the British soul singer's second album, which was released to great acclaim in the UK in 2006.

Title: Zeit
Info: When Rammstein's tour was postponed by the COVID-19 pandemic, they started writing and recording this eighth studio release during the lockdowns.

Title: Your Queen Is A Reptile
Info: The third full-length release for the jazz quartet led by the tenor saxophonist Shabaka Hutchings features contributions from Josh Idehen and Congo Natty.

Title: Untouchable
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the rock band led by Emmett Kelly features contributions from Ty Segall.

Title: Max Richter: Three Worlds – Music from Woolf Works
Info: Wayne McGregor commissioned the German-born British composer to create a score for his ballet production based on the three novels by Virginia Woolf (Mrs. Dalloway, Orlando, and The Waves).

Title: Heart like a Levee
Info: The sixth full-length release for M.C. Taylor was self-produced with Bradley Cook.

Title: Melody A.M.
Info: This is the debut album for the downbeat electronica duo from Norway, which has drawn comparisons to bands such as Air, Groove Armada, and Boards of Canada. Erlend Oye (Kings of Convenience) provides vocals on several tracks.

Title: Be More Kind
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Joshua Block, Austin Jenkins and Charlie Hugall.

Title: Mangy Love
Info: The eighth full-length release for the California singer-songwriter features contributions from Angel Olsen and Blake Mills, with production by Rob Schnapf and Dan Horne.

Title: Goldenheart
Info: The debut full-length release from the former Danity Kane/Diddy Dirty Money singer was produced by Andrew "Druski" Scott, The Fisticuffs, and Deonte. It is the first of a planned trilogy of albums about love, loss, and redemption.

Title: Black Forest
Info: This is the sophomore album for the indie-rock band from Madison, Wisconsin.

Title: Strange to Explain
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the folk rock band was recorded in Stinson Beach, California.

Title: Deceiver
Info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn-based indie rock band was inspired by lead singer Zachary Cole Smith's recovery from drug addiction.

Title: Time & Space
Info: The second full-length release for the Baltimore hardcore band was produced by Will Yip.

Title: Mind Control
Info: The third full-length release for the British metal band was inspired by 1970s exploitation films.

Title: If...
Info: The debut solo album from the former lead guitarist of The Coral was written as a musical adaptation of Italo Calvino's 1979 novel, If on a Winter's Night a Traveler and features The London Philharmonic.

Title: Logos
Info: This is the second album for Bradford Cox's solo project.

Title: Jay Stay Paid
Info: The 28-track collection of unreleased tracks from the rapper/producer, who passed away three years ago, was produced by his mother and arranged by Pete Rock.

Title: Now Soon Someday [EP]
Info: The former Anti-Pop Consortium member's second solo release is a nine-song EP, with six new tracks and three remixes by Kings, Prefuse 73 and El-P.

Title: Sing The Sorrow
Info: This is the major-label debut for the Bay Area punk rockers (whose initials stand for "A Fire Inside"), who got their start in Ukiah, Calif. in 1991. Garbage's Butch Vig produces.

Title: These Are The Vistas
Info: This is not your ordinary jazz trio. For their major-label debut, The Bad Plus work with alt-rock producer Tchad Blake, and include covers of  Nirvana's "Smells Like Teen Spirit," Blondie's "Heart of Glass," and Aphex Twin's "Flim" among their seven original tracks.

Title: Misadventures of Doomscroller
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for Los Angeles folk rock band Dawes was produced by Jonathon Wilson.

Title: The Family Afloat
Info: The Chicago-based indie rock band releases its second full-length album.

Title: Screen Violence
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Scottish synth-pop trio features a guest appearance from Robert Smith.

Title: She Walks in Beauty
Info: The latest collaboration between Marianne Faithfull and Warren Ellis features   poems by the Romantics (Byron, Hood, Keats, Shelley, Tennyson, and Wordsworth) set to music with contributions from Nick Cave, Brian Eno and Vincent Segal.

Title: Amyl and the Sniffers
Info: The debut full-length release for the Australian garage punk band was produced by Ross Orton.

Title: Reality Testing
Info: The fifth release for the British electronic artist Matt Cutler as Lone features hip-hop influences.

Title: Lullaby and... The Ceaseless Roar
Artist: Robert Plant & the Sensational Space Shifters
Info: The tenth solo album for the British rock singer backed by his band the Sensational Space Shifters feature influences from African, dance and jazz music.

Title: Visitor
Info: The second full-length release for the Philadelphia noise-pop band Empath was produced by Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Jake Portrait.

Title: Epic Ten
Info: Fiona Apple, Courtney Barnett, Aaron Dessner, IDLES, Shamir, St. Panther, Justin Vernon and Lucinda Williams cover songs from the singer-songwriter's 2010 album.

Title: Shut Up I Am Dreaming
Info: This is the second album for the band led by Spencer Krug (who can also be found in both Wolf Parade and Frog Eyes).

Title: Rubber Factory
Info: The blues-rock duo of Dan Auerbach and Patrick Carney return with their third album, so-named because it was recorded in a deserted rubber (tire) factory.

Title: Der Lange Marsch
Info: This is the latest full-length ambient studio release for Wolfgang Voigt under the name GAS.

Title: Fin
Info: The debut full-length release for the R&B artist features production from Hit-Boy MeLo-X, and Rakhi.

Title: Be Still Please
Info: Laura Cantrell, Peter Holsapple, and Annie Hayden guest on Mac McCaughan's second Portastatic album of 2006.

Title: God's Son
Info: Jay-Z's mortal enemy returns with his third (!) release of 2002, which includes collaborations with Alicia Keys and 2Pac (yes, that 2Pac, who, as you may recall, died several years ago).

Title: Sorceress
Info: The 12th full-length studio release for the Swedish prog metal band was produced by Tom Dalgety.

Title: The Milk Of Human Kindness
Info: 'Human Kindness' is the latest disc of psychedelic electronica from Dan Snaith, who formerly recorded under the name Manitoba (before a threatened lawsuit from a similarly-named artist caused the switch to the similarly-Canadian Caribou).

Title: Sing the Delta
Info: The first release of original songs from the singer-songwriter in 16 years focuses on life on the Arkansas delta.

Title: Fits
Info: This is the second album for the Austin, Texas indie rock band.

Title: Metals
Info: This is the fourth full-length studio album for the Canadian singer.

Title: W
Info: The latest full-length release from the Japanese post-rock band Boris is its first on the Sacred Bones label.

Title: The Horses and the Hounds
Info: The first new full-length studio release for singer-songwriter in seven years was recorded in Santa Monica with producer Ross Hogarth.

Title: Butterfly 3000
Info: The second release in 2021 for the Australian rock band was recorded remotely at home during the COVID-19 pandemic lockdown.

Title: Fat Pop, Vol.1
Info: The 16th full-length solo release for the British rock artist features contributions from Andy Fairweather Low, Lia Metcalfe, Hannah Peel and his daughter Leah.

Title: Banana Skin Shoes
Info: The first new release in over eight years for British singer-songwriter Damon Gough features production from Gethin Pearson, Youth, Keir Stewart, and Seadna McPhail.

Title: Revel in the Drama
Info: The first full-length release in seven years for the British singer-songwriter was written and produced with Romeo Stodart of the Magic Numbers.

Title: Ribbons
Info: The latest release from the British producer Stephen Wilkinson features a variety of stringed instruments including the mandolin and fiddle.

Title: I'm a Harmony
Info: The California folk singer-songwriter worked with such artists as Devendra Banhart, Nels Cline, Julia Holter, Wilco's Glenn Kotche, and Mark Pritchard on her third full-length release that was produced with Pat Sansone and Fernando Perdomo.

Title: Impressions
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band was self-recorded.

Title: The Unborn Capitalist From Limbo
Info: This is the debut full-length solo release for the Wand frontman.

Title: Don't Let the Kids Win
Info: The debut full-length release for the Australian singer-songwriter was recorded in New Zealand with producer Ben Edwards.

Title: Unseen
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the husband-and-wife duo of Brett and Rennie Sparks features contributions from David Gutierrez, Alex McMahon, and Jason Toth.

Title: GLA
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Scottish alternative rock band was inspired by its hometown of Glasgow.

Title: Eve
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the indie rock guitarist was recorded and mixed by Andy Hong.

Title: No Man's Sky: Music for an Infinite Universe [Original Video Game Soundtrack]
Info: The soundtrack from the British post-rock band features six tracks of soundscapes along with 10 originals for the first-person survival video game released on Playstation 4 and Windows PC in August.

Title: West Kirby Country Primary
Info: The third full-length solo release for the ex-The Coral guitarist was written and recorded in the house he grew up in.

Title: Strangers
Info: The second solo release for the former drummer of the Felice Brothers was co-produced with David Baron.

Title: Crimson/Red
Info: This is the first new release of recently recorded songs in over 10 years for the British singer-songwriter Paddy McAloon.

Title: Ask the Dust
Info: The second full-length electronic release from Marcos Ortega as Lorn and his first on the Ninja Tune label.

Title: Origin: Orphan
Info: The Canadian indie band's fifth album is its first on the Arts & Crafts label.

Title: Dragonslayer
Info: The third album for the Spencer Krug-led project is its first with newest member Mark Nicol.

Title: Animals In The Dark
Info: The Iowan-born singer-songwriter releases his first album on the Anti label.

Title: Gold And Green
Info: Originally released in Japan in 2000, 'Gold And Green' finally reaches U.S. shores at a non-import price on Thrill Jockey. Yuko Honda and Sean Lennon guest.

Title: It's a Wonderful Life
Info: This is the third album for Mark Linkous and Sparklehorse.

Title: Can Our Love...
Info: The bands fifth studio album (and first for Beggars Banquet), 'Can Our Love...' features eight new tracks produced by the band with Ian Caple. It expands on the more-soul-based sound that appeared on 1999's 'Simple Pleasure.'

Title: Double Figure
Info: The release notes say that this is the third installment in the trilogy that began with "Not For Threes" and "Rest Proof Clockwork" and that it deals with the "duality of the ear." Hey, as long as it sounds good.

Title: WIXIW
Info: The Liars go more electronic on their sixth album that includes production with Mute Records founder Daniel Miller.

Title: Raw Honey
Info: Michael Collins is joined by a full band--plus guests like Natalie Mering of Weyes Blood--on his second album as Drugdealer.

Title: Yawn
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was self-produced and features guest vocals from The Orielles and Our Girl.

Title: Downey to Lubbock
Info: The debut full-length collaboration between Dave Alvin and Jimmie Dale Gilmore features 10 covers and two originals, including the title track co-written by the duo.

Title: Mutt
Info: The third album for Nashville-based singer-songwriter is his first on Bloodshot Records.

Title: The Raging Wrath Of The Easter Bunny Demo
Info: The Northern California experimental rock band reunite Mike Patton, Trey Spruance, and Trevor Dunn, with Anthrax's Scott Ian, and ex-slayer Dave Lombardo to re-record its trash metal-influenced demo.

Title: Cavalcade
Info: The second full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced with John "Spud" Murphy (and one track by Marta Salogni).

Title: 1000 gecs & the Tree of Clues
Info: The remix album from the experimental pop duo of Dylan Brady and Laura Les features guest appearances from Tommy Cash, Charli XCX, Count Baldor, Hannah Diamond, Nicole Dollanganger, Dorian Electra, Fall Out Boy, GFOTY, Kero Kero Bonito, Lil West, Craig Owens, Rico Nasty, and Tony Velour.

Title: Torture
Info: The eleventh album for the upstate New York death metal band was produced by Erik Rutan.

Title: Engineers
Info: This debut album showcases the British band's symphonic, shoegaze-y sound.

Title: Alasdair Roberts
Info: This is the eighth solo full-length studio release for the Scottish singer-songwriter.

Title: About the Light
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the former Beta Band frontman was recorded with producer Stephen Street's live band.

Title: Tanglewood Numbers
Info: Will Oldham and members of the Jesus Lizard and Lambchop guest on David Berman's country-tinged fifth Silver Jews disc, which also sees the return of on-again, off-again band member Stephen Malkmus.

Title: Anniemal
Info: This debut full-length by the Norwegian singer is preceded by quite a bit of critical buzz on both sides of the Atlantic.

Title: -io
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Haley Fohr project is the first on the Matador label.

Title: New History Warfare, Vol. 3: To See More Light
Info: The final volume to the saxophonist's New History Warfare series was produced by Ben Frost and features guest vocals Bon Iver's Justin Vernon on four tracks.

Title: Borders
Info: The fifth release for the experimental electronic British duo of James Ginzburg and Paul Purgas was recorded live.

Title: Put Your Back N 2 It
Info: The second album from Mike Hadreas under the Perfume Genius name was recorded in England and Washington.

Title: Patience (After Sebald)
Info: Leyland Kirby used Austrian composer Franz Schubert's music to create the soundtrack to Grant Lee's film of the same name.

Title: July Flame
Info: The Portland, Oregon-based singer-songwriter included more strings on her seventh album produced by Tucker Martine.

Title: Wilderness
Info: This is the debut full-length for the Baltimore four-piece whose frontman (James Johnson) bears a strong vocal resemblance to John Lydon.

Title: Bonfires On The Heath
Info: The British indie rock band releases its fifth full-length studio album.

Title: St. Elsewhere
Info: This is the highly-anticipated debut release for the pairing of Danger Mouse and Cee-Lo.

Title: Ocean to Ocean
Info: The first full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter in four years was written during the pandemic lockdown in Cornwall, England.

Title: No Home of the Mind
Info: The third full-length release for the David Moore project finds it streamlined to a five person ensemble.

Title: Drums And Guns
Info: The slowcore trio (including new bassist Matt Livingston) reunites with producer Dave Fridmann.

Title: Gore
Info: The eight full-length studio release for the Sacramento alternative metal band features a guest appearance from Alice in Chain's Jerry Cantrell.

Title: The Gods We Can Touch
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Norwegian pop artist AURORA features a guest appearance from Pomme.

Title: War & Leisure
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the R&B singer-songwriter features guest appearances from J. Cole, Salaam Remi, Rick Ross, Travis Scott, and Kali Uchis.

Title: Less Than Human
Info: The latest DFA artist to create a buzz in the music press is former Six Finger Satellite guitarist John Maclean, whose "Less Than Human" is his full-length debut as The Juan Maclean.

Title: Yuck
Info: The London-based band’s debut is full of fuzzy noise rock and guitar-heavy anthems, seemingly influenced by the ‘90s grunge era.

Title: Savage Mode II
Info: The second full-length release for the collaboration between 21 Savage and Metro Boomin features guest appearances from Drake, Morgan Freeman, Young Nudy, and Young Thug.

Title: Kill the Lights
Info: This is the third full-length solo release for the San Francisco Bay Area artist.

Title: Embryonic
Info: The latest album for the rock band features guest appearances by MGMT, the Yeah Yeah Yeah's Karen O, and German mathematician, Dr. Thorsten Wormann.
This is the debut full-length release for the former member of Canadian indie pop band, Makeout Videotape.

Title: My Name Is My Name
Info: The debut solo studio release for the rapper, who began his career as part of the rap duo Clipse, features guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Chris Brown, Future, Kendrick Lamar, Pharrell, Rick Ross, and Kelly Rowland.

Title: Council Skies
Info: The fourth full-length studio release from Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds was co-produced with Paul Stacey.

Title: Loving in Stereo
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British electronic producer duo of Josh Lloyd-Watson and Tom McFarland features guest appearances from Bas and Priya Ragu.

Title: Gold-Diggers Sound
Info: The third full-length release for the R&B artist was recorded in Los Angeles and features guest appearances from Robert Glasper, Ink and Terrace Martin.

Title: Agora
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Austrian experimental electronic artist was recorded in his bedroom when he lost his studio space.

Title: This Is How You Smile
Info: This is the sixth full-length release for New York-based Roberto Carlos Lange as Helado Negro.

Title: Diversions Vol. 4: The Songs and Poems of Molly Drake
Info: The folk group's fourth full-length album features interpretations of the songs Molly Drake recorded in the 1950s (and released in 2013) with readings of her poems by her daughter, Gabrielle Drake.

Title: The Glowing Man
Info: This is the fourth and final release for the Michael Gira-led experimental rock band's line-up that includes Christoph Hahn, Thor Harris, Christopher Pravdica, Phil Puleo, and Norman Westberg.

Title: You Can't Go Back if There's Nothing To Go Back To
Info: The final album from the Oregon alt-country band was produced by John Morgan Askew.

Title: Cyrk
Info: The Welsh singer-songwriter releases her second full-length album.

Title: A Common Turn
Info: The debut full-length release for the London-based singer-songwriter  was produced by William Doyle.

Title: Hypersonic Missiles
Info: The debut full-length release for the indie singer-songwriter was recorded with Bramwell Bronte.

Title: Ghost Culture
Info: The debut full-length release for London-based electronic producer James Greenwood was co-produced by Erol Alkan

Title: This Is My Demo
Info: 'Demo' is the self-produced debut for British rapper Derek DeSafo.

Title: Scissor Sisters
Info: Although a New York band, Scissor Sisters (as evidenced by this debut disc) are definitely not part of the typical New York scene, eschewing garage and no wave to embrace campier, glammier 70s and 80s rock and dance music sounds. Included here is the band's cover of Pink Floyd's "Comfortably Numb."

Title: Transcendental Youth
Info: The 14th studio release for the folk rock band led by John Darnielle features horns by Matthew E. White.

Title: Brickbat
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the music project that includes Lush's Miki Berenyi, Modern English's Mick Conroy, Moose's K.J. McKillop, and Elastica's Justin Welch.

Title: Sleeping Through the War
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Nashville psychedelic rock band led by Charles Michael Parks Jr. was produced by Dave Cobb.

Title: Infinite Love
Info: The solo album for Ponytail's Dustin Wong was composed almost entirely with only a guitar.

Title: A  Weird Exits
Info: The latest release for the garage rock band led by John Dwyer is its first with drummers Ryan Moutinho and Dan Rincon.

Title: English Tapas
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British post-punk duo was recorded in London at Steve Mackey's studios.

Title: Thirstier
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the indie singer-songwriter was co-produced with Rob Ellis and Peter Miles.

Title: Song Machine, Season One: Strange Timez
Info: The latest full-length studio release for the Damon Albarn and Jamie Hewlett's virtual band features music that was part of its web series and features guest appearances from 6lack, Roxani Arias, Beck, Fatoumata Diawara, Georgia, Peter Hook, Elton John, Leee John, Kano, Octavian, ScHoolboy Q, Slaves, slowthai, Robert Smith, and St. Vincent.

Title: On All Fours
Info: The second full-length release for the British post-punk band was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Congotronics 2: Buzz'N'Rumble From The Urb'N'Jungle
Info: Following on the heels of one of 2005's best-reviewed world music discs is this second installment in the Congotronics series of electronica-esque African music, this time featuring the work of Konono No. 1 plus six additional (but similar) artists from Kinshasa.

Title: Engravings
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British electronic producer Matthew Barnes.

Title: Microcastle
Info: The rock group from Georgia recorded the album in a week in Brooklyn, New york.

Title: You Are Not Alone
Info: You Are Not Alone finds Mavis Staples teaming up with Wilco's Jeff Tweedy, who produced the album and penned several of the songs, and while Tweedy may seem an odd fit, he obviously knew what he was up to, crafting material that fits Staples' gospel-fueled vocals.

Title: a ghost is born
Info: When you record one of the most acclaimed albums of the decade, what do you do for an encore? If you are Jeff Tweedy & co., you return with both old (Jim O'Rourke again producing) and new (yet another lineup change) for your fifth studio LP.

Title: Crack-Up
Info: The third full-length release for the indie folk quintet from Seattle was co-produced by the band's Robin Pecknold and Skyler Skjelset.

Title: ForeverandEverNoMore
Info: The latest full-length solo release for Brian Eno is his first to contain mostly vocals in 17 years and was self-recorded and produced.

Title: Colourgrade
Info: The second full-length studio release for the British artist was co-produced by Mica Livi and Coby Sey.

Title: Lamb of God
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the heavy metal band features guest appearances from Chuck Billy and Jamey Jasta.

Title: Superstar
Info: Self-produced and recorded, the fourth full-length release for the New York indie-pop artist is a concept album about a person taking off for Los Angeles to seek fame.

Title: Giant Swan
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British experimental electronic duo of Harry Wright and Robin Stewart.

Title: Someday Everything Will Be Fine
Info: The fifth full-length release for the garage punk band features guest appearances from Matthew Hoopengardner of the Golden Boys, Jana Misener, Seth Moody, Jack Oblivian, Patrick Stickles of Titus Andronicus, John Whittemore, and Krista Wroten-Combest of the Memphis Dawls.

Title: Goin' Platinum!
Info: The second full-length release from the Louisiana-based blues singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Auerbach.

Title: Lilies
Info: The third full-length release for the Belgian jazz singer was self-produced.

Title: A Deeper Understanding
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock band led by Adam Granduciel is its first on the Atlantic label.

Title: Love
Info: The third full-length release for the folk project for Damon McMahon features guest appearance from Elias Bender Rønnenfelt of Iceage and was produced by Dave Bryant and Efrim Menuck.

Title: A Wonder Working Stone
Info: The latest release from the Glasgow-based folk artist includes contributions from such artists as Olivia Chaney, Rafe Fitzpatrick, Ben Reynolds, and music ensemble Concerto Caledonia.

Title: Reverie
Info: Marc Ribot, Jean McClain, Lisa Hannigan, and Patrick Warren appear as guests on Henry's home-recorded acoustic album.

Title: Micah P. Hinson and the Pioneer Saboteurs
Info: This is the fourth album for the Texas-based singer-songwriter.

Title: Black Dialogue
Info: The Perceptionists feature Boston-based MCs Mr. Lif and Akrobatik backed by the beats of DJ Fakts One. El-P also shows up on one track.

Title: I Am Easy to Find
Info: The eighth full-length release for the indie rock band includes guest appaearnces from the Brooklyn Youth Choir, Gail Ann Dorsey, Lisa Hannigan, Kate Stables, Mina Tindle, and Sharon Van Etten.

Title: Rainbow
Info: The third full-length studio release for the pop artist features guest appearances from The Dap-Kings Horns, Eagles Of Death Metal, Dolly Parton.

Title: Mercy
Info: The latest full-length solo release for John Cale features guest appearances from Actress, Animal Collective, Sylvan Esso, Fat White Family, Laurel Halo, Tei Shi, and Weyes Blood.

Title: New View
Info: The third full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was produced with Clemens Knieper and recorded live to tape in upstate New York.

Title: Pastoral
Info: The latest full-length release for the British electronic artist Elizabeth Bernholz features elements of folk music, as well as the harpsichord and recorder.

Title: Rhythm
Info: The fourth full-length release from the Swedish husband-and-wife duo of Mariam Wallentin and Andreas Werliin was self-recorded and produced.

Title: Ghosts V: Together
Info: The eight-track surprise release is one of the two new albums (Ghosts VI: Locusts being the other) that continues Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross' instrumental Ghosts series.

Title: You're Better Than This
Info: The third full-length release for the Boston rock band led by Rick Maguire was produced by Ben Brodin.

Title: Going Out In Style
Info: The blue-collar Boston punk band's newest release is just in time for St. Patrick's Day--staying true to its Irish roots with its traditional punk-folk anthems.

Title: Easy Wonderful
Info: Straightforward pop songs are this Boston band's specialty, and its latest release builds around its trademark sound with melodious guitars, sweeping vocal harmonies, and hook-filled songs.

Title: Sweetener
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the pop singer features guest appearances from Nicki Minaj, Missy Elliott and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Sweet Heart Sweet Light
Info: The seventh album for the space rock band was produced by frontman Jason Pierce.

Title: My Boy
Info: The third full-length release for the New Zealand singer-songwriter Marlon Williams was co-produced by Tiny Ruins guitarist Tom Healy.

Title: The Crossing
Info: The latest release for the Texas-based singer-songwriter is a concept album about two men, one from Italy and the other from Mexico, as they seek to immigrate to the United States.

Title: Flashmob
Info: This is the second full-length studio album for the French-born electronic artist.

Title: MM..Food
Info: MF Doom drops his first solo record (under the MF Doom name) since 1999's 'Operation Doomsday.'

Title: Villains
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the rock band led by Josh Homme was produced by Mark Ronson.

Title: III
Info: The third full-length release for the rock band that includes Ty Segall, Charles Moothart and Chad Ubovich was recorded with Steve Albini.

Title: Victim of Love
Info: The soul singer worked with producer Thomas Brenneck on his second release on Daptone Records.

Title: The Evangelist
Info: Robert Forster's first album in 11 years also features songs written by his now-deceased Go-Between partner.

Title: Penance Soiree
Info: Alan Moulder mixed this sophomore disc for the hard-rocking Los Angeles band, known for their black and red "uniforms" and strong live sets.

Title: The Old Kit Bag
Info: On an indie label for the first time in almost two decades, the veteran British folk-rocker returns with a stripped-down sound, courtesy of producer John Chelew.

Title: I Phantom
Info: Indie Boston rapper Mr. Lif returns with his fourth album.

Title: Something Wicked This Way Comes
Info: This is the fourth Ninja Tune release for the innovative London-based hip-hop outfit, mixing somewhat more traditional rap cuts with acid-jazz and trip-hop instrumental pieces.

Title: Insignificance
Info: The Chicago-based avant-garde musician (best known for his work in Gastr Del Sol) offers up seven new tracks in his follow-up to 1999's 'Eureka.' Wilco's Jeff Tweedy adds guitar.

Title: The Coral
Info: This debut effort from Liverpool's The Coral is an inventive mix of numerous musical styles.

Title: Nightmare Ending
Info: The seventh studio release for Matthew Cooper is a double LP with a guest appearance by Ira Kaplan of Yo La Tengo.

Title: We're Not Talking
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian indie pop trio was produced with Architecture In Helsinki's James Cecil and Cameron Bird.

Title: Melt Yourself Down
Info: The debut release for the avant-garde jazz group that includes Kushal Gaya, Ruth Goller, Shabaka Hutchings, Satin Singh, Tom Skinner, and Pete Wareham was produced by Leafcutter John.

Title: Hair
Info: Ty Segall and Strange Boys' Tim Presley (under the name White Fence) collaborated on the eight-track release recorded in San Francisco.

Title: ILYSM
Info: The fourth full-length release for New York indie rock band Wild Pink features contributions from such artists as Julien Baker, Mike Brenner, Samantha Crain, J Mascis, Peter Silberman, Julia Steiner, Ryley Walker, and Yasmin Williams.

Title: Native Sons
Info: The 17th full-length studio release for the Los Angeles rock band includes covers of songs about Los Angeles or were written by fellow natives of the City of Angels.

Title: Modus Vivendi
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper from New Jersey features The Ebonys on one track.

Title: She Remembers Everything
Info: The 15th full-length release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from such artists as T Bone Burnett, Elvis Costello, Kris Kristofferson, John Leventhal, Lera Lynn, Tucker Martine, and Sam Phillips.

Title: New Path
Info: The fifth full-length release for the French Canadian husband-and-wife duo was inspired by n Philip K. Dick's A Scanner Darkly.

Title: Brilliant Sanity
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie pop band was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Quarantine
Info: The debut full-length album for the Brooklyn artist showcases her vocals more than her previous ambient electronic EPs.

Title: Ay Ay Ay
Info: The Chilean-born artist now based in Paris and Buenos Aires releases his second solo album.

Title: Offend Maggie
Info: The latest release from the trio of rockers from San Francisco.

Title: Sound & Color
Info: The second full-length release for the southern rock band was produced by Blake Mills.

Title: Manafon
Info: The latest solo album for the ex-Japan band member features work with musicians from the United Kingdom, Austria, and Japan.

Title: Gemini Rights
Info: The second full-length solo studio release for producer/The Internet guitarist Steve Lacy features guest appearances from Fousheé and Matt Martians.

Title: Dornik
Info: The debut full-length release for the British pop/R&B singer was produced by Pop Wansel.

Title: Surrender
Info: The second full-length major label release for singer-songwriter Maggie Rogers was co-produced with Kid Harpoon.

Title: Everybody's Heart Is Broken Now
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Swedish pop duo of Malin Dahlström and Gustaf Karlöf.

Title: The Ascension
Info: The eighth full-length solo studio release is the indie artist's first in five years.

Title: The Shining
Info: This posthumous release--the late James Yancey's third solo album--was near completion at the time of his February 2006 death. Unlike 'Donuts,' this disc (featuring appearances by Madlib, Busta Rhymes and Common) is largely based on live instrumentation rather than samples.

Title: All Is Dream
Info: This is the Buffalo, NY band's follow-up to their acclaimed 1998 release 'Deserter's Songs.'

Title: Caprisongs [Mixtape]
Info: The first mixtape from FKA twigs features guest appearances from Dystopia, Rema, Pa Salieu, Shygirl, Jorja Smith, Unknown T, and The Weeknd.

Title: Crawl Space
Info: This is the full-length debut release for the New York City-based indie pop singer-songwriter Valerie Teicher.

Title: Hi Honey
Info: The third full-length release for the Philadelphia rock band was produced by Thomas Brenneck with contributions from Dean Ween and tUnE-yArDs' Merrill Garbus.

Title: Mount The Air
Info: This is the first studio release for the Mercury-nominated British folk band in over four years.

Title: The  Future's Void
Info: The second full-length release for Erika M. Anderson was produced with Leif Shackleford.

Title: Spring and Fall
Info: The journey from the beginning to the end of a relationship is the concept behind the 19th studio release for the Australian singer-songwriter.

Title: I Thought of You
Info: The first new full-length solo release for Canadian singer-songwriter Julie Doiron in nine years was recorded in Montreal.

Title: Forth Wanderers
Info: The second full-length release for the indie rock band that includes members based in Ohio and New York was recorded in five days by Cameron Konner.

Title: Paradise [EP]
Info: The six-track EP was recorded during the same sessions as 2016's Hopelessness with production from Oneohtrix Point Never and Hudson Mohawke.

Title: A Dotted Line
Info: The Grammy-winning bluegrass trio of Chris Thile, Sara Watkins, and Sean Watkins return from its 2007 "indefinite hiatus" to release its Eric Valentine-produced sixth studio album.

Title: Icky Thump
Info: Jack and Meg White spent a whopping three weeks (an eternity by White Stripes standards) in Nashville recording their sixth studio album.

Title: No One Wants To Be Here and No One Wants To Leave
Info: The fourth studio release for the Scottish trio was mixed by Peter Katis.

Title: The Crying Light
Info: The third album for the Antony Hegarty-led band features music arrangements by Nico Muhly.

Title: Sahel Folk
Info: Sidi Toure's second solo album was recorded live in Mali with several of his friends over a few days.

Title: Freedom Highway
Info: The second solo release for the Grammy-winning folk singer includes nine original songs.

Title: Traditional Techniques
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the Pavement co-founder features a 12-string acoustic guitar.

Title: The  Argument
Info: The latest solo album from the Hüsker Dü founding member was inspired by John Milton's Paradise Lost.

Title: Bloodsports
Info: The first release from the Britpop band in 11 years was produced by Ed Buller.

Title: Guy
Info: The tribute album to Guy Clark features contributions from such artists as Terry Allen, Shawn Camp, Rodney Crowell, Emmylou Harris, Jim McGuire, Gary Nicholson, Mickey Raphael, Verlon Thompson and Jerry Jeff Walker.

Title: Ventriloquism
Info: The covers album from the singer-songwriter features such 1980-90s songs as George Clinton's "Atomic Dog 2017," Janet Jackson's "Funny How Time Flies (When You're Having Fun)," Prince's "Sometimes It Snows in April," Sade's "Smooth Operator," Tina Turner's "Private Dancer," and "TLC's "Waterfalls."

Title: I Need To Start a Garden
Info: The debut full-length release for the Portland, Oregon singer-songwriter was produced by Zak Kimball.

Title: The  No-Hit Wonder
Info: The fourth full-length release for the alt-country-rock singer-songwriter features features guest appearances from Tim Easton, Craig Finn, Jason Isbell, Austin Lucas, Caitlin Rose, and Steve Selvidge.

Title: Murdering Oscar (And Other Love Songs)
Info: The second solo album for the Drive-By Truckers lead singer features his father (bassist with the Muscle Shoals) and his DBT bandmates.

Title: Heart
Info: This is the second LP for the Montreal-based indie-pop quartet featuring actor Torquil Campbell, Evan Cranley (also a member of Broken Social Scene), Amy Millan and Chris Seligman.

Title: Let Go
Info: One-hit wonders, you say? Well, the New York trio did score an MTV hit with "Popular," from their 1996 debut album, but it is a more mature and less commercial Nada Surf that returns now with a third LP, their first for indie label Barsuk.

Title: Blue Boy
Info: Canadian singer-songwriter Ron Sexsmith returns with his fifth album, produced by Steve Earle and Ray Kennedy.

Title: Kid A
Info: Seemingly unwilling to stick to a successful formula, Radiohead follow their breakthrough album 'OK Computer' with this much more experimental work (recorded during sessions that also spawned the later-released 'Amnesiac' album), which ventures even further away from conventional song structure and embraces electronica more fully (even sounding at times like Aphex Twin).

Title: Music
Info: The follow-up to Madonna's hit 'Ray of Light' was produced by 'Light's producer William Orbit and French electronica artist Mirwais.

Title: The Louder I Call, The Faster It Runs
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Baltimore duo of Jenn Wasner and Andy Stack was mixed by John Congleton.

Title: Pulse/Quartet
Info: The latest release for the composer features two pieces: Pulse includes winds, strings, piano and electric bass with the International Contemporary Ensemble and Quartet includes two vibraphones and two pianos with the Colin Currie Group.

Title: I Liked It Better When You Had No Heart
Artist: Butch Walker And The Black Widows
Info: The producer-singer-songwriter returns with his first album to be credited with his new backing band, The Black Widows.

Title: Akron/Family
Info: The latest neo-folk outfit under the tutelage of Michael Gira are the Brooklyn quartet Akron/Family, who make their debut with this self-titled release.

Title: Have We Met
Info: The 12th full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band led by Dan Bejar was produced and mixed by John Collins.

Title: Ratchet
Info: The debut full-length release for the Las Vegas dance-pop artist was produced by Nick Sylvester.

Title: Aw C'Mon
Info: Recorded at the same time and released on the same day, 'Aw C'Mon' and 'No, You C'Mon' are actually intended as separate albums, rather than two parts of a double album. The Nashville String Machine lends strings to each.

Title: Real Life Is No Cool
Info: Norway's Lindstrom and singer Christabelle join up to release their first album of disco-influenced music together.

Title: Wink
Info: The third full-length release for the Japanese rock band features guest appearances from Mndsgn, Ric Wilson, and YMCK.

Title: Fortitude
Info: The seventh full-length release for the French metal band was produced by Joe Duplantier and mixed by Andy Wallace.

Title: Giver Taker
Info: The debut full-length release for the Boston-based singer-songwriter was produced by Justine Bowe of Photocomfort and Gabe Goodman.

Title: Mirror Traffic
Info: The Pavement frontman releases his latest rock album with The Jicks, produced by Beck.

Title: Return To The Sea
Info: The debut disc for the new band from former Unicorns members Nick Diamonds and J'aime Tambeur includes appearances from members of Royal City, Wolf Parade and Arcade Fire.

Title: Cedars
Info: This sophomore LP (and U.S. debut) for the English band was produced by the Cocteau Twins' Simon Raymonde.

Title: Noonday Dream
Info: The third full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in England and France with Mickey Smith.

Title: Humming By The Flowered Vine
Info: Members of Calexico guest on the singer-songwriter's Matador debut.

Title: Band of Joy
Info: The title of Plant's new album revives the name of his pre-Zeppelin psychedelic band from the '60s and combines folksy rock with his own solo work.

Title: The New OK
Info: The surprise digital release from the alternative country band includes songs from recording sessions from the recently released, The Unraveling plus a few songs written while under the pandemic quarantine.

Title: Three Chords and the Truth
Info: The 41st full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from Jay Berliner and The Righteous Brothers' Bill Medley.

Title: I Shall Die Here
Info: The experimental doom band worked with Bobby Krlic (also known as the Haxan Cloak) on its fourth full-length release.

Title: Destroy Rock & Roll
Info: This debut LP for Scotland cut-and-paste artist Myles MacInnes was released in the UK in 2004 and finally hit American shores in early 2006.

Title: One True Vine
Info: Wilco's Jeff Tweedy returns to produce the singer's latest release that includes songs written by Alan Sparhawk of Low, Nick Lowe, and Tweedy.

Title: American Head
Info: The 16th full-length studio release for the experimental rock band features a guest appearance from Kacey Musgraves

Title: Gorilla Manor
Info: The Los Angeles band's debut album is the latest to incorporate afropop to its sound.

Title: Goes West
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the Nashville guitarist was produced by Bradley Cook and Tucker Martine.

Title: Stellular
Info: The ex-Pipettes singer worked with Oli Bayston (aka Boxed In) on her second full-length solo release.

Title: Retribution
Info: The fourth release for the Polaris Prize-winning Inuit throat-singer features a guest appearance from Shad.

Title: Suckfish
Info: Audion is the dirty-minded techno alter-ego of Matthew Dear.

Title: Tragedy and Geometry
Info: The debut solo album from Steve Hauschildt, member of the Cleveland-based electronica trio Emeralds, was named for the Greek muses of tragedy (Melpomene) and geometry (Polyhymnia).

Title: KoKoro
Info: The fifth full-length release for Sarah Assbring features influences from music and instruments from around the world including Africa,  the guzheng (a Chinese string instrument) and the Japanese shakuhachi flute.

Title: Koch
Info: This is the third full-length release for the British electronic producer.

Title: Kenny Dennis LP
Info: Produced by Odd Nosdam, the Chicago rapper's latest full-length release is a follow-up to his Kenny Dennis EP as his mustached alter ego.

Title: April
Info: This is the third album for the group led by Mark Kozelek, who also wrote and produced the album.

Title: Aşk
Info: The fifth full-length release from Amsterdam-based sextet Altin Gün features psychedelic pop versions of traditional Turkish folk songs

Title: In Between
Info: The sixth full-length release for the New Jersey indie rock band is its first album in six years.

Title: Fetch
Info: This is the first studio release for the Japanese noise rock duo of Yako and Agata since 2007's Bambi's Dilemma.

Title: Honest
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from Andre 3000, Casino, Drake, Pharrell, Pusha T, Kanye West, and Wiz Khalifa.

Title: The Tigers Have Spoken
Info: The New Pornographers singer (and accomplished solo artist) offers up a live set of originals and eclectic covers, backed by The Sadies.

Title: Kill For Love
Info: The fourth full-length album for the band led by Johnny Jewel features 17 tracks.

Title: Pleasure
Info: The fifth full-length solo studio release for the Canadian indie pop artist features a guest appearance from Jarvis Cocker and was produced with Mocky and Renaud LeTang.

Title: Wyatt at the Coyote Palace
Info: The 10th solo release for the Throwing Muses lead singer was released as a book of essays and stories.

Title: Music for the Age of Miracles
Info: This is the first new release of music in seven years for the British indie rock/pop band.

Title: Invisible Cities
Artist: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
Info: The latest full-length release from the duo of Dustin O'Halloran and Stars of the Lid's Adam Wiltzie was originally created for a Leo Warner-directed multimedia stage production based on Italo Calvino's 1972 novel Invisible Cities.

Title: The Ooz
Info: This is the second full-length release for British singer-songwriter Archy Marshall under the name King Krule.

Title: Heron Oblivion
Info: The debut full-length release for the psychedelic folk rock band formed by Meg Baird, Ethan Miller, Noel Von Harmonson, and Charlie Saufley was recorded by Eric Bauer in San Francisco.

Title: Since We Last Spoke
Info: The underground hip-hop producer (also a member of Soul Position) returns with a follow-up to his acclaimed 2002 Def Jux Debut, 'Dead Ringer.'

Title: Tasty
Info: Kelis' third LP (second in the States) features production from the Neptunes, Dallas Austin and Andre 3000.

Title: New York Noise
Info: This 16-track compilation offers an impressive sampling of the New York underground scene from the late 1970s and early 80s, including cuts from "no-wave," post-punk, experimental and hip-hop artists such as ESG, Material, DNA, Defunkt, and Liquid Liquid.

Title: A Little Deeper
Info: A former member of UK hip-hop outfit So Solid Crew, Ms. Dynamite (aka Niomi McLean-Daley) earned Britain's Mercury Music Prize for this debut effort.

Title: Under Cold Blue Stars
Info: Singer/songwriter Josh Rouse's third solo LP was produced by Roger Moutenot.

Title: The Mars Volta
Info: The first new full-length studio release in 10 years for progressive rock duo The Mars Volta features Caribbean rhythms.

Title: Wu Hen
Info: The second full-length release for the London-based artist features guest appearances from Miguel Atwood-Ferguson and Lauren Faith.

Title: Build a Problem
Info: The debut full-length release from British singer-songwriter was produced by Joe Rubel.

Title: Perpetual Motion People
Info: The third full-length solo release for the San Francisco-based indie rock artist was produced with Tim Sandusky.
The seventh full-length release for the Baltimore dream pop duo was recorded in part in its home studio with some help from Peter Kember (aka Sonic Boom).

Title: Always Foreign
Artist: The World Is a Beautiful Place & I Am No Longer Afraid to Die
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Connecticut emo group was produced by Chris Teti.

Title: The Sunlandic Twins
Info: Kevin Barnes' eighth Of Montreal disc finds the Georgian heading into more electronic territory, enlisting his laptop to assist in the recording process. Music on a laptop--who knew?

Title: End of Everything
Info: The seventh full-length release from Erin Birg as Mega Bog was co-produced with James Krivchenia (who also mixed and played drums on the record).

Title: Fever
Info: The seventh full-length solo release for the Detroit rapper/producer features guest appearances from Ab, Dwele, and Sudie.

Title: Precious Art
Info: This is the fourth full-length release (and its first on the SideOneDummy label) for the West Virginia pop-punk band led by Jordan Hudkins.

Title: Lily-O
Info: The fifth full-length release from the Vermont-born indie folk artist features contributions from Bill Frisell and was produced by Valgeir Sigurðsson.

Title: Songs
Info: The follow-up to the Oklahoma singer-songwriter's 2012 Grammy-nominated debut From The Ground Up was co-produced with Wes Sharon.

Title: LP
Info: The Canadian electronic band releases its sophomore album.

Title: Hey Hey My My Yo Yo
Info: The Danish duo return with their second album.

Title: Communion
Info: This is the debut full-length release for Houston-based electronic producer Eric Burton.

Title: After the Party
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Pennsylvania punk band was produced by Will Yip.

Title: Dye It Blonde
Info: Chicago's Smith Westerns take psychedelic rock to the next level with their second album of David Bowie-inspired vocals and catchy melodies.

Title: Hallelujah Anyhow
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for North Carolina-based indie folk band led by M.C. Taylor was produced with Brad Cook and features contributions from Tift Merritt, Skylar Gudasz, Mac McCaughan, Alexandra Sauser-Monnig, Tamisha Waden, and John Paul White.

Title: The Last Romance
Info: The Scottish duo of Aidan Moffett and Malcolm Middleton return with a sixth studio album.

Title: Bill Orcutt
Info: This the first solo studio release to feature the guitarist on an electric guitar.

Title: Comma
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for the The Sea and Cake band member is his first in five years.

Title: Wraith
Info: The fifth full-length release for the London-based experimental/post-rock band was produced by Erol Alkan.

Title: Another Life
Info: The debut full-length release for the Berlin-based Finnish experimental electronic duo of Ville Haimala and Martti Kalliala features guest appearances from Pan Daijing and Oracle.

Title: Face Your Fear
Info: The second full-length release for the Atlanta-based R&B/soul artist was produced with Danger Mouse and Sam Cohen.

Title: Lost Time
Info: The follow-up to Dave and Phil Alvin's Grammy-nominated Common Grounds release is another covers album that includes songs from such artists as James Brown, Thomas Dorsey, Lead Belly, and Big Joe Turner.

Title: Hoodoo
Info: The swamp rock veteran's latest release is his first on the Yep Roc label.

Title: Hello Cruel World
Info: The Grammy-nominated singer-songwriter's ninth album features Rodney Crowell as a guest singer.

Title: Superwolf
Info: 'Superwolf' is the first collaboration between singer-songwriter Will Oldham (aka Bonnie Prince Billy) and Zwan's Matt Sweeney.

Title: Le Noise
Info: The legendary socially conscious rocker joins forces with producer Daniel Lanois, creating an album full of self-proclaimed folk-metal music.

Title: The Power Of Negative Thinking: B-Sides & Rarities
Info: The four-disc collection of B-sides and rare recordings from the Scottish band.

Title: Swisher
Info: A year after the release of the self-titled compilation albuum from the Brooklyn-based electronic duo of Sam Haar and Zach Steinman comes its follow-up full-length with nine new tracks.

Title: Year Of Meteors
Info: This is the fifth album for the Seattle-based singer-songwriter.

Title: Tones Of Town
Info: This second studio LP for the Sunderland, England trio once again finds the band being compared to XTC.

Title: Let the Good Times Roll
Info: The second full-length release for the Oklahoma-born singer-songwriter was produced with Mark Neill.

Title: The Morning Star
Info: The 12th full-length release for the Virginia six-string and lap guitarist features contributions from Forrest Marquisee and Ian McColm.

Title: Lucky Shiner
Info: UK producer Gold Panda's debut is a fusion of psychedelic pop, samples and dance beats.

Title: Dirt Farmer
Info: Former The Band drummer/singer returns with a solo album.

Title: Overload
Info: The latest release for the Los Angeles R&B artist features guest appearances from Shana Jenson and Dudley Perkins.

Title: Bottomless Pit
Info: Released digitally, the instrumentals and vocals for the fifth full-length studio release for the Sacramental experimental hip-hop band was also released as a free download. A physical release of the entire album is scheduled for July.

Title: A Beginner's Mind
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Sufjan Stevens and Angelo De Augustine was inspired by such films as All About Eve, Bring It On Again, Night of the Living Dead, Mad Max, Point Break, Silence of the Lambs, and The Thing.

Title: From a Room, Vol. 2
Info: The third full-length release for the award-winning country singer-songwriter was produced with Dave Cobb.

Title: American Football (LP3)
Info: The third full-length release for the Illinois emo band features guest appearances from Rachel Goswell, Elizabeth Powell and Hayley Williams.

Title: Tassili
Info: The Tuareg group releases their fifth studio album, fusing blues and styles of the nomadic people of the Sahara.

Title: Black Sun
Info: Steve "Kode9" Goodman, the London-based electric artist, collaborates with Stephen "The Spaceape" Gordon for a second album of dubstep and techno jams.

Title: Night Falls Over Kortedala
Info: The Swedish singer's second studio album features guest singers Frida Hyvonen and El Perro del Mar.

Title: Jim Noir
Info: The Manchester, England, native wrote, produced, recorded, and mixed his sophomore album.

Title: Give My Love to London
Info: The 20th studio release for the British singer-songwriter features contributions from such artists as Anna Calvi, Nick Cave, Steve Earle, Ed Harcourt, Tom McRae, Portishead's Adrian Utley, and Pink Floyd's Roger Waters.

Title: Power
Info: The debut full-length release for the Houston-born and Berlin-based electronic producer J'Kerian Morgan was inspired partly by marching bands and Ta-Nehisi Coates' "Between The World And Me."

Title: The Book of Souls
Info: The 16th full-length release from the British heavy metal band was produced by Kevin Shirley.

Title: Believers
Info: The third solo album for the folk singer was produced by Rob Schnapf.

Title: Street Horrrsing
Info: The debut album for the Bristol, England experimental music duo.

Title: After Hours
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Canadian artist features contributions from such artists as Belly, Max Martin, Metro Boomin, Oneohtrix Point Never, and Tame Impala.

Title: Oshin
Info: Formerly known as Dive, this is the debut album for the rock-pop quartet led by Z. Cole Smith of Beach Fossils.

Title: Joy'All
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for singer-songwriter Jenny Lewis was recorded in Nashville and produced by Dave Cobb.

Title: Random Axe
Info: This is the debut release for the group that includes producer Black Milk, Guilty Simpson, and Sean Price.

Title: Follow Me Down
Info: The Texas-born singer-songwriter's second album features nine original songs and covers of Bob Dylan and Radiohead.

Title: Revolutions Per Minute
Info: Talib Kweli and Hi-Tek reunite for their second album together in ten years. It features guest appearnces by such artists as Mos Def, Bun B, Estelle, Bilal, Jay Electronica, and J Cole.

Title: At The Cut
Info: Silver Mt. Zion Orchestra return for the Athens, GA-based singer-songwriter's latest album, the first of two album released this year [the live album, "Skitter On Take Off" was released October 6th].

Title: Rainwater Cassette Exchange
Info: The latest EP for the Atlanta, Georgia indie-rock band was produced by Nicolas Vernhes.

Title: Mystery [EP]
Info: The South African indie-rock band releases its first EP produced by Secret Machines' Brandon Curtis.

Title: One Day As A Lion [EP]
Info: Rage Against the Machine's Zack De La Rocha releases his solo EP, which includes Mars Volta's Jon Theodore on drums.

Title: What I Do
Info: One of the rare country music stars who is both a critical and commercial success (and without crossing over into pop), Jackson returns with a follow-up to his huge 2002 hit 'Drive.'

Title: Fabulous Muscles
Info: This is the third full-length album for the challenging, intensely personal Bay Area post-punk outfit led by Jamie Stewart.

Title: Me First
Info: Rilo Kiley's Blake Sennett is the mastermind behind this collective, which includes contributions from members of Azure Ray and Ozma and production from Mike Mogis (Bright Eyes) and Jimmy Tamborello (DNTEL, Postal Service).

Title: Dangerous Magical Noise
Info: This is the third full-length for the Detroit garage rockers led by guitarist Mick Collins (ex of the Gories) and featuring a supersized rhythm section of two bass players and two drummers. Included in early versions are bonus covers of Brian Eno's "King's Lead Hat" and Robyn Hitchcock's "Executioner of Love."

Title: Us
Info: This is the second album for the quriky Scottish indie-pop duo of Colin MacIntyre and Alan Malloy.

Title: Sharpen Your Teeth
Info: Ugly Casanova is the alter ego of Modest Mouse singer/guitarist Isaac Brock, who makes his solo debut with this release. The 13 tracks were produced by Brian Deck (Tortoise, Sea and Cake), and the backing band includes Pall Jenkins (Black Heart Procession) and Tim Rutili (Red Red Meat), but it sounds a lot like a Modest Mouse release.

Title: God Hates Us All
Info: Produced by Matt Hyde, 'God Hates Us All' is the eighth studio album (and first in three years) for the Southern California thrash-metal band. Originally set for a July 2001 release, the album was delayed so that American Recordings head Rick Rubin and producer Sean Beavan could remix each of the tracks.

Title: The Flying Club Cup
Info: The follow-up album from the trio headed by Zach Condon.

Title: Triplicate
Info: The singer-songwriter three-disc set continues his exploration of the  Great American Songbook and was produced by Jack Frost.

Title: Landing On A Hundred
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Atlanta-born R&B/soul singer was recorded in Memphis, Tennessee and in Germany with his co-producer, Patrice Bart-Williams.

Title: Rest
Info: The first new release for the London-based actress/singer in six years features contributions from Paul McCartney, Daft Punk's Guy-Manuel de Homem-Christo, Connan Mockasin, Owen Pallett, and SebastiAn.

Title: The Lady Killer
Info: Bringing back his blend of Motown and neo-soul to pop music, Cee-Lo returns with his third solo album featuring his viral hit, "F*** You".

Title: A Chance To Cut Is A Chance To Cure
Info: The fourth LP (and the first on Matador) from the experimental San Francisco outfit is a concept album about plastic surgery, utilizing samples from actual surgical procedures in its seven electronic/techno tracks. A track from this LP was included in the Whitney Museum's Bitstreams Exhibit in Spring 2001.

Title: Big Black Coat
Info: The Canadian electronic pop duo of Jeremy Greenspan and Matt Didemus return from a five-year break (they each worked on other solo projects) to release their fifth full-length release.

Title: X: The Godless Void and Other Stories
Artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
Info: The 10th full-length release for the Austin-based alternative rock band was produced by the band's own Conrad Keely and Charles Godfrey.

Title: Tell Me How You Really Feel
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian singer-songwriter was produced with Burke Reid and Dan Luscombe.

Title: Utopian Ashes
Info: The debut full-length collaboration between Primal Scream's Bobby Gillespie and the Savages' Jehnny Beth includes contribution from Johnny Hostile and Primal Scream's Martin Duffy, Andrew Innes, and Darrin Mooney.

Title: Nothing Is Wrong
Info: The second album for the Los Angeles folk-rock band was produced by Jonathan Wilson.

Title: End Times Undone
Artist: David Kilgour and the Heavy Eights
Info: The latest solo release (his second with the Heavy Eights) from the former co-founder of New Zealand indie-pop band the Clean was recorded over three years.

Title: You're Nothing
Info: The second release from the Danish post-punk band was self-produced.

Title: Pink
Info: The Japanese band named after a Melvins song releases their latest album.

Title: Ruinism
Info: The third full-length release for the British electronic producer Stuart Howard features guest appearances from GABI, JFDR, Louisahhh, and Talvi.

Title: Hundreds of Days
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles-based harpist was created in a Northern California barn during a residency at the Headlands Center for the Arts.

Title: Mnestic Pressure
Info: This is the first release on the Hyperdub label for the London-based electronic DJ/producer.

Title: Americana
Info: Inspired in part by his 2013 memoir, the first solo studio release for the Kinks founding member in a decade was co-produced with Guy Massey and John Jackson.

Title: Rolling Golden Holy
Info: The second full-length release for folk trio Bonny Light Horseman was produced by the band's Josh Kaufman.

Title: Bedroom
Info: The debut full-length release for the British five-piece led by Ryan Smith was recorded and mixed by Alex Greaves.

Title: Praise & Blame
Info: Not commonly known for his subtlety, the singer from Wales returns with an album that keeps it simple and goes back to basics--blues and traditional gospel songs that are spiritual and speak nothing but the truth.

Title: Collector
Info: The debut full-length release for the Wisconsin indie rock band that includes Raina Bock, Isaac de Broux-Slone, Shannon Connor, Logan Severson, and Brendan Manley was produced by Rob Schnapf.

Title: Marissa Nadler
Info: The singer/songwriter's fifth release, funded by a Kickstarter campaign, is lyrically poignant and melodic with a folk edge.

Title: Transference
Info: The seventh full-length album self-produced by the band strips the music down to nothing more than  guitar, bass, precussion, and Britt Daniel's voice.
