Title: Flamagra
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the experimental electronic producer/rapper features guest appearances from Anderson Paak, George Clinton, Denzel Curry, Little Dragon, David Lynch, Shabazz Palaces, Solange, Thundercat, Tierra Whack, and Toro y Moi.

Title: "Hello, Hi"
Info: The latest full-length solo release for Ty Segall was mostly self-recorded at his home studio.

Title: Medieval Femme
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles-based Kuwaiti electronic composer was inspired by poetry written by Arab women.

Title: Changes
Info: The third full-length release for the soul singer discovered by Daptone founder Gabriel Roth features a cover of Black Sabbath's track.

Title: Drunk
Info: The fourth full-length release for Stephen Bruner as Thundercat features guest appearances from Wiz Khalifa, Kendrick Lamar, Kenny Loggins, Michael McDonald, and Pharrell.

Title: My Maudlin Career
Info: The fourth album for the Scottish band was produced by Jari Haapalainen.

Title: The Snake
Info: The Swedish duo releases their second album.

Title: Cupid's Head
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for Axel Willner as The Field was created without computers.

Title: Dragging A Dead Deer Up A Hill
Info: The third album for the Portland, Oregon-based indie pop singer Liz Harris.

Title: The Golden Age
Info: The San Francisco band, now relocated to Los Angeles and with two new members, releases its latest album.

Title: My Finest Work Yet
Info: The 12th full-length solo studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Paul Butler.

Title: Martha Wainwright
Info: Daughter of Loudon and sister of Rufus, Martha becomes the third Wainwright to release an album in 2005. This self-titled effort is her full-length debut, following on the heels of her subtly-titled EP "Bloody Mother Fucking Asshole."

Title: & The Charm
Info: The debut full-length pop release from DJ/dance producer Avalon Emerson was produced by Bullion.

Title: High Risk Behaviour
Info: The debut full-length release for the Australian punk trio of Matt Boggis, Josh Price, and Eamon Sandwith was recorded in Geelong by Billy Gardner.

Title: Rainford
Info: The latest full-length release from the Jamaican dub artist was produced by Adrian Sherwood.

Title: The Wild
Info: The seventh full-length solo release for the rapper features guest appearances from Andra Day, G-Eazy, Cee Lo Green, Lil Wayne, and P.U.R.E.

Title: Chants for Socialists
Info: The British singer-songwriter's concept album was based on the poetry by socialist activist William Morris.

Title: Spiderwebbed
Info: The debut full-length release for the British producer features guest appearances by Steffaloo, Co Ma, and Birds Of Passage.

Title: Wind In The Wires
Info: The 21-year-old British singer-songwriter's second solo recording again sets his instrumentation against a moody electronic backdrop.

Title: Mic Tyson
Info: The third full-length studio release from the Brooklyn rapper includes such guests and producers as Pharoahe Monch, The Alchemist, 9th Wonder, and Khrysis.

Title: The Hum
Info: The second full-length release for the British psychedelic/noise rock quintet is its first with new drummer, JN.

Title: Vessel
Info: The latest release for the New York indie pop project of Greta Kline  is its first on the Sub Pop label.

Title: Songs From The Year Of Our Demise
Info: 'Songs' is the first solo LP for the co-founder of The Posies, who is also a member of the current lineup of Big Star.

Title: Stay Gold
Info: The third full-length release (and the first on the Columbia label) for the Swedish sister duo was produced by Mike Mogis.

Title: The Return To Form Black Majick Party
Info: A member of Ladytron's touring band as well as the trio Super Numeri, English multi-instrumentalist Jonathan Pop Levi (yes, Pop is indeed his middle name) makes his full-length solo debut with this eclectic disc.

Title: Goodbye Bread
Info: The San Francisco-based garage revivalist returns with a new record, the first on Drag City's label.

Title: Earthly Delights
Info: This is the fifth album for the rock band from Rhode Island.

Title: The Wedding
Info: This is the seventh album for the New York noise-rock three-piece. Phil Manley of Trans Am guests.

Title: Street's Disciple
Info: Nas co-produced this double album along with Salaam Remi, Q-Tip and L.E.S. Also stopping by to lend a hand (or a voice) are Busta Rhymes, Kelis, Ludacris and Maxwell.

Title: Pig Lib
Info: The second solo release for the former Pavement leader (although it is credited to "Stephen Malkmus & The Jicks"), 'Pig Lib' features 11 new tracks.

Title: The Execution of All Things
Info: This is the second full-length album for the Los Angeles-based indie band, who are now labelmates of Omaha's Bright Eyes. Fans of the TV program "Boy Meets World" (all three of you) may recognize guitarist Blake Sennett, who played Joey on that show. (Singer Jenny Lewis has also guested on numerous sitcoms over the years.)

Title: With Ghost
Info: Former Galaxie 500 members Damon Krukowski and Naomi Yang unite with Japanese outfit Ghost for an album of dreamy, contemplative folk-rock.

Title: Modern Nature
Info: The 12th studio release for the British alternative rock band is its first album without founding member Jon Brookes, who passed away in 2013 from brain cancer.

Title: There Is a Hell, Believe Me I've Seen It, There is a Heaven, Let's Keep It a Secret
Info: The British metal band's third album was produced by Fredrik Nordstrom and features guest appearances by Lights, You Me At Six's Josh Franceschi, and The Chariot's Josh Scogin.

Title: Begin To Hope
Info: The Russia-born, New York-based anti-folkie returns with a dozen new tracks produced by David Kahne (The Strokes).

Title: Out in the Storm
Info: The fourth full-length release for Katie Crutchfield's music project  was produced with John Agnello.

Title: Everything in Between
Info: This is the second studio album for the the indie rock duo from Los Angeles.

Title: 4eva Is a Mighty Long Time
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Mississippi rapper features guest appearances from Bilal, Robert Glasper, CeeLo Green, Keyon Harrold, Joi, Lloyd, Jill Scott, Sleepy Brown, T.I., Burniss Earl Travis II, UKG, and Kenneth Whalum.

Title: Up On The Ridge
Info: Grammy-nominated Dierks Bentley releases an all-acoustic bluegrass country album featuring guest appearances by Kris Kristofferson, Miranda Lambert, Jamey Johnson, the Del McCoury Band, and the Punch Brothers.

Title: Prog
Info: The rock-influenced piano trio's fifth album mixes originals with covers of songs by David Bowie ("Life On Mars"), Tears For Fears ("Everybody Wants To Rule The World") and Rush ("Tom Sawyer").

Title: Mr. M
Info: Dedicated to the late Vic Chesnutt, Mr. M is the latest album from the alt-country group led by Kurt Wagner and was recorded in Mark Never's studio.

Title: Hideous Bastard
Info: The debut full-length release for The xx bassist/singer Oliver Sim features a guest appearance from Jimmy Somerville and was produced by Jamie xx.

Title: Green to Gold
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for New York indie rock band led by Peter Silberman is its first album of new songs in seven years.

Title: How Did I Find Myself Here?
Info: The first studio release in 29 years for the rock band led by Steve Wynn was produced with Chris Cacavas.

Title: Ouroboros
Info: The sixth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced with Jim James of My Morning Jacket.

Title: Saturnalia
Info: The Afghan Whigs' Greg Dulli and Screaming Trees' Mark Lanegan team up on their debut album as The Gutter Twins.

Title: A Loud Bash of Teenage Feelings
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Philadelphia pop-punk band led by James Alex was produced by Dave Downham.

Title: Keep It Hid
Info: This is the solo debut album for the Black Keys singer/guitarist.

Title: Formal Growth in the Desert
Info: The sixth full-length studio release from Detroit rock band Protomartyr was recorded in Texas with producer Jake Aron.

Title: Further
Info: The eighth full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was co-produced by Colin Elliot and Shez Sheridan.

Title: Faithful Fairy Harmony
Info: The latest release for the Colorado-based singer-songwriter features contributions from Jon Estes, Victor Herrero, Chris Scruggs, Gyða Valtýsdóttir, as well as members of The Cherry Blossoms.

Title: Jaiyede Afro
Info: The latest release from the Nigerian saxophonist Orlando Julius is a collaboration with the British funk ensemble The Heliocentrics.

Title: Breaking Kayfabe
Info: The debut album from the Canadian rapper, who has also remixed songs for Lady Sovereign and Ciara.

Title: Beast Epic
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for Sam Beam was recorded live by Tom Schick at The Loft in Chicago.

Title: Bestial Burden
Info: The second full-length release for Margaret Chardiet as Pharmakon was recorded with Sean Ragon.

Title: Grid of Points
Info: The 11th full length release for Liz Harris was written and recorded in Wyoming over a week-and--a-half.

Title: Running with the Hurricane
Info: The third full-length release for Australian trio Camp Cope was recorded, produced and mixed with Anna Laverty.

Title: Three Fact Fader
Info: The second full-length album for the indie band was produced with Ken Thomas.

Title: No Home Record
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Sonic Youth co-founder was produced by Justin Raisen with contributions from Shawn Everett and Jake Meginsky.

Title: A Rush Of Blood To The Head
Info: The UK quartet follows the critical and commercial success of their 2000 debut album 'Parachutes' with this long-awaited follow-up release, which the band has suggested may be their last.

Title: Dark in Here
Info: The latest full-length release for the John Darnielle-led band was recorded in March 2020.

Title: The Childhood of a Leader [OST]
Info: The soundtrack to Brady Corbet's 2015 film that was inspired by a short story by Jean-Paul Sartre about the childhood of a future Fascist leader is the second film score for the avant-garde artist.

Title: Thank Your Lucky Stars
Info: Produced with Chris Coady, the sixth studio album is the Baltimore duo's second album for 2015.

Title: Mystery Glue
Info: The second release since Parker and the Rumour reunited in 2011 was recorded in six days.

Title: Warp & Weft
Info: Produced by Tucker Martine, the ninth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Neko Case, My Morning Jacket's Jim James, and members of the Decemberists.

Title: We've Been Going About This All Wrong
Info: The sixth full-length release from singer-songwriter Sharon Van Etten was produced with Daniel Knowles.

Title: Never Not Together
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the New York alternative rock band was recorded in Wales.

Title: Stay Gold
Info: The eighth full-length solo studio release for the rock producer/singer-songwriter features a duet with Ashley Moore.

Title: The Midnight Organ Fight
Info: The British band's sophomore album was produced by Peter Katis.

Title: Did You Know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd.
Info: The ninth full-length studio release from singer-songwriter Lana Del Rey features guest appearances from Jon Batiste, Bleachers, Father John Misty, Tommy Genesis, Riopy, and SYML.

Title: Eight Gates
Info: The posthumous release for the Ohio singer-songwriter was recorded in 2008.

Title: The Unraveling
Info: The 12th full-length studio release for the alt-country/southern rock band was recorded in Memphis with Matt Ross-Spang and producer David Barbe.

Title: Lush
Info: The debut full-length release for 18-year-old British indie rock singer-songwriter Lindsey Jordan was produced by Jake Aron.

Title: The Disco's of Imhotep
Info: This is the debut full-length solo studio release for Chicago house producer Jamal Moss.

Title: When the Cellar Children See the Light of Day
Info: The second release for the Finnish singer-songwriter was produced by Vladislav Delay.

Title: Cruise Your Illusion
Info: The debut full-length release for the Olympia, Washington indie punk quartet formed by brothers, Alex Coxen and Joe Rutter.

Title: Endless Falls
Info: The latest ambient album for Scott Morgan, the Canadian producer, features a spoken word track with Destroyer's Dan Bejar.

Title: The Slow Wonder
Info: This is the first solo release for Carl Newman, who can also be found leading indie-rock supergroup The New Pornographers as well as the (now defunct) Canadian power-pop band Zumpano.

Title: Hate
Info: The Glasgow, Scotland-based band follow 2000's stunning 'The Great Eastern' with this, their fourth (and almost equally stunning) LP.  Dave Fridmann (Mercury Rev) returns as producer.

Title: Yanqui U.X.O.
Info: Slightly (and confusingly) changing their name to Godspeed You! Black Emperor for this outing, the Canadian instrumental band recorded these 5 tracks (clocking in at 75 minutes) with Steve Albini as a follow-up to their extremely well-received 2000 effort 'Lift Yr Skinny Fists Like Antennas To Heaven.'

Title: Pajo
Info: This is Slint guitarist David Pajo's first solo LP under his own name (well, at least half of his own name).

Title: The Bones of What You Believe
Info: This is the debut full-length studio release for the Scottish synth-pop trio.

Title: The Besnard Lakes Are The Roaring Night
Info: The indie rock quartet led by music producer Jace Lasek and his wife Olga releases its second album on the Jagjaguwar label.

Title: Super Taranta!
Info: The second album from Side One Dummy Records for the New York band who are influenced by gypsy music.

Title: The Libertines
Info: While some eponymous albums suggest a lack of creativity, the heralded UK rock outfit's sophomore disc is titled 'The Libertines' because it is indeed about The Libertines--or, more specifically, about the ongoing conflict between the band's two songwriters, Carlos Barat and Pete Doherty (the latter of whom was subsequently kicked out of the band after three failed rehab attempts). The Clash's Mick Jones returns as producer.

Title: Atlas Vending
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Toronto punk rock trio was co-produced with Uniform's Ben Greenberg.

Title: The Sun's Tirade
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Tennessee rap artist features guest appearances from Deacon Blues, Kari Faux, Hugh Augustine, Kendrick Lamar, Jay Rock, SiR, Syd the Kid, SZA, and Zacari.

Title: Twelfth
Info: The 12th full-length studio release for the alt-country band was recorded in Nashville and was produced by Vance Powell.

Title: Compliments Please
Info: The debut full-length release for the solo project from former Slow Club member Rebecca Taylor was produced by The Very Best's Johan Karlberg.

Title: Fixed Ideals
Info: The second full-length release for the British pop-punk trio led by Lande Hekt was produced and mixed by Lewis Johns.

Title: Good Time [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
Info: The soundtrack by Daniel Lopatin for the 2017 film directed by Josh and Benny Safdie was awarded the Best Soundtrack Award at Cannes.

Title: Gulag Orkestar
Info: This Eastern European-sounding, multi-instrumental effort is actually the work of Albuquerque teenager Zach Condon. Members of A Hawk And A Hacksaw also lend a hand.

Title: BE
Info: The latest full-length studio release for the South Korean pop band features production from Brasstracks and Cosmo's Midnight.

Title: The Way The Wind Blows
Info: This is the third Hawk album for former Neutral Milk Hotel drummer Jeremy Barnes. Like previous efforts, it has an Eastern European flavor, although unlike previous efforts, it also includes contributions from Beirut's Zach Condon.

Title: Nootropics
Info: The second album for the Baltimore-based indie rock band led by Jana Hunter was produced Drew Brown.

Title: My Krazy Life
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Los Angeles rapper features guest appearances from Drake, Jeezy, Kendrick Lamar, Jay Rock, Schoolboy Q, and Ty Dolla $ign.

Title: Everything is Love
Info: The debut full-length collaborative album for Beyonce and Jay-Z was a surprise release and features guest appearances from Migos, Offset, Quavo, Rory from Stone Love, and Ty Dolla $ign.

Title: 3001: A Laced Odyssey
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Brooklyn-based rap trio of Meechy Darko, Zombie Juice and Erick “The Architect” Elliott features guest appearances from Diamante and Anthony Flammia.

Title: 13 & God
Info: 13+God is a collaboration between German rocktronica outfit The Notwist and American indie-rappers Themselves. Also guesting are members of Ms. John Soda, Lali Puna, and cLOUDDEAD; basically, if they're on Morr Music or Anticon, you'll find them here.

Title: Are You Alone?
Info: The second full-length release for Canadian duo Devon Welsh and Matthew Otto features contributions from Owen Pallett.

Title: Assume Form
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British electronic producer features guest appearances from André 3000, Metro Boomin, Rosalía, Travis Scott, and Moses Sumney.

Title: All My Demons Greeting Me as a Friend
Info: The Norwegian dark pop singer-songwriter worked with Odd Martin Skalnes and Magnus Skylstad on her debut full-length release.

Title: Be Small
Info: The fourth release for the quintet-turned duo of Luke Temple and Michael Bloch was self-produced.

Title: Throw It to the Universe
Info: The sixth release for the Swedish rock band is said to be its final album.

Title: Growing Up
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based punk band The Linda Lindas was recorded, mixed and produced by Carlos de la Garza.

Title: Side Effects
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Austin rock band features some songs that were either demos, outtakes or were not included in previous albums.

Title: Desperate Man
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Nashville-based country artist was produced by Jay Joyce.

Title: Fresh Blood
Info: The second full-length release from the indie rock artist was produced with Trey Pollard.

Title: Tetsuo & Youth
Info: The fifth studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from  Ab-Soul and Nikki Jean.

Title: The Eldritch Dark
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian doom metal band was produced by Ian Blurton.

Title: We The Vehicles
Info: This second Maritime LP is the final one to feature former Dismemberment Plan bassist Eric Axelson, who left the group (which also includes former members of the Promise Ring) after its recording.

Title: Pawn Shoppe Heart
Info: The Detroit garage rockers make their major-label debut with this sophomore album, which was produced by Jerry Harrison.

Title: American III: Solitary Man
Info: In his sixth decade of recording, Johnny Cash reunites with producer Rick Rubin for a third consecutive outing. Like its two predecessors, 'III' consists of a mix of Cash originals and covers, this time from the likes of Nick Cave ("The Mercy Seat"), Tom Petty ("I Won't Back Down"), and U2 ("One").

Title: Thirteen Tales From Urban Bohemia
Info: The third album from the Portland, Ore. indie-rock band failed to elevate their standing in their home country, although they continue to sell well (and receive favorable press) in Europe.

Title: All Of A Sudden I Miss Everyone
Info: The instrumental post-rock band from Texas returns after a four-year wait with this fourth studio album.

Title: Give the People What They Want
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Brooklyn soul band was originally scheduled for an August release but was delayed due to the cancer diagnosis of singer Sharon Jones.

Title: Denies The Day's Demise
Info: The Los Angeles-based electronica artist's fifth album has a bit of a Brazilian feel.

Title: Corsicana Lemonade
Info: Produced by Jim Vollentine, The sixth full-length studio release for the Austin band includes two tracks produced by Wilco's Jeff Tweedy.

Title: 12 Bit Blues
Info: Samples from early blues records are used in the sixth studio album for the Canadian DJ.

Title: DS2
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper was named after his 2011 mixtape Dirty Sprite and features a guest appearance from Drake.

Title: Fall Heads Roll
Info: Mark E. Smith & Co. return with their full-length follow-up to 'The Real New Fall LP.'

Title: Ya-Ka-May
Info: Heavily influenced by hip-hop, rock, blues, funk, and jazz, the New Orleans "Bounce" quintet Galactic enlists vocal legends for its sixth studio effort. These include Rebirth Brass Band and Irma Thomas, as well as such up-and-coming Bounce artists as Cheeky Blakk, Big Freedia, and Sissy Nobby.

Title: The Angels Of Light Sing 'Other People'
Info: Michael Gira's post-Swans project Angels Of Light returns with a fourth release of mostly acoustic folk/rock, backed by musicians from Akron/Family.

Title: Animated Violence Mild
Info: This is the fourth full-length studio release for the electronic solo project of Fuck Buttons' Benjamin John Power.

Title: Small Town Heroes
Info: The latest release for the folk ensemble led by Alynda Lee Segarra is its first on the ATO label.

Title: Exai
Info: The 11th full-length release from the British electronic duo of Sean Booth and Rob Brown is over two hours long.

Title: Ali
Info: The collaboration between Vieux Farka Touré and Khruangbin is said to be an homage to the music of the late Ali Farka Touré (Vieux's father).

Title: Get On Board
Info: The latest full-length release for the collaboration between Taj Mahal and Ry Cooder features covers of songs from Sonny Terry & Brownie McGhee.

Title: Private Space
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Indiana retro-soul group features synths and disco influences.

Title: The Last Exit
Info: This is the fifth full-length release for the duo of Tessa Murray and Greg Hughes.

Title: Powers
Info: The first full-length release in seven years for the British post-punk band was self-produced.

Title: Horizon
Info: The third full-length release for the British post-punk trio is its first in five years.

Title: Black Friday
Info: The third full-length release for the Boston-based indie rock trio led by Ellen Kempner was co-produced with Gabe Wax.

Title: A Laughing Death in Meatspace
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Australian rock band that includes The Drones' Gareth Libbiard and Fiona Kitschin; High Tension's Lauren Hammel; and Harmony/Palm Springs' Erica Dunn.

Title: Infinite Moment
Info: This is the sixth full-length release for Swedish electronic producer Axel Willner as The Field.

Title: Bad Contestant
Info: The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in 12 days with Alex Burey and Foxygen's Jonathan Rado.

Title: Goat Girl
Info: The debut full-length release for British rock band was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Three/Three
Info: The third and final part of Tadd Mullinix's trilogy features guest appearances from Danny Brown, Clear Soul Forces, Denmark Vessey, Doom, Fatt Father, G & D, Guilty Simpson, Ghostface Killah, Silas Green, Intricate Dialect, Kadance, La Peace, Roc Marciano, Georgia Anne Muldrow, Nolan The Ninja, Dudley Perkins, Phat Kat, Quelle Chris, Shigeto, and Jon Wayne.

Title: Life Is Fine
Info: The 23rd full-length release for the Australian singer-songwriter features guest appearance from Linda and Vika Bull.

Title: Poor David's Almanack
Info: The third release (and the first under just his name) for the guitarist/producer features Gillian Welch as well as Brittany Haas, Paul Kowert, Ketch Secor, and Willie Watson.

Title: Also Sprach Zarathustra
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Slovenian avant-garde group was originally made for a theatrical production of Thus Spoke Zarathustra (Also Sprach Zarathustra) for the Anton Podbevšek Theatre (APT) in Slovenia.

Title: Snake Pit
Info: The latest solo studio release for the blues-rock guitarist who played with such artists as Canned Heat, John Mayall, and the Rolling Stones, was recorded in two days.

Title: Fingers Crossed
Info: The latest release for the British rock singer-songwriter was co-produced with Andy York and features Dandy, a tribute to David Bowie.

Title: Jura
Info: Originally released on Black Friday Record Store Day in 2015, the Mekons and Robbie Fulks went to the Scottish island of Jura to record the album of acoustic folk songs.

Title: Georgia
Info: The full-length debut for the British artist who worked with Kwes and Kate Tempest was self-produced.

Title: Give Up Your Dreams
Info: This is the sixth full-length studio release for the New Zealand six-piece band.

Title: Worthy
Info: Produced by Joe Henry, the latest release for the soul singer includes songs by the Beatles, Beth Nielsen Chapman, Bob Dylan, Mary Gauthier, and the Rolling Stones.

Title: Three Chords Good
Info: Graham Parker reunites with his British rock band, The Rumour, after more than 30 years for this 12-track album produced with Dave Cook.

Title: Where Do You Start
Info: Brad Mehldau's second album in 2012 with his jazz trio is a covers album of songs by such artists as Sufjan Stevens, Alice in Chains, Elvis Costello, Nick Drake, and Jimi Hendrix.

Title: Quakers
Info: Portishead's Geoff Barrow (under the name Fuzzface), 7-Stu-7 (Portishead's studio engineer, Stuart Matthews), and Katalyst produced the hip-hop album featuring 35 rappers contributing rhymes to the 41-track release.

Title: Mariachi El Bronx (II)
Info: This is the second album of mariachi music for El Bronx's alter ego band.

Title: In Trance
Info: The third teaming up of British guitarist Justin Adam and Gambian singer Juldeh Camara now includes Billy Fuller on bass and Dave Smith on drums.

Title: Gob
Info: The debut LP for the British rapper features production from Micachu, Hot Chip's Joe Goddard, Kwes and Roots Manuva.

Title: Regifted Light
Info: The Cleveland-born transgender singer-songwriter's latest album was produced by Andrew W.K.

Title: Progress
Info: The British boyband welcomes Robbie Williams back to the group on its sixth album.

Title: Ole! Tarantula
Info: The veteran musician is backed by REM and/or Minus 5 members Peter Buck, Scott McCaughey, and Bill Rieflin (together, the Venus 3) on his first release since 2004's 'Spooked.'

Title: The Magic Numbers
Info: This debut disc showcases the 50s and 60s pop stylings and three-part harmonies of the pair of brother-sister duos (Romeo & Michelle Stodart and Sean & Angela Gannon) that make up The Magic Numbers.

Title: Infiniheart
Info: The Canadian illustrator and musician makes his Sub Pop debut with this self-recorded album.

Title: Silver Age
Info: The latest solo studio album for the former Hüsker Dü and Sugar singer is his first on the Merge label.

Title: Keepsake
Info: The debut full-length release for the Australian dream pop artist Harriette Pilbeam was produced by John Castle.

Title: A Place To Bury Strangers
Info: The debut album for the trio from New York.

Title: Still Trippin'
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based footwork producer features guest appearances from DJ Lucky, DJ Manny, DJ Paypal, Chuck Inglish, Odile Myrtil, Fabi Reyna, and UNIIQU3.

Title: Cracker Island
Info: The eighth full-length release for animated supergroup Gorillaz features guest appearances from Bad Bunny, Beck, Pharcyde's Bootie Brown, Stevie Nicks, Adeleye Omotayo, Tame Impala, and Thundercat.

Title: Every Acre
Info: The third full-length solo release for North Carolina singer-songwriter H.C. McEntire was co-produced with Missy Thangs and Luke Norton.

Title: Sweep It Into Space
Info: The 12th full-length release for the Massachusetts rock trio was produced with Kurt Vile.

Title: Oneiric Formulary
Info: The first full-length solo release for the Sun City Girls guitarist in five years.

Title: The Take Off and Landing of Everything
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British alternative rock band was again produced by Craig Potter.

Title: Pretty Years
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Staten Island rock band led by Joseph D'Agostino was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Going Down in History
Info: The first studio release of original songs since 2005's Freedom And Weep from the Chicago alt-country band led by Jon Langford was produced by Mike Hagler.

Title: Aquarius
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, Future, Devonté Hynes, and ScHoolboy Q.

Title: Tournament Of Hearts
Info: The Canadian rockers follow 'Shine A Light' with this 10-track set.

Title: Prize
Info: The latest full-length solo release for London-based Rozi Plain features contributions from Danalogue, Alabaster De Plume and Cole Pluice.

Title: Charli
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British pop artist was produced by A.G. Cook and features guest appearances from Big Freedia, Brooke Candy, Christine and the Queen, Clairo, CupcakKe, Haim, Lizzo, Kim PetrasTroye Sivan, Sky Ferreira, Tommy Cash, Pabllo Vittar, and Yaeji.

Title: Night Thoughts
Info: The seventh full-length release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Ed Buller.

Title: Hot Dreams
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Canadian folk band led by Taylor Kirk and was produced by Simon Trottier.

Title: If I Can't Have Love, I Want Power
Info: Produced by Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross, the fourth full-length studio release for the alternative pop artist is a concept album about pregnancy and giving birth.

Title: Pang!
Info: The sixth full-length solo release for the Super Furry Animals frontman was produced and mixed by Muzi.

Title: Club Meds
Info: Canadian singer-songwriter Dan Mangan returns as Dan Mangan + Blacksmith for his fourth overall full-length album and it was produced by Colin Stewart.

Title: Under The Skin
Info: The Fleetwood Mac guitarist's first solo outing in over a dozen years features bandmates Mick Fleetwood and John McVie on two tracks of a largely acoustic set.

Title: Purge
Info: This is the first full-length studio release in six years from British industrial metal band Godflesh.

Title: Album
Info: This is the debut album for the San Francisco-based duo of Christopher Owens and Chet White.

Title: Exile in the Outer Ring
Info: The third full-length solo release for Erika Anderson was co-produced with Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Jacob Portrait.

Title: Run Fast
Info: The debut release for Bikini Kill founder Kathleen Hanna's Julie Ruin project includes Carmine Covelli, Sara Landeau, Kenny Mellman of Kiki And Herb, and Kathi Wilcox of Bikini Kill.

Title: The King of Limbs
Info: Released a day earlier than expected as a digital download on February 18th, this is the eighth album from the epic, experimental UK five-piece.

Title: Now Here Is Nowhere
Info: This is the full-length debut for the Dallas, TX trio of brothers Benjamin and Brandon Curtis and Josh Garza.

Title: The Highwomen
Info: The debut full-length release for the country supergroup that includes Brandi Carlile, Natalie Hemby, Maren Morris, and Amanda Shires was produced by Dave Cobb.

Title: Fabriclive 93
Info: Dan Snaith brings 23 new tracks under his DJ alias for the latest Fabriclive mix release.

Title: The Craft
Info: The San Francisco rap duo of Gift of Gab (aka Timothy Parker) and Chief Xcel (Xavier Mosley) return with a third album.

Title: Last Days Of Wonder
Info: This is the first release in three years for the husband-and-wife duo of Brett and Rennie Sparks.

Title: Twins
Info: This is the San Francisco rock singer's third release in 2012 (the other two were: Hair with White Fence and Slaughterhouse with his own band).

Title: K Bay
Info: The first full-length solo release for the indie singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Joseph "JoJo" Clarke.

Title: Serfs Up!
Info: The English rock band moves to Domino for their third album.

Title: A  Flame My Love, a Frequency
Info: The latest full-length release for the French artist known for using a viola da gamba changes to electronic instruments that include Moog effects pedals and Critter and Guitari synthesizers.

Title: Apricity
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British psychedelic rock band was produced by Jason Falkner.

Title: Rewind the Film
Info: Richard Hawley, Cate Le Bon, and Lucy Rose guest on the 11th full-length studio release from the Welsh alternative rock band.

Title: The Rat Road
Info: The third full-length studio release from Aaron Jerome under the name SBTRKT features guest appearances by Anna Of The North, Saya Gray, Kai-Isaiah Jamal, Leilah, Little Dragon, George Riley, Sampha, Teezo Touchdown, and Toro Y Moi.

Title: Premonition
Info: The first new full-length album for Canadian punk band White Lung in five years was produced by Jesse Gander and was announced as its last.

Title: Water
Info: This is the second full-length release for Berlin-based experimental electronic producer J'Kerian Morgan.

Title: Monkey Minds in the Devil's Time
Info: The Beta Band singer self-produced 11 songs and Dan Carey worked on the other nine songs on Mason's politically-influenced second solo release.

Title: Breaks in the Armor
Info: The sixth album for the indie rock band led by Archer of Loaf's Eric Bachmann was recorded at The Bakery with Matt Yelton.

Title: Nashville
Info: The singer-songwriter follows his acclaimed effort '1972' with another album produced by Brad Jones. Don't be fooled by the title: it's not a country album, but rather, a farewell to the city Rouse has called home for the past decade (before moving to Spain).

Title: The Wondershow Of The World
Info: This is Will Oldham's first Bonnie "Prince" Billy album to credit the Cairo Gang, who performed on the previous three Billy albums.

Title: Welcome to Bobby's Motel
Info: The debut full-length release for the Montreal-based indie rock band was produced by Jonathan Schenke.

Title: Butter
Info: The Scottish electronic artist releases his debut full-length album.

Title: Hey Mr Ferryman
Info: The 10th full-length solo release for the former lead singer of American Music Club was produced by Bernard Butler.

Title: Ruins
Info: The tenth studio release from Liz Harris as Grouper was mainly recorded in Portugal in 2011 on a 4-track.

Title: One Breath
Info: The follow-up to the British singer-songwriter's Mercury Prize-nominated debut was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Unglamorous
Info: Faith Hill and Tim McGraw guest on Lori McKenna's first album with a major label.

Title: Love Keeps Kicking
Info: This is the third full-length release for the British indie punk band.

Title: Reassemblage
Info: The second full-length release for the ambient duo of Spencer Doran and Ryan Carlile features guest appearances from  Matt Carlson, Miyako Koda, and Motion Graphics.

Title: Down Like Gold
Info: The debut release for the Isle of Wight brother duo was recorded at a former water tower.

Title: Tin Star
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.

Title: I'll Sleep When You're Dead
Info: El-P's long-anticipated second solo disc features collaborations with Cat Power, Trent Reznor, Matt Sweeney, Aesop Rock, and The Mars Volta.

Title: The End, So Far
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the masked metal band Slipknot is its first with Michael Pfaff as percussionist.

Title: Robyn Hitchcock
Info: The latest solo release for the artist was produced with Brendan Benson with a full studio band that included Grant-Lee Phillips, Pat Sansone, Emma Swift, and Gillian Welch.

Title: The Universal Want
Info: The first full-length studio release for the British alternative rock band in over 10 years was produced with Dan Austin.

Title: Love, Damini
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for Nigerian artist Burna Boy features guest appearances from Blxst, J Balvin, J Hus, Kehlani, Khalid, Ladysmith Black Mambazo, Popcaan, Ed Sheeran, and Victony.

Title: Invisible Hour
Info: Recorded over four days, the 13th release for the singer-songwriter feature guest appearances from Lisa Hannigan as well as Kenneth Pattengale & Joey Ryan of The Milk Carton Kids.

Title: A Ways Away
Info: This is the first album on K Records for the Portland, Oregon, singer-songwriter.

Title: Lazaretto
Info: The second solo release for The White Stripes/The Raconteurs/The Dead Weather musician/producer shows influences of blues, country, folk, hip-hop, and rock music.

Title: Visions
Info: The fourth release for the Canadian artist Claire Boucher is her first on the 4AD label.

Title: Thunderbitch
Info: The debut surprise release for the side project of Alabama Shakes' Brittany Howard features members from Nashville rock bands Fly Golden Eagle and Clear Plastic Masks.

Title: Music for People in Trouble
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Norwegian singer/songwriter was produced with Jørgen Træen.

Title: At Swim
Info: The third full-length solo release for the Irish singer-songwriter was produced with Aaron Dessner.

Title: Bright Sunny South
Info: The folk artist reworks Mariah Carey's "Shake It Off" and Tim McGraw's "My Old Friend" on his debut release with the Nonesuch label.

Title: City Music
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the former Woods bassist was inspired by cities and music of the mid-70s.

Title: On the Water
Info: Produced by Chester Endersby Gwazda, the second album for the trio features cello, marimba, and violin instrumentation.

Title: Ascent
Info: The latest release from the band led by Ben Chasny was inspired by a dream about constructing a spacecraft on the moon.

Title: Second Line
Info: The sixth full-length solo release for the New Orleans electronic/R&B artist was produced with Ila Orbis.

Title: Shyga! The Sunlight Mound
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Australian psychedelic rock band was partially recorded at lead singer Jack McEwan's home studio.

Title: Nightmare Vacation
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Aminé, Gucci Mane, ppcocaine, Rubi Rose, Sukihana, Don Toliver, and Trippie Redd.

Title: Ghosts VI: Locusts
Info: The 15-track surprise release is one of the two new albums (Ghosts V: Together being the other) that continues Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross' instrumental Ghosts series.

Title: ONDA
Info: The third full-length release for the South Korean post-rock group is its first with former live band members Jaehyuk Choi and B.K Yu joining as regular members.

Title: Powerplant
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles duo of Harmony Tividad and Cleo Tucker was recorded and mixed by Drew Fischer.

Title: T2: Trainspotting [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
Info: The soundtrack to the sequel to the 1996 film Trainspotting features a Prodigy remix of Iggy Pop's "Lust for Life," as well as tracks from classic artists such as Blondie, Queen, Run DMC, The Clash and newer artists such as Fat White Family, Rubberbandits, Wolf Alice, and Young Fathers.

Title: The  Dusted Sessions
Info: The Oakland, California band formed by Marielle Jakobsons and Gregg Kowalsky adds bassist Ben Bracken, tanpura player Michael Elrod, and guitarist Noah Phillips for its third full-length release.

Title: Swing Lo Magellan
Info: The sixth album for the experimental indie rock band was recorded in Delaware County in New York state and produced by the band's lead singer, Dave Longstreth.

Title: Gather, Form & Fly
Info: The sophomore album gathers music from two discs for the North Carolina-based band.

Title: Party Intellectuals
Info: The debut album for guitarist/vocalist Marc Ribot as Ceramic Dog, who heads up the experimental rock trio.

Title: Death Is This Communion
Info: The fourth album for the Oakland, California metal band.

Title: Emerald City
Info: The producer of Spoon's Gimme Fiction, explore 9/11 and politics again.

Title: Untouchables
Info: The California alt-metal outfit finally returns with a successor to the smash hit 1999 album 'Issues.'

Title: The Contino Sessions
Info: Former London club DJ Richard Fearless (now working with Tim Holmes) returns for a follow-up to 1997's 'Dead Elvis.' Guest vocals are provided by Bobby Gillespie (Primal Scream), Jim Reid (Jesus And Mary Chain), Dot Allison (One Dove) and Iggy Pop.

Title: Oh My God, Charlie Darwin
Info: The first album on the Nonesuch label for the trio of Rhode Islanders.

Title: Blue Banisters
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter features production from Zach Dawes, Mike Dean, Dean Reid, and Gabe Simon.

Title: Happy New Year
Info: They're either a bit early or a bit late with their new year's tidings, but the experimental Brooklyn band is back with 11 new tracks.

Title: All This I Do for Glory
Info: The sixth full-length solo release for the saxophonist was recorded live with no overdubs or loops and was self-produced.

Title: How Do You Burn?
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for alternative rock band The Afghan Whigs features contributions from the late Mark Lanegan, Van Hunt, Susan Marshall, and Marcy Mays.

Title: Fun House
Info: The third full-length release for the Meg Duffy project features a guest appearance from Perfume Genius and was produced by Sasami Ashworth and mixed by Chris Coady and Kyle Thomas.

Title: King of Cowards
Artist: Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs
Info: The second full-length release for the British rock band led by Matt Baty was recorded by John Martindale and Sam Grant.

Title: Other
Info: The ninth full-length solo studio release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Guy Sigsworth.

Title: MeYouWeYou
Info: The debut full-length release for the London-based brothers of Ben and Tom Page was self-produced.

Title: Jake Bugg
Info: The Nottingham artist was only 18 when this debut album was released.

Title: Rising Down
Info: The latest studio album from the hip-hop group features Common, Malik B, Talib Kweli, Mos Def, Styles P, Wale, and DJ Jazzy Jeff, amongst others guest artists.

Title: M.A.D.E.
Info: The rapper from Houston releases his latest album, which features artists such as Lil Wayne, T.I., and Wacko.

Title: Confessions On A Dance Floor
Info: Stuart Price co-produced the 47-year-old Anglophile's latest dance-oriented effort.

Title: Furr
Info: The fourth album for the Portland, Oregon group is the first on the Sub Pop label.

Title: Golden Sings That Have Been Sung
Info: The third full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Wilco's Leroy Bach.

Title: Works for Tomorrow
Info: The 12th full-length release for the Chicago alternative rock band that includes Janet Bean, Mark Greenberg, Doug McCombs, and Rick Rizzo features the addition of guitarist Jim Elkington.

Title: Draw Down the Moon
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Connor Murphy-led trio was produced by Andy Hull of Manchester Orchestra.

Title: Big Baby D.R.A.M.
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper from Virginia features guest appearances from Erykah Badu, Lil Yachty, and Young Thug).

Title: Fever Dream
Info: The third solo full-length release for the artist who was one half of Everything But the Girl features contributions from Bernard Butler, Martin Ditcham, and Rex Horan.

Title: Colonial Patterns
Info: The Kansas City electronic producer Brian Leeds releases his debut full-length release as Huerco S.

Title: Black Sea
Info: This is the fourth studio album for the electronic artist from Austria.

Title: Broken Knowz
Info: This is the debut full-length studio release for the Detroit techno producer.

Title: The Animal Years
Info: Brian Deck (Modest Mouse) produced the Idaho singer-songwriter's fourth album and major-label debut.

Title: Quiet the Room
Info: The debut full-length release for Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter Helen Ballentine as Skullcrusher was recorded by producer Andrew Sarlo.

Title: Yol
Info: The third full-length release for the Turkish psych-folk band from Amsterdam was mixed by Jacco Gardner.

Title: Viscerals
Artist: Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs
Info: The third full-length release for the British band began recording the album with the songs only about 80% complete.

Title: Hollow Ground
Info: The debut full-length release for Brooklyn-based Max Clarke was recorded in Los Angeles and New York.

Title: I'm Not Your Man
Info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features The Big Moon as her backing band and was again produced by Charlie Andrew.

Title: Bobby Fuller Died for Your Sins
Info: The latest release was inspired in part by the mysterious death of rock artist Bobby Fuller in Los Angeles in 1966 as well as songs about the death of David Bowie, and a San Francisco security guard named Alex Nieto.

Title: In and Out of Youth and Lightness
Info: The third full-length album for the hard rock band from Louisville, Kentucky, which began as mathcore band Breather Resist before its sound changed, was produced with Kevin Ratterman.

Title: Paul's Tomb: A Triumph
Info: The Canadian rock band led by Carey Mercer release its latest album on new label Dead Oceans.

Title: Antics
Info: The New York-based foursome of Paul Banks, Carlos D., Sam Fogarino and Daniel Kessler took indie rockers worldwide by storm (and made Matador a lot of money) with 2002's 'Turn On The Bright Lights,' which introduced their neck-stabbing guitar-rock mix of Joy Division, The Cure, The Smiths, and all of your other favorite 80s bands. That captivating sound returns on this sophomore release, which features many of the new tracks ("Narc," "Length Of Love," etc.) which first debuted live during their relentless touring over the past two years.

Title: A Lifetime Of Temporary Relief
Info: This three-disc box set, subtitled "10 Years of B-Sides and Rarities," is just that, collecting 56 tracks from the Duluth, MN slowcore trio. Also included in the set is a 32-page booklet and a DVD with videos, concert footage and documentaries.

Title: Regard The End
Info: The Americana collective founded and led by fronted by Robert Fisher returns with a fifth LP. Co-founder/guitarist Paul Austin is no longer a full-time band member, but he appears on some tracks, as do Kristin Hersh, Chris Eckmen (The Walkabouts) and a variety of other guests.

Title: When I Pretend To Fall
Info: The one constant in the Seattle indie band The Long Winters is Alaska native John Roderick, who is joined on this sophomore effort by a host of musicians including Peter Buck (REM), Scott McCaughey (Minus 5) and Sean Ripple (American Analog Set), with Chris Walla (Death Cab For Cutie) and Ken Stringfellow (The Posies) co-producing.

Title: Twoism [EP]
Info: Boards of Canada's very first release--once limited to just 100 self-released vinyl copies in 1995--has finally been reissued on CD. (So if you've been holding on to your 12-inch to sell on eBay, tough luck.)

Title: Outside Closer
Info: The Leeds, England band follow their acclaimed 2001 release 'Cold House' with this 10-track effort which, like its predecessor, combines acoustic guitars and some glitchy electronica elements into moody indie rock.

Title: The Scene Of The Crime
Info: LaVette's latest features the Drive-By Truckers as her backing band.

Title: Fleeting
Info: The sixth solo release for the Cul de Sac guitarist was recorded by Laura Baird.

Title: Sleeper
Info: The semi-acoustic release for the rock musician was written after the death of his father.

Title: Georgia Blue
Info: Inspired by the 2020 elections, the latest release from the guitarist and his band features songs by Georgia artists and includes guest appearances from Julien Baker, Brandi Carlile, Bela Fleck, Steve Gorman, Peter Levin, Brittney Spencer, Amanda Shires, Chris Thile, Sadler Vaden, Adia Victoria, and John Paul White.

Title: OST
Info: The soundtrack to the film about a hard-living country music singer (Jeff Bridges) features the Golden Globe-winning song "The Weary Kind."

Title: The Further Adventures Of Lord Quas
Info: Madlib's somewhat bizarre alter-ego returns with a 27-track set.

Title: Keep It Like A Secret
Info: This second major-label release from Doug Martsch and company (following 'Perfect From Now On') features shorter, cleaner-sounding songs than that previous release.

Title: Physicalist
Info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn synth trio is its first with John Also Bennett and features acoustic instruments.

Title: Psi
Info: Named after the 23rd letter of the Greek alphabet, ψ, the third full-length release for the British experimental duo's album was inspired in part by industrial, club, '80s goth, pop, and British electronic music.

Title: Well-Done
Info: Producer Static Selektah and rapper/chef Action Bronson's second album together is liberally sprinkled with humorous food references and features guest appearances by both Nina Sky and Meyhem Lauren.

Title: Vapours
Info: The third album features the return of founding member, Jamie Thompson.

Title: A Black Mile to the Surface
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the indie rock band led by Andy Hull and Robert McDowell was produced by Catherine Marks and John Congleton.

Title: Psychic
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between guitarist Dave Harrington and electronic producer Nicolas Jaar took two years to record.

Title: ROADRUNNER: NEW LIGHT, NEW MACHINE
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based hip-hop collective features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, A$AP Ferg, Baird, Danny Brown, JPEGMAFIA, SoGone SoFlexy, and Charlie Wilson.

Title: Flight Of The Conchords
Info: The first full-length album from the band is featured in the HBO series of the same name.

Title: Tromatic Reflexxions
Info: 'Reflexxions' marks the first full-length collaboration between The Fall's Mark E. Smith and Mouse On Mars' Andi Toma and Jan St. Werner.

Title: Junun
Info: Shye Ben Tzur, Jonny Greenwood, and the Rajasthan Express collaborate on an album produced by Nigel Godrich and recorded in a 15th-century Mehrangarh Fort.

Title: Max Richter: Sleep [8 Hour Version]
Info: The German-born British composer consulted with neuroscientist Dr. David Eagleman for his eight-hour "lullaby for a frenetic world." There is also an one-hour version called From Sleep.

Title: The Face of Mount Molehill
Info: Jazz pianist Neil Cowley's latest release includes a strings group and guitarist Leo Abrahams.

Title: Rain On The City
Info: The first album of new studio material in nine years for the singer-songwriter was produced by Richard McLaurin.

Title: No Geography
Info: The ninth full-length release for the British electronic duo features only Japanese rapper Nene and Norwegian singer-songwriter Aurora.

Title: Full Upon Her Burning Lips
Info: The ninth full-length release for the Seattle drone duo of Dylan Carlson and Adrienne Davies was recorded and mixed by Mell Dettmer.

Title: More Life [Mixtape]
Info: The "playlist" project for the Canadian hip-hop artist features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Black Coffee, Giggs, PartyNextDoor, Quavo, Sampha, Travis Scott, Jorja Smith, Kanye West, and Young Thug.

Title: Sound & Fury
Info: The fourth full-length release for the outlaw country artist was recorded in Michigan with Bobby Emmett, Chuck Bartels, Miles Miller,  and John Hill.

Title: Found Light
Info: The 12th full-length release for Portland, Oregon-based singer-songwriter Laura Veirs was coproduced with Shahzad Ismaily.

Title: Lately I Feel Everything
Info: The fourth full-length release for daughter of Will and Jada Pinkett Smith features guest appearances from Travis Barker, Cherry Glazerr, Ayla Tesler-Mabe, and Tierra Whack.

Title: In A Town Called Addis
Info: Trans-Global Underground's Nick Page gathered a group of Ethiopian musicians to record this album that mixes African and dub reggae music.

Title: Swanlights
Info: With their fourth album, Antony Hegarty and the rest of his New York City band infuse atmospheric intonations, innovation, and heartfelt emotion into their experimental music.

Title: On Your Own Love Again
Info: The second full-length release for the California singer-songwriter was home recorded on a four track.

Title: II
Info: This is the first album in over five years for the rock trio from New York.

Title: Yours Truly, Cellophane Nose
Info: The debut full-length album for the British singer-songwriter and her band, the Hooves of Destiny, was produced by Ben Hillier.

Title: VEGA INTL. Night School
Info: Part of the third full-length release for the Alan Palomo's project was recorded on a cruise ship with his brother.

Title: Wavering Radiant
Info: The fifth album for the Los Angeles rock band was produced by Joe Barresi.

Title: Wenu Wenu
Info: Produced by Four Tet's Kieran Hebden, the official debut studio release for the Syrian dabke singer was recorded in Brooklyn with keyboardist Rizan Sa'id.

Title: It's Album Time
Info: The debut full-length release for the Norwegian electronic producer features a guest appearance from Bryan Ferry.

Title: Gang Of Losers
Info: The Montreal band led by Murray Lightburn is a little more rocking and a little less orchestral on this follow-up to 'No Cities Left.'

Title: Mordechai
Info: The third full-length release for the Houston trio was produced by Steve Christensen.

Title: Physical
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Factory Floor artist is a concept release with the 14 tracks forming a story about a night out to a dance club.

Title: Dissed and Dismissed
Info: Originally a limited release on the Melters label, the debut full-length solo album from the San Francisco Bay Area hardcore artist is reissued by Slumberland.

Title: Felt 3: A Tribute To Rosie Perez
Info: The third album from the side project of Slug and Murs was produced with Aesop Rock.

Title: Alegranza
Info: The first album released in the US for the Barcelona, Spain-based artist.

Title: Out Of The Shadow
Info: Originally self-released by the band in 2003, this debut album for Rogue Wave (basically just namesake Zach Rogue, plus additional musicians on some songs) was remastered and re-released by Sub Pop in 2004.

Title: The Ship
Info: The latest solo release was inspired by the Titanic and features  experiments with "three dimensional recording techniques."

Title: Lenses Alien
Info: The second album for the indie rock band from Staten Island was produced by John Agnello.

Title: God's Problem Child
Info: The latest release for the country singer-songwriter was produced by Buddy Cannon and features guest appearances from Jamey Johnson, Leon Russell (in one of his final recordings), and Tony Joe White.

Title: Long Island
Info: The third release for the Brooklyn rock band led by Paul Major sees the addition of guitarist Matt Sweeney.

Title: Deep Trip
Info: The latest release for the psychedelic rock band originally formed by Ryan Rousseau with Jay Reatard and Alicja Trout, now features Rousseau, his brother Rusty, N. Nappa, J. Aurelius, and A. Flores.

Title: In Advance Of The Broken Arm
Info: New York guitarist Stern (who blends harder, experimental rock with more typical indie-rock tunes)  makes her debut with this 13-song set co-produced by Zach Hill (Hella).

Title: Chromatica
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the pop artist features guest appearances from BLACKPINK, Ariana Grande and  Elton John.

Title: Sol Invictus
Info: The first release from the San Francisco alternative metal band led by Mike Patton in 18 years was produced by Billy Gould.

Title: An Inbuilt Fault
Info: The second full-length release from British Athens-based indie singer-songwriter was produced with Big Thief's James Krivchenia.

Title: I Am Very Far
Info: After serving as Roky Erickson's backup band on True Love Cast Out All Evil, the Texas-based band return with their self-produced sixth studio album of indie-folk.

Title: All That You Can't Leave Behind
Nothing's Real
Info: The debut full-length release for the British pop artist was produced with Greg Kurstin and Joel Pott.

Title: In Prism
Info: The first studio album for the rock band in more than 12 years was produced by Brian Paulson.

Title: Daze
Info: The third full-length release for the London-based electronic producer is his first on the Tri Angle label.

Title: House of Woo
Info: This is the second release for the Washington, D.C. electronic producer Andrew Field-Pickering.

Title: Lost Songs
Artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
Info: The eighth studio release from the Austin rock band was inspired by various social and political issues like war and apathy.

Title: So This Is Goodbye
Info: This is the second album for the acclaimed Canadian electronica outfit led by Jeremy Greenspan.

Title: Squeeze
Info: The second full-length release for Los Angeles-based artist SASAMI features elements of classical, country-pop, folk rock, and nu-metal music.

Title: My Dinosaur Life
Info: Blink-182's Mark Hoppus produces the punk band's fourth album.

Title: So Much (For) Stardust
Info: The eighth full-length studio release from Fall Out Boy was produced by Neal Avron.

Title: Peacers
Info: The debut release for Mike Donovan's mew music project was produced by Ty Segall.

Title: All or Nothin'
Info: The second full-length release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Auerbach.

Title: Band of Brothers
Info: Produced by Buddy Cannon, the latest release for the country singer-songwriter features nine original songs and a duet with Jamey Johnson.

Title: Seeds
Info: For the first time, Georgia Anne Muldrow hands over the producing reins to someone else, in this case to rapper/producer Madlib.

Title: Biophilia
Info: The Icelandic actress/singer-songwriter's latest album of experimental music was partially recorded on an iPad.

Title: Ugly Season
Info: The latest full-length release for Perfume Genius began as a soundtrack to  Mike Hadreas and Kate Wallich's dance project, The Sun Still Burns Here.

Title: Spook the Herd
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Hazel Wilde was recorded in Yorkshire.

Title: Intoxicated Women
Info: The final Serge Gainsbourg covers release from the Bad Seeds member features guest appearances from Sophia Brous, Channthy Kak, Jess Ribeiro, Andrea Schroeder, Lyndelle-Jayne Spruyt and Xanthe Waite.

Title: Blisters in the Pit of My Heart
Info: The second full-length release for the British pop-punk band was produced by MJ from Hookworms.

Title: Alternative Light Source
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British electronic group is its first in over 16 years.

Title: Grievances
Info: This is the fourth full-length release for the British mathcore quintet.

Title: Bahamas Is Afie
Info: The third studio release for the Canadian indie band led by Afie Jurvanen was produced with Robbie Lackritz.

Title: Feel It Like a Scientist
Info: This is the first release in a dozen years for the San Francisco-based experimental rock band now led by guitarist Helios Creed with Anne Dromeda, Steve “Trash” Fishman, Tommy GrenasKeith Thompson, Aleph Omega, and Lux Vibratus.

Title: The Moral of the Elephant
Info: The debut release for the British folk father-daughter duo of Martin & Eliza Carthy was produced by Oliver Knight.

Title: The Hope Six Demolition Project
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter was drawn from Harvey's travels to Kosovo, Afghanistan and Washington, D.C.

Title: Runner
Info: For the indie band's 10th release, Sam Prekop used a synthesizer to develop some songs before the other band members contributed their own ideas.

Title: Empire Builder
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Oregon singer-songwriter features contributions from Peter Broderick, Death Cab for Cutie guitarist Dave Depper, Alela Diane, Neko Case drummer Dan Hunt, and Nate Query of the Decemberists.

Title: Hold Time
Info: The singer-songwriter releases his latest solo album featuring guests such as The Decemberists' Rachel Blumberg, Lucinda Williams, DeVotchKa's Tom Hagerman, and Zooey Deschanel.
The latest full-length release from Brooklyn-based black metal band Liturgy was recorded by Steve Albini.

Title: No More Stories Are Told Today I'm Sorry They Washed Away No More Stories the World Is Grey I'm Tired Let's Wash Away
Info: The fifth album for the Danish band was produced by Rich Costey.

Title: Dedicated Side B
Info: The surprise release from the Canadian pop artist features contributions from such artists as Jack Antonoff, Bleachers, JOhn Hill, Dev Hynes, and Ariel Rechtshaid.

Title: Murray's Revenge
Info: The rapper once again collaborates with producer 9th Wonder on this follow-up to 3:16.

Title: I Am a Problem: Mind in Pieces
Info: The Detroit experimental noise rock/trip metal band releases its latest album on Jack White's Third Man Records.

Title: Bend Beyond
Info: The latest full-length album for the Brooklyn band features the debut of new drummer Aaron Neveu.

Title: The Unfairground
Info: The ex-Soft Machines band member returns with his first solo studio album since 1992.

Title: Three Futures
Info: The third full-length release for Brooklyn-based Mackenzie Scott as Torres was produced by Rob Ellis.

Title: Across the Multiverse
Info: Written and recorded in Los Angeles, the fourth full-length release was produced by the Mississippi artist and features a guest appearance from Frankie Cosmos.

Title: Desperation
Info: This is the first release of new music from the Memphis garage rock trio of Jack Yarber, Greg Cartwright, and Eric Friedl in over 15 years.

Title: The Unseen In Between
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the Brooklyn-based singer-songwriter was produced by James Elkington.

Title: III
Info: The third full-length release for the Swedish dream pop band is its first without guitarist Gustav Andersson.

Title: Cage Tropical
Info: The fourth full-length release for the indie-pop artist was produced with Jorge Elbrecht.

Title: Bandwagonesque
Info: Death Cab For Cutie's Ben Gibbard covers all 12 tracks from Teenage Fanclub's 1991 album Bandwagonesque.

Title: Cody
Info: The fourth full-length release for the California pop-punk band led by Barry Johnson was produced by Rob Schnapf.

Title: Same As You
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British experimental jazz band led by Seb Rochford was produced by Ken Barrientos.

Title: The Book of David
Info: The eighth studio album for the rapper/producer from Compton features guest appearances by Bizzy Bone, BlakKazz K.K., Bun B, Dwele, Ice Cube, Kurupt, Jon B., Gift Reynolds, Gary Shider, and Suga Free.

Title: Reconstruction Site
Info: This is the third album for the Winnipeg, Canada-based group led by former Propagandhi member John K. Samson.

Title: Twice
Info: 'Twice,' which, yes, follows 2001's 'Once,' is the second album for the Los Angeles-based band that features three members of Beachwood Sparks. While the Sparks employ a 60's California pop sound, the Tyde tend to echo somewhat more recent British groups such as Felt.

Title: How I Long To Feel That Summer In My Heart
Info: The Welsh Britpop band returns with its second album in 2001 and sixth U.S. release overall. The first single is "Stood On Gold."

Title: No More Shall We Part
Info: The first new album from Cave and his band since 1997's well-received 'The Boatman's Call.'

Title: Coexist
Info: The second release for the British indie pop band was inspired by club music.

Title: Glitter And Doom Live
Info: The singer-songwriter releases a live CD with tracks recorded from various cities on his 2008 tour. The second disc contains 35-minutes of stories and antidotes as told by Waits.

Title: Desire
Info: After eght years Pharoah Monch returns with his new album.

Title: Lotta Sea Lice
Info: The debut full-length collaboration between Courtney Barnett and Kurt Vile was recorded and mixed by Callum Barter.

Title: Hoodies All Summer
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from D Double E, Ghetts, Kojo Funds, Lil Silva, and Popcaan.

Title: Every Country's Sun
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Scottish post-rock band was produced by Dave Fridmann

Title: Standards
Info: The third full-length for the solo project of Chicago indie rock artist Evan Weiss was produced by John Vanderslice.

Title: Desperate Youth, Blood Thirsty Babes
Info: Brooklyn art-rockers TV On The Radio make their full-length debut with this release. The trio consists of vocalist/animator Tunde Adebimpe, multi-instrumentalist/producer David Andrew Sitek (who produced the Yeah Yeah Yeahs debut) and guitarist Kyp Malone.

Title: DSU
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock artist Alex Giannascoli. [This album was originally credited under the name Alex G]

Title: Pressure Machine
Info: The poems Brandon Flowers wrote about the small Utah town he grew up in were the basis for the Las Vegas rock band's seventh full-length studio release that also features a guest appearance from Phoebe Bridgers.

Title: Soul Music
Info: British electronic producer Paul Woolford's debut full-length release as Special Request includes a remix of Lana Del Rey's Ride.

Title: Child Ballads
Info: This debut release from Anaïs Mitchell and Jefferson Hamer was inspired by the Francis J. Child Collection of Ballads books and was produced by Gary Paczosa.

Title: I've Seen a Way
Info: The debut full-length release from Manchester, England-based band Mandy, Indiana features tracks recorded in caves, crypts and a shopping mall.

Title: The Plugs I Met 2
Info: The nine-track release from the New York hip-hop artist and producer Harry Fraud features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Chinx, Fat Joe, French Montana, Rick Hyde, and Jim Jones.

Title: Sorry You Couldn't Make It
Info: The latest full-length release for the R&B/soul singer includes country music influences and features guest appearances from Polica's Channy Leaneagh, Jenny Lewis, John Prine, and Justin Vernon.

Title: Big Exercise
Info: The second full-length release for the Dutch indie trio of Jaap van der Velde, Erik Woudwijk and Elias Elgersma was recorded in Amsterdam.

Title: No More Normal
Info: The latest release for the British dubstep/grime producer features guest appearances from Andrew Ashong, Etta Bond, Kiko Bun, D Double E, Daley, Nubya Garcia, Ghetts, Knucks Eva Lazarus, P Money, Kojey Radical, and Rider Shafique.

Title: Pedestrian Verse
Info: The fourth studio release from the Scottish indie band led by Scott Hutchinson is its first on the Atlantic label.

Title: The Allegory
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Oswin Benjamin, Beny The Butcher, Cyhi The Prynce, Conway the Machine, G Perico, Grafh, Kid Vishis, KXNG Crooked, Ashley Sorrell, Sy Ari Da Kid,  T.I., Westside Gunn, White Gold, and YBN Cordae.

Title: One of Us Is the Killer
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the New Jersey hardcore rock band was produced by Steve Evetts.

Title: Hellfire
Info: The third full-length release for British post-punk rock band Black Midi was produced by Marta Salogni.

Title: What We All Come To Need
Info: This is the fourth album for the metal band from Chicago.

Title: Backspacer
Info: The ninth studio album for the Seattle-based alt rock band was produced with Brendan O'Brien.

Title: Working With God
Info: This is the latest full-length release for the Melvins line-up that includes Buzz Osborne, Dale Crover, and Mike Dillard (also known as "Melvins 1983").

Title: The Caretaker
Info: The first release on the Anti- label for the Nandi Rose project was co-produced with David Tolomei.

Title: Come Over When You’re Sober, Pt. 2
Info: The posthumous release of the New York rapper's second full-length album was completed with the help of his mother, Liza Womack and producer Smokeasac.

Title: Sexwitch
Info: The debut release for the collaboration between Bat For Lashes' Natasha Khan and the British rock band Toy features six 1970 psych and folk cover songs from different countries.

Title: Take Me to the Land of Hell
Info: The latest release for the widow of John Lennon/Japanese avant garde artist was produced with Sean Lennon and Yuka Honda. The album includes guest appearances from Nels Cline, Lenny Kravitz, Questlove, and Andrew Wyatt.

Title: In Ghost Colours
Info: The Australian group's sophomore album hit number one on the Australian charts when released in their home country.

Title: Hip Hop Is Dead
Info: Dr. Dre, Kanye West and will.i.am are among the producers for the rapper's follow-up to 'Street's Disciple,' which marks his first release for Def Jam.

Title: Schmilco
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Chicago alt-rock band was recorded during the same sessions for 2015's Star Wars.

Title: Just Dropped In (To See What Condition My Rendition Was In)
Info: The posthumous release features covers of songs by such artists as Bad Medicine, Woody Gutherie, Janet Jackson, Gladys Knight, Bob Marley, The Marvelettes, Shuggie Otis, Prince, Kenny Rogers, Dusty Springfield, and Stevie Wonder.

Title: Tiny Changes: A Celebration of Frightened Rabbit's The Midnight Organ Fight
Info: Recorded in 2018 before Scott Hutchison's death in May 2018, Julien Baker, Biffy Clyro, Daughter, Aaron Dessner, Craig Finn, Fiskur, Benjamin Gibbard, Katie Harkin, Inletts, Manchester Orchestra, Lauren Mayberry, Oxford Collapse, The Philistines Jr., Piano Bar Fight, Right On Dynamite, Josh Ritter, Sarah Silverman, The Twilight Sad, and Wintersleep cover all the tracks from the Scottish band's 2008 album.

Title: I AKA I
Info: This is the second full-length solo release for the London-based Iranian electronic artist.

Title: The Family
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for hip hop collective BROCKHAMPTON was advertised as its final album before TM was announced as a surprise release the day before the release of The Family.

Title: Psychedelic Country Soul
Info: The first new full-length release in over 30 years for the Alt-country/Americana band was produced by Ed Stasium.

Title: Beast
Info: The fifth album for the metal band from Santa Barbara was produced by Mark Lewis.

Title: Last Summer
Info: The Fiery Furnaces member makes her solo debut of emotionally-moving experimental pop.

Title: Consummation
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the Brooklyn-based indie artist was produced with Adam Brisbin and Julian Fader.

Title: Walking Like We Do
Info: The second full-length release for the British pop quartet led by Juliette Jackson was produced by Ben H. Allen.

Title: So Much Fun
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from 21 Savage, J. Cole, Doe Boy, Future, Gunna, Juice WRLD, Lil Baby, Lil Duke, Lil Keed, Lil Uzi Vert, Machine Gun Kelly, NAV, Quavo, and Travis Scott.

Title: D
Info: The trio becomes a quartet with the addition of second guitarist Austin Jenkins on its latest album of indie rock.

Title: Distortion
Info: The latest album for the band led by singer/songwriter Stephin Merritt.

Title: The End Is Near
Info: This is the sophomore disc for the Texas five-piece featuring former Bedhead co-founders (and current brothers) Matt and Bubba Kadane. The album was recorded in Chicago with Steve Albini.

Title: Killing Joke [2003]
Info: The first album in seven years for the UK punk outfit founded in 1978 features newly reunited members Jaz Coleman, Youth and Paul Raven, with Dave Grohl filling in on drums.

Title: Mary Star of the Sea
Info: The new group led by Billy Corgan of The Smashing Pumpkins features a lineup including fellow Pumpkin Jimmy Chamberlin on drums and guitarists Matt Sweeney (Chavez, Skunk) and David Pajo (Slint, Tortoise).

Title: Nextdoorland
Info: The legendary (and quirky) English band fronted by Robyn Hitchcock follow their 2001 reunion tour with this, their first new studio recording in 22 years.

Title: Live at Convocation Hall
Info: Recorded live at a March 2002 show in Toronto, this 22-track, 2-disc set includes songs from Hayden's three previous albums, as well as three new tracks and a cover of Neil Young's "Tell Me Why."

Title: Optometry
Info: This latest installment in Thirsty Ear's Blue Series of progressive/experimental jazz recordings is the work of turntablist DJ Spooky (Tha' Subliminal Kid), whose own mixing, bass, and kalimba are joined by jazz notables such as Matthew Shipp, Guillermo Barreto Brown, William Parker, and Medeski, Martin & Wood's Billy Martin.

Title: Italian Platinum
Info: Steve Albini was behind the boards for the Chicago-by-way-of-Seattle band's third album for Touch & Go Records.

Title: Visions of Bodies Being Burned
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles experimental rap trio features guest appearances from Ted Byrnes, Cam, China, Michael Esposito, Ho99o9, Jeff Parker, SICKNESS, and Greg Stuart.

Title: Brothers and Sisters of the Eternal Son
Info: The Shins' Richard Swift returns to produce the sequel to Damien Jurado's 2012 album, Maraqopa.

Title: Restarter
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Miami metal band was mixed by Converge's Kurt Ballou.

Title: Late Developers
Info: The latest full-length release for Scottish indie pop band Belle and Sebastian features songs from the same recording sessions as 2022's A Bit of Previous.

Title: Ultra Vivid Lament
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the Welsh rock band features guest appearances from Julia Cumming and Mark Lanegan.

Title: Lost Wisdom pt. 2
Info: This is the second full-length collaboration between Phil Elverum and  Julie Doiron.

Title: Anoyo
Info: The six-track release for the electronic producer was recorded during the same session as 2018's Konoyo.

Title: Friends That Break Your Heart
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter features guest appearances from JID, Monica Martin, SwaVay, and SZA.

Title: Skelethon
Info: The sixth full-length studio solo release for the San Francisco-based rapper features guest appearances from the Moldy Peaches' Kimya Dawson, Allyson Baker of Dirty Ghosts, and Rob Sonic.
The second full-length studio release for the Black Hippy rapper features guest appearances from Black Hippy, Busta Rhymes, Kendrick Lamar, Isaiah Rashad, Sir, and Lance Skiiiwalker.

Title: Oddfellows
Info: The alternative rock supergroup comprised of Duane Denison, Mike Patton and John Stanier returns with its fourth release and a new member in Trevor Dunn, who takes over bass duties from Kevin Rutmanis.

Title: Diaper Island
Info: Chad VanGaalen returns from producing Women's 2010 album Public Strain to release his fourth full-length solo album.

Title: As Above, So Below
Info: The second full-length release for the Zambian-born, Australian-based  poet/rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Denzel Curry, Joey Bada$$, Angélique Kidjo, and Kojey Radical.

Title: Inji
Info: This is the debut full-length solo release for Late Of The Pier's Sam Dust.

Title: Shame
Info: The fourth full-length release for the New York industrial metal trio was mixed by Randall Dunn.

Title: Here Lies the Body
Info: The debut full-length collaboration between Aidan Moffat and RM Hubbert features a guest appearance from Siobhan Wilson.

Title: Teens of Style
Info: The major label debut full-length release for the music project of Will Toledo features new recordings of his older songs previously released on Bandcamp.

Title: Half Free
Info: The latest release for the Meg Remy project was produced by Onakabazien and features guest appearances from Ben Cook, Amanda Crist, and Remy's husband Slim Twig.

Title: Freeman
Info: This is the first solo release of new songs from Aaron Freeman since leaving Ween.

Title: Beautiful Rewind
Info: The second release for British producer Kieran Hebden in 2013 as Four Tet is his first full-length since 2010's There Is Love in You.

Title: Now We Can See
Info: The band's first album on the Kill Rock Stars label was produced by John Congleton.

Title: The Campfire Headphase
Info: Well, they certainly aren't the most prolific of artists, but the acclaimed Scottish electronica duo of Michael Sandison and Marcus Eoin finally return with a third album.

Title: Exploding Head
Info: The second album for the Brooklyn rock band is its first on Mute Records.

Title: Yesterday And Today
Info: The follow-up to Axel Willner's 2007 album, "From Here We Go Sublime" features Battles drummer John Stanier.

Title: Hokey Fright
Info: Kimya Dawson teams up with Aesop Rock to combine their music styles on their debut music project together as The Uncluded.

Title: What Makes Bob Holler
Info: The tribute album to Bob Willis by the country-jazz trio from Austin, Texas, was recorded over three days in London.

Title: Static Tensions
Info: The latest album for the metal band from Savannah, Georgia is its second featuring two drummers.

Title: Heba
Info: The debut full-length release for the Danish indie pop band was co-produced with Anders Boll.

Title: Love Letter for Fire
Info: The debut release for the collaboration between Sam Beam and  Jesca Hoop was produced by Tucker Martine.

Title: EarthEE
Info: The second full-length release from the alternative R&B duo features guest appearances from Taylor Brown, Meshell Ndegeocello, Porter Ray, and Shabazz Palaces.

Title: White Bread Black Beer
Info: Not-so-prolific Welsh singer-songwriter Green Gartside returns with his first Scritti Politti album in seven years.

Title: I Love the New Sky
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for the frontman of The Charlatans was produced with Grumbling Fur's Daniel O'Sullivan.

Title: Earl Grey
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie-pop trio of Poppy Hankin, Iris McConnell, and Sophie Moss was recorded over two weeks by the band's touring guitarist, Mike O'Malley.

Title: Tribute to Ndiouga Dieng
Info: The first new studio release for the Afro-Cuban band from Senegal in 10 years is a tribute to singer Ndiouga Dieng, who passed away in November 2016.
The debut solo release for the Race Horses singer is described as a collection of songs about what happened to him in 2013, including a trip to Rome.

Title: Dark Matter/Dark Energy
Info: This is the first full-length release of new songs from the British post-punk band since 1989.

Title: Universal Themes
Info: The seventh full-length release for the indie rock band features contributions from Steve Shelley and a majority of it was recorded in San Francisco.

Title: 1372 Overton Park
Info: The rock band from Tennessee releases their first album on the Universal Republic label.

Title: Hozier
Info: The debut full-length release for Irish singer-songwriter Andrew Hozier-Byrne features a guest appearance from Karen Cowley.

Title: Nostalchic
Info: This is the debut full-length release for British electronic producer Stuart Howard.

Title: Grim Town
Info: The second full-length release for the Northern Ireland singer-songwriter was recorded with Ant Whiting.

Title: Wanderer
Info: The first new release from the indie rock artist in six years was self-produced, mixed by Rob Schnapf and features a guest appearance from Lana Del Rey.

Title: S/T II: The Cosmic Birth and Journey of Shinju TNT
Info: The experimental trio's fifth album was produced by Chris Koltay and features former band member Ryan Vanderhoof as a guest vocalist.

Title: The Way I See It
