Info: The fourth album for the R&B singer features artists such as Joss Stone, Stevie Wonder, and Jay-Z.

Title: Emanon
Info: The three-disc release from the saxophonist includes a six-track live set recorded in 2016 and a graphic novel.

Title: Songs to Play
Info: The first album in seven years for the Go-Betweens co-founder features contributions from the John Steel Singers and his wife, Karin Baumler.

Title: Colorado
Info: The 39th studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter with his Crazy Horse band is his first with Nils Lofgren since 1971 and was produced with John Hanlon.

Title: Satis Factory
Info: The second full-length release for the Atlanta-based singer-songwriter was co-produced by Randy Michael and Jonah Swilley.

Title: I Need a New War
Info: The third and final part of the The Hold Steady frontman's solo trilogy of albums that began with 2015's Faith In The Future was produced by Josh Kaufman.

Title: What It Is
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Nashville-based Texas-born singer-songwriter was co-produced by Brad Jones and Allison Moorer (who also co-wrote several songs).

Title: Live in London
Info: The live recording from the soul singer's two-night performance at London's Union Chapel was self-produced.

Title: You Tell Me
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the collaboration between Field Music's Peter Brewis and Admiral Fallow's Sarah Hayes.

Title: Last Building Burning
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Cleveland indie rock band was recorded over eight days with producer Randall Dunn.

Title: Songs of the Plains
Info: The second full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.

Title: DNA Feelings
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Swiss-born Nepalise-Tibetan electronic artist.

Title: Twerp Verse
Info: The third full-length release for the Massachusetts indie rock band led by Sadie Dupuis was mixed by Mike Mogis.

Title: Neuk Wight Delhi All-Stars
Info: The second full-length collaboration from James Yorkston, Suhail Yusuf Khan and Jon Thorne was self-produced.

Title: Feel Infinite
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Canadian electronic producer features a guest appearance from How To Dress Well.

Title: Unfold
Info: The 19th full-length release for the Australian experimental jazz trio was self-produced.

Title: Garden of Ashes
Info: The sixth full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Strat Barrett.

Title: Good Luck and Do Your Best
Info: The third full-length release for the British electronic producer was influenced by his visits to Japan.

Title: Age of Transparency
Info: The third full-length release for Arthur Ashin as Autre Ne Veut is the second part of a planned trilogy of albums.

Title: Abandoned
Info: The fifth full-length for the Boston-based hardcore band led by Derek Archamault continues its conceptual albums about a New Jersey blue-collar family with a focus on a Catholic priest who is having a crisis of faith due to his time in World War II.

Title: Heartbreak Pass
Info: The latest release from the alt-country rock band led by Howe Gelb was inspired by the Arizona desert and features contributions from Ilse DeLange, Grant-Lee Phillips, and Steve Shelly.

Title: American Interior
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the former Super Furry Animal was inspired by his 18th century ancestor, explorer John Evans, who mapped the Missouri River.

Title: Ultimate Painting
Info: Jack Cooper of Mazes and James Hoare of Veronica Falls each wrote five songs on their debut full-length release together.

Title: Hero Brother
Info: The debut solo release for the violinist best known for her work with Arcade Fire and Bell Orchestre was produced with Nils Frahm.

Title: Disarm the Descent
Info: The sixth studio release for the Massachusetts metalcore band sees the return of original lead singer Jesse Leach, who had left in 2002.

Title: The  House at Sea
Info: The second release from the collaboration between Alasdair MacLean of the Clientele and Lupe Núñez-Fernández of Pipas was produced by Brian O'Shaughnessy.

Title: In Focus?
Info: The fifth release for the Japanese experimental pop artist was recorded by Tokumaru and mastered at Abbey Road Studios.

Title: No Beginning No End
Info: The R&B/jazz singer-songwriter's fourth full-length was co-produced with Pino Palladino and Brian Bender.

Title: Mars
Info: The second solo release for Ahmed Gallab as Sinkane includes influences from Afro-pop, funk, jazz, krautrock, and soul music.

Title: Generals
Info: Produced by Richard Swift, the second release for the music project led by Laura Burhenn is said to be both a concept and protest album.

Title: The Marble Downs
Info: The British folk band Trembling Bells collaborates with Kentuckian Bonnie "Prince" Billy.

Title: Be Strong
Info: Originally proposed as a three-piece with Metronomy's Joe Mount, Hot Chip's Joe Goddard and Raf Daddy went ahead with the idea without Mount to become The 2 Bears. After three EPs, the duo releases its debut full-length of original songs.

Title: What Day Is It Tonight? (Trans Am Live 1993-2008)
Info: The three-disc set contains live recordings that span the 15-year career of the rock trio.

Title: BiRd-BrAiNs
Info: This is the debut album for the Canadian singer-songwriter Merrill Garbus.

Title: Little Hells
Info: The fourth album for the Boston-based singer-songwriter was produced by Chris Coady.

Title: Man-Made
Info: The first studio album in five years for the Scottish rockers was produced by Tortoise's John McEntire.

Title: Elk-Lake Serenade
Info: A bit more upbeat-sounding than its predecessors, 'Elk-Lake Serenade' is the fourth studio disc for Toronto singer-songwriter Hayden Desser (who draws frequent Neil Young comparisons, and not just for being Canadian).

Title: Youth & Young Manhood
Info: This is the debut full-length for the Nashville-based rock band consisting of three brothers (the sons of a preacher) and their cousin.

Title: Whoa, Nelly!
Info: The debut album from Canadian/Portugese singer-songwriter Nelly Furtado is an ecelctic mix of musical styles.

Title: So...How's Your Girl?
Info: Producers Prince Paul and Dan "The Automator" Nakamura assembled a varied cast of collaborators, including Miho Hatori (Cibo Matto), Del Tha Funkee Homosapien, DJ Shadow, Sean Lennon, Josh Hayden (Spain), De La Soul, and, of all people, Father Guido Sarducci. The band's name comes from an episode of the Chris Elliott sitcom "Get A Life."

Title: Nothing Was the Same
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Canadian artist features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Jay-Z, and Majid Jordan.

Title: No, You C'Mon
Info: Recorded at the same time and released on the same day, 'Aw, C'Mon' and 'No, You C'Mon' are actually intended as separate albums, rather than two parts of a double album. The Nashville String Machine lends strings to each.

Title: Miss Anthropocene
Info: Climate change is theme for the fifth full-length release from the Canadian artist.

Title: Tip Of The Sphere
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced with Dan Horne.

Title: The Audience's Listening
Info: This is the solo debut for the veteran turntablist / DJ / producer, formerly of Jurassic 5.

Title: Power Up
Info: The 17th full-length studio release for the Australian hard rock band was produced by Brendan O'Brien.

Title: Get Color
Info: This is the second album for the Los Angeles-based indie band.

Title: Stainless Style
Info: Boom Bip and Super Furry Animals' Gruff Rhys come together to release a concept album about the life of John DeLorean.

Title: Drum's Not Dead
Info: The third album for the now Berlin-based experimental trio includes a DVD with (count 'em!) three videos for each of the dozen songs on the CD.

Title: Oh You're So Silent Jens
Info: This CD collects tracks from the Swedish artist's most recent EPs and singles.

Title: Show Your Bones
Info: The New York trio's short but highly anticipated sophomore set--which features a mellower, more polished sound--was produced by Squeak E Clean and mixed by Alan Moulder.

Title: Music for Psychedelic Therapy
Info: The latest full-length release for British electronic producer Jon Hopkins was inspired by the Tayos Caves of Ecuador.

Title: Closer to Grey
Info: The first releases in seven years from the Los Angles electropop trio is not the previously announced (and still unreleased) Dear Tommy, but a surprise release of 12 new songs.

Title: No Burden
Info: The debut full-length release for the Virginia singer-songwriter was recorded in one day.

Title: Downtown Church
Info: The latest album from the folk singer features gospel songs recorded in a church.

Title: This Old Dog
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was written after he moved from New York to Los Angeles.

Title: May Your Kindness Remain
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Arizona-born singer-songwriter was produced by Mark Howard.

Title: Beings
Info: The third full-length release for the British indie rock quartet was produced by band member Paul Gregory.

Title: Velociraptor!
Info: The British rock band releases their fourth album, featuring production by Dan the Automator.

Title: National Ransom
Info: Costello's second album with producer T-Bone Burnett is both reminiscent of his earlier work and experimental in sound, with a foray into finger-picking country and eclectic folk-rock tunes.

Title: Prisoner
Info: The 16th full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was influenced by his divorce from singer Mandy Moore.

Title: Pale Bloom
Info: The latest release for the Los Angeles-based composer features a three-part piano-based suite.

Title: Real High
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles electronic artist was recorded over a period of four years with Cole M.G.N. and features contributions from such artists as Dâm-Funk, Droop-E, and Julia Holter.

Title: Here
Info: The Scottish alternative band returns after six years for its 10th full-length studio release recorded in France, Scotland and mixed in Germany.

Title: Big GRRRL Small World
Info: The second full-length release for the Minnesota-based rapper artist was produced by BJ Burton and features contributions from Bionik, Doomtree's Lazerbeak, Alex Nutter, N.A.S.A.'s Sam Spiegel, and Bon Iver's Justin Vernon.

Title: First Two Pages of Frankenstein
Info: The ninth full-length studio release from indie rock quintet The National features guest appearances by Phoebe Bridgers, Sufjan Stevens, and Taylor Swift.

Title: Lifted
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Texas-based singer-songwriter was co-produced with Ted Young.

Title: All the Way
Info: One of two releases [the other is a live album] in March 2017 for the avant-garde singer, the studio album features jazz and traditional standards.

Title: Personal Record
Info: The second solo release for the indie pop singer, who is one half of The Fiery Furnaces with her brother Matthew, was co-written with songwriter Wesley Stace (a.k.a. John Wesley Harding) and produced by Eric Broucek.

Title: The Satanic Satanist
Info: The rock quartet from Alaska, now based in Portland, Oregon, releases its fourth album.

Title: Deep States
Info: This is the third full-length release for the Australian avant-punk band led by Gareth Liddiard.

Title: The Alternative To Love
Info: Long championed by the White Stripes' Jack White, fellow Detroit singer-songwriter Brendan Benson follows his 2002 disc 'Lapalco' with this set co-produced by Tchad Blake.

Title: Twisted Crystal
Info: The sixth full-length release for the New York-based band led by  Kassie Carlson includes influences from 70s krautrock and experimental rock.

Title: Melody's Echo Chamber
Info: The debut full-length release for the dream pop project of Paris-based singer Melody Prochet was produced by Kevin Parker of Tame Impala.

Title: Fuck Death
Info: Carey Mercer recorded his second album under the name Blackout Beach by himself.

Title: Lungs
Info: The debut album for the band led by Florence Welch was produced by Paul Epworth, James Ford and Steve Mackay.

Title: Drift Code
Info: The follow-up solo release to ex-Talk Talk bassist Paul Webb's 2002 collaboration with Portishead's Beth Gibbons was home-recorded with Lee Harris on drums.

Title: La  Grande
Info: The latest album for the singer-songwriter was inspired in part by the town of La Grande, Oregon.

Title: Wild Hunt
Info: After his well-received debut album released by Swedish label Gravitation, Kristian Matsson returns with his follow-up on the US-based label Dead Oceans.

Title: Shook
Info: The fourth full-length release for Atlanta-based post-punk band Algiers features guest appearances from Backxwash, Lee Bains, Big Rube, DeForrest Brown Jr., Mark Cisneros, Zack De La Rocha, Nadah El Shazly, Samuel T. Herring, LaToya Kent, Jae Matthews, Patrick Shiroishi, and billy woods.

Title: This Is Not A Test!
Info: Missy Elliott reunites with producer Timbaland for her fifth album, which features vocal contributions from Nelly, Jay-Z, Mary J. Blige, Fabolous and R. Kelly.

Title: Logic Will Break Your Heart
Info: The Montreal, Canada-based quartet (basically, 2003's version of Interpol) follows its acclaimed, 80s-influenced EP "Rememberese" with this debut full-length. "Still In Love Song" is the only song from that EP to reappear here.

Title: Good Mourning
Info: The Chicago-based emo band returns with their fourth full-length.

Title: About A Boy [Soundtrack]
Info: Instead of a real follow-up to "The Hour of Bewliderbeast" (look for that later in 2002), Damon Gough returns with the score to the film adaptation of the Nick Hornby novel. The 16 new tracks here are split between short instrumental pieces and full songs.

Damon Albarn's breakup album (he split with his longtime girlfriend, Elastica's Justine Frischmann, prior to recording) was produced by William Orbit and features the singles "Tender" and "Coffee & TV" (although it failed to produce an American hit along the likes of the previous album's "Song 2").

Title: Constant Image
Info: The debut full-length release for the Washington, DC post-punk band was produced by Nicolas Vernhes.

Title: Thankful N' Thoughtful
Info: Craig Street produced the latest release from the R&B singer featuring songs originally made by The Black Keys, Bob Dylan, Gnarls Barkley, The Pogues, Sly & the Family Stone, Tom Waits, and Neil Young.

Title: The Trials Of Van Occupanther
Info: This sophomore set finds the Texas five-piece utilizing a 1970's classic rock / soft rock sound.

Title: The Turning Wheel
Info: The third full-length release for Chrystia Cabral as Spellling was self-produced.

Title: Bicep
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the London-based duo from Belfast, Matt McBriar and Andy Ferguson.

Title: Rivers and Streams
Info: The latest release from the Ukrainian pianist was inspired by a variety of waterways including The Amazon.

Title: Tribal
Info: Dr. John revives the Night Tripper persona for his new album Tribal, which features guest spots from Derek Trucks, Donald Harrison, and tunes by Bobby Charles and Allen Toussaint.

Title: Subiza
Info: The quartet from Spain releases its third album.

Title: The Future
Info: The third full-length release for Nathaniel Rateliff and his band was produced by Brad Cook and R.M.B.(Rateliff, Patrick Meese, and James Barone).

Title: XOXO
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the Minnesota alt-country band was recorded over two weeks.

Title: Book of Bad Decisions
Info: The 12th full-length release for the Maryland rock band was produced by Vance Powell.

Title: Republique Amazone
Info: The debut full-length release for the all-female supergroup of African artists that includes Pamela Badjogo, Massan Coulibaly, Mariam Doumbia, Mamani Keita, Angelique Kidjo, Mariam Kone, Rokia Kone, Kandia Kouyaté, Nneka, and Mouneissa Tandina was produced by Liam Farrell.

Title: Preternaturals
Info: The third full-length release for experimental pop duo of Daniel O’Sullivan and Alexander Tucker

Title: Agnostic Hymns & Stoner Fables
Info: The latest album from the Nashville-based singer-songwriter was produced with Eric McConnell.

Title: Teflon Don
Info: Losing none of the momentum put in motion by his 2009 effort, Deeper Than Rap, Rick Ross keeps a very good thing going on Teflon Don, arguably his best album to date. You want rap-style luxury? Then Deeper is the better fit, but Teflon plays up the chilled and soulful elements of its predecessor, meaning Ross has graduated to a level where words like â€œorganicâ€ and â€œpoignantâ€ come into play. The former is best represented by â€œMayback Music IIIâ€ and itâ€™s swirling, â€˜70s-flavored dreamscape created by the J.U.S.T.I.C.E. League production team. Ross allows guests T.I. and Jadakiss to go first on the cut, then grabs his cigar for an uplifting story of ghetto triumph that goes from pushing to pleasing the folks (â€œParents never had a good job/Now itâ€™s black American Express cards"). When it comes to â€œpoignant,â€ the evidence is dotted throughout the album with the rapper reflecting on where heâ€™s been, and he often questions his own lust for fame. He chants the title to the opening â€œIâ€™m Not a Starâ€ as if it was a remindful mantra, but itâ€™s his new love of contrasts thatâ€™s really interesting, following Kanyeâ€™s swaggering on â€œLive Fast, Die Youngâ€ with â€œSeems to me we gettinâ€™ money for the wrong things/Look around, Maseratis for the whole team/Look at Haiti, children dyinâ€™ round the clock/Iâ€™d send a hundred grand but thatâ€™s a decent watchâ€. The familiar party and thugging tunes work too with â€œB.M.F. (Blowin' Money Fast),â€ â€œNo. 1,â€ and the mixtape favorite â€œMC Hammerâ€ -- now with added Gucci Mane verse -- all coming correct. Add all the Illuminati references in the Jay-Z team-up (â€œFree Masonâ€), a decent smoking song (â€œSuper Highâ€), and a track where Cee-Loâ€™s performance just might make you misty (â€œTears of Joyâ€), and itâ€™s obvious Rossâ€™ albums are no longer just vessels for his singles. ~ David Jeffries

Title: Heroes & Thieves
Info: Vanessa Carlton's third album is her first on The Inc. label.

Title: Alive And Wired
Info: This 31-song live set was recorded during a pair of 2005 shows in the band's native Texas.

Title: Fijacion Oral Vol. 1
Info: The first of two planned 2005 releases for the Colombian pop star is this Spanish-language disc, with its English counterpart due in the fall.

Title: Act IV: Rebirth in Reprise
Info: The fourth release of a planned six-part conceptual series for the progressive rock band led by Casey Crescenzo.

Title: Signs Under Test
Info: This is the tenth full-length release for the California-based techno DJ/producer.

Title: Cold World
Info: The second retro soul release on Daptone Recordings for the gospel/R&B singer was recorded live on eight-track tape.

Title: A Church That Fits Our Needs
Info: The death of lead singer Ari Picker's mother in 2009 was the catalyst for the second full-length release from the North Carolina chamber folk group.

Title: The Holy Pictures
Info: The latest album for the Irish musician who also contributed to a variety of film soundtracks, including "Ocean's Eleven" and its sequels.

Title: This Week
Info: The underground New York MC returns with her sophomore LP, with some production assistance from 9th Wonder.

Title: Blackout! 2
Info: After some delays, the sequel to the release of the first collaboration together, Blackout!, is finally released.

Title: Broken Hearts and Beauty Sleep
Info: The nine-track mini-album from the Southern California rapper features guest appearances from Big Freedia, Blood Orange, Jay Cue, Kari Faux, God Colony, Bruno Ribeiro, and Jamila Woods.

Title: Book of Curses
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the punk band that includes Huggy Bear's Chris Rowley, Male Bonding's John Arthur Webb and Kevin Hendrick, and Sonny Barrett.

Title: The Black Parade
Info: This highly-anticipated and highly-theatrical concept album follow's the New Jersey band's 2004 breakthrough hit 'Three Cheers For Sweet Revenge.'

Title: Government Commissions: BBC Sessions 1996-2003
Info: This disc compiles tracks from all five sessions the band recorded for the BBC's John Peel and Steve Lemacq shows.

Title: The Stand-In
Info: The second release for the Nashville singer-songwriter was produced by Jordan Lehning and Skylar Wilson.

Title: Supernature
Info: This is the third album for the British electronica duo of Alison Goldfrapp and Will Gregory.

Title: Dedicated
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Canadian pop artist features a guest appearance from Electric Guest.

Title: Compassion
Info: This is the second full-length release for the electronic project of Matthew Barnes.

Title: Knockin' Boots
Info: The debut full-length release for the British house music producer features guest appearances from Bixby, Sam Dew, Heavy D. & the Boyz, J'Danna, Julie Mendoza, and Okmalumkoolkat.

Title: The Secret Sisters
Info: Laura and Lydia Rogers were signed onto Jack White's label after an audition in October 2009. The debut album was executive produced by T. Bone Burnett and features both covers and original songs.

Title: Album of the Year
Info: The Detroit producer introduces some funk and rock music with a backing band on his fourth full-length solo album.

Title: Endless Summer Vacation
Info: The eighth full-length studio release from Miley Cyrus features guest appearances from Brandi Carlile and Sia as well as production with Kid Harpoon, Greg Kurstin, Mike WiLL Made-It, and Tyler Johnson.

Title: Drill Music in Zion
Info: The latest full-length studio release for rapper Lupe Fiasco features guest appearances from Ayesha Jaco and Nayirah.

Title: Spiral
Info: The second full-length studio release for the collaboration between Nicolás Jaar and Dave Harrington features six track written in 2018.

Title: Arcology
Info: This the second full-length release for the Denver-based electronic producer Ryan McRyhew.

Title: Dedication
Info: This is the British dubstep producer's second full-length album and his first on the 4AD label.

Title: Infinite House
Info: This is the third full-length release for the Brooklyn-based quintet was self-recorded.

Title: Alternate/Endings
Info: The debut full-length release for the New York City producer from Sacramento includes contributions from Juan Alderete from Mars Volta and Black Atlass.

Title: Shapeshifting
Info: The Canadian trio's third album sees its music changing to a more electronic feel under new producer Dan Lissvik.

Title: The Dream
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock trio Alt-J was produced by Charlie Andrew.

Title: Lindsey Buckingham
Info: The first full-length solo studio release in 10 years for the Fleetwood Mac guitarist was self-recorded, produced and mixed in his Los Angeles home studio.

Title: Showtunes
Info: The latest full-length release for the alternative band led by Kurt Wagner was produced and mixed with Jeremy Ferguson.

Title: Super Monster
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Brooklyn-based indie-pop artist features guest appearances Melanie Faye, Nick Hakim and Shelly.

Title: Graveyard Whistling
Info: the 11th full-length release for the alt-country band was produced by Vance Powell.

Title: Tied to the Moon
Info: The second full-length release for the Scottish singer-songwriter was written while she was staying in Nova Scotia.

Title: Uzu
Info: The second full-length release for the Canadian experimental/art rock five-piece was produced by the band's drummer, Alaska B.

Title: Let It All In
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the British indie rock band was co-produced by Guy Garvey and Craig Potter of Elbow.

Title: Darker Handcraft
Info: The third full-length album for the hardcore punk band was produced by Kurt Ballou.

Title: Limbo, Panto
Info: The debut album for the indie rock quartet from Leeds.

Title: WHO
Info: The first full-length release of new material from the British rock band in 13 years  was co-produced by Pete Townshend & D. Sardy with vocal production by Dave Eringa.

Title: Masterpiece
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Brooklyn folk-influenced rock band led by Adrianne Lenker.

Title: Good Times!
Info: Micky Dolenz, Michael Nesmith, and Peter Tork celebrate the 50th anniversary of the pop band with its first new release in 20 years that features songs written by such artists as Rivers Cuomo, 	Neil Diamond, Noel Gallagher, Andy Partridge, and producer Adam Schlesinger.

Title: Traveling Alone
Info: Produced by Tucker Martine, the fifth studio album for the New York-based singer-songwriter features Jay Brown, John Convertino, Eric Heywood, and Marc Ribot as guest musicians.

Title: Soldier Of Love
Info: After a 10-year hiatus, Sade returns with her sixth studio effort and first since 2000's "Lover's Rock."

Title: Beat the Champ
Info: The 15th studio release for John Darnielle is a professional wrestling-themed concept album.

Title: Rausch
Info: This is the sixth full-length release for Wolfgang Voigt under the GAS moniker.

Title: Crash
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for British pop artist Charli XCX features guest appearances from Christine and the Queens, Caroline Polachek, and Rina Sawayama.

Title: Somewhere
Info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian indie rock duo of Courtney Garvin and Connor Mayer was recorded and mixed by Joo-Joo Ashworth.

Title: The Healing Component
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Chicago-based rapper features guest appearances from Michael Anthony, BADBADNOTGOOD, J-Stock, Ravyn Lenae, Noname, Xavier Omär, and theMIND.

Title: DFA Remixes: Chapter 2
Info: The duo's second remix compilation this year includes their take on tracks by Junior Senior, N.E.R.D., Nine Inch Nails, Goldfrapp and more.

Title: Orc
Info: The John Dwyer-led band shortens its name from Thee Oh Sees to just Oh Sees for its 19th full-length studio release.

Title: Starry Mind
Info: The first album in four years for the New York band led by Pat Gubler adds more rock elements to its acoustic folk style.

Title: How To Dismantle An Atomic Bomb
Info: The band's first new album since 2000, a more stripped-down, "classic U2" disc than previous efforts, was recorded chiefly with producer Steve Lillywhite, with Chris Thomas and Nellee Hooper also helming some tracks.

Title: Investigate Witch Cults Of The Radio Age
Info: Broadcast joins up with The Focus Group to release a 23-track mini album together.

Title: Woman
Info: The debut release by the pop duo of Robin Hannibal and Mike Milosh was recorded in Copenhagen and Los Angeles.

Title: Remedy
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Americana string band was produced by Ted Hutt and includes a song co-written by Bob Dylan.

Title: B Flat A
Info: This is the sixth full-length release for the Polish rock band Trupa Trupa.

Title: The Velvet Trail
Info: The Soft Cell artist worked with producer Chris Braide on his first full-length solo release since 2010's Variete.

Title: No Blues
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Welsh indie pop band was produced by John Goodmanson.

Title: Splinter: Songs From a Broken Mind
Info: The 20th studio release for the British electronic artist features guitarist Robin Finck and was produced with Ade Fenton.

Title: Days Are Gone
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angles indie pop trio of sisters was produced by Ariel Rechtshaid and James Ford.

Title: Paradise
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian punk rock band was produced by Lars Stalfors.

Title: Tricolore
Info: The debut release for the British instrumental trio of Gemma Barkerwood, Sophie Barkerwood, and Louise Croft features an appearance from A Little Orchestra.

Title: This Is What I Mean
Info: The third full-length studio release for British grime artist Stormzy features contributions from such artists as Amaarae, India.Arie, Black Sherif, Jacob Collier, Debbie, Ms Banks, Nao, and Sampha.

Title: Flood
Info: The second full-length release for Australian singer-songwriter Stella Donnelly was co-produced with Anna Laverty and Methyl Ethyl's Jake Webb.

Title: Cry Sugar
Info: The first full-length studio release in six years for Scottish electronic producer Hudson Mohawke.

Title: Radiate Like This
Info: The first full-length release in nearly six years for Los Angeles indie rock band Warpaint was produced with Sam Petts-Davies.

Title: Endless Arcade
Info: The latest full-length release for the Scottish rock band is its first with Euro Childs of Gorky’s Zygotic Mynci and the first without co-founder Gerard Love who left in 2018.

Title: Pure Luxury
Info: The third full-length release for the project of Michael Lovett features guest appearances from Amber Strother of King and VIAA.

Title: Frkwys, Vol. 13: Sunergy
Info: The latest release in RVNG Intl.'s FRKWYS series features the collaboration between Kaitlyn Aurelia Smith and Suzanne Ciani.

Title: Sermon on the Rocks
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was recorded in two weeks and was produced with Trina Shoemaker.

Title: Truelove's Gutter
Info: The ex-Pulp guitarist releases his sixth solo album, which was recorded in Sheffield, England.

Title: Okovi
Info: The fifth full-length release for Nika Roza Danilova was written in her Wisconsin hometown where she retreated after dealing with depression and dark times experienced by her close friends.

Title: The Hungry Saw
Info: The seventh album for the English trio is its first in more than five years.

Title: Dancing Queen
Info: The ABBA covers album from the pop singer/actress was produced by Mark Taylor.

Title: E3 AF
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the British rapper features guest appearances from Chip, D Double E, Frisco, Ghetts, Alicaì Harley, Kano, P Money, Ocean Wisdom, Rob Jones TV, Smoke Boys, and Steel Banglez.

Title: There Is No Love in Fluorescent Light
Info: The eighth full-length release for the Canadian indie pop band was produced by Peter Katis.

Title: Just Be Free
Info: The fourth studio and first major label release for the New Orleans rapper who popularized bounce music, a subgenre that mixes house and hip-hop music with chants, was produced by Thomas McElroy.

Title: Living with Yourself
Info: The Emeralds singer and guitarist releases his debut solo album on the Edition Mego label.

Title: Crows
Info: Since 2009's covers collection "Mockingbird," Allison Moorer felt it was time to do something entirely different for her next record. The country-folk singer-songwriter releases her first collection of original material in four years. It features guitarist Joe McMahan, a former member of Moorer's road band for Miss Fortune; and bassist Brad Jones, who contributed to Getting Somewhere.

Title: In Defense Of The Genre
Info: The two-disc album contains more than two dozen guests, including Gerard Way of My Chemical Romance, Chris Carrabba of Dashboard Confessional, and Chad Gilbert of New Found Glory.

Title: Xen
Info: This is the second full-length release for producer Alejandro Ghersi, who is known for his work on Kanye West’s Yeezus and FKA twigs albums.

Title: The Mind of Traxman
Info: The latest release from Chicago DJ/producer Cornelius Ferguson includes not only footwork, but influences from soul, funk, jazz, and hip-hop.

Title: I Will Be
Info: The debut album for Dee Dee (aka Kristen Gundred) was recorded with the help of producer Richard Gottehrer.

Title: C U L T U R E
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Atlanta rap trio features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, DJ Khaled, Gucci Mane, and Travis Scott.

Title: And I Have Been
Info: The third full-length release for British singer-songwriter Benjamin Clementine was self-produced.

Title: Crooked Tree
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for Molly Tuttle features her band the Golden Highway and contributions from Sierra Hall, Old Crow Medicine Show, Margo Price, Billy Strings, Dan Tyminski, and Gillian Welch.

Title: Covers
Info: The latest full-length covers album from Cat Power features songs from such artists as Jackson Brown, Nick Cave, Lana Del Rey, Billie Holiday, Iggy Pop, Frank Ocean, The Replacements, and Kitty Wells.

Title: Novelist Guy
Info: The debut full-length release for the grime artist was self-produced.

Title: Until Silence
Info: The third full-length release for the Swedish electronic duo features a 26-piece orchestra.

Title: Open
Info: The 17th release for the Australian improvised jazz trio is an over hour piece.

Title: Double Cup
Info: The debut full-length release on the Hyperdub label for the footwork producer features appearances from DJ Earl, DJ Phil, DJ Spinn, Addison Groove, Manny, and Taso.

Title: Dancing
Info: The British folk singer-songwriter created the songs for her third release with a computer.

Title: Absolute Dissent
Info: The 14th studio album from the UK masters of doom-and-gloom metal is their first album in 28 years featuring the band's original lineup.

Title: Wheeltappers and Shunters
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the British post-punk experimental band is "a satirical take on British culture" and its first studio album in seven years.

Title: Forever Sounds
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Cincinnati indie rock band was produced by Jerri Queen and John Hoffman.

Title: Vs. Children
Info: This is the second release in 2009 for Owen Ashworth following last month's release of his compilation album, Advance Base Battery Life.

Title: One Life Stand
Info: The fourth album for the British electropop rock band aims for a more pop feel.

Title: No Treasure But Hope
Info: The 12th full-length release for the British alternative band led by Stuart Staples was recorded in six days.

Title: Lord Steppington
Info: The debut rap collaboration from Evidence and Alchemist features guest appearances from such artists as Action Bronson, Fashawn, Domo Genesis, Roc Marciano, Oh No, and Styles P.

Title: The Historical Conquests of Josh Ritter
Info: It's the fifth album for the Idaho-born singer-songwriter.

Title: Your Blues
Info: This is the sixth album for the Vancouver, Canada indie rock outfit led by Dan Bejar (also of the New Pornographers).

Title: Lovers
Info: The Australian rockers, who have attracted attention in their homeland and in Europe with their early EPs, make their full-length debut with this LP.

Title: lemonjelly.ky
Info: This CD collects the first three 10-inch EPs from the British electronica duo, whose Fred Deakin also designs the band's album covers.

Title: Wincing The Night Away
Info: The increasingly-popular indie-pop outfit led by James Mercer returns with a third album.

Title: Sukierae
Info: The debut release for the side project from Wilco's Jeff Tweedy and his son Spencer features contributions from Scott McCaughey of the Baseball Project, Jess Wolfe and Holly Laessig of Lucius.

Title: Glass Boys
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian punk band was produced by Bill Skibbe.

Title: The List
Info: The daughter of Johnny Cash releases a country covers album. Elvis Costello, Bruce Springsteen, Jeff Tweedy, and Rufus Wainwright appear as guest singers.

Title: Never Going Back
Info: The fifth album for the daughter of blues guitarist/singer Johnny Copeland was produced by Oliver Wood.

Title: @#%&*! Smilers
Info: The latest album from the singer-songwriter includes Sean Haynes as a guest on one track.

Title: Red Gone Wild: Thee Album
Info: The rapper's delayed follow-up to 2001's 'Malpractice' was produced by Timbaland, Eminem, Erick Sermon, Scott Storch, and Rockwilder. Method Man and Nate Dogg also guest.

Title: Gloss Drop
Info: The second full-length album for the New York rock band features Matias Aguayo, Gary Numan, Kazu Makino, and Yamantaka Eye as guest musicians.

Title: Hella Personal Film Festival
Info: The collaboration between rapper Open Mike Eagle and producer Paul White features guest appearances from Aesop Rock and Future Islands' Hemlock Ernst.

Title: I Grow Tired But Dare Not Fall Asleep
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British artist features guest appearances from Art School Girlfriend, Katie Dove Dixon, Skinny Girl Diet's Delilah Holiday, and SaraSara.

Title: Until the Hunter
Info: The third full-length studio release for the duo that includes the Mazzy Star singer and My Bloody Valentine's Colm Ó Cíosóig features a guest appearance from Kurt Vile.

Title: Sirens
Info: The second full-length solo release for the electronic producer is his first in five years.

Title: Captain of None
Info: The sixth full-length release for the French artist was self-recorded and produced in Spain.

Title: Level Live Wires
Info: San Francisco Bay Area DJ/producer David P. Madson's latest album.

Title: Years Of Refusal
Info: The latest solo album for the singer was produced by the late Jerry Finn.

Title: Preoccupations
Info: The Canadian post-punk previously known as known as Viet Cong return with a new name and a new album produced by Graham Walsh.

Title: Commontime
Info: This is the fifth full-length studio release from the indie brother duo of Peter and David Brewis.

Title: Tales From Turnpike House
Info: Sarah Cracknell & co.'s latest is a concept album about the residents of a London high rise.

Title: Where The Humans Eat
Info: The Martha's Vineyard native recorded this debut LP of intelligent, folky rock when he was 19.

Title: Things Take Time, Take Time
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Australian alternative singer-songwriter was produced with Stella Mozgawa.

Title: Kelly Lee Owens
Info: The debut full-length release for the London-based Welsh electronic producer features a guest appearance from Jenny Hval.

Title: A Foul Form
Info: The latest full-length release for the Osees was recorded in frontman John Dwyer's basement and was inspired by the punk music they grew up with.

Title: I Used to Spend So Much Time Alone
Info: The third full-length release for the Seattle indie rock band led by Julia Shapiro was recorded in Portland, Oregon with producer Matthew Simms.

Title: In The Future
Info: The Canadian indie rock band releases its sophomore album.

Title: Here Be Monsters
Info: This is the first release in four years for the Mekons/Waco Brothers member and his band that includes Joe Camarillo, Jean Cook, Alan Doughty, Jim Elkington, and Tawny Newsome.

Title: Pilot Talk II
Info: The New Orleans rapper returns with his second album in 2010 which features guest appearances by Snoop Dogg, Mos Def, Devin the Dude, Jay Electronica, Mikey Rocks, Big K.R.I.T., Smoke DZA, Trademark Da Skydiver, and Young Roddy.

Title: The Marriage of True Minds
Info: The first release in five years for the Baltimore-based experimental electronic duo includes guest appearances from Dan Deacon, Angel Deradoorian, Dominique Leone, and Wye Oak's Jenn Wasner.

Title: A Dream Outside
Info: The debut full-length release for the British alternative rock band led by Felix Bushe was produced with James Bragg.

Title: Lost Domain
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Ash frontman is a tribute to his late father, who suffered from Alzheimer’s disease.

Title: Head Down
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Southern California blues-rock band was produced by Dave Cobb.

Title: Barchords
Info: Toronto-based singer-songwriter Afie Jurvanen releases his second album of guitar-centric music.

Title: Spirit
Info: The debut album of the Connecticut rock group was originally released overseas in 2006.

Title: American Idiot
Info: Structured as a rock opera complete with 9-minute-plus songs and a somewhat complicated storyline, 'American Idiot' is the Berkeley punk band's first album in over four years.

Title: The Loneliest Time
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for Canadian pop artist Carly Rae Jepsen includes production from Rostam Batmanglij, Captain Cuts and Alex Hope.

Title: Earthling
Info: The third full-length solo release for the Pearl Jam frontman Eddie Vedder features a guest appearance from Elton John and was produced by Andrew Watt.

Title: Home Counties
Info: The first new release in five years for the British alternative dance trio was co-produced by Shawn Lee.

Title: Let's Turn It Into Sound
Info: The latest full-length release for Los Angeles-based electronic producer Kaitlyn Aurelia Smith features results from a new vocal processing technique she created.

Title: Mountain Moves
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the San Francisco indie rock band features guest appearances from Awkwafina, Devin Hoff, Juana Molina, Chad Popple, Matana Roberts, Xenia Rubinos, Laetitia Sadler, The Staple Singers, and Jenn Wasner.

Title: Life After Youth
Info: Produced by John Agnello, the third full-length release for the indie rock band led by Elizabeth Powell was written while taking care of her father and features a guest appearance from Sharon Van Etten.

Title: Fluorescent Black
Info: The Anti-Pop Consortium returns to release their first album together in six years.

Title: Our Two Skins
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian singer-songwriter was co-produced with Chris Messina and Zach Hanson.

Title: Lover
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the country pop artist features a guest appearances from the Dixie Chicks and Brendon Urie of Panic! at the Disco.

Title: Dark Days + Canapés
Info: The fourth full-length release for the London-based artist was produced by Leo Abrahams.

Title: Under the Sun
Info: The first solo release in five years for the electronic producer features guest appearances from Beans, Bibio, Thom Yorke, Thom Yorke.

Title: Field Music (Measure)
Info: The indie rock English outfit made up of brothers David and Peter Brewis (original drummer in the Futureheads) has reunited with founder/director Andrew Moore on its latest, Field Music (Measure).

Title: Red Letter Year
Info: The latest release for this folk singer was produced with Mike Napolitano and was recorded in Louisiana.

Title: i
Info: Stephin Merritt handles all of the vocal duties on Magnetic Fields' latest release (so named because each song title begins with the letter I), though the musicians who helped flesh out '69 Love Songs' return, including Claudia Gonson (also of Future Bible Heroes and the band's manager), John Woo and Sam Davol.

Title: Illumination
Info: The former Style Council and Jam frontman returns with a solo album, and finds Weller producing and playing most of the instruments himself, with the help of a few celebrity guests such as Noel Gallagher, Kelly Jones and Aziz Ibrahim.

Title: Walking With Thee
Info: The distinctive Liverpool indie/garage band is back with a follow-up to their well-received 2000 debut 'Internal Wrangler' (which was just released last fall in the U.S.). The positive press generated by these two releases led to the band signing a major-label deal with Universal, which re-released 'Walking With Thee' on August 6, 2002.

Title: Fan Dance
Info: This is Sam Phillips' first new album in five years, following 1996's poorly-received 'Omnipop.' Phillips' husband, T-Bone Burnett, produces.

Title: What's Next To The Moon
Info: The first full-length solo album from Red House Painters frontman Mark Kozelek (following his 2000 EP, 'Rock N Roll Singer') consists entirely, believe it or not, of Bon Scott-era AC/DC covers. You'd never guess it by listening to the album, however, as Kozelek transforms them into something entirely new.

Title: Here and Nowhere Else
Info: The fourth studio release for the Cleveland indie rock band led by Dylan Baldi was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Pure Heroine
Info: The debut full-length release for the 16-year-old New Zealand pop singer-songwriter was produced by Joel Little.

Title: No Color
Info: The indie folk duo from San Francisco return with a fourth album of psychedelic, atmospheric, genre-bending rock.

Title: Below The Branches
Info: The San Francisco-based psych-rock solo artist returns with a third full-length.

Title: Trials & Errors
Info: Recorded during a live performance by the Jason Molina-led four-piece in Brussels in 2003, 'Trials' includes seven songs from the Songs:Ohia catalog as well as three new Magnolia Electric Co. tracks.

Title: Slugger
Info: The debut full-length solo release for Speedy Ortiz's Sadie Dupuis was self-produced and features a guest appearance from Sammus.

Title: Formentera
Info: The eighth full-length release for Canadian indie band Metric was co-produced by Liam O'Neil and Gus Van Go.

Title: Mothers
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock was produced by Dreamtrak.

Title: With Light and With Love
Info: The eighth studio release for the Brooklyn folk rock band led by Jeremy Earl includes the use of a saloon piano, singing saw, and more percussion.

Title: Factory Floor
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British trio led by Nik Colk Void.

Title: Cerulean Salt
Info: The second full-length release for former P.S. Eliot singer Katie Crutchfield includes backing from Swearin' members Keith Spencer,  Kyle Gilbride, and her twin sister, Allison Crutchfield.

Title: World Boogie Is Coming
Info: The seventh studio release for the southern blues-rock/folk band was self produced.

Title: Some Say I So I Say Light
Info: Co-produced with Richard Formby, the second release for the British electronic artist features guest appearance from Gwilym Gold, Charles Hayward, Dave Okumu, Lucy Rose, and Woodpecker Wooliams.

Title: Mudcrutch
Info: The debut album for the Florida-based rock band known as the band Tom Petty was in before the Heartbreakers.

Title: Every Loser
Info: The latest full-length solo release for The Stooges' Iggy Pop features contributions from such artists as the late Taylor Hawkins, Travis Barker, Pearl Jam's Stone Gossard, and Guns N’ Roses' Duff McKagan, Dave Navarro, Red Hot Chili Peppers' Chad Smith.

Title: Ivory
Info: The latest full-length release for singer-songwriter Omar Apollo features guest appearances from Daniel Caesar and Kali Uchis.

Title: Ignorance Is Bliss
Info: The fifth Full-length studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from B Live, Boy Better Know, Lancey Foux, J Hus, Key, Lay-Z, Cheb Rabi, Nafe Smallz, and WizKid.

Title: II
Info: This is the second full-length release for Ty Segall's side project with Charlie Moothart and Chad Ubovich.

Title: The Most Lamentable Tragedy
Info: The fourth full-length studio release fro the punk band led by Patrick Stickles is a rock opera inspired by his own experience with manic depression.

Title: Spiritual Songs For Lovers To Sing
Info: The debut full-length release for the duo of WU LYF's Ellery Roberts and Ebony Hoorn was produced by The Haxan Cloak.

Title: Island of Noise
Info: The latest full-length release for Modern Nature was inspired in part by Shakespeare's The Tempest.

Title: Snow
Info: The indie rock/slowcore band returns with its first new release in nine years which was written over that course of time between albums.

Title: Electric
Info: The British folk rock guitarist's latest solo release was produced by Buddy Miller and includes guest appearances by Alison Krauss and Siobhan Maher Kennedy.

Title: Healing Is a Miracle
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn-based experimental artist features guest appearances from Jónsi, Mary Lattimore and Nosaj Thing.

Title: I'll Be Your Mirror: A Tribute to the Velvet Underground & Nico
Info: Courtney Barnett, Matt Berninger of The National, Andrew Bird, Doveman, Fontaines D.C., Bobby Gillespie, Iggy Pop, King Princess, Lucius, Thurston Moore, Angel Olsen, St. Vincent, Michael Stipe, Matt Sweeney, Sharon Van Etten, and Kurt Vile & the Violators cover songs from The Velvet Underground's 1967 debut album with German singer Nico.

Title: The Last Rider
Info: The 14th full-length solo release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was recorded with his touring band and was produced by Ron and Don Kerr.

Title: Invariable Heartache
Info: Lambchop's Kurt Wagner and Cortney Tidwell teamed up as KORT and released this album of songs originally recorded by the Chart Label.

Title: An Imaginary Country
Info: The Canadian electronica artist releases his latest album.

Title: Abyss
Info: The fifth full-length release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from Russian Circles guitarist Mike Sullivan and was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Geneva
Info: The third album for the rock trio was produced by Brandon Curtis.

Title: In The Court Of The Wrestling Let's
Info: The debut full-length album for the British rock trio was named after the King Crimson album, In the Court of The Crimson King.

Title: Because Of The Times
Info: The Brothers Followill reunite with producers Ethan Johns and Angelo Petraglia for their first album in over two years.

Title: Magma
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the French metal band was recorded at their own studio in New York.

Title: Garden of Delete
Info: The eighth release for Daniel Lopatin as Oneohtrix Point Never features a backstory about an alien named Ezra and a band called Kaoss Edge.

Title: Little Bird
Info: The Australian singer-songwriter releases her fifth solo album.

Title: Glowing in the Dark
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Dave MacLean and features a guest appearance from Charlotte Gainsbourg.

Title: Flowers for Vases/descansos
Info: The second full-length solo release for the Paramore singer was recorded at her Nashville home during the COVID-19 lockdown.

Title: Our Blood
Info: The alt-country rocker releases his latest album on Merge Records.

Title: Dolls Of Highland
Info: The debut full-length release for the Louisiana-born singer-songwriter was self-recorded and mixed by Brandon Summers and Benjamin Weikel of The Helio Sequence.

Title: Guider
Info: The second album for the Chicago-based band is the final album with original drummer Graeme Gibson who left the quartet to be closer to his family.

Title: OST
Info: The Oscar nominated film's soundtrack features three songs with M.I.A. and A.R. Rahman's score.

Title: Accelerate
Info: The rock band's 14th album is promised to be more rocking than its last release, Around the Sun.

Title: Jump Rope Gazers
Info: The second full-length release for the New Zealand indie pop quartet was produced by the band's guitarist Jonathan Pearce and lead singer Elizabeth Stokes.

Title: Could It Be Different?
Info: This is the third full-length release for the Scottish indie-pop quartet.

Title: House With No Home
Info: The sophomore album for the folk band from Portland, Oregon.

Title: The Greater Wrong Of The Right
Info: A reunited Nivek Ogre and cEvin Key return with their first Skinny Puppy album in eight years, with Ken Marshall (Tool) producing. (Apparently, their brand of hardcore political industrial noise is only needed during Republican administrations.)

Title: Permission To Land
Info: 'Permission To Land' is the debut LP for the rock four-piece from Norfolk, England (and we're talking the big, loud, stadium-rock end of the rock continuum, not the indie-rock end).

Title: Lead Us Not Into Temptation
Info: Byrne's latest release originated as the soundtrack to the film 'Young Adam' (itself based on the novel by Scottish beat writer Alexander Trocci). Since the film is set in Scotland, and since the former Talking Head himself was born there, he decided to enlist members of Glasgow-based groups such as Mogwai, Belle & Sebastian and The Reindeer Section to assist with this music (only a small portion of which actually is heard in the film).

Title: Supper
Info: The eleventh album from Bill Callahan and (Smog) features new vocalist Sarabeth Tucek.

Title: Night Works
Info: This is the sophomore effort for the duo of DJs from a popular London club known as The End. It is not a mix album, however; instead, the 14 trance-house tracks are original compositions.

Title: Motherland
Info: The singer's third solo album was produced by T-Bone Burnett.

Title: When The Pawn...
Info: The full title of this sophomore effort from the 22-year-old singer-songwriter runs a whopping 90 words: When the Pawn Hits the Conflicts He Thinks Like a King What He Knows Throws the Blows When He Goes to the Fight and He'll Win the Whole Thing 'Fore He Enters the Ring There's No Body to Batter When Your Mind Is Your Might So When You Go Solo, You Hold Your Own Hand and Remember That Depth Is the Greatest of Heights and if You Know Where You Stand, Then You Know Where to Land and if You Fall It Won't Matter, 'Cuz You'll Know That You're Right.

Title: The Big To-Do
Info: The debut on ATO Records leans more toward rock than the last studio release for the Athens, Georgia, band.

Title: Ultraviolet
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Georgia sludge metal band was influenced by a rough period of time for both Laura Pleasants and Phillip Cope.

Title: Love Is Magic
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the former frontman of The Czars was produced with Midlake's Paul Alexander and Wrangler's Benge.

Title: Formerly Extinct
Info: The second instrumental rock release from the trio of Sir Richard Bishop, Ben Chasny, and Chris Corsano was influenced by Easter European and Middle Eastern music.

Title: Tiger My Friend
Info: This is the debut album for the London-based electronica duo, who blend their minimalist, experimental tendencies with more organic elements, including vocals (think of a more playful version of Mum).

Title: Just Because
Info: The second full-length release for the brother and sister duo of Barbara and Ethan Gruska was produced with Shawn Everett.

Title: All I Intended To Be
Info: The latest album for the country singer was produced by Brian Ahern with Dolly Parton and Vince Gill as guest vocalists.

Title: Culture of Volume
Info: The second full-length release for William Doyle as East India Youth was recorded at home.

Title: COW / Chill Out, World!
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the Ambient techno duo was recorded while on tour.

Title: I, Gemini
Info: The debut full-length release for the British experimental pop teen duo of Rosa Walton and Jenny Hollingworth was recorded by Will Twynham in a former nuclear bunker-turned-studio.

Title: The Calcination Of Scout Niblett
Info: The latest album for the singer-songwriter was produced by Steve Albini and is her first with Drag City.

Title: Convivial
Info: Sasu Ripatti's fourth album as Luomo features Johanna Iivanainen, Sascha Ring (aka Apparat), Robert Owens, Sue-C, Panorama Bar's Cassy, and Scissor Sisters' Jake Shears.

Title: Love Is Not Pop
Info: The third album for the Swedish singer was produced with Rasmus Hagg.

Title: Black Velvet
Info: The posthumous release for the soul singer features songs recorded during sessions from his previous three releases.

Title: The Answer Is Always Yes
Info: The third full-length release from Australian singer-songwriter Alex Lahey features songs co-written with Ali Barter, Chris Collins, Jacknife Lee, and John Mark Nelson.

Title: Bonny Light Horseman
Info: The debut full-length release for the trio that includes Anaïs Mitchell, Josh Kaufman and Eric D. Johnson includes new interpretations of traditional folk songs, many hundreds of years old.

Title: Tenderness
Info: The second full-length release for the Montreal duo Raphaelle Standell-Preston and Alexander Cowan was inspired by Standell-Preston's unrequited relationship with someone online.

Title: Forgetting the Present
Info: The third full-length release for the Scottish instrumental band led by Graeme Ronald was recorded by Tony Doogan.

Title: The Shadow of Heaven
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Manchester rock quartet of Scott Beaman, Billy Byron, Charlie Cocksedge, and Jamie Lee.

Title: Blue Moon: The New York Session
Info: Jazz pianist Ahmad Jamal pays tribute to some of his favorite Broadway, Hollywood, and Great American Songbook classic songs.

Title: Love You To Death
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Canadian sister duo was produced by Greg Kurstin.

Title: The Beast in Its Tracks
Info: The seventh full-length studio release from the singer-songwriter was written after his divorce from his wife, singer Dawn Landes.

Title: Ash
Info: The second full-length release for sisters Lisa-Kaindé and Naomi Diaz was produced by Richard Russell and features guest appearances from Chilly Gonzales, Meshell Ndegeocello, Mala Rodriguez, and Kamasi Washington.

Title: Sagittarian Domain
Info: The one 33-minute track release from the Australian artist was recorded and performed by himself in one day.

Title: All We Could Do Was Sing
Info: The indie band based in Oakland, California wrote songs for its sophomore album while up in Alaska for the summer.

Title: Sam Amidon
Info: The latest full-length release for the singer-songwriter is a covers album and features a guest appearance from Beth Orton.

Title: Five Roses
Info: The debut album for the Canadian indie artist, who was nominated for the Polaris Music Prize in 2007.

Title: Pick A Bigger Weapon
Info: Audioslave's Tom Morello is among the musicians providing the framework for the politically-charged rap duo's first release in five years.

Title: Exhausting Fire
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Georgia sludge metal band features influences from New Wave, Americana, Eighties goth, and death rock music.

Title: Becoming A Jackal
Info: This is the solo debut for Irishman Conor J. O'Brien, a member of the rock band The Immediate who split up in 2007.

Title: Some Echoes
Info: This is the Ohio band's fourth album of jazzy prog-rock.

Title: Black City
Info: 1980's influences exist throughout the latest album for the Texas-born electronic artist.

Title: Take Care
Info: The second studio album for the hip-hop artist features guest appearances from Andre 3000, Birdman, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne, Nicki Manah, Rick Ross, Rihanna, and The Weeknd.

Title: The Sun Awakens
Info: Ben Chasny returns with a follow-up to 'School Of The Flower.'

Title: A Kiss for the Whole World
Info: The seventh full-length release from British rock band Enter Shikari was recorded using only solar power in a run-down farmhouse.

Title: K.O.
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the the Israeli dancehall MC was produced by The Bug.

Title: Rock N Roll Consciousness
Info: The fifth solo release for the Sonic Youth guitarist was produced by Paul Epworth with contributions from My Bloody Valentine's Debbie Googe and Sonic Youth's Steve Shelley.

Title: Né So
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Malian singer-songwriter was produced by John Parish and features guest appearances from  Devendra Banhart, John Paul Jones, and Toni Morrison.

Title: Alone Together
Info: Jazz, hip hop, electronic, rock, and funk are just some of the music styles influences on the debut solo 34-track release from the jazz drummer and hip hop producer.

Title: O' Be Joyful
Info: This is the debut release for the South Carolina husband and wife duo of Michael Trent and Cary Ann Hearst.

Title: Coracle
Info: The duo of Alessio Natalizai of Banjo or Freakout and Sam Willis of Allez-Allez releases its sophomore album.

Title: Wasting Light
Info: The seventh studio album from the alternative rock band has Dave Grohl bringing in producer Butch Vig (of Nirvana's Nevermind fame) for its latest release.

Title: Haymaker!
Info: The Austin, Texas band releases its ninth album.

Title: Antibalas
Info: The Brooklyn Afro-beat ensemble releases it first album in four years on new label Daptone Records.

Title: Edition 1
Info: Christian Fennesz is the first collaborator of a planned four part series of albums from experimental trio King Midas Sound.

Title: MartyrLoserKing
Info: The fifth full-length release for the New York rapper is a concept album about a computer hacker in Burundi features guest appearances from Emily Kokal and Haleek Maul.

Title: Blackbirds
Info: The latest full-length release for the R&B singer features songs sung by other female artists and was produced by Steve Jordan.

Title: Ghost Notes
Info: The first release from the Chicago indie rock band's original line-up since 1997's Eight Arms To Hold You was produced by Brad Wood.

Title: Tragicomedies
Info: The second release for the Berlin-based Scottish producer moves further away from the traditional electronic sounds of his 2010 debut.

Title: Country Music
Info: The latest album for the country singer produced by T Bone Burnett features popular bluegrass, country, and folk songs.

Title: (Watch My Moves)
Info: The first full-length release on Verve Records for Philadelphia rock artist Kurt Vile was self-produced with contributions from Chastity Belt, Cate Le Bon, Sarah Jones, Stella Mozgawa, Rob Schnapf, James Stewart, and The Violators.

Title: Deciphering the Message
Info: The latest full-length release for Chicago-based jazz drummer Makaya McCraven features remixes of Blue Note jazz songs with contributions from Matt Gold, Marquis Hill, De’Sean Jones, Jeff Parker, Junius Paul, Joel Ross, and Greg Ward.

Title: A Star Is Born [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
Info: The soundtrack to the 2018 remake of the 1937 film features tracks written by Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper as well as Jason Isbell, Hillary Lindsey, Lukas Nelson, Mark Ronson, Anthony Rossomando, Justin Tranter, and Diane Warren.

Title: Distractions
Info: The third full-length studio release for the London electronic music producer features guest appearances by Andrea Galaxy, Jammz, Jessy Lanza, and Sweyn J.

Title: Marigolden
Info: The second full-length release for the Chris Porterfield-led folk band was produced with Robbie Lackritz.

Title: At Mount Zoomer
Info: The Montreal quartet recorded its sophomore album at Arcade Fire's church studio.

Title: Set You Free
Info: The ninth studio release for the country singer features co-production with Greg Droman, Jay Joyce, and Mark Wright.

Title: Broken
Info: The third album for the electronic duo features Mark Lanegan as the main singer, with Bonnie "Prince" Billy, Jason Pierce, Mike Patton, Richard Hawley, and Gibby Haynes as guest vocalists.

Title: Demolished Thoughts
Info: The Sonic Youth guitarist's fourth album, produced by Beck, features guest appearances by Bram Inscore, Mary Lattimore, Samara Lubelski, and Joey Waronker.

Title: Gas Lit
Info: The latest release for the  Australian experimental metal duo of Takiaya Reed and Sylvie Nehill was produced by Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Ruban Nielson.

Title: Sympathy for Life
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Brooklyn indie rock band was produced with Rodaidh McDonald.

Title: The Things We Do To Find People Who Feel Like Us
Info: The debut full-length release for the Pennsylvania punk band led by James Alex includes JP Flexner of Nona and Ex-Friends, Ed McNulty of Nona and Crybaby, and Ruben Gallego.

Title: Isa
Info: The latest release for the music project of Copenhagen's Loke Rahbek features vocals from Alto Aria, Frederikke Hoffmeier, Soho Rezanejad, Jonnine Standish of HTRK, and Yves Tumor.

Title: Dionysus
Info: The ninth full-length release for the musical project of Lisa Gerrard and Brendan Perry was inspired by European festivals that began as celebrations for the Greek god Dionysus.

Title: Mother
Info: The third full-length release for the duo of George Xylouris and Jim White was produced by Fugazi's Guy Picciotto.

Title: Beams
Info: This is the fourth full-length solo release for the Texas-born producer/pop artist.

Title: The  Dreamer
Info: Coproduced with Josh Sklair and her sons, Danto and Sametto, The Dreamer is said to be Etta James' final album as she retires to take care of her health.

Title: No Better Than This
Info: T-Bone Burnett returned to produce the singer-songwriter's latest album which was recorded while Mellencamp was touring the Southern states.

Title: Diamond Eyes
Info: The sixth album for the rock band was recorded and released as a substitution (with Sergio Vega on bass) to Eros which was put on hold when bassist Chi Cheng was involved in a serious car accident.

Title: Getting Into Knives
Info: The latest full-length release for the indie folk band led by John Darnielle features a guest appearance from Charles Hodges and was produced by Matt Ross-Spang.

Title: The Prettiest Curse
Info: The third full-length release for the Spanish indie rock band was produced by Jenn Decilveo.

Title: Shadow of a Doubt
Info: The third full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Black Thought, E-40, Tory Lanez, Gucci Mane, Manman Savage, and Dana Williams.

Title: The  Chronicles of Marnia
Info: The fourth release for the New York singer-guitarist features new drummer Kid Millions of Oneida (replacing Zach Hill of Death Grips).

Title: Raum
Info: This is the second full-length release for German electronic band Tangerine Dream after the death of Edgar Froese in 2015.

Title: 10th Avenue Freakout
Info: Andrew Broder's third Fog album reprises the song "Hummer" from a recent EP of the same name, and adds 12 new tracks. It's both more vocal-oriented and (at times) more electronic than earlier efforts.

Title: All My Friends Are Funeral Singers
Info: The Chicago rock band's latest album is also the soundtrack to the film of the same name.

Title: Want Two
Info: The singer's fourth album features the same producer (Marius deVries) and backup musicians as his previous outing, 'Want One.'

Title: Carried To Dust
Info: The sixth album for the duo from Arizona features Iron & Wine, Douglas McCombs, Amparo Sanchez, and Pieta Brown as guest musicians.

Title: Toward the Low Sun
Info: The trio from Australia releases its first album of instrumental rock since 2005's Cinder.

Title: Cease To Begin
Info: The Seattle band's follow-up to their debut album.

Title: Eye of I
Info: The latest full-length release for jazz tenor saxophonist/composer James Brandon Lewis features a guest appearance from The Messthetics.

Title: The Work
Info: This is the first full-length studio release for British electronic producer Gold Panda in six years.

Title: Tyron
Info: The second full-length release for the British rapper features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, James Blake, Deb Never, Denzel Curry, Dominic Fike, Mount Kimbie, and Skepta.

Title: Trip
Info: The latest full-length release for the alt-country band led by Kurt Wagner is covers album with each member selecting one song for the for the group to cover.

Title: Rakka
Info: The latest full-length release for the Finnish electronic producer Sasu Ripatti is his first credited under his Vladislav Delay moniker in six years.

Title: What a Boost
Info: The fourth full-length release for the London-based singer-songwriter was self-produced and features contributions from Sam Amidon, Chris Cohen, Jamie Whitby Coles, Neil Smith, Kate Stables, and Joel Wästberg.

Title: Dungeness
Info: This is the latest full-length release for the Scottish folk rock group led by Alex Neilson.

Title: In the Magic Hour
Info: The second full-length solo release for the Crooked Still member was inspired by memories of her Irish grandfather and was produced by Tucker Martine.

Title: In Another Life
Info: Produced by Adrian Younge, the fifth full-length studio release for the R&B/soul artist features guest appearances from Big K.R.I.T., Kimbra, and Kendrick Lamar.

Title: Other Worlds
Info: The third release for the Swedish singer was inspired by her trip to Hawaii and was co-produced by The Tough Alliance’s Henning Fürst.

Title: Little Hell
Info: This is the third album for the Alexisonfire lead singer's other music project, City and Colour.

Title: Ma Fleur
Info: Jason Swinscoe's first Cinematic Orchestra disc in five years is indeed a soundtrack... to an imaginary film.

Title: Cannibal Sea
Info: This is the third album of 60s-influenced tunes from the Brooklyn-based indie-pop band.

Title: Saint Dymphna
Info: The fourth album for the the Brooklyn, New York, experimental rock band.

Title: Eternally Even
Info: The second full-length solo release for the My Morning Jacket frontman was produced by Blake Mills.

Title: Con Todo El Mundo
Info: The second full-length release for the Texas trio of Laura Lee, Mark Speer, and Donald “DJ” Johnson adds influences by Mediterranean and  Middle Eastern music.

Title: Happy Hollow
Info: The Tim Kasher-led band has lost its cellist (Gretta Cohn) but added a horn section for its latest release, produced, as always, by Mike Mogis.

Title: Paperwork
Info: The sophomore album for the Chicago-area avant-garde rock band.

Title: Devil's Halo
Info: The latest album for the Grammy-nominated singer-songwriter was produced with Chris Bruce.

Title: Cool
Info: The latest full-length release for the Los Angeles indie pop artist was produced by Gordon Raphael.

Title: Apple
Info: The second full-length release in 2020 for the British electronic producer features contributions from Hannah Diamond and Caroline Polachek.

Title: Undertow
Info: The five-track release from the Detroit noise rock trio is its first on its own label.

Title: Chills on Glass
Info: The third release for the Chicago band led by Todd Rittman is its first on the Drag City label.

Title: Relayted
Info: The debut album for the indie supergroup led by Ryan Olson features musicians from such Minneapolis-area bands as Solid Gold, Megafaun, Rhymesayers, and Bon Iver.

Title: Atlas
Info: The third full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Tom Schick and recorded at Wilco's studio in Chicago.

Title: The  Follower
Info: This is thee fifth full-length release for Swedish producer Axel Willner.

Title: The Air Between Words
Info: The third full-length release for the Washington, D.C.-based producer Martijn Deykers features collaborations with Kieran Hebden and Inga Copeland.

Title: Sunbathing Animal
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based rock band led by Andrew Savage follows the title track's 7-inch single release on Record Store Day.

Title: Silence Is Wild
Info: This is the second album to be released in the United States for the Swedish singer.

Title: Trust Not Those In Whom Without Some Touch Of Madness
Info: A 20-year veteran of the indie music scene, the former Come frontwoman returns with her second solo LP.

Title: Fortune
Info: Using a 2003 European tour as inspiration, the Athens, Georga indie-rockers recorded this sixth album as a series of narratives about both Americans traveling abroad and about recent immigrants to the United States.

Title: Trey Anastasio
Info: The official solo debut for the Phish head features 12 new Anastasio-penned tracks, with the guitarist backed by an eight-piece band.

Title: People Helping People
Info: The latest full-length studio release for Los Angeles duo No Age was recorded, mixed and produced by its guitarist Randy Randall.

Title: Cala
Info: The sixth full-length solo release for the Irish folk singer-songwriter was made in his hometwon of Bray.

Title: Where the Action Is
Info: The 13th full-length release for the British band led by Mike Scott was co-produced by Paul Brown and Simon Dine.

Title: Prince of Tears
Info: The fifth full-length release for British indie artist was co-produced with Ash Workman and features guest appearances from Jason Williamson of Sleaford Mods and Rose Elinor Dougall.

Title: Different Creatures
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band was co-produced by Alan Moulder.

Title: Jessica Pratt
Info: The debut release for the San Francisco singer-songwriter is also the first album on Tim Presley's Birth Records.

Title: Mayhem
Info: The Dublin-based singer fuses blues and rockabilly on her rocking new album.

Title: Supreme Balloon
Info: The seventh album for the experimental band is promised to include many kinds of synthesizers.

Title: I Was Born Swimming
Info: The debut full-length release for the Boston singer-songwriter Ella Williams was recorded in New York City with producer Gabe Wax.

Title: Wrecking Ball
Info: Produced with Ron Aniello, Springsteen’s 17th studio album was inspired by the impact of the financial crisis and is the last album with Clarence Clemons, who passed away in June 2011.

Title: The Expanding Flower Planet
Info: The debut full-length release for the Dirty Projectors' bassist Angel Deradoorian was co-produced with Kenny Gilmore.

Title: Cape God
Info: The second full-length release for the Canadian indie pop artist features guest appearances from Mitski and Troye Sivan.

Title: The Way Of The World
Info: The first album in 12 years for the jazz pianist is his first on the ANTI label and was produced by Joe Henry.

Title: The True False Identity
Info: This is the veteran producer's first solo artist album in 14 years.

Title: Seeking Thrills
Info: The second full-length release for the British electo-pop artist features guest appearances by Maurice and Shygirl.

Title: Things Are Great
Info: The first full-length studio release in five years for the Ben Bridwell-led band Band Of Horses.

Title: In Each and Every One
Info: This is the fifth full-length release for the experimental jazz band led by Sebastian Rochford.

Title: Bad Self Portraits
Info: The Brooklyn-based band formed by former students at the New England Conservatory releases its second full-length studio album.

Title: To Believe
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British electronic/nu-jazz project led by Jason Swinscoe and Dom Smith features guest vocals from Grey Reverend, Roots Manuva, Moses Sumney, Tawiah, and Heidi Vogel.

Title: Better Oblivion Community Center
Info: The surprise release for the music project of Phoebe Bridgers and Conor Oberst features contributions from Carla Azar, Anna Butterss, Christian Lee Hutson, Yeah Yeah Yeahs' Nick Zinner as well as Dawes’ Wylie Gelber and Griffin Goldsmith.

Title: The Things We Think We're Missing
Info: The second full-length release for the Pennsylvania alternative rock band was produced by Will Yip.

Title: Sex And Gasoline
Info: The fourth album for the Grammy-winning country singer was produced by Joe Henry.

Title: Laughter's Fifth
Info: Yes, this is indeed the fifth full-length for the band led by Sam Jayne.

Title: Lose
Info: The third full-length release for the New York indie rock band led by Joseph D'Agostino was produced by John Agnello.

Title: In the Silence
Info: The English-language version of the Icelandic singer-songwriter's debut release which went triple platinum in his native country was translated by John Grant.

Title: Sisterworld
Info: The fifth album for the trio was recorded in Los Angeles with Tom Biller.

Title: Go-Go Boots
Info: With a mix of country, rock and soul, the ninth album from the Georgian alternative band is genre-defying and full of their trademark Southern rock influences.

Title: Somebody's Knocking
Info: The 11th full-length studio release was recorded over 11 days in Los Angeles with contributions from Martin Jenkins, Rob Marshall, and Sietse van Gorkom.

Title: Run Around the Sun
Info: This is the second full-length release for the British indie pop duo of Rachel Aggs and Eilidh Rodgers.

Title: No Better Time Than Now
Info: The third full-length release from Detroit-based electronic producer Zach Saginaw was written after a move back to Michigan and the end of a long-term relationship.

Title: St. Peter & 57th St. [Live]
Info: The jazz group celebrated its 50th anniversary with a live concert at Carnegie Hall with such guests as Steve Earle, Givers, Merrill Garbus (aka Tune-Yards), Mos Def, My Morning Jacket, and Pete Seeger's grandson, Tao Rodríguez-Seeger.

Title: Heretofore
Info: The band led by Phil Cook releases a six-track album which was completed in six weeks.

Title: Spaces Everywhere
Info: This is the third full-length release since the British post-punk band reformed in 2011.

Title: Post Tropical
Info: The second full-length release from the Irish singer-songwriter was self-produced and recorded in the US.

Title: Total Life Forever
Info: The follow-up to the British rock band's 2008 debut Antidotes was produced by Luke Smith.

Title: Metronomy Forever
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British electropop band led by Joseph Mount was recorded in his home studio.

Title: Impermanence
Info: The debut full-length solo release for The Antlers frontman was influenced by a period of time when he was suffering from temporary total hearing loss.

Title: Sincerely, Future Pollution
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Canadian trio was recorded in France.

Title: Rub
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Canadian electronic artist features guest appearances from Feist, Kim Gordon, and Simmone Jones.

Title: Turtleneck & Chain
Info: The trio led by Saturday Night Live's Adam Samberg returns with its follow-up to its 2009 parody debut album.

Title: Hunting My Dress
Info: This is the latest album for the California singer-songwriter, who started out as the nanny to Tom Waits' children.

Title: Crimson
Info: Jerry Finn (blink-182) produced this follow-up to 'Good Mourning.'

Title: Holding Hands With Jamie
Info: The debut full-length release for the Dublin noise-rock band was self-produced.

Title: Big Picture
Info: The third full-length release from British indie folk artist Fenne Lily was produced with Brad Cook (and one track with Christian Lee Hutson).

Title: Screen Memories
Info: The first new studio release in six years for the experimental pop artist was written and recorded in his Minnesota home.

Title: Raskit
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the grime artist features production from The Arcade, Cardo, Darkness, Deputy, Donae'O, Dan Farber, Heavy Trackerz, Valentino Khan, and Salva.

Title: Revival
Info: The former Creedence Clearwater Revival singer returns after three years with his latest solo album.

Title: Das Not Compute
Info: The Swedish garage rockers return with a sophomore LP.

Title: Bows & Arrows
Info: Although lumped in with the New York garage-rock scene, The Walkmen (which includes members of defunct bands Jonathan Fire Eater and The Recoys) stand out by incorporating a wider range of influences and instrumentation. (Plus, they own their own New York recording studio, which puts them about as far from an actual garage as you can get). This is the band's second LP, which follows their acclaimed 2002 debut 'Everyone Who Pretended to Like Me Is Gone.'

Title: Hot Shit
Info: The duo of Sam Coomes and Janet Weiss (Sleater-Kinney) return with their fifth LP.

Title: KicK iii
Info: One of the four releases on the same day for Arca's KICK anthology is said to be "more manic, violently euphoric and aggressively psychedelic."

Title: Cellardyke Recording and Wassailing Society
Info: The latest release from the Scottish singer-songwriter was produced by Hot Chip's Alexis Taylor and features contributions from such artists as KT Tunstall, The Pictish Trail, Hot Chip drummer Rob Smoughton, Fimber Bravo, Jon Thorne, and Emma Smith.

Title: Marry Me
Info: Polyphonic Spree member Annie Clark releases her debut album.

Title: Honeymoon
Info: The debut full-length release for the Chicago indie pop band led by Lili Trifilio was recorded with producer Joe Reinhart.

Title: The  Devil You Know
