Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Atlanta punk rock trio was produced by Nic Jodoin.

Title: Until the Colours Run
Info: This is the second release for the British symphonic rock five-piece (Adam and Brendan Sykes left the group in 2012).

Title: Sound the Alarm
Info: The multiple Grammy-winning R&B/soul singer returns to the Stax label with an album featuring guest appearances from such artists as Gary Clark, Jr., Estelle, Anthony Hamilton, Mayer Hawthorne, Luke James, Sheila E., and Vintage Trouble.

Title: Purgatory/Paradise
Info: The first release in over ten years for the alternative rock band is a 32 songs set with a book by singer Kristin Hersh.

Title: The Love Invention
Info: The debut full-length solo release from Alison Goldfrapp was produced with James Greenwood and Richard X.

Title: Path of Wellness
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Portland, Oregon-based alternative rock duo was self-produced.

Title: Boy King
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by John Congleton.

Title: I Love You
Info: The second solo release for the now Portland, Oregon-based electronic artist was created while Urick was moving from Baltimore and dealing with his personal relationships.

Title: Sainthood
Info: The latest album for the twin singer-songwriters was produced with Chris Walla.

Title: Nozinja Lodge
Info: This is the debut full-length studio release for South African Shangaan electronic artist Richard Hlungwani as Nozinja.

Title: Kollaps Tradixionales
Artist: Thee Silver Mt. Zion Memorial Orchestra & Tra-La-La Band
Info: The sixth album for the Canadian group is the first credited under the shortened name of Thee Silver Mt. Zion Memorial Orchestra.

Title: The Age of Pleasure
Info: The first full-length studio release in five years for Janelle Monáe features guest appearances by Amaarae, Ckay, Doechii, Grace Jones, Nia Long, and Sister Nancy.

Title: Hey U x
Info: The debut full-length release for the New Zealand alternative pop artist features guest appearances from Lily Allen, Bakar, Kenny Beats, Gus Dapperton, Flo Milli, Grimes, Mallrat, and Muoki.

Title: The Nature of Imitation
Info: The second full-length release for electronic producer Oliver Johnson as Dorian Concept was inspired by '60s jazz, '70s fusion, '80s neo prog-rock, and ‘90s electronica.

Title: Nature
Info: The third full-length release for the indie band led by Honey Owens is its first in seven years.

Title: Nothing Important
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie folk artist features two tracks over 15 minutes long.

Title: Powder Burns
Info: 'Powder Burns' is Greg Dulli's fourth album under the Twilight Singers name, and was recorded in New Orleans before, during (using generators) and after Hurricane Katrina. Joseph Arthur and Ani DiFranco guest.

Title: Suicide Songs
Info: The second full-length release for the British trio was produced by Charlie Andrew.

Title: Tangier Sessions
Info: The latest solo release from the former Sun City Girls guitarist was self-recorded in Morocco.

Title: Color
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based electronic artist.

Title: Live from the Underground
Info: The Mississippi-born rapper's debut studio album was delayed from its original release in the fall of 2011 due to legal issues. The 16 track release features guest appearances by such artists as Bun B, B.B. King, Devin the Dude, Melanie Fiona, and Ludacris.

Title: Heartbreaking Bravery
Info: Spencer Krug's second album under the name Moonface was recorded with the Finnish band Siinai.

Title: Change Becomes Us
Info: Unfinished material from 1979-80 were the framework for the latest release from the British post-punk band.

Title: Witching Hour
Info: Jim Abbiss (Kasabian) produced this third album for the UK band, which finds them expanding slightly away their electroclash sound.

Title: A Mad & Faithful Telling
Info: The Denver, Colorado-based quartet known for its work on the "Little Miss Sunshine" soundtrack and score releases its latest album on the Anti label.

Title: 'Em Are I
Info: Jeffrey Lewis' latest album is his first to be credited with his backing band, The Junkyard.

Title: Telling It Like It Is
Info: The second full-length release for the side project of Iceage's Elias Bender Rønnenfelt features contributions from Choir of Young Believers' Sonja La Bianca as well as members of the Stargaze Orchestra.

Title: Dry Food
Info: This is the debut full-length release for Boston singer-guitarist Ellen Kempner.

Title: Mirel Wagner
Info: Acoustic guitar accompanies the debut album for the singer-songwriter from Ethiopia now living in Finland.

Title: The Devil And God Are Raging Inside Me
Info: The Long Island emo band's major-label debut was co-produced by Mike Sapone.

Title: Made In The Dark
Info: This is the third album for the English electro-indie rock band.

Title: Building Something Beautiful for Me
Info: The latest full-length release for London-based electronic producer Loraine James was inspired by composer Julius Eastman's work.

Title: Welcome 2 Club XIII
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for Georgia rock band Drive-By Truckers features background vocals from Schaefer Llana, R.E.M.'s Mike Mills, and Margo Price.

Title: To Willie
Info: Matthew Houck releases his cover album of Willie Nelson songs.

Title: Blue Mountain
Info: The first solo release of new material from the Grateful Dead guitarist in 30 years was produced by Josh Kaufman with contributions from Aaron and Bryce Dessner, Josh Ritter, and Scott Devendorf.

Title: The  Names
Info: This is the debut full-length solo release for Vampire Weekend's Chris Baio.

Title: Return to Love
Info: The third full-length release for the New York alternative rock band was produced by Mike Ditrio.

Title: A Hundred Things Keep Me Up At Night
Info: The Swedish indie-rock band releases its sophomore album.

Title: Bless This Mess
Info: The latest full-length release for Meg Remy's experimental pop project U.S. Girls features guest appearances from Michael Rault, Marker Starling and Alanna Stuart.

Title: Makes a King
Info: The third full-length release for the duo of Malawian Esau Mwamwaya and Swedish producer Johan Hugo feature contributions from Baaba Maal, Seye, and Chris Baio of Vampire Weekend.

Title: New Magnetic Wonder
Info: The sixth album for the Robert Schneider-led indie-pop band is packed with 24 songs (although a dozen of them are brief instrumental segues).

Title: Here's To Being Here
Info: The fourth solo album for the Broken Social Scene member includes appearances by Liam O'Neil, Tony Scherr, and Andrew Whiteman.

Title: Seasonal Hire
Info: The second collaboration between Steve Gunn and The Black Twig Pickers was recorded live.

Title: Old Fears
Info: Field Music's David Brewis releases his first album under his solo project School Of Language since 2008's Sea from Shore.

Title: Family and Friends
Info: Chicago-based David Cohn's latest album as Serengeti was produced by Why's Yoni Wolf and Owen Ashworth.

Title: Long Island Shores
Info: This is the second album for the New York-born, Nashville-based singer-songwriter.

Title: Humor Risk
Info: The San Francisco-based singer-songwriter releases his second album for the year.

Title: Deep Fantasy
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian punk rock band was produced by Jesse Gander.

Title: Ruminant Band
Info: Eric Johnson returns to the indie rock band for its fourth album after having worked with The Shins and Vetiver.

Title: Local Business
Info: Produced by Kevin McMahon, the third full-length album for the indie rock band focuses on singer-guitarist Patrick Stickles recent life experiences, including accidental electrocution and battling an eating disorder.

Title: Rabbit Fur Coat
Artist: Jenny Lewis With The Watson Twins
Info: This is the solo debut for former child star, Rilo Kiley frontwoman and occasional Postal Service vocalist Jenny Lewis. Contributors include Bright Eyes' Conor Oberst, Death Cab For Cutie's Ben Gibbard and singer-songwriter M. Ward.

Title: Twentytwo in Blue
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn indie pop trio of Julia Cumming, Nick Kivlen, and Jacob Faber was co-produced by Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Jacob Portrait.

Title: Chalice Hymnal
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Portland, Oregon post-rock band was self-produced.

Title: Total Folklore
Info: The debut full-length solo release from Parts & Labor's keyboardist and singer is a follow-up to his debut EP Valedictorian/Exoskeleton, released in November 2012.

Title: The Stand Ins
Info: The indie rock band releases its latest album produced by Brian Beattie.

Title: Nocturnal Koreans
Info: Eight songs from the British rock band's 2015 self-titled release were reworked for this "mini-LP."

Title: Drill A Hole In That Substrate And Tell Me What You See
Info: The always interesting Florida-based singer-songwriter's third album was co-produced by Joe Henry, with appearances from Aimee Mann, Chocolate Genius, M. Ward, Bil Frisell and The Sadies.

Title: All of This Will End
Info: The third full-length release from North Carolina indie rock artist Indigo De Souza was produced with Alex Farrar.

Title: Positive Force
Info: The second album of indie pop from Steve Marion was recorded and produced in his home.

Title: Criminal
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Luis Vasquez solo project was produced by Maurizio Baggio.

Title: Excellent Italian Greyhound
Info: This is the first release in seven years for the trio of super-producer Steve Albini (guitar), Todd Trainer (drums), and Bob Weston (bass).

Title: Useless Coordinates
Info: The debut full-length release for the British post-punk trio features contributions from Chris Duffin of XAM Duo.

Title: Nobody's Smiling
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Chicago rapper was produced by No I.D. and features guest appearances Jhené Aiko, Snoh Aalegra, Big Sean, Elijah Blake, Cocaine 80's, Dreezy, Lil Herb, and Malik Yusef.

Title: Ex Lives
Info: The Buffalo, NY, hardcore band's sixth album is its last with bassist Josh Newton, who left the band in October 2011.

Title: FFS
Info: The debut release for the collaboration between Franz Ferdinand and Sparks was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Fort Nightly
Info: The debut record for the New York quintet includes two drummers and a piano player.

Title: Mura Masa
Info: The debut full-length release for the London-based electronic producer features guest appearances from Damon Albarn, A$AP Rocky, Bonzai, Charli XCX, Christine And The Queens, Desiigner, Jamie Lidell, NAO, A. K. Paul, and Tom Tripp.

Title: Clinging To A Scheme
Info: The Swedish trio returns with a more pop sound for its third release.

Title: Concrete Desert
Info: The debut full-length collaboration from The Bug’s Kevin Martin and Earth’s Dylan Carlson was recorded in two days in Los Angeles.
The second full-length release for the band led by Tom Petty was produced by band members Petty and Mike Campbell with Ryan Ulyate.

Title: Channel Pressure
Info: Previously known as Games, Joel Ford and Daniel Lopatin release their debut full-length album under their new name.

Title: Death Dreams
Info: The second release for the Canadian rock duo of Benjamin Nelson and Paul Saulnier was produced by Matt Rogalsky and inspired by dreams Saulnier had while on tour.

Title: Saltbreakers
Info: The Portland, Ore-based singer-songwriter reunites with producer Tucker Martine (The Decemberists) for her sixth album, which is titled after her backing band.

Title: Electric Cables
Info: Former members of Teenage Fanclub Dave McGowan and Brendan O'Hare along with The Pastels' Tom Crossley, and Belle & Sebastian's Bob Kildea contributed to the debut solo album for Teenage Fanclub's Gerard Love as Lightships.

Title: Face The Truth
Info: Malkmus' third post-Pavement recording is his most "solo" effort to date (not to mention his weirdest), with only some of the songs featuring the full complement of Jicks backing him up.

Title: The Life Pursuit
Info: Tony Hoffer produced this seventh studio LP for the veteran Scottish indie-pop band.

Title: Alvvays
Info: The debut release for the Canadian five-piece indie pop band that includes Molly Rankin, daughter of Rankin Family member John Morris; former Two Hours Traffic member Alec O'Hanley; and Danks drummer Phil MacIsaac was produced by Chad VanGaalen.

Title: Relax
Info: The pop-rap experimentalists release its debut full-length album.
This solo debut for the Azure Ray member includes appearances from fellow Saddle Creek-ers Conor Oberst and Andy LeMaster.

Title: Hit Reset
Info: The second full-length release for the band led by Kathleen Hanna was mixed by Eli Crews.

Title: Guero
Info: This much-anticipated release for the eclectic performer--a return to the "fun" Beck of 'Odelay' and 'Midnite Vultures'--was produced by the Dust Brothers and Tony Hoffer.

Title: End Of Love
Info: The fifth album for Eef Barzelay & co. includes contributions from members of Lambchop and Crooked Fingers. Barzelay himself produced the entire disc.

Title: I'm New Here
Info: Poet, musician, and singer/songwriter Gil Scott-Heron is one of the most influential progenitors of hip-hop music. Such artists as Kanye West, Mos Def, Black Star, and Air have sampled his work. Now, the poet returns with his first album in 15 years released on XL Recordings.

Title: Real Gone
Info: Fans of his acclaimed 2002 pair of discs will have to settle for just one album this time out, co-produced by Waits with Kathleen Brennan. Marc Ribot and Les Claypool guest.

Title: Keep Your Courage
Info: The first full-length solo studio release in nine years for singer-songwriter Natalie Merchant features a guest appearance from Abena Koomson-Davis and contributions from Kinan Azmeh, Steve Davis, and Lúnasa.

Title: $oul $old $eparately
Info: The latest full-length release for rapper Freddie Gibbs features guest appearances from Anderson .Paak, DJ Paul, Moneybagg Yo, Musiq Soulchild, Offset, Kelly Price, Pusha T, Raekwon, Rick Ross, and Scarface.

Title: Mahal
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for Chaz Bear as Toro y Moi features guest appearances from Salami Rose Joe Louis, The Mattson 2, and Sofie.

Title: Leaving None But Small Birds
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between The Body and BIG|BRAVE was recorded, produced and mixed by Seth Manchester.

Title: Reason to Live
Info: The latest full-length solo release for indie artist who was a member of Dinosaur Jr., Sebadoh and The Folk Implosion, was recorded by Marc Seedorf.

Title: The Bitter Truth
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the rock band led by Amy Lee was produced by Nick Raskulinecz.

Title: Italian Ice
Info: The fifth full-length release for the New Jersey singer-songwriter was co-produced with Ben Tanner with contributions from Seth Avett, Britt Daniel, David Hood, Spooner Oldham, Erin Rae, McKenzie Smith, and John Paul White.

Title: What's New, Tomboy?
Info: The latest full-length release for the singer-songwriter from Seattle was self-produced.

Title: Kinshasa Succursale
Info: The Congo-born Belgian-raised rapper returned to the Democratic Republic of the Congo to work with some local musicians on his latest album.

Title: Passenger
Info: The second solo album for the folk singer was produced by Joe Henry.

Title: Leveler
Info: The fourth studio album for the metal band from Pennsylvania was produced by Jason Suecof.

Title: Diamond Mine
Info: King Creosote collaborates with electronica producer Jon Hopkins to rerecord seven of his songs.

Title: Peanut Butter Blues and Melancholy Jam
Info: This is the debut full-length album for British rapper/producer Obaro Ejimiwe.

Title: Peepers
Info: The Mercury Prize-nominated experimental jazz band releases its fourth album.

Title: San Patricio
Info: The concept album about a group of Irish US soldiers who deserted to join the Mexican army during the Mexican-American War was an idea by The Chieftains' Paddy Moloney and co-producer Ry Cooder.

Title: Roll On
Info: The latest album for the blues singer, who most recently collaborated with Eric Clapton on their 2006 Grammy-winning album, "The Road to Escondido."

Title: Receivers
Info: The latest album for the Brooklyn, New York band is the first with new drummer Joe Wong and guitarist Sarah Lipstate.

Title: Who Killed Amanda Palmer
Info: The debut album for the Dresdan Dolls singer was produced with Ben Folds.

Title: Sleepless Nights
Info: The latest album for the country artist was produced by Emory Gordy, Jr.

Title: The Broken String
Info: After releasing an EP every month for a year in 2006, the Brooklyn-based band returns with a full-length album.

Title: The Brag And Cuss
Info: His fifth album finds the Texan singer-songwriter backed by a full band.

Title: Hypnotize
Info: Co-produced by Rick Rubin, this 12-song disc was recorded during the same sessions as 'Mesmerize,' and is intended to be heard with that earlier 2005 disc as one complete set.

Title: Collisions
Info: The New York band returns with a third album.

Title: Mighty Rearranger
Info: The Led Zeppelin singer's first full solo album of original songs in a dozen years finds him backed (as on 2002's 'Dreamland') by The Strange Sensation.

Title: The Difference Between Me And You Is That I'm Not On Fire
Info: Steve Albini returns as producer for the Welsh indie-punk trio's third album.

Title: Almost Killed Me
Info: 'Almost Killed Me' is the debut for the New York City band featuring two former members of Lifter Puller, including band founder Craig Finn. Unlike most recent NYC bands, they draw their influences from classic American rock.

Title: Immortal Memory
Info: Known for her work as half of the 4AD group Dead Can Dance, as well as more recent efforts scoring such films as Gladiator and Whale Rider, Lisa Gerrard here unites with Irish classical composer Patrick Cassidy for ten new tracks, including songs sung in Aramaic, Latin and Gaelic.

Title: Earthquake Glue
Info: The ever-prolific Robert Pollard returns with a brand-new GbV studio disc (the 15th or so since 1987), retaining the core group of musicians that has been with him for the last few albums.

Title: Sumday
Info: The best indie rock band to come out of Modesto, California in quite some time (well, ever, we'd think) returns with a long-awaited fourth LP, arriving a full three years after The Sophtware Slump thanks to worldwide tours and a lengthy recording process.

Title: What Sound
Info: The trip-hop duo continues to expand their sound on their third album, which features guest appearances from Michael Franti (Spearhead), Me'Shell Ndegeocello, Jimi Goodwin (Doves) and the Scratch Perverts.

Title: Uninvisible
Info: The New York-based experimental jazz trio expands its sound on this album by adding turntablists DJ P Love and DJ Olive and a five-piece horn section.

Title: Lost in Revelry
Info: This is the fourth album (and third record label) for the Athens, GA indie outfit.

Title: Kittenz And Thee Glitz
Info: The veteran Chicago house producer offers up 16 tracks of modernized 80's electro (think Daft Punk or Ladytron), highlighted by "Silver Screen (Shower Scene)." The album picked up a great deal of acclaim in the UK when it was released in mid-2001, and finally secured U.S. distribution (through Emperor Norton) in early 2002.

Title: If You're Reading This It's Too Late [Mixtape]
Info: The surprise 17-track mixtape from the Canadian artist features guest appearances from Lil Wayne, PARTYNEXTDOOR, and Travi$ Scott was produced by Noah “40” Shebib and Matthew Jehu Samuels.

Title: II
Info: The second release for the psychedelic rock band led by Ruban Nielson was written while on tour.

Title: Open Door Policy
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the indie rock band was recorded by producer Josh Kaufman and engineer D. James Goodwin.

Title: Fear Of A Black Tangent
Info: 'Fear' is the second solo disc for the unique Los Angeles-based MC (born Regan Farquhar), who is backed here by beats from Daedelus, Danger Mouse, and others.

Title: Deep in the Iris
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian experimental pop trio was produced with Damian Taylor.

Title: Moonshine Freeze
Info: The fourth full-length release for the alternative folk rock project of Kate Stables was produced by John Parish.

Title: Shrink Dust
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Canadian is self-described as his country album.

Title: The Western Lands
Info: The UK indie rock group's fifth album.

Title: Death Peak
Info: The latest release for the British electronic producer features vocal/choral recordings.

Title: Live from KCRW
Info: The fourth live release for the rock band was recorded from two appearances at KCRW's Santa Monica studios in April 2013.

Title: Playing The Angel
Info: Borrowing a page from late-80s to early-90s DM in terms of sound (and possibly even quality), the Ben Hillier-produced 'Angel' is the first Depeche Mode album to feature some David Gahan-penned songs in addition to the usual assortment of Martin Gore tracks.

Title: Discover A Lovelier You
Info: Thom Monahan produced the band's fourth studio album.

Title: Matangi
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British singer/rapper features a guest appearance from The Weekend as well as production from Danja, Doc McKinney, Hit-Boy, Illangelo, The Partysquad, and Switch.

Title: Lullabies To Paralyze
Info: Only Josh Homme remains from the QOTSA's previous LP, and he's now joined by guitarist Troy Van Leeuwen (A Perfect Circle) and drummer Joey Castillo (Danzig). The band's fourth album also includes appearances by Brody Dalle, Shirley Manson and ZZ Top's Billy Gibbons.

Title: The River In Reverse
Info: The British musician teams with legendary New Orleans songwriter and producer Allen Toussaint for this mix of covers and new material.

Title: Dream a Garden
Info: This is the second full-length release for London producer Jack Latham as Jam City.

Title: The  Rip Tide
Info: The New Mexico-based band releases its newest album of indie rock, fusing world music with pop to develop a unique sound all of its own.

Title: General Dome
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based duo was self-produced and recorded.

Title: Dressed Up For The Letdown
Info: This is the second or third album (depending on how you keep score) for the Oregon-by-way-of-Los Angeles singer-songwriter.

Title: South of Reality
Info: The second full-length release for the experimental psychedelic rock duo of Les Claypool and Sean Lennon was self-produced.

Title: Major
Info: The second album for the indie rock band from Rhode Island is a follow-up to its self-titled debut.

Title: Spirit Fiction
Info: The first album on new label Blue Note for the saxophonist Ravi Coltrane features two different groups backing his compositions. One led by his long-time pianist Luis Perdomo, bassist Drew Gress, and drummer E.J. Strickland and the other led by trumpeter Ralph Alessi, pianist Geri Allen, bassist James Genus, and drummer Eric Harland who worked on his second album, From the Round Box.

Title: Up Above
Info: Asian instrumentation is highlighted on the Chicago minimalist, avant-garde outfit's sixth release.

Title: Who's Your New Professor
Info: 'Professor' marks the second solo outing for the Sea And Cake leader. He's backed by the same group of musicians that performed on his previous 1999 release, including S&C bandmate Archer Prewitt and Josh Abrams (Town & Country).

Title: Sensational
Info: The second full-length release for the Danish R&B artist was produced with Natal Zaks.

Title: Christmas Everywhere
Info: The Christmas-themed album from the country singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Daddy Cool & The Yule, Mary Kerr, Brennen Leigh, and Lera Lynn.

Title: Painkillers
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the lead singer of The Gaslight Anthem was produced by Butch Walker.

Title: Chance of Rain
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn artist is a techno-inspired instrumental album.

Title: Planet (i)
Info: The latest full-length release for the indie folk/rock artist from Boston features contributions from Brooke Bentham, Jemima Coulter, Katy J Pearson, Tenci’s Jess Shoman, Tomberlin, her father and her two brothers, Nate and Jameson Williams.

Title: Magic Mirror
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles singer-songwriter was produced by Lewis Pesacov.

Title: The Winter Of Mixed Drinks
Info: The third studio album for the Scottish indie band produced by Peter Katis is its first with new member Gordon Skene.

Title: Cassadaga
Info: Conor Oberst & co. branch out into country and orchestral pop on their latest 13-track set, which finds them joined by guests Gillian Welch, Janet Weiss, and M. Ward.

Title: Remember That I Love You
Info: This is the fifth solo album of anti-folk ditties for the former Moldy Peaches member.

Title: Loose In The Air
Info: Steve Revitte produced the experimental Brooklyn four-piece's third album (and first for Matador).

Title: Tween
Info: Digitally released in June, the Baltimore indie duo of Jenn Wasner and Andy Stack collected and completed eight outtakes from its previous two albums for the band's fifth studio release.

Title: The Power Out
Info: The all-female indie-rock band from Brighton, England (who in the past have crossed Stereolab's love for vintage electronics with a more raucous sound) worked with producer Steve Albini on this second full-length, which incorporates vocals into the mix for the first time.

Title: Cellar Door
Info: Popular San Francisco-based indie producer and former MK Ultra frontman John Vanderslice returns with his fourth solo album.

Title: Love Is Hell, Part 2 [EP]
Info: Adams' 'Love Is Hell' 2-part album concludes with seven more tracks.

Title: The Instinct
Info: The Virginia band's sophomore disc has a more immediate sound compared to their trip-hoppy self-titled debut.

Title: Busted Stuff
Info: Even the most casual DMB fan knows the story by now: Dave & Co. record a dark, challenging album with producer Steve Lillywhite, those "Lillywhite Sessions" are leaked onto the Internet where the tracks quickly become fan favorites, and the band chooses not to release them, instead heading back into the studio with producer Glen Ballard to record 'Everyday.' The new studio LP 'Busted Stuff' does not contain those original tracks from the 2000 sessions, but nine of those songs (plus two new tracks) are here, newly recorded.

Title: Handcream For A Generation
Info: This long-awaited fourth album from the London-based outfit headed by Tjinder Singh and Ben Ayres is an even more eclectic mix of styles than previous efforts. The 13 new tracks include the excellent (and excellently titled) lead single "Lessons Learned From Rocky I to Rocky III," and a reworking of "People Power (In The Disco Hour)" from Singh and Ayres' Clinton side project.

Title: Gold
Info: 'Gold' is the second solo release for former Whiskeytown frontman Ryan Adams, and garnered a good deal of attention for the singer-songwriter in 2001.

Title: Fugu1
Info: French band Fugu mines the pop sounds of the Beach Boys and the Beatles, a la contemporaries Stereolab (who contribute to this album) and Apples In Stereo.

Title: Special
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for Lizzo features contributions from  Benny Blanco, Max Martin, Pop Wansel, Ricky Reed, and Mark Ronson.

Title: Dreamt For Light Years In The Belly Of A Mountain
Info: Mark Linkous' first Sparklehorse album in five years includes collaborations with Danger Mouse, Christian Fennesz, and Tom Waits.

Title: Surviving
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Arizona alt-rock/emo band was produced with Justin Meldal-Johnson.

Title: Made Of Rain
Info: The first new full-length studio release for the English alternative rock band since 1991's World Outside was produced with Richard Fortus.

Title: Gold Past Life
Info: The seventh full-length release for Eric D. Johnson's indie folk-rock project was produced by Thom Monahan and is the first release on the Merge label.

Title: HNDRXX
Info: The second full-length release from the rapper in two weeks features guest appearances from Rihanna and The Weeknd.

Title: Foreign Body
Info: This is the debut album for the side project of Liz Harris of Grouper and Jesy Fortino of Tiny Vipers.

Title: A Sufi And A Killer
Info: Gonjasufi, who appeared on the Flying Lotus track "Testament," releases his debut album with producer Gaslamp Killer.

Title: Transnormal Skiperoo
Info: The fourth album for the Florida-based alt-country singer features the band Olabelle and was produced by Joe Pernice.

Title: Everything Not Saved Will Be Lost, Pt. 1
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by frontman Yannis Philippakis.

Title: Employment
Info: Stephen Street (Blur) produced this debut disc for the Leeds, England five-piece.

Title: Nurture
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Atlanta-based electronic producer features a track Totally Enormous Extinct Dinosaurs.

Title: Dead Reckoning
Info: The third album for the Portland, Oregon, folk rock band was produced by Adam Selzer.

Title: This Is the Sonics
Info: The garage rock band from Tacoma, Washington, return with three original members and producer Jim Diamond for its first studio release since 1967.

Title: The Golden Casket
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the indie rock band was produced with Dave Sardy and Jacknife Lee.

Title: Ordinary Man
Info: The 12th full-length solo studio release for the Black Sabbath singer features guest appearances from Elton John, Post Malone and Travis Scott.

Title: Phantom Brickworks
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for British experimental electronic producer Stephen Wilkinson is mostly improvised musical pieces.

Title: Anthology: Movie Themes 1974-1998
Info: The director/composer re-recorded 13 themes from his films including Halloween Escape From New York, and Assault on Precinct 13 with his son, Cody Carpenter, and godson, Daniel Davies.

Title: Nothing Valley
Info: The debut full-length release for the Chicago indie rock band was recorded in Dave Vettraino's basement studio on 8-track analog tape.

Title: Chaos And Creation In The Backyard
Info: Radiohead producer Nigel Godrich helms the bassist's 20th post-Beatles album, which finds McCartney in true solo mode, playing every instrument on these 13 songs.

Title: Venus in Leo
Info: The first full-length release in five years for the Australian duo of Jonnine Standish and Nigel Yang was self-produced.

Title: Versus
Info: First recorded in 2010, the collaboration between the Detroit techno producer with the Les Siecles Orchestra, French conductor François-Xavier Roth, and Francesco Tristano is finally released.

Title: Dark Sky Island
Info: The eighth studio release for the Irish artist was inspired by Roma Ryan's  poetry books about islands, especially the island of Sark.

Title: Comfort Of Strangers
Info: Jim O'Rourke produced the singer-songwriter's fourth LP.

Title: Call the Comet
Info: The third full-length solo release for the ex-Smiths guitarist was recorded at Manchester's Crazy Face Studios and features a future society at the brink of destruction that ultimately find help from "a different intelligence from the cosmos.'

Title: Clean
Info: The debut full-length release for the Nashville indie singer-songwriter was produced by Gabe Wax and mixed by Ali Chant.

Title: Hendra
Info: The first solo release for the co-founder of Everything But the Girl since 1983's North Marine Drive features contributions from Bernard Butler, David Gilmour, and Tracey Thorn.

Title: Holy Fvck
Info: The eighth full-length release for Demi Lovato features guest appearances from Dead Sara, Royal & the Serpent and YUNGBLUD.

Title: Fungus II
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaborative project of Lightning Bolt's Brian Chippendale and Ty Segall was recorded at Segall's house.

Title: Burnt Offering
Info: Produced by guitarist Thomas Brenneck, the fourth release for the New York-based funk band sees influences from psychedelia and metal music.

Title: 30 Year Low
Info: This is the final album with both Tim Bracy and Shannon McArdle in the group, in light of their divorce.

Title: The World And Everything In It
Info: The second album from the Baltimore band was produced by band leader and vocalist Roman Kuebler.

Title: No Wow
Info: This is the second album for the garage-blues duo of VV and Hotel (known to their parents as Alison Mosshart and Jamie Hince).

Title: In Love With Oblivion
Info: The second album by this Brooklyn band ventures further into the musical landscape of guitar-led experimentation while maintaining a pop sound.

Title: A Bit of Previous
Info: The latest full-length release for Scottish indie pop band Belle And Sebastian was self-produced and features contributions from Kevin Burleigh, Shawn Everett, Brian McNeil, and Matt Wiggins.

Title: Tomb
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was produced by Thomas Bartlett.

Title: The Colour In Anything
Info: The surprise album release of the British electronic producer's third full-length features a collaboration with Bon Iver as well as the track "Radio Silence," which had been the tentative title of the album in 2015.

Title: Genuine Negro Jig
Info: With the help of Joe Thompson--one of the last of North Carolina's African-American string-band players--the trio seeks to continue the style with its third album.

Title: Death Magnetic
Info: The Rick Rubin-produced album for the heavy-metal band is its first to feature Robert Trujillo on bass.

Title: A Different Ship
Info: The third full-length release for the indie rock band from Brooklyn was produced by Nigel Godrich.

Title: Sucker Punch
Info: The debut full-length release for the Norwegian pop artist was produced by Martin Sjølie, Odd Martin Skålnes, and Oscar Holter.

Title: The Marshall Mathers LP
Info: The second full-length from Eminem (aka Marshall Mathers) garnered two Grammys for the rapper and became the fastest-selling rap album in history.

Title: Deep Down Happy
Info: The debut full-length release for the the British indie rock band led by by Alex Rice was produced by Burke Reid.

Title: Gentle Stream
Info: This is the second album from Reine Fiske, Johan Holmegard (both members of the Swedish band, Dungen), and Christopher Gunrup.

Title: DJ-Kicks
Info: The latest from the DJ-Kicks mix series is from Glasgow-based DJ that was influenced by some of his first shows.

Title: The Stimulus Package
Info: On his first album with the Rhymesayers label, rapper Freeway teams up with producer Jake One.

Title: Emancipated Hearts
Info: The debut solo release for the Galaxie 500 and Luna frontman was produced by Jason Quever of Papercuts.

Title: Yesterday Was Lived and Lost
Info: Felix Martin and Al Doyle of Hot Chip along with Tom Hopkins collaborated on their debut album together as New Build.

Title: The Land, the Water, the Sky
Info: The third full-length release for Katherine Paul as Black Belt Eagle Scout was mixed by Nicholas Wilbur.

Title: Odd Blood
Info: This is the second full-length album for the Brooklyn-based rock band.

Title: The Fine Print (A Collection Of Oddities And Rarities 2003-2008)
Info: The collection of b-sides and rare tracks contains songs from the "Dirty South" recording sessions.

Title: Whiteout Conditions
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band led by A.C. Newman does not feature Dan Bejar (he was working on music for a Destroyer album).

Title: World Record
Info: The latest full-length release for Neil Young with Crazy Horse was produced with Rick Rubin and features nine new songs written in 2021.

Title: To Be Everywhere Is to Be Nowhere
Info: The California alternative rock band return from a five year hiatus with its ninth full-length studio release produced by Eric Palmquist.

Title: The  Nihilist
Info: The third full-length solo release for the son of Crowded House's Neil Finn was recorded in Brooklyn.

Title: Third Mouth
Info: The latest solo release from the British singer is a blend of psych rock and ambient pop.

Title: Revelation Road
Info: After releasing two albums in 2010, the singer-songwriter returns with her 12th studio album.

Title: Part II: The New December
Info: Fol Chen continues to embrace mystery and avoid the obvious on Part II: The New December. As on Part I: John Shade, Your Fortuneâ€™s Made, the enigmatic band makes a virtue out of indirectness, sending songs through secret passages and tunnels that end in hooks some distance from where they were expected. Thereâ€™s a strong experimental streak in the brainy way Fol Chen takes what seems like a straightforward idea and twists it into something completely different; like the Dirty Projectors, the group flirts with and subverts mainstream pop ideas, and like labelmates Cryptacize, theyâ€™ve got a flair for the deceptively simple. The band goes even further down the rabbit hole than on Part I, beginning The New December with some of its strangest music. â€œIn Ruinsâ€ contrasts deep, whispered vocals with lively girlish ones atop busy keyboards playing busy, vaguely Eastern-tinged melodies; â€œYour Curtain Callâ€ begins with breathy beats and woozy flutes, expanding into bells and a drunken sax solo before pulling back again; and â€œMen, Houses or Beastsâ€ tiptoes so slowly that it almost sounds like it was recorded at the wrong speed. Fittingly for a band so committed to disguising its identity, some of The New Decemberâ€™s best songs deal with miscommunication and missed connections. On â€œThe Holograms,â€ a tale of forgotten names and words doubling into optical illusions, bounces along on one of the albumâ€™s catchiest melodies, while the excellent â€œC/Uâ€ keeps its lovers apart despite its almost perversely straightforward beat. Likewise, the band buries some of its best songs on the albumâ€™s second half: â€œAdeline (You Always Look so Bored)â€â€™s sharp-tongued chamber pop recalls St. Vincentâ€™s abundant musical and lyrical wit, and â€œThey Came to Meâ€ boasts rubbery beats that are just as danceable as they are strange, and could be heard at a club with a trampoline for a dancefloor. How exactly these songs fit together with â€œHolesâ€â€™ delicate plucking and the title trackâ€™s pixelated folk might be locked in Fol Chenâ€™s brains, but even if there are more pieces of their puzzle-pop missing here than there were on John Shade, Your Fortuneâ€™s Made, The New December is never boring. ~ Heather Phares

Title: Trouble In Dreams
Info: Dan Bejar, the New Pornographer member, releases his ninth album.

Title: Juxtaposition
Info: The third album for the Vienna-based electronica-infused post-rock trio was recorded partially in Austria and partially with John McEntire in Chicago.

Title: Tyrannosaurus Hives
Info: The Swedish garage-rockers return with their third full-length disc.

Title: Hypnotic Underworld
Info: The experimental/psychedelic Japanese collective returns with their first album in five years, with co-founder Taishi Takizawa re-joining the group as a member (in addition to continuing to serve as the band's producer).

Title: stellastarr*
Info: The New-York four piece makes its full-length debut with this 10-track effort that has drawn comparisons to the usual suspects (Joy Division, The Cure, The Pixies, et al) as well as to newer bands who also draw from the same sources (Interpol, Hot Hot Heat, et al).

Title: Sleep And Release
Info: The Glaswegian guitar rockers emerge with their second full-length album, an even more intense affair than their 2001 debut 'Story In White.'

Title: Revelling/Reckoning
Info: The normally prolific DiFranco hasn't released a new album since 1999's 'To The Teeth,' but now she returns with a vengeance: this 2-disc, 2-hour, 29-track collection of new songs. Ani goes solo on about half the tracks; the others feature members of her touring band. Guest musicians include trumpter Jon Hassell, sax man Maceo Parker, and guitarist Lloyd Maines.

Title: Night Music
Info: The debut solo album for the member of the French duo Zombie Zombie was produced by Carl Craig.

Title: I Can Feel You Creep Into My Private Life
Info: The fourth full-length release for Merrill Garbus and Nate Brenner was mixed by Mikaelin "Blue" BlueSpruce.

Title: Come Feel Me Tremble
Info: Named after a recent documentary about him, Westerberg's latest home-recorded solo disc contains some of the songs first heard in that film, as well as new material. It was released concurrently with 'Dead Man Shake' by his alter-ego, Grandpaboy.

Title: Typical Music
Info: The sixth full-length solo release for The Charlatans' Tim Burgess features a guest appearance by Pearl Charles.

Title: Possible Dust Clouds
Info: The 10th full-length solo studio release for the Throwing Muses singer is her first on the Fire Records label.

Title: The House That Jack Built
Info: The third album for the Manchester, England-based singer-songwriter was co-produced with Shawn Everett, Blake Mills, and Tony Berg.

Title: Bloom
Info: The fourth full-length release for the indie pop band was produced by Chris Coady.

Title: Mothertongue
Info: The sophomore album for the New York composer is divided into three suites of music.

Title: Hold On Baby
Info: The second full-length release for Brooklyn-based artist King Princess features a guest appearance from Fousheé.

Title: Best Troubador
Info: Will Oldham's tribute album to Merle Haggard features contributions from Van Campbell, Mary Feiock, Emmett Kelly, Nuala Kennedy, Danny Kiley, Drew Miller, Cheyenne Mize, A.J. Roach, Chris Rodahoffer, and Matt Sweeney.

Title: The  English Riviera
Info: The third album for the electronic band was produced by its lead singer, Joseph Mount.

Title: Run Rabbit Run
Info: The string quartet performs Sufjan Stevens' 2001 album, "Enjoy Your Rabbit."

Title: The Bride
Info: The fourth full-length release for Natasha Khan is a concept album about a woman who takes her honeymoon trip alone after her fiance was killed just before their wedding.

Title: Play It Strange
Info: The third full-length album for the San Francisco indie band was recorded over a week.

Title: Why There Are Mountains
Info: This is the debut album for the New York rock quartet.

Title: II
Info: The second full-length release for the Canadian trio was produced by Graham Walsh.

Title: Tron: Legacy
Info: The Grammy award-winning electronic dance duo--and their masked identities portraying them as man-machines--make a logical pairing to score the soundtrack of the innovative science fiction film.

Title: Springtime Can Kill You
Info: This is the second studio solo set for the folk singer-songwriter who also performs with the Be Good Tanyas.

Title: Tooth
Info: The second full-length release for the British electronic duo of Joe Andrews and Tom Halstead was inspired by Raime side-project Moin's 2013 self-titled EP.

Title: Seeds
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the indie rock band is its first since the death of bassist Gerald Smith and was produced by guitarist David Sitek.

Title: Several Shades of Why
Info: With sparse percussion and acoustic instrumentation, the Dinosaur Jr guitarist, singer and songwriter releases a solo album of low-key, unplugged tunes.

Title: Ships
Info: The latest disc from the Danielson Famile's Daniel Smith boasts--in addition to a shorter band name--a whopping 34 contributors, including Sufjan Stevens, Steve Albini, and the members of Why?.

Title: Ape In Pink Marble
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was written, produced, arranged, and recorded with Noah Georgeson and Josiah Steinbrick.

Title: Time to Go Home
Info: The second full-length release for the Seattle post-punk band was recorded in a deconsecrated church and mixed by Wire guitarist Matthew Sim.

Title: Rise Above
Info: Dave Longstreth reimagines Black Flag's album "Damaged."

Title: Get Yr Blood Sucked Out
Info: This fourth album marks the Barsuk debut for the eclectic Portland, Ore. husband-and-wife duo of Kevin and Anita Robinson.

Title: Here's To Taking It Easy
Info: The Matthew Houck-led band returns with its first album of new material since 2007's Pride.

Title: Jake Shears
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Scissor Sisters frontman was produced by Kevin Ratterman and features members from My Morning Jacket and the Preservation Hall Jazz Band.

Title: Elytral
Info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Thom Monahan.

Title: Ibeyi
Info: The debut full-length release for the French-Cuban twins Naomi and Lisa-Kaindé Díaz (daughters of Buena Vista Social Club percussionist Miguel Díaz) includes influences from Cuban folk music, electronic, French jazz, R&B and pop music.

Title: Phantom Radio
Info: The ninth full-length studio release from the ex-Screaming Trees singer was produced by Alain Johannes and features contributions from Duke Garwood, Sietse van Gorkom, and Shelley Brien.

Title: Creatures of an Hour
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the British quartet led by American-born Greg Hughes and Tessa Murray.

Title: Friend And Foe
Info: This second song-based album of unconventional indie-rock from the Portland, Ore. trio marks their Barsuk debut.

Title: Live A Little
Info: Joe Pernice & co. return with an album produced by Michael Deming.

Title: Hey Clockface
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter  was produced with Sebastian Krys and recorded in Helsinki, New York and Paris.

Title: Sculptor
Info: The third full-length release for the Australian duo of Zoe Randell and Steve Hassett features contributions from The National’s Aaron Dessner, Matt Eccles, J Mascis, Dave Nelson, and Jim White of Dirty Three.

Title: Promises Promises
Info: The sophomore album from the New Zealand trio.

Title: *Happiness Not Included
Info: The first full-length studio release in 20 years for British synth-pop duo Soft Cell features a song collaboration with the Pet Shop Boys.

Title: Tasjan! Tasjan! Tasjan!
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter was produced with Gregory Lattimer.

Title: Storm Damage
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the former Everything But The Girl member features a guest appearance from Alan Sparhawk of Low.

Title: The Salt Doll Went to Measure the Depth of the Sea
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Rhode Island indie folk band was inspired by a Buddhist fable about a doll made of salt who searches for herself by going into the sea.

Title: My Way Home
Info: The fifth full-length release for the R&B/soul singer was recorded over four days and features influences of more gospel and blues than his previous album.

Title: Still Smiling
Info: The 12-track release from German musician Blixa Bargeld and Italian composer Teho Teardo took nearly two years, with recording done in Berlin and Rome.

Title: The Bunkhouse, Vol. 1: Anchor Black Tattoo
Info: The fourth release fro the Irish singer-songwriter was recorded at his home studio.

Title: Lights Out
Info: The third full-length release for the Swedish metal band was produced by Don Alsterberg.

Title: Goodbye Terrible Youth
Info: Ex-Working For A Nuclear Free City guitarist Gary McClure added Ian Reitz, Josh Van Hoorebeke, and his wife, Bridgette Imperial for his second full-length release as American Wrestlers.

Title: Happy in the Hollow
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock band was self-produced and self-mixed.

Title: The Heart Is a Monster
Info: The first full-length in nearly 20 years for the alternative rock band was self-produced.

Title: Seabed
Info: This is the full-length debut release for the London-based indie electronic trio of Lewis Rainsbury, Matt Law, and Alex Bailey.

Title: Kill My Blues
Info: The second release for the band led by the Sleater-Kinney singer-guitarist is said to be more collaborative.

Title: Carousel Waltz
Info: The third album for the indie-pop outfit is, for one thing, a lot shorter (at 30 minutes) than their previous double-album effort On Vacation.

Title: A Long Hot Summer
Info: 9th Wonder is among the producers on the veteran Brooklyn MC's fifth full-length (rumored to be his last), a prequel to previous disc ?Disposable Arts.' Guests include Rahzel, Jean Grae and The Beatnuts.

Title: On! Air! Library!
Info: This self-titled disc marks the debut for the unique-sounding New York post-rock/experimental trio of Philip Wann and twin sisters Claudia and Alley Deheza. Steve Rivette (Liars) produced, with guest drumming from Interpol's Sam Fogarino.

Title: Two Way Monologue
Info: 21-year-old Norwegian pop singer-songwriter Sondre Lerche returns with his second U.S. release.

Title: So Stylistic
Info: This debut LP for the Brooklyn retro rap outfit (consisting of three female vocalists--including two high school students--backed by a pair of DJs) includes their surprise hit single, "Cameltoe."

Title: Soul Journey
Info: The talented singer-songwriter reunites with producer David Rawlings for her fourth album.

Title: The Hour of Bewilderbeast
Info: The debut full-length album from Damon Gough (who records under the Badly Drawn Boy name) earned Britain's Mercury Prize for Best Album in 2000.

Title: Tremors
Info: This is the debut full-length release for Vienna-based British electronic producer Christopher Taylor.

Title: Bish Bosch
Info: The first studio solo release for the American-born singer-songwriter since 2006's The Drift was recorded over three years.

Title: Welcome Break
Info: The second full-length release for the Dutch quartet was recorded over three weeks and was self-produced.

Title: Treefight for Sunlight
Info: Originally released in the UK in February 2011 with the title Treefight for Sunlight, this is the debut album from the Danish quartet.

Title: In Love & War
Info: The fourth album for the R&B singer features Fabolous, Lil Wayne, and Trey Songz as a guest artists.

Title: Ambulance Ltd
Info: This self-titled effort marks the full-length debut for the Brooklyn-based shoegazers.

Title: How to Dance
Info: The third full-length release for the North Carolina trio features guest appearances from Amy Ray, Angel Olsen, and Mirah Zeitllyn.

Title: Let's Cry and Do Pushups at the Same Time
Info: This is the second full-length release for Brooklyn producer Luke Wyatt as Torn Hawk.

Title: Koloss
Info: This is the seventh album for the Swedish progressive metal band.

Title: Life Like
Info: The fourth album for the indie-rock duo from North Carolina.

Title: The Waterfall
Info: The seventh full-length release for the indie rock band led by Jim James was recorded near Stinson Beach, California with Tucker Martine.

Title: Is Is [EP]
Info: The New York band releases its latest EP, written during the Fever To Tell tour.

Title: Country Sleep
Info: The debut full-length release from Winston Yellen was written and recorded in a rented Nashville house previously owned by Johnny Cash and June Carter.

Title: ArtScience
Info: Written and produced together for the first time, the latest release for the group that features influences of jazz, R&B, hip-hop and pop was recorded in New Orleans.

Title: You & Me
Info: The sales of the digital version of the band's latest album will be donated to Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center and the Joy Fund.

Title: Cornershop & the Double-O Groove Of
Info: The British indie rock band collaborate with Bubbley Kaur to create a Punjabi folk-tinged new album.

Title: Under Great White Northern Lights [Live]
Info: The live album features recording from the duo's summer tour of Canada in 2007 which was also filmed for a documentary of the same name.

Title: Multi-Love
Info: The third full-length release for the psych-rock band led by Ruben Nielson includes contributions from his brother Cody and his father Chris.

Title: Next Thing
Info: This is the second full-length studio release for the indie-pop project of Greta Kline.

Title: Light Information
Info: The sixth full-length release fro the Canadian indie artist was self-produced.

Title: Terms of Surrender
Info: The latest full-length release for the folk-rock band led by MC Taylor was produced with Brad Cook.

Title: Strange Peace
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian noise rock trio of  Alex Edkins, Chris Slorach and Hayden Menzies was produced by Steve Albini.

Title: The Haze
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British rock band is its first with new drummer Tommy Davidson was produced by Ross Orton.

Title: Cayamo Sessions at Sea
Info: Buddy Miller invited such artists as Brandi Carlile, Shawn Colvin, Kris Kristofferson, The Lone Bellow, Kacey Musgraves, Lucinda Williams, and Lee Ann Womack on the annual Cayamo Festival Cruise to perform and record their performances.

Title: Love + War
Info: The debut full-length release for the British R&B singer Kwabena Sarkodee Adjepong features production from SOHN and Dave Okumu.

Title: Breaks & Bone
Info: The latest release for the Scottish flamenco-influenced guitarist was produced by Paul Savage.

Title: Featherbrain
Info: The fourth album for the Norwegian experimentalist features Erik Vister as a guest performer.

Title: The Broken Wave
Info: The debut album for the British folk singer was produced by Mike Lindsay of Tunng.

Title: The Sea
Info: The second album for the British singer includes darker-themed songs influenced by the death of her husband.

Title: Constant Future
Info: The Brooklyn-based band releases another noise-rock album, this time featuring a slightly more pop sound than previous proto-punk efforts.

Title: City of No Reply
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the ex-member of Dirty Projectors was produced partly by David Longstreth.

Title: You, Whom I Have Always Hated/Released from Love
Info: The collaboration between the heavy metal bands The Body and Thou includes the previously vinyl-only four-track EP release with six additional tracks recorded during their tour in July 2014.

Title: That's Harakiri
Info: This is the debut full-length release for Milwaukee-based grime producer Peter Runge.

Title: Two Sunsets
Info: Scotland's Pastels and Japan's Tenniscoats release their first album together, which was recorded over a three year period while the bands were touring.

Title: Fast Food
Info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Ben Hiller.
The indie rock trio led by Low guitarist Alan Sparhawk releases its second album.

Title: Earth Suck
Info: The second full-length release for the Chicago metal band was recorded by Matt Russell.

Title: Aftershock
Info: The 21st studio release for the British metal band led by Lemmy Kilmister was produced by Cameron Webb.

Title: Flourish // Perish
Info: Keyboardist Katie Lee left the band before the completion of the Canadian trio's mostly guitar-less second full-length release.

Title: Family of Love
Info: The Massachusetts trio releases a second EP to follow-up its first release, "Sun Bronzed Greek Gods" with more indie-pop and synth-heavy songs.

Title: Sad Songs For Dirty Lovers
Info: This is the second album for the Brooklyn- (formerly Ohio-) based indie rockers fronted by singer Matt Berninger.

Title: I'm Staying Out
Info: This sophomore effort for the former Whiskeytown member was, like her acclaimed 2002 debut, produced by Chris Stamey. Mary Chapin Carpenter and Mitch Easter are among numerous guests on the album.

Title: On Top
Info: This third album for the Jersey City rockers (who come across a bit like an emo Tenacious D) was produced by Steve Albini.

Title: Feminist Sweepstakes
Info: Kathleen Hanna (also of Bikini Kill) returns for her second album with Le Tigre, the follow-up to the band's well-received 1999 debut.

Title: Change Is Coming
Info: "Money" Mark Nishita has worked with the Dust Brothers and the Beastie Boys. This is his third album and first for Emperor Norton.

Title: Songs In A Minor
Info: This is the smash-hit debut album from 20-year-old singer-songwriter (and classically-trained pianist) Alicia Keys.

Title: We Are Him
Info: The fifth album includes contributions from Akron/Family, Bill Rieflin, Julia Kent, and Christoph Hahn.

Title: Sleep of Reason
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the London-based electronic producer, Benjamin Stefanski.

Title: More Fish
Info: This quick follow-up to 'Fishscale' includes production work from Pete Rock, Madlib and Hi-Tek.

Title: A People's History of Gauche
Info: This is the debut full-length release on Merge label for the Washington, D.C. band that includes Daniele Yandel of Priests and Mary Jane Regalado of Downtown Boys.

Title: Lust for Life
Info: The fourth full-length release for the pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from ASAP Rocky, Sean Ono Lennon, Stevie Nicks, Playboi Carti, and The Weeknd.

Title: Dance on the Blacktop
Info: The third full-length release for the Philadelphia shoegaze band led by Domenic Palermo was produced by John Agnello.

Title: Mean Love
Info: The fourth release for Ahmed Gallab expands his African-influenced soul sound with aspects of country, pop, and reggae music.

Title: Black Pumas
Info: The debut full-length release for the Austin duo of Adrian Quesada and Eric Burton who were named Best New Band at the 2019 Austin Music Awards.

Title: Sold Out
Info: The debut mini-album for the North Carolina producer features guest appearances from DJ Earl, DJ Taye, Feloneezy, Jackie Dagger, Keiska, Nangdo and Tielsie.

Title: In League with Dragons
Info: The 17th full-length studio release for the indie folk band led by John Darnielle was produced by Owen Pallett.

Title: Restless Ones
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Ohio indie rock band was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Modern Guilt
Info: The 10th album for the Los Angeles artist was produced by Brian "Danger Mouse" Burton.

Title: Kingdom Of Rust
Info: The fourth album for the British rock band was co-produced with Dan Austin and John Leckie.

Title: Love Kraft
Info: Mario Caldato Jr. (Beastie Boys) produced the Furries' follow-up to 2003's "Phantom Power," which sees all of the band members (rather than just Gruff Rhys) taking turns at writing and singing. There are no Welsh songs this time out, although there is one in Portugese.

Title: No Highs
Info: The latest full-length release from Canadian electronic artist Tim Hecker features contributions from Colin Stetson.

Title: The Melodic Blue
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Kendrick Lamar, Travis Scott and Don Toliver

Title: Temporary High in the Violet Skies
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based R&B artist features guest appearances from James Fauntleroy and Tyler, The Creator.

Title: Among the Ghosts
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Memphis alt-country band was recorded live in studio with Matt Ross-Sprang.

Title: Sad Clowns & Hillbillies
Info: The 23rd full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter feature Carlene Carter (daughter of June Carter Cash) and a track with Martina McBride.

Title: Take Her Up to Monto
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Irish singer-songwriter features some songs from the same recording sessions as her 2015's Hairless Toys.

Title: Mandatory Fun
Info: The latest release for the musical humorist "Weird Al" Yankovic features parodies of songs sung by Iggy Azalea, Imagine Dragons, Lorde, Robin Thicke, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Guilty of Everything
Info: The debut full-length release for the Philadelphia band led by Domenic Palermo was produced by Jeff Zeigler.

Title: The Year of Magical Drinking
Info: This is the debut album for the indie rock band led by former Broken West member Ross Flournoy.

Title: Crystal Castles [2010]
Info: The second self-titled album for the Canadian duo was recorded in a variety of places, including a garage in Detroit, a church in Iceland, a cabin in Canada, and a real music studio in London.

Title: I Know You're Married But I've Got Feelings Too
Info: The sophomore album for the sister of Rufus Wainwright includes a track written by Annie Lennox and Dave Stewart.

Title: In the Shape of a Storm
Info: The latest release for the now Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was recorded in two hours with only "occasional accompaniment from Josh Gordon."

Title: I'm Bad Now
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian band led by Nigel Chapman was recorded and mixed by Howard Bilerman and Mike Wright.

Title: For the Sake of Bethel Woods
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for Texas folk rock band Midlake was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Beach House III
Info: The second full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from 24hrs, Future, Lauren Jauregui, Tory Lanez, Swae Lee, Lil Wayne, MadeinTYO, Damian Marley, Skrillex, The-Dream, Pharrell Williams and Wiz Khalifa.

Title: C'Mon Miracle
Info: The third full-length for indie singer-songwriter Mirah Yom Tov Zeitlyn was recorded with Calvin Johnson and Phil Elverum (The Microphones).

Title: 72 Seasons
Info: The first full-length studio release of new material from heavy metal band Metallica since 2016's Hardwired... to Self-Destruct was produced with Greg Fidelman.

Title: Lily We Need to Talk Now
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Palberta band member was produced by Nate Amos.

Title: Stars Are the Light
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Portland-based psychedelic rock duo of Ripley Johnson and Sanae Yamada was mixed by Sonic Boom.

Title: Office Politics
Info: The 12th full-length release for the orchestral pop band led by Neil Hannon was recorded in London and Ireland.

Title: Laughing Matter
Info: The 5th LP from the L.A.-based psych-rock band is a 15-song double-album.

Title: Deeper Woods
Info: The third full-length release for the North Carolina folk singer-songwriter was self-produced and mixed by Jason Meagher.

Title: International Blackjazz Society
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Norwegian group led by  Jørgen Munkeby was mixed by Sean Beavan.

Title: The Sovereign Self
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Scottish folk rock band was influenced by Greek tragedies, psychedelia, early-70s prog and rock music.

Title: Hard Boiled Soft Boiled
Info: The second full-length release for the Canadian band led by Dean Tzenos was produced by Colin Stewart.

Title: Privateering
Info: The double-disc release for the former Dire Straits leader was co-produced with Guy Fletcher and Chuck Ainlay.

Title: The Raven That Refused to Sing and Other Stories
Info: Co-produced with Alan Parsons, the third solo release from Steven Wilson was based on short stories the Porcupine Tree singer/guitarist wrote or co-wrote with Hajo Mueller.

Title: Away from the World
Info: The seventh studio album for the alternative rock band sees the return of their first producer Steve Lillywhite, who worked on the band's first three studio albums.

Title: Far Side Virtual
Info: The sounds of an electronic device-driven world are the influences on Ferraro's first full-length release on the Hippos in Tanks label.

Title: Steeple
Info: This is the first album on the Jagjaguwar label for the British rock quartet.

Title: Lucky
Info: The fifth album for the trio from New York was produced by John Goodmanson.

Title: Dying In Stereo
Info: This mini-album marks the debut for the New York-based all-female hip-hop trio (think "Beastie Girls" and you won't be too far off).

Title: Selling Live Water
Info: This is the latest challenging release for Sole, one of the founders of the anticon collective of underground hip-hop artists.

Title: Three
Info: The aptly named 'Three' is the third solo release for graphic artist/Sea And Cake guitarist Archer Prewitt.

Title: Age Of The Sun
Info: The Sunshine Fix is a 60s-themed side project for Olivia Tremor Control's Bill Doss.

Title: Circulatory System
Info: After the breakup of Olivia Tremor Control, Will Hart went on to form Circulatory System along with fellow musicians from that group as well as others, such as Jeff Magnum (Neutral Milk Hotel). This is their debut release.

Title: Friends of Rachel Worth
Info: The first new release in 12 years from the influential Australian band features founding members Robert Forster and Grant McLennan with backing from members of Sleater-Kinney.

Title: The Voyager
Info: The first solo release for the former Rilo Kiley frontwoman in six years was produced by Ryan Adams and Mike Viola.

Title: Trees Outside The Academy
Info: The Sonic Youth singer releases his first solo album since 1995 on his own label.

Title: Hey Venus!
Info: Hey Venus! is the Welsh band's follow-up to Love Kraft.

Title: Fallen Angels
Info: Produced by Jack Frost, the latest release from the singer-songwriter features cover songs written by such artists as Harold Arlen, Sammy Cahn, Carolyn Leigh and Johnny Mercer.

Title: Faithful Man
Info: The latest album for the soul singer was produced by Jeff Silverman and Leon Michels.

Title: I Can't Imagine
Info: The 13th studio release for the singer-songwriter was self-produced.

Title: Bajas Fresh
Info: The first full-length non-collaborative release for the Chicago experimental electronic trio in three years.

Title: Idols Of Exile
Info: Howie Beck produced this latest studio outing for the Toronto singer-songwriter, who is also a member of Broken Social Scene. Many members of that band guest on this record, including Emily Haines and Kevin Drew.

Title: Love Hates What You Become
Info: The second full-length release for the British duo of Ebony Hoorn and Ellery James Roberts was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Broke With Expensive Taste
Info: Originally set to be released in 2012, the debut full-length studio album from the New York rapper surfaces as a digital release.

Title: First of a Living Breed
Info: The third full-length release for the new York rapper was producer by Jonwayne and is his first on the Stones Throw label.

Title: King
Info: Atlanta rapper Tip Harris (who also stars in the current theatrical release "ATL") returns with a fourth album, which finds him joined by Young Jeezy, Jamie Foxx, Pharrell, and Common.

Title: Californian Soil
Info: The third full-length release for the British trio features production from Charlie Andrew, Everton Nelson, George FitzGerald, and Steve Mac.

Title: No Cross No Crown
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the North Carolina metal band sees the return of singer/guitarist Pepper Keenan and was produced by John Custer.

Title: Prophet
Info: This is the second album from the ex-Menomena band member Brent Knopf as Ramona Falls.

Title: Dream Attic
Info: The live album was recorded during Richard Thompson's tour of the West Coast in February, with a majority of the tracks from performances at San Francisco's Great American Music Hall.

Title: V
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie rock band led by Nathan Williams was produced by Woody Jackson.

Title: Frkwys, Vol. 9: Icon Give Thank
Info: Sun Araw and M. Geddes Gengras who traveled to Jamaica to work with The Congos on the ninth entry in RVNG Intl.’s FRKWYS series.

Title: Celebration, Florida
Info: The New York folk-rock quintet drop their eighth album of roots rock and Americana, tinged with a country sound that combines the use of electronic-based instrumentation.

Title: Root For Ruin
Info: This is the fifth album for the New York City rock band led by Tim Harrington.

Title: "Awaken, My Love!"
Info: The third full-length release for the hip hop artist/actor Donald Glover features influences of funk and soul music.

Title: Insides
Info: This is the second full-length release for British electronic artist Michael Greene.

Title: Order of Noise
Info: This is the debut full-length release for Bristol-based electronic producer, Sebastian Gainsborough.

Title: Dear
Info: Originally intended as the last album for the Japanese experimental metal band, but they came out of the recording studio with three albums worth of material.

Title: Valende
Info: 'Valende' is the third album overall and American debut for the Italian psychedelic rock band Jennifer Gentle. (Note that there is nobody in the band actually named Jennifer, and we are unsure about exactly how gentle they are.)

Title: Undivided Heart & Soul
Info: The third full-length release for the rock artist was produced with Dan Molad and features contributions from Nicole Atkins, Holly Laessig & Jess Wolfe of Lucius, Jack Lawrence, Aaron Lee Tasjan, and Butch Walker.

Title: Cotonou Club
Info: The Benin group who first gained fame in the 1970s releases its first studio album in more than 20 years.

Title: Emotional Mugger
Info: The eighth full-length release for the garage rock artist was produced with F Bermudez.

Title: This Is For The White In Your Eye
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the Danish group.

Title: Three Easy Pieces
Info: Singer/guitarist Bill Janovitz had dismissed ideas of a reunion over the years, but Buffalo Tom is back with their new album since 1998.

Title: The Tree of Forgiveness
Info: Produced by Dave Cobb, the first release of new songs in 13 years for the singer-songwriter features contributions from such artists as Dan Auerbach, Brandi Carlile, Jason Isbell, and Amanda Shires.

Title: The Classic Symptoms of a Broken Spirit
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for British metalcore band Architects was produced by Dan Searle and guitarist Josh Middleton, with frontman Sam Carter providing additional production.

Title: Dream Nails
Info: The second full-length release for the British all-female punk/riot grrrl band was produced and mixed by Tarek Musa.

Title: AFI (The Blood Album)
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the alternative rock quartet was produced by band guitarist, Jade Puget, with co-production by Matt Hyde.

Title: Daughter
Info: The latest full-length release for the Ohio singer-songwriter was recorded in Chicago with producer Tom Schick.

Title: The  Phoenix
Info: The debut full-length release for King Britt as Fhloston Paradigm combines electronic music with science fiction movie soundtrack elements.

Title: Live at the South Bank
Info: Swedish saxophonist Mats Gustafsson joined the last collaboration of Steve Reid and Kieran Hebden of Four Tet on this final album from Reid, who died in April 2010.

Title: W.A.R. (We Are Renegades)
Info: The New York-based rapper known for his complex rhyming ability and lyrical social commentary releases his third studio album on Duck Down Records.

Title: Rivers
Info: The husband-and-wife Swedish duo's third album was recorded with an Icelandic choir.

Title: Pieces of April [Soundtrack]
Info: Stephin Merritt's soundtrack to the film "Pieces of April" includes previously released tracks from his bands The 6ths and Magnetic Fields, as well as four brand new songs from the latter.

Title: Who Will Cut Our Hair When We're Gone?
Info: This is the second album for the lo-fi indie-pop trio based in Montreal, Canada.

Title: A Mark, A Mission, A Brand, A Scar
Info: This is the fourth album for the Florida-based emo band led by Christopher Carraba.

Title: Kill Them With Kindness
Info: The Los Angeles-based indie-rock band led by Blair Shehan (formerly of Knapsack) makes its long-awaited full-length debut after several years of touring with bands ranging from Death Cab For Cutie to the Foo Fighters.

Title: From Every Sphere
Info: Nominated for Britain's Mercury Music Prize for his 2001 debut 'Here Be Monsters,' DIYer Ed Harcourt returns with his second studio recording.

Title: Machine Says Yes
Info: Forget the Chemical Brothers; British producer/DJs Dan and John Kahuna really are brothers, and this, their debut LP, plays like a tour of electronica, venturing from electro to disco to acid to downtempo.

Title: On
Info: This is the third album for the San Francisco band featuring drummer Lynn Perko and former Faith No More keyboardist Roddy Bottum.

Title: Quality Control
Info: Although Los Angeles-based rappers Jurassic 5 formed in 1995, 2000's "Quality Control" is their first full-length release.

Title: Original Motion Picture Score for The Virgin Suicides
Info: The soundtrack to Sofia Coppola's film features instrumental tracks from Air, as well as the single "Playground Love," featuring vocals from Gordon Tracks.

Title: Tamer Animals
Info: Such orchestral instruments as the bassoon, cello, clarinet, trumpet, and violin are featured on the second album from Oklahoma indie rock band Other Lives, previously known as Kunek.

Title: Weirdo Shrine
Info: The second full-length release for the Seattle-based indie rock band was recorded in a Southern California surf shop and produced by Ty Segall.

Title: Boot!
Info: The latest release for the Scandinavian free jazz trio of baritone saxophonist Mats Gustafsson, bassist Ingebrigt Håker Flaten, and drummer Paal Nilssen-Love includes three originals and two jazz standards.

Title: Born Like This
Info: The latest album for Daniel Dumile, who dropped MF from his name and now goes by Doom.

Title: We Move
Info: The third full-length release from the Irish singer-songwriter features production from Nineteen85, Two Inch Punch, and Frank Dukes.

Title: Non-Believers
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Superchunk frontman under his own name features influences from 1980s music.

Title: At War with Reality
Info: The Swedish death metal band releases its first studio album since 1995's Slaughter Of The Soul.

Title: Invisible Life
Info: This is the third full-length Latin electronic pop release from Roberto Carlos Lange as Helado Negro.

Title: Have You Lost Your Mind Yet?
Info: The latest full-length release for the two-time Grammy winner was inspired by socially and politically-aware albums from 1960s-70s.

Title: Tasmania
Info: The eighth full-length release for the Australian psychedelic rock band was produced with Tame Impala's Kevin Parker

Title: Wildest Dreams
Info: The debut release from the psychedelic rock band led by Harvey W. Bassett (aka DJ Harvey) with three members of Orgone: Dan Hastie, Ethan Phillips, and Sergio Rios.

Title: The Gloaming
Info: This is the debut Irish folk-influenced release for the collaboration from Martin Hayes, Thomas Bartlett aka Doveman, Iarla Ó Lionaird, Dennis Cahill and Caoimhín Ó Raghallaigh.

Title: Oro: Opus Primum
Info: The Italian metal trio's sixth album is part one of a planned two-part epic (Oro: Opus Alter is due in September, 2012).

Title: Palermo Snow
Info: The British guitarist releases his first solo album since 1998's Traveller's Prayer.

Title: Trying Hartz
Info: The two-disc collection of live shows and radio recordings covers the years of 1994 to 2004.

Title: There's a Riot Going On
Info: The 15th full-length release for the New Jersey indie rock trio is its first featuring new songs since 2013's Fade.

Title: Silver Tongue
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter was recorded in Brooklyn and is her first on the Merge label.

Title: Process
Info: This is the full-length debut release for the Brooklyn industrial rock duo of Rick Daniel and Noah Kardos-Fein.

Title: We Will Always Be
Info: The husband-and-wife duo of Carl Hultgren and Windy Weber release their eighth album that began as a solo album by Carl to be a Valentine's Day present to Windy.

Title: Moderat
Info: Modeselektor and Apparat team up to release their first full-lenth album together.

Title: It's Real
Info: The second full-length release for the Washington, D.C. alternative rock trio was produced by Jonah Takagi and mixed by Collin Dupuis.

Title: En Är För Mycket och Tusen Aldrig Nog
Info: The latest full-length release for Gustav Ejstes-led Swedish collective Dungen was produced by Mattias Glavå.

Title: Out of the Game
Info: The seventh solo album from the singer-songwriter was produced by Mark Ronson and features Nels Cline of Wilco; The Dap-Kings; Sean Lennon, Martha Wainwright; Andrew Wyatt from Miike Snow; and Nick Zinner of Yeah Yeah Yeahs as guest musicians.

Title: Waterfall II
Info: The eighth full-length release for the rock band led by Jim James features 10 tracks from the same recording sessions as 2015's The Waterfall.

Title: Emotions and Math
Info: The debut full-length release for the Brooklyn-based singer-songwriter was mixed by Shawn Everett.

Title: Nux Vomica
Info: Nick Launay produced this sophomore set for the New Zealand band led by Finn Andrews, who has drawn numerous Nick Cave comparisons. Aside from Andrews, it's a completely different lineup than the one that recorded 'Runaway Found.'

Title: The Repulsion Box
Info: Victor Van Vugt (Nick Cave, Beth Orton, PJ Harvey) produced this debut disc for the Glaswegian band.

Title: Eyehategod
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the New Orleans hardcore band is the final album with drummer Joey LaCaze, who passed away in August of 2013.

Title: Chief
Info: Nashville's country-rocker releases his third studio album.

Title: Big Balloon
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British indie pop band was co-produced by Brendan Williams and Phil Bulleyment.

Title: Dead & Born & Grown
Info: The debut full-length release for the folk-rock sisters Emily, Jessica, and Camilla Staveley-Taylor was produced by the father-and-son team of Glyn and Ethan Johns.

Title: Moonbuilding 2703 AD
Info: This is the 13th studio release for the electronic duo of of Alex Paterson and Thomas Fehlmann.

Title: A Legendary Christmas
Info: The holiday album from the R&B singer was produced by Raphael Saadiq feature guest appearances from Esperanza Spalding and Stevie Wonder.

Title: Bad Witch
Info: The six-track project is the third and final part of a planned trilogy of EPs for Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross.

Title: Impossible Dream
Info: The latest solo release for the Minnesota-based singer-songwriter was produced with Jacob Hanson.

Title: Last of the Country Gentlemen
Info: The debut album from the country-folk artist takes the unadorned simplicity of acoustic guitar and emotional vocals to create bittersweet songs of love, hate and life.

Title: Love Letter
Info: Taking his sound back to Motown, the R&B hit maker tones down his controversial image, releasing classic love songs inspired by '50s and '60s slow jams.

Title: The  Fool
Info: The LA-based indie band's album continues its excursion into experimental rock infused with psychedelic soundscapes and dreamy, melodic vocals.

Title: Infest the Rats' Nest
Info: The 15th full-length studio release for the Australian psychedelic rock band features heavy metal influences.

Title: Spoils
Info: The latest album from the Scottish singer-songwriter features his drummer from Appendix Out.

Title: To the Bone
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for the British progressive pop artist features guest appearances from Sophie Hunger and Ninet Tayeb.

Title: Axe To Fall
Info: The latest album for the punk rock band features guest artists from such bands as Cave In, Genghis Tron, Neurosis, and Hatebreed.

Title: The Man with the Iron Fists [OST]
