Info: The Wu Tang's RZA releases a soundtrack to his martial arts film of the same name featuring tracks by such artists as The Black Keys, Ghostface Killah, Freddie Gibbs, Method Man, Pharoahe Monch, Kanye West, and Wiz Khalifa.

Title: The Revenant [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
Info: Ryuichi Sakamoto worked with Alva Noto, and Bryce Dessner on the soundtrack of Alejandro G. Iñárritu's 2015 film starring Leonardo DiCaprio.

Title: For The Season
Info: This is the second album for the garage-psych outfit led by Greg Ashley.

Title: The Baby
Info: The debut full-length release for the New York singer-songwriter was recorded with producers Caleb Hinz, Hippo Campus' Jake Luppen and Nathan Stocker.

Title: 1992 Deluxe
Info: The debut full-length studio release from the New York rapper Destiny Frasqueri features remastered tracks from her 2016 mixtape and eight new tracks.

Title: Ceremony
Info: The second release for the Swedish singer has already nominated for Swedish Grammys and a Nordic Music Prize.

Title: Signed and Sealed in Blood
Info: Flogging Molly's Ted Hutt returns to produce the eighth studio release for the Boston punk rock band.

Title: Tambourine
Info: George Drakoulias produced this sophomore release for the singer-songwriter, who garnered praise for her 2002 debut 'Bramble Rose.' Here, she adds some Muscle Shoals-style soul to her roots and country repertoire.

Title: Sonic Nurse
Info: The veteran New York band, again operating as a five-piece (with Jim O'Rourke still in the group), return with a successor to one of their best albums in recent memory, 2002's 'Murray Street.'

Title: Love This Giant
Info: The collaboration between David Byrne and St. Vincent, first planned more than two years ago, was produced with John Congleton.

Title: Carrier
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie San Francisco duo of Logan Kroeber and Meric Long was influenced by the sudden death of guitarist Christopher Reimer in February 2012.

Title: The Iron Gates at Throop and Newport
Info: The second album for the singer-songwriter was written in Brooklyn and recorded in Nashville.

Title: Nabuma Rubberband
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Swedish synthpop band includes a track co-written with Dave of De La Soul.

Title: Zaba
Info: The debut full-length release for the British quartet led by David Bayley was self-produced by Bayley.

Title: Ancestral Star
Info: This is the third album for the San Francisco duo of Evan Caminiti and Jon Porras.

Title: The Art of Pretending to Swim
Info: The fourth full-length release for the solo project for the Irish singer-songwriter Conor J. O'Brien was self-produced.

Title: Second Love
Info: The third full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was influenced by her experience living in the United States while working as a journalist the past three years.

Title: No Gods No Masters
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the alternative rock band was produced with Billy Bush.

Title: Lamp Lit Prose
Info: The eighth full-length release for David Longstreth project features guest appearanmces from Dear Nora, Empress Of, Haim, Amber Mark, Fleet Foxes' Robin Pecknold, Rostam, and Syd of The Internet.

Title: Look Up Sharp
Info: This is the second full-length solo release for the London-based Australian experimental artist.

Title: Quazarz: Born on a Gangster Star
Info: One of two concept albums released on the same day for the hip-hop duo of Ishmael Butler and Tendai "Baba" Maraire about a being from another world named Quazars was recorded over two weeks in Seattle with producer Erik Blood.

Title: Monument Builders
Info: The eighth full-length solo release for ex-Destroyer drummer Scott Morgan was inspired by the score to the 1982 experimental film Koyaanisqatsi by Phillip Glass.

Title: Lighthouse
Info: The latest solo release from the singer-songwriter was co-written and executive produced by Michael League of Snarky Puppy.

Title: Smash the System
Info: The latest solo release for the British singer-songwriter is his first non-concept album since 2009's 21st Century Man.

Title: Manhattan
Info: The first full-length studio release in four years for the anti-folk artist was produced by John Agnello.

Title: Watching Dead Empires in Decay
Info: This is the first release for British ambient electronic musician Leyland Kirby as The Stranger in five years.

Title: The Cherry Thing
Info: Neneh Cherry worked with the Norwegian/Swedish jazz trio The Thing on this jazz-inspired album.

Title: To the Happy Few
Info: The first new material in 18 years for the Los Angeles alternative rock band is its first with the original line-up since 1995's Her Highness.

Title: The  King Is Dead
Info: The Portland-based band returns with less rock and more atmospheric, orchestral arrangements with a little bit of country-folk thrown in as well.

Title: Basic Volume
Info: The debut full-length release for the British industrial electronic/dancehall artist features production from Aart, DADRAS, Dre Skull, Dutch E Germ, Jam City, Nick Leon, Buddy Ross, and SOPHIE.

Title: Whistle Down the Wind
Info: The first full-length studio release in a decade for the folk singer-songwriter features covers of songs by such artists as Anohni, Mary Chapin Carpenter, Tim Eriksen, Joe Henry (who also produced the album), and Josh Ritter.

Title: Metropole
Info: The first release in eight years for the Chicago-based punk trio was co-produced with Matt Allison.

Title: Heat Lightning Rumbles in the Distance
Info: The third solo album for the Drive-By Truckers singer was based on a semi-autobiographical novel he never completed.

Title: Love, Death & Dancing
Info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter  was self-produced with additional production from Brett Cox, James Flannigan and Jacknife Lee.

Title: In Search of the Miraculous
Info: The third full-length release for the British indie rock/pop band led by Jo Bevan was self-produced.

Title: Cult Following
Info: Working with Arcade Fire's Richard Reed Parry, the second full-length release for the Canadian-based indie artist Laurel Sprengelmeyer features guest appearances from such artists as Sufjan Stevens, Sharon Van Etten, and Kyp Malone.

Title: Czarface
Info: The collaboration between Wu-Tang Clan's Inspectah Deck, 7L, and Esoteric features guest appearances by  Action Bronson, Cappadonna,   Ghostface Killah, Roc Marciano, Mr. MFN eXquire, Oh No, and Vinnie Paz

Title: Uniform Distortion
Info: The third full-length solo release for the My Morning Jacket frontman was self-produced and was inspired by a photo in the 1970s magazine, The Last Whole Earth Catalog.

Title: Invite the Light
Info: The second full-length release for Damon Riddick features guest appearances from such artists as Computer Jay, Flea, Junie Morrison, Nite Jewel, Q-Tip, Snoop Dogg, Novena Carmel, and Jody Watley.

Title: All Eternals Deck
Info: The 18th studio album from the North Carolina indie-folk trio features production by Hate Eternal frontman Erik Rutan, as well as others.

Title: Hate for Sale
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the Chrissie Hynde-led rock band was produced by Stephen Street.

Title: Queens of the Summer Hotel
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was originally part of a planned stage musical adaptation of Girl, Interrupted.

Title: Sonik Kicks
Info: The 11th studio album for the singer includes guest appearances from Noel Gallagher and Blur's Graham Coxon.

Title: Hymn and Her
Info: Aaron Espinoza and Ariana Murray return with this follow-up to last year's "Mentor Tormentor."

Title: Show Me How You Disappear
Info: The third full-length release for Jilian Medford indie pop project features production from Andrew Sarlo and Andy Seltzer.

Title: White Reaper Does It Again
Info: The debut full-length release for the garage rock quartet from Kentucky was produced by Kevin Ratterman.

Title: Silver Dollar Moment
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie pop trio of Esme Dee Hand-Halford, Sidonie Hand-Halford, and Henry Wade was produced by Marta Salogni.

Title: No More Lamps in the Morning
Info: The singer-songwriter re-records some of her songs live with simpler backing from her husband Victor Herrero on a 12-string Portuguese guitar and cello from Gyða Valtýsdóttir.

Title: Everybody Down
Info: The British poet's debut solo rap release was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Cheatahs
Info: The debut full-length release for the London-based band led by Nathan Hewitt was self-produced.

Title: Humanz
Info: The animated band returns after a seven year absence with a studio album featuring guest appearances from Jehnny Beth, Danny Brown, Benjamin Clementine, D.R.A.M., Del La Soul, Peven Everett, Anthony Hamilton, Grace Jones, Zebra Katz, Kelela, Popcaan, Jamie Principle, Pusha T, Mavis Staples, Vince Staples, and Kali Uchis.

Title: Basar
Info: The debut full-length release for the electronic project from Berlin-based DJ Nomad and producer Dirk Leyers that features influences from West African music.

Title: TOY
Info: The debut album for the British indie rock quintet was produced By Dan Carey.

Title: Plumb
Info: The fourth album for the British indie rock quartet runs just over 30 minutes and spans 15 tracks.

Title: Love And Its Opposite
Info: The Everything But The Girl singer's third solo album was produced by Ewan Pearson.

Title: Loose Fur
Info: This six-track disc is a collaboration between Wilco frontman Jeff Tweedy, drummer Glenn Kotche, and Jim O'Rourke (known for both his acclaimed recent solo albums and work with Wilco and Sonic Youth).

Title: Happyness
Info: The Chicago indie band's fifth album is the first in a planned trilogy, and features a bit more electronics than previous outings. Members of Tortoise guest on the album, as does Rebecca Gates from the Spinanes.

Title: Hardcore Will Never Die, But You Will
Info: The Scottish five-piece noise-rock band’s latest album is a mix of distorted guitars, piano and synthesizers –- minimal and with little to no vocals whatsoever.

Title: Songs
Info: The second full-length release for Daniel Woolhouse sees more emphasis on his vocals.

Title: Celebration
Info: Members of TV On The Radio produced and contributed to this debut Celebration LP from Baltimore husband and wife Sean Antanaitis and Katrina Ford (joined in Celebration by drummer David Bergander), who have previously played in bands Jaks and Love Life.

Title: Interiors
Info: The first new release in 22 years for the post-hardcore band led by Walter Schreifels was produced by Will Yip.

Title: A Mineral Love
Info: The seventh full-length release for producer Stephen Wilkinson as Bibio features guest appearances from Gotye, Olivier St. Louis, and Wax Stag.

Title: Forever
Info: Phife Dawg's posthumous release features guest appearances from Cheryl Boyce-Taylor, Darien Brockington, Busta Rhymes, Dwele, Illa J, Lyric Jones, Little Brother, Maseo of De La Soul, Renée Neufville, Pos of De La Soul, Q-Tip, Rapsody, Redman, V.Rich, and Angela Winbush.

Title: Little Dark Age
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the indie rock duo of Andrew VanWyngarden and Ben Goldwasser was produced with Patrick Wimberly and Dave Fridmann.

Title: Space Gun
Info: The latest release from the indie rock band led by the prolific Robert Pollard introduces Mark Shue and Bobby Bare, Jr. to the line-up.

Title: Les Revenants [OST]
Info: Following a four-track EP of the score, the Scottish post-rock instrumental band returns with a full-length soundtrack to the French zombie television series called Les Revenants.

Title: Don't Be a Stranger
Info: Produced by Sheldon Gomberg, American Music Club's Mark Eitzel returns with his sixth solo album after suffering a heart attack in 2011.

Title: Liminal
Info: The debut full-length release for the trio of DJ Adam Freeland, Steve Nalepa, and Ry X features sounds and influences from bass, field recordings, rock, and pop music.

Title: Overseas
Info: This is the debut release from the indie group formed by David Bazan of Pedro the Lion; Will Johnson from Centro-Matic; and brothers Bubba and Matt Kadane after the death of Vic Chesnutt.

Title: Whitechapel
Info: The fourth album from the deathcore metal band was produced by Mark Lewis.

Title: The Lucky Ones
Info: Recorded in less than four days, this is the eighth full-length album released by the Seattle-based band.

Title: The Coincidentalist
Info: Bonnie "Prince" Billy, Sonic Youth's Steve Shelley, KT Tunstall, and  M. Ward appear as guests on the latest Arizona-inspired solo release from the Giant Sand founder.

Title: Good Luck
Info: The debut full-length release from Toronto-based Debby Friday was produced with Holy Fuck's Graham Walsh and features a guest appearance from Uñas.

Title: Blonde on the Tracks
Info: The Bob Dylan covers album from the Nashville-based Australian singer-songwriter was produced by Patrick Sansone.

Title: Desert Sessions, Vols. 11 & 12
Info: 16 years since the last volume, Josh Homme and a new group of artists including Carla Azar, Matt Berry, Les Claypool, Billy Gibbons, Mike Kerr, Stella Mozgawa, and Jake Shears came together in Joshua Tree to record eight new songs over five days.

Title: New
Info: The first release of new solo material in six years from the former Beatle includes production from Paul Epworth, Ethan Johns, Giles Martin (son of Beatles producer George Martin), and Marc Ronson.

Title: Land of Sleeper
Artist: Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs
Info: The fourth full-length release for British rock band Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs sees the return of drummer Ewan Mackenzie, who was last seen on 2017's Feed The Rats.

Title: Scatterbrain
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the New Zealand band led by Martin Phillipps was produced by Tom Healy.

Title: Jacqueline
Info: The second full-length release for the Haley Fohr music project includes the Bitchin Bajas' Cooper Crain, Rob Frye, and Dan Quinlivan.

Title: Beat Poetry for Survivalists
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between R.E.M.'s Peter Buck and The Auteurs' Luke Haines includes contributions from Scott McCaughey and Linda Pitmon.

Title: As You Please
Info: The third full-length release for the Michigan/Ohio indie rock band led by Mat Kerkes was produced by Will Yip.

Title: Dumb Flesh
Info: This is the second solo release for Fuck Buttons' Benjamin John Power.

Title: Violent Waves
Info: The fourth studio release from Philadelphia-based rock band was self-recorded and produced.

Title: Beard, Wives, Denim
Info: The Australian psych-rock band's fourth album was recorded in two weeks at a friend's farmhouse.

Title: The Parallax: Hypersleep Dialogues
Info: The North Carolina metal band's EP is part one of a two-part concept album that will conclude in an upcoming full-length album.

Title: Idealism
Info: 'Idealism' is the full-length debut for the German electronica duo of Jens Moelle and Ismail Tuefekci.

Title: Don't Stop
Info: The second album for the Norwegian singer features guest appearances by Franz Ferdinand's Alex Kapranos and Datarock's Fredrik Saroea.

Title: Turning [Live]
Info: In 2006, Antony Hegarty and filmmaker Charles Atlas worked on creating a performance piece exploring femininity and identity that evolved into a concert tour with an orchestra. The tour was recorded and resulted in Turning, a documentary by Charles Atlas as well as a live album of the band's performance in 2006 at London's Barbican.

Title: LP5
Info: The fifth full-length solo studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Matt Pence.

Title: Chastity Belt
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Seattle-based band was co-produced by Jay Som.

Title: Years to Burn
Info: The first full-length collaboration between Calexico and Iron & Wine was recorded over four days in Nashville by producer Matt Ross-Spang.

Title: Cryptograms
Info: This is the second LP for the Atlanta five-piece known for their experimental psyche tunes and blistering live shows.

Title: Oblation
Info: Mixed by Converge's Kurt Ballou, the Miami doom/sludge band returns with its first release since they disbanded in 2003.

Title: If I Could Make It Go Quiet
Info: The debut full-length release for the Norwegian indie pop artist features production from FINNEAS.

Title: Networker
Info: The third full-length release for the Atlanta post-punk band led by Philip Frobos was recorded in a cabin in Georgia.

Title: Virginia Creeper
Info: This is the fourth solo album for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter (and occasional Gilmore Girls actor) formerly of the group Grant Lee Buffalo.

Title: Gallowsbird's Bark
Info: Unlike Jack and Meg White, this brother-sister garage-blues duo really are brother and sister. 'Gallowsbird's Bark' marks the full-length debut for New Yorkers Eleanor and Matthew Friedberger after several years touring with the likes of Spoon, The Kills and French Kicks.

Title: No More Drama
Info: The sixth album from Mary J. Blige features guest appearances from Lenny Kravitz, Eve, and Missy Elliott and production work from The Neptunes and Dr. Dre.

Title: Two Against Nature
Info: The duo of Walter Becker and Donald Fagen return after a 20-year hiatus, with this Grammy-winning comeback album sounding as if they had never left.

Title: WE ARE CHAOS
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the rock band was produced with Shooter Jennings.

Title: Milano
Info: The debut collaboration between Daniele Luppi and Parquet Courts features vocals from Karen O and was inspired by the youth/art subculture in Milan in the 1980s.

Title: Stitch of the World
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was recorded while she was six months pregnant and features a guest appearance from Sam Beam.

Title: The End of Comedy
Info: The latest release from Michael Collins features guest appearances from Ariel Pink, Danny James, Sheer Agony, and Weyes Blood.

Title: Loud Planes Fly Low
Info: The Rosebuds bandmates Ivan Howard and Kelly Crisp reunite to record an emotional album of failed love and a hopeful future.

Title: Hummingbird
Info: The sophomore release for the Los Angeles indie rock quartet produced by The National's Aaron Dessner is its first without bassist Andy Hamm (who left the band in 2011).

Title: Shadow Offering
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian art rock trio was was co-produced with Chris Walla.

Title: Konono No.1 Meets Batida
Info: The Congolese band worked with producer Batida for its fifth full-length release.

Title: Everything Ecstatic
Info: Kieran Hebden's fourth Four Tet album dispenses somewhat with the "folk" portion of his folktronica sound, resulting in a more beat-driven effort.

Title: The Civil War
Info: The fifth album from the experimental electronica duo of M. C. Schmidt and Drew Daniel (best known in the past few years as Bjork's backing "band") takes a 21st century approach to 19th century themes. Members of Radar Brothers and Acetone guest, as does pianist David Grubbs.

Title: Gallows
Info: The British punk rock band returns with Alexisonfire's Wade Macneil on lead vocals for its third full-length album.

Title: Pedals
Info: The sophomore album from the New York-based post-hardcore band are back with a more focused, more dynamic, melodious sound.

Title: What We Lose In The Fire We Gain In The Flood
Info: Former Georgie James band member Laura Burhenn releases her debut album produced by Richard Swift.

Title: Oh Holy Molar
Info: This is the second release from the British chamber pop trio.

Title: Infra
Info: The fifth solo album for the German-born artist is based on music he wrote for a 2008 Royal Ballet production.

Title: You're Not Alone
Info: This is the first new full-length studio release for the hard rock artist in nine years.

Title: Year of the Spider
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Oakland, California-based garage rock band was recorded in Nashville by producer Dan Auerbach.

Title: The Nightmare of Being
Info: The latest full-length release for the Swedish death metal band was produced and mixed by Jens Bogren.

Title: Every Valley
Info: The impact of deindustrialization on Welsh mining industry is the theme of the third full-length release from the British art-rock band.

Title: Bulldozer
Info: One of two Kickstarter-funded releases [Bubblegum was also released on the same day] for the Brooklyn indie rock singer is a solo album produced by Rob Schnapf.

Title: Wild Smile
Info: The full-length debut for the Brooklyn-based indie rock band was produced by Chris Zane.

Title: Relationship Of Command
Info: This is the final release for At The Drive-In, who later split to form groups Sparta and The Mars Volta.

Title: Most Normal
Info: This is the first full-length release for Irish noise rock band Gilla Band who previously released music under the name Girl Band.

Title: Cheater
Info: The second full-length release for the Norwegian quartet was produced with Marcus Forsgren.

Title: Cantus Descant
Info: The latest full-length release for the Canadian composer features recordings of a variety of church organs in Amsterdam, Chicago, Vancouver, Copenhagen and Los Angeles.

Title: Mirrorland
Info: The debut full-length release for the hip hop duo Olu (aka Johnny Venus) and WowGr8 (aka Doctur Dot) features guest appearances from  Kehlani, Malik, Arin Ray, T-Pain, and Young Thug.

Title: Vol. 8
Info: The latest volume of improvisational songs from the Philadelphia alternative rock band that are usually released on limited number of  CD-Rs gets a wider distribution.

Title: A Positive Rage
Info: The first live album for the band features 17 live tracks recorded on October 31, 2007 and a DVD about the release of "Boys ands Girls in America."

Title: Try Not To Freak Out
Info: The debut full-length release for the Norwegian pop-punk band led by Haley Shea was produced by Dan Austin.

Title: Keep You
Info: The third full-length release from the Baltimore screamo band led by Kyle Durfey was produced by Will Yip.

Title: Speak Now
Info: The singer-songwriter's third album is the first that she wrote entirely on her own and remains true to her country-pop roots that made her one of the biggest selling artists of 2009.

Title: Same Old Man
Info: John Hiatt's latest album was produced by the singer-songwriter and features his daughter on two songs.

Title: We Shall All Be Healed
Info: John Darnielle's fifth Mountain Goats disc in the past two years was produced by John Vanderslice.

Title: Gist Is
Info: The debut release for the British alternative quartet led by Harry Burgess was produced by Tom Howe.

Title: Red Barked Tree
Info: Birthed from the British punk explosion, Wire's rousing experimental rock has lasted decades and continues with the release of the post-punk trio's 12th studio album.

Title: Bride Screamed Murder
Info: After almost 25 years and more than 25 albums, the unstoppable Melvins have the same sludgy, Sabbath-styled post-punk heaviness that solidified their place in rock history since the early '90s.

Title: Parades
Info: The Danish band's second full-length album features 30 guest musicians.

Title: American Tunes
Info: Produced by Joe Henry, the final release for the New Orleans artist, who passed away in November 2015, features guest appearances from Bill Frisell, Rhiannon Giddens, Greg Leisz, Charles Lloyd, and Van Dyke Parks.

Title: Civilians
Info: Joe Henry releases his 10th album after producing records for other artists.

Title: Re-Engineering
Info: Berlin-based British electronic artist Steven Warwick describes his latest release as a "cybernetic poem."

Title: Dear Mark J. Mulcahy, I Love You
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the former Miracle Legion member is his first since 2005's In Pursuit Of Your Happiness.

Title: Lesser Evil
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Montreal electronic producer Airick Woodhead as Doldrums.

Title: Rough Carpenters
Info: The latest full-length release from the Appalachian folk band was recorded during the same sessions as its 2012's Wompyjawed EP.

Title: Release
Info: The eight-track release from London-based Kevin McAuley includes influences from UK bass, dubstep, and techno music.

Title: Mantasy
Info: The second solo album for the electronic DJ/producer is his the first release in eight years.

Title: Red
Info: Taylor Swift's fourth album was produced by Max Martin and features Mark Foster (Foster the People) and singer/songwriter Lori McKenna.

Title: Standing at the Sky's Edge
Info: The British singer-songwriter's seventh album is his first on the Parlophone label.

Title: In a Dim Light
Info: The London-based trio continues to mix different electronic music styles on its second album.

Title: Kitty Wells Dresses: Songs of the Queen of Country Music
Info: Laura Cantrell covers songs by country music's first female star, Kitty Wells, on her fourth full-length release.

Title: Nothing Hurts
Info: The British trio releases its first full-length album, which features the Vivian Girls on one song.

Title: The Liberty Of Norton Folgate
Info: Clive Langer and Alan Winstanley return to produce the band's first album of new music since 1999.

Title: Blood From Stars
Info: The latest album for the producer/singer-songwriter features Marc Ribot and Jason Moran as guest musicians.

Title: Hills And Valleys
Info: Lloyd Maines produced the Texan country trio's first album in five years.

Title: The New Year
Info: The indie rock band started by ex-Bedhead members Matt and Bubba Kadane releases its third album.

Title: Ode To Sunshine
Info: The group featuring ex-Noise Ratchet founders releases its debut album, which was recorded in a cabin in Julian, CA.

Title: Shine
Info: The latest studio album for the Canadian singer-songwriter.

Title: North Star Deserter
Info: The latest album includes guest appearances by Constellation artists A Silver Mt. Zion, members of Godspeed You! Black Emperor, and Fugazi's Guy Picciotto.

Title: God Save The Clientele
Info: Recorded in Nashville, the UK band's third studio album is slightly peppier and happier than past efforts (for The Clientele, anyway).

Title: Living With The Living
Info: Brendan Canty produced the band's first album for their new label, Touch and Go.

Title: You, You're A History In Rust
Info: This fifth release from the adventurous Toronto-based instrumental post-rock outfit is their first album in four years.

Title: Zeroes And Ones
Info: This is the veteran post-punk band's first release in six years.

Title: Demon
Info: The Swedish-French indie rockers make their full-length debut with this genre-hopping disc.

Title: The Outsider
Info: The country singer-songwriter follows 'Fate's Right Hand' with an 11-song set that includes a collaboration with Emmylou Harris and John Prine on Bob Dylan's "Shelter from the Storm."

Title: Atom Bomb
Info: The long-lived Grammy-winning gospel-blues group's latest finds them joined by David Hidalgo and Billy Preston.

Title: Take Fountain
Info: Eight years ago, Wedding Present leader David Gedge put that band on hold to pursue--at first--a more cinematic sound with his new outfit, the aptly named Cinerama. With Cinerma's sound more closely approximating the Wedding Present's in recent years, Gedge has revived the WP name (but retained the most recent Cinerama lineup) for this latest release, produced by Steve Fisk.

Title: More Parts Per Million
Info: Portland, Oregon's The Thermals recorded this "no-fi" (otherwise known as "very, very, very lo-fi") debut album direct to four-track at the house of founding member Hutch Harris.

Title: More Than A Woman
Info: The R&B singer returns with a follow-up to 2000's 'The Heat' which sees her moving in more of a hip-hop direction, with production help from hitmakers Rodney Jerkins, Babyface, Irv Gotti and the Neptunes.

Title: Release
Info: The Boys' eighth studio release features features Johnny Marr on guitar.

Title: Electric Sweat
Info: Although the 20-something New York City rockers have the names of two former Can vocalists in their moniker, their sound is more frequently compared to the MC5. 'Electric Sweat,' their second album, attracted a good deal of attention for the band from music publications in the U.S., drawing the now-mandatory Strokes comparisons.

Title: Hot Shots II
Info: The second full-length (not including a collection of EPs) from Britain's heralded Beta Band is just as eclectic as the band's first outing, combining pop and indie rock with touches of hip hop and electronica. The ten new tracks are highlighted by the singles "Squares" and "Broke." (And if the immodest album title reminds you of the Stone Roses' 'Second Coming,' don't worry--the comparisons end there.)

Title: One Part Lullaby
Info: This is the third full-length and first major-label release for the low-fi duo of Lou Barlow (Sebadoh, Dinosaur Jr.) and John Davis, who earlier achieved brief commercial success with the single "Natural One" off the soundtrack to the movie "Kids."

Title: La Isla Bonita
Info: The 12th studio release for the San Francisco alternative rock band was recorded live in guitarist Ed Rodriguez's basement and was produced by Nick Sylvester.

Title: Impersonator
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the now duo of Montreal producer Devon Welsh and Matthew Otto. [Welsh released II, a collection of songs in 2011 as a solo project.]

Title: Fibs
Info: The second full-length solo release for the British composer features new instruments not heard on 2016's Varmints.

Title: Who's Feeling Young Now?
Info: The third album from the bluegrass group Punch Brothers includes a cover of Radiohead's Kid A.

Title: O Shudder
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British indie pop band was produced by Brendan Williams and features guest appearance from Stealing Sheep.

Title: Liberation!
Info: The debut solo release for the former member of The Walkmen was inspired by religious/mythological ideas and his childhood living in ashrams.

Title: Havilah
Info: The latest album for the Australian rock band is the first studio album to feature current guitarist Dan Luscombe, who replaced Rui Pereira.

Title: Every Open Eye
Info: The second full-length release for the Scottish synthpop trio was recorded at the band's studio in Glasgow.

Title: The Lion King: The Gift
Info: The Lion King-inspired album was executive-produced by Beyoncé and features 070 Shake, Yemi Alade, Burna Boy, Busiswa, Blue Ivy Carter, Childish Gambino, Jay-Z, Kendrick Lamar, Mr. Eazi, Nija, Pharrell, Jessie Reyez, Salatiel, Moonchild Sanelly, St. Jhn, Tekno, Shatta Wale, Tierra Whack, and Wiz Kid.

Title: Day Breaks
Info: The singer-songwriter returns to her jazz roots on her sixth full-length solo release that includes three cover songs.

Title: FurFour
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British psych-pop duo of Alexander Tucker and Daniel O'Sullivan features guest appearances from This Heat's Charles Bullen and Isobel Sollenberger from Bardo Pond.

Title: III
Info: This is the third full-length release for the collaboration between Modeselektor's Gernot Bronsert, Sebastian Szary and Apparat's Sascha Ring.

Title: England Keep My Bones
Info: This is the fourth studio album for the British folk rock singer-songwriter.

Title: Bromst
Info: The Baltimore-based artist releases his follow-up to his 2007 album, Spiderman of the Rings.

Title: Mykki
Info: The debut full-length release for the New York rapper features guest appearances from Jean Deaux, Jeremiah Meece, and Woodkid.

Title: The Shadow I Remember
Info: The latest full-length release for the Cleveland indie rock band led by Dylan Baldi was produced by Steve Albini.

Title: It Was Good Until It Wasn't
Info: The second full-length studio release for the R&B artist from Oakland, California features guest appearances from Jhene Aiko, James Blake, Tony Lanez, Lucky Daye, and Masego.

Title: Atomic
Info: The Scottish post-rock band reworked a version of the soundtrack to Mark Cousins' documentary Atomic: Living in Dread and Promise for its .

Title: Un Dia
Info: This is the fifth album for the Argentinean artist.

Title: Santogold
Info: The debut full-length album for the alternative rock artist has Spank Rock and Trouble Andrew as featured guests.

Title: Feels Like
Info: The debut full-length release for the Nashville alternative rock band led by Alicia Bognanno features re-recorded some tracks from its self-titled 2014 EP.

Title: Unrepentant Geraldines
Info: The 14th studio release for the singer-songwriter is said to be a return to her piano-centric alternative pop/rock sound.

Title: Pentatonic Wars and Love Songs
Info: The latest album for the blues artist includes Gary Moore and Jason Moran as guests.

Title: Ultra Beatdown
Info: The metal band releases its first album with Frederic Leclercq on bass.

Title: Guilt Trips
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Canadian producer features guest appearances from Sinead Harnett, Kitty (formerly known as Kitty Pryde), Lofty305, Haleek Maul, and Tinashé.

Title: Welcome Home Armageddon
Info: The Welsh rock band's fifth album was produced by Romesh Dodangoda. It is the first full-length album since Gavin Burrough moved from bass to guitar and Richard Boucher joined the band as its new bassist.

Title: It's a New Day Tonight
Info: The second full-length release for the Montreal-based rock artist was produced by Wayne Gordon.

Title: Rio
Info: The Latin pop band returns with its follow-up to its 2006 Grammy-winning album, "Oye."

Title: Motivational Jumpsuit
Info: The fifth release since the Robert Pollard-led band reformed in 2010 is its first without drummer Kevin Fennell.

Title: Understated
Info: The eighth solo release for the former Orange Juice frontman is his second (but first written) since he suffered a cerebral hemorrhage in 2005.

Title: Modern Streets
Info: A majority of the latest release for Steve Spacek as Beat Spacek was created on iPhone and iPad apps.

Title: Power
Info: Producer-songwriter Benjamin Garrett's second release as Fryras was produced with Luke Smith.

Title: Speech Therapy
Info: The British artist releases her debut album produced by Wayne Lotek.

Title: A Snowflake Fell (And It Felt Like A Kiss)
Info: The Scottish band's Christmas-themed album was recorded over 12 days.

Title: Family Portrait
Info: This is the debut full-length release for British electronic producer Felix Clary Weatherall.

Title: In Amber
Info: The first release in five years for the Andy Butler project Hercules And Love Affair features guest appearances from ANOHNI and Elin Ey.

Title: Mr. Davis
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, Big Sean, Chris Brown, Migos, Nicki Minaj, Monica, Rico Love, ScHoolboy Q, Slim Jxmmi, Ty Dolla $ign, The Weeknd, and Young Dolph.

Title: Simply Grand
Info: The latest album from the Grammy-winning R&B singer features pianists such as Dr John, Henry Butler, and Tom McDermott.

Title: Frozen Letter
Info: The fourth full-length release for the North Carolina garage rock band led by Dan McGee features a guest appearance from Superchunk's Mac McCaughan.

Title: A  Different Kind of Fix
Info: The third album for the British rock band was produced by Ben Allen, along with contributions from Jim Abbiss and Jack Steadman.

Title: Wheelhouse
Info: The country singer self-produced his ninth studio release that features guest appearances from Dierks Bentley, Charlie Daniels, Hunter Hayes, Eric Idle, Mat Kearney, LL Cool J, and Roger Miller.

Title: Forgiveness Rock Record
Info: With John McEntire as producer, Kevin Drew, Brendan Canning, Charles Spearin, Andrew Whiteman, Sam Goldberg, and Justin Peroff worked together to write the group's fourth studio album (outside of the two Broken Social Scene Presents...albums). Other BSS members do appear as guests on this release, including Leslie Feist, Amy Millan and Evan Cranley of Stars, Emily Haines and Jimmy Shaw of Metric, Jason Collett, and Ohad Benchetrit of Do Make Say Think and Years.

Title: Fair Ain't Fair
Info: The Brooklyn, New York-based artist explores the idea of an apocalypse on his latest album.

Title: Castlemania
Info: This is the first of two releases in 2011 for the San Francisco indie rock band led by John Dwyer.

Title: Where The Wild Things Are [OST]
Info: The Yeah Yeah Yeahs' Karen O and several of her musician friends compose the soundtrack to Spike Jonze's adaptation of the children's book, Where The Wild Things Are.

Title: Saltwater
Info: Martin Crane expands his Brazos music project with the addition of drummer Ian Chang and bassist Spencer Zahn on his second full-length release.

Title: Some Racing, Some Stopping
Info: The sophomore full-length album for the indie rock trio from Champaign, Illinois.

Title: In The Reins [EP]
Info: This mini-album finds seven new originals written and sung by Sam Beam (Iron & Wine) with Calexico's Joey Burns and John Convertino performing as his backing band.

Title: Bigger Than Life
Info: The third full-length release for the Chris Stewart music project was self-recorded and produced.

Title: Morning/Evening
Info: The two-track, 40-minutes album for Kieran Hebden as Four Tet was created using Ableton Live software.

Title: Death After Life
Info: This is the debut full-length techno release for Chicago-based producer Ryan McRyhew.

Title: Young Modern
Info: The fifth album from the Australian band includes Luke Steele, Julian Hamilton, and Paul Mac as guests.

Title: You Can't Imagine How Much Fun We're Having
Info: The underground hip-hop duo of Slug and Ant return with a new two-disc set.

Title: Street Punk
Info: Produced by Facundo Bermudez, Seth Bogart shares lead vocals with Shannon Shaw on the garage punk band's second full-length release.

Title: They Threw Us in a Trench and Stuck a Monument On Top
Info: This debut LP from the experimental punk outfit from Brooklyn known for their strong live sets features lengthy song titles and an even lengthier closing track (clocking in at over half an hour).

Title: Flat White Moon
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the British rock band led by brothers David Brewis and Peter Brewis was inspired in part by music from The Beatles, Free, Fleetwood Mac, and Led Zeppelin.

Title: Tonic Immobility
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Mike Patton-led band that includes  Duane Denison, John Stanier, and Trevor Dunn was co-produced with Paul Allen.

Title: Abysmal Thoughts
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn indie pop band-turned-solo-project by Jonny Pierce who wrote and produced the album.

Title: Bestival Live 2011
Info: The recording of The Cure's appearance at Britain's Bestival in September 2011 is the band's first live album since 1993.

Title: 151A
Info: This is the debut solo full-length album for violinist/producer K. Ishibashi.

Title: Celestite
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the black metal duo is a five-track companion album to 2011's Celestial Lineage.

Title: First Flower
Info: The second full-length release for the Austin-based singer-songwriter was produced with Erik Wofford.

Title: Silver/Lead
Info: The 40th anniversary for British post-punk band brings its 15th studio release that was partly recorded in Wales.

Title: Jaakko Eino Kalevi
Info: The full-length debut for the Berlin-based electronic artist features guest appearances from Suad Khalifa and Sonja Immonen.

Title: Taking Back Sunday
Info: The rock band from Long Island returns with a new album produced by Queens of the Stoneage's Eric Valentine and features the original lineup from its 2002 debut.

Title: The Big Roar
Info: This is the debut full-length album on Atlantic for the Welsh trio and continues to be a cacophony of rock riffs and pop sensibility.

Title: Pilot Talk
Info: Ski Beatz produced most of the New Orleans-born rapper's first solo album with Def Jam.

Title: Waxing Gibbous
Info: This is the fifth studio album for the ex-Arab Strap band member.

Title: Requiem
Info: The latest full-length release for nu metal band Korn was produced by Chris Collier.

Title: Intruder
Info: The 18th full-length solo release for the British electronic artist is said to be about climate change from the Earth's point of view.

Title: In the End
Info: The final release for Dolores O'Riordan (who passed away in January 2018) and the Irish rock band was produced by Stephen Street.

Title: Felder
Info: The latest solo release for the Mouse on Mars artist is the fourth album in St. Werner's experimental Fiepblatter series.

Title: Fantastic Planet
Info: This is the latest release for the solo project of Sarah Lipstate.

Title: Legacy
Info: This is the debut full-length release from one of the pioneers of footwork.

Title: Duppy Writer
Info: British producer Wrongtom remixes a collection of Roots Manuva's tracks.

Title: Natural
Info: Check out the latest album from the British punk-rock band formed in 1977.

Title: Shitty Hits
Info: The debut full-length release for the Brooklyn pop singer-songwriter was self-produced like her 2015 EP, Bleaksploitation.

Title: Growing Pains
Info: The eighth album for the R&B singer was produced with help from The-Dream, Ne-Yo, Stargate, Dre & Vidal, and Timbaland.

Title: Total Loss
Info: Tom Krell's second release as How to Dress Well shows more R&B influences.

Title: Songs and Stories [Live]
Info: The country singer-songwriter releases a live acoustic album recorded at Nashville's Belcourt Theatre in 2009.

Title: We Have You Surrounded
Info: The Dirtbombs fourth full-length album includes covers of songs by Alan Moore, Dead Moon, and Sparks.

Title: Gliss Riffer
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Baltimore-based electronic artist was self-produced.

Title: Dirt Femme
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for Swedish dance-pop artist Tove Lo features guest appearances from Channel Tres, First Aid Kit and SG Lewis.

Title: Typhoons
Info: The third full-length release for the British rock duo was self-produced except for two tracks with production from Paul Epworth.

Title: Fudge Sandwich
Info: The covers album from the garage rock artist features songs by The Dils, Amon Düül II, Funkadelic, Gong, Grateful Dead, John Lennon, Rudimentary Peni, Sparks, Spencer Davis Group, War, and Neil Young.

Title: Strychnine Dandelions
Info: The debut album featuring Reigning Sound's Greg Cartwright and The Ettes' Coco Hames includes appearances by Dan Auerbach, Patrick Keeler, and fellow band members Jem Cohen, Poni Silver, and Dave Amels.

Title: A Brighter Beat
Info: This is the first solo release for the Scottish artist since the breakup of his band Arab Strap.

Title: We All Raise Our Voices to the Air: Live Songs 04.11.08
Info: The two-disc live album collects 20 live songs from the band's tour for its 2011 album, The King Is Dead.

Title: 22 Dreams
Info: The ninth album for Paul Weller features Blur's Graham Coxon, Little Barrie, Oasis' Noel Gallagher and Gem Archer, Ocean Colour Scene's Steve Cradock, and Stone Roses' Aziz Ibrahim.

Title: SUGAREGG
Info: The third full-length release for Alicia Bognanno's rock project was produced by John Congleton.

Title: The Bob's Burgers Music Album [Original Television Soundtrack]
Info: The soundtrack to the Fox animated comedy features songs from the first 107 episodes as well as five exclusive cover songs performed by  Lapsley, The National, St. Vincent, and Stephin Merritt of Magnetic Fields.

Title: Ambulance
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Swedish indie rock band was live recorded over a few days.

Title: Serpents Unleashed
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Ohio trash metal band was produced by Kurt Ballou.

Title: Through the Window
Info: This is the experimental techno three-track release from Cold Cave member Dominick Fernow.

Title: Olympic Girls
Info: The third full-length release for the New Zealand folk band was produced by Tom Healy.

Title: Goodnight Oslo
Info: The second album Robyn Hitchcock has recorded with The Venus 3 (Peter Buck, Scott McCaughey, & Bill Rieflin) features a track used in the film Rachel Getting Married.

Title: Little Amber Bottles
Info: The Detroit-based group and backing band on Loretta Lynn's "Van Lear Rose" release their sophomore album.

Title: The Route To The Harmonium
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the Scottish singer-songwriter was recorded in his Scottish home and was produced with David Wrench.

Title: Notes of Blue
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the alt-country band led by Jay Farrar was inspired by blues music.

Title: Highway Hypnosis
Info: The third release for Eva Moolchan as Sneaks was produced by Carlos Hernandez and Tony Seltzer (as well as Jacknife Lee on "Hong Kong to Amsterdam").

Title: Resolve
Info: The latest solo release for the British artist who is also a member of Hidden Orchestra was self-produced.

Title: Antisocialites
Info: The second full-length release for the Toronto-based indie-pop band led by Molly Rankin was produced by Alec O'Hanley and John Congleton.

Title: Golden Eagle
Info: The debut full-length release for the Irish-born country artist was produced by Paul Gregory of Lanterns On The Lake.

Title: Apache
Info: The latest solo release for the multiple Grammy award-winner was produced by Eric Krasno.

Title: I Forget Where We Were
Info: The follow-up to the British singer-songwriter's Mercury Prize-nominated debut was produced by Chris Bond.

Title: Unravelling
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Scottish indie rock band was produced by Paul Savage.

Title: El Pintor
Info: Self-produced, the first release in four years for the New York rock band is also its first without bassist Carlos Dengler and features contributions from Secret Machines' Brandon Curtis, Jellyfish's Roger Joseph Manning, Jr., and Bon Iver's Rob Moose.

Title: Impressions
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles pop trio comes five years after their 2009 debut, Expressions.

Title: The Reckoning
Info: The second full-length release for the British producer/singer-songwriter was produced by Ryan Adams.

Title: Wild Crush
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British band sees the addition of Kristian Robinson and the return of Duke Garwood.

Title: Motion: Connected Works
Info: The fourth full-length solo studio release for Mountains' Koen Holtkamp includes a disc of music that were first released on vinyl.

Title: Invasion of Love
Info: The debut solo project for Cherry Ghost frontman Simon Aldred was produced by Ash Workman.

Title: Pearl Mystic
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie rock quintet includes influences from psychedelic and krautrock.

Title: Pleasure Pressure Point
Info: Ex-Beta Band-er Steve Mason's latest group releases its debut full-length.

Title: Jinx
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based post-punk trio was produced by Monte Vallier.

Title: Dream Wife
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the London based indie-pop trio of Rakel Mjöll, Alice Go, and Bella Podpadec.

Title: Rose Mountain
Info: The sixth full-length release for the New Jersey rock trio was produced by Matt Bayles.

Title: Nothing
Info: With the death of Daddi Gee, who worked under the name the Spaceape, dubstep producer Steve Goodman goes solo with this release, which does feature Spaceape’s vocals on one track.

Title: What Went Down
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock band was recorded in France with producer James Ford.

Title: Don't Tell the Driver
Info: The fourth solo release for the Dirty Three guitarist features guest appearances from  Peggy Frew, Caroline Kennedy-McCracken, Oliver Mann, Kishore Ryan, Ian Wadley, and Jeff Wegener.

Title: Bodied
Info: The sixth full-length release for British electronic producer Alan Myson is said to have a "much greater focus into the sound design and palette."

Title: Wooden Aquarium
Info: The third full-length release for the British rock band was recorded live with producer Jonathan Schenke.

Title: Honey Locust Honky Tonk
Info: The 17-track album from the prolific singer-songwriter is his 19th solo release.

Title: More Light
Info: The tenth studio release for the Scottish rock band was produced by David Holmes and features guest appearances by Robert Plant, My Bloody Valentine's Kevin Shields, and Mark Stewart.

Title: Frantic
Info: Fresh off the Roxy Music reunion tour, Bryan Ferry resumes his solo career with this 13-track effort, a mix of Ferry originals and covers (including two Dylan tracks). Ferry has actually been working on this album for parts of the last eight (!) years, and it includes contributions from former Roxy Music partner/nemesis Brian Eno, the Eurythmics' Dave Stewart, and Radiohead's Johnny Greenwood.

Title: Go Tell Fire To The Mountain
Info: The British rock band self-produced its debut full-length album, which was recorded in an unused church.

Title: Human The Death Dance
Info: The underground rapper/poet returns with his second album for Epitaph, joined by guests Buck 65, Jolie Holland and Mark Isham.

Title: Canta Lechuza
Info: Roberto Carlos Lange's second solo electronic album was written while he was staying at an isolated cabin in Connecticut.

Title: White Crosses
Info: Though known for always being on the road, Against Me! has finally released its second major label album, which continues to blend elements of its trademark punk and folk rock with fist-pumping anthems celebrating teenage anarchy and encouraging all to fight the good fight.

Title: Guns Don't Kill People...Lazers Do
Info: Switch and Diplo team up to release their first album as Major Lazer.

Title: Happiness In Magazines
Info: Stephen Street produces the former Blur guitarist's fifth solo disc.

Title: How to Let Go
Info: The second full-length release for the Norwegian pop singer-songwriter Sigrid  features a guest appearance from Bring Me The Horizon.

Title: Brighter Wounds
Info: The fifth full-length release for Ryan Lott's solo-project-turned-trio that now includes Rafiq Bhatia and Ian Chang is its first on the City Slang label.

Title: Water on Mars
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock trio led by Mike Polizze is its first recorded in a professional studio.

Title: The Chaos
Info: Taking the best of post-punk, new wave, and pop as inspiration, Sunderland's Futureheads were among the best of the U.K.'s "angular" movement. Their capability of delivering their trademark pop thrills on this album sustains their position as Sunderland's sharpest export.

Title: Saint Bartlett
Info: The latest album for the singer-songwriter was produced by Richard Swift and recorded in just under week.

Title: The '59 Sound
Info: The sophomore album for the New Jersey punk-rock band was produced by Ted Hutt.

Title: Marlon Williams
Info: The solo full-length debut for the New Zealand singer-songwriter was co-produced with Ben Edwards.

Title: Serpentine Prison
Info: The debut full-length solo release for The National's frontman was recorded over 14 days with producer Booker T. Jones.

Title: Tomboy
Info: Noah Lennox, Animal Collective's founding member, releases his fourth solo album.

Title: I'll Follow You
Info: The fourth album but the first with Merge Records for the Brooklyn-based band.

Title: Say Yes to Love
Info: The noise punk band led by Meredith Graves releases a full-length follow-up to its 2013's four-track EP, I Have Lost All Desire For Feeling.

Title: Sun and Shade
Info: Singer-guitarist Jeremy Earl and his band release their sixth full-length of sunny West Coast pop and folk rock.

Title: The Volunteers
Info: Onelinedrawing is the alter ego for Sacramento, Calif.-based singer/guitarist Jonah Matranga, formerly of the emo band Far.

Title: Margerine Eclipse
Info: 'Margerine Eclipse' marks the London-based band's first LP since the death of long-time member Mary Hansen, as well as the once-prolific group's longest-ever gap between albums (2 1/2 years).

Title: Punk Rock
Info: 'Punk Rock' is just that, combining new recordings of some of the band's edgier late-70s output with live performances culled from their 25th anniversary tour in 2002.

Title: In Reverie
Info: Less punk, more pop is the motto for the fourth album by the New Jersey emo band led by singer-songwriter Chris Conley.

Title: AOI: Bionix
Info: The second installment in the "Art Official Intelligence" series (following 2000's 'Mosaic Thump') features the hit single "Baby Phat" and guest appearances from Slick Rick and Cypress Hill's B Real.

Title: Last Place
Info: The first release in over a decade for the California indie rock band was produced by frontman Jason Lytle.

Title: Why Love Now
Info: The fifth full-length release for the noise rock band was produced by Arthur Rizk and Lydia Lunch.

Title: Asleep on the Floodplain
Info: Ben Chasny's psych-folk project releases its seventh album in five years, producing a more playful, atmospheric sound with Ben's trademark twangy, country-folk feel.

Title: Postcards From a Young Man
Info: The Welsh rock band goes with a poppier sound on its Dave Eringa-produced 10th studio album.

Title: Angels Of Destruction
Info: The Philadelphia/Brooklyn-based band returns with its latest studio album following a Christmas album in 2005.

Title: Freakout/Release
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for British electro-pop band Hot Chip was written and recorded at its East London studio.

Title: Weirdon
Info: The seventh full-length release from the Philadelphia psych-punk trio includes influences from pop and indie rock music.

Title: Shelter
Info: The is the debut full-length release from the London-based house/techno producer.

Title: Ashore
Info: The British folk singer's latest album is a concept album about the relationships we have with the sea.

Title: Payola
Info: The punk band led by Conor Oberst returns from a 13-year hiatus for its second full-length release that was co-produced by Mike Mogis.

Title: The Eraser
Info: Nigel Godrich produced this 9-song solo debut for the Radiohead frontman, which mainly sounds like--shockingly--a Radiohead album, albeit with much less guitar.

Title: The Visitor
Info: The third full-length solo release for the South American dance producer/artist includes contributions from Philipp Gorbachev, Ana Helder, Daniel Maloso, Alejandro Paz, Juliana Gattas, A'rea Negrot, Liset Alea and Jorge Gonz lez.

Title: I Know What Love Isn't
Info: The Swedish singer-songwriter's first album in five years was influenced by a break-up.

Title: Tales from the Realm of the Queen of Pentacles
Info: The first release of original material in seven years for the New York singer-songwriter was produced by Gerry Leonard.

Title: Balf Quarry
Info: The latest album for the band from Connecticut was produced by Scott Colburn.

Title: Go
Info: After releasing an album with boyfriend Alex Somers in 2009, the Sigur Ros singer returns with his first solo album produced with Peter Katis.

Title: Parallax Error Beheads You
Info: British electronica artist Ben Jacobs returns from a six year absence to release his third album under the Max Tundra name.

Title: Mutator
Info: The posthumous solo release of the Suicide frontman's songs recorded with Liz Lamere in 1995-1996.

Title: Badlands
Info: This is the latest album for the Canada-based Taiwanese lo-fi indie singer Alex Zhang Hungtai.

Title: On a Mission
Info: The UK singer's debut album is an eclectic mix of electronic pop, dubstep and R&B.

Title: Paper Airplane
Info: Alison Krauss brings a bluegrass feel to rock with the help of Union Station, her first album with them since 2004's Lonely Runs Both Ways.

Title: Wonderland
Info: This is the second full-length solo release from the former member of The Former Alliance, Erick Berglund.

Title: Kids
Info: The second full-length release for the Israeli electronic pop artist/producer features guest appearances from BLIMES, Reo Cragun and ROUSSO.

Title: Confess
Info: The follow-up to the singer's 2010 debut was self-produced and mixed by Michael H. Brauer.

Title: Chopper
Info: The third full-length release for Canadian indie rock band Kiwi Jr. was produced by Dan Boeckner.

Title: Startisha
Info: The first full-length release for the rapper as Naeem (previous albums were under the name Spank Rock) features guest appearances Amanda Blank, Micah James, Swamp Dogg, Velvet Negroni, and Justin Vernon.

Title: You Only Live 2wice
Info: The third full-length studio release for the rapper features production from BADBADNOTGOOD, Aaron Bow, Crooklin, Dupri, DNYC3, ESVYBE, Kaytranada, Lambo, Jay Nari, Blair Norf, Pops, SLWJMZ, Speakerbomb, and Teddy Walton.

Title: 32 Levels
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the hip-hop producer features guest appearances from  A$AP Rocky, Sam Dew, Mikky Ekko, Samuel T. Herring, Kelela, Lil B, Joe Newman, Vince Staples, and Kelly Zutrau.

Title: Herd Runners
Info: The third full-length release for Simon Aldred's solo project was mixed with Dan Austin.

Title: 200 Tons Of Bad Luck
Info: The second album for the supergroup of musicians from such bands as Mogwai, Pantheist, Gonga, and Electric Wizard.

Title: SweetSexySavage
Info: This is the debut full-length studio release for the Oakland R&B artist who was a finalist on the sixth season of "America's Got Talent." [The deluxe edition includes "Gangsta," which also appears on the "Suicide Squad" film soundtrack.]

Title: Conor Oberst
Info: The first solo album released on CD for the Bright Eyes singer was recorded in Mexico.

Title: Songs in A&E
Info: Jason Pierce nearly died of pneumonia halfway through writing the group's sixth album.

Title: You're Gonna Miss It All
Info: The second full-length release for the Philadelphia indie pop band was mastered by Will Yip.

Title: We Live in Rented Rooms
Info: This is the seventh album for the singer-songwriter F.M. Cornog.

Title: The Heat
Info: This is the second solo release for the former D Generation frontman. Malin's buddy Ryan Adams does not produce this time around, but he does appear on the album.

Title: The Secret Of Elena's Tomb [EP]
Artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
Info: Trail of Dead fans waiting for the band's follow-up to 2002's 'Source Tags & Codes' will have to make do, for now, with this 5-track EP (which also contains three videos).

Title: I Might Be Wrong: Live Recordings
Info: Recorded during a 2000-2001 European tour, Radiohead's first live album contains just eight tracks: seven songs culled from 'Kid A' and 'Amnesiac,' plus long-time live staple "True Love Waits."

Title: Tin Can Trust
Info: With influences ranging from Sonic Youth to My Bloody Valentine, this Los Angeles trio's second album mixes melodic dream pop, electronica, and rock.

Title: Deafman Glance
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Chicago singer-songwriter was produced with LeRoy Bach.

Title: Hug of Thunder
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Canadian alternative rock collective features many of the original members including Emily Haines and Jimmy Shaw of Metric; Amy Millan and Evan Cranley of Stars; Charles Spearin and Ohad Benchetrit of Do Make Say Think; and Leslie Feist.

Title: Have Some Faith in Magic
Info: The Scottish post-rock quartet aim for a pop sound on its third full-length album

Title: Great Dismal
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Philadelphia shoegaze band led by Domenic Palermo was produced by Grant Yip.

Title: Ferndorf
Info: The German musician releases his latest album of experimental electronic piano music.

Title: Incorruptible Heart
Info: Produced by OKGO's Damian Kulash Jr. and Dave Fridmann, the second full-length album for the Los Angeles-based quartet led by Becky Stark is its first release in five years.

Title: CVI
Info: the debut full-length release for the Atlanta metal band was produced by Joey Jones.

Title: Let It Burn
Info: The Austin singer-songwriter releases an album of gospel, folk, R&B, and rock covers, featuring The Blind Boys of Alabama, William Bell, Ike Stubblefield, and members of the Funky Meters as guests.

Title: Under Stellar Stream
Info: The British artist latest solo album features songs about homelife and fatherhood.

Title: Warmth
Info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn duo of Sam Haar and Zach Steinman is their first on the R&S label.

Title: Moh Lhean
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the indie rock band led by Yoni Wolf was co-produced with Josiah Wolf.

Title: Future Crayon
Info: This B-sides and rarities complilation contains 18 previously-released (although not always easy-to-find) tracks.

Title: Suit Yourself
Info: The country singer was joined in a Nashville studio by Benmont Tench (The Heartbreakers), Michael Ward (The Wallflowers) and others on this latest release.

Title: Watch Me Fall
Info: The Tennessee-born artist releases his latest solo album on the Matador label.

Title: Eskimo Snow
Info: The latest album for the California group was recorded during the Alopecia recording sessions.

Title: Traditional Synthesizer Music
Info: The latest release for Canadian electronic artist Aaron Funk features modular synthesizers.

Title: Easy Come, Easy Go
Info: The latest album for the English artist features guest appearances by Nick Cave, Cat Power, Rufus Wainwright, Keith Richards, and Antony Hegarty.

Title: We Don't Even Live Here
Info: The fourth release for the Minnesota punk-rapper features guest appearances by Astronautalis, Isaac Gale of Marijuana Deathsquads, Mike Mictlan, Sims, and Justin Vernon of Bon Iver.

Title: Vanishing Point
Info: The ninth studio release for the Seattle quartet is its first new album since 2008's The Lucky Ones.

Title: Themes for Dying Earth
Info: The sixth full-length release for the ambient pop project of Jamison Isaak features contributions from Jon Anderson, Sean Carey, Nadia Hulett, Sound Of Ceres, and Dustin Wong.

Title: 1000 Days
Info: The third release in 2015 for the California psychedelic rock band was recorded in Los Angeles and San Francisco.

Title: Seven Dials
Info: The fourth solo studio release for the Scottish singer was co-produced with Seb Lewsley.

Title: Drenge
Info: The debut full-length release for the British brother duo of Rory and Eoin Loveless was produced by Ross Orton.

Title: Land of CanAan
Info: The debut full-length release for the violinist/singer discovered by TV on the Radio's Kyp Malone was inspired in part by the Frederick Douglass' autobiography.

Title: Payback
Info: The seventh studio album for the rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Agallah, El-P, Lil B, Phonte, Questlove, Res, and Swiss Beatz.

Title: Oversteps
Info: This is the 10th album for the electronica duo from Manchester, England.

Title: Abandoned Language
Info: The experimental, often noisy hip-hop duo (former third member Still has left the group) from New Jersey returns with a follow-up to 2005's 'Absence.'

Title: The Breakthrough
Info: The R&B singer's latest includes a cover of U2's "One." The all-star roster of contributors includes Bono, Jay-Z, Raphael Saadiq, Dr. Dre and will.i.am.

Title: Return to the Ugly Side
Info: The Bristol duo are a throwback to the psychedelic ‘60s, making noisy and experimental music with roots in garage rock.

Title: Sports
Info: This is the San Francisco-based trio's debut full-length release.

Title: Ciao!
Info: The Canadian DJ's latest album features Scissor Sisters' Jake Shears, LCD Soundsystem's James Murphy, and producer Soulwax.

Title: Mount Moriah
Info: Heather McEntire and Jenks Miller, who previously preformed under the name Un Deux Trois, return with a new name for their debut album of alt-country influenced by their North Carolina roots.

Title: Totems Flare
Info: The British electronic artist, now based in Berlin, releases his fifth album.

Title: #N/A
Info: The Japanese instrumental trio of Masako Takada, Yuri Zaikawa, and Sayaka Himeno worked with producer Adrian Sherwood for its latest release.

Title: English Electric
Info: The 12th overall release for the British synth-pop band is their second since their return in 2005.

Title: Skip a Sinking Stone
Info: The second full-length release for the Jordan Lee project was influenced by his time on tour, settling in New York, falling in and out of a relationship and struggling with depression.

Title: The Nocturne Diaries
Info: The latest release for the Austin-based singer-songwriter was produced by her son, Cisco Ryder.

Title: Plastic Anniversary
Info: The latest release for the experimental electronic duo features sounds made from plastic objects including dominos, coolers, polyethylene waste containers, PVC panpipes, bubble wrap, silicone gel breast implants and synthetic human fat.

Title: Watershed
Info: K.D. Lang's latest album was produced entirely by herself.

Title: Shiny New Model
Info: The seven-track release for the Brooklyn art-punk band was produced by its guitarist Madison Velding.

Title: Into the Lime
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the pop rock supergroup formed by Joe Pernice of the Pernice Brothers, Teenage Fanclub's Norman Blake, and Mike Belisky of The Sadies.

Title: Long Slow Dance
Info: The fourth full-length studio release from the San Francisco indie rock band led by Tim Cohen was recorded at Phil Manley's Lucky Cat Studios.

Title: Unsound
Info: The fifth album for the Boston rock band is its first on the Fire Records label.

Title: Dreamin' Man Live '92
Info: The latest from Neil Young's Archives Performance Series features live songs from various appearances in 1992 before the release of "Harvest Moon."

Title: ...For The Whole World To See
Info: After refusing to change the band's name, the trio of brothers from Detroit were turned away by Clive Davis of Columbia Records and the album was never completed. The surviving songs receive a proper album release some 30-plus years later from Drag City.

Title: Meadow
Info: The singer-songwriter reunites with producer J.D. Foster for his eighth album, which also finds him backed by former members of Guided By Voices.

Title: Eye To The Telescope
Info: The 20-something Scottish singer-songwriter makes her debut with this Steve Osborne-produced disc.

Title: Anything
Info: The former Tricky collaborator was nominated for the UK's Mercury Music Prize for her solo debut 'Quixotic,' which arrives in the U.S. a year later re-sequenced, re-designed, and re-titled (as 'Anything'). Included (as on the original version) is a collaboration with Josh Homme and Mark Lanegan, as well as tracks recorded with Tricky and David Holmes.

Title: Spoon And Rafter
Info: This is the fourth album for the Neil Halstead-fronted band, who have taken on a more alt-country feel since their origins in Slowdive.

Title: Easy Listening
Info: Otherwise known as the backing band for Robert Pollard in Guided By Voices, Cleveland's Cobra Verde combine numerous 70s rock influences on this, their third studio album. J Mascis guests.

Title: God Loves Ugly
Info: The Minneapolis underground hip-hop duo of rapper Slug and producer Ant offer up 18 new tracks.

Title: Reveal
Info: 'Reveal,' the Athens, GA band's 12th full-length album, marks the 20-year anniversary of the group. Operating as a trio for the second consecutive outing, R.E.M. offer up 12 new tracks, mainly of the mid-tempo acoustic guitar and keyboard variety. Guests include Joey Waronker, Ken Stringfellow (The Posies), and Scott McCaughey (The Young Fresh Fellows).

Title: Begone Dull Care
Info: The third album fof the electronic duo from Canada.

Title: Falling Down A Mountain
Info: The latest album for the group features new members drummer Earl Harvin and guitarist Davis Kitt.

Title: Imploding the Mirage
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the rock band features guest appearances from k.d. lang and Weyes Blood.

Title: A+E
Info: The eighth solo album for the former guitarist of Blur was produced by Ben Hillier.

Title: Vodka & Ayahuasca
Info: The second collaborative full-length album between Alchemist and Oh No includes Roc Marciano, Kool G. Rap, and Prodigy as guests.

Title: Shall Noise Upon
Info: The latest album for the rock trio was recorded in the Catskill Mountains.

Title: Destroyer Of The Void
Info: Portland-based Blitzen Trapper brings a haunting, ethereal touch to folk rock with their new album, blending twangy rock riffs with bittersweet piano-laced melodies to create beautiful stylistic textures.

Title: Valve Bone Woe
Artist: Chrissie Hynde & the Valve Bone Woe Ensemble
Info: The Pretenders singer's jazz classics covers album was produced by Marius de Vries and Eldad Guetta.

Title: Scholars
Info: The third full-length release for the New York duo of Arone Dyer and Aron Sanchez is their first in five years.

Title: Holding All the Roses
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Georgia country rock was produced by Brendan O'Brien

Title: (III)
Info: The third release for the Canadian electro-pop duo was produced by the band member Ethan Kath and recorded in Berlin and Warsaw.

Title: Trying To Never Catch Up
Info: This 2004 debut album for the Austin, Texas band was re-released (with four bonus tracks mixed by Spoon's Jim Eno) in 2006 when the band signed with Barsuk.

Title: III
Info: The rock trio follow-up "II" with the appropriately titled III.

Title: Magic & Medicine
Info: One of the more attention-grabbing British bands to emerge in the last few years--their fun, genre-jumping debut album landed them a Mercury Music Prize nomination--The Coral returns with a more coherent, '60s-influenced sophomore LP.

Title: Hurry Up, We're Dreaming
Info: Anthony Gonzalez's two-disc album produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen features contributions from Medicine's Brad Laner, Morgan Kibby, and Zola Jesus.

Title: Two Suns
Info: The second album for the singer was produced by David Kosten and features guest appearances by Yeasayer and Scott Walker.

Title: Come Around
Info: The third full-length solo release for Australian electro-pop singer-songwriter Carla dal Forno features a guest appearance from Thomas Bush.

Title: Household Name
Info: The third full-length release for alternative rock band Momma was mastered by  Emily Lazar.

Title: Lost Girls
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was inspired by Los Angeles and the 1980s.

Title: Here We Rest
Info: The former Drive-By Truckers member releases another album with his current band, the 400 Unit, primarily made up of Alabama musicians.

Title: Choice of Weapon
Info: The first studio album for the Brotihs rock band in five years was produced by Chris Goss and Bob Rock (Metallica).

Title: Catacombs
Info: This is the foruth album for the singer from Baltimore.

Title: Myth Takes
Info: The dance-punk outfit returns with a third LP.

Title: Shriek
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Baltimore duo of Jenn Wasner and Andy Stack was co-produced with Nicolas Vernhes.

Title: Illusion of Time
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Daniel Avery and Alessandro Cortini was created over several years.

Title: Obsidian
Info: Darker themes and lyrics dominate the second full-length release for Southern California artist Will Wiesenfeld as Baths.

Title: Etiquette
Info: This fourth disc of lo-fi indie electronica from Portland, Oregon's Owen Ashworth adds guest vocalists and a much wider variety of instrumentation into the mix.

Title: It's A Bit Complicated
Info: This is the second album for the tongue-in-cheek English band fronted by Eddie Argos.

Title: British Road Movies
Info: The debut solo full-length release for the Long Blondes singer was produced by Bernard Butler.

Title: Plaza
Info: The third full-length release for the psychedelic rock band was produced by Jarvis Taveniere.

Title: Expressions
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the Los Angeles-based rock trio.

Title: Ghetto Bells
Info: The Athens, Georgia singer-songwriter is backed by an all-star band of Van Dyke Parks (keyboards), Bill Frisell (guitar) and Don Heffington (drums), with John Chelew producing.

Title: Never
Info: The second studio release from the British trio led by Mica Levi was produced by the band.

Title: Phase Zero
Info: This is the second full-length release for the California psych-rock singer-songwriter.

Title: M:FANS
Info: The Velvet Underground founding member reworked the tracks from his 1982 solo debut, Music For A New Society.

Title: The Ballad of Dood & Juanita
Info: The latest full-length release for the singer-songwriter is a concept album about Dood's search for his kidnapped wife and features a guest appearance from Willie Nelson.

Title: The Avalanche: Outtakes & Extras From The Illinois Album
Info: Each of these 21 tracks originated during the recording of Stevens' 2005 album 'Illinoise,' although most were re-recorded or fleshed out during later sessions. Included are several new versions of the track "Chicago" from that earlier album.

Title: Kensington Heights
Info: The fourth album for the Canadian indie rock band is its first full-length album on the Arts & Crafts label.

Title: Random Spirit Lover
Info: The third album for the band led by Wolf Parade's Spencer Krug.

Title: Yes, I'm A Witch
Info: 'Witch' features an assortment of indie artists who have reimagined classic Yoko Ono tracks by mixing elements of the originals (mainly the vocals) with newly recorded music. The roster includes the Flaming Lips, Le Tigre, Spiritualized, Cat Power and the Polyphonic Spree.

Title: Obey
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Mexico City-based project that includes Anika Henderson, Hugo Quezada, and Martin Thulin.

Title: Epoch
Info: This is the fourth full-length studio release for the Scott Hansen-solo-project-turned-ambient-trio.

Title: Milky Ways
Info: This is the third album for the French group led by Joakim Bouaziz.

Title: Evil Friends
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the psychedelic rock band was produced by Danger Mouse.

Title: Images du Futur
Info: The second release from the Montreal rock band was produced by Jace Lasek of the Besnard Lakes.

Title: Real Emotional Trash
Info: The former Pavement singer returns with his latest album with the Jicks.

Title: Tracey Denim
Info: This is the third full-length release from Bar Italia, the London-based trio of Nina Cristante, Jezmi Tarik Fehmi, and Sam Fenton.

Title: Scenery
Info: The third full-length release for the New York City indie R&B artist was produced by Jeremy Most and mixed Tom Elmhirst.

Title: Endgame
Info: The punk rock quartet from Chicago's sixth studio album reveals a change in sound for the group, with more polished, politically-driven songs and uptempo rhythms.

Title: Stuck On Nothing
Info: The debut full-length album for the Philadelphia band produced by LCD Soundsystem's James Murphy shows influences of 1970's rock music.

Title: No Mas
Info: After receiving a good reception from the demo release, "Jamz n Jemz," the duo from Providence, Rhode Island, releases its full-length debut on Luaka Bop.

Title: Grass Geysers...Carbon Clouds
Info: The trio from Brooklyn and Philadelphia releases its latest album.

Title: The Back Room
Info: The Birmingham, England post-punk quartet is the latest band to have the UK music press in a tizzy, with this debut LP drawing the usual comparisons to Joy Division and Echo & The Bunnymen. (Actually, they just sound like Interpol.)

Title: First Mind
Info: The solo full-length debut for the former Portico Quartet member was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Chelsea Light Moving
Info: This is the debut release for Sonic Youth's Thurston Moore newest project with Keith Wood, John Maloney, and Samara Lubelski.

Title: Sorry for the Late Reply
Info: The second full-length release for the Norwegian punk-pop band includes songs about climate change, immigration, and relationships.

Title: Perfect Shapes
Info: The second full-length release for the indie singer-songwriter was produced by Wye Oak's Jenn Wasner.

Title: Freedom Tower: No Wave Dance Party 2015
Info: Mixed by Alap Momin, the tenth studio release for the New York trio who incorporate blues, funk, punk and hip-hop is a tribute to New York City.

Title: Down There
Info: The Brooklyn-based Animal Collective frontman's debut solo album is both dark and upbeat, as he experiments with energentic electronic production and soulful, slow-moving instrumentation.

Title: This Mess Is a Place
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Seattle pop-punk band was produced by Erik Blood.

Title: Dream On
Info: The debut full-length release for the Swedish singer-songwriter was produced by Patrik Berger.

Title: The  Devil's Walk
Info: The fourth album for Sasha Ring under the name Apparat is his first on the Mute label.

Title: Superabundance
Info: The trio from Ashby-de-la-Zouch, Leicestershire, England, releases its sophomore full-length album.

Title: La Radiolina
Info: After six years, Manu Chao releases his fourth studio album in the U.S.

Title: The Rarity of Experience
Artist: Chris Forsyth & the Solar Motel Band
Info: The second full-length release credited with the Solar Motel Band is a double album produced by Forsyth.

Title: Side Pony
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the indie pop band from Boston was produced by Dave Cobb.
The husband and wife duo releases their debut album of psychedelic pop music.

Title: Thank You, Happy Birthday
Info: The Kentucky quintet's sophomore album is filled with noisy guitars and pop-laced alternative rock jams, comparable to bands like the Pixies and Cake.

Title: Year Zero
Info: Trent Reznor offers his vision of a bleak future (the year 2022, to be exact) on this 16-track concept album.

Title: Peel Sessions
Info: The first official release of the trio's two BBC radio sessions for John Peel (recorded in 1989 and 1990) includes covers of songs by the Sex Pistols and Jonathan Richman.

Title: Goodnight City
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Brad Albetta, and Thomas "Doveman" Bartlett.

Title: Smart Flesh
Info: The eclectic, folk-rock foursome's third album was recorded in Central Falls, RI in an abandoned pasta sauce factory and has an old-timey, indie-folk feel.

Title: Wolfroy Goes To Town
Info: Recorded in Kentucky, the latest album for the singer-songwriter features Ben Boye, Van Campbell, Shahzad Ismaily, Emmett Kelly, Danny Kiely, and Angel Olsen as guest artists.

Title: Unfinished Business
Info: Produced by Justin Townes Earle, the rockabilly singer covers some songs by such artists as Woody Guthrie/Wilco, Sonny Thompson, Townes Van Zant, and Bobby Womack.

Title: Everything's OK
Info: The legendary soul singer reunites with longtime producer Willie Mitchell for the second time in three years.

Title: Feed The Animals
Info: The fourth album for the Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, artist is made from samples from a diverse palette of artists, including Jay-Z, Britney Spears, The Velvet Underground, Roy Orbison, Megadeth, UGK, and The Cure.

Title: Marigold
Info: The fourth full-length release for the New Jersey indie rock band was recorded in upstate New York.

Title: Angel in Realtime
Info: The third full-length release for the London-based Australian alternative rock band Gang Of Youths is said to be about the life of frontman Dave Le'aupepe's late "father, indigenous identity, death, grief and God."

Title: This Too Will Pass
Info: This is the third release for the lo-fi indie outfit led by Hrishikesh Hirway.

Title: Rare
