Info: The third full-length solo release for the pop artist features guest appearances by 6lack and Kid Cudi (plus Kygo, Gucci Mane and Marshmello on special editions).

Title: At.Long.Last.A$AP
Info: The second full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from A-cyde, A$AP Yams, Bones, James Fauntleroy, Joe Fox, Future, Juicy J, Lil Wayne, Miguel, Mos Def,  M.I.A., Mark Ronson, Schoolboy Q, Rod Stewart, UGK, and Kanye West.

Title: Depression Cherry
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie duo was produced with Chris Coady.

Title: Back in Love City
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by Daniel Ledinsky.

Title: Find the Sun
Info: The second full-length solo release for the former Dirty Projectors member was recorded at Stinson Beach, California with Samer Ghadry and Dave Harrington.

Title: Harmony Avenue
Info: The debut full-length release for the band that includes Jonah Falco and Mike Haliechuk of Fucked Up, Tamsin M Leach and Jack Goldstein was recorded by Alex Gamble.

Title: Snapshot of a Beginner
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian band led by Nigel Chapman was co-produced by Jonathan Low and James Elkington.

Title: False Alarm
Info: The fourth full-length release for the indie rock trio from Northern Ireland was recorded by Jacknife Lee and features guest appearances from Mokoomba and Open Mike Eagle.

Title: Imani, Vol. 1
Info: The fourth full-length for the California rap duo features guest appearances from Amde of The Watts Prophets, Bosko, Imani Coppola, DJ D Sharp, Fantastic Negrito, Danielle Flax, Lateef, Lyrics Born, Monophonics, Myron, Vursatyl & Jumbo of Lifesavas, and Zap Mama.

Title: Into Colour
Info: The third full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Rob Shirakbari.

Title: This Is My Hand
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for Shara Worden as My Brightest Diamond was produced with Zac Rae.

Title: Quack
Info: The full-length disco house debut for the collaboration between Armand Van Helden and A-Trak includes previously released tracks "aNYway", "Barbra Streisand", and "It's You."

Title: Time of Dust
Info: The six-track mini-release from the British singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Kathryn Williams.

Title: Internal Sounds
Info: The latest release from the Canadian alt-country band was produced by Dallas Good and features a guest appearance by Buffy Sainte-Marie.

Title: The Drop
Info: The second full-length release for the Danish psychedelic rock band includes two tracks from its Second Amendment EP.

Title: Night
Info: Folk singer-songwriter Tift Merritt teams up with Brooklyn classical pianist Simone Dinnerstein on a release of traditional folk, standards, classical pieces, plus new songs by Patty Griffin, Brad Mehldau, and Merritt herself.

Title: Memphis
Info: Produced by Steve Jordan and recorded in Memphis, the first studio release in five years for the Grammy-winning singer-songwriter is a collection of cover songs and two originals reflecting the sounds from the South.

Title: Macaroni
Info: The themes on the sixth studio album from Chicago's Bobby Conn include the Occupy Wall Street movement.

Title: Tiger Talk
Info: The third full-length album for the Canadian indie rock band was produced by Colin Stewart.

Title: The Songs of Robert Wyatt and Antony & The Johnsons: Live from The Union Chapel, London (Diversions Vol.1)
Info: The British folk group releases an album of live recorded covers of Robert Wyatt and Antony & The Johnsons songs.

Title: Fake History
Info: The Los Angeles hard rock band's third album was originally released on the Tragic Hero label in February and rereleased by Epitaph with three additional tracks in April.

Title: Simon Werner A Disparu
Info: The avant-garde art rockers return with a soundtrack recording for the film by French director Fabrice Gobert.

Title: Get Closer
Info: The Australian country recording artist's latest release includes both fun-loving, up-tempo tunes and guitar-heavy ballads.

Title: Time Flies... 1994-2009
Info: One of the major bands from the Brit-pop scene, Oasis' singles are collected in this two-CD compilation of their hits. Deluxe editions also include a DVD and a disc of songs performed for the 2009 iTunes Festival in London.

Title: Only Revolutions
Info: The fifth studio album for the Scottish rock trio was produced by Garth "GGGarth" Richardson.

Title: Snowflakes And Carwrecks [EP]
Info: An extended EP of material from Ferndorf recording sessions.

Title: Workout Holiday
Info: The debut album for the Austin, Texas, trio features songs from both of their EPs.

Title: Young Prayer
Info: This short solo disc for half of the current Animal Collective lineup was recorded in 2002 after the death of his father.

Title: Olympia
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Canadian-based electro-pop band led by Katie Stelmanis is said to have been a more collaborative effort.

Title: Lucifer
Info: This is the third album from the duo of Aaron Coyes and Indra Dunis.

Title: Arrow
Info: Produced by Jim Eno of Spoon, Arrow is the fourth album for the Austin-based band from Ohio and its first on Partisan Records with new guitarist, Mark Nathan.

Title: All Things Will Unwind
Info: The experimental pop singer's return to Detroit influenced the themes of her folk-inspired album.

Title: Enderness
Info: The first full-length release in eight years for the Alabama singer-songwriter was self-recorded.

Title: Man Made
Info: The debut full-length release for the British neo-soul artist was Executive-produced by Earbuds.

Title: Strangers
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Boston singer-songwriter was produced by Randall Dunn.

Title: Chrome Dreams II
Info: Neil Young resurrects the album title of his unreleased 1977 album for his latest.

Title: Everything Under the Sun
Info: The second album for the rock trio was produced by Peter Katis.

Title: District Line
Info: The first album on the Anti- label for ex-Hüsker Dü/Sugar member Bob Mould.

Title: King of Hearts
Info: King of Hearts -- Lloyd's fourth album -- is his first release with Polow da Don's Interscope-affiliated Zone 4 label.

Title: No Earthly Man
Info: Will Oldham produced this third album for the former Appendix Out member, which consists of his interpretations of traditional Scottish folk songs.

Title: Ghost People
Info: The second album for the Dutch electronic producer sees him exploring the life of a DJ and being on the road.

Title: Pro Tools
Info: The latest solo album for the Wu-Tang member features guests such as Masta Killa, RZA, and Young Justice.

Title: The Hawk Is Howling
Info: The sixth album for the Scottish rock band was produced by Andy Miller.

Title: Ha, Ha, He.
Info: The second full-length release for the Catalonia indie rock band was influenced by the band's experiences after the release of its debut album in 2015.

Title: Dark Developments
Artist: Vic Chesnutt, Elf Power, And The Amorphous Strums
Info: Athens, Georgia's Vic Chesnutt and Elf Power team up to release this collaboration albumeith The Amorphous Strums.

Title: Spirit Stereo Frequency
Info: All Night Radio is the latest (and most psychedelic) incarnation for Beachwood Sparks' Dave Scher and Jimi Hey.

Title: Lullaby For Liquid Pig
Info: After a five-year break from the music business, Lisa Germano returns with a new record deal and a new album, hoping to regain the cult following she developed through a series of critically-lauded releases for 4AD in the 1990s.

Title: Paid Tha Cost To Be Da Boss
Info: Snoop's sixth LP features production work from The Neptunes and DJ Premier (among others), with guest appearances by Redman, Nate Dogg, Warren G, Jay-Z, and Ludacris.

Title: Start Breaking My Heart
Info: Manitoba consists entirely of Toronto's Dan Snaith (yes, we are aware that Toronto isn't actually in Manitoba), and this is his debut album. [This release was originally credited under the name Manitoba before being re-released under the name Caribou after the name change]

Title: Free All Angels
Info: This is the third album for the Irish indie-punk quartet, and takes a less harsh, more pop approach than their poorly-received 1998 sophomore effort 'Nu-Clear Sounds.'

Title: Peace or Love
Info: The first full-length release for the Norwegian duo of Erik Glambek Bøe and Erlend Øye in 12 years features a guest appearance from Feist.

Title: Eat Pray Thug
Info: The debut full-length studio release from the former Das Racist rapper features tracks about 9/11, heartbreak, and xenophobia.

Title: Ganglion Reef
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Los Angeles psych rock band led by Cory Hanson.

Title: Doubled Exposure
Info: The latest release for the band led by Dave Shuford was recorded in upstate New York by Jason Meagher includes influences of Americana, blues, folk, and rock music.

Title: Body Talk Pt 1
Info: The latest album for the Swedish pop artist Robyn has been said to be part of a trilogy of albums to be released this year.

Title: Similes
Info: Heavily influenced by neoclassical icons like Erik Satie and Philip Glass, the experimental musician Eluvium (aka Matthew Cooper) is set to release Similes. It's an eight-song album featuring three key musical elements: percussion, a verse-chorus song structure, and singing.

Title: New Seasons
Info: The Canadian alt-country rockers return with their latest album.

Title: A River Ain't Too Much To Love
Info: Bill Callahan's 12th Smog album finds him joined in the studio by such musicians as Jim White (Dirty Three) and Joanna Newsom.

Title: Attack & Release
Info: Daniel Auerbach and Patrick Carney release their fifth full-length album, produced by Danger Mouse.

Title: Boys & Girls
Info: The full-length debut for the Alabama-based Southern soul-rock quartet was produced by the band.

Title: The Secret Migration
Info: The psychedelic indie rockers, led by returning core trio of vocalist Jonathan Donahue, guitarist Grasshopper and drummer Jeff Mercel, return with a less-orchestral follow up to 2001's 'All Is Dream.' Longtime collaborator David Fridmann co-produced.

Title: The Good, The Bad & The Queen
Artist: The Good, the Bad & the Queen
Info: Danger Mouse produced this first album for the new collaboration between Damon Albarn (Blur,Gorillaz), Paul Simonon (The Clash), Tony Allen (Africa 70 / Fela Kuti) and Simon Tong (The Verve).

Title: Miracle Temple
Info: The second release for the North Carolina band formed by Heather McEntire and Jenks Miller was co-produced by Miller, McEntire, and Mark Nevers.

Title: The  Official Body
Info: The third full-length release for the London-based pop-punk band was produced by Edwyn Collins.

Title: To Find Me Gone
Info: Devendra Banhart guests on the second full-length for the folk-rock band led by Andy Cabic.

Title: Remain Calm
Info: This is the debut full-length release from the collaboration between Mica Levi (aka Micachu) and Oliver Coates, who previously worked together on 2014's "Under the Skin" soundtrack.

Title: USA (United State Of Atlanta)
Info: D-Roc and Kaine's fourth disc boasts appearances by Missy Elliott, Mike Jones, Busta Rhymes and Adam Levine (Maroon5).

Title: Girls in Peacetime Want to Dance
Info: The ninth studio release for the Scottish indie pop band was produced by Ben H. Allen III.

Title: Luciferian Towers
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Canadian post-rock band was recorded and mixed by Greg Norman.

Title: Plowing Into the Field of Love
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Danish punk band was produced by Nis Bysted.

Title: Invitation
Info: A member of Sharon Van Etten's band (among others), the singer-songwriter has two previous solo LPs to her name, most recently 2015's Glider.

Title: My Favourite Faded Fantasy
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Irish singer-songwriter was produced by Rick Rubin.

Title: Songs Cycled
Info: This is the first solo studio release in 24 years for the pop singer-songwriter, who first gained fame for his work on Brian Wilson's SMiLE album.

Title: Boss
Info: The newest album for the duo from Connecticut.

Title: The New Life
Info: The second full-length release for the Belfast band sees the addition of Philip Quinn to the group.

Title: Before The Poison
Info: Faithfull's latest comes with some all-star assistance: P.J. Harvey wrote, produced and performed on over half of the tracks, with Damon Albarn and Nick Cave contributing to others.

Title: Belong
Artist: The Pains of Being Pure at Heart
Info: The NYC indie rockers channel the early '90s alternative sound on their second full-length album, working with famed producers Flood and Alan Moulder.

Title: Outside the Box
Info: This is the second full-length album for the British dubstep producer.

Title: Outside the Box
Info: This is the second full-length album for the British dubstep producer.

Title: Health
Info: The third full-length release for the Scottish indie pop artist was produced by Elbow's Craig Potter.

Title: Talent Night at the Ashram
Info: The latest release for the band led by Sonny Smith was originally planned as a soundtrack to a feature-length film Smith wanted to film.

Title: Ores & Minerals
Info: The second full-length release from the London-based indie rock quartet was self-produced.

Title: Out Of Breach (Manchester's Revenge)
Info: The Sheffield, England husband and wife electronica duo of Maurice Fulton and Mutsumi Kanamori attack various aspects of pop culture on this second funny, angry and strange release, which features song titles such as "Paris Hilton" and "Stop Bothering Michael Jackson."

Title: Beauty & Ruin
Info: The 11th solo studio release for the former frontman of Hüsker Dü and Sugar was partially influenced by the death of his father in 2012.

Title: Content Nausea
Info: Credited under the name Parkay Quarts, the fourth full-length release for the New York's Parquet Courts was recorded over a two-week period on a four-track tape and features contributions from Jackie-O Motherfucker's Jef Brown and the Easter's Bob Jones.

Title: Maximum Balloon
Info: The latest project for TV on the Radio's Dave Sitek features such guests as Karen O, David Byrne, Kyp Malone, and Theophilus London.

Title: Prey//IV
Info: The debut full-length solo release for ex-Crystal Castles singer-songwriter Alice Glass was produced by Jupiter Keyes.

Title: Pyroclasts
Info: The companion album for the drone metal band's earlier released Life Metal album was recorded at the same sessions with Steve Albini.

Title: Kablammo!
Info: The first full-length release in eight years for the alternative rock band from Northern Ireland was produced with Claudius Mittendorfer.

Title: Kid Face
Info: The third full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by John Vanderslice.

Title: We'll Never Turn Back
Info: Ry Cooder produced this new set of songs for the 66-year-old civil rights activist and member of famed gospel group the Staple Singers.

Title: Atlas
Info: The eclectic Mexican five-piece returns with a sophomore LP.

Title: Draft 7.30
Info: The experimental English electronic duo of Rob Brown and Sean Booth was able to find enough time while serving as curators of the 2003 UK version of All Tomorrow's Parties to record this, their seventh full-length as Autechre.

Title: 10th
Info: Kyoto, Japan's Nobukazu Takemura plays all of the instruments (and computers) on his latest release of playful, poppy electronica, which features vocals from a speech synthesizer.

Title: Unrest
Info: The solo debut for the Kings of Convenience guitarist (who also provided vocals on the recent Röyksopp album) features 10 tracks recorded in 10 cities with 10 different producers, including Schneider TM, Soviet, Prefuse 73, and Metro Area's Morgan Geist.

Title: Loud Like Nature
Info: The London-based electronica outfit, known for their vintage analogue equipment and propulsive (and destructive) live shows, return with their fifth full-length.

Title: Getaway
Info: The legendary (and influential, at least among the indie rock set) New Zealand band The Clean returns with its first album in five years (and only the fourth of their 22-year career). Yo La Tengo's Georgia Hubley and Ira Kaplan guest on two tracks.

Title: The Optimist LP
Info: The debut LP from Britain's Turin Brakes (whom the press have heralded as 2001's Coldplay) collects five tracks from previous EPs as well as seven new songs.

Title: The Loon
Info: The Minneapolis band's debut full-length has drawn comparisons to Pavement.

Title: Up on High
Info: The seventh full-length release for the folk band led by Andy Cabic was produced with Thom Monahan.

Title: The Republic
Info: The fourth solo release for the singer and guitarist of The Sea And Cake features nine tracks written for a show by video installation artist David Hartt.

Title: Masts of Manhatta
Info: Tracy Bonhamâ€™s career trajectory seems to run in reverse; with each record, she gets riskier, coming a long, long way from the bottled-up furious angst of her â€˜90s alt-rock staple â€œMother Mother.â€ Masts of Manhatta, her fourth album and first since 2005â€™s Blink the Brightest, ups the ante from that haunting record by accentuating its elliptical turns, its songs dodging conventional routes in favor of left turns. Bonham is assisted greatly by Beck guitarist Smokey Hormel and his trio, who lend her songs earthiness and art, giving this heft and welcome unpredictability. To an extent, Bonham lays out her albumâ€™s thesis on â€œWe Moved Our City to the Country,â€ a knowing satire of hipsters fleeing the urban jungle for faux authenticity, where she feels the pull of the two extremes as evidenced by how her sawing violin contrasts with the cabaret shuffle of Hormelâ€™s group. Masts of Manhatta walks this line throughout, sometimes getting quite a bit livelier, sometimes indulging in decidedly moody textures, always twisting just slightly from the expected, making for a record thatâ€™s quite intriguing upon the first listen and better on repeats, where the songs begin to dig in and all the textures gain resonance. ~ Stephen Thomas Erlewine

Title: Wilco (The Album)
Info: The seventh album for the rock group was produced with Jim Scott.

Title: The Door
Info: The Brooklyn, New York, quartet's debut album on the Ecstatic Peace label was produced with Thurston Moore.

Title: Popular Manipulations
Info: The third full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock features four songs produced by John Congleton, with the rest of the tracks self-recorded with Pine Barons member Keith Abrams.

Title: All Your Happy Life
Info: The second full-length release for the British rock band was co-produced with Luke Oldfield and Jim Sclavunos.

Title: No Grace
Info: The third full-length release for the Scottish punk trio was produced by blink-182's Mark Hoppus.

Title: Dungeon Golds
Info: The indie-pop collective led by Scott McCaughey reworked 12 tracks from a five LP limited set released for Record Store Day 2014.

Title: Rock and Roll Animals
Info: Actress Julia Davis provides narration for the British singer-songwriter's conceptual album about the adventures of a Badger, cat, and a fox.

Title: Wolfmother
Info: This is the first full-length release for the hard-rocking, classic rock-influenced Australian power trio.

Title: Here
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the R&B singer features a guest appearance from A$AP Rocky as well as contributions from Roy Ayers, Mark Batson, Emeli Sandé, Swizz Beatz, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Life Journey
Info: The latest solo release for the pianist was produced by Tommy LiPuma and includes two original songs.

Title: Derdang Derdang
Info: This is the second album for the British garage rockers.

Title: Let Us Never Speak Of It Again
Info: The first album in two years for the New York band (which shares three members with !!!) introduces a few vocals (from group members Phyllis Forbes and Molly Schnick) and drum machines into the mix for the first time.

Title: Volume 1
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the supergroup that includes Midlake's Eric Pulido, McKenzie Smith, Joey Mcclellan and Jesse Chandler with vocals from Band of Horses' Ben Bridwell, Travis' Fran Healy, Franz Ferdinand's Alex Kapranos, and Grandaddy's Jason Lytle.

Title: No Mythologies to Follow
Info: The debut full-length release for Danish electro pop singer Karen Marie Ørsted was produced by Ronni Vindhahl.

Title: EYEYE
Info: The fifth full-length release for Swedish singer-songwriter Lykke Li was produced by Björn Yttling.

Title: Instrumentals 2015
Info: This is the first new release from the British space rock band in 15 years.

Title: Commune
Info: This is the second full-length release from the Swedish psychedelic rock collective.

Title: Ultimate Care II
Info: The latest release created from sounds from a Whirlpool Ultimate Care II model washing machine by the experimental electronic duo was recorded in the basement of their home with contributions from Dan Deacon, Horse Lords' Max Eilbacher, Horse Lords' Sam Haberman, Needle Gun's Duncan Moore and Half Japanese's Jason Willett.

Title: 1000 Forms of Fear
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Australian pop singer-songwriter was produced by Greg Kurstin.

Title: Groove Denied
Info: The first solo release for the rock artist in 18 years is an electronic album and was self-recorded/produced.

Title: Livin' on a High Note
Info: Produced by M Ward, the latest release from the R&B/soul singer features songs written for her by such artists as Aloe Blacc, Benjamin Booker, Neko Case, Nick Cave, Ben Harper, tUnE-yArds, and Justin Vernon.

Title: I'm Going Away
Info: Matthew Friedberger produces the indie rock duo's eighth album.

Title: Ghost on Ghost
Info: The fifth release for the singer-songwriter is his first on Nonesuch Records and was produced by Brian Deck.

Title: Homecoming
Info: The third full-length release for Beth Jeans Houghton as Du Blonde features guest appearances from Andy Bell, Ezra Furman, Shirley Manson, and The Farting Suffragettes.

Title: End of Suffering
Info: Recorded over six month with producer Cam Blackwood, the third full-length release for the former Gallows frontman with The Rattlesnakes features a guest appearance from Tom Morello and was mixed by Alan Moulder.

Title: Gensho
Info: The collaborative work from Boris and Merzbow features two discs, each disc containing music from one of the artist designed to be play simultaneously or separately.

Title: Hidden Fields
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Britih psychedelic rock band led by Stephen Lawrie features a 15 minute track.

Title: A Long Way To the Beginning
Info: The third release from the youngest son of Fela Kuti was produced by Robert Glasper.

Title: Flumina
Info: The two-disc release is the third album from composer Ryuichi Sakamoto and ambient artist Christian Fennesz.

Title: Renmin Park
Info: Inspired by a trip to China, Cowboy Junkies' new release--the first of a four-part series--captures their ability for innovate song arrangement while capturing the color of another culture through music.

Title: Come Down With Me
Info: The second album for the Scottish quartet was produced by the band with some assistance from Steven Ward.

Title: Integrity Blues
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the rock band was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.

Title: Thunder Follows the Light
Info: John Lee worked with Gabriel Birnbaum of Wilder Maker, Mike Clifford, Jake Falby, Johanne Swanson of Yohuna, Felix Walworth of Told Slant, and Dillon Zahner on his third full-length release for his music project.

Title: II: Void Worship
Info: The second full-length release for the Rhode Island doom metal band is its first as duo after original bassist Count Elric the Soothsayer left in 2013.

Title: Hello Sadness
Info: Recorded in Girona, Spain, with producer John Goodmason, the latest album for the Welsh band led by Gareth Campesinos expands on its pop sounds.

Title: The Off-Season
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from 21 Savage, 6lack, Bas, Lil Baby, and Morray.

Title: Dangerous Woman
Info: The third full-length release for the actor/pop singer features guest appearances from Future, Macy Gray, Lil Wayne, and Nicki Minaj.

Title: The Runners Four
Info: The experimental San Francisco outfit led by Rob Fisk and Greg Saunier return with what is by far their lengthiest (and calmest) release yet.

Title: Beat Pyramid
Info: The debut album for the British band was produced by Gareth Jones.

Title: Big Station
Info: Tony Visconti produced and Chuck Prophet co-wrote some of the songs on Alejandro Escovedo's eleventh album.

Title: Say Anything
Info: The third album for the Los Angeles rock band was produced by Neal Avron.

Title: Middle Brother
Info: Delta Spirit's Matthew Vasquez, Deer Tick's John McCauley, and Dawes' Taylor Goldsmith join up to release their debut album together as Middle Brother.

Title: Precollection
Info: The first album in four years for Kurt Heasley and his band continues his fixation with all things British.

Title: Lost Planets & Phantom Voices
Info: The former member of Guided By Voices returns with a solo album (his fourth), recorded in his Michigan home.

Title: Anti-Pop Consortium Vs. Matthew Shipp
Info: Thirsty Ear's Blue Series continues with the unlikely pairing of avant-garde jazz pianist (and Blue Series curator) Matthew Shipp with the experimental New York hip-hop outfit Anti-Pop Consortium. This is also the very last album to be released by APC, who have officially disbanded.

Title: Rock Action
Info: The third LP from Scotland's Mogwai was produced by David Fridmann of Mercury Rev.

Title: Native Speaker
Info: The Canadian quartet delivers experimental, post-rock dream pop on its new album.

Title: Kicking The National Habit
Info: The London duo of Rupert Lyddon and Lawrence 'La' Rudd make their debut with this '80s-influenced album (reminiscent of everyone from New Order to the Police).

Title: Queen of Golden Dogs
Info: The third full-length release for Sebastian Gainsborough as Vessel is his first in four years and features vocals from Olivia Chaney.

Title: Somewhere Beautiful [Live]
Info: This is the live recording of a 2011 New Year's Eve private party performance from the New Zealand indie pop group led by Martin Phillips.

Title: Plum
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles psychedelic rock band is its first with new members: Robert Cody and Sofia Arreguin.

Title: Who Is the Sender?
Info: The British singer-songwriter latest release was produced by Joshua Henry and recorded in 13 days.

Title: Untamed Beast
Info: The second full-length release from Sallie Ford and her band was produced by Adam Landry and Justin Collins.

Title: Faith in the Future
Info: The second full-length solo release for The Hold Steady frontman was produced by Josh Kaufman.

Title: Golden Ocean
Info: The indie-rock trio 50 Foot Wave includes a pair of Throwing Muses (Kristin Hersh and Bernard Georges) plus Rob Ahlers. This full-length debut follows a self-titled EP released in 2004.

Title: Hairball
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock duo for of Ben Thompson and Lew Currie was produced by Bob Cooper.

Title: In Roses
Info: Magik Magik Orchestra string arranger Minna Choi joined on the second release for the Massachusetts-based duo of Christopher Barnes and Kristen Drymala.

Title: Shelter
Info: The fourth release for the shoegaze band was produced by Birgir Jón Birgisson and features a guest appearance from Slowdive's Neil Halstead.

Title: Farm
Info: The second album for the alt-rock band since it reunited in 2005 is its first on the Jagjaguwar label.

Title: True Love
Info: The fourth full-length release for the duo of Charlie Martin and Will Taylor was recorded by Andrew Sarlo.

Title: Melanie C
Info: The eighth full-length solo release for the Spice Girl features a guest appearance from Nadia Rose.

Title: Phoenix
Info: The second full-length release for the pop singer includes an Avicii track, as well as guest appearances from Bebe Rexha, Cardi B, Charli XCX, Julia Michaels, Liam Payne, and Rudimental.

Title: No. 4
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Belgium-based composer features contributions from such artists as Forma's John Also Bennett, Angel Deradoorian, Echo Collective, and Steve Hauschildt.

Title: Cellar Door: Terminus Ut Exordium
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Brooklyn hip-hop duo of MCs AK and Issa Gold features a guest appearance from Portugal The Man.

Title: Double Exposure
Info: The seventh full-length solo release for the San Francisco-based singer-songwriter is his first on Third Man Records.

Title: Sticky Wickets
Info: Cricket is the theme on the second full-length release for the Irish pop duo.

Title: Vexovoid
Info: This is the fourth full-length release from the Australian death metal band.

Title: Jiaolong
Info: This is the debut electronic full-length release for Dan Snaith [aka Caribou] as Daphni.

Title: http://www.itstartshear.com
Info: The second full-length solo album for the multi-instrumentalist was produced by Nils Frahm.

Title: Punk and Poetry
Info: The third album for the British punk rock band was produced by Peter Miles.

Title: Pray To Be Free
Artist: James Levy & The Blood Red Rose
Info: Guy Berryman produced the pop album about love and romance for James Levy and Allison Pierce.

Title: Thank You Very Quickly
Info: The third album for the band that includes members from Kenya and the United States.

Title: Continue as a Guest
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for Canadian indie rock group The New Pornographers is its first on the Merge label.

Title: And They Turned Not When They Went
Info: Alexander Tucker and Daniel Beban's second release was recorded in part at the BBC's Bush House and mixes sounds from various locations in Britain.

Title: Alopecia
Info: The band returns with its latest album. With guests musicians Andrew Broder and Mark Erickson of Fog.

Title: No Shouts, No Calls
Info: This is the fourth studio album for the all-female four-piece from Brighton, England.

Title: No Life For Me
Info: The surprise release of the debut collaboration between Wavves and Cloud Nothings was produced by Sweet Valley.

Title: Fall Into the Sun
Info: The third full-length release for the Philadelphia trio of Allison Crutchfield, Kyle Gilbride and Jeff Bolt was recorded in Los Angeles and Philadelphia.

Title: Upper Air
Info: This is the first album on the Dead Oceans imprint for the trio from Raleigh, North Carolina.

Title: Low Country Blues
Info: On his latest album, the blues-rock singer pays tribute to his influences, both as a solo artist and as a member of the Allman Brothers. Allman also collaborates with other blues instrumentalists to create his own spin on a collection of old-time songs.

Title: The Belbury Tales
Info: The fourth album for the band led by Jim Jupp features Christopher Budd and Jim Musgrave as guest musicians.

Title: Polymers Are Forever
Info: The first single heard from the Welsh quartet since its 2009 album, Travels With Myself and Another, features the addition of second guitarist, Jimmy Watkins.

Title: Thao & Mirah
Info: The debut album of dreamlike indie folk rock from duo Thao Nguyen and Mirah Yom Tov Zeitlyn.

Title: Roadhouse Sun
Info: The second major release for the New Mexico singer.

Title: Volume 1: Frozen Ropes and Dying Quails
Info: R.E.M.'s Scott McCaughey and Peter Buck along with ex-Dream Syndicate member Steve Wynn and Miracle 3's Linda Pitmon team up together to create an album of songs about baseball.

Title: Lay Down The Law
Info: The debut album for the British rock band was produced by Rob Schnapf.

Title: Can't Wait Another Day
Info: Jens Lekman and members of The Clientele and Architecture In Helsinki guest on the Brooklyn band's sixth album.

Title: We Fight Til Death
Info: The now Philadelphia-based band's fifth album in its ten-year history marks its debut for Secretly Canadian. What's not so secret is that the disc was produced by Dan Burton (Early Day Miners).

Title: Echoes
Info: The Brooklyn band's dance/punk/80s hybrid debut follows months of hype and anticipation fed by several years of touring. Included here is the single "House Of Jealous Lovers."

Title: C'Mon Lets Pretend
Info: This 1999 debut album for the all-girl Swedish garage band gets a belated U.S. release (complete with new packaging and bonus tracks) to capitalize on the recent success of their American breakthrough, 2002's 'Jennie Bomb.'

Title: Mount Eerie
Info: The Microphones is an alias for Washington state-based Phil Elvrum, who returns here with a five-part concept album named after a mountain in his home state. The album is also being released in two limited edition alternate versions, one an a capella version called "Singing from 'Mt. Eerie,'" and one a drums-only version (!) called, naturally, "Drumming from 'Mt. Eerie.'"

Title: Power In Numbers
Info: The Los Angeles-based underground hip-hop outfit returns with a follow up to their 2000 debut, 'Quality Control.' Nelly Furtado guests on one track.

Title: Aldhils Arboretum
Info: Prone to making concept albums, the Athens, GA band led by Kevin Barnes returns with a more conventional offering for this, their fifth LP.

Title: Torino
Info: Basically a continuation of The Wedding Present (but with a broader, more "cinematic" sound), Cinerama features David Gedge and Simon Cleave from that band as well as Gedge's wife, Sally Murrell. Torino, the group's third studio album, was produced by Dare Mason and longtime collaborator Steve Albini, and features the UK hit single "Health And Efficiency."

Title: You Can't Fight What You Can't See
Info: Moving back to the indie leagues after one major-label release (1998's 'Freak*on*ica' for Geffen), the hard-rocking foursome return to form for the most part on these 11 tracks, retaining only a few techno touches from the experimentation of their previous effort.

Title: Stereo
Info: The former Replacements leader returns with his first solo effort in three years, which actually is two albums in one: Stereo, his new 12-track solo release; and Mono, a second recording by Westerberg and full band under the Grandpaboy name.

Title: Sign [EP]
Info: Clocking in at 65 minutes, this EP from Japanese experimental electronica producer Nobukazu Takemura contains just four songs, including the title track (which differs from the version on 'Hoshi No Koe') and "Souvenir in Chicago," a 35-minute jam session featuring members of Tortoise.

Title: Haunted
Info: Poe's second album is a concept album, of sorts, about the death of her father (noted documentarian Tad Danielewski). Partially based on the autobiographical novel House of Leaves by Poe's brother Mark Z. Danielewski, 'Haunted' utilizes tapes of her father's voice as well as a mix of dark electronic and organic sounds.

Title: Essence
Info: Former 808 State-er Gerald Simpson returns with a follow-up to 1995's Black Secret Technology.

Title: The Odd Couple
Info: This is the sophomore album for producer Danger Mouse and rapper Cee-Lo Green.

Title: Come Home To Mama
Info: The third full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Cibo Matto's Yuka Honda and features such guests as Nels Cline, Sean Lennon, and Dirty Three drummer Jim White.

Title: Era Extrana
Info: The chillwave band from Texas returns with another album of experimental pop, recorded during a long Helsinki winter.

Title: Out Of The Woods
Info: This is the Everything But The Girl singer's first solo release since 1982.

Title: Heartland
Info: Due to trademark reasons, Canadian singer-songwriter Owen Pallett retired the Final Fantasy band name and returned to his own name for his latest release.

Title: Holy Fire
Info: The third full-length release from the British indie rock band was produced by Flood and Alan Moulder.

Title: Whoop Dee Doo
Info: This is the first album of new material in ten years for the garage rock trio led by Kim Shattuck (ex-Pixies bassist who replaced Kim Deal).

Title: Tranquility Base Hotel + Casino
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the British indie rock band led by Alex Turner was produced by James Ford.

Title: Bunny
Info: The fifth full-length release for the electronic music producer features guest appearances from Tegan and Sara.

Title: Deer Tick, Vol. 2
Info: One of two releases from the Rhode Island alternative rock band, Vol. 2 features 10 rock songs with electric guitars.

Title: Hormone Lemonade
Info: The third full-length release for the project of Stereolab's Tim Gane was recorded to tape over three one-hour sessions.

Title: Do Hollywood
Info: The debut full-length release for the Long Island pop band led by brothers Brian and Michael D'Addario was produced by Jonathan Rado of Foxygen.

Title: Ruminations
Info: The seventh full-length solo studio release for the singer-songwriter was written while visiting his hometown in Nebraska and was recorded over two days.

Title: Lost Time
Info: The third full-length release for the Seattle punk-pop band was produced by Erik Blood.

Title: The Air Force
Info: Deerhoof's Greg Saunier produced this fifth album for the experimental Bay Area band led by Jamie Stewart.

Title: Tommy
Info: The fifth album for Martin Dosh was named after his friend Tom Cesario, who had died two years ago.

Title: No Way Down [EP]
Info: This is the Swedish indie-pop band's second EP.

Title: The Pains Of Being Pure At Heart
Artist: The Pains of Being Pure at Heart
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the New York indie-rock band.

Title: Sing in a World That's Falling Apart
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Atlanta garage rock band features influences from country music.

Title: V
Info: The fifth full-length release from New Zealand band Unknown Mortal Orchestra features contributions from his father Chris Nielson and was created in Palm Springs, California, and Hilo, Hawaii.

Title: Darkness and Light
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the multi-award-winning R&B singer-songwriter was produced by Blake Mills and features guest appearances from Chance the Rapper, Brittany Howard, and Miguel.

Title: Familia
Info: The third full-length solo release for Camila Cabello features guest appearances from Maria Becerra, Ed Sheeran, WILLOW, and Yotuel.

Title: Close It Quietly
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Greta Kline-led band was co-produced with Gabe Wax.

Title: Pickpocket's Locket
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Canadian indie band led by Carey Mercer was created on an acoustic guitar his father willed to him.

Title: Early Riser
Info: With influences from electronic, hip-hop, and jazz, the debut full-length release for the son of Grammy-winning jazz musician Bobby McFerrin features guest appearances from Robert Glasper, César Camargo Mariano, Nai Palm, RYAT, Thundercat, and Marcus Gilmore.

Title: Perils from the Sea
Info: This is the debut release from the collaboration between Sun Kil Moon's Mark Kozelek and Album Leaf's Jimmy Lavelle.

Title: Love Will Prevail
Info: This is the third album for Sean Ragon as Cult of Youth.

Title: Fine Line
Info: The second full-length solo release for the One Direction member features production from Jeff Bhasker, Tyler Johnson, Kid Harpoon, and Sammy Witte.

Title: Insecure Men
Info: The debut full-length release for the new project from Fat White Family's Saul Adamczewski and Childhood's Ben Romans-Hopcraft was produced by Sean Lennon.

Title: Crooked Calypso
Info: The third full-release for The Beautiful South's Paul Heaton and Jacqui Abbott was produced by John Owen Williams.

Title: Fresh Air
Info: The 13th full-length release for the Krautrock band with Jean-Hervé Peron, Werner Diermaier and Maxime Manac'h features guest appearances from Jürgen Engler, Barbara Manning, and Ysanne Spevack.

Title: Paperback Ghosts
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the British indie pop band led by David Feck was produced by Simon Trought.

Title: Via
Info: This is the first release from Thalia Zedek Band in five years is also its first with new drummer Dave Bryson of Son Volt (replacing Daniel Coughlin).

Title: Blood Rushing
Info: The latest release for the singer-songwriter from Colorado was produced by Andrija Tokic and again features Spanish guitarist Victor Herrero.

Title: Carbeth
Info: The debut album for the English and Scottish quartet is led by Alex Neilson, who has worked as a drummer for Wil Oldham, Isobel Campbell, and Bonnie "Prince" Billy.

Title: Yesterday, Today & Tomorrow
Info: The latest album for the Massachusetts-born rapper features guests such as High Priest, Busdriver, Subtitle, Nocando, Vyle, and Mestizo.

Title: Apocalipstick
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles rock band led by Clem Creevy (and a new lineup from its debut) was produced by Joe Chicarelli and Carlos de la Garza.

Title: ISAM
Info: The Brazilian electronics musician continues to evolve his environmental sampling sound on his latest album.

Title: Honky Tonk
Info: Jay Farrar's latest release with his alternative country band Son Volt harkens back to the Bakersfield sound of the 1950-60s.

Title: An Album by Korallreven
Info: This is the first album from the Swedish duo of Marcus Joons and Daniel Tjader (formerly of The Radio Dept.).

Title: Blue Chips 7000
Info: The second full-length studio release for the rapper is the third for his Blue Chips trilogy and features guest appearances from Big Body Bes, Jah Tiger, Meyhem Lauren and Rick Ross.

Title: Oracular Spectacular
Info: David Fridmann produced the debut full-length album for the New York-based band.

Title: Son of Rogues Gallery: Pirate Ballads, Sea Songs & Chanteys
Info: Johnny Depp and Hal Willner's second collection of pirate/sea songs includes vocals from such artists as Dr. John, Marianne Faithfull, Iggy Pop, Courtney Love, Keith Richards, Patti Smith, Michael Stipe, and Tom Waits.

Title: Back in Black
Info: The latest full-length release for the California hip-hop group Cypress Hill features guest appearances from Demrick and Dizzy Wright.

Title: Blondes
Info: The debut album for the Brooklyn electronic duo of Zach Steinman and Sam Haar includes three previously released tracks.

Title: The Story of Sonny Boy Slim
Info: The second full-length release for the Austin guitarist was self-produced.

Title: Amok
Info: Originally conceived to perform The Eraser, Thom Yorke's 2006 debut album live, the supergroup comprised of Thom Yorke, Nigel Godrich, Mauro Refosco, Joey Waronker, and Flea toured for two weeks in 2010 with some new material. After the success of the tour, the band decided to work on an album and recorded the debut in three days.

Title: Ur Fun
Info: The 16th full-length studio release for the indie pop band led by Kevin Barnes features a guest appearance from Locate S,1.

Title: hej!
Info: The full-length debut studio release for the London-based producer features a guest appearance from Chairlift's Caroline Polachek.

Title: The Return
Info: The debut full-length release for the British jazz artist features a guest appearance from Mansur Brown and influences from drum 'n' bass, hip hop and R&B.

Title: Hang
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie rock duo of Sam France and Jonathan Rado features a full symphony orchestra conducted by Trey Pollard and contributions from Matthew E. White, The Flaming Lips' Steve Drozd and The Lemon Twigs.

Title: A Cure for Loneliness
Info: The eighth solo release for J. Geils Band lead singer features four songs co-written with Grammy/Academy Award-winning songwriter Will Jennings.

Title: Aa
Info: The debut full-length release for the Philadelphia electronic producer features guest appearances from such artists as Future, Leikeli47, M.I.A., Novelist, Pusha T, Rustie, and Tirzah.

Title: Before A Million Universes
Info: This is the second full-length release for the New York post-punk quartet.

Title: Wald
Info: The seventh full-length release from Berlin-based producer Stefan Betke was inspired by his walks in the Alps forest.

Title: Parker Millsap
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Oklahoma singer-songwriter.

Title: Unity Band
Info: The latest album for Pat Metheny features an ensemble that includes Antonio Sanchez, Ben Williams, and Chris Potter.

Title: The High Country
Info: The alt-country band's latest album tells of a dark and violent love affair set in an unnamed Oregon logging town.

Title: Gentle Spirit
Info: Produced by the singer-songwriter-producer, the album was recorded between tours and other producing jobs on analog tape. It includes Andy Cabic and Otto Hauser of Vetiver; Chris Robinson and Adam McDougall of the Black Crowes; and Brian Geltner, Barry Goldberg, Josh Grange, Gerald Johnson, Gary Louris, and Gary Mallaber as guest musicians.

Title: Screws Get Loose
Info: The Tennessee-based band release their second album of folk, country and garage punk and draw comparisons to bands like The Ramones to the Carter Family because of their genre-bending style.

Title: Isla
Info: The British jazz quartet's follow-up to Knee-deep In The North Sea, its Mercury Prize-nominated debut album, was recorded at Abbey Road Studios with producer John Leckie.

Title: Intoxication
Info: The dance-hall artist returns with his latest album, including one song with Akon.

Title: ...And They Have Escaped the Weight of Darkness
Info: The second full-length album for Icelander Olafur Arnalds continues to meld classical music with pop and rock music.

Title: Babes Never Die
Info: The second full-length release for the Scottish indie-pop duo of Cat Myers (taking over for Shona McVicar, who left shortly after their debut release) and Stina Tweeddale was produced by James Dring.

Title: True Romance
Info: The debut studio release for the British pop singer includes some tracks from her two previous mixtapes "Heartbreaks and Earthquakes" and "Super Ultra."

Title: Jumping the Shark
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Seekae co-founder was produced with Fanny B.

Title: Russian Roulette
Info: Alan Maman moves from the producer chair to the mic for his third solo album as The Alchemist that includes guest appearances from such artists as Action Bronson, Danny Brown, Guilty Simpson, Fashawn, Roc Marciano, and Schoolboy Q.

Title: Algiers
Info: The latest full-length release for the Arizona alternative rock band led by Joey Burns and John Convertino was recorded in New Orleans with producer Craig Schumacher.

Title: Young Machetes
Info: The band's fifth album was produced by Guy Piccioto and John Goodmanson.

Title: All Fiction
Info: The latest full-length release for Boston indie rock band Pile was produced with Kevin S. McMahon.

Title: My Way
Info: The latest release for the country singer-songwriter is a tribute to Frank Sinatra featuring songs made famous by the the man called the Chairman of the Board and a guest appearance by Norah Jones.

Title: Backwater
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Australian electronic-pop duo of Chloe Kaul and Simon Lam.

Title: Cellar Door
Info: Even with more than 20 years in the industry, British DJ/producers Conrad McDonnell and Dan Tyler have not released a full-length album of their own until now.

Title: Komba
Info: Portugal's Buraka Som Sistema, best known for blending African kuduro with European techno and dubstep, presents its second album. Komba is named after an Angolan religious ritual celebrated seven days after someone passes away.

Title: Woke On A Whaleheart
Info: The singer-songwriter behind Smog [and its more parenthetical offshoot, (Smog)] returns with his first release under his given name.

Title: Blood Pressures
Info: Ending a multi-year hiatus, The Kills return with another album of minimalist garage punk.

Title: Doko Mien
Info: The third full-length release for the Nigerian Afro-electronic band led by London-born Eno Williams was produced by Max Grunhard.

Title: Move in Spectrums
Info: The first release in four years for the Brooklyn synth-pop trio was produced by the Violens' Jorge Elbrecht.

Title: Two Matchsticks
Info: This is the second album for the band led by American Analog Set's Andrew Kenny and includes Sean Haskins, Matt Pond and Leslie Sisson. Death Cab For Cutie's Ben Gibbard features as a guest.

Title: Escape 2 Mars
Info: The rapper who was a member of Blackalicious releases his second solo album.

Title: The Neon
Info: The latest full-length release from the British synth-pop duo was self-produced and recorded in Atlanta.

Title: Do It Again
Info: The five-track mini-LP from the collaboration between Royksopp and Robyn includes two tracks from Röyksopp’s upcoming album.

Title: In Stormy Nights
Info: The first release in three years for the Japanese psych-rockers contains just six tracks, including one that clocks in at nearly half an hour.

Title: Elsie
Info: The debut side project for Gaslight Anthem lead singer Brian Fallon also features his guitar tech, Ian Perkins.

Title: Slime & Reason
Info: The fourth album for the rapper includes Metronomy as a guest artist.

Title: Reunion Tour
Info: The Canadian band's fourth studio album, again produced by Ian Blurton.

Title: Principe del Norte
Info: The fourth solo release from the Norwegian artist/producer is a two-disc (or four LP) album of instrumentals influenced by 90's ambient music.

Title: Lost Time
Info: The debut release for Liturgy's Greg Fox and Oneida's Kid Millions was recorded in two separate sessions.

Title: Everyday Robots
Info: The solo debut release for the Blur frontman features guest appearances from Brian Eno, Bat For Lashes' Natasha Khan, and The Leytonstone City Mission Choir.

Title: Lustre
Info: Ryan Hadlock helped produce the fifth studio album for British singer-songwriter, Ed Harcourt. The UK edition includes a seven-track bonus disc.

Title: Heaven Is Whenever
Info: The first album for the band without Franz Nicolay, who left the band in January 2010, was produced by Dean Baltulonis.

Title: What Do You Think About the Car?
Info: The debut full-length release for the British alternative pop singer-songwriter was produced by James Ford of Simian Mobile Disco.

Title: In Mind
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn-based New Jersey indie rock band is its first with new guitarist, Julian Lynch (Matt Mondanile left to concentrate on Ducktails).

Title: Seek Warmer Climes
Info: This is the debut full-length release from the Danish post-punk band led by Adrian Toubro.

Title: ilp.
Info: The debut full-length release for the British producer/singer  includes elements of R&B, pop and electronic music.

Title: The Pet Parade
Info: The ninth full-length release for Eric D. Johnson's indie folk project was produced and engineered with Josh Kaufman.

Title: Girl with Basket of Fruit
Info: the 11th full-length release for the Los Angeles-based experimental band led by Jamie Stewart and was co-produced by Angela Seo and Deerhoof's Greg Saunier.

Title: Million Dollars To Kill Me
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Southern California pop-punk band was produced by Kurt Ballou.

Title: Hammer of the Witches
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the British extreme metal band led by Dani Filth features a line-up with two guitarists: Marek "Ashok" Šmerda and Richard Shaw.

Title: We Come from the Same Place
Info: This is the third full-length release for the indie pop band.

Title: No One's First, And You're Next
Info: Modest Mouse releases an album with tracks from the "We Were Dead Before the Ship Even Sank" and "Good News for People Who Love Bad News" recording sessions.

Title: Many Moons
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Real Estate frontman was produced by Woods' Jarvis Taveniere.

Title: Believe You Me
Info: This is the debut full-length release from the collaboration between Julianna Barwick and Helado Negro (aka Roberto Lange).

Title: Black Cascade
Info: The third album for the Washington-based metal band was produced by Randall Dunn.

Title: Stranger Than Fiction
Info: After a number of mixtapes, the rapper from Louisiana releases his debut full-length studio release that includes guest appearances from Juicy J and Wiz Khalifa.

Title: Total Dust
Info: Leon Taheny produced the debut solo album for Holy Fuck's Brian Borcherdt as Dusted.

Title: Vertigo Days
Info: The first new full-length studio release in seven years for the German band features guest appearances Angel Bat Dawid, Ben LaMar Gay, Juana Molina, and Zayaendo.

Title: Love in the 4th Dimension
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Jules Jackson was co-produced with Catherine Marks.

Title: Skin
Info: The second full-length release for Australian electronic producer Harley Streten features guest appearances from AlunaGeorge, Beck, Kai, Allan Kingdom, Kučka, Little Dragon, Tove Lo, Vic Mensa, MNDR, Raekwon, and Vince Staples.

Title: Family
Info: British folk rock artist Teddy Thompson collaborates with his father Richard, his mother Linda, his sister Kami, his half-brother Jack Thompson, and nephew Zak Hobbs on this debut release produced by Teddy.

Title: Till Midnight
Info: The fourth studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Christopher Thorn and features guest appearances from Ben Nichols of Lucero, Dave Hause of The Loved Ones, Jenny O., Chad Price, and John Snodgrass of Drag The River.

Title: The Big Other
Info: The full-length debut for the British indie rock band includes a song dedicated to World War II scientist Alan Turing.

Title: I Was a Cat from a Book
Info: Dave Wrench helped produced the album with the British singer-songwriter that includes contributions from members of The Cinematic Orchestra, Lamb, and Sparrow & The Workshop.

Title: MMXII
Info: An apocalyptic future is the central theme for the 15th album from the British post-punk rock band.

Title: Food for Worms
Info: The third full-length release for British punk band Shame features a guest appearance from Phoebe Bridgers.

Title: I Love You. It's a Fever Dream
Info: The first release in four years for Kristian Matsson as The Tallest Man On Earth was recorded in his Brooklyn apartment.

Title: The Desired Effect
Info: The second full-length solo release for The Killers lead singer was produced with Ariel Rechtshaid.

Title: Hive Mind
Info: Mi Ami's Daniel Martin-McCormicks releases a five-track album of house music under the name Ital for Planet Mu.

Title: Cigarettes After Sex
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Brooklyn ambient pop band led by Greg Gonzalez.

Title: IV
Info: The first studio release in more than five years [not including the Year Zero soundtrack] for the Vancouver rock band was produced by Randall Dunn.

The third full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter features songs co-written with such artists as Brian Burton, Samuel Dixon, Paul Epworth, Tobias Jesso Jr., Greg Kurstin, Bruno Mars, Max Martin, Karl Johan Schuster, and Ryan Tedder.

Title: Centipede Hz
Info: The ninth studio album sees the return of founding member Deakin and co-producer Ben Allen.

Title: Smile
Info: The Japanese experimental group's latest album features guest musicians Michio Kurihara of Ghost and Stephen O'Malley of Sunn O))).

Title: The  Bronx (IV)
Info: The fourth self-titled release for the Los Angeles punk band is its first since 2008. They previously released two albums under the name Mariachi El Bronx in 2009 and 2011.

Title: Honey Moon
Info: The latest album for the duo is a series of love songs to celebrate their 20 years of marriage.

Title: The Rhumb Line
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the upstate New York indie rock band.

Title: The  Inevitable End
Info: The final release for the Norwegian electronic duo of Svein Berge and Torbjørn Brundtland as Röyksopp features guest appearances from Ryan James of Man Without Country, Jamie McDermott of The Irrepressibles, Robyn, and Susanne Sundfør.

Title: Humbug
Info: The third album for the British band was co-produced by Josh Homme and James Ford.

Title: Tales of a Grass Widow
Info: The fifth full-length release for the sister duo of Bianca and Sierra Casady was produced with Valgeir Sigurðsson.

Title: Winds Take No Shape
Info: The Bay Area indie-pop band returns with a second LP.

Title: Today Is The Day [EP]
Info: More "rocking" than recent LP 'Summer Sun,' this six-track EP includes four new songs plus alternate versions of "Cherry Chapstick" and the title cut.

Title: Chicken & Beer
Info: Perhaps the most successful Dirty South rapper, Ludacris returns with his third Def Jam release.

Title: So Much Staying Alive & Lovelessness
Info: Mixing post-rock and emo with punk edigness and experimentalism, Chicago's Joan of Arc features members of the Owls and Cap'n Jazz, including Owls vocalist Tim Kinsella. On this fourth album, they are also joined by members of Califone, Isotope 217, and Ugly Casanova, among others.

Title: Equilibrium
Info: The latest installment in Thirsty Ear's Blue Series (which mixes cutting-edge jazz with elements of electronica and hip-hop), 'Equilibrium' showcases the talents of avant-garde pianist Matthew Shipp.

Title: Held
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Manchester electronic producer.

Title: Night & Day
Info: Andre Williams and the Canadian alt-country rock band the Sadies worked together in 2008, however due to Williams' legal and personal problems the project was shelved until they reunited recently to finish the album.

Title: True Loves
Info: This is the Brooklyn indie rockers first full-length album on Dovecote.

Title: The Lamb
Info: The second full-length release for the Chicago-based singer-songwriter was written after a series of events including "a home invasion, deaths of loved ones and general violence."

Title: New Spirit
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Australian electro-rock trio (previously known as Pivot) was recorded in London and Sydney.

Title: Arms Around a Vision
Info: The third full-length release for the Northern Irish post-punk band was self-produced and mixed by Dan Rejmer.

Title: Going Back Home
Info: After former Mr. Feelgood guitarist Wilko Johnson learned he had terminal pancreatic cancer, he went on tour and soon heard from Who singer Roger Daltrey about recording an album together. The collaboration was recorded in a week and was produced by Dave Eringa.

Title: Despite Our Differences
Info: Mitchell Froom produced the latest for the duo of Amy Ray and Emily Saliers.

Title: Combat Sports
Info: The fourth full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Ross Orton.

Title: Who Are You
Info: This is the debut full-length studio release for producer Eddie Ruscha, who previously released music under the name Secret Circuit.

Title: Royal Headache
Info: The self-titled release for the garage punk band from Australia was produced by Mikey Young of Eddy Current Suppression Ring.

Title: Just A Little Lovin'
Info: Shelby Lynne's 10th album has her covering some of Dusty Springfield's biggest hits.

Title: Jackleg Devotional to the Heart
Info: The second release for the Texas folk band was co-produced by band member Jason Reimer and producer Stuart Sikes.

Title: XXXX
Artist: You Say Party! We Say Die!
Info: Released in their native country last fall, the third album for the Canadian rockers finds the quintet adds new variations to their sound.

Title: Translated From Love
Info: Five years since her last release (Christmas album withstanding), country singer Kelly Willis returns with a new album.

Title: Lux
Info: Brian Eno's debut solo release on Warp (two previous releases were collaborations with other artists) was originally composed for a sound art exhibit in Italy.

Title: Unbreakable
Info: The first studio release in seven years for the R&B/pop singer features guest appearances from Missy Elliott and J. Cole.

Title: We Must Become the Pitiless Censors of Ourselves
Info: This is the latest album for the experimental composer from Minnesota.

Title: Chewed Corners
Info: This is the first solo release for the British electronic producer/Planet Mu founder Mike Paradinas since 2007's Duntisbourne Abbots Soulmate Devastation Technique.

Title: Get Lonely
Info: John Darnielle follows 'The Sunset Tree' with this equally personal 12-song set.

Title: Forever Turned Around
Info: The second full-length release for the ex-Smith Westerns duo of Julien Ehrlich and Max Kakacek was produced by Bradley Cook and Jonathan Rado.

Title: Crosseyed Heart
Info: The first solo release in 23 years for the Rolling Stones' guitarist was produced with Steve Jordan.

Title: Afraid Of Ghosts
Info: The seventh full-length release for the singer-songwriter-producer was produced by Ryan Adams and feature guest appearances from Johnny Depp, Bob Mould, and Mike Viola.

Title: Eight
Info: The eighth release for the Los Angeles indie rock band led by Jim Putnam released only on Vinyl and digitally features new band members: Stevie Treichel, Be Hussey, Dan Iead, Brian Cleary, and Ethan Walter.

Title: After Robots
Info: The debut full-length album for the South African indie rock band was recorded in three weeks.

Title: Upside Down Mountain
Info: The first release for the singer-songwriter on Nonesuch Records includes contributions from First Aid Kit, Blake Mills, Macey Taylor, and was produced Jonathan Wilson.

Title: 4everevolution
Info: British rapper Rodney Smith's latest studio album features guest appearances by Toddla T, DJ MK, Daddy Kope, Ricky Ranking, and Rokhsan.

Title: Thank Me Later
Info: Showcasing his depth as a rapper, singer, and songwriter, Drake's debut album secures his place among hip-hop's elite with emotionally charged lyrics and dynamically produced beats.

Title: Mind Bokeh
Info: Bibio, the moniker for UK producer Stephen Wilkinson, is a danceable, electronic music project with pop and chillwave undertones.

Title: Pumps!
Info: The Brooklyn, New York, band moves to Vice Records for its latest album, which is also the first with new band member Sadie Laska.

Title: Voltaic [Live]
Info: The live CD features live recordings after the release of 2007's "Volta."

Title: The Heretic's Bargain
Info: This is the third full-length release for the psych supergroup formed by Sir Richard Bishop, Ben Chasny and Chris Corsano.

Title: Love Yes
Info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn-based band was produced by Daniel Schlett.

Title: When The Devil's Loose
Info: This is the second solo album for the former Verbena lead singer.

Title: Save Rock and Roll
Info: Produced by Butch Walker, the fifth full-length studio release from the pop punk band is its first album since the quartet announced an indefinite hiatus in 2009.

Title: The Million Things That Never Happened
Info: The latest full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Izumi and Romeo Stodart.

Title: The Life Of Pablo
Info: After several album name changes (So Help Me God, SWISH, Waves, and T.L.O.P.), the seventh studio release for the rapper finally was set with guest appearances from Vic Mensa, Post Malone, Sia and Ty Dolla $ign.

Title: Louden Up Now
Info: This is the second full-length for the dance-oriented Sacramento/New York seven-piece (down from eight), who share several members with the band Out Hud.

Title: Apropa't
Info: Savath & Savalas is a side project from avant-garde hip-hop producer Scott Herren (aka Prefuse 73) that here incorporates elements of post-rock, Latin pop and jazz rhythms, and other world music elements. Aiding him are drummer John Herndon (Tortoise) and vocalist Eva Muns.

Title: Control
Info: Christian-indie rocker David Bazan follows 2000's 'Winners Never Quit' with this full-length album. This time out, Casey Foubert (Seldom) lends a hand with the instrumentation.

Title: Bavarian Fruit Bread
Info: This is the debut album for the former Mazzy Star chanteuse's new band.

Title: Amnesiac
Info: These eleven tracks were recorded during the same sessions that produced 2000's 'Kid A,' but are a bit more song-like and a bit less electronic.

Title: Lunatico
Info: A Frenchman, a Swiss and an Argentine walked into a band, and the result was the tango-tronica sound of Gotan Project, who return with a follow-up to their 2002 debut.

Title: Ten Silver Drops
Info: This is the sophomore set from the Texas-founded (and now New York-based) band known for its epic, proggy, psychedelic sound.

Title: Bloom Forever
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the ex-S.C.U.M. frontman chronicles his life between 2012 and 2015 with songs influenced by his marriage to Peaches Geldof, the birth of their children, and her sudden death at 25.

Title: Cupid Deluxe
Info: The second release from Dev Hynes as Blood Orange includes guest appearances from such artists as Adam Bainbridge of Kindness, Clams Casino, MC Despot, David Longstreth of Dirty Projectors, Caroline Polachek of Chairlift, Skepta, and Samantha Urbani of Friends.

Title: Universes
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based artist features influences from funk, hip-hop, house, and pop music.

Title: Laru Beya
Info: Produced by guitarist Ivan Duran, the latest album for Aurelio Martinez was recorded in Senegal.

Title: Return of the Century
Info: The second full-length album for the Chicago pop band finds it with a new lineup after the loss of two of its founding members.

Title: The Music Scene
Info: This is the third album for the New York-based rapper.

Title: Triangle
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for the Norwegian singer who previously released music under Susanna And The Magical Orchestra.

Title: Consolers Of The Lonely
Info: The Raconteurs surprised much of the music industry by announcing the release of its sophomore album a week before it was released.

Title: Working Man's Cafe
Info: The sophomore solo album for The Kinks' lead singer was recorded in Nashville, Tennessee.

Title: Music For The Long Emergency
Info: This is the debut full-length collaboration between Minneapolis electro-pop band Poliça and the Berlin-based orchestra collective Stargaze.

Title: Legends Never Die
Info: The posthumous release is the rapper's full-length studio album and features guest appearances from Halsey, Marshmello, Polo G, The Kid Laroi, and Trippie Redd.

Title: Cistern
Info: The second full-length release for the California composer/multi-instrumentalist was recorded in part in an empty two million gallon underground water tank.

Title: Bitchitronics
Info: The four-track release from the Chicago duo of Cooper Crain and Dan Quinlivan is their first on the Drag City label.

Title: Leave Your Sleep
Info: The former 10,000 Maniacs singer releases a 26-track solo album based on poems about childhood.

Title: For My Parents
Info: This is the sixth album for the Japanese instrumental post-rock band.

Title: Nothin' But Blood
Info: The eighth full-length release for the Texas artist was recorded in his home studio.

Title: Silver Pony
Info: This album contains several live and studio recorded songs from the Grammy-winning jazz singer.

Title: Axis Of Evol
Info: This is the second Pink Mountaintops album for Vancouver, Canada's Stephen McBean.

Title: Front Parlour Ballads
Info: This is the guitarist's first solo acoustic album in nearly 25 years.

Title: Frances The Mute
Info: The psychedelic prog-rock outfit led by Cedric Bixler Zavala and Omar Rodriguez return with a second ambitious album, which follows the death of band member Jeremy Ward.

Title: Hesitant Alien
Info: The debut solo release for the former My Chemical Romance singer was produced by Doug McKean.

Title: Tahoe
Info: The second full-length ambient release for the California producer (who also released albums under the name Lee Bannon) was recorded in Berlin, California, Cambridge, and New York.

Title: Lola
Info: Produced by Lee Townsend, the latest release from the Austin singer-songwriter features covers of Mexican classics and originals influenced by those songs.

Title: Into the Wide
Info: The fourth full-length release for the California indie rock band was produced by Ben Allen.

Title: Belle and Sebastian Write About Love
Info: The Glaswegian indie pop band returns after a four-year hiatus with an eighth studio album, featuring its trademark down-tempo ballads and jangly guitar rock.

Title: Magnificent Fiend
Info: The sophomore album for ex-Comets on Fire frontman is the first jointly released on Birdman and Rick Rubin's American label.

Title: Blues Funeral
Info: The seventh Mark Lanegan Band album features guest appearances by Josh Homme, Greg Dulli, Jack Irons, and Alain Johannes.

Title: Apocalypse
Info: The seven-track album is the third studio release for the singer-songwriter since dropping the name Smog.

Title: Dreamland
Info: The third full-length release for the British psychedelic pop band led by Dave Bayley (who also produced the album) was executive produced by Paul Epworth.

Title: Tooth & Nail
Info: The first new studio release in five years for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in California at producer Joe Henry's house.

Title: Acid Tongue
Info: The latest solo album for the Rilo Kiley singer features guests such as Elvis Costello and Chris Robinson.

Title: The Runner [Original Soundtrack]
Info: The soundtrack for the short horror film Massachusetts electronic duo Boy Harsher also wrote and directed features guest appearances from Cooper B. Handy (aka Lucy) and Mariana Saldaña of BOAN.

Title: Injury Reserve
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Arizona alternative rap group features guest appearances from Aminé, Dylan Brady, Cakes Da Killa, DRAM, Freddie Gibbs, JPEGMAFIA, Pro Teens, Rico Nasty, and Tony Velour.

Title: This Is Not the End
Info: The debut full-length release for the Norwegian indie rock trio of Mads Baklien, Stian Brennskag, and Christian Løvhaug was produced by Tord Øverland Knudsen of The Wombats and Team Me's Marius Drogsås Hagen.

Title: The Soul of the Hour
Info: the ninth studio release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Johann Scheerer and is its first with new bassist Leo Kurunis.

Title: Comfort
Info: The debut full-length release for the British DJ and producer includes guest appearances from such artists as Hercules And Love Affair’s Kim Ann Foxman, Miss Kittin, Karin Park, Alpines’ Catherine Pockson, Nadine Shah, and Tricky.

Title: Love Triangles, Hate Squares
Info: The second full-length release for the soul-punk British four-piece led by Al Kershaw was recorded in Georgia with producer Mark Neil.

Title: Live
Info: The unedited second live release for the electronic duo was recorded at a 2012 show in Philadelphia.

Title: Cabinet of Curiosities
Info: The debut release for the Dutch musician was inspired by the music of the 1960s.

Title: awE naturalE
Info: The debut full-length release on Sub Pop for the Seattle hip-hop duo of Stasia Irons and Catherine Harris-White features Shabazz Palaces' Ishmael Butler as a guest singer.

Title: Youth
Info: Originally a solo project for Swede Sebastian Armstrong, the debut full-length album is the first for the band as a trio.

Title: No Thyself
Info: This is the first album in 30 years for the British post-punk band who reunited in 2008.

Title: An Appointment with Mr. Yeats
Info: The Celtic folk rock band led by Mike Scott release an album of songs based on the poems of W.B. Yeats.

Title: James Farm
Info: This is the debut release for the jazz quartet made up of Joshua Redman, Aaron Parks, Matt Penman, and Eric Harland.

Title: White Wilderness
Info: The singer-songwriter recorded the album live over three days with the Magik*Magik Orchestra.

Title: Before the Frost...
Info: The latest album for the rock band was recorded live at Levon Helm's barn. The CD comes with a code to download "Until The Freeze," which contains a second set of songs.

Title: Twang
Info: The latest album for the country singer produced by Tony Brown features three songs cowritten with his son, George "Bubba" Strait, Jr.

Title: Insides
Info: The electronic artist/producer who previously worked on Coldplay's Viva La Vida releases his first album on the Domino label.

Title: Wall Of Arms
Info: The second album for the British indie-rock quintet was produced by Markus Dravs.

Title: Never Better
Info: This is the third album for the Minnesota rapper, who is also a member of punk band Building Better Bombs.

Title: Everything That Happens Will Happen Today
Info: The sophomore album for the two rock legends was released digitally on their Web site, with a physical CD due later in the fall.

Title: The Concretes
Info: The Swedish group (originally formed 9 years ago as an all-girl trio, but now featuring 8 full-time members) make their international debut with an album that manages to combine elements of classic Motown, Mazzy Star and the Velvet Underground.

Title: I Can't Stop
Info: The Reverend returns to his roots, reuniting with the same producer (Willie Mitchell), Memphis studio (Hi Records' Royal Studios) and session musicians that made him a legend during the 1970s.

Title: 45/45 [EP]
Info: Berlin's Stefan Betke (aka Pole) makes his debut for Mute with this 4-track disc, the first in a planned series of EPs.

Title: Close Cover Before Striking [EP]
Info: This seven-track EP recorded during the sessions for 'Romantica' includes covers of the Rolling Stones' "Waiting On A Friend" and Kraftwerk's "Neon Lights," as well as five new songs and videos for "Lovedust" and "1995."

Title: Home
Info: The ever-popular contemporary country act returns with their sixth album.

Title: Driving Rain
Info: This is the former Beatle's first album of original recordings since 1997's 'Flaming Pie.'

Title: Silencio
Info: The second solo release for the Stereolab singer features guest appearances from Sam Prekop of Sea & Cake and fellow Stereolab band member Tim Gane.

Title: Elastic Days
Info: The latest solo release for the Dinosaur Jr. singer/guitarist features guest vocals from Black Heart Procession's Pall Jenkins, Mark Mulcahy and Luluc's Zoë Randell.

Title: Drifters/Love Is the Devil
Info: The two years Canadian artists Alex Zhang Hungtai spent on the road is the concept behind his double album as Dirty Beaches.

Title: The Sermon On Exposition Boulevard
Info: The lyrics for each of the songs on this rock-oriented disc are based on the teachings of Jesus (Christ).

Title: Along the Way
Info: This is the third full-length solo release for the former Emeralds guitarist.

Title: ::Disco2
Info: Health's 2009 album "Get Color" is remixed by such artists as Crystal Castles, Tobacco, CFCF, Javelin, and Little Loud.

Title: Future Teenage Cave Artists
Info: The 15th full-length studio release for the San Francisco indie/experimental pop band was self-produced.

Title: I Have to Feed Larry's Hawk
Info: Released under the expanded name, Tim Presley’s White Fence, the seventh full-length solo release for the California rock artist was recorded in San Francisco by Jeremy Harris.

Title: Tales of Us
Info: The sixth full-length release from the electronic duo is an cinematic-inspired album that will be accompanied by a film directed by Lisa Gunning.

Title: Actually, You Can
Info: The 18th full-length studio release for the San Francisco-based experimental rock band is self-described as "baroque gone DIY."

Title: Tribute To [EP]
Info: My Morning Jacket's Jim James releases his tribute EP to the late George Harrison.

Title: Late Night Endless
Info: This is the debut full-length collaboration between Adrian Sherwood and Rob Ellis.

Title: Latin
Info: The third album for the Canadian band was recorded in a barn and is the first with new member Matt Schulz.

Title: Please Be Mine
Info: The debut full-length release for the Austin-based indie pop singer from Los Angeles was recorded in two days with co-producer Dan Duszynski.

Title: Hypercaffium Spazzinate
Info: The first new release in 12 years for the Southern California punk quartet was produced by the band's guitarist Stephen Egerton and drummer Bill Stevenson.

Title: Parallel Play
Info: This is the latest album for the Canadian rock-pop quartet.

Title: Dark Bird Is Home
Info: This is the fourth full-length release for the Swedish singer-songwriter Kristian Matsson.

Title: Ignore The Ignorant
Info: This is the first album for the British rock band to feature the Smiths' Johnny Marr as lead guitarist.

Title: Ringer
Info: Kieran Hebden releases a 30-minute, four-track minialbum.

Title: Infinity On High
Info: The Chicago pop-punk band face high expectations for this fourth album after its predecessor, their major-label debut 'From Under The Cork Tree,' brought their first taste of mainstream success. Jay-Z (briefly) guests.

Title: Death Song
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Austin psych rock band was produced by Phil Ek.

Title: The  North Borders
Info: The fifth release for electronic producer Simon Green features guest appearances from Erykah Badu, Cornelia, Grey Reverend, and Szjerdene.

Title: In Search Of Stoney Jackson
Info: This California rap group at one time had Xzibit as a member, but now, the group is a trio, and releasing its first album in three years produced by Madlib.

Title: Venus On Earth
Info: The Los Angeles-based band that mixes  Cambodian pop to rock music releases its third album.

Title: The Defamation Of Strickland Banks
Info: Known primarily as a rapper, Ben Drew releases his soul singer concept album, exploring different sounds and an alter ego.

Title: No Rules Sandy
Info: North Carolina electro-pop duo Sylvan Esso created the songs for its fourth full-length release while staying in Los Angeles earlier this year.

Title: Is Your Love Big Enough?
Info: The debut full-length album for the British 22-year old singer-songwriter was produced by Matt Hales (also known as Aqualung).

Title: Temper
Info: The second album for the American electronic artist Thomas Meluch.

Title: Good Arrows
Info: The third album from the electronica-influenced UK  band.

Title: Intriguer
Info: Internationally acclaimed rockers release their sixth album since Neil Finn first formed the band 25 years ago, featuring production by Jim Scott from Wilco.

Title: Alone in the Universe
Info: Self-produced, the first release of new music from ELO since 2001's Zoom was completely a one-man project except for Jeff's daughter Laura Lynne on backing vocals.

Title: It's Hard for Me to Say I'm Sorry
Info: The collaboration between Christian Fennesz and Jim O'Rourke is a two-track full-length release.

Title: When You're Through Thinking, Say Yes
Info: The Jacksonville, Florida, pop-punk band returns with its seventh album of catchy melodies and sing-along choruses--its first release in almost three years after its reformation in 2010.

Title: The Documentary 2
Info: A sequel to the rappers debut 2005 album is part one of a double album (The Documentary 2.5 was released October 16th) features guest appearances from such artists as Ab-Soul, Diddy, Dr. Dre, Drake, Fergie, Ice Cube, Kendrick Lamar, Q-Tip, Snoop Dogg, Kanye West, and will.i.am.

Title: Songs for Singles
Info: The latest release from the Miami-based metal band is its second without guitarist Juan Montoya who left the band in 2008.

Title: Luv Is Rage 2
Info: The debut full-length release for the Philadelphia rapper features The Weeknd and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Late Night Feelings
