Info: The fifth full-length solo studio release for the British producer features guest appearances from Camila Cabello, Miley Cyrus, Diana Gordon, Ilsey, Alicia Keys, King Princess, The Last Artful, Dodgr, Lykke Li, Angel Olsen, and YEBBA.

Title: SremmLife 2
Info: The second full-length release form the rap brother duo from Mississippi features guest appearances from Gucci Mane, Juicy J,  Kodak Black, and Lil Jon.

Title: Raw Data Feel
Info: British alternative rock band Everything Everything's frontman Jonathan Higgs tried A.I. to help form lyrics for the quartet's sixth full-length release.

Title: Nothing Is Precious Enough For Us
Info: Joel Thibodeau's sophomore album was recorded in New Jersey and produced by Pete Donnelly.

Title: Ascension
Info: This is the first full-length album in more than four years for the British experimental rock band.

Title: Conquistador
Info: The latest solo release for the Earth frontman was recorded by Kurt Ballou.

Title: Lanterns
Info: The third full-length studio release for producer Ryan Lott as Son Lux includes contributions from Gem Club's Ieva Berberian Mutemath's Darren King, Lily & Madeleine, The Antlers' Peter Silberman, DM Stith, The Punch Brothers' Chris Thile, and yMusic.

Title: Electric Slave
Info: The third release from the Austin soul and blues-rock band includes production from Stuart Sikes and John Congleton on three tracks.

Title: Rot Gut, Domestic
Artist: Margot & the Nuclear So and So's
Info: Jon Congleton produced the fourth album for the indie pop group led by Richard Edwards.

Title: Slow Summits
Info: The first release since 1997’s Illumination for the Scottish indie pop band was produced by John McEntire and includes guest appearances from the Tenniscoats; Norman Blake and Gerard Love of Teenage Fanclub; and Stefan Schneider and Ronald Lippok of To Rococo.

Title: Mirror II
Info: The third full-length release for the Australian trio was recorded in Bristol by producer John Parish.

Title: Arrow
Info: The ninth full-length release for Sarah Lipstate as Noveller was recorded in Los Angeles.

Title: Heza
Info: The third full-length studio release for the New Orleans-based duo of Grant Widmer and Ted Joyner is the first album on the Polyvinyl label.

Title: Weird Sister
Info: The debut release for the Welsh noise pop band was produced by MJ of the Hookworms.

Title: The Incredible True Story
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Maryland rapper features guest appearances from Big Lenbo, Jesse Boykins III, Dria, and Lucy Rose.

Title: Woman
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the R&B/soul singer features production from 9th Wonder, David Banner, and Andre "Dre" Harris.

Title: No Coast
Info: The first full-length studio release from the emo band in 16 years was produced by Will Yip.

Title: Morgan Delt
Info: The debut full-length release for the California indie pop singer-songwriter was influenced by 1960s music.

Title: The Blue Depths
Info: The latest album from the Indiana rock duo, now based in Berkeley, California.

Title: Out My Window
Info: This is the debut album for the Candian producer/DJ.

Title: Pay The Devil
Info: The singer-songwriter takes a stab at country music with this collection of a dozen covers and three originals.

Title: Fever Breaks
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Jason Isbell and features contributions from Amanda Shires and members of Isbell's the 400 Unit.

Title: Permo
Info: The debut full-length release for the Scottish indie pop band was produced by Edwyn Collins.

Title: The Deepest Lake
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Los Angels group was self-produced.

Title: Palme
Info: The Icelandic singer-songwriter worked with Gunnar Orn Tynes of mum and Skuli Sverrisson on her fourth full-length release.

Title: The Mystery of Heaven
Info: This is the second release for the year from the collaboration between Jozef Van Wissem and guitarist Jim Jarmusch.

Title: In Ferneaux
Info: The latest release for Benjamin John Power's solo electronic project features two 20-minutes long tracks.

Title: Spectre
Info: The latest release for the Slovenian group includes three songs originally released on its 2013 EP S.

Title: Love Your Dum and Mad
Info: The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Ben Hillier.

Title: Wild Onion
Info: The second full-length release for the Chicago rock band was produced with R. Andrew Humphrey and Colin Croom.

Title: Good Morning Gorgeous
Info: The latest full-length release for R&B artist Mary J. Blige features guest appearances from DJ Khaled, Dave East, Fivio Foreign, Anderson .Paak, and Usher.

Title: Gallipoli
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie folk band led by Zach Condon was produced by Gabe Wax.

Title: Please Don't Be Dead
Info: The follow-up to the Oakland artist's Grammy Award-winning 2016 release was influenced in part by divisive political and social issues.

Title: Brand New Abyss
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Washington state electro-pop duo of Khaela Maricich and Melissa Dyne.

Title: Government Plates
Info: The third full-length studio release for the experimental rap group was self-released and posted as a free download. It was official release on iTunes on 14 January 2014.

Title: Go Easy
Info: The third release for the Brisbane, Australian band is a mix of pop and psychedelic rock.

Title: Flockaveli
Info: The rapper who worked with Gucci Mane on a few mixtapes releases his first official album.

Title: Hymn To The Immortal Wind
Info: The fifth album for the Japanese experimental rock band was produced by Steve Albini.

Title: One Armed Bandit
Info: The Norwegian group led by Lars Horntveth continues its jazz fusion of music styles on its latest album.

Title: H-P1
Info: The latest album for the Brooklyn rock band led by Dave W. features a 17-minute-long track.

Title: Ce
Info: The Brazilian superstar takes a stab at rock, backed by a much younger band and co-production by his son, Moreno.

Title: Social Cues
Info: John Hill produces the Kentucky alt-rock band's fifth album, which features a collaboration with Beck.

Title: Allo Darlin'
Info: The debut album for the London based indie pop band includes two Australian and two British members.

Title: ACCA
Info: The second full-length release for the Paris-based British singer features guest appearances from Iggy Pop and Lakeith Stanfield.

Title: Unfurl
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Australian, LA-based singer-songwriter.

Title: Vaxis - Act I: The Unheavenly Creatures
Info: The Amory Wars epic continues in the self-produced ninth full-length studio release for the progressive rock band.

Title: Writing of Blues & Yellows
Info: The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Rich Cooper and Cam Blackwood.

Title: Adventure
Info: The latest release for the Japanese pop-punk band sees the return of original drummer Atsuko Yamano.

Title: Each Other
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Marcus Paquin.

Title: Mess
Info: The seventh full-length release for the rock trio was produced by band member, Angus Andrew.

Title: Shout!
Info: The first release on the Blue Note label for the jam band is a double album with the second disc of the same songs as the first disc with guest singers including Elvis Costello, Dr. John, Toots Hibbert, Glenn Hughes, Ben Harper, Jim James, Myles Kennedy, Dave Matthews, Grace Potter, Ty Taylor, and Steve Winwood.

Title: Vapor Trails
Info: Canada's favorite prog rockers return with their first album of new material in six years, eh.

Title: Rome
Info: Inspired by Italian film scores from the 1960s and featuring guest vocalists Norah Jones and Jack White, Rome is producer Danger Mouse's pet project with Daniele Luppi.

Title: Froot
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Welsh artist was recorded with a live band.

Title: Dignity And Shame
Info: Velocity Girl's Sarah Shannon guests on Eric Bachmann's fourth Crooked Fingers release, which was co-produced by Martin Feveyear.

Title: Long.Live.A$AP
Info: 2 Chainz, Action Bronson, Big K.R.I.T., Danny Brown, Drake, Joey Bada$$, Kendrick Lamar, Santigold, Schoolboy Q, Skrillex, and Yelawolf guest on the official debut studio release for the New York rapper.

Title: There Is No End
Info: The posthumous release from the drummer features beats recorded before he passed away in 2020 and completed by producer Vincent Taeger and co-producer Vincent Taurelle with vocals from Nate Bone, Danny Brown, Nah Eeto, Jeremiah Jae, Koreatown Oddity, Lava La Rue, Lord Jah-Monte Ogbon, Marlowe, Ben Okri, Sampa The Great, Skepta, Tsunami, and Zelooperz.

Title: Quit the Curse
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Frontier Ruckus/Failed Flowers member was mixed by Collin Dupuis.

Title: Built on Glass
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Australian producer, songwriter, and singer Nick Murphy.

Title: Radical Connector
Info: The German elecronica duo of Andi Toma and Jan St. Werner are back with their first LP in three years, combining distorted vocals and samples with their glitchy yet melodic--and sometimes even humorous--instrumentation.

Title: Sorry I Make You Lush
Info: Wagon Christ is the alter-ego of prolific English electronica artist Luke Vibert (who also records under his own name and Plug).

Title: The Cure
Info: The follow-up to 2000's 'Bloodflowers' sees Robert Smith & co. working with metal producer Ross Robinson (Limp Bizkit, Korn) for the first time (and apparently, he ate up so much of the recording budget that they couldn't afford an album cover artist).

Title: Voice Of Treason
Info: If you think the concept of a guitar-drums blues duo from Detroit sounds a bit, well, familiar, consider this: Soledad Brothers guitarist Johnny Walker allegedly is responsible for teaching the White Stripes' Jack White how to play guitar. This is the Brothers' third studio LP.

Title: Strays
Info: A reunited Jane's Addiction (sans bassist Eric Avery) is back with their first studio recording in 13 years.

Title: L' Avventura
Info: Bassist Britta Phillips and guitarist Dean Wareham (each a member of the band Luna) offer a mix of originals and covers, including takes on songs by Madonna, the Silver Jews and the Doors, all produced by Tony Visconti (David Bowie, T. Rex).

Title: Ego War
Info: Already being heralded as 2003's version of The Streets, the suburban London duo who compose the Audio Bullys combine everything from punk, ska, new wave, and house on this debut.

Title: Beauty Party
Info: 'Beauty Party' represents experimental hip-hop artist Mike Ladd's second album in a planned trilogy, the first being 2000's 'Gun Hill Road' by The Infesticons. Unlike its predecessor, the Majesticons disc ventures into commercial rap territory (albeit with a satirical bent), attempting to skewer contemporary hiphop by beating it at its own game.

Title: Amore del Tropico
Info: The San Diego-based band returns with their fourth album of dark, atmospheric music, following previous albums '1,' '2,' and, yes, '3' (c'mon guys, what happened to '4?'). This one is a concept album of sorts, about a murder mystery.

Title: The MF Life
Info: The second album for the R&B/soul Canadian singer features guest appearances by J. Cole, B.o.B, John Legend, and T-Pain.

Title: A Flash Flood of Colour
Info: The third album for the British band was produced by Dan Weller.

Title: Our Thickness
Info: Mathew Adam Hart's quirky one-man bedroom-pop band (think Magnetic Fields) returns with a third album.

Title: Romance Is Boring
Info: The latest album for the Welsh rock band was recorded in Connecticut and Seattle, with Xiu Xiu's Jamie Stewart, Parenthetical Girls' Zac Pennington, and Dead Science's Jherek Bischoff appearing as guests.

Title: Sound Kapital
Info: The music project of Wolf Parade's Dan Boeckner and his wife Alexei Perry releases a third album influenced by Eastern European synthesizer sounds and noise pop.

Title: Go to School
Info: The second full-length release for Brian and Michael D'Addario is a concept musical album about a chimpanzee named Shane raised a human boy and features guest appearances from Todd Rundgren and the D'Addario brothers' mother.

Title: Fingers, Bank Pads and Shoe Prints
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Chicago footwork artist who is considered the founder of the style.

Title: Sunlit Youth
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles indie rock band was recorded in Hawaii, Malaysia, Nicaragua, Ojai, and Thailand.

Title: Outrun
Info: The concept behind the full-length debut release from the French house producer Vincent Belorgay is how a man who crashed his Ferrari Testarossa in 1986, arises as a zombie in 2006 to make music and race cars.

Title: A Certain Trigger
Info: A somewhat unusual signing for Warp Records, the guitar-oriented Maximo Park (who sound not unlike a cross between the Futureheads and Franz Ferdinand) make their full-length debut with this Paul Epworth-produced disc.

Title: The Switch
Info: This is the second full-length studio release for Kim Gordon's post-Sonic Youth project with guitarist Bill Nace.

Title: The 20/20 Experience
Info: The third solo release for the pop singer is his first in nearly seven years and was produced by Timbaland (two tracks with Timberlake and Jerome "J-Roc" Harmon).

Title: Wire
Info: This is the 14th studio release for the British post-punk band led by Colin Newman.

Title: The Mutt's Nuts
Info: The second full-length release for the London-based punk band led by Charlie Manning Walker was produced by Fucked Up's Jonah Falco.

Title: Not Dark Yet
Info: The debut full-length collaboration between sisters Shelby Lynne and Allison Moorer features one original co-written song and was produced by Teddy Thompson.

Title: Long Enough to Leave
Info: The second full-length release for the San Francisco Bay Area garage-pop band was produced by Kelley Stoltz.

Title: Detours
Info: Sheryl Crow returns from an eventful few years with her latest record produced by Brian Bottrell, who also produced her debut.

Title: Kurr
Info: The Icelandic group known for touring with Sigur Ros releases their debut album.

Title: Big Wheel and Others
Info: The seventh full-length release for the indie singer-songwriter is a 22-track double-album featuring blues, country, folk, and jazz styles.

Title: A Wasteland Companion
Info: M. Ward returns with his solo album featuring such guests as Howe Gelb of Giant Sand, Toby Leaman of Dr. Dog, Tom Hagerman of Devotchka, Mike Mogis of Bright Eyes, Steve Shelley of Sonic Youth, and She & Him collaborator Zooey Deschanel.

Title: Meat + Bone
Info: The first release in eight years from the blues-rock trio was produced by frontman Jon Spencer.

Title: Present Tense
Info: The fourth full-length release for the New Zealand electro-pop band was recorded remotely with some in-studio sessions in Los Angeles, London, Florence, New York and New Zealand due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Hyacinth
Info: The second full-length release for the Glasgow-based indie rock band is the first with Rachel Taylor, who took over for the departing Cal Donnelly.

Title: All-Amerikkkan Bada$$
Info: The second full-length studio release for the New York rapper features guest appearances from Chronixx, Nyck Caution, Meechy Darko, J. Cole, Kirk Knight, Schoolboy Q, and Styles P.

Title: Lament
Info: The German industrial band's latest release is music planned for a live performance commissioned by the city Diksmuide to commemorate the 100 year anniversary of the start of the First World War.

Title: Pura Vida Conspiracy
Info: The sixth full-length release for the gypsy punk band led by Eugene Hütz was produced by Andrew Scheps.

Title: Provider
Info: This is the US release of the debut solo album for the Constantines frontman.

Title: Rooster Rag
Info: The blues rock band returns with its first new album in nine years.

Title: The  Old Magic
Info: Growing older is the major theme of Nick Lowe's latest release, coproduced by Neil Brockbank and Robert Treherne.

Title: Weareallgoingtoburninhellmegamixxx3
Info: With a follow-up to his 2007 I'll Sleep When You're Dead still in the works, El-P releases an album of instrumental tracks.

Title: The Centre Cannot Hold
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Australian experimental artist was recorded over 10 days with contributions from Steve Albini, Lawrence English, Nico Muhly, Valgeir Sigurðsson, and Skuli Sverrisson.

Title: There Is No Enemy
Info: The latest album for the indie rock band features  Quasi's Sam Coomes, Treepeople's Scott Schmaljohn, Butthole Surfers' Paul Leary, John McMahon, and Roger Manning as guest musicians.

Title: Ringleader Of The Tormentors
Info: Tony Visconti (David Bowie) produced the suddenly prolific Moz's third release of the past two years.

Title: Glider
Info: This is the second full-length solo release for the singer who has worked with Alela Diane, Efterklang, Laura Gibson, Horse Feathers, and Sharon Van Etten.

Title: Generation Indigo
Info: The front woman of X-Ray Spex returns with her first solo album, staying true to her punk, reggae, and pop roots.

Title: Art Brut vs. Satan
Info: The third album for the English band was produced by Black Francis (aka Frank Black).

Title: Let's Build A Fire
Info: This is the third album for the James Baluyut-led indie rockers.

Title: Delta Kream
Info: Dan Auerbach and Patrick Carney recorded covers of Mississippi hill country blues songs in Nashville over two sessions with Kenny Brown and Eric Deaton.

Title: Me And Armini
Info: The latest album for the Icelandic singer was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Woman on the Internet
Info: The debut full-length release for the Irish singer-songwriter was produced by Pete Robertson.

Title: The Long Walk
Info: Ben Greenberg and Michael Berdan add drummer Greg Foxfor for the band's third full-length release.

Title: A Sentimental Education
Info: The New York City indie rock band return after breaking up in 2005 with an album of covers that includes songs by such artist as David Bowie, The Cure, Bob Dylan, Fleetwood Mac, Mercury Rev, Rolling Stones, and YES.

Title: Long Lost Suitcase
Info: The latest studio release for the Welsh singer was produced by Ethan Johns.

Title: I'm in Your Mind Fuzz
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Australian psychedelic rock band.

Title: One Way, It's Every Way
Info: This is the second album of electronica-meets-indie-pop (falling somewhere between Manitoba and the Postal Service) from Mark Mitchell.

Title: Soft Commands
Info: This solo disc from the Posies member features guest appearances from Jill Sobule and members of Velocity Girl, Oranger and the Posies.

Title: The Ladybug Transistor
Info: This self-titled disc (the band's fifth studio recording) was recorded in Arizona with Calexico/Giant Sand producer Craig Schumacher.

Title: Song In The Air
Info: This is the third LP for the Louisville-based emo band known for their strong live shows.

Title: A Grown-Ass Man
Info: The sixth solo release for Yo La Tengo bassist James McNew finds him playing all of the instruments on 13 tracks that veer from style to style but share a certain lo-fi charm. There are ten originals and three covers, including the unlikely album-closing take on Thin Lizzy's "Cowboy Song."

Title: Diamonds On The Inside
Info: Southern California native Harper has gained a cult following for his jam-band-like approach to roots rock. This is his fifth studio LP.

Title: Does This Look Infected?
Info: The Toronto, Canada punk outfit returns with a follow-up to their successful 2001 debut, 'All Killer No Filler.'

Title: One By One
Info: Former Nirvana drummer (and sometime Queens of the Stone Age drummer) Dave Grohl returns to the front of the stage for his role as vocalist, guitarist, and bandleader of the Foo Fighters on this, their fourth studio recording.

Title: Out From Out Where
Info: This is the fourth album for the London-based, Brazilian-born jungle/breakbeat producer and DJ, following 2000's well-received 'Supermodified.'

Title: The Magnificent
Info: You know him from his days supplying the beats to the Fresh Prince, but DJ Jazzy Jeff has finally stepped into the spotlight with this solo debut. Vocals are supplied by a variety of guests, including Jill Scott, Raheim, ?uestlove and J-Live.

Title: Muzikizum
Info: The British house trio has been performing, producing, and remixing for ten years, but 'Muzikizum' represents their first album, highlighted by the breakout UK hit single "Lazy" featuring guest vocals from David Byrne.

Title: New Favorite
Info: Alison Krauss and her band have gained popularity in recent months, thanks to the success of the O Brother, Where Art Thou? soundtrack (which featured the band's version of "I Am A Man Of Constant Sorrow" among other contributions). This is their first album since 1999's 'Forget About It.'

Title: Live!
Info: Luna's first live recording compiles performances from New York's Knitting Factory and Washington D.C.'s 9:30 Club, including the band's final show with bassist Justin Harwood and one of its first with Harwood's replacement Britta Phillips. The disc includes songs from each of Luna's five studio albums, as well as one track ("4th of July") from frontman Dean Wareham's previous band, Galaxie 500.

Title: Jade Bird
Info: Born in England but leaning, musically, toward Americana, the 21-year-old singer-songwriter follows her 2017 EP, "Something American," with this full-length debut.

Title: Broken Side Of Time
Info: The debut full-length album for the band led by Swedish-born Petter Ericson Stakee and Terry Wolfers was produced by Mike McCarthy.

Title: Black Rainbow Sound
Info: The third full-length release for the British duo of Ryan Needham and Liza Violet features a guest appearance by Brix Smith and was produced by Matt Peel.

Title: Everything Else Matters
Info: The debut full-length release for the Russian shoegaze quintet was recorded in 2013.
The sixth album from the Dutch-Israeli singer-songwriter is a mix of choral arrangements, guitar, piano, and clarinet.

Title: When Fish Ride Bicycles
Info: The duo of Chuck Inglish and Mikey Rocks, aka Sir Michael Rocks, releases its long-awaited album that was more than two years in the making.

Title: B-Sides & Rarities
Info: For you Nick Cave completists out there, this three-disc box set compiles 56 tracks spanning both decades of his work with the Bad Seeds, including some previously unreleased material.

Title: Big Dark Love
Info: The seventh full-length release from the indie rock band was produced with Kevin Ratterman and is its first with new band member, David Fountain.

Title: Black Moon Spell
Info: The third full-length release for the Kyle Thomas' psychedelic rock project includes contributions from Ty Segall.

Title: Daughter of Everything
Info: The debut release from the collaboration between John Schmersal and former Triclops!/Anywhere member Christian Beaulieu includes a guest appearance from Robert Pollard.

Title: Cannibal Courtship
Info: The Los Angeles-based rock band returns with its first album on new label Fantasy.

Title: Mosquito
Info: The fourth full-length release for the New York rock trio features production from Nick Launay, James Murphy of LCD Soundsystem, and Dave Sitek of TV On The Radio.

Title: Bought to Rot
Artist: Laura Jane Grace & the Devouring Mothers
Info: The debut full-length release for the music project from the Against Me! singer/guitarist features Atom Willard and Marc Hudson.

Title: OFF!
Info: The debut "full-length" [16 tracks with a run time of about 16 minutes] album from the hardcore punk quartet that includes ex-Black Flag and Circle Jerks singer Keith Morris; Dimitri Coats of Burning Brides; Mario Rubalcaba of Hot Snakes and Rocket from the Crypt; and Steven McDonald of Redd Kross was recorded over three days.

Title: Whole Lotta Red
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from Future, Kid Cudi and Kanye West.

Title: The Afterman: Descension
Info: The sixth studio release continues the story from The Afterman: Ascension and sees the return of drummer Josh Eppard.

Title: Appia Kwa Bridge
Info: The Afrobeat Academy band appears on the second solo release for the guitarist and songwriter from Ghana.

Title: Care
Info: The fourth full-length release for Tom Krell features production from the Bleachers' Jack Antonoff, CFCF, Kara-Lis Coverdale and Dre Skull.

Title: Not Real
Info: This is the second full-length release for the British trio of Rebecca Hawley , Emily Lansley, and Lucy Mercer.

Title: Pom Pom
Info: The 17-track solo release from the Los Angeles artist features two songs co-written with Kim Fowley.

Title: How Do You Spell Heaven
Info: The second Guided By Voices release in 2017 for Robert Pollard was recorded in New York and Ohio.

Title: Widowspeak
Info: The debut album for the Brooklyn indie rock trio was produced by Jarvis Taveniere of Woods.

Title: First Rose of Spring
Info: The latest full-length release for the country singer-songwriter features two new songs and was produced by Buddy Cannon.

Title: Collection
Info: The debut full-length release for the Nashville singer-songwriter Sophie Allison features some newly recorded songs previously released on Bandcamp as well as some new songs.

Title: Animal Races
Info: The third full-length release for the San Francisco garage rock band was recorded to tape by Kelley Stoltz.

Title: Green Naugahyde
Info: Drummer Jay Lane returns to Primus on its first full-length release since 1999 album, Antipop.
This is the thrid album for Norwegian Susanna Wallumrod.

Title: The  Gathering
Info: The fourth album for the rock band was influenced by Carl Jung.

Title: When Machines Exceed Human Intelligence
Info: The first album from Mark Pritchard under the name Harmonic 313.

Title: Shade Themes from Kairos
Info: Sunn O)))'s Oren Arbarchi, Stephen O’Malley and producer Randall Dunn expand on the themes and sounds from their work on the score for Alexis Destoop's film "Kairos."

Title: Maryland Mansions
Info: Rjyan Kidwell's second release of 2003 (third, if you count his all-instrumental alternate version of 'Being Ridden') features 8 new songs that run the gamut from rap to industrial rock to glitchy electronica.

Title: Art Official Intelligence (Mosaic Thump)
Info: The rap outfit's first album since 1996's 'Stakes Is High' is the first in a planned trilogy.

Title: Black Foliage: Animation Music
Info: This second studio album for the experimental Elephant 6 band led by William Cullen Hart and Bill Doss includes the single "Hideway" among its 27 (!) tracks.

Title: Capture / Release
Info: The London four-piece try to capitalize on press generated by recent support slots for the Libertines with this debut disc, produced by Paul Epworth (Bloc Party).

Title: Close to the Glass
Info: Th eighth full-length release for the German electronic band is its first studio album in over five years.

Title: Looking 4 Myself
Info: The seventh studio album for the R&B singer features songs produced and/or written by Diplo, Max Martin, the Neptunes, Rico Love, Salaam Remi, and Swedish House Mafia.

Title: Destroyer
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Canadian psychedelic rock band was inspired by frontman Stephen McBean receiving his driver's license in 2017 and is its first with and Adam Bulgasem and Rachel Fannan.

Title: Shine a Light: Field Recordings from the Great American Railroad
Info: Billy Bragg & Joe Henry recorded the 13 train-themed tracks at several stops along their journey from Chicago to Los Angeles by train.

Title: Courting the Squall
Info: The debut full-length release for the Elbow frontman was backed by I Am Kloot's Pete Jobson, The Whip's Nathan Sudders, Ben Christophers, and Alex Reeves.

Title: Bad News Boys
Info: This is the first release in six years for the garage punk duo of Mark Sultan and Arish Ahmad Khan.

Title: It All Starts with One
Info: The latest album for the Norwegian singer was produced by Tobias Froberg.

Title: Shangri-La
Info: The Portland, Oregon, dance duo's latest album is a concept album about man's search for utopia.

Title: We Walk This Road
Info: Working with producer T. Bone Burnett, Robert Randolph picked songs representing the roots of 20th century American music.

Title: My True Story
Info: The first release on Blue Note for the R&B/Soul singer co-produced by by Keith Richards and Don Was covers some of the classic doo-wop songs that influenced his works.

Title: The Glow
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Australian trio was produced by Stuart Price.

Title: B4.DA.$$
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Brooklyn rapper features guest appearances from Action Bronson, BJ The Chicago Kid, Chronixx, Kiesza, Dyemond Lewis, Raury, Maverick Sabre, and Elle Varner.

Title: Culture III
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the hip hop trio features guest appearances from Justin Bieber, Cardi B, Drake, Future, Juice WRLD, Polo G, Pop Smoke and YoungBoy Never Broke Again.

Title: Walking Field
Info: This is the debut release for the ambient band formed by William Cashion of Future Islands and Bruce Willen of Double Dagger.

Title: Fields
Info: The debut full-length album for the Jose Gonzalez-led trio.

Title: I Wasn't Born to Lose You
Info: This is the first new release in over 15 years for the British alternative rock band formed by Adam Franklin and Jimmy Hartridge.

Title: Trouble
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the British electronic producer/artist.

Title: Mystery Hour
Info: The second full-length release for Oliver Hill and Eliza Bagg was influenced by the breakup of their six-year relationship.

Title: Home Economics
Info: This is the third full-length release for the British duo of Tobin Prinz and Suzi Horn.

Title: I Have Fought Against It, But I Can't Any Longer.
Info: The seventh full-length release for the duo of Lee Buford and Chip King features contributions from Sandworm's Ben Eberle, Lingua Ignota's Kristin Hayter and Assembly of Light Choir's Chrissy Wolpert.

Title: Nocturne
Info: The second release for the dream-pop project of Jack Tatum was produced with Nicolas Vernhes.

Title: Quickies
Info: The 12th full-length release for the band led by Stephen Merritt features songs as short as 13 seconds to just over two and a half minutes.

Title: Last Day of Summer
Info: The 12-song collection from prior recording sessions was originally released digitally in 2010.

Title: Black Light
Info: The British duo returns with its latest album of electronic music featuring such guest singers as Bryan Ferry, Nick Littlemore, and Will Young.

Title: By The Hedge
Info: Captured Tracks releases the New York-based indie band's debut full-length album following positive reactions and comparisons to  The Cure on the group's previously released singles.

Title: Caught In The Trees
Info: The latest album for the Seattle, Washington, artists.

Title: Both Ways Open Jaws
Info: This is the sophomore album for the French/Finnish duo of Olivia Merilahti and Dan Levy.

Title: Fear of the Dawn
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for Jack White is the first of two albums expected in 2022 (Entering Heaven Alive is set for July 22 release).

Title: Cole World: The Sideline Story
Info: After making three successful mixtapes, the rapper releases his debut studio album featuring guest appearances from Drake, Missy Elliot, Jay-Z, and Trey Songz.

Title: True North
Info: The 16th release for the Southern California punk band was co-produced by the band and Joe Barresi.

Title: Twenty One
Info: The sophomore album for the English indie rock band was produced by Erol Alkan.

Title: Hats Off To The Buskers
Info: The very young Scottish four-piece shot straight to #1 on the UK charts with the release of this Britpop-flavored debut album, produced by Owen Morris (Oasis, The Verve).

Title: Phantom Punch
Info: After a diversion into jazz-pop (2006's 'Duper Sessions'), the Norwegian artist returns with a more muscular rock album produced by Tony Hoffer.

Title: Black Holes & Revelations
Info: The stadium-sized English trio returns with a follow-up to its 2004 hit 'Absolution,' again produced by Rich Costey.

Title: Flies The Fields
Info: Bob Weston produced this third studio album for the Louisville indie rockers.

Title: Houses of the Molé
Info: The oh-so-punny industrial rockers return with, believe it or not, their 10th LP (although that does include their early synth-pop releases when they were scary for very different reasons).

Title: Give
Info: The modern-jazz trio stick to the formula of their well-received 2003 debut on this sophomore effort, working again with producer Tchad Blake on a mix of originals and unlikely covers (this time out including Black Sabbath's "Iron Man" and The Pixies' "Velouria").

Title: Kila Kila Kila
Info: This is the fourth release for the all-female Japanese rock band fronted by Yoshimi P-We of the Boredoms.

Title: Obrigado Saudade
Info: Mice Parade is the solo moniker adopted by Adam Pierce (drummer for the east coast indie rock band The Swirlies) for his forays into electronica and post-rock. Although he has expanded Mice Parade into a full-band effort on some previous releases, Pierce recorded this fourth studio LP mainly on his own.

Title: 100th Window
Info: The first of two planned 2003 releases for the far-from-prolific Bristol-based electronica collective sees the group pared down to one original member: Robert "3-D" del Naja (although Grant "Daddy G." Marshall intends to return to the group for the next disc). Horace Andy returns to provide vocals on several tracks, and Sinead O'Connor also guests on two songs.

Title: lovehatetragedy
Info: The No-Cal rap-metal outfit returns with a second album for Dreamworks (their third overall). Lead singer Coby Dick has reverted back to his given name, Jacoby Shaddix, but otherwise, the band and sound remain the same.

Title: Forever
Info: Former Camper Van Beethoven frontman David Lowery once again leads Cracker for the band's first new album in four years. Sparklehorse's Mark Linkous co-produces and adds backing vocals and instrumentation.

Title: The Photo Album
Info: This is the third album for the Washington-based indie rockers.

Title: The Invisible Man
Info: Mark Eitzel's fifth solo release since the breakup of American Music Club is his first album in three years. Unlike on his previous albums, Eitzel is mostly alone here, both producing and playing most of the instruments.

Title: Lateralus
Info: The band's first album of new material in five years was produced by Tool with David Bottrill and features 13 tracks.

Title: Wish I Was In Heaven Sitting Down
One Day It Will Please Us To Remember Even This
Info: The first album in 32 years for the legendary glam-punk band features guest appearances from Michael Stipe, Bo Diddley and Iggy Pop. Only David Johansen and Sylvain Sylvain return from the Dolls' original lineup, however.

Title: Idle No More
Info: The first release for the Berlin-based psychedelic soul rock band in six years was named after a Canadian indigenous-rights movement.

Title: Junip
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Swedish indie rock trio.

Title: A City By The Light Divided
Info: The New Jersey emo-rockers (not to be confused with the day of the week of the same name) are back with a fourth album, with Dave Fridmann producing.

Title: Passage
Info: The full-length debut release for the Brooklyn indie band led by the married duo Devon Church and Aleksa Palladino continues the atmospheric and emotional sound from their 2011 EP, From Silence.

Title: Hotel Valentine
Info: The first album in 15 years from the avant-garde pop duo of Yuka Honda and Miho Hatori is a concept album about a hotel haunted by a female ghost.

Title: Four Stars
Info: The Cincinnati rock band led by Craig Fox reunites after Jack Lawrence and Patrick Keeler formed The Raconteurs with Jack White and Brendan Benson during The Greenhornes' hiatus in 2005.

Title: Mountain Battles
Info: The fourth album for the rock band formed by Kim Deal of the Pixies was produced by Steve Albini.

Title: Melbourne, Florida
Info: The third full-length release for the Australian indie pop quartet was produced by Mike Young.

Title: It's Up to Emma
Info: The British-born, Portland-based artist was backed by Jose Medeles, Dan Wilson, Saunder Jurriaans, Banny Bensi, and Emil Amos on her sixth full-length studio release.

Title: Deleter
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Canadian electronic band  features guest appearances from Nicholas Allbrook, Angus Andrew and Alexis Taylor.

Title: Calling Out
Info: The debut full-length debut for the trio of Ezra Tenenbaum, Shane O'Connell and Michael Stasiak was produced by Jarvis Taveniere.

Title: Old Yellow Moon
Info: Hot Band members James Burton, John Ware, and Bill Payne, as well as Vince Gill, John Jorgenson, Bill Payne, Stuart Duncan, and Steuart Smith appear as guests on the duets album between Emmylou Harris and Rodney Crowell.

Title: If You Wait
Info: The debut full-length release for the London trio includes "Help Me Lose My Mind," its collaboration with Disclosure. [US edition includes  "Maybe," "High Life," and a remix of "Strong."]

Title: One Hand on the Steering Wheel the Other Sewing a Garden
Info: Montreal is the theme of the second full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter.

Title: More Rain
Info: The eighth solo release for the singer-songwriter features guest appearances from R.E.M.'s Peter Buck, Neko Case, k.d. lang, The Secret Sisters, and Joey Spampinato of NRBQ.

Title: Reason and Rhyme: Bluegrass Songs by Robert Hunter & Jim Lauderdale
Info: The latest partnership between Jim Lauderdale and the Grateful Dead's Robert Hunter produces an album of bluegrass songs.

Title: Era Vulgaris
Info: Josh Homme's fifth QOTSA disc includes guest appearances by The Strokes' Julian Casablancas and returnee Mark Lanegan. Oddly, however, the disc does not include its title track collaboration with Trent Reznor, which was released separately.

Title: Jesu/Sun Kil Moon
Info: The debut collaboration between Jesu and Sun Kil Moon features contributions from such artists as Modest Mouse's Isaac Brock, Slowdive's Rachel Goswell, Low, and Will Oldham.

Title: Lucid Dreaming
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the electro pop twin sister duo of Miranda and Elektra Kibley-Jansson (daughters of The Church's Steve Kilbey  and Pink Champagne's Karin Jansson).

Title: Skit I Allt
Info: The Swedish rock band led by Gustav Ejstes releases its sixth album.

Title: Mo'Mega
Info: This long-awaited follow-up to 2002's 'I Phantom' once again reunites the indie MC (also known as Jeffrey Haynes) with producer El-P. Also appearing are Aesop Rock, Akrobatik, Blueprint, and Murs.

Title: The Soft Cavalry
Info: The debut full-length release for the husband-and-wife duo of Steve Clarke and Slowdive's Rachel Goswell was produced by Steve's brother, Michael Clarke.

Title: Rattle That Lock
Info: The fourth solo release for the Pink Floyd guitarist was produced with Phil Manzanera.

Title: Ancient Romans
Info: The Los Angeles-based solo project of Cameron Stallones releases the fifth LP of psychedelic electro noise pop.

Title: Feel It Break
Info: This is the Toronto-based trio's debut album of electronic synth-pop.

Title: Horehound
Info: Jack White plays drums and produced this album for the band headed by The Kills' Alison Mosshart, which also includes The Raconteurs' Jack Lawrence and Queens of the Stone Age's Dean Fertita.

Title: After You
Info: The third full-length release for the British indie singer-songwriter was co-produced with Alex Epton, Inflo aka Dean Josiah, and Paul Epworth.

Title: Hawk
Info: Hawk is the third collaborative album between former Belle & Sebastian songbird Isobel Campbell and former Screaming Trees frontman Mark Lanegan. Like the two records before it, it draws inspiration from the sultry torch songs once performed by Nancy Sinatra and Lee Hazlewood. Unique to this album is a solid list of guest appearances, however, and the duo covers two Townes Van Zandt songs to boot.

Title: My Soft Machine
Info: The second full-length release from Arlo Parks features a guest appearance by Phoebe Bridgers.

Title: Origin
Info: The third full-length release for the London-based, New-Zealand born and Australian-raised alternative R&B artist was inspired by "dystopian views of our future."

Title: American Man
Info: The debut full-length release for the Colorado country blues-rock band led by Nate Cook was produced by Cracker's Johnny Hickman,

Title: Endgame
Info: The latest release for Brooklyn-based producer Daniel Martin-McCormick was mixed with M. Geddes Gengras.

Title: Space Zone
Info: This is the debut solo release for footwork artist, David Davis.

Title: Men's Needs, Women's Needs, Whatever
Info: The English trio of brothers look to leave a mark in the US with their third album.

Title: Requiem
Info: The third full-length release for the Swedish alternative band is said to be a folk album and features pan flutes.

Title: Droppin' Science Fiction
Info: The rappers latest album features such guest artists as DJ Shadow, Mr. Lif, Damian Marley, and MF Doom.

Title: Beat Konducta Vol. 1-2: Movie Scenes
Info: The hip-hop producer--unusually recording under his own name--offers a soundtrack to an imaginary movie.

Title: Garden Ruin
Info: Joey Burns and John Convertino return with an album produced by J.D. Foster (Dwight Yoakam).

Title: PL3DGE
Info: This is the final album in his Pledge Allegiance to the Grind series of releases.

Title: Everything Wrong Is Imaginary
Info: Kurt Heasley's eighth Lilys album finds him working with hip-hop producer Michael Musmanno.

Title: Eusa
Info: Originally released as piano sheet music, the debut solo piano release for the French artist was inspired by the island in Brittany where he lives.

Title: Grown Unknown
Info: The second album for the singer-songwriter from Brooklyn, New York, was written while she was in Vermont.

Title: Bits
Info: The fourth album for the Brooklyn rock band.

Title: Dodge and Burn
Info: The third full-length studio release for the rock band was produced by band co-founder Jack White.

Title: Devout
Info: The second full-length release for the London-based grime producer features guest appearances from such artists as Denai Moore, P Money, Palmistry, and Py.

Title: If I Had A Hi-Fi
Info: Experience has only made their work richer, bringing gravity to the subject matter and lightness to the sound of this new album. Keeping things honest--and often rapturous--has become a modus operandi.

Title: Prins Thomas
Info: The Norwegian producer, who has worked with Lindstrom on several albums, releases his debut solo album.

Title: King's Mouth: Music and Songs
Info: The band's 15th studio LP is a story-driven concept album with narration from The Clash's Mick Jones. The album was originally released (on vinyl only) as a Record Store Day exclusive on April 13, 2019, but was later re-released in multiple formats on July 19, 2019.

Title: Love And Other Planets
Info: This is the second album of home-made recordings for multi-instrumentalist and former Fridge bassist Adem Ilhan.

Title: Iris [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
Artist: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
Info: The third full-length release and first soundtrack for the electronic duo is a soundtrack for Jalil Lespert's French 2016 film.

Title: Reprieve
Info: The latest studio outing from the prolific singer-songwriter features production by Mike Napolitano (along with DiFranco herself) and contributions from touring musician Todd Sickafoose.

Title: Menos el Oso
Info: The Seattle band returns with a fourth album.

Title: Planet's Mad
Info: The second full-length release for the electronic artist features a guest appearance from Bipolar Sunshine.

Title: Versions
Info: The recording of songs reworked by JG Thirlwell with the Mivos Quartet was originally performed at the Guggenheim Museum.

Title: Black Forest
Info: This is the Sub Pop debut (and third overall album) for the Seattle-based punk trio.

Title: Obscurities
Info: The singer-songwriter from The Magnetic Fields releases a solo album of B-sides, compilation cuts, and various unreleased material.

Title: Live At The Olympia
Info: The second live recording for the band features songs from its five-night residency at Dublin, Ireland's Olympia Theatre in 2007.

Title: Teeth Dreams
Info: The sixth studio album for the band is its first in four years and was produced by Nick Raskulinecz.

Title: Crybaby
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for Candian indie pop duo Tegan And Sara was produce with John Congleton.

Title: Patience
Info: The third full-length release for the British trio features guest appearances from Anna Calvi, Rosie Lowe, Connan Mockasin, and Jessie Ware.

Title: What One Becomes
Info: The second full-length release for the metal trio was produced by Kurt Ballou.

Title: Nothing Is Real
Info: The third full-length release for the California psychedelic rock trio was recorded at singer Jonny Bell's home studio.

Title: You Know You Like It [EP]
Info: R&B and electronic music influences are apparent on the three-track debut EP release from singer Aluna Francis and producer George Reid.

Title: Warpaint
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles indie rock band was produced with Flood

Title: Abundance Welcoming Ghosts
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British folk rock band was recorded in four days in Wales with contributions from Joan Shelley, and Tara Jane O'Neil.

Title: Rap Album One
Info: The third full-length studio release for Southern California rapper/producer features a guest appearance by Scoop DeVille.

Title: See You In Magic
Info: This is the debut album for the newest band led by John Reis of Rocket From the Crypt, Drive Like Jehu, and Hot Snakes.

Title: Forever Endeavour
Info: The 13th release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Mitchell Froom.

Title: Totem
Info: Each track on the third release from the Los Angeles-based artist is said to represent the sound of an animal's spirit.

Title: The Shape of Things
Info: The two-disc release is the second electronic album with Ultravox founding member John Foxx and producer Benge.

Title: SMOD
Info: Manu Chao produced the third album for the Mali rap group. The band name stands for the original members of the band (Sam, Ousco, Dronsky, and former member Mouzy).

Title: Lunglight
Info: The debut full-length album for the Portland, Oregon-based indie rock band.

Title: Not Them, You
Info: Dave Fridmann produced the Baltimore jam band's latest.

Title: Happenstance
Info: 'Happenstance' is the first solo LP for the Chicago-based singer-songwriter, who has also recorded with the funk band Bumpus.

Title: Universal High
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band was influenced by 1970s soul music and was recorded in Atlanta with producer Ben H. Allen III.

Title: Troubadour
Info: The Somalian-born rapper releases his second album, which features Chubb Rock, Damian Marley, Adam Levine (Maroon 5), Kirk Hammett (Metallica), Mos Def, and Chali 2na as guests.

Title: Pursuit of Momentary Happiness
Info: The second full-length release for British alternative rock trio led by Oli Burslem was produced by Jason Pierce and features a guest appearance from J Spaceman.

Title: Foreverland
Info: This is the 11th full-length studio release for the orchestral pop band led by Neil Hannon.

Title: Post Plague
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian band led by Dean Tzenos features guest vocals from New Pornographers' Kathryn Calder.

Title: American Wrestlers
Info: The debut full-length release for the solo project of ex-Working for a Nuclear Free City member Gary McClure was recorded in his St Louis home studio with a Tascam eight-track cassette deck.

Title: So You Are... So You'll Be
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Brooklyn-based space rock trio was produced by Martin Bisi.

Title: Mature Themes
Info: The second album for the Los Angeles band features a guest appearance from Dam-Funk.

Title: Wonky
Info: The eighth album for the British techno band is its first since 2004's Blue Album and the duo reforming in 2008.

Title: Sunset/Sunrise
Info: This is the second album for the Seattle-based indie rock duo.

Title: Eating Us
Info: The fourth album for the Pittsburgh indie band was produced by Dave Fridmann.

Title: Where You Want To Be
Info: The sophomore effort from the Long Island emo band was produced by Lou Giordano (Ataris), and features new vocalist Fred Mascherino (joining band founder Adam Lazzara).

Title: Dim Stars, Bright Sky
Info: Founding member of Los Angeles punkers X and occasional actor John Doe returns with his fourth solo album, this one produced by Joe Henry with guest appearances from Rhett Miller (Old 97s), Aimee Mann, Jakob Dylan and Jane Wiedlin.

Title: How Animals Move
Info: Known mainly for his work with PJ Harvey (most notably, 'To Bring You My Love' and 'Dance Hall At Louse Point'), producer/musician John Parish has previously released just one solo record under his own name. On this mostly instrumental record, he is supplemented by numerous guests, including Harvey and Portishead's Adrian Utley.

Title: Finelines
Info: This debut LP for the electric English quartet was originally released in March 2001 to enough critical acclaim that Sony/Epic picked the album up for a re-release in the summer of 2002. Their sound combines harder-edged alt-rock with "shoegazing"-style noise manipulation.

Title: Howdy!
Info: This is the sixth studio LP from the Scottish three-piece.

Title: Only in Dreams
Info: The second full-length album for the pop band includes songs written after the death of the mother of singer Dee Dee.

Title: World, You Need a Change of Mind
Info: The debut release for Adam Bainbridge was produced by Philippe Zdar.

Title: Perfect Hair
Info: The latest studio release for the Los Angeles rapper features guest appearances from Aesop Rock, Danny Brown, Open Mike Eagle, Pegasus Warning, and VerBS.

Title: Viola Beach
Info: This is the posthumous debut release by the British indie rock quartet who (along with their manager) died in a car accident while on tour in Sweden.

Title: Modern Dancing
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock trio was produced by Hookworms' MJ.

Title: Colours of the Night
Info: The Oregon-born singer-songwriter/producer went to Switzerland and recorded this album with a Swiss backing band with producer Timo Keller.

Title: Touch Down 2 Cause Hell
Info: The latest release for the Baton Rouge rapper formerly known as Lil Boosie features guest appearances from Akelee, Chris Brown, J. Cole, Keyshia Cole, Jeezy, PJ, Rich Homie Quan, Rick Ross, T.I.,Webbie, Young Thug.

Title: Individ
Info: The sixth studio release for the San Francisco duo of Meric Long and Logan Kroeber was recorded soon after completing 2013's Carrier.

Title: Surfing Strange
Info: This is the second full-length release for the alternative rock band that includes Allison Crutchfield (her twin sister's solo project is Waxahatchee), Kyle Gilbride, and Jeff Bolt.

Title: Burials
Info: The ninth studio release for the alternative rock band led by Davey Havok was produced by Gil Norton.

Title: Spooky Action at a Distance
Info: This is the second album for the solo project for Deerhunter guitarist Lockett Pundt.

Title: Here for a Good Time
Info: The country singer releases his 39th studio album.

Title: Keep It Together
Info: The Boston-based trio has developed a devoted following over the course of three albums and ten years of touring. This fourth album, produced by Roger Moutenot (Yo La Tengo), adds additional elements such as bass and drums to their ususal mix of two acoustic guitars and bongos.

Title: Silent Shout
Info: This is the third album (and first American release) for the Swedish brother-sister electro-pop duo of Olof Dreijer and Karin Dreijer Andersson.

Title: Lifeline
Info: The San Francisco Bay Area native recorded his latest album in seven days after a tour in Europe.

Title: Own Side Now
Info: The Nashville singer's follow-up to her 2008 EP Dead Flowers is her full-length debut disc.

Title: IN///PARALLEL
Info: The first full-length solo release for the British artist better known for his work as a member of Thenewno2 and as the only son of the  Beatles' George Harrison.

Title: Oral Fixation Vol. 2
Info: The singer's second 2005 release is sung entirely in English, and includes two tracks originally sung in Spanish on Fijacion Oral Vol. 1.

Title: The Distance Is So Big
Info: This is the third full-length studio release for the Buffalo indie punk-pop trio.

Title: Again into Eyes
Info: The British rock quintet releases its debut full-length album produced by Ken and Jolyon Thomas.

Title: The Atlantic Ocean
Info: The latest solo album for the singer-songwriter includes one track co-produced by Mark Ronson.

Title: Meatbodies
Info: The debut full-length release for the band led by Chad Ubovich of Fuzz and Mikal Cronin was recorded with Eric King.

Title: Feels Like Home
Info: Arif Mardin produced this follow-up to the singer's hugely successful 2002 effort 'Come Away With Me.' Dolly Parton guests.

Title: Thirteenth Step
Info: Tool vocalist Maynard James Keenan's side project returns with a second LP on which he's backed by Jeordie "Twiggy Ramirez" White (Marilyn Manson), Billy Howerdel (Tool's guitar tech) and Josh Freese (Guns N' Roses).

Title: If We Meet In The Future
Info: This sophomore LP for the Reading, England band continues the retro-futuristic pop sound (frequently compared to Stereolab) from their debut, with vocals sung in English, Spanish and French.

Title: Soft Spot
Info: The fourth album for the alt-country trio (whose song "Moment in the Sun" is the theme for NBC's "Ed") was produced by Joe Chiccarelli (American Music Club).

Title: Zoo Psychology
Info: This is the second album from the post-punk outfit, one of the edgier, less-mainstream bands on the current New York underground circuit.

Title: Deftones
Info: This self-titled release is the fourth studio album for the California alt-metal outfit.

Title: Chat & Business
Info: Another member of the new generation of neo-art-punkers (think Interpol or Liars, perhaps), this Los Angeles-based British four-piece makes its debut with 'Chat & Business,' which comes with a complimentary set of stickers with which to decorate the album cover.

Title: Make Up The Breakdown
Info: This Sub Pop debut for the British Columbia band falls into the 80s/punk revival category occupied by the likes of French Kicks and Radio 4, although Cure comparisons are more likely (since lead singer Steve Bays' voice sounds, at times, almost identical to Robert Smith's).

Title: High Society
Info: This is the second album for the eclectic indie-rock band fronted and founded by John Schmersal (Brainiac). For this outing, the band has expanded to a four-piece, with new members Matt Schultz and former Blonde Redhead bassist Toko Yasuda (who replaces Steve Calhoon and handles some vocals).

Title: Love, Loss and Auto-Tune
Info: The latest release for the soul artist was produced by Poliça's Ryan Olson (with assistance from Bon Iver's Justin Vernon) and features guest appearances from Bon Iver and Guitar Shorty.

Title: Seer
Info: The third release for the Oregon duo of Matt Carlson and Jonathan Sielaff was recorded over two years.

Title: Challengers
Info: The Canadian indie rock band's mellow fourth album.

Title: The Devil, You + Me
Info: This is the electronic band's first album since its 2002 album, "Neon Golden."

Title: Multi-Task
Info: The second full-length release for the Georgia trio was recorded in a cabin and produced by ex-Carnivore Nathaniel Higgins.

Title: Where All Is Fled
Info: This is the first solo release for Cleveland-based electronic artist since the Emeralds disbanded in 2013.

Title: Armonico Hewa
Info: The latest album for the Japanese quartet is the band's first release since 2006's "Taiga."

Title: No One Dances Quite Like My Brothers
Info: The debut full-length release for Ice Age's Elias Bender Rønnefelt's side project with Loke Rahbek of Sexdrome, Kristian Emdal of Lower, and Lukas Højland of Redflesh was recorded in New York.

Title: Slipstream
Info: Bonnie Raitt returns after seven years with her first studio album since 2005's Souls Alike.

Title: Tough Love
Info: The second full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter was produced by Benny Blanco and Two Inch Punch.

Title: Lost In Space
Info: This self-released effort for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter (and former Til Tuesday frontwoman) is her first release since the twin 2000 critical successes of 'Bachelor No. 2' and the soundtrack to "Magnolia."

Title: The Alchemist's Euphoria
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for British rock band Kasabian is the first with Serge Pizzorno as lead singer.

Title: Confetti
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the British pop group features contributions from such artists as Kamille, MNEK, Tayla Parx, and TMS.

Title: Sorceress
Info: The fourth full-length release for the singer-songwriter from Texas was self-produced with some co-production from Al Carlson, Dan Duszynski, and Shane Renfro.

Title: Anything Could Happen
Info: The second full-length release for the band led by ex-Replacements bassist Tommy Stinson was recorded live in studio.

Title: Echtzeit
Info: A portion of the sixth full-length release for the experimental electronic trio was recorded in a church.

Title: My Friend Fish
Info: The debut solo release for Foxygen drummer Shaun Fleming was recorded in two weeks while he was at home recovering from the flu.

Title: Aventine
Info: The second full-length release for the Danish singer-songwriter was recorded in Berlin and self-produced.

Title: Invisible Empire // Crescent Moon
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Scottish singer-songwriter was produced with Howe Gelb and includes a guest appearance by PJ Harvey.

Title: Long Distance Song Effects
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie folk-rock group was produced by Tobi Gmur.

Title: Mon Pays
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the son of late Malian bluesman Ali Farka Touré includes appearances by Sidiki Diabáte and Idan Raichel.

Title: Equatorial Ultravox
Info: The EP for the electronic artist also known as Hugo Manuel moves away from chillwave to a pop sound.

Title: Tear the Fences Down
Info: The third album from the L.A. band is indie pop with an emotional edge.

Title: Thing Of The Past
Info: "A Thing of the Past" also features guest appearances by Vashti Bunyan, the Chapin Sisters and Michael Hurley

Title: This Harness Can't Ride Anything
Info: This is the second LP for the Chicago-based avant-pop outfit.

Title: Automato
Info: The DFA produced this full-length debut for the unconventional rap outfit consisting of MC Jesse Levine and a live five-piece backing band.

Title: Pearl Jam
Info: Adam Kasper again co-produced the band's belated follow-up to 2002's 'Riot Act.' It is Pearl Jam's eighth studio album overall.

Title: Life of Pause
Info: The third full-length release for the indie rock band led by Jack Tatum was recorded in Los Angeles and Stockholm.

Title: Fortress Around My Heart
Info: This is the debut album for the singer from Norway.

Title: Wild Young Hearts
Info: The second album for the British trio was produced by Jim Abbiss and features Peaches as a guest singer on one track.

Title: Lost Themes
Info: The debut non-soundtrack release for the director best known for his horror films was improvised instrumental music with his son Cody.

Title: Command Your Weather
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Seattle sludge metal band now composed only of Jared Warren and Coady Willis was recorded in Joshua Tree with Dave Curran.

Title: KiCk i
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the electronic artist/producer features guest appearances from Björk, Rosalía, Shygirl, and SOPHIE.

Title: Everything Else Has Gone Wrong
Info: The first full-length studio release in five years for the British indie rock band was produced with John Congleton.

Title: Weird
Info: The 17th full-length solo studio release for the indie singer-songwriter was self-produced.

Title: Light Divide
Info: The fourth solo release for the Barn Owl guitarist sees Porras moving toward an electronic ambient sound.

Title: The Dreamer
Info: The sixth solo album for the Old 97's frontman sees more country music influences than his previous solo releases.

Title: Mondo Cane
Info: The former Faith No More singer releases a live solo album of classic Italian pop songs featuring a 40-piece orchestra.

Title: The Invisible Deck
Info: Compared to a no-wave B-52's, the garage-rock trio Rogers Sisters return with a second LP, produced by Tim Barnes.

Title: Inside the Rose
Info: The first full-length studio release in six years for the British band is its first as a duo.

Title: Murs For President
Info: The debut album on the Warner Bros. label for the Los Angeles rapper features Snoop Dogg and will.i.am as guest artists.

Title: Strength & Loyalty
Info: The Game, Akon, Twista,  Mariah Carey and Bow Wow help with vocals--as does jailed group member Flesh-N-Bone--on the latest comeback attempt from the trio. Jermaine Dupri and will.i.am are among the producers.

Title: Further Complications
Info: The second solo album for the Pulp frontman was produced by Steve Albini.

Title: Revival
Info: The second full-length solo release for the pop singer features a guest appearances from A$AP Rocky.

Title: Ministry of Love
Info: The debut full-length release for the duo of Ioanna Gika and Leopold Ross includes Asian instruments.

Title: Just Like The Fambly Cat
Info: The Modesto, Calif. band has announced that it will break up after the release of this final 14-track album.

Title: Man About Town
Info: This is the fourth full-length solo studio release for the Grammy-nominated soul singer-songwriter.

Title: Primitives
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the electronic project of Roger Sellers.

Title: Infinite Summer
Info: The second release for the solo project of Michael Lovett features the addition of Charlotte Hatherly and Sarah Jones as well as more influences from rock music.

Title: Vestiges & Claws
Info: The third full-length solo release for the Swedish singer-songwriter is his first in seven years.

Title: Nobody Knows
Info: The second release for the singer-songwriter features Rodaidh McDonald and a duet with Cat Powers.

Title: On the Ones and Threes
Info: The indie rock trio returns with its original lineup to release its first new album in 10 years.

Title: In And Out Of Control
Info: The fourth album for the Danish rock duo was produced with Thomas Troelsen.

Title: Rites Of Uncovering
Info: Frequent Will Oldham collaborator (and member of The Anomoanon) Dave Heumann offers the second album of rustic rock from his own project, Arbouretum.

Title: Two
Info: The indie rock band led by Tim Kinsella reunited in 2012 after disbanding in 2002 and worked for 18 months to release its first studio release in 13 years.

Title: Hands of Glory
Info: Described as a companion piece to the earlier released Break It Yourself, it features one new track, two new versions of songs from Break It Yourself, as well as covers of songs by Alpha Consumer, the Carter Family, the Handsome Family, and Townes Van Zandt.

Title: Jhelli Beam
Info: This is the second album for Anti label by the rap artist.

Title: Event II
Info: Dan the Automator, The Funky Homosapien, and Kid Koala return 13 years later with the follow-up to the sci-fi concept album about Deltron Zero and his fight against corporations. Guest appearances include: Damon Albarn, Black Rob, Zack De La Rocha, David Cross, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, The Lonely Island, Mike Patton, and Amber Tamblyn.

Title: Luminous
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British rock quintet was recorded with co-producer Craig Silvey.

Title: Cautionary Tale
Info: After walking away from his deal with Rough Trade Records due to alcohol and exhaustion two years ago, the Alabama singer-songwriter worked with the Civil Wars' John Paul White and the Alabama Shakes' Ben Tanner on his third full-length release.

Title: Bones
Info: The second album for the British alternative rock band was produced by Dan Weller.

Title: Born with Stripes
Info: The third album for the San Diego indie rock quartet sees the influence of the music of Pavement.

Title: Living Proof
Info: The blues guitarist's latest solo album features Carlos Santana and B.B. King as guests.

Title: Missiles
Info: The fourth album for the indie rock band from Montreal.

Title: Silver Eye
Info: The seventh full-length release for the British electro-pop duo was produced by Haxan Cloak and John Congleton.

Title: Moving On Skiffle
Info: Van Morrison latest full-length studio release features skiffle-influenced covers of 23 blues, country, folk, gospel, and jazz songs.

Title: Songs of the Recollection
Info: The latest full-length release from Cowboy Junkies features covers of songs by such artists as David Bowie, Vic Chestnutt, The Cure, Bob Dylan, Gordon Lightfoot, Gram Parsons, The Rolling Stones, and Neil Young.

Title: A Broke Moon Rises
Info: The latest solo release for David Pajo as Papa M features just acoustic guitars and drums.

Title: The Small Hours
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British comedian/musician was recorded in part in his home studio.

Title: Future Hearts
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the punk-pop band was produced by John Feldmann and features guest appearances from blink-182's Mark Hoppus and Good Charlotte's Joel Madden.

Title: Beyond the Sun
Info: The singer-songwriter's latest release from Sun Records is a cover album of hit songs that were originally recorded by such artist as Johnny Cash, Jerry Lee Lewis, and Elvis Presley.

Title: As Long as You Are
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Baltimore band is its first as a quartet with drummer Mike Lowry and was produced with Steve Wright.

Title: Shade
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the hard rock band was produced by Andre Betts.

Title: Hippo Lite
Info: The second full-length release for the collaboration between Cate Le Bon and White Fence's Tim Presley was produced by Stephen Black and recorded in a house in the south of France.
The third full-length studio release for rapper Joey Bada$$ features guest appearances from Chris Brown, Diddy, Capella Grey, JID, Larry June, and Westside Gunn.

Title: The Last Hero
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Florida rock band that includes former members of Creed and Myles Kennedy was produced by Michael "Elvis" Baskette.

Title: The London Sessions
Info: The R&B singer worked with Disclosure, Jimmy Napes, Naughty Boy, Sam Romans, Emeli Sandé, and Sam Smith during her month-long visit to London for her 13th studio release.

Title: The Tragic Treasury: Songs From A Series Of Unfortunate Events
Info: The first album for the latest "band" from Magnetic Fields' Stephin Merritt (he's pretty much solo here) is intended as a companion to Lemony Snicket's series of books.

Title: Take Them On, On Your Own
Info: The London-by-way-of-Los-Angeles-by-way-of-San Francisco rockers known as JAMC--er, make that BRMC--return with their second LP, which actually finds the group distancing themselves (at least a little) from the Jesus and Mary Chain-influenced sound of their debut.

Title: Hasta el Cielo
Info: The third full-length release for the Houston trio features a dub version of its 2018's Con Todo El Mundo.

Title: Impeach My Bush
Info: Leslie Feist, Joan Jett, Josh Homme and Beth Ditto are among the guests on the electro-sleaze (and we mean that in a good way) artist's third LP.

Title: If You're Dreaming
Info: The second full-length release for the indie-pop singer-songwriter was produced with Sam Evian.

Title: Gracious Tide, Take Me Home
Info: The British folk group releases its debut full-length album produced by band member Paul Gregory.

Title: Grace/Wastelands
Info: The Babyshambles/Libertines lead singer releases his first solo album produced by Stephen Street.

Title: Creep On Creepin' On
Info: The Canadian folk trio releases its follow-up to its self-titled 2009 album.

Title: Marks to Prove It
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced with Laurie Latham.

Title: Dear God, I Hate Myself
Info: Dear God, I Hate Myself is the art-rock band's first release featuring new band member Angela Seo (keys). The album also features contributions from producer/Deerhoof member Greg Saunier.

Title: 90 in November
Info: The debut full-length release for Blair Howerton-led band Why Bonnie on the Keeled Scales label was written mostly in Brooklyn during the COVID-19 pandemic lockdown.

Title: Everyday Nothing
Info: The debut full-length release for the London-based singer-songwriter was produced by Bill Ryder-Jones.

Title: European Heartbreak
Info: The second full-length release for the Dutch indie pop artist was co-produced with Deerhoof's Chris Cohen and Trey Pollard.

Title: Lady Parts
Info: This is the debut release for the collaboration between Guillermo Scott Herren (aka Prefuse 73) and Michael Christmas.

Title: Los Niños Sin Miedo
Info: The debut full-length release for the Spanish garage rock trio led by Diego Garcia was recorded in a week.

Title: The  Heart Speaks in Whispers
Info: The third full-length release for the British soul singer-songwriter is her first in six years and was co-produced with her second husband, Steve Brown.

Title: Home Everywhere
Info: This is the second release for the Los Angeles-based rock band since they returned from disbanding in 1995.

Title: Baby
Info: The third full-length studio release for Casey Dienel was self-produced in a home studio in her parents' basement.

Title: 13 Degrees of Reality
Info: The latest release for the the British ensemble includes influences of jazz, rock, and world music with instruments such as kalimba, the koto, marimbula, and santur.

Title: A Turn in the Dream-Songs
Info: The sixth solo album for the singer-songwriter includes member of the Vaselines, Dr. Dog, Au Revoir Simone, Misty's Big Adventure, The Wave Picture, Johnny and the Sussex Wit, and Schwervon.

Title: Nursing Home
Info: The second full-length album for the British indie rock band was produced by Steve Albini.

Title: Moody, Standard and Poor
Info: The Brooklyn-based alternative rock band--featuring former members of Hot Snakes and Drive Like Jehu--release their second full-length on Sub Pop.

Title: Baseball Project, Vol. 2: High and Inside
Info: The second album from the Baseball Project continues with more baseball-themed songs with guest singers such as Death Cab for Cutie's Ben Gibbard, Yo La Tengo's Ira Kaplan, Los Lobos' Steve Berlin, The Hold Steady's Craig Finn, and The Decemberists' Chris Funk and John Moen.

Title: The Grand Theatre, Vol. 1
Info: The band led by Rhett Miller releases the first volume of songs that were originally planned as part of a double album. Volume two is scheduled for a May 2011 release.

Title: Love To Live
Info: The debut album for the trio formed by The Bird And The Bee's Inara George, Lavender Diamond's  Becky Stark, and Eleni Mandell.

Title: Loney, Noir
Info: Sweden multi-instrumentalist Emil Svanangen (aka Loney, Dear) makes his American debut with this re-release of his fourth album.

Title: Headphones
Info: This new side project for Pedro The Lion's David Bazan finds that group's guitars replaced with synthesizers.

Title: trampin'
Info: The legendary rocker's ninth album is a lowercase effort (song titles included), featuring her daughter Jesse on piano on the title track, as well as the same backing band that has been with her for the past decade.

Title: Heron King Blues
Info: The latest LP from the Chicago-based experimental indie-rockers returns the same four-piece lineup (led, as always, by Tim Rutili) from 2003's Quicksand/Cradlesnakes.

Title: thickfreakness
Info: The Akron, Ohio guitar-drums blues duo (needless White Stripes comparison omitted) of Dan Auerbach and Patrick Carney recorded this sophomore effort in a single 14-hour session.

Title: Piano Ombre
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Afropop-influenced indie pop band led François Marry was produced by Ash Workman.

Title: Vengeance Falls
Info: The sixth studio release for the melodic thrash band was produced by Disturbed's David Draiman.

Title: Out of View
Info: The debut release for the British quintet was self-produced by band guitarist Jerome Watson.

Title: Gift for the End
Info: The second full-length release for the folk singer-songwriter was produced by Sean Kae.

Title: No Gods
Info: The debut full-length release for the British punk band was produced by Brian McTernan.

Title: Steve Reich: WTC 9/11
Info: Steve Reich's composition about the September 11 attacks was written for the Kronos Quartet. The album also includes the Mallet Quartet performed by So Percussion and Dance Patterns with Steve Reich and Musicians.

Title: Pressure & Time
Info: The LA-based band releases a blues-rock, heavy-sounding second full-length album.

Title: Home
Info: The folk artist wrote, recorded, and produced the album of songs with the help of Mads Brauer.

Title: Little Death
Info: The debut album for the Reading, England, quintet was produced by Gareth Parton.

Title: Boarding House Reach
Info: The third full-length solo release for The White Stripes/The Raconteurs artist features contributions from C.W. Stoneking, Esther Rose and Ann & Regina McCrary of The McCrary Sisters.

Title: Mystic Familiar
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for the experimental electronic artist is his first in nearly five years.

Title: Planet of Ice
Info: The band's third album is the first to feature its new keyboardist Alex Rose, who replaced Matt Bayles.

Title: Home
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Michael Milosh project features the Danish National Girls' Choir and was mixed by mixed by Alan Moulder.

Title: Bang, Zoom, Crazy... Hello
Info: The first release in seven years for the rock band is its first with Daxx Nielsen on drums.

Title: It's a Holiday Soul Party
Info: The holiday album from the R&B/soul singer and her band features both standards and original songs.

Title: The Cookbook
Info: Slick Rick, The Neptunes, M.I.A., Tweet and Mary J. Blige are among the guests on Elliott's first new disc in two years. Longtime collaborator Timbaland produces just two tracks here.

Title: Spirit
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the British electronic band was produced by Simian Mobile Disco's James Ford.

Title: Together At Last
Info: The first of a planned series of acoustic solo releases for the Wilco artist features songs from his career with Wilco and his side projects.
This is the second full-length release for the British electronic duo of Gabe Gurnsey and Nik Void (drummer Dominic Butler left the band after the release of its debut in 2013).

Title: Kin
Info: When the music videos first appeared in 2010, the identity of the person(s) who was iamamiwhoami was unknown. It has since been revealed Swedish singer Jonna Lee is the person behind the music.

Title: A Certain Feeling
Info: The sophomore album for the Los Angeles group.

Title: Spooked
Info: Gillian Welch guests on Hitchcock's latest solo offering, produced by David Rawlings.

Title: Heroes To Zeros
Info: 'Heroes' marks the third album for the ever-strange UK outfit, who self-produced the disc and handed it off to Nigel Godrich (Radiohead) for mixing.

Title: Ultravisitor
Info: Tom Jenkinson's latest full-length attempts to incorporate more of his live sound into the overall feel.

Title: The Trouble With Being Myself
Info: The distinctive-voiced singer hopes to rebound from the disappointing sales of her 2001 sophomore effort 'The Id' with this third LP, which includes Beck and Pharoah Monche among its guests.

Title: Spend The Night
Info: American's favorite high school rockers have graduated and grown up, resulting in this, their fifth (and most mature) album to date.

Title: The Joy of Sing-Sing
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the retro-pop band (think Cardigans or St. Etienne) founded by Lush guitarist/vocalist Emma Anderson and vocalist Lisa O'Neill. Many of the band's earlier singles appear here (in reworked versions), along with new material, all produced by Mark Van Hoen (Locust).

Title: Fog
Info: Fog is 23-year-old turntablist Andrew Broder, and this is his debut album, a cut-and-paste mix of various sounds combined with guitar and vocals.

Title: Ovalcommers
Info: Markus Popp returns with eleven untitled tracks of noise and sounds of skipping CDs. Some people like that.

Title: Sleepwalking
Info: Second full-length from the British production duo.

Title: Antidotes
Info: The debut full-length album for the Oxford, England-based band.

Title: Peanut Butter
Info: The second full-length release for the Welsh rock band was produced by Hookworm's MJ.

Title: The Brutalist Bricks
Info: The Ted Leo-led rock band moves to Matador Records for its sixth album.

Title: Golden Archipelago
Info: Produced by John Congleton (St. Vincent, Black Mountain, Polyphonic Spree, Explosions in the Sky), Golden Archipelago is Shearwater's third album released on Matador Records.

Title: Out of Touch, In the Wild
Info: This is the third release for the British five-piece led by Duncan Wallis.

Title: Me Moan
Info: The second solo release of country and electronic music for the former drummer of Pearls And Brass is his first on Sub Pop and was co-produced with Benjamin Balcom.

Title: Mr. Hollywood, Jr. 1947
Info: The Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter's first outing in five years is a loose concept album set in the year 1947.

Title: Instrument
Info: The eigth full-length release for the Berlin-based electronic trio of Robert Lippok, Ronald Lippok, and Stefan Schneider features Arto Lindsay on three tracks.

Title: Endless
Info: After several days of streaming video of himself building a wooden staircase, Frank Ocean releases an 18-track visual album on Apple Music.

Title: Blood//Sugar//Secs//Traffic
Info: The second full-length release for the Pittsburgh rock band features guest appearances from Tim Midyett of Silkworm and Bottomless Pit, and Joe Casey of Protomartyr.

Title: Gone by the Dawn
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Oakland, California-based garage rock trio was produced by Sonny Smith of Sonny & The Sunsets.

Title: Inner Fire
Info: The sixth release for the Canadian collective was produced by Pierre Chrétien and Jason Jakunas.

Title: Wasted Years
Info: This is the third full-length studio release for the Los Angeles punk band led by Keith Morris.

Title: Folila
Info: The album mixes recording sessions from New York and Mali featuring such guests as Tunde Adebimpe, Bertrand Cantat, Ebony Bones, Kyp Malone of TV on the Radio, Santigold, Jake Shears of the Scissor Sisters, Theophilus London, and Nick Zinner of the Yeah Yeah Yeahs.

Title: Complete Surrender
