Info: The third full-length release for the British indie pop duo of Rebecca Taylor and Charles Watson was produced by Colin Elliot.

Title: Pieces Of The People We Love
Info: The New York City dance-punk outfit returns with a sophomore album a full three years after their debut 'Echoes.' 'Pieces' sees them ditching The DFA for new producers Ewan Pearson, Paul Epworth and Danger Mouse.

Title: Feels Like Home
Info: Produced with Justin Niebank, the first country release for the singer-songwriter includes songs co-written with Al Anderson, Brandy Clark, Rodney Clawson, Chris DuBois, Luke Laird, Shane McAnally, and Brad Paisley.

Title: The Parallax II: Future Sequence
Info: Produced with Jamie King, the sixth studio album for the metal band is a sequel to its 2011 EP release The Parallax: Hypersleep Dialogues.

Title: Live At Earls Court
Info: Recorded during a Christmas show in 2004, this live set includes a mix of solo and Smiths material.

Title: Without You
Info: King Midas Sound's 2009 album is redone by a variety of artists, including Flying Lotus, Gang Gang Dance, Nite Jewel, Hype Williams, Kode 9, and the Spaceape.

Title: Sing It Loud
Info: Iconoclastic country singer k.d. lang returns with her third Nonesuch effort, 2011's Sing It Loud.

Title: Miami Memory
Info: The third full-length release for the Australian indie singer-songwriter was inspired by his relationship with Jemima Kirke and was produced by Jonathan Rado.

Title: Thought Rock Fish Scale
Info: The second full-length release for the Canadian rock band was recorded live to tape over four days.

Title: The Shakes
Info: This is Matthew Herbert's first full-length dance release in eight years under the Herbert name.

Title: Storyteller
Info: The fifth full-length release for the country-pop singer was produced by  Mark Bright and Jay Joyce.

Title: Encore
Info: Produced by Dave Cobb, the fourth full-length release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter features contributions from Tim Bergling, Johnny McDaid, Ed Sheeran, and Chris Stapleton.

Title: Dreams Say, View, Create, Shadow Leads
Info: A majority of the second album for Ponytail's guitarist Dustin Wong was live recorded.

Title: Give Till It's Gone
Info: This is Ben Harper's first solo album of soul, reggae, and rock since 2006.

Title: Black Radio
Info: The jazz pianist's latest album of original and cover songs features guest appearances by Bilal, Erykah Badu, Lalah Hathaway, Shafiq Husayn, Ledisi, Lupe Fiasco, KING, Chrisette Michele, Mos Def, Musiq Soulchild, Meshell Ndegeocello, and Stokley Williams.

Title: None Shall Pass
Info: Guest appearances by El-P, Cage, Breeze Brewin, Rob Sonic, and John Darnielle of The Mountain Goats are featured on Aesop Rock's latest album.

Title: No One Is Lost
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Canadian indie pop band was co-produced with Liam O’Neil.

Title: Brightest Blue
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British artist features guest appearances from blackbear, Diplo, Juice WRLD, Lauv, serpentwithfeet, and Swae Lee.

Title: Life & Livin' It
Info: The fifth full-length release of African-influenced music for Ahmed Gallab was self-produced.

Title: Nebula Dance
Info: This is the third full-length release for Brighton producer, Alan Myson.

Title: I Like Fun
Info: The 20th full-length studio release for the Brooklyn duo of John Flansburgh and John Linnell was mixed by Patrick Dillett.

Title: Antenna to the Afterworld
Info: The San Francisco-based band shifts away from the country sound of its last album back to garage pop with its fourth release colored by Sonny Smith experience with a psychic and the death of his friend, Esme Barrera.

Title: After the End
Info: Self-recorded and produced, the latest release from the now five-piece band led by Carson Cox is its first with its two new members: Chris Horn and Elsner Nino.

Title: Radio Music Society
Info: The fourth release for the 2011 Grammy-winning Best New Artist is described as a more upbeat album with two cover songs.

Title: Recording A Tape The Colour Of The Light
Info: This is the long-in-the-making debut album for the instrumental Montreal band that shares two members (Sarah Neufeld and Richard Reed Parry) with the Arcade Fire.

Title: Out Of Heart
Info: The debut full-length release for London-based rapper Flohio features a guest appearance from HAWA.

Title: Guild of the Asbestos Weaver
Info: The eighth full-length solo studio release for the British experimental singer-songwriter features influences from drone music, science fiction and cosmic horror comics.

Title: No One Ever Really Dies
Info: After seven years working on their own projects, Pharrell Williams, Chad Hugo and Shay Haley return with the trio's fifth full-length release that features guest appearances from André 3000, Kendrick Lamar, Gucci Mane, M.I.A., Rihanna, Ed Sheeran, and Wale.

Title: Big Box of Chocolates
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by Edwyn Collins.

Title: Afro-Haitian Experimental Orchestra

Title: The Quickening

Title: Us

Title: Snow Bound

Title: Junior

Info: The veteran singer-songwriter is still going strong nearly 40 years after launching his recording career.

Title: Modern Ruin

Title: Far
Info: The Russian-born singer-songwriter's latest album was produced by Jeff Lynne, Mike Elizondo, David Kahne and Garret "Jacknife" Lee.

Title: OST

Title: Ultraviolence

Title: Exercises [EP]

Title: Let's Go Eat the Factory

Title: One Less Heartless To Fear
Info: The latest album for the Chicago rock band was recorded live in Louisville, Kentucky, and Tokyo, Japan.

Title: Dum Spiro Spero

Title: Warpaint

Title: KIRK

Title: Kathryn Calder
Info: The third full-length solo release for the New Pornographers singer/keyboardist was co-produced by Colin Stewart.

Title: NYC, Hell 3:00 AM
Info: The latest release for the experimental artist/producer was inspired by the city of New York.

Title: Mr. Beast
Info: The fifth studio album for the Scottish five-piece was produced, like its predecessor, by Tony Doogan.

Title: Eagulls
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Leeds post-punk band.

Title: Discipline +  Desire
Info: The Chameleons' Mark Burgess worked on the second full-length release from the post-punk band led by Hether Fortune.

Title: Wizard Bloody Wizard

Title: Scum

Title: Different Days

Title: Dillatronic
Info: Curated by his mother, Ma Dukes, Dillatronic offers 41 rare instrumentals from the late Detroit hip-hop producer James "J Dilla" Yancey, with the focus being on his "electronic music influences," who are as much Kraftwerk as George Clinton. Case in point, the funky, slinky track seven included here -- none of the tracks are titled -- which slowly rocks back and forth like Clinton's solo hit "Atomic Dog," while the 26th cut comes off as a cross between Madlib and "Maggot Brain" with Funkadelic guitars spinning and swaying in a psychedelic manner. The latter track also strays from the "electronic music influences" concept, which happens with about a quarter of the album's tracks. Good thing too, as the chugging and organic track three is a much bigger surprise than the half-speed redo of "Trans Europe Express" that is track 20, plus the drifting, Janet Jackson-esque closer has little to do with electro but is likely to become a favorite with the target audience (a combination of the Dilla faithful, underground beatheads, and amateur MCs looking for mixtape productions). While the collection doesn't come with the purposeful feel of Donuts, it flows extremely well for a beat tape, and one released nine years after the artist passed. Add to that the amount of new flavors and unexpected twists (Was track 12 influenced by early dubstep? What was the plan for the dark and dense track 28?) plus crisp, clean recordings that beat the bootlegs, and Dillatronic is a necessary pickup for fans. ~ David Jeffries

Title: Plain Spoken
Info: The 22nd studio album for the singer-songwriter was self-produced (T Bone Burnett was credited as executive producer) and is his first release on the Republic Records label.

Title: +++ (Crosses)

Title: Antiphon

Title: Almost Free

Title: Planet High School

Title: Home Acres

Title: Alphabetical
Info: This is the second album for the French synth-rock outfit, who attracted some international acclaim with their 2000 debut 'United.'

Title: Let It Come Down

Title: For The Recently Found Innocent

Title: The Beatific Visions

Title: IX
Artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead

Title: Piramida

Title: Dusk

Title: Gutter Tactics

Title: Hypnophobia
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Dutch producer.

Title: It's Frightening
Info: The second album for the band was produced by Spoon's Britt Daniel.

Title: Summer 08

Title: Hotel Shampoo

Title: The Bird And The Bee

Title: Powerhouse

Title: Passwords

Title: Strangers

Title: Mines

Title: The Process Of Belief

Title: Cults

Title: Deeper
Info: The third full-length release for Luis Vasquez as Soft Moon was written and recorded while in Berlin and Venice, Italy.

Title: The Sound The Speed The Light
Info: This is the fourth album for the punk rock band from Boston.

Title: Dereconstructed
Artist: Lee Bains III & the Glory Fires
Info: The second full-length release for the Alabama Southern rock band led by Lee Bains III was produced by Tim Kerr.

Title: ∞ (Infinity)
Info: The eighth release for the French artist best known for his work on the Amélie soundtrack was inspired by Iceland and the islands of Brittany.

Title: Chiaroscuro

Title: Get There

Title: Rat Farm

Title: Soft Fall

Title: Good Morning to the Night

Title: The  Stepkids

Title: The  Human Romance

Title: Some Are Lakes

Title: Kesto (234.48:4)

Title: Again
Info: This entertaining electronica-with-vocals debut by France's Marc Nguyen Tan (aka Colder) is informed by the last 25 years of electronic music, especially 70's and 80's artists such as Cabaret Voltaire and New Order.

Title: Bazooka Tooth

Title: The New Romance

Title: Long Walk Home: Music From The Rabbit-Proof Fence

Gabriel turns to Aboriginal music throughout the album, but don't expect any true "songs" from this work, which consists chiefly of longer, moody, instrumental pieces with a world music flavor.

Title: Almanac
Info: The second release for the duo of Molly Hamilton and Robert Earl Thomas was produced by Kevin McMahon.

Title: We All Want the Same Things

Title: Evolve or Be Extinct
Info: This is the second album in six months for the British grime artist.

Title: God Help The Girl
Info: The sountrack to Belle & Sebastian's Stuart Murdoch musical movie of the same name, which is scheduled to be filmed in 2010.

Title: Shaolin vs. Wu-Tang

Title: Hardwired...To Self-Destruct
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the California metal band was produced by Greg Fidelman.

Title: Sound Mirror
Info: The second full-length release for the Canterbury psych-rock quartet was self-produced.

Title: Plat du Jour

Title: Negrophilia: The Album

Title: Minotaur
Info: The Clienteleâ€™s 2009 album Bonfires on the Heath was one of the best, most hauntingly beautiful records of the bandâ€™s impressive career. So strong that it spawned an equally wonderful EP made up of songs recorded at the Bonfires sessions that were deemed suitable for the album itself. Hard to believe that they couldnâ€™t find room for the title track "Minotaur" as its fragile melody and sweetly swaying dynamics would have fit in perfectly. The same with the bouncing and sweet "Paul Verlaine"; it would have been one of the more memorable tracks there. That these songs were indeed left off only points out how good Bonfires was, and how easily the Clientele concoct note-perfect autumnal pop. Add in a moodily drifting cover of The West Coast Pop Art Experiment's creepy ballad from the late 60s,â€œAs the World Rises and Falls,â€ a couple of tracks that hit the usual Clientele sweet spot between heartbreak and tender melancholy, and a long spoken word ramble from leader Alasdair MacLean, and you have a record that rises above stopgap or left-overs status. Minotaur is as essential as anything else the band has released and whether as part of Bonfires or on its own, the record stands as a welcome addition to their legacy as one of the great indie pop bands of their era. ~ Tim Sendra

Title: Here Come The Choppers
Info: The actor/singer/songwriter (and father of recording artists Martha and Rufus) is joined by Bill Frisell (and others) on his first disc in five years.

Title: Road To Rouen
Info: This is album nubmer five for the UK rockers led by Gaz Coombes.

Title: Death Seat

Title: Caracal
Info: The second full-length release from the brother duo of Guy and Howard Lawrence features guest appearances from Kwabs, Lion Babe, Lorde, Miguel, Nao, Gregory Porter, Jordan Rakei, Brendan Reilly, Sam Smith, and The Weeknd]

Title: Wild World

Title: Strange Weekend

Title: Putrifiers II

Title: Let's Start Here

Title: Every Step's a Yes

The debut release from the British indie rock band was produced by Pulp's Steve Mackey.

Title: Long Way Home

Title: Fear in Bliss

Title: Blue Lights On The Runway

Title: III
Info: The third full-length release from the Chilean trio was self-recorded with additional synth sounds from Atom TM.

Title: Rolling Blackouts

Title: Texis
Info: This is the sixth full-length release for the New York-based duo of Alexis Krauss and Derek Miller.

Title: Life Among the Savages

Title: Cloud Nothings

Title: Ellipsis

Title: The Grand Tour

Title: The In Crowd

Title: j.a.c.
Info: This is the fourth album for the duo of Richard Dorfmeister (of Kruder & Dorfmeister fame) and Rupert Huber. Vocals are handled by a variety of guests, including Chris Eckman (The Walkabouts).

Title: Undying Color

Title: Dances in Dreams of the Known and Unknown
Info: This is the 13th studio release for the Swedish rock band led by former Lungfish singer Daniel Higgs.

Title: Beach Fossils
Info: This is the debut album for the lo-fi indie band led by Dustin Payseur.

Title: The Spell

Title: Cass County

Title: Turbines

Title: La Futura

Title: Dirty Jeans and Mudslide Hymns

Title: WE

Title: Yu

Title: Unknown Mortal Orchestra
Info: This is the debut album for the Portland, Oregon-based band led by New Zealand-born Ruban Nielson of the Mint Chicks.

Title: Central Market
Info: The Battles band member releases his latest solo album on the Warp label.

Title: Stuff Like That There
Info: The latest release for the New Jersey indie rock band features covers of songs by the Cure, the Lovin' Spoonful, Darlene McCrea, the Parliaments, Sun Ra, and Hank Williams, as well as reworkings of its own older songs.

Title: Vapor City
Info: This is the first release on Ninja Tune for Berlin-based electronic artist Travis Stewart.

Title: Highway Companion
Info: The rocker's third solo disc has only one Heartbreaker (Mike Campbell) in tow, with the rest of the instrumentation handled by Jeff Lynne (who also produces) and Petty himself.

Title: Good Apollo, I'm Burning Star IV, Volume One: From Fear Through The Eyes Of Madness
Info: This is the third emo-sci-fi album from the prog-rock foursome fronted by Claudio Sanchez.

Title: Memory of a Cut Off Head
Info: The 20th full-length studio release for John Dwyer is the first since 2005 credited under the OCS name.

Title: Good Bad Not Evil
Info: The fifth studio album for the group from Georgia.

Title: The Indian Tower
Info: This is the second album for the Pennsylvania stoner-rock outfit.

Title: KOD
Info: The fifth full-length release for the North Carolina rap artist feature tracks about addiction and rap culture.

Title: The  Wack Album
Info: The third release for the comedy rap trio of Andy Samberg, Akiva Schaffer, and Jorma Taccone includes guest appearances from Billie Joe Armstrong, Lady Gaga, Hugh Jackman, Kendrick Lamar, Adam Levine,  Robyn, Solange, T-Pain, Justin Timberlake, Too $hort, Kristen Wiig, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Albert Einstein
Info: The second release from the collaboration between Mobb Deep's Prodigy and The Alchemist includes guest appearances from  Action Bronson, Domo Genesis, Havoc, Raekwon, and Roc Marciano.

Title: Superorganism
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the London-based eight-person indie pop collective.

Title: Rated O
Info: The triple album is the second of the band's "Thank Your Parents" trilogy of releases.

Title: Astronomy For Dogs
Info: Beta Band founder Gordon Anderson (also of Lone Pigeon) reunites with most of his former bandmates for this new, equally quirky project.

Title: Stadium Arcadium
Info: Rick Rubin produced this double-disc, 28-song set for the veteran Los Angeles rock outfit.

Title: We Slept At Last
Info: The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter the was produced by Charlie Andrew.

Title: Innocence
Info: The eighth full-length release for the Virginia rock trio was recorded without computers.

Title: Solo Piano II
Info: The follow-up to his 2004 album Solo Piano was recorded over 10 days in Paris.

Title: We'll Be the Moon
Info: The debut full-length release for the British psychedelic five piece band was produced by Nathaniel Lennox Jr.'s.

Title: Alas, I Cannot Swim
Info: The debut album for the ex-Noah And The Whale member was nominated for the 2008 Mercury Prize.

Title: Cosmos
Info: The third album for the Mexican electronica artist Fernando Corona.

Title: In The Clear
Info: The trio (which includes Fountains of Wayne's Adam Schlesinger) return with their first new album in four years, produced by Steve Osborne.

Title: Summer In Abaddon
Info: This is the third album for the indie rock outfit led by Armistead Burwell Smith IV (formerly of 3 Mile Pilot) and Rob Crow.

Title: Simple Math
Info: The Atlanta alternative band release a third album of grunge-y indie-pop.

Title: Fishing for Fishies
Info: The latest full-length studio release for the Australian psychedelic rock band features elements from blues music.

Title: Hello Love
Info: This the third album for the Canadian folk trio includes a cover of Prince's "When Doves Cry."

Title: Coma Ecliptic
Info: The seventh full-length release for the North Carolina prog metal band was produced by Jamie King.

Title: Magic
Artist: Bruce Springsteen & The E Street Band
Info: The Boss is back with his E Street Band.

Title: St. Catherine
Info: The fifth release for the solo project of Real Estate's Matt Mondanile was produced by Rob Schnapf.

Title: Somewhere
Info: The second full-length release for the Austin-based indie pop band was produced by Danny Reisch.

Title: Everything's Beautiful
Info: Robert Glasper took master takes and outtakes of Miles Davis' work and produced new songs with vocals from Erykah Badu, Bilal, Hiatus Kaiyote, Illa J, Ledisi, KING, Laura Mvula, John Scofield, and Stevie Wonder.

Title: Trial Of The Century
Info: This sophomore disc finds the New York foursome moving a bit further into 80s synth-pop territory.

Title: Weather Diaries
Info: The first new release in 21 years for the British rock band was produced by DJ Erol Alkan and mixed by Alan Moulder.

Title: Seeds We Sow
Info: Fleetwood Mac's famed songwriter and guitarist returns with another solo release that was recorded entirely in his home.

Title: There Existed an Addiction to Blood
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Los Angeles experimental rap trio features guest appearances from Ed Balloon, Benny The Butcher, Sarah Bernat, Counterfeit Madison, Elcamino, Robyn Hood, La Chat, and Pedestrian Deposit.

Title: Closer Apart
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the collaboration between South African producer Okzharp and Die Antwoord's Manthe Ribane.

Title: I'm Rich Beyond Your Wildest Dreams
Info: The second full-length release for the Nashville pop-punk six-piece band was produced by Kevin McMahon.

Title: Burnt Up on Re-Entry
Info: The fifth release for Mat Sweet as Boduf Songs includes more guitars and electronics.

Title: Write Me Back
Info: R. Kelly's latest release is a continuation of the 1950-70s R&B and soul music he explored on his 2010 album, Love Letter.

Title: Hidden Vagenda
Info: This is the fourth solo album for the Moldy Peaches singer.

Title: OST
Info: Producer T-Bone Burnett compiled this collection of traditional Americana, country and blues tunes to complement Anthony Minghella's Civil War epic. Among the performers here are Alison Krauss and the White Stripes' Jack White.

Title: Closer
Info: Techno pioneer Richie Hawtin returns with his first Plastikman album in five years. Unlike his DJ sets, 'Closer' is a dark, minimalist, challenging affair (note how often the word "paranoia" pops up in reviews).

Title: Tour de France Soundtracks
Info: No, it's not actually a soundtrack, but it is--shockingly enough--the legendary German electronic band's first new studio recording since 1986's 'Electric Cafe.' While the title track "Tour De France" was released as a single in 1983 (and is found here in four new versions), the remaining 8 tracks are brand new compositions.

Title: Rainy Day Music
Info: The seventh album for the Minnesota alt-country outfit features a smaller-than-usual lineup of songwriter/vocalist Gary Louris, bassist Marc Perlman and drummer Tim O'Reagan, joined by new guitarist Stephen McCarthy. Matthew Sweet and Jakob Dylan guest.

Title: Holes In The Wall
Info: This is the debut album for psychedlic British indie-rockers Electric Soft Parade (actually two teenage brothers, Tom and Alex White), drawing comparisons to everyone from Grandaddy and the Charlatans to Teenage Fanclub and Buffalo Springfield.

Title: Alive To Every Smile
Info: The fourth album from Bob Wratten under the Trembling Blue Stars name features yet another new lineup (although Annemari Davies does return for a couple of tracks).

Title: Libra Scale
Info: Ne-Yo's latest effort takes on the influence of themes and character archetypes found in sci-fi fantasies and comic books and structures them around a musical plot to create a daring concept album.

Title: Bubblegum
Info: The band's sixth album is inventive and dreamy, shifting in sounds using strings, harpsichords, and dulcimers to combine its psychedelic lullabies with folk rock.

Title: Where Does This Door Go
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based singer includes contributions from Kendrick Lamar, Jessie Ware, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: The Wink
Info: The debut solo full-length release for the White Fence artist under his real name was produced by Cate Le Bon.

Title: Miscontinuum Album ( Fiepblatter Catalogue #3)
Info: Recorded over four years, this electronic release from the Mouse on Mars member features contributions from Dylan Carlson, Markus Popp, Kathy Alberici, and Taigen Kawabe.

Title: For Now I Am Winter
Info: The third full-length release for the Icelandic composer was orchestrally arranged by Nico Muhly and features the vocals of Agent Fresco singer Arnór Dan Arnarson on four tracks.

Title: Attack Decay Sustain Release
Info: Two members from the electro-rock group Simian reform and release their own debut album.

Title: Belong
Info: This is the third full-length release for Ellis Ludwig-Leone chamber pop solo project-turned seven-piece indie rock group.

Title: The Minimal Wave Tapes, Vol. 2
Info: This is the second volume of the compilation of electronic music recorded in the 1980s.

Title: Get Guilty
Info: This is the second solo album for the New Pornographers' Carl Newman.

Title: Blame It On Gravity
Info: The Dallas-based alt-country quartet releases its seventh studio album.

Title: - Ugh, those feels again
Info: The second full-length release for the Swedish Iranian R&B artist was executive produced by No I.D.

Title: Lo Moon
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie pop trio of Crisanta Baker, Matt Lowell, and Sam Stewart was produced by Death Cab For Cutie's Chris Walla.

Title: Past Time
Info: The San Francisco-based trio releases its first album on the Kill Rock Stars label after a successful release of its self-titled debut.

Title: Here Before
Info: Recorded in Hoboken, this New Jersey band continues their post-punk/new wave sound with their first collection of new music in nearly 19 years.

Title: Knuckle Down
Info: DiFranco breaks from her usual DIY practice by enlisting Joe Henry to co-produce this latest release.

Title: The Bears for Lunch
Info: This is the third release in 2012 for the Robert Pollard-led band that boasts the original lineup that played together between 1992 and 1996.

Title: Church with No Magic
Info: The Australian rock trio releases its first album as PVT, after an American band claimed legal rights to the name Pivot.

Title: Closer To The Bone
Info: The singer-songwriter/actor's latest album is again produced by Don Was and features Bob Dylan on the backing vocals of the title track.

Title: This Is Not The World
Info: The English rock quartet releases its third album on its own label, Nul Records.

Title: None of Us Are Getting out of This Life Alive
Info: The first full-length release in nearly 10 years for the British rapper features guest appearances from Oscar #Worldpeace, Hak Baker, Dapz on the Map, Donae'O, ELIZA, Greentea Peng, Rob Harvey, IDLES, Kasien, Jimothy Lacoste, Chris Lorenzo, Ms Banks, Jesse James Solomon, and Tame Impala.

Title: Art of Doubt
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.

Title: Tidal Wave
Info: Produced by Mike Sapone, the seventh full-length studio release for the alternative rock band was inspired in part by music from such artists as Tom Petty and Bryan Adams.

Title: Till the Tomb
Info: The second full-length release for the British electronic pop trio was produced by David Wrench and Dave Eringa.

Title: Miami
Info: The third full-length release for the German experimental electronic trio of Daniel Brandt, Jan Brauer, and Paul Frick features guest appearances from such artists as Gudrun Gut, Nina Kraviz, Jamie Lidell, and Om'Mas Keith.

Title: We Are The Pipettes
Info: The female Brighton, England trio (with backing music by The Cassettes) reinvents the 1960s girl group for a new century with this debut LP, which features the lead single "Pull Shapes."

Title: At Best Cuckold
Info: The second full-length release for the indie pop band led by Avi Zahner-Isenberg was self-produced.

Title: Lost
Info: Low, The Drums' Jonny Pierce, and The Raveonettes' Sune Rose Wagner appear as guests on the third full-length release for the Danish producer.

Title: Threadbare
Info: This is the latest album for the California-based indie rock trio.

Title: The Tarnished Gold
Info: Thom Monahan produced the Los Angeles-based country-rock band's first album in nearly 12 years and it features contributions from Ariel Pink; Neal Casal, Darran Rademaker of The Tyde, Dan Horne, and Jen Cohen.

Title: Prairie Wind
Info: The veteran rocker's first release since recovering from a brain aneurysm  includes contributions from Emmylou Harris and Spooner Oldham.

Title: Life. Love. Flesh. Blood
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Irish singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Jeff Beck and Jools Holland and was produced by T-Bone Burnett.

Title: The  Chief
Info: The debut full-length release for the R&B/hip-hop artist features guest appearances from Roman GianArthur, Nana Kwabena, Janelle Monáe, and St. Beauty.

Title: St. Germain
Info: The third full-length release for French artist Ludovic Navarre features Malian instrumentation and influences of jazz.

Title: The Black Dirt Sessions
Info: The latest album for the John McCauley's band Deer Tick is its first with former Titus Andronicus guitarist Ian O'Neil.

Title: Riceboy Sleeps
Info: Sigur Ros' Jon Thor (Jonsi) Birgisson and his boyfriend Alex Somers release their first album together.

Title: I Com
Info: Born in France and now residing in Berlin, Miss Kittin (aka Caroline Herve) has provided vocals for a variety of electronica producers, including Felix Da Housecat and The Hacker. Here, she works with producers Tobi Neumann and Thies Mynther.

Title: Shootenanny!
Info: The Eels fifth album finds head Eel Mark Oliver Everett (aka "E") injecting more humor into his otherwise dark alt-rock tunes.

Title: Tomorrow Right Now
Info: This debut release from Anti-Pop Consortium rapper Beans continues the experimental, genre-defying approach to hip-hop of that now-defunct group, mixing intelligent lyrics with cutting-edge production.

Title: Get Rich Or Die Tryin'
Info: If you're even reading this, you most likely already know the life story of Queens' Curtis Jackson (aka 50 Cent), whose first attempt at rap stardom in the mid 1990s ended in a brutal attack that almost cost him his life. In recent years, however, 50 Cent was lucky enough to hook up with Eminem (who signed him) and producer Dr. Dre, which resulted in a track on the 8 Mile soundtrack and now this, his much-anticipated first full-length release.

Title: Daybreaker
Info: The fifth album for the British metalcore band includes guest appearances by Jon Green of Deez Nuts, Oli Sykes of Bring Me The Horizon, and Drew York of Stray From The Path.

Title: Uptown Special
Info: The fourth full-length release for the singer/producer was co-produced with Jeff Bhasker and features guest appearances from such artists as Bruno Mars, Mystikal, Tame Impala's Kevin Parker, Stevie Wonder, and Andrew Wyatt. The lyrics come from an unlikely source: novelist Michael Chabon.

Title: The January EP
Info: The six-song EP was recorded during the same time frame as 2009's Pigeons and was produced by the band's bass player Jen Turner.

Title: Scars On Broadway
Info: The debut album for the band that includes System of a Down's Daron Malakian and John Dolmayan.

Title: Sundowner
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Kansas-based singer-songwriter was recorded in Texas with producer Brad Cook  and completed remotely during the pandemic lockdown.

Title: The Now Now
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Damon Albarn's animated band features guest appearances from George Benson, Jamie Principle and Snoop Dogg.

Title: Allah-Las
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles surf/psych rock band who met while working at Amoeba Records was produced by Nick Waterhouse.

Title: Human Ceremony
Info: The debut full-length release for the Brooklyn trio of Julia Cumming, Nick Kivlen, and Jacob Faberwas produced by Matt Molnar.

Title: Harkin
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the indie singer-songwriter features contributions from  Warpaint’s Stella Mozgawa and Wye Oak’s Jenn Wasner and was recorded with John Agnello and Richard Formby.

Title: Knuckleball Express
Info: The latest release for Neil Hagerty's Howling Hex project was recorded over eight days and was produced by Clay Jones.

Title: Man Alive!
Info: The third full-length release for Archy Marshall as King Krule was inspired in part in his move away from London.

Title: Wave
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was mixed with Rob Heaney.

Title: Qualia
Info: The third full-length solo release for the British electronic artist features contributions from Erick Legrand and Nina Walsh.
the 13th release for the avant-garde Norwegian trio of Arve Henriksen, Helge Sten (aka Deathprod) and Ståle Storløkken was recorded from the music coming out from its stage PA system.

Title: One Day All of This Won't Matter Any More
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British indie pop duo of Charles Watson and Rebecca Taylor was produced by Matthew E. White.

Title: Last Evenings on Earth
Info: This is the second full-length studio release for the London-based group led by Kushal Gaya.

Title: Heartworms
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie-pop rock band was self-produced by James Mercer.

Title: TFCF
Info: With just Angus Andrew at the helm, the eighth full-length release for the now solo act was recorded in Australia and mixed by Gareth Jones.

Title: La Cucaracha
Info: With this full-length album, Ween move away from their electro-heavy "Friends" EP released earlier this year.

Title: Love Me
Info: The second solo release for the drummer of WhoMadeWho includes guest appearances from his WhoMadeWho bandmates Jeppe Kjellberg and Tomas Høffding as well as Nina Kinert, Sleep Party People, and Luke Temple.

Title: Natalie Merchant
Info: The self-produced release for the former 10,000 Maniacs singer is her first album of original songs since 2001's Motherland.

Title: All We Grow
Info: Justin Vernon was so impressed with Sean Carey's ability that he was invited to be a part of Bon Iver's touring band. Now comes Carey's solo debut album recorded at his own home and Vernon's studio in Wisconsin.

Title: Folie A Deux
Info: The latest album for the emo rock band was produced by Neal Avron.

Title: Devin Dazzle And The Neon Fever
Info: The producer and electroclash artist returns with a proper follow-up to 2001's 'Kittenz and Thee Glitz.' Guest vocalists include the titular Neon Fever as well as James Murphy (the DFA).

Title: Beet, Maize & Corn
Info: The seventh LP for the Sean O'Hagan-led indie-pop band features backing vocals from the late Mary Hansen (Stereolab) and does away with drums on all but a handful of tunes.

Title: Redemption's Son
Info: The only "rock" act signed to Peter Gabriel's Real World label, Akron, Ohio native Joseph Arthur returns with his third album.

Title: Toxicity
Info: This is the alternative metal band's follow-up to their hit 1998 self-titled debut. Rick Rubin produced the 14-track effort.

Title: Red Dirt Girl
Info: Similar in sound to 1995's adventurous 'Wrecking Ball,' this album of original Harris tunes features guest appearances from Bruce Springsteen, Dave Matthews and Jill Cunniff (Luscious Jackson), among others.

Title: Cansei De Ser Sexy
Info: This Brazilian dance-rock outfit may be "Tired Of Being Sexy," but that didn't stop Sub Pop from making them the first South American addition to its roster. This is their debut.

Title: Provincial
Info: The Weakerthans' lead singer releases his debut solo full-length album.

Title: The Invisible Invasion
Info: Portishead's Geoff Barrow and Adrian Utley produced this fourth LP for the UK retro-rockers.

Title: Century Plaza
Info: The latest release for the Alabama rock artist features songs inspired by the electro-pop music of the 1980s.

Title: Demons: The Nomad Series, Vol. 2
Info: The second album in the band's Nomad series contains covers of Vic Chesnutt songs.

Title: Static
Info: Produced with Shane Stoneback and Ben Allen, the emotions around a breakup is the central theme of the second full-length release from the Brooklyn pop duo of Madeline Follin and Brian Oblivion.

Title: Dream Get Together
Info: This is the third full-length album for the San Francisco-based indie rock band.

Title: Are We There Yet?
Info: The properly-hatted New York City four-piece make their debut with this ambitious CD.

Title: Absolute II
Info: The album is the final release for Oneida's Thank Your Parents trilogy.

Title: Deth Red Sabaoth
Info: This is the first album of new material in six years for the rock band led by Glenn Danzig.

Title: Car Alarm
Info: The eigth album for the indie rock band formed in Chicago was recorded in three months.

Title: The Information
Info: Nigel Godrich produced the latest eclectic release for the prolific Los Angeles-based artist, which is more varied and uptempo than their previous collaborations.

Title: Grace/Confusion
Info: This is the third full-length album for Dayve Hawk as Memory Tapes.
The 12th full-length release for the Canadian power-pop band features three songs written by each of its four members.

Title: Gentlewoman, Ruby Man
Info: The covers release from the debut collaboration between Flo Morrissey and Matthew E White features songs from a variety of artists including Leonard Cohen, Barry Gibb, Frank Ocean, Frankie Valli, and the Velvet Underground.

Title: White Van Music
Info: The Seattle producer's debut album features such guests as MF Doom, Young Buck, Brother Ali, Busta Rhymes, and Prodigy.

Title: Clues
Info: The debut album for the group is led by the Unicorns' Alden Penner and Arcade Fire member, Brendan Reed.

Title: Snakes & Arrows
Info: Their 18th album overall, 'Snakes' is the Canadian trio's first studio outing since 2002's 'Vapor Trails.' Nick Raskulinecz co-produced.

Title: Oxnard
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Southern California artist features guest appearances from Kadhja Bonet, BJ The Chicago Kid, J. Cole, Dr. Dre, Kendrick Lamar, Norelle, Pusha T, Q-Tip, Cocoa Sarai, Snoop Dogg, and The Last Artful, Dodgr.

Title: Providence
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British electronic producer features guest vocals from Prurient and the Braids' Raphaelle Standell-Preston.

Title: Take It Like a Man
Info: This is the debut release from the collaboration between the Packway Handle Band and Jim White.

Title: June Gloom
Info: The second full-length release for the indie pop duo of Kacey Underwood and Alice Costelloe was produced by Rory Attwell.

Title: Clutching Stems
Info: The indie pop band releases its first album since the 2007 death of drummer San Fadyl.

Title: You See Colours
Info: Graham Sutton produced this sophomore set for the English band fronted by Greg Gilbert.

Title: Instinct
Info: This is the debut full-length release for Swedish electro-pop duo of Malin Dahlström and Gustaf Karlöf.

Title: Blood, Looms, And Blooms
Info: The first album for the Iranian producer in over eight years is also her first under the Warp label.

Title: Lightning Bolt
Info: The tenth studio release for the Eddie Vedder-led rock band was produced by Brendan O'Brien.

Title: You Can Have What You Want
Info: The third album for the indie-pop band led by Jason Quever.

Title: Invitation
Info: This is the debut full-length release from the rock supergroup that features Sleater-Kinney's Corin Tucker, R.E.M.'s Peter Buck, The Minus 5's Scott McCaughey, The Fastbacks' Kurt Bloch, and King Crimson's Bill Rieflin.

Title: brand new eyes
Info: The follow-up to the band's second album was produced by Rob Cavallo.

Title: Good Mood Fool
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for Here We Go Magic's frontman was recorded in an upstate New York cabin with backing from Dirty Projectors' Mike Johnson and We Go Magic bandmate, Eliot Krimsky.

Title: Neverendless
Info: This is the Chicago-based psychedelic band's first album as a quartet.

Title: Dave Alvin & the Guilty Women
Info: Dave Alvin collaborates with a female group on his latest album.

Title: Harmonium
Info: The rock quartet from Nottingham releases its debut album.

Title: Ooey Gooey Chewy Ka-Blooey!
Info: The latest release from the Detroit garage rock band led by Mick Collins was inspired by 1970s Bubblegum pop music created by Jerry Kasenetz and Jeff Katz.

Title: Sunshine
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn noise-rock duo of Andrya Ambro and Sarah Register emphasizes melodies.

Title: The Prophet Speaks
Info: The latest 40th full-length release for the singer-songwriter features six new original songs as well as eight covers of classics jazz and R&B songs.

Title: Fomo
Info: The singer-songwriter from New Zealand releases his second solo album.

Title: Welcome Oblivion
Info: After two EPs, the band led by Nine Inch Nails's Trent Reznor releases its full-length debut album.

Title: Fucked Up Friends
Info: The solo debut for the electronic artist Tobacco also features Aesop Rock

Title: Shulamith
Info: The second release for the Minneapolis indie band led by Channy Leaneagh includes a duet with Justin Vernon.

Title: Disco Volador
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie-pop group was produced by Marta Salogni.

Title: The Competition
Info: The Baltimore indie pop band is now a duo with just Jana Hunter and Nate Nelson on its fourth full-length release.

Title: Romaplasm
Info: The fourth full-length release for Will Wiesenfeld as Baths was mastered by Daddy Kev.

Title: Sing to the Moon
Info: The debut full-length release for the Birmingham Conservatoire graduate includes influences from gospel, jazz, R&B, and soul music.

Title: All Or Nothing
Info: The sophomore album for the English trio was produced by Butch Vig.

Title: Back To Me
Info: The Canadian singer-songwriter's sophomore release again blends country and rock sounds, and includes a guest appearance by Benmont Tench (The Heartbreakers).

Title: Dancer Equired
Info: The lo-fi indie pop trio from Ohio return with their fifth album--their first album recorded in a proper studio.

Title: Shifty Adventures in Nookie Wood
Info: The first album of new music in seven years from the Velvet Underground co-founder includes a song featuring Danger Mouse.

Title: Deeper Than Rap
Info: The third album for the rapper features such guests as Foxy Brown, John Legend, Lil Wayne, Kayne West, The-Dream, Robin Thicke, Ne-Yo, and T-Pain.

Title: And Everything Else
Info: Indie hip-hop/electronica producer Nobody (aka Elvin Estela) teams with Prefuse 73, Mia Doi Todd and members of Beachwood Sparks on his Plug Research debut.

Title: This Gift
Info: The third album for the Scottish band was produced by Bernard Butler.

Title: High Road
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the pop singer features guest appearances from Big Freedia, Sturgill Simpson, Brian Wilson, and Wrabel.

Title: B-Room
Info: The Philadelphia psychedelic rock band named its seventh full-length release after its new recording studio where they recorded the album with producer Nathan Sabatino.

Title: Build A Nation
Info: The Beastie Boys' Adam Yauch produced this first release in a dozen years for the original lineup of the lengendary hardcore punk outfit.

Title: As If Apart
Info: This is the second full-length solo release for the former Deerhoof guitarist.

Title: A Bigger Bang
Info: Don Was co-produced the band's first new studio album in eight years. Keith Richards sings on two tracks.

Title: Tower Of Love
Info: This debut LP (which actually collects tracks from three previous EPs together with a few new songs) from the English singer-songwriter combines indie rock with lo-fi electronics and '60s and '70s pop influences.

Title: West
Info: The San Francisco quartet releases another album of psychedelic rock.

Title: Meaning of Life
Info: The soul-influenced eighth full-length studio release for the pop artist is her first on the Atlantic label and features production from Greg Kurstin, The Monarch, Maureen "Mozella" McDonald, Jesse Shatkin, and Mick Schultz.

Title: Holly
Info: The second full-length solo release for the Los Angeles singer-songwriter was co-produced with Kevin Augunas.

Title: A  Map of the Floating City
Info: The concept album made up of three EPs about three imaginary continents is the first since the singer's 1992 album Astronauts & Heretics.

Title: The  Palace Guards
Info: The Cracker and Camper Van Beethoven singer releases his solo debut album.

Title: City Center
Info: This is the debut album for the New York indie band led by Fred Thomas.

Title: Dropout Boogie
Info: The latest full-length release for rock duo The Black Keys features a guest appearance from ZZ Top's Billy F Gibbons.

Title: Ephyra
Info: This is the second and final release for the London-based indie pop trio.

Title: Tapes
Info: The New York indie-rock band releases its first mix album.

Title: Asa Breed
Info: This third album is the most song-based effort yet for the Michigan electronic music producer, who also records under the name Audion.

Title: Wake UP!
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based artist born in Australia was produced by Ben H. Allen and Justin Raisen.

Title: The Family Sign
Info: The Minnesotan hip-hop group is back with a new album released through Rhymesayers.

Title: See You There
Info: Recorded during the same sessions as 2011's Ghost On The Canvas, some of the country singer's biggest songs are reworked by producers Dave Darling and Dave Kaplan.

Title: Corrosion of Conformity
Info: The eighth album for the North Carolina punk metal band lacks Pepper Keenan and sees the return of the lineup that recorded its 1985's release Animosity.

Title: The Brian Jonestown Massacre
Info: The 18th full-length studio release for the San Francisco psychedelic rock project led by Anton Newcombe was recorded in Berlin.

Title: Magic Ship
Info: The first release in eight years for the North Carolina-based trio of Amelia Meath, Molly Sarle and Alexandra Sauser-Monnig was mixed by Nick Sanborn.

Title: Watching Movies with the Sound Off
Info: The second release for the Pittsburgh rapper includes guest appearances from Ab-Soul, Action Bronson, Jay Electronica, Schoolboy Q, Earl Sweatshirt as well as production from Flying Lotus and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Cradlesong
Info: The second solo album for the former Matchbox Twenty singer was produced with Matt Serletic.

Title: Testimony: Vol. 2, Love & Politics
Info: The follow-up to "Testimony: Vol. 1, Life & Relationship" features MC Lyte, Musiq Soulchild, Gramps Morgan, Dobet Gnahore, Terrell Carter and Sezen Aksu as guest artists.

Title: Vacilando Territory Blues
Info: Fleet Foxes' newest member, Joshua Tillman releases his fifth solo album, the first on the Western Vinyl label.

Title: God Bless Your Black Heart
Info: The Texas noise-rock trio led by John Congleton returns with a third LP.

Title: Televise
Info: This is the third LP for the New York-based noise-rock trio, known for their intense live shows.

Title: The Teaches of Peaches
Info: While, like other artists lumped under the "electroclash" label, the Canadian-born Peaches (Merrill Nisker) utilizes a vaguely early-80s style synth-based sound, no one else, then or now, has managed to be quite as raw, lewd and sexually graphic as she.

Title: All For You
Info: The first new album in four years from the former Diff'rent Strokes star. (OK, so we've been watching too much Nick at Nite lately.)

Title: Magic Chairs
Info: The third album for the Danish band was produced by Gareth Jones and recorded with a live band.

Title: Mulberry Violence
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Youth Lagoon artist under his real name.

Title: Fearless
Info: Taylor Swift's follow-up to her triple-platinum debut album was produced with Nathan Chapman and features a duet with Colbie Calliat.

Title: HONESTLY, NEVERMIND
Info: The seventh studio album from Drake is a surprise release and features a guest appearance by 21 Savage.

Title: Flume
Info: The debut full-length debut from Australian electronic producer Harley Streten includes influences from R&B, hip-hop, and pop music.

Title: The Light the Dead See
Info: The British duo worked with Depeche Mode's Dave Gahan on The Light the Dead See.

Title: I And Love And You
Info: Rick Rubin produces the latest album for the North Carolina band.

Title: Afterparty Babies
Info: Cadence Weapon's sophomore album is said to be inspired by his summer in Edmonton.

Title: Wilderness Heart
Info: Vancouver singer/songwriter Stephen McBean returns as the main musical mastermind behind this psychedelic rock outfit, combining stoner metal with dreamy pop.

Title: The Apple And The Tooth
Info: The follow-up to his June release "Ambivalence Avenue" features eight remixes and four new songs.

Title: Melophobia
Info: The third full-length release for the Kentucky rock band was produced by Jay Joyce.

Title: Seadrum/House Of Sun
Info: The latest "album" from the Japanese outfit contains just two tracks, albeit at 20 minutes apiece.

Title: The Weight Is A Gift
Info: Death Cab For Cutie's Chris Walla returns as producer for the band's followup to 'Let Go.'

Title: The State Between Us
Info: Over a thousand musicians from across the European Union contributed to the album about being British in the face of Brexit from the British-born electronic producer.

Title: Couples
Info: The quintet from England uses influences from 1980s pop on its sophomore album produced by Erol Alkan.

Title: An  Object
Info: The fourth full-length release for the rock band was produced and recorded with Facundo Bermudez.

Title: Sky Blue Sky
Info: The sixth studio set for the Jeff Tweedy-fronted band is less experimental and adventurous than Wilco's previous few efforts. It is the first Wilco studio album to feature the work of touring guitarist Nels Cline.

Title: Glad All Over
Info: The sixth full-length release for the alternative rock band led by Jakob Dylan is its first studio-recorded album in seven years.

Title: Station
Info: The sophomore album for the Chicago-based instrumental band was produced by Matt Bayles.

Title: Summer In The Southeast
Info: This 17-song set was recorded during Will Oldham's 2004 tour.

Title: Elements of Light
Info: The fourth release from Pantha du Prince sees the techno producer working with Norwegian percussion group The Bell Laboratory and sounds from a bell carillon--an instrument with 50 bronze bells.

Title: Shine
Info: The sophomore album for the British artist features Kanye West on her chart topping single "American Boy."

Title: Devour You
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles rock band was produced by Nick Launay.

Title: Chromatics
Info: The second full-length release for producer Sam Genders as Diagrams was inspired by relationships.

Title: Girls Like Us
Info: The debut full-length release for the Manchester indie pop quartet was self-produced.

Title: Working Girl's Guitar
Info: The rockabilly singer-guitarist releases her 11th album.

Title: Colour of the Trap
Info: The Rascals singer releases his solo debut, which features such guests as the Arctic Monkey's Alex Tuner, Super Furry Animal's Gruff Rhys, and Oasis' Noel Gallagher along with production work by Dan Carey and Dan the Automator.

Title: Devotion
Info: The sophomore album for the Baltimore-based indie-rock duo.

Title: Skin
Info: Aside from the track "Heal Me," which includes background vocals by Laura Dern and Meg Ryan, this is a true solo effort for Melissa Etheridge, who wrote and performed all 10 tracks on this, her seventh album. Much of the music was written during her breakup with her long-time companion, and the songs reflect this experience.

Title: Sound Mirrors
Info: This is the first album in eight years for the duo of Jon Moore and Matt Black. Roots Manuva, Mike Ladd, Jon Spencer and Andrew Broder (Fog) are among the eclectic guests.

Title: Oxy Music
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for Australian singer-songwriter Alex Cameron features contributions from Jackie McLeann, Lloyd Vines and Sleaford Mods' Jason Williamson.

Title: Abolition of the Royal Familia
Info: The latest full-length release for the British ambient house project led by Alex Paterson features contributions from such artists as Roger Eno, Miquette Giraudy, David Harrow, Steve Hillage, and Youth.

Title: Marble Skies
Info: The third full-length release for the London-based art-rock band features contributions from Metronomy's Anna Prior and Slow Club's Rebecca Taylor.

Title: Kykeon
Info: The third release for the Brooklyn improvisational rock band that features Greek and Middle Eastern music was recorded with Jason Meagher.

Title: Eighteen Hours of Static
Info: The debut full-length release for the New York post-punk band was recorded by Charles DeChants.

Title: Paradise Valley
Info: Produced by Don Was, the second Americana-influenced release from the singer-songwriter includes guest appearances from Frank Ocean and Katy Perry.

Title: An Invitation
Artist: Inara George With Van Dyke Parks
Info: Inara George Works pairs up with the famous arranger Van Dyke Parkson on her latest album inspired by Frank Sinatra and Richard Sherman.

Title: Surrender to the Fantasy
Info: The first release in four years for the Connecticut-based trio of Elisa Ambrogio, Pete Nolan, and John Shaw.

Title: Television
Info: The latest album for the Senegalese musician was produced with Barry Reynolds.

Title: Marauder
Info: The sixth full-length release for the New York indie rock band was produced by Dave Fridmann.

Title: Madness
Info: The latest full-length release for Minneapolis band Poliça features the use of producer Ryan Olson and Seth Rosetter's "anthropomorphic production tool" AllOvers(c).

Title: Jellies
Info: The debut full-length release for the side project from The Bees' Aaron Fletcher and Tim Parkin was recorded on the Isle of Wight.

Title: The Great Divide
Info: The third full-length release for the Scottish alternative rock band was produced by Jacknife Lee and Gil Norton.

Title: Wu-Massacre
Info: Wu-Tang's Method Man, Ghostface Killah, and Raekwon join up again with an album produced by RZA and Mathematics.

Title: Happy to You
Info: The second album from the indie electronic trio of Chris Karlsson, Pontus Winnberg, and Andrew Wyatt features Lykke Li as a guest singer.

Title: The Race for Space
Info: The London-based duo mixed exclusive archive footage about the Space Race from the British Film Institute for their second full-length release.

Title: Knives Don't Have Your Back
Info: The first solo album for the Metric singer finds her backed by members of Stars, Metric and Broken Social Scene (together billed as The Soft Skeleton).

Title: Neuroplasticity
Info: The second full-length release for Canadian singer-songwriter Al Spx was produced by Jim Anderson.

Title: Blurry Blue Mountain
Info: The follow up to the band's 2008 album ProVisions was produced by Howe Gelb and Kent Olsen.

Title: Liberation Transmission
Info: This is the third album for the hard-rocking Welsh band.

Title: Fear Is On Our Side
Artist: I Love You But I've Chosen Darkness
Info: Paul Barker (Ministry) produced the Austin band's debut full-length.

Title: You Were Right
Info: This is the sixth full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter who previously was a member of The Raconteurs.

Title: Exposion
Info: The indie rock band's first full-length releases in the US was originally self-released at its concert tour.

Title: Crystal Castles
Info: The debut full-length album for the Toronto duo of Ethan Kath and Alice Grass.

Title: Everyday Life
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the British alternative rock band is a double album and was produced by Rik Simpson.

Title: Judy Sucks A Lemon For Breakfast
Info: This is the first album for the British band since 2002's "Handcream For A Generation."

Title: Finding Forever
Info: The seventh album produced by Kanye West (who also guests on one track), features appearances from Lily Allen, DJ Premier, D'Angelo, and Bilal.

Title: New Me, Same Us
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Swedish band was self-produced and is its first on the Ninja Tune label.

Title: Geography
Info: The debut full-length release for the British artist features guest appearances from Poppy Ajudha, De La Soul, Loyle Carner, and GoldLink.

Title: 24 Karat Gold: Songs from the Vault
Info: The eighth solo studio release for the Fleetwood Mac singer contains songs she wrote during the 70s and 80s, plus two in the early 90s.

Title: Careers
Info: This is the debut release for Frankie Rose's side project with Drew Citron.

Title: Lion
Info: The tenth full-length solo release for the former Bauhaus singer was produced by Youth.

Title: Do Whatever You Want All the Time
Info: The Baltimore quartet return from its hiatus (guitarist Dustin Wong recorded a solo album and drummer Jeremy Hyman had a stint with the Boredoms) to reunite for its third album of experimental art rock.

Title: Watersports
Info: The San Francisco band's debut on the Quarter Stick label.

Title: Third World Pyramid
Info: The 15th full-length release for the San Francisco psychedelic rock band led by Anton Newcombe was recorded in Berlin and features a guest appearance from Serena-Maneesh's Emil Nikolaisen.

Title: I'm Gay (I'm Happy)
Info: The California rapper received death threats after revealing the title of this digitally released album.

Title: Lazers Never Die
Info: Diplo and Switch return as Major Lazer with a six-track EP which includes a remix by Thom Yorke (Radiohead) of one track from their 2009 release Guns Don't Kill People...Lazers Do.

Title: Blue Roses
Info: The debut album for Laura Groves was recorded in different places with her family and friends.

Title: Death Magic
Info: The fifth release for the Los Angeles noise rock band was produced by The Haxan Cloak.

Title: The Feast of the Broken Heart
Info: Co-produced by Ha-Ze Factory and Mark Pistel, the third full-length studio release from the Andy Butler electronic collective features guest appearances from John Grant, Rouge Mary, and Krystle Warren.

Title: High Places Vs. Mankind
Info: The Los Angeles-based indie duo releases its second studio album.

Title: We All Belong
Info: The fourth album for the Philadelphia band was recorded on a 24-track tape.

Title: Power Chords
Info: The fourth full-length release for Los Angeles-based garage rock/power-pop artist was produced by Mike McCarthy.

Title: Moth
Info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn duo of Caroline Polachek and Patrick Wimberly was inspired by New York City.

Title: Return to the Moon
Info: This is the debut release for the side project of The National's Matt Berninger and Menomena's Brent Knopf.

Title: Angel
Info: The third full-length release for the Austin band sees the addition of the touring guitarist Matty Tommy Davidson.

Title: We're Animals
Info: The San Francisco electro-punk trio make their Kill Rock Stars debut with this third LP.

Title: Free The Bees
Info: This '60s-influenced sophomore release from the Isle of Wight-based duo was recorded at Abbey Road.

Title: Steady
Info: The 13th full-length studio release for Canadian indie rock band Sloan was produced and mixed with Ryan Haslett.

Title: Tomorrow's Hits
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Brooklyn five-piece was recorded over two days before 2013's New Moon was released.

Title: Hexadic II
Info: The second release based on Ben Chasny's new composition method features a more acoustic sound.

Title: Who Killed The Zutons
Info: The Liverpool band's debut disc was, like similar-sounding recent discs by The Coral, produced by Ian Broudie. It was nominated for a Mercury Music Prize.

Title: A  Different Kind of Truth
Info: The first album from Van Halen in 14 years sees the band reunited with David Lee Roth.

Title: Ventriloquizzing
Info: The British Kraut-rock trio's fourth album of artsy dance music is full of funky guitar licks; club-ready bass; and melodic, trippy beats.

Title: Rainier Fog
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Seattle rock band was produced by Nick Raskulinecz and is its first on the BMG label.

Title: Pokey Lafarge
Info: Produced by Ketch Secor, the fifth full-length release for the St. Louis singer is his first on Third Man Records.

Title: Born and Raised
Info: The fifth studio album from the singer-songwriter was produced by Don Was and was delayed from its original release date by Mayer's throat granulomas.

Title: Troubled, Shaken Etc.
Info: This is the second full-length album for the British band.

Title: Afrodisiac
Info: A ten-year music-industry veteran at age 25, Brandy returns with 15 new tracks, ditching long-time collaborator Rodney Jerkins in favor of producers Timbaland, Organized Noize and Kanye West.

Title: Fall Back Open
Info: Michael Stipe and Conor Oberst guest on this sophomore disc for the Athens, GA outfit led by producer Andy LeMaster (Bright Eyes), with vocals from Orenda Fink and Maria Taylor (Azure Ray).

Title: At Crystal Palace
Info: Picking up on the sounds of late 70s / early 80s post-punk and no-wave, this all-female Bay Area quartet drew positive notices for their debut 'Other Animals' and now return with a sophomore LP two years later.

Title: Sleep/Holiday
Info: The Welsh band returns with 12 new tracks of indie rock mixed with folk, pop, and psychedelia.

Title: Fashionably Late
Info: Talk about apt titles. The British folk legend's first album in a whopping 17 years features 10 new songs recorded mainly with her son, Teddy Thompson, and numerous guests such as Rufus Wainwright, Van Dyke Parks, and ex-husband and recording partner Richard Thompson.

Title: Dreamland
Info: The former Led Zeppelin singer's first solo album in nearly 10 years is a mix of originals and covers, including Bob Dylan's "One More Cup of Coffee" (also recently covered by the White Stripes) and Tim Buckley's "Win My Train Fare Home."

Title: Spiritual Emergency
Info: This is the second release for the psychedelic rock project led by Greg Fox.
The aptly titled fourth studio album from the pop songstress has both dance-floor-ready jams and down-tempo tunes that are a bit tamer than those in the last album.

Title: Velocifero
Info: The British quartert's fourth album features two songs sung in Bulgarian.

Title: WWI
Info: This is the debut full-length for the Lawrence, Kansas band consisting of Matt Suggs (Butterglory), Rob Pope (The Get Up Kids), and John Anderson, Zach Holland, Dustin Kinsey (Thee Higher Burning Fire).

Title: Dispossession
Info: Folk, jazz, and psychedelic rock are just some of the influences seen on the latest album for the Brooklyn singer-songwriter that includes contributions from At The Drive-In's Ryan Sawyer, trumpeter Nate Wooley, and violinist Jessica Pavone.

Title: Fighting Demons
Info: The second posthumous release for the rapper Juice WRLD features guest appearances from Justin Bieber, Polo G, Suga of BTS, and Trippie Redd.

Title: Body Music
Info: The debut full-length release for electro-soul duo of Aluna Francis and producer George Reid includes a cover of Montell Jordan's "This Is How We Do It."

Title: Blue
Info: This is the third full-length release from the collaboration between Jonna Lee and Claes Björklund.

Title: The  Age of Fracture
Info: Produced by Dreamtrak, the latest release from the British quartet was inspired by Princeton professor Daniel T. Rodgers' book of the same name.

Title: The Highway
Info: Produced with Charlie Peacock, the granddaughter of Hank and the daughter of Hank Jr. releases her first new recording in four years.

Title: There Were Wolves
Info: The debut album for the quartet includes Sam Genders of Tunng, Stephen Cracknell of The Memory Band, Hanna Caughlin of The Bicycle Thieves, and Liam Bailey.

Title: Birthmarks
Info: The second full-length solo release for the Irish singer-songwriter was written over two years and recorded while she was pregnant in Ireland and Norway with producer Lasse Marhaug.

Title: Privilege
Info: The Portland, Oregon-based experimental pop band releases a full-length album of 12 tracks selected from its five Privilege EPs.

Title: Twist Again
Info: This is the third album for the Los Angeles indie rock trio that includes married couple David and Meredith Matcalf.

Title: Distant Relatives
Info: The African-themed album brings Nas and reggae singer Damien Marley (the youngest son of Bob Marley) together. It features guest appearances by K'naan, Lil Wayne, Joss Stone, Dennis Brown, and Damien's brother Steven Marley, who also produced the release.

Title: Spelled In Bones
Info: The Chicago band led by Eric Johnson (sometimes of Califone) returns with a third album.

Title: Love is Dead
Info: The third full-length release for the Scottish synthpop trio was produced by Greg Kurstin.

Title: Pour Une Âme Souveraine: A Dedication to Nina Simone
Info: Meshell Ndegeocello co-produced the tribute album to Nina Simone with Chris Bruce and it features guest appearances by Cody Chesnutt, Valerie June, Sinéad O'Connor, Toshi Reagon, and Tracy Wannomae.

Title: Ella Mai
Info: The debut full-length release for the British R&B artist features production from DJ Mustard and guest appearances from Chris Brown, H.E.R., and John Legend.

Title: Vessel of Love
Info: The third full-length solo release for former singer of The Slits was produced by Martin Glover.

Title: Night Fiction
Info: The third solo release for the Irish guitarist features his vocals and was recorded in Dublin by Girl Band's Daniel Fox.

Title: MTV Unplugged [Live at Hull City Hall]
Info: The live recording of the Oasis singer's solo MTV Unplugged concert at Hull City Hall in August 2019 features the 24-piece Urban Soul Orchestra and Oasis guitarist Paul “Bonehead” Arthurs.

Title: The Russian Wilds
Info: The third full-length album for the San Francisco rock band was produced by Rick Rubin.

Title: Thee Physical
Info: The second album of electronica from Travis Egedy was produced by HEALTH's Jupiter Keye.

Title: Black Sands
Info: The fourth album for Simon Green, the British DJ who goes by the name Bonobo, weaves in orchestral strings, hip hop beats, afro-latin sounds, and vocals from Andreya Triana to his downtempo style.

Title: Call Me Crazy
Info: The sixth album for the Texas-born country singer was produced by Tony Brown.

Title: Nocturama
Info: Nick Cave & co. return for a follow up to 2001's 'No More Shall We Part.'

Title: Riot Act
Info: Still going strong, the Seattle grunge band returns with its seventh studio album.

Title: Halos & Horns
Info: The legendary singer's third roots-country album for Sugar Hill Records includes 12 Parton originals as well as covers of Bread's "If" and, of all things, Led Zeppelin's "Stairway to Heaven."

Title: Southern Hummingbird
Info: The former backup singer for Missy Elliott and Timbaland comes into her own on this, her debut album, which was produced and co-written by her two benefactors. Tweet's presence and talent are evidenced by the surprising abundance of guitar/soul tracks here, instead of a reliance on electronic/dance numbers typical of a Missy-Timbaland production.

Title: Souljacker
Info: Based in Los Angeles, the Eels have had some stateside success on MTV but have perhaps found greater popularity in the UK and Europe. This new LP (their fourth) features guest appearances by Koool G Murder, John Parish (who also produces), and Joe Gore.

Title: Cuttin' Heads
Info: John Mellencamp's 18th album features guest appearances from India Arie and Chuck D.

Title: Wolf's Law
Info: This is the second full-length release from the Welsh alternative rock trio.

Title: Imps of Perversion
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn quartet was produced by Martin Bisi.

Title: Hey Ma
Info: The first album in nearly 10 years for the British rock band was recorded in France.

Title: New Material
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian post-punk quartet was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnson.

Title: Black Bubblegum
Info: The experimental electronic artist used keyboards, guitars and effect pedals on his latest solo release.

Title: Everybody Looking
Info: The ninth full-length release for the Atlanta rapper was recorded in six days after he was released from jail in May 2016 and features guest appearances from Drake, Kanye West, and Young Thug.

Title: Laced
Info: After establishing "shitgaze" as a subgenre of "shoegaze", the Ohio band continue on their wildly experimental path with a more electronic-based space-rock sound.

Title: Born In The Echoes
Info: The eight full-length release for the British electronic dance duo features guest appearances from Beck, Annie Clark, Cate Le Bon, Ali Love, and Q-Tip.

Title: Ullages
Info: The second full-length release for the British post-punk band was produced by Matt Peel.

Title: There's No Leaving Now
Info: This is the third full-length album from Swedish singer-songwriter Kristian Matsson.

Title: In Case We Die
Info: Imagine the Arcade Fire dosed with happy pills, stocked with toy instruments and forced to score a musical about the 1980s, and you may start getting close to the idea of this eight-piece co-ed band from Melbourne, Australia. This second album follows recent tours with the likes of Death Cab For Cutie, David Byrne and Belle And Sebastian.

Title: Atum
Info: The 33-track rock opera/concept album from The Smashing Pumpkins features the story of Shiny, who was first introduced on 1995's Mellon Collie And The Infinite Sadness.

Title: Outer Peace
Info: The latest full-length release for Chaz Bundick as Toro y Moi features guest appearances from ABRA and Wet.

Title: Heydays
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Ohio rock band that includes Cloud Nothings' drummer Jayson Gerycz.

Title: Other People's Lives
Info: This is the first album of any kind in eight years (and the first true solo singer-songwriter album period) for the former leader of the Kinks.

Title: Highway Songs
Info: The first new studio release from David Pajo as Papa M in 15 years comes after a suicide attempt in 2015 and a motorcycle accident in March.

Title: Aesthethica
Info: This is the second full-length album for the Brooklyn-based black metal band.

Title: Born Again In The USA
Info: This is the second album from the trio of Jeff Tweedy (Wilco), Glenn Kotche and Jim O'Rourke.

Title: Give Me the Future
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for British pop band Bastille features guest appearances from Riz Ahmed and BIM.

Title: Gentle Grip
Info: The debut full-length release for the New York band that includes Samantha York and Vince McClelland of Wall and Drew Citron and Scott Rosenthal of Beverly features elements of funk, disco, and punk music.

Title: Trans-Continental Hustle
Info: Rick Rubin produced the gypsy-inspired band's debut for Columbia Records, which also includes Brazilan influences now.

Title: Herein Wild
Info: The third full-length release for the garage rock singer was co-produced with Michael Cheever.

Title: She Wolf
Info: The Colombian singer releases her third English-language album, which reunites her with Wyclef Jean, who appeared on their number one single "Hips Don't Lie."

Title: Decemberunderground
Info: Jerry Finn returns as producer for the band's first album in three years.

Title: Under the Spell of Joy
Info: The latest full-length release for the Los Angeles-based garage/psych rock band features a children's choir.

Title: Hitch
Info: The third full-length release for the Welsh alternative rock trio was self-produced and mixed by Alan Moulder.

Title: I Feel Alive
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian pop band led by Jane Penny and David Carriere is its first with Marta Cikojevic.

Title: Ready for Confetti
Info: The Texas songwriter releases his 16th album.

Title: My Electric Family
Info: The second full-length album for the New Zealand-based artist, Annabel Alpers.

Title: Blakroc
Info: The Damon Dash-produced project features the Black Keys and several hip hop artists including Ol' Dirty Bastard, Mos Def, Ludacris, RZA, Raekwon, Jim Jones, Nicole Wray, Q-Tip, Pharoahe Monch, NOE, and members of M.O.P.

Title: Resistance
Info: The second full-length solo release for the Los Angeles artist features guest appearances from N’Dambi, Patrice Quinn, Sheera, and Techdizzle.

Title: Get Gone
Info: The debut full-length release for the Louisiana-based rock band led by A.J. Haynes was produced by Jimbo Mathus.

Title: 36 Seasons
Info: The 11th solo studio release for the Wu-Tang rapper features guest appearances from AZ, Kool G Rap, Nems, Pharoahe Monch, The Revelations, Kandace Springs, Shawn Wigs, and Tre Williams.

Title: Better Day
Info: The legendary country starlet releases an album of all-new studio material.

Title: Love Is Love
Info: The 10th full-length release for the New York folk rock band was recorded in two months after the presidential election.

Title: Burials in Several Earths
Info: The first new release in 32 years for the surviving members of the ensemble that began as the BBC's in-house musicians.

Title: Flying Microtonal Banana
Info: The first of a planned five albums in 2017 for the psychedelic rock band features microtonal tuning.

Title: Heavy Meta
Info: The second solo release for the Toy Soldiers singer/guitarist was produced with Joe Bisirri.

Title: Future Standards
Info: The latest solo release from the Giant Sand artist is a jazz-influenced album with a duet with Lonna Kelley.

Title: Building a Beginning
Info: The first solo release on the British soul singer's own label was produced by Justin Stanley and Ben Ash.

Title: We're All Gonna Die
Info: The fifth full-length release for the folk rock band led by Taylor Goldsmith was produced by Blake Mills and features backing vocals from Brittany Howard of Alabama Shakes, Jim James of My Morning Jacket, Mandy Moore, Will Oldham, Holly Laessig and Jess Wolfe of Lucius.

Title: Luck or Magic
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Ultrababyfat and Luna, and Dean & Britta band member features five original and five cover songs.

Title: Take All My Loves: Nine Shakespeare Sonnets
Info: The latest release for the pop singer-songwriter is based on Shakespearean sonnets and features guest appearances from such artists as Helena Bonham Carter, Carrie Fisher, Sian Phillips, opera singer Anna Prohaska, William Shatner, Martha Wainwright, and Florence Welch.

Title: The Ruffian's Misfortune
Info: The 16th studio release for the Texas-based singer-songwriter was produced with bassist George Reiff.

Title: Lease Of Life
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Scottish alternative rock trio features guest appearances from Bek Oliva and Cecilia Stamp.

Title: Vibes!
Info: Kanye West executive produces and appears as a guest on the second full-length studio release for the Trinidad-born, Brooklyn-based rapper.

Title: Rock & Roll Time
Info: Co-produced by Steve Bing and Jim Keltner, the latest release from the rock singer known as "The Killer," is backed by a band that includes such artists as Doyle Bramhall II, Jon Brion, Nils Lofgren, Keith Richards, Robbie Robertson, Derek Trucks, Ron Wood, and Neil Young, with guest vocals from Shelby Lynne.

Title: Under Pressure
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Maryland rapper was produced largely by 6ix.

Title: Par Avion
Info: The fourth full-length release for the duo of Liz Wendelbo and Sean McBride was mixed by Chris Coady.

Title: Mutineers
Info: The first release in four years for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Andy Barlow.

Title: III
Info: The third release for the Canadian hip-hop jazz trio of Chester Hansen, Alex Sowinski, and Matthew Tavares was produced by Frank Dukes.

Title: Ledges
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter who previously headed up The Courage was self-produced.

Title: Eve
Info: The first release in four years for the Grammy-winning Beninese singer-songwriter was produced by Patrick Dillett with guest appearances from such artists as ASA, Vampire Weekend's Rostam Batmagli, Dr. John, Yvonne Kidjo, the Kronos Quartet, Trio Teriba, and the Orchestre Philharmonique du Luxembourg.

Title: Oh My Sexy Lord
Info: Justin Vernon guests on the debut full-length studio release for the Minneapolis experimental project that includes Ryan Olson of Gayngs, Stef Alexander of Doomtree, Isaac Gale, Ben Ivascu of Poliça, Mark McGee of To Kill a Petty Bourgeoisie, and Jeremy Nutzman.

Title: Wishbone
Info: The third release for the Danish pop singer Nanna Øland Fabricius was produced by Dave Sitek.

Title: Rhythm & Blues
Info: Produced by Tom Hambridge, the latest release for the multiple Grammy-winning blues musician includes guest appearances from Gary Clark, Jr., Beth Hart, Kid Roc, Joe Perry, Steven Tyler, Keith Urban, and Brad Whitford.

Title: Jungle Revolution
Info: Jungle producer Michael West's first album since 2005's Born Again as Rebel MC includes production from Benny Page, Serial Killaz, and Boyson & Crooks.

Title: Palms
Info: This is the debut release for the art rock band led by the Deftones' Chino Moreno with Isis members Clifford Meyer, Jeff Caxide, and Aaron Harris completing the line-up.

Title: Edgeland
Info: The debut solo album for the Underworld co-founder is less electronic than his partnership with Rick Smith.

Title: If You Leave
Info: The debut full-length release for the London-based trio of Remi Aguilella, Igor Haefeli, and Elena Tonra was produced with Rodhaidh McDonald and Jolyon Vaughan Thomas.

Title: Absolute Zero
Info: The debut full-length release from the Dublin folk rock quintet was produced by Markus Dravs.

Title: In Love
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by Jim Abiss.

Title: Earth Rocker
Info: The tenth studio release for the Maryland-based rock band is a heavier and faster than previous albums.

Title: Mala
Info: The eighth full-length release from the singer-songwriter is his first on Nonesuch and was co-produced with collaborator/guitarist Noah Georgeson.

Title: Go Outside
Info: The third album for the Canadian indie rock band was produced by John Collins.

Title: Traveler
Info: The latest album from the multiple Grammy-winning bluegrass/country artist was produced by Russ Titelman and includes guest appearances by Eric Clapton, Marc Cohn, Keb' Mo, Alison Krauss, Mumford & Sons, and Paul Simon.

Title: Tucson: A Country Rock Opera
Info: The latest album from the Arizona band led by Howe Gelb is a country rock opera about a man's road trip to escape from his hometown of Tuscon.

Title: Big Moon Ritual
Info: The debut album for the music project led by the Black Crowes' Chris Robinson features tracks that are over seven minutes long.

Title: A  Monument
Info: This is the second album from the Portland, Oregon-based band led by Joe Haege and Corrina Repp.

Title: Mountain Echo
Info: The Welsh singer's 1960s-inspired debut album was produced by Bernard Butler.

Title: Carnivale Electricos
Info: The New Orleans ensemble bring the sounds of Mardi Gras and Carnivale to its latest album of funk.

Title: Portico Quartet
Info: The third album for the British jazz band incorporates electronic elements to its sound.

Title: Duets II
Info: This second installment of the legendary singer's Duets pairs him with Aretha Franklin, Norah Jones, Willie Nelson, and the late Amy Winehouse, among many others.

Title: Hell: The Sequel EP
Info: The hip-hop duo from Detroit consists of rappers Royce da 5'9" and Eminem.

Title: Neptune
Info: The third folk album released by the daughter of Martin Carthy and Norma Waterson focuses on the last 10 years of her life.

Title: The Excitement of Maybe
Info: Best known as the lead singer of the punk band X, Exene continues evolving her solo music career and in her latest release brings more rock influences to her folk and country style.

Title: Light Chasers
Info: The experimental band from Minnesota led by Craig Minowa releases its first concept album about space travel, life, death, and babies.

Title: European
Info: The Swedish pop band named after the Serge Gainsbourg's song releases its third album.

Title: Pictures
Info: This is the third album for the British rock band that has been compared to The Who for its 1960's sound.

Title: New Clouds
Info: This is the latest solo album for Portland-based Adam Forkner.

Title: Somewhere Gone
Info: The lead singer of the punk rock band X releases her first solo album on the Bloodshot Records label.

Title: My Way
Info: The latest solo album for the former Stone Roses singer was produced by Dave McCracken.

Title: Folk Songs
Artist: James Yorkston & The Big Eyes Family Players
Info: The Scottish singer-songwriter teams up with a different group of musicians for this folk song collection.

Title: Treasury Library Canada
Info: The second full-length album for the Canadian indie-rock band was produced by Aaron Fisher.

Title: The Point Of It All
