Info: The latest album for the producer/singer from North Carolina features David Banner on the single 'Cool.'

Title: Around The Bend
Info: The country singer returns with his latest album produced by Kyle Lehning.

Title: Free At Last
Info: Freeway's sophomore album features 50 Cent, Jay-Z, Jadakiss, Busta Rhymes, and Scarface as some of his guest artists.

Title: The Pursuit
Info: The latest album for the young jazz artist features both original and cover songs including Cole Porter's "Just One of Those Things," Rihanna's "Don't Stop the Music," Sweeney Todd's "Not While I'm Around."

Title: Coastal Grooves
Info: Former Test Icicles member Dev Hynes releases a solo album of experimental '80s electronica.

Title: Realism
Info: Stephin Merritt's final album in his "no-synth trilogy" was largely inspired by 1960s-70s British folk.

Title: Optimist
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the songwriter and producer who is best known for his work with his sister, Billie Eilish.

Title: Probot
Info: Probot is the all-star metal band founded by Nirvana/Foo Fighters drummer Dave Grohl and fronted by a variety of singers, including King Diamond, Max Cavalera (Sepultura), and Lemmy Kilmister (Motorhead).

Title: Want One
Info: The Canadian singer-songwriter worked with producer Marius deVries (Björk, Massive Attack) for this third LP, which is actually the first half of what was originally planned as a double album ('Want Two' will instead arrive next year).

Title: Love & Life
Info: Mary J. reunites with P. Diddy (who produced her debut 'What's the 411?') for this latest release, which features appearances from 50 Cent, Eve, Jay-Z and Method Man.

Title: Dusty Trails
Info: The band consists of former Luscious Jackson keyboardist Vivian Trimble and Breeders bassist Josephine Wiggs, who previously teamed up on another Lucscious Jackson side project, The Kostars (Wiggs produced their one album).

Title: Tender New Signs
Info: This is the second release for the San Francisco-based duo of Tamaryn and Rex John Shelverton.

Title: Release The Stars
Info: The singer-songwriter self-produced (with the help of Pet Shop Boys' Neil Tennant) this follow-up to 'Want Two.' Richard Thompson guests.

Title: Concrete and Gold
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the rock band led by Dave Grohl was produced with Greg Kurstin.

Title: Tears, Lies, And Alibis
Info: This is the first album on the Virginia-born singer-songwriter’s own label, Everso Records.

Title: Mantaray
Info: Siouxsie Sioux of the rock band Siouxsie & the Banshees and The Creatures releases her debut solo album.

Title: Congratulations
Info: Pete Kember produced the second album with the rock band led by Andrew VanWyngarden and Ben Goldwasser, which also includes three members from the touring live band.

Title: Autodrama
Info: The second full-length release for the electro-pop sister duo of Piper and Skylar Kaplanwas produced with Sam Mehran.

Title: Leaving Eden
Info: The follow-up to their 2010 Grammy-winning debut album was produced by Buddy Miller.

Title: Jessica Rabbit
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn duo of Alexis Krauss and Derek Miller was self-produced.

Title: BlackenedWhite
Info: The duo that comprises Odd Future members Hodgy Beats and Left Brain releases its second studio album on Fat Possum.

Title: Sea of Brass
Info: The British indie rock band recorded new versions of some of their songs with a full brass orchestra.

Title: Hometowns
Info: Orginally self-released in early 2008, Saddle Creek re-releases the debut full-length album for the Canadian indie rock band.

Title: De La Soul's Plug 1 & Plug 2 Present...First Serve
Info: De La Soul's Plug 1 (Dave) and Plug 2 (Posdnous) with French producers Chokolate and Khalid release a concept album that follows the rise to fame of a fictional rap group.

Title: Terroir Blues
Info: This is the second solo LP from the co-founder of such legendary alt-country bands as Uncle Tupelo and Son Volt.

Title: Lindsey Buckingham/Christine McVie
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Fleetwood Mac's Lindsey Buckingham and Christine McVie features contributions from Mick Fleetwood and John McVie.

Title: Fain
Info: The second full-length studio release for the British folk rock band led by Jack Sharp features guest appearances from Olivia Chaney, Rachel Davies, Nic Kearey, and Jace Lasek.

Title: No Line On The Horizon
Info: The 12th studio album for the Irish rock band was produced with Brian Eno, Daniel Lanois, and Steve Lillywhite.

Title: Nothing's Gonna Change the Way You Feel About Me Now
Info: Skylar Wilson helped coproduce Justin Townes Earle's Memphis soul-influenced fifth album.

Title: Working On A Dream
Artist: Bruce Springsteen & The E Street Band
Info: Springsteen's latest solo album is the fourth time he has worked with producer Brendan O'Brien.

Title: Olympia
Info: What began as a Roxy Music reunion album turned into Ferry's first album of new material in eight years and features contributions from original Roxy Music members like Brian Eno and Phil Manzanera.

Title: Cosmic Logic
Info: The second release for the Los Angeles-based indie husband-and-wife duo was produced with Matt Thornley.

Title: Big Echo
Info: The indie rock trio from Berkeley, California,  releases its first album on Rough Trade, which was produced by band member Chris Chu and Grizzly Bear's Chris Taylor.

Title: Snow Globe
Info: The latest release for the synthpop duo is a holiday album featuring four originals and classic Christmas songs.

Title: The Recession
Info: The latest album for the Atlanta-born rapper includes guest appearances by Nas and Kanye West.

Title: Thank You for Stickin' with Twig
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian producer includes contributions from Michael Rault and Slim Twig's wife, Meg Remy of U.S. Girls.

Title: Clear Shot
Info: The third full-length release for the British alternative rock band was recorded in 12 days with producer David Wrench.

Title: Something Dirty
Info: The latest album for the krautrock pioneers features a new lineup with James Johnston and Geraldine Swayne joining original members Jean-Herve Peron and drummer Zappi Diermaier.

Title: Forgiveness
Info: The fourth full-length release for Los Angeles indie pop duo Girlpool was produced by Yves Rothman.

Title: I Want to Grow Up
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles pop-punk artist was produced by JEFF the Brotherhood's Jake Orrall.

Title: Sucre du Sauvage
Info: Roberto Carlos Lange's second solo electronic album was written while he was staying at an isolated cabin in Connecticut.

Title: What For?
Info: The fourth full-length release from Chaz Bundick features contributions from Julian Lynch and Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Ruban Nielson.

Title: Home Again
Info: The British soul singer's debut full-length album was produced by Paul Butler.

Title: The Flaming Lips and Heady Fwends
Info: The latest album from The Flaming Lips was originally released on Record Store Day and it includes collaborations with Erykah Badu, Biz Markie, Bon Iver, Nick Cave, Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros, Jim James of My Morning Jacket, Ke$ha, Chris Martin of Coldplay, Neon Indian, New Fumes, Yoko Ono, Prefuse 73, and Tame Impala.

Title: Carnival Ride
Info: The "American Idol" winner returns with her follow-up to her multiaward winning debut.

Title: Christ Illusion
Info: This is the first studio output for the original lineup of the metal band since 1990's Seasons In The Abyss.

Title: Fab Four Suture
Info: All 12 songs on the band's first album in two years have been released as singles.

Title: I Disagree
Info: The third full-length release for the artist first discovered on YouTube is the first on the Sumerian Records label.

Title: The Other Side of Make-Believe
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the New York rock band Interpol was produced by Flood and Alan Moulder.

Title: Time Bend And Break The Bower
Info: The debut full-length release for Irish post-punk poet Sinead O'Brien was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Hot Mess
Info: The third album for the rock band features Gossip Girl’s Leighton Meester on one track.

Title: Chemical Chords
Info: Tim Gane and company release their latest album, mixed by Joe Watson.

Title: Soviet Kitsch
Info: The Russian-born singer/pianist makes her major-label debut with this disc produced by Gordon Raphael (The Strokes).

Title: Feathers
Info: This is the fourth studio disc for the Washington D.C. psych-rock outfit, who are now a four-piece with the addition of guitarist Cory Shane.

Title: Purple Haze
Info: Kanye West and Twista guest on the rapper's fourth disc.

Title: Power
Info: This is the third Dischord release for the Washington, D.C. rockers, who are frequently mentioned next to hyphenated labels such as "post-punk" and "dance-punk."

Title: In The World Of Him
Info: On this solo outing, the Mekons singer tackles a range of material written by male artists, including songs by Ryan Adams, Mark Eitzel and bandmate Jon Langford.

Title: Love Is Here
Info: This is the much-heralded debut album from the English foursome, produced by Steve Osbourne.

Title: M!ssundaztood
Info: Fresh off her hit "Lady Marmalade" remake from the "Moulin Rouge" soundtrack, the pop diva returns with her second album. Former 4 Non Blonde member Linda Perry produced and wrote most of the tracks.

Title: Shangri-La Dee Da
Info: Grunge is long-gone, but somehow STP have survived. This is the fifth album for these long-time favorites of alternative radio.

Title: Pixel Revolt
Info: Vanderslice continues his album-a-year pace (despite also serving as a producer on numerous indie-rock albums) with this typically literate and well-produced fifth disc, which was recorded with the help of The Mountain Goats' John Darnielle.

Title: Viva La Vida
Info: The fourth album for the English band was produced by Brian Eno and Markus Dravs.

Title: Bespoke
Info: The latest full-length release from the Los Angeles experimental producer and remixer of electronic music.

Title: The World Is Just a Shape to Fill the Night
Info: Jesse Lortz recorded this album in Washington state with his friends in a secluded cabin.

Title: The Incident
Info: The latest album for the rock band led by Steven Wilson features a 55-minute piece (broken up into 14 tracks).

Title: Romanian Names
Info: The singer-songwriter releases his first album on the Dead Oceans label after leaving Barsuk.

Title: Occult Architecture, Vol. 1
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Oregon psychedelic duo explores the dark side on this first of a two-part concept that explores dark and light/ying and yang energies.

Title: Silver Wilkinson
Info: The seventh release from Stephen Wilkinson as Bibio sees the British producer going back to more ambient and folk style of his earlier albums.

Title: Spirit If...
Info: Broken Social Scene's singer goes solo in what will be a series of albums featuring each member of the band plus a few guests.

Title: The  Way Things Fall
Info: Detroit's Adam Miller and Nicola Kuperus return with their first release since 2007's Why Bother?.

Title: Strange Negotiations
Info: The Seattle-based indie singer-songwriter and former lead singer of Pedro the Lion, releases his second solo album.

Title: Freedom Wind
Info: The six-piece band from South Carolina releases its debut album on the Dead Oceans label.

Title: The Meanest Of Times
Info: The sixth album for the Celtic punk band finds them on a new label.

Title: Working Out
Info: This is the self-produced debut release for the British quartet formed by Orlando Leopard and Elliot Barnes.

Title: Rise Ye Sunken Ships
Info: After the band Pela ended, singer Billy McCarthy and bassist Eric Sanderson, along with new drummer Rob Allen, formed We Are Augustines. The death of Billy McCarthy's brother had a great influence on the songs on the debut album produced by Dave Newfield.

Title: Our Ill Wills
Info: The Swedish band releases its second album, produced by fellow Swede Björn Yttling of Peter Bjorn and John.

Title: Parachutes
Info: The debut album from the London quartet earned the band a Mercury Music Prize nomination and frequent comparisons to Jeff Buckley and Travis.

Title: Celebrants
Info: The first full-length studio release since 2014's A Dotted Line from bluegrass trio Nickel Creek was produced, recorded and mixed by Eric Valentine.

Title: Hiperasia
Info: The third full-length release for the Spanish producer Pablo Diaz-Reixa was inspired by the Hiperasia chain of Chinese bazaars in Madrid.

Title: Chambers
Info: The latest release from the Canadian artist is a suite of chamber music with a string and piano quartet.

Title: Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded--the Re-Up
Info: The pop rapper reissues her second release with eight new tracks featuring guest appearances by Thomas Brinx, Cassie, Ciara, Lil Wayne, Parker, and Tyga.

Title: Death By Sexy
Info: An early candidate for Album Title of the Year, 'Sexy' marks the second outing for Josh Homme's rockin' side project.

Title: Family Crimes
Info: The seventh release for the California psych-pop duo of Glenn Donaldson and Donovan Quinn was recorded by Jason Quever of Papercuts.

Title: This Is Alphabeat
Info: The Danish six-piece pop group releases its debut album.

Title: All Days Are Nights: Songs For Lulu
Info: The sixth album for the singer-songwriter has a more stripped-down feel with Rufus' voice and piano as the focus plus three tracks based on Shakespeare's sonnets and an aria from the opera he wrote.

Title: The  Lights from the Chemical Plant
Info: The third full-length release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter was produced by Jacquire King.

Title: Heart Of My Own
Info: The second album for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Howard Bilerman.

Title: Fate
Info: This is the fifth album for the indie-rock band from Philadelphia.

Title: Halloween [Original 2018 Motion Picture Soundtrack]
Info: The soundtrack to the 2018 installment of the Halloween franchise directed by David Gordon Green.

Title: Love in the Future
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the R&B/soul singer features guest appearances from Rick Ross and Stacy Barthe as well as production from Kanye West and Dave Tozer.

Title: How To Walk Away
Info: The 10th solo album for the artist was produced by Andy Chase and features Richard Butler, Matthew Caws, Jody Porter, and Tracy Bonham as guests.

Title: Man Mountain
Info: Greek-born Londoner Andy Dragazis returns with his second album of chill-out electronica.

Title: Don't Be Afraid Of Love
Info: This is the second studio release for the London-based electronica/rock/funk band. Vocals are handled by a group of guests, including Bootsy Collins and Lisa Millet, following the departure of the group's vocalist Wrekked Train.

Title: Come With Us
Info: The fourth full-length for production duo Tom Rowlands and Ed Simons features the singles "Star Guitar" and "It Began In Afrika." Guest vocalists include long-time Chemical Brothers staple Beth Orton and Richard Ashcroft.

Title: We Love The City
Info: The third album from the London-based indie outfit.

Title: The Evens
Info: This eponymous disc is the debut for the Washington D.C. duo of Dischord Records/Fugazi head Ian MacKaye and drummer Amy Farina (The Warmers).

Title: Information Retrieved
Info: This is the fifth full-length studio release for the San Diego indie rock band led by Zach Smith and Rob Crow.

Title: Goblin
Info: XL Recordings signed the founding member of the hip-hop group Odd Future Wolf Gang Kill Them All for a one-album deal to release his second solo effort.

Title: Girls And Weather
Info: The debut album for the English quartet was produced by Tony Hoffer.

Title: Axxa/Abraxas
Info: The debut solo studio full-length release for Georgia-based Ben Asbury was produced by Jarvis Taveniere.

Title: Artificial Fire
Info: The seventh full-length album from the Los Angeles singer/songwriter.

Title: Doom Days
Info: The third full-length release for the British indie pop band was produced with Mark Crew and Dan Priddy.

Title: Taste
Info: One of two albums [the other is "Should I Remain Here At Sea"] released on the same day for the indie rock band, the seventh full-length release features more electronic music influences.

Title: Adrian Younge Presents: Twelve Reasons to Die II
Info: The sequel to the rapper's 2013 concept album about the DeLuca crime family is set in 1970s New York City with guest appearances from Bilal, Chino XL, Lyrics Born, Raekwon and RZA, Scarub, and Vince Staples.

Title: Showroom of Compassion
Info: After a seven-year hiatus, the Sacramento band's long-awaited album mixes alt-country sounds of steel guitars with their trademark bass-and-horn combination to create their sixth playful pop/rock record.

Title: Elephants...Teeth Sinking Into Heart
Info: The 2-CD set for the singer/songwriter was produced by Mike Mogis and John Alagia.

Title: Fantasy
Info: The first full-length studio release in seven years from French electronic band M83 was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.

Title: Worship the Sun
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles rock band was produced by Nick Waterhouse.

Title: Frankie Rose and the Outs
Info: Frankie Rose, who previously was in several up-and-coming indie rock bands, such as Vivian Girls, Dum Dum Girls, and Crystal Stilts, returns with the debut album for her own band.

Title: Let's Be Still
Info: The second full-length release for the Seattle folk rock group was produced with Shawn Simmons and mixed by Peter Katis.

Title: The Documentary
Info: The west coast rapper's debut boasts an all-star production and guest roster including the likes of Eminem, Timbaland, Kanye West, Just Blaze, Busta Rhymes, Dr. Dre and 50 Cent.

Title: King's Disease
Info: the 13th full-length solo release for the rapper features guest appearances from  Anderson Paak, ASAP Ferg, AZ, Big Sean, Brucie B, Cormega, Dr. Dre, The Firm, Fivio Foreign, Foxy Brown, Hit-Boy, Lil Durk, Don Toliver, and Charlie Wilson.

Title: Is This the Life We Really Want?
Info: The first solo rock release for the Pink Floyd co-founder in 25 years was produced by Nigel Godrich.

Title: God Don't Never Change: The Songs of Blind Willie Johnson
Info: The tribute album to blues singer Blind Willie Johnson features such artists as the Blind Boys of Alabama, Rickie Lee Jones and the Cowboy Junkies, Maria McKee, Sinead O’Connor, Derek Trucks & Susan Tedeschi, Tom Waits, and Lucinda Williams.

Title: Alias
Info: This is the fourth studio release for the British band formed by two pairs of siblings.

Title: The  End of Silence
Info: The three-track suite was created using a 10-second audio sample of a bomb falling in Libya recorded by war photographer Sebastian Meyer in 2011.

Title: God of the Serengeti
Info: The second solo release for the Italian-American rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Immortal Technique, Kool G Rap, Mobb Deep, and Scarface.

Title: Passive Me Aggressive You
Info: The New Zealand indie electronic band's debut album opened at number one on the New Zealand album chart.

Title: Just Like You
Info: The follow-up to her 2005 debut album, "The Way It Is."

Title: Grand Animals
Info: The New York indie band releases its sophomore album.

Title: Visitations
Info: Gareth Jones produced this fourth album for the distinctive Liverpool band.

Title: Back To Land
Info: The sixth full-length release for the San Francisco psychedelic rock band was written in Oregon by Ripley Johnson and Omar Ahsanuddin.

Title: Planetarium
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Sufjan Stevens, Nico Muhly, Bryce Dessner, and James McAlister is a song-cycle about the solar system which was originally commissioned by Dutch concert hall Muziekgebouw Eindhoven.

Title: Noise
Info: The latest release for the Japanese experimental metal band includes influences from doom, psychedelic, punk, shoegaze, and sludge-rock music.

Title: Palindrome Hunches
Info: The third solo album for Mojave 3 singer was produced by Nick Holton and features members of Wallingford’s Band of Hope.

Title: Personal Life
Info: Portland's indie-punk trio's fifth album is full of fist-pumping rock anthems about relationships and regret.

Title: Violent Hearts
Info: The debut album for the Canadian indie-pop trio was influenced by music from the 1950s and '60s.

Title: Vicious Lies and Dangerous Rumors
Info: The second solo release for the OutKast rapper features guest appearances from such artists as A$AP Rocky, B.o.B, Kid Cudi, Killer Mike, Little Dragon, Ludacris, Phantogram, Kelly Rowland, T.I., and Wavves.

Title: Sun Piano
Info: The latest release for the New York-based new age artist features the piano and was recorded at a Brooklyn church.

Title: Departed Glories
Info: The 12th full-length release for the Norwegian ambient Geir Jenssen is his first in five years.

Title: Family Perfume, Vol. 1
Info: The first volume of a planned two album release is the third full-length release for Tim Presley.

Title: Many Colored Kite
Info: The second solo album for The Jayhawks' Mark Olson was produced by Beau Raymond.

Title: Pink Graffiti
Info: Brian Wilson and the Beach Boys are influences on the debut album for the trio from North Dakota, who started out as a duo named White Foliage.

Title: The Solution
Info: Philadelphia rapper Beanie Sigel releases his fourth album, featuring R. Kelly, Styles P, Jay-Z, Ghostface Killah, and Scarface.
The third full-length release for the band that includes Portishead's Geoff Barrow, Billy Fuller and Will Young.

Title: Saturday Night
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Ought frontman was produced by Ross Gillard and Amy Fort.

Title: You Got Me Singing
Info: The covers album from Amanda Palmer and her father Jack was produced with  Joe Costa.

Title: Okemah And The Melody Of Riot
Info: Jay Farrar has revived his post-Uncle Tupelo outfit Son Volt for their first album in seven years.

Title: Wet From Birth
Info: Mike Mogis produced this fourth album for the dance-inducing Nebraska indie rockers. Azure Ray's Orenda Fink and Maria Taylor add vocals on several tracks.

Title: She Loves You
Info: The third disc for the Twilight Singers, the side project for the Afghan Whigs' Greg Dulli, is a covers album, tackling such interesting, diverse subject matter as Bjork's "Hyperballad," John Coltrane's "A Love Supreme," and Marvin Gaye's "Please Stay (Once You Go Away)."

Title: Young Miss America
Info: Better known to the indie-rock crowd than the hip-hop community (perhaps because in his former life, he was a white, balding computer programmer), San Francisco-based Topher Lafata (aka Gold Chains) follows a series of well-received EPs and singles with this full-length debut.

Title: Baby I'm Bored
Info: The singer/songwriter/guitarist returns to the studio for the first time since 1996, when he recorded his final album as leader of the Lemonheads. Here, he's joined by Jon Brion on four tracks, as well as members of Giant Sand, Calexico, and Spacehog.

Title: Log 22
Info: The Amsterdam-based rockers who gave us college-radio hit albums 'Palomine' and 'Lamprey' return with their fifth LP.

Title: Come Here When You Sleepwalk
Info: The debut album from Adelaide, Australia's Mark Mitchell (who records as Clue To Kalo) is a mix of indie rock and electronica, drawing comparisons to everyone from Badly Drawn Boy to Dntel.

Title: Kinky
Info: Kinky is a five-piece band from Monterrey, Mexico that combines rock, electronica, and traditional Latin music. This debut album was produced by Chris Allison (Coldplay, Beta Band).

Title: From The Desk Of Mr. Lady [EP]
Info: Le Tigre features Kathleen Hanna of Bikini Kill. This seven-track EP follows the band's 1999 self-titled debut album.

Title: A Brief History Of Love
Info: The British duo's debut full-length album was mixed by Rich Costey.

Title: Born On Flag Day
Info: The second album for the rock band led by John J. McCauley III, now includes three new members.

Title: The Law Of Large Numbers
Info: The former Delgado singer releases her second solo album and has her former band member Paul Savage producing it.

Title: Until the Tide Creeps In
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie pop band led by brother-and-sister Jack and Lily Wolter was produced by Dave Izumi.

Title: Palaces
Info: The third full-length studio release for Australian electronic producer Flume features guest appearances from Damon Albarn, Kucka, Laurel, Emma Louise, Virgen Maria, May-A, Oklou, and Caroline Polachek.

Title: QTY
Info: The debut full-length release for the New York City indie rock band led by Dan Lardner and Alex Niemetz was produced by Suede's Bernard Butler.

Title: Take Control
Info: The second full-length release for the British punk duo was produced by the Beastie Boys' Michael "Mike D" Diamond (who also guests on one track).

Title: Miike Snow
Info: Andrew Wyatt teamed up with Swedish producers Chris Karlsson and Pontus Winnberg (best known for their Grammy-winning work on Britney Spears' "Toxic") to form the new group.

Title: Phrazes For The Young
Info: This is the solo debut for the Strokes lead singer.

Title: Jim
Info: This is the third studio album for the English artist now based in Germany.

Title: Cursing the Sea
Info: The debut full-length release for the all-female noise-pop quintet from Dublin includes four singles from its previously released EPs.

Title: Luminous Night
Info: Ben Chasny returns to his solo project to release his 11th studio album.

Title: I'm Having Fun Now
Info: The real-life musician couple's debut album combines classic-rock textures with more pop-oriented love songs.

Title: Clapton
Info: At 65, the British blues-rock guitarist returns with a new album that rediscovers and reinvents classic jams, including songs by noted composers such as Irving Berlin and Fats Waller.

Title: We Know About The Need
Info: 'Need' marks the solo debut for Chris Adams of the Leeds, England band Hood.

Title: Heligoland
Info: The legendary trip-hop trip, Massive Attack releases its fifth studio album Heligoland featuring an all star cast of guest vocals from Damon Albarn, Hope Sandoval, Martina Topley-Bird, Guy Garvey and Tunde Adebimpe. The duo also collaborated with DFA's Tim Goldsworthy on selected tracks.

Title: Yours To Keep
Info: This is the first solo album for the guitarist for The Strokes, whose father was also a successful singer-songwriter. Guests include Sean Lennon and Ben Kweller.

Title: The  Carpenter
Info: Rick Rubin returns to produce the seventh studio release for the indie folk-pop band.

Title: Stories Don't End
Info: The third studio release for the folk-inspired rock band led by Taylor Goldsmith was produced by Jacquire King.

Title: Sport
Info: The debut full-length release for the British electronic producer features vocals from HTRK's Jonnine Standish (although credited as Frankie and Jonny) Dale Cornish, and Loke Rahbek.

Title: Swimming
Info: The quartet from New York mixed and produced its own sophomore album.

Title: Burn The Maps
Info: This is the first studio disc in four years for the Irish quartet, who are massively popular in their native country.

Title: Normal Happiness
Info: Many of the songs on the former Guided By Voices leader's second solo set of the year originated in tracks recorded for the soundtrack to the Steven Soderbergh film "Bubble."

Title: All That Must Be
Info: The second full-length release for the British electronic producer features guest appearances from Lil Silva, Hudson Scott, Tracey Thorn.

Title: Release Me
Info: The second album for the Mark Ronson-produced quartet goes for a 1960's sound.

Title: Jukebox
Info: Chan Marshall releases her second covers album.

Title: Hopeless Romantic
Info: The third full-length major studio release for the pop singer-songwriter was produced by Patrick Carney.

Title: In Our Nature
Info: Known for his appearance on Zero 7's album, he releases the follow-up to his debut.

Title: Spells
Info: The now New York-based psych-rock five-piece worked with producer Bill Racine on this fourth album.

Title: Inventions
Info: This is the debut release for the collaboration between Matthew Cooper of Eluvium and Mark T. Smith of Explosions In The Sky.

Title: James Pants
Info: The third album for the Washington-state native features a variety of influences, ranging from 1950's songs to the TV series Twin Peaks.

Title: Colors
Info: The 13th full-length release for the pop singer-songwriter was recorded with Greg Kurstin between 2013 and 2017.

Title: This Is Eggland
Info: The fifth full-length release for British psychedelic punk duo of Holly Ross and David Blackwell was produced by Dave Fridmann.

Title: Do Easy
Info: The third full-length release for the Canadian band formed by twin sisters Sari and Romy Lightman features contributions from Blue Hawaii's Alex Cowan, Ryan Driver, Simone Schmidt and Brodie West.

Title: Valley Tangents
Info: The latest release from the duo of Russ Waterhouse and Lea Cho is their first on the Drag City label.

Title: Shine A Light
Info: The live soundtrack to Martin Scorsese's documentary of the Rolling Stones' concerts at New York's Beacon Theater.

Title: Island Intervals
Info: Joel Thibodeau worked with Alex Somers and Jónsi on his third release as Death Vessel.

Title: Volcano
Info: The second full-length release for the British psychedelic pop band was self-produced.

Title: My Dark Places
Info: This is the first album in 11 years for the English band led by the troubled Dan Treacy.

Title: Black Rebel Motorcycle Club
Info: The major-label debut from the British-influenced rockers from Los Angeles.

Title: Pissing Stars
Info: The second full-length solo release for the Canadian artist who co-founded Godspeed You! Black Emperor and Thee Silver Mt. Zion is said to be inspired by the short relationship between TV host Mary Hart and Saudi arms dealer Mohammed Khashoggi.

Title: Dark Sky Paradise
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Jhené Aiko, Chris Brown, Drake, E-40, Ariana Grande, John Legend,  Lil Wayne, PARTYNEXTDOOR, Ty Dolla Sign, and Kanye West.

Title: Diploid Love
Info: Produced with Alain Johannes, the debut solo release for the former frontwoman of The Distillers and Spinnerette features guest appearances from Warpaint's Emily Kokal, Garbage's Shirley Manson, Queens of the Stone Age's Michael Shuman, and The Strokes' Nick Valensi.

Title: Dizzy Heights
Info: The Crowded House co-founder worked with Dave Fridmann on his first solo work since 2001's One Nil.

Title: Where the Heaven Are We
Info: The full-length debut release for the British indie rock quartet was produced by Charlie Hugall.

Title: Cyclops Reap
Info: Tim Presley's fifth solo release as White Fence continues his psychedelic 1960s-inspired sound.

Title: Home
Info: The second full-length solo release for Jason Chung as Nosaj Thing features Blonde Redhead's Kazu Makino and Chaz Bundick of Toro y Moi as guest vocalists.

Title: Skins
Info: The first album in four years for the Boston rock band is its first on its own label, Scrawny Records.

Title: Travellers In Space And Time
Info: The indie rock band led by Elephant 6 label co-founder Robert Schneider releases its seventh studio album.

Title: Fornever
Info: The rapper teams up with the producer for their fourth album together, which features Kurupt, Verbs, 9thmatic, Suga Free, Sick Jacken, and Uncle Chucc as guest performers.

Title: Several Arrows Later
Info: This is the fifth album for the O.C.-endorsed band.

Title: Straight Outta Ca$hville
Info: 'Cashville' is the solo debut for the G-Unit member (who in real life is Nashville, Tenn. native David Brown). Production on the disc is handled by Dr. Dre, Eminem, and Lil' Jon, with 50 Cent and Lloyd Banks also making appearances.

Title: So Much For The City
Info: Hailing from Dublin, Ireland, The Thrills incorporate the sounds of California rock from the 1960s and 70s (the Byrds, Beach Boys) as well as a bit of Beatles thrown in for good measure on this debut album, already a hit in the UK (and a nominee for the Mercury Music Prize).

Title: Heroes & Villains
Info: The Los Angeles- (no, not Bay Area-) based alt-rock band led by singer-songwriter James Grundler returns with a Rick Rubin-produced sophomore LP.

Title: Holy Wood (In the Shadow of the Valley of Death)
The Courage Of Others
Info: Released on Bella Union Records, The Courage Of Others is Midlake's third full-length album.

Title: American Beauty/American Psycho
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Chicago pop-punk band is its second since returning from its five year hiatus in 2013.

Title: Zeros
Info: This is the second full-length release for the San Francisco band led by Luis Vasquez.

Title: Coconut
Info: Four years since its sophomore release, the British band worked with producer Tim Goldsworthy on its third album.

Title: Attention Please
Info: The Japanese experimental band release their 17th studio album on the same day as their other latest album, Heavy Rocks.

Title: Idlewild
Info: The mega-stars follow 'Speakerboxxx/The Love Below' with their own 'Purple Rain,' a sure-to-be-huge (and definitely all over the musical map) soundtrack to their movie musical of the same name.

Title: The  Errant Charm
Info: The San Francisco folk band release their fifth full-length album.

Title: Vows
Info: Jazz influences the debut full-length pop album from the New Zealand singer, who was featured in Gotye's single "Someone I Used To Know." It includes six new songs in addition to the tracks that appeared on the Australia/New Zealand release.

Title: Small Craft On A Milk Sea
Info: After five long years, Brian Eno finally releases his first solo album since Another Day on Earth and continues to take a more ambient musical approach, collaborating with Leo Abrahams and Jon Hopkins.

Title: Good Girl Gone Bad
Info: The singer collaborated with Timbaland, Justin Timberlake and Ne-Yo for her third album.

Title: Born Under Saturn
Info: The London-based Scottish quartet's follow-up to its Mercury-nominated debut release was recorded in a professional studio.

Title: Beak>
Info: The debut album for the trio from Bristol was written in 12 days.

Title: The Resistance
Info: The fifth album for the English rock trio was produced entirely by the band.

Title: Black Cherry
Info: This sophomore LP from the UK duo of vocalist Allison Goldfrapp and multi-instrumentalist Will Gregory follows their acclaimed 2000 debut, 'Felt Mountain.'

Title: Metallic Spheres
Info: Pink Floyd's David Gilmour joins the electronic duo on this album that includes two 20-minute-plus tracks.

Title: These Four Walls
Info: The debut album for the Scottish indie-rock quartet.

Title: Tomorrow's Modern Boxes
Info: The latest solo album from the Radiohead frontman was a surprise Friday release through BitTorrent.

Title: Lupercalia
Info: The British singer-songwriter's latest album was supposed to be a part of a double album titled Battle. It was later announced that it would be split into two releases, 2009's The Conqueror and this release.

Title: Dying Surfer Meets His Maker
Info: The third full-length release for the Nashville psychedelic rock band was recorded in six days.

Title: Sumie
Info: The full-length debut for the Gothenburg-based singer (her sister Yukimi is in Little Dragon) was produced by Dustin O'Halloran.

Title: 'Til Your River Runs Dry
Info: The first release of new solo material since 2004's My Secret Life for the British singer-songwriter was co-produced with Tony Barnacle.

Title: Prisoner
Info: The debut full-length release for the Australian indie pop group was produced by Lachlan Mitchell and won the 2011 Australian Music Prize.

Title: Take the High Road
Info: The multiple Grammy-winning group's latest album combines gospel with country and is produced with Jamey Johnson. It features such guest singers as Vince Gill, Willie Nelson, the Oak Ridge Boys, Hank Williams, Jr., and Lee Ann Womack.

Title: Reservoir
Info: Peter Katis produced the debut album for the Simon Balthazar-led band.

Title: The Majestic Silver Strings
Info: Buddy Miller and guitarists Bill Frisell, Marc Ribot, and Greg Leisz come together to sing classic country songs and a few originals. Julie Miller, Shawn Colvin, Emmylou Harris, Lee Ann Womack, and Ann McCrary are some of the guests on the album.

Title: Tickets to My Downfall
Info: The rapper turns toward pop-punk on his fifth full-length release executive produced by Travis Barker and featuring guest appearances from Blackbear, Iann Dior, Halsey, and Trippie Redd.

Title: Unknown Rooms: A Collection Of Acoustic Songs
Info: The debut acoustic folk release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Ben Chisholm.

Title: Absolution
Info: A commercial and critical success in the UK upon its release in the fall of 2003, 'Absolution' marks the third album for the English rockers (who frequently draw comparisons to Radiohead--but then again, who doesn't?). It also marks their first time working with producer Rich Costey.

Title: Music By Cavelight
Info: This instrumental hip-hop disc marks the solo debut by the longtime producer for Aesop Rock and other Def Jux artists.

Title: Promise Of Love
Info: The Austin, Texas-based drone-pop qunitet--known to friends and reviewers as AmAnSet--returns with their fifth LP.

Title: Anxiety Always
Info: The Detroit-based electronica duo of Nicola Kuperus and Adam Lee Miller (who also run the Ersatz Audio label) have gained a great deal of acclaim for their early singles and work with other artists. Here, on their full-length debut, they offer 10 brand-new tracks. (Yes, the period at the end of their name is necessary.)

Title: Miss Fortune
Info: This is the critically-acclaimed Alabama singer's third album, and first for her new label Universal South.

Title: Gutterflower
Info: Believe it or not, these guys have been around for over 15 years now, and this is their eighth release (and first since 1998's 'Dizzy Up The Girl').

Title: All This Sounds Gas
Info: This is the solo debut for founding Pavement guitarist Scott Kannberg (aka "Spiral Stairs"). As Preston School of Industry, Spiral is joined by Andrew Borger on drums and Jon Erickson on bass, with other musicians guesting.

Title: Too True
Info: The third full-length release for the indie pop band led by Dee Dee Penny was produced by Richard Gottehrer and Sune Rose Wagner of the Raveonettes.

Title: Natural History
Info: The second full-length release for the Baltimore rock band was produced by J Robbins of The Office of Future Plans.

Title: Lifer
Info: The third full-length release for the Baltimore-based noise rock band led by Andrew Laumann was produced by Travis Harrison.

Title: Disc-Overy
Info: The London rapper makes his debut of hip-hop and pop jams.

Title: Lust Lust Lust
Info: The Danish duo's latest album features a 3D cover.

Title: Picture You
Info: The third studio release for the Swedish five-piece band was recorded in three days.

Title: Bosnian Rainbows
Info: Produced by Johann Scheerer, Mars Volta's Omar Rodríguez-Lopez forms a new group with Mars Volta drummer Deantoni Parks, Teri Gender Bender of Le Butcherettes, and Nicci Kasper.

Title: Washington Square Serenade
Info: Steve Earle's latest album features his wife Allison Moorer, as well as the Brazilian group Forro in the Dark.

Title: False Idols
Info: The 10th studio release for the British trip-hop artist features guest appearances by Francesca Belmonte, Nneka, Fifi Rong, and  Antlers' Peter Silberman.

Title: Jungle
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British indie funk band formed by Tom McFarland and Joshua Lloyd-Watson.

Title: One for the Ghost
Info: The latest solo release for the British artist features contributions from James Hoare, Franic Rozycki, Jonny Helm and Pam Berry.

Title: Ex
Info: The first Plastikman release from Richie Hawtin since 2003 was created for the Guggenheim's International Gala.

Title: Luck
Info: The third full-length release for the British dance-rock artist was self-produced.

Title: Jimmy's Show
Info: This is the third full-length psychedelic pop release for Mancunian Alan Roberts as Jim Noir.

Title: The Gate
Info: Kurt Elling's latest album of jazz and classic rock was produced by Don Was.

Title: Night Work
Info: The third album for the dance quartet was inspired from a night at a Berlin club and was produced with Stuart Price.

Title: Aporia
Info: The collaboration between Sufjan Stevens and Lowell Brams was recorded over several years and features contributions from such artists as the Shins' Yuuki Matthews, the National's James McAllister and Sunn O)))'s Steve Moore.

Title: You Are The Quarry
Info: Morrissey's first studio release since 1997 (and seventh overall) was recorded in Los Angeles with producer Jerry Finn (Blink-182, Green Day) and longtime collaborators Alain Whyte and Boz Boorer.

Title: The Marshall Mathers LP 2
Info: Executive produced by Dr. Dre & Rick Rubin, the eight studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Skylar Grey, Kendrick Lamar, Rihanna, and Nate Ruess of fun.

Title: Every Now & Then
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian psychedelic rock trio features contributions from Stella Mozgawa of Warpaint, Ewan Pearson and producer James Ford.

Title: Wysing Forest
Info: The second release for the British producer was recorded in part live over a six week period.

Title: It's Never Been Like That
Info: This is the third studio album for the French synth-rock band.

Title: Omnium Gatherum
Info: The 20th full-length studio release for Australian psychedelic rock band King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard was produced by Stu Mackenzie.

Title: And Never Ending Nights
Info: Alex Willner's debut album for his solo project, Loops of Your Heart, features synth-based electronic music.

Title: Crownsdown
Info: The rap duo releases their first studio album in seven years.

Title: Sol-Angel And The Hadley St. Dreams
Info: The sophomore album for the younger sister of Beyonce Knowles.

Title: Saturday Night Wrist
Info: Bob Erzin (Jane's Addiction) produced the alt-metal band's fifth album. System Of A Down vocalist Serj Tankian guests.

Title: BBF Hosted By DJ Escrow
Info: The debut release for the Dean Blunt project features guest appearances from Arca and Micachu.

Title: Imitations
Info: The latest solo album fpr the alternative rock singer-songwriter features covers of songs sung by such artists as Nick Cave, Bobby Darin, Hall & Oates, Frank Sinatra, Nancy Sinatra, and Andy Williams.

Title: In Rolling Waves
Info: The second full-length release for the New Zealand alternative rock five-piece was produced with Justin Meldal-Johnsen and mixed by Alan Moulder.

Title: Tribute to 2
Info: The second covers release for the singer-songwriter features songs by such artist as The Beach Boys, Irving Berlin, Bob Dylan, Emerson, Lake & Palmer, Willie Nelson, and Sonny & Cher.

Title: The  Thrill of It All
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Grammy-winning British singer-songwriter features production from Emile Haynie, Tyler Johnson, Malay, Jimmy Napes, Stargate, and Timbaland.

Title: A Thousand Shark's Teeth
Info: The sophomore album for New York-based singer, Shara Worden.

Title: All That Emotion
Info: The latest full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by The National's Aaron Dessner.

Title: Sweating the Plague
Info: The third-full-length release in 2019 for the prolific band led by  Robert Pollard.

Title: Always Ascending
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Scottish indie rock band band was produced by Philippe Zdar of Cassius and is the first with Julian Corrie (who took over for Nick McCarthy).

Title: Good Nature
Info: The third full-length release for the Virginia rock band led by Austin Getz was produced by Will Yip.

Title: Antipodes
Info: The debut full-length from the New Zealand alternative rock trio was recorded in a 1930s dancehall.

Title: Mr. Lucky
Info: The first album in seven years from Chris Isaak--who also returns with his own talk show on the Biography Channel--was produced by Eric Rosse and John Shanks.

Title: The Black And White Album
Info: The Swedish band worked with Pharrell Williams, Jacknife Lee, and Dennis Herring for their fourth album.

Title: Flock
Info: The third album from the Irish band, which previously included Damien Rice.

Title: Is the Is Are
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based indie rock band led by Zachary Cole Smith was self-recorded and produced.

Title: Jackie Lynn
Info: Chicago-based singer-songwriter Haley Fohr, who also released music under the name Circuit des Yeux returns as Jackie Lynn in this concept album.

Title: What the World Needs Now
Info: This is the 10th full-length studio release for the British post-punk band led by John Lydon.

Title: Ripe
Info: The debut solo release for the project of former Field Music bassist Ian 'Blackie' Black was co-produced with Peter and David Brewis of Field Music.

Title: Destination Tokyo
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the Japanese trio.

Title: Love's Miracle
Info: Qui covers Pink Floyd's 'Echoes' and Frank Zappa's 'Willie the Pimp' on their latest album.

Title: Enemy Mine
Info: The second album for the band comprising Daniel Bejar (Destroyer, New Pornographers), Spencer Krug (Sunset Rubdown, Wolf Parade), and Carey Mercer (Frog Eyes, Blackout Beach).

Title: Micah P. Hinson And The Opera Circuit
Info: This is the second full-length album for the young Texas-based singer-songwriter, recorded at his home while he was recovering from major back surgery.

Title: God First
Info: The debut full-length solo release for Bombay Bicycle Club's Jack Steadman features guest appearances from Alexandria, Horace Andy, BJ The Chicago Kid, Charles Bradley, De La Soul, Elli Ingram, and Lalah Hathaway

Title: Opticks
Info: This is the Norwegian singer-songwriter's second album.

Title: She's In Control
Info: This tongue-in-cheek Canadian duo mixes 70s and 80s electro, funk, rock, and dance sounds on this debut.

Title: Paranormal
Info: The latest solo studio release for the rock artist was produced by Bob Ezrin and features guest appearances by ZZ Top's Billy Gibbons, Deep Purple's Roger Glover and U2's Larry Mullen Jr. A second bonus disc contains two tracks featuring the original Alice Cooper band and six live tracks recorded in Columbus with his current backing band.

Title: Urstan
Info: Alasdair Roberts and Mairi Morrison collaborated on the album of traditional Gaelic songs for Ceol’s Craic, a Gaelic arts center in Glasgow.

Title: Threads
Info: The 11th full-length release for the singer-songwriter is said to be her last and features contributions from Brandi Carlile, Chuck D, Eric Clapton, Gary Clark, Jr., Andra Day, Vince Gill, Emmylou Harris, Jason Isbell, Kris Kristofferson, Lucius, Maren Morris, Lukas Nelson, Stevie Nicks, Margo Price, Bonnie Raitt, Keith Richards, St Vincent, Mavis Staples, Chris Stapleton, Sting, James Taylor, and Joe Walsh.

Title: Long Live the Angels
Info: The second full-length release for the Scottish soul singer features guest appearances from Jay Electronica, Joel Sande & The Serenje Choir, and Áine Zion.

Title: Catch My Shoe
Info: Recorded by Steve Albini, this is the first album without cofounder G. W. Sok, who left the Dutch experimental punk band in 2009 to pursue other interests.

Title: The Camel's Back
Info: This is the British duo's third album.

Title: Revolution Radio
Info: The 12th full-length studio release for the Northern California punk trio was self-produced and includes songs about gun violence in the US as well as a track lead singer Billie Joe Armstrong wrote for the movie he stars in.

Title: Combinations
Info: The Texan siblings release their second full-length album.

Title: Roadsinger (To Warm You Through The Night)
Info: The latest album for the singer-songwriter previously known as Cat Stevens was recorded live in various studios around the world.

Title: Cranekiss
Info: The third release for the indie artist was influenced by her move to New York and working with Weekend's Shaun Durkan and producer Jorge Elbrecht.

Title: Frying on This Rock
Info: The third album on the Thrill Jockey label for the space rock band was produced by Martin Bisi.

Title: Dreamer
Info: The second full-length release for Nabihah Iqbal under her real name (she previously released music under the name Throwing Shade) was written in Pakistan during the COVID-19 pandemic lockdown.

Title: I Go Missing in My Sleep
Info: The debut full-length release for the Brooklyn-based trio of Tamsin Wilson, Drew Arndt, and Johnny Simon was recorded with producer Ben Baptie.

Title: I Wanna Go Back to Detroit City
Info: The latest release from the R&B artist was inspired by Detroit and features contributions from such artists as Dennis Coffey, Dan Kroha, Matthew Smith, and Jim White.

Title: Science & Magic
Info: 25% of the profits from the debut release from the celebrity cat adopted by Mike Bridavsky go to an ASPCA-affiliated charity group helping special needs animals.

Title: Little Honey
Info: The latest album for the folk singer features a duet with Elvis Costello.

Title: Port of Morrow
Info: James Mercer's label Aural Apothecary releases The Shins' first studio album in five years.

Title: II
Info: The second full-length release for the collaboration between electronic producers Danilo Plessow (aka Motor City Drum Ensemble) and Innervisions' Marcus Worgull features guest contributions from Tadhg Murphy, Dermot O'Mahony, and Robbert Van Der Bildt.

Title: Augustines
Info: The second studio release for the Brooklyn indie rock band (previously known as We Are Augustines) was co-produced with Peter Katis.

Title: Wildwood
Info: The North Carolina bluegrass quartet releases its follow-up to the band's 2008 album IV.

Title: The Last Laugh
Info: The debut album for the UK artist Helena Costas was produced by Danger Mouse.

Title: Set Free
Info: The sixth album for the Andrew Kenny-led band is their first for Canadian label Arts & Crafts.

Title: Plague Park
Info: Handsome Furs is a side project for Wolf Parade's Dan Boeckner, who is joined by his fiancee Alexei Perry and Wolf Parade drummer Arlen Thompson.

Title: Czarface Meets Ghostface
Info: The latest comic book-inspired hip-hop release for Czarface is a collaboration with Ghostface Killah.

Title: V.
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the psychedelic rock band was mixed by Cooper Crain.

Title: Blood
Info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was influenced by her Jamaican and Greek heritage and features production from Paul Epworth, Matt Hales, Jamie Lidell, and Stephen McGregor.

Title: Mogic
Info: The third full-length release for the British band that includes Richard Dawson, Rhodri Davies, Dawn Bothwell and Sally Pinklington.

Title: Rat A Tat Tat
Info: Broken Social Scene's Jason Collett releases his fifth solo album produced by Zues band members Carlin Nicholson and Michael O'Brien.

Title: Life Is Sweet! Nice To Meet You
Info: The former Test Icicles frontman Devonte Hynes of Lightspeed Champion returns with the follow-up to 2008's Falling Off The Lavender Bridge. Produced by Ben Allen (Animal Collective, Gnarls Barkley), Life Is Sweet! Nice To Meet You is a collection of songs influenced by classical music and musical theatre.

Title: Compassion
Info: This is the fifth full-length release from the synth-pop trio led by Hannes Norrvide.

Title: Here Come the Rattling Trees
Info: The first release in five years for the band led by Sean O’Hagan is a concept album based on a stage production about the changes that happened in Peckham, a district in south-east London.

Title: Lovers Know
Info: The third full-length release for the indie pop band led by Laura Burhenn was produced by Bradley Hanan Carter.

Title: We Are the Champions
Info: This is the fifth studio album for Jake and Jamin Orrall, who were previously in the indie rock band Be Your Own Pet.

Title: Dear John
Info: The latest album for Sweden's Emil Svanangen is his first on the Polyvinyl label.

Title: Whiskey Tango Ghosts
Info: The former Throwing Muses and Breeders member's third solo release finds her collaborating with the likes of Dean Fisher (who doubles as Juliana Hatfield's bassist and Donelly's husband) and Rich Gilbert.

Title: Hotel Morgen
Info: The Berlin-based trio (who share a member with the band Tarwater) continue to mix electronica with post-rock on their first album in three years (and first for Domino).

Title: Ether Teeth
Info: This sophomore release for Minnesota-based turntablist/multi-instrumentalist Andrew Broder, like recent releases from "folktronica" artists such as Four Tet, utilizes organic sound samples, but mixes them with both indie rock elements (including some vocals) and shades of hip-hop.

Title: 6Twenty
Info: The New Zealand retro-rockers scored a major-label deal in the U.S. on the strength of this 2002 debut album, which received an American re-release in March 2003.

Title: Quiet Is The New Loud
Info: This is the sophomore American release from the Norweigian group, following their eponymous debut on Kindercore (which shares about half of the same tracks with this album).

Title: Exodus 1:7
Info: The posthumous release for the rapper features guest appearances from Benny The Butcher, Bono, Conway The Machine, Cross, Denaun, Icepick, Infrared, Jay-Z, Brian King Joseph, Alicia Keys, Lil Wayne, Moneybagg Yo, Nas, Exodus Simmons, Snoop Dogg, Swizz Beatz, The LOX, Usher, and Westside Gunn.

Title: Modern English Decoration
Info: The second full-length release for the British alternative rock band led by Rhys Edwards was recorded and mixed at their house.

Title: Blossoms
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie pop band was produced by Rich Turvey and The Coral's James Skelly.

Title: Poemss
Info: This is the debut release for the collaboration between producer Joanne Pollock and Aaron Funk of Venetian Snares.

Title: The Politics of Envy
Info: The eighth solo album for the Pop Group singer features guest appearances by Primal Scream, Factory Floor, Keith Levene of Clash, Richard Hell, Lee "Scratch" Perry, Gina Birch of The Raincoats, Tessa Pollitt of Slits, Douglas Hart of Jesus and Mary Chain, and Daddy G of Massive Attack.

Title: Zonoscope
Info: The third full-length release is dance pop combined with down-tempo transitions using various instrumentation and heavy, pulsating rhythms.

Title: Sun Comes Up Again
Info: The debut solo album for the ex-Razorlight drummer Andy Burrows was produced by Eliot James.

Title: Sewn Together
Info: The Meat Puppets return with its second album since reuniting in 2006.

Title: The Diving Board
Info: Produced by T-Bone Burnett, the first solo album in over seven years for the pop singer-songwriter is a return to the more stripped down sound of his earlier career built around a piano, bass and drums.

Title: Doom Abuse
Info: The first release in six years since 2008's Fasciinatiion for the Omaha post-punk band was produced with Mike Mogis.

Title: Half of Where You Live
Info: The second full-length release for the Berlin-based electronic producer Derwin Schlecker was inspired by the sounds and music he heard through his travels.

Title: Sic Alps
Info: The fifth album for the San Francisco indie rock quartet is its first full-length on the Drag City label.

Title: Untitled
Info: After many delays and controversy over the title, Nas' latest album is finally released with no title.

Title: Blanck Mass
Info: Fuck Button's Benjamin John Power releases his debut solo album of ambient electronic music.

Title: Heart Like A River
Info: The New York indie-folk band's seventh album (their first in four years) is co-produced by Warren Defever (His Name Is Alive).

Title: Young For Eternity
Info: Ian Broudie (Lightning Seeds) produced this debut LP for the co-ed English trio of teenagers.

Title: Gone Now
Info: The second full-length release for the Jack Antonoff solo project was influenced by the death of sister from brain cancer and features guest appearances from Sam Dew, Carly Rae Jepsen, Lorde, and Julia Michaels.

Title: Haven
Info: This is the latest album from the Denmark-based electronic producer.

Title: Shiver
Info: The second full-length solo studio release for the Sigur Rós frontman was co-produced by A. G. Cook and recorded in Berlin, Helsinki, London, and Reykjavik.

Title: Outside
Info: The New York City five-piece band releases its third album of Americana-influenced music.

Title: Hold on Tight
Info: The final album for the soul singer who passed away in October 2010 features a collaboration with Dutch artist De Dijk.

Title: Ta-Dah
Info: The surprisingly successful party band's second album includes a track co-written with Elton John.

Title: Foam Island
Info: The third full-length release for the electronic pop duo of Aiden Whalley and James Young (James Buttery left the band in 2014) was co-produced with Lexxx and features samples of interviews of young people in Huddersfield, England.

Title: Baby Darling Doll Face Honey
Info: The debut album for the indie rock band was produced by Ian Davenport.

Title: Maximum Overload
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British power metal band now led by Marc Hudson was produced by Jens Bogren.

Title: Pre-Human Ideas
Info: Phil Elverum rerecorded with MIDI instrumentation and used Auto-Tune to create new sounds from a selection of tracks from his 2012 releases: Clear Moon and Ocean Roar.

Title: Bankrupt!
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the French rock band was co-produced with Philippe Zdar of Cassius.

Title: Panic Prevention
Info: The British artist's debut album was one of the nominees for the 2007 Mercury Prize.

Title: Deathfix
Info: The Washington, D.C. band formed by ex-Fugazi drummer Brendan Canty and Blowoff member Rich Morel includes Devin Ocampo and Mark Cisneros of Medication on its debut release.

Title: Shake Shook Shaken
Info: The third full-length release for the French-Finnish duo of Olivia Merilahti and Dan Levy was recorded at their personal studio.

Title: To All the Girls...
Info: The 18-track double release from the country singer features duets with such artists as Brandi Carlile, Sheryl Crow, Emmylou Harris, Norah Jones, Wynnona Judd, Alison Krauss, Miranda Lambert, Loretta Lynn, Shelby Lynne, Dolly Parton, Mavis Staples, and Carrie Underwood.

Title: Skeletal Lamping
Info: The Kevin Barnes-led sextet releases its follow-up to 2007's Hissing Fauna, Are You the Destroyer?

Title: Earth To Dora
Info: This is the 13th full-length studio release for the indie rock band led by E, who also produced the album.

Title: Islands
Info: The eighth full-length release for the Northern Ireland trio was produced by the band's frontman, Tim Wheeler.

Title: Seekers and Finders
Info: The seventh full-length release for the gypsy punk rock band led by Eugene Hütz features a guest appearance by Regina Spektor.

Title: Convenanza
Info: The first solo release for the British electronic producer since 2009 was co-written with the Sabrettes’ Nina Walsh.

Title: Soft Will
Info: Producer Chris Coady returns for the third release for the Chicago indie rock trio.

Title: Fading Love
Info: The debut full-length release from the Berlin-based British DJ/producer features vocals from Boxed In's Oli Bayston and Lawrence Hart.

Title: Splazsh
Info: This is producer Darren Cunningham's second album under the name Actress.

Title: Collapse into Now
Info: R.E.M. returns with their 15th album, mixing up their winning musical recipe of the past with a new approach, featuring guest appearances by Patti Smith, Eddie Vedder, and Peaches.

Title: The Dew Lasts an Hour
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Berlin-based pop trio.

Title: From A Compound Eye
Info: The first post-GBV solo outing for the prolific Pollard was produced by Todd Tobias.

Title: Jamie Lidell
Info: The fifth full-length release from the British producer/singer was influenced by 1980s pop-soul.

Title: Liberation
Info: The first full-length for the pop singer since 2012's Lotus features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, GoldLink, Keida, Demi Lovato, Shenseea, Ty Dolla $ign, and XNDA.

Title: Black Pudding
Info: Mark Lanegan collaborates with British Blues artist Duke Garwood on the release recorded by Justin Smith in California.

Title: Broken Bells
Info: This is the debut album for The Shins James Mercer and producer Brian Burton (aka as Danger Mouse).

Title: A Coliseum Complex Museum
Info: The fifth full-length release for the psychedelic rock band led by Montreal husband-and-wife duo of Jace Lasek and Olga Goreas features two new band members, Sheenah Ko and Robbie Macarthur.

Title: Wonder Where We Land
Info: The second full-length release for the Aaron Jerome project features guest appearances from A$AP Ferg, Ezra Koenig, Koreless, Denai Moore, Caroline Polachek, Raury, Sampha, Jessie Ware, and Warpaint.

Title: Tentacles
Info: The debut full-length for the indie-rock band from Long Beach, California.

Title: CHUCK
Info: The first new release since 1979 would be the final album for the rock 'n' roll legend.

Title: Mixed Emotions
Info: This is the full-length debut release for the Brooklyn-based duo of Eric Emm and Jesse Cohen.

Title: Nude With Boots
Info: The latest album for the metal band from Washington includes members from Big Business who joined the band on their last album.

Title: Hard Times and Nursery Rhymes
Info: Though it's been seven years since Social Distortion's last release, the newest album picks up where they left off with visceral, hard-driving rock songs about love and life.

Title: As You Were
Info: The debut full-length release for the former Oasis lead singer was produced by Dan Grech-Marguerat and Greg Kurstin.

Title: It's Not Me, It's You
Info: The follow-up to her 2007 debut album was produced by Greg Kurstin.

Title: Will of the People
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for British rock band Muse was self-produced and recorded in London and Los Angeles.

Title: Night Call
Info: The third full-length release for Years & Years is now an Olly Alexander solo project after Mikey Goldsworthy and Emre Türkmen stepped back as active members.

Title: YSIV
Info: The fourth and final installment of the Maryland rapper's Young Sinatra series features guest appearances from Big Lenbo, Cappadonna, Ghostface Killah, Inspectah Deck, Jackpot Scotty Wotty, KAjo, John Lindahl, Masta Killa, Method Man, Raekwon, RZA, Lucy Rose & The RattPack, Slaydro, Jaden Smith, Hailee Steinfeld, Ryan Tedder, U-God, and Wale.

Title: This Girl's in Love (A Bacharach & David Songbook)
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features songs written by Burt Bacharach and Hal David was recorded with her husband Rob Shirakbari and with Bacharach on piano.

Title: Teen Men
Info: The full-length debut for the electro-pop quartet that includes Nick Krill and Joe Hobson of the Spinto Band.

Title: Kindred
Info: The third full-length release for the indie pop band led by Michael Angelakos was co-produced with  Chris Zane, Alex Aldi, and Benny Blanco.

Title: New York Before the War
Info: The latet solo release for the New York singer-songwriter features contributions from Peter Buck, Craig Finn, Wayne Kramer and J. Mascis.

Title: Croz
Info: The first studio solo release in 20 years for the founding member of The Byrds and Crosby, Stills & Nash features guest appearances from Mark Knopfler, Wynton Marsalis, Leland Sklar, and Steve Tavaglione.

Title: Born Sinner
Info: The second full-length release for the rapper features guest appearances from Amber Coffman, Miguel, and Kendrick Lamar.

Title: Spirit in the Room
Info: Tom Jones latest release is a disc of covers of contemporary blues and classic rock songs.

Title: Napa Asylum
Info: The latest album for the San Francisco-based indie band is its first since 2008's U.S. EZ.

Title: True Romance
Info: The debut album for the British indie rock trio.

Title: Here Is What Is
Info: The fifth studio album for the Canadian singer and producer is also the soundtrack to the documentary of the same name.

Title: The  Valley
Info: The third album from the indie-rock Texans features some of their most mood-driven music thus far, with dreamy vocals and eclectic arrangements to add dimension to their sound.

Title: VYP: Voice of the Young People
Info: The debut album includes Hot 100 single "Lip Gloss" released last year, as well as the Avril Lavigne remix of "Girlfriend."

Title: New Shapes of Life
Info: The latest solo release for the former member of The Boo Radley was mixed by Greg Haver and Clint Murphy.

Title: Constellations
Info: The Austin group added four members since its 2008 album for the band's fourth album.

Title: Family
Info: This is the second album for the indie rock band formed in Washington D.C.

Title: I Blame You
Info: This is the debut album for Rick Froberg's latest band.

Title: Man On The Moon: The End Of Day
Info: The debut album for the Cleveland-born who helped cowrite four tracks on Kayne West's "808s & Heartbreak."

Title: The Open Road
Info: The singer-songwriter releases his latest album of roots rock recorded at his home studio.

Title: Detroit 2
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from 42 Dugg, Anderson.Paak, Jhené Aiko, Boldy James, Cash Kidd, Diddy, Drego, Dwele, Earlly Mac, Eminem, Hit-Boy, Kash Doll, Dom Kennedy, Lil Wayne, Nipsey Hussle, Payroll, Post Malone, Royce da 5'9", Sada Baby, Travis Scott, Tee Grizzley, Twenty88, Ty Dolla Sign, Wale, and Young Thug.

Title: Strange House
Info: Alan Moulder and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs' Nick Zinner are among the producers on the UK goth-punk band's debut LP.

Title: The Sister
Info: The latest release for the Boston singer-songwriter is said to be a continuation of her 2010 self-titled album.

Title: Guadalupe Plata (2015)
Info: The fourth full-length release (and fourth self-titled album that was released in March 2015 in Spain) for the Spanish blues rock trio was recorded in London with producer Liam Watson.

Title: Lighght
Info: This is the second full-length indie pop release for K Ishibashi.

Title: Childish Prodigy
Info: This is the second album for the Philadelphia-based singer-songwriter.

Title: Past Life
Info: The third full-length release for the band led by Ari Picker is down to from a quintet to a quartet.

Title: Tales From Terra Firma
Info: The self-produced second release for the British folk-pop band was mainly written in a camper van in Oxford.

Title: The Dark Crawler
Info: The second full-length release for the grime artist features Kozzie, Meleka, Riko, Trim, MCs Deadly, Mayhem, and Saf-One as guest vocalists.

Title: Cuts Across The Land
Info: The UK rockers (making their full-length debut with this Flood- and Simon Raymonde-produced disc) are fronted by Liela Moss, who has drawn comparisons to Patti Smith and PJ Harvey.

Title: PHOX
Info: The debut full-length release for the Wisconsin indie pop group was produced by Brian Joseph.

Title: Larceny & Old Lace
Info: The second album for the all-women rock band from Atlanta was produced by Ed Rawls.

Title: Echo Party
Info: Edan mixes a variety of songs from the Traffic Entertainment Group into a 29-minute track.

Title: Turn to Gold
Info: The third full-length release for the Nashville-based garage rock band was produced by Vance Powell.

Title: Melody Road
Info: The first release in six years (and his first on the Capitol Records label) for the singer-songwriter was produced by Don Was and Jacknife Lee.

Title: Machineries of Joy
Info: Some early versions of the songs on the sixth full-length studio release for the British indie rock band were released as part of six EPs that were released in conjunction with its monthly Krankenhaus club nights.

Title: Loose
Info: Whoa, Nelly indeed. Timbaland produced the bulk of the singer's dancier, poppier third album, and even sings on one track.

Title: The Future Will Come
Info: This is the second album for the electronic artist from Rhode Island.

Title: Try This
Info: Following the unexpected critical and commercial success of M!ssundaztood, Pink returns with a third, even more rock-oriented album. Linda Perry returns to helm just a few tracks, with the bulk of the producing/writing  chores falling to Rancid's Tim Armstrong.

Title: Mississauga Goddam
Info: This is the sophomore LP (third, if you count their debut demo collection) for the Toronto band led by Joel Gibb.

Title: Is 4 Lovers
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Canadian dance-punk duo was self-produced and recorded.

Title: Watercolor
Info: The debut full-length release for the Seattle rapper features guest appearances from Alana Belle, Black, Cashtro, Fly Guy Dai, JD, Nate Jack, The Palaceer, Aslan T. Rife, Shabazz Palaces, Stas THEE Boss, Debra Sullivan (his mother), Thad, and THEESatisfaction.

Title: Brother Is To Son
Info: 'Brother Is To Son' is nominally a solo effort for Daniel Smith (aka "Brother Danielson," aka leader of the Christian indie-rock outfit the Danielson Familie), although fellow Familie (and, in real life, family) members appear throughout this acoustic-only disc, as does frequent collaborator Sufjan Stevens.

Title: High Water (Mark)
Info: The Def Jux rapper expands into the realm of modern jazz, with the help of Blue Series stalwarts Matthew Shipp, William Parker and Guillermo Brown.

Title: Everything Must Go
Info: What sounds like a Steely Dan clearance sale is actually the veteran duo's first album of new material since their 2000 comeback effort 'Two Against Nature.'

Title: A New Day At Midnight
Info: The English singer-songwriter finally returns with a follow-up to his 1999 breakthrough hit 'White Ladder.'

Title: We Are Your Friends
Info: The Manchester-based pyschedelic pop quartet returns with a follow-up to their 2001 debut, 'Chemistry Is What We Are.'

Title: Wallpaper For The Soul
Info: Ivy's Andy Chase produced this sophomore effort from the French band that gave us 2000's irresistibly poppy 'Puzzle.'

Title: Loud
Info: The popular German trance DJ offers up his first set of original songs, featuring guest vocals by the likes of Kelis and Finley Quaye.

Title: Playgroup
Info: Playgroup is the brainchild of producer/designer Trevor Jackson, who has remixed artists such as Massive Attack, U2, and Death In Vegas. On this eponymous debut, a variety of guests from the hip-hop and indie music worlds (Kathleen Hanna, Shinehead, Edwyn Collins, KC Flightt, Roddy Frame, Rowetta) lends vocals to the twelve eclectic tracks, including a cover of Paul Simon's "50 Ways To Leave Your Lover."

Title: Expansion Team
Info: The second album from Los Angeles rap outfit Dilated Peoples features contributions from JuJu, DJ Premier, Tha Liks, Alchemist and Da Beatminerz.

Title: The Id
Info: This is the follow-up to the singer's acclaimed 1999 debut. Rick Rubin produces, with guest appearances from Slick Rick, Mos Def, and Erykah Badu.

Title: Sincere
Info: This debut album from two-step pioneer MJ Cole was nominated for the Mercury Prize in the UK (but lost out to Badly Drawn Boy).

Title: The Good, the Bad, and the Funky
Offering
Info: The third full-length release for the indie pop duo of Madeline Follin and Brian Oblivion was produced by Shane Stoneback.

Title: Texas Rose, The Thaw & The Beasts
Info: Rafter Roberts produced the latest album for the Raymond Raposa-led band.

Title: Boo! Human
Info: This is the latest release for the Chicago-based  experimental indie rock band.

Title: Are You Satisfied?
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British duo of Isaac Holman and Laurie Vincent.

Title: Do Not Engage
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Vancouver indie rock duo of Becky Black and Maya Miller was produced by Jim Diamond.

Title: Hot House
Info: Pianist Chick Corea and vibraphonist Gary Burton team up again on this album of pop and jazz cover songs.

Title: Dark Is the Way, Light Is a Place
Info: The fifth album for the alternative rock band was produced by Brendan O'Brien.

Title: Fossils And Other Phantoms
Info: Originally called Peggy Sue And The Pirates, the British trio shortened its name to just Peggy Sue for its debut full-length release.

Title: Where You Live
Info: Tchad Blake co-produced the singer-songwriter's seventh album. The Red Hot Chili Peppers' Flea guests.

Title: Heard It in a Past Life
Info: The debut full-length major label release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from such artists as Rostam Batmanglij, Kid Harpoon, Greg Kurstin, and Ricky Reed.

Title: Lost Marbles And Exploded Evidence
Info: 'Lost Marbles' collects six years of previously uncompiled material by the John Schmersal-led band, including internet-only tracks and limited-edition singles.

Title: Little Joy
Info: The debut album for the rock band headed up by The Strokes' Fabrizio Moretti and Rodrigo Amarante.

Title: Barton Hollow
Info: The full-length debut from Joy Williams and John Paul White – featured on an episode of Grey’s Anatomy – is a collection of lyrically deep songs of love and the human condition, using the simplicity of multiple instruments and soulful vocals.

Title: Forget The Night Ahead
Info: The Scottish band's follow-up to its debut album "Fourteen Autumns and Fifteen Winters" was produced by guitarist Andy McFarlane and Paul Savage.

Title: Habeas Corpus
Info: This is the second album on the Jive label for the rock quartet from St. Louis.

Title: Animal Serenade
Info: Recorded live at Los Angeles' Wiltern Theater in 2003, this 2-disc set finds Reed supported by a small (drummerless) band on material culled from his recent disc 'The Raven' as well as older albums from his 35-plus-year career (including Velvet Underground tunes "Venus In Furs," "Candy Says," and "Heroin").

Title: Daylight
Info: The New York singer-songwriter works with producer Patrick Leonard (Madonna, Jewel) for this, his fourth album.

Title: Title TK
Info: A comeback of sorts, 'Title TK' comes a full nine years after The Breeders' previous effort (1993's 'Last Splash') and sees the group with a new lineup (only Kim Deal and sister Kelley remain) and producer (Steve Albini).

Title: My Ride's Here
Info: Warren Zevon's eleventh studio recording (his first, 'Wanted Dead or Alive,' was released in 1969!) features songs penned with the help of an unusual group of collaborators, including novelist Carl Hiaasen and sportswriter Mitch Albom (whose song, "Hit Somebody! (The Hockey Song)," features a vocal spot from David Letterman, of all people).

Title: As If To Nothing
Info: Scottish composer Craig Armstrong has provided his arranging and writing talents to numerous film soundtracks (including Moulin Rouge) and albums by the likes of Massive Attack and Madonna. This is his third solo album, and features guest appearances by Evan Dando, Mogwai, Bono, and Photek.

Title: The  Civil Wars
Info: The second release for the duo Joy Williams and John Paul White followed an announced hiatus in November 2012 due to "internal discord and irreconcilable differences of ambition."

Title: American Gong
Info: The indie band formed in Portland, Oregon, releases its first album with new official member, bassist Joanna Bolme.

Title: Death Becomes Her
Info: The South African DJ/electronic producer's first full-length release on the Hyperdub label features guest appearances from K-$, K Rizz and Queezy.

Title: A Strange Arrangement
Info: Andrew Cohen, the Michigan-born singer-songwriter, releases his debut album.

Title: Pollinator
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the rock band led by Debbie Harry features contributions from such artists as Laurie Anderson,  The Gregory Brothers, Dev Hynes, Joan Jett, Sia, Dave Sitek, and Nick Valensi.

Title: Hubcap Music
Info: The fifth release from the blues singer was created on a guitar made from hubcaps.

Title: Flat-Pack Philosophy
Info: This is the fifth album for the reunited version of the punk band (still featuring Pete Shelley and Steve Diggle), now marking over 30 years since their original formation.

Title: Romance
Info: The second full-length solo release for the former Fifth Harmony singer features guest appearances from DaBaby and Shawn Mendes.

Title: Wrong Creatures
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based rock band was produced by Nick Launay.

Title: Man on the Moon, Vol. 3: The Chosen
Info: The third and final installment of the rapper's Main On The Moon trilogy features guest appearances from Phoebe Bridgers, Pop Smoke, Skepta, and Trippie Redd.

Title: Manzanita
Info: The classically-trained, Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter returns with her rich and varied fifth full-length which, like her previous outing, finds her utilizing (at times) a backing band. Members of Beachwood Sparks, Dead Meadow and Brian Jonestown Massacre guest.

Title: Blade of the Ronin
Info: The follow-up to Vast Aire and Vordul Mega's debut release Cold Vein comes 14 years later with an album produced by Bill Cosmiq.

Title: The Lillywhite Sessions
Info: The latest release for the Chicago singer-songwriter is a cover album of the Dave Matthews Band's unreleased (but bootlegged and some rerecorded for Busted Stuff) Lillywhite Sessions.

Title: Worldwide
Info: The debut album for the duo from Australia was produced by band member Johnny Siera.

Title: Gumption
Info: This is the debut full-length release for Kansas singer-songwriter Taryn Miller was produced by Nicolas Vernhes.

Title: He Thinks He's People
Info: The Pinback co-founder releases his latest solo album.

Title: You're Welcome
Info: The sixth full-length release for Nathan Williams-led band features influences from 1950s doo-wop, Cambodian pop, and South American '70's psychedelia.

Title: Avonmore
Info: Co-produced by Rhett Davies, the Roxy Music singer's latest solo release features original songs and two covers songs as well as contributions from  Flea, Mark Knopfler, Johnny Marr, Maceo Parker, Nile Rodgers of Chic, Ronnie Spector, and Todd Terje.

Title: Electric Lines
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Hot Chip artist-producer features a guest appearance from SLO (Jess Mills).

Title: T R O U B L E
Info: Featuring guest appearances by David Thomas Broughton and Mary Margaret O'Hara, the sixth full-length studio release from the Canadian collective led by Mark Andrew Hamilton was inspired by his two years traveling around the world.

Title: Feelin Kinda Free
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Australian rock band sees the return of original drummer Christian Strybosch.

Title: Holdin' the Bag
Info: The latest release for the Seattle-based rock trio features guest appearances from Hayes Carll and Lydia Loveless.

Title: Array 1 [EP]
Info: The four-track EP from the British alternative rock band founded by Robert Hampson comes after the group reunited in 2013 for the All Tomorrow's Parties festival.

Title: Brain Pulse Music
Info: The latest album from Masaki Batoh, the singer for the band Ghost, includes sounds made from brain waves he records with his Brain Pulse Machine.

Title: Songbook [Live]
Info: This acoustic, live album from the former Soundgarden frontman features songs from every musical side project he has had a part in, including music from Temple of the Dog; Audioslave; and his solo album, Scream.

Title: Inclusions
