Info: The second solo album for the cellist from Kentucky blends ideas from other music genres and was produced by Duane Lundy.

Title: I Can Wonder What You Did with Your Day
Info: The Canadian singer's latest solo album was produced by ex-Eric's Trip bandmate Rick White.

Title: The Digging Remedy
Info: The 11th full-length for the British electronic duo of Ed Handley and Andy Turner features flute and guitar from Benet Walsh.

Title: Revelation
Info: The 14th release for the San Francisco psych-rock band led by Anton Newcombe includes contributions from Ricky Maymi, Joachim Alhund, Constantine Karlis, and Ryan Van Kriedt.

Title: Blazing Gentlemen
Info: This is the second solo release for the prolific Guided By Voices' singer-songwriter.

Title: Something Shines
Info: This is the third solo release for the former Stereolab singer.

Title: What The Toll Tells
Info: This is the second album (and Saddle Creek debut) for the San Francisco duo of Adam Stephens and Tyson Vogel.

Title: From A Birds Eye View
Info: The second full-length studio release for rapper Cordae features guest appearances from Ant Clemons, Eminem, Freddie Gibbs, Gunna, H.E.R., Lil Durk, Lil Wayne, Roddy Ricch, and Stevie Wonder.

Title: Old Friends New Friends
Info: The two-disc release from Nils Frahm features 23 solo piano compositions recorded between 2009 and 2021 that were not included on previous albums.

Title: The Great Awakening
Info: The first full-length release in six years for Austin indie rock band Shearwater was co-produced with Dan Duszynski.

Title: Life in the Dark
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the folk rock band was self-produced and recorded at a farm in upstate New York.

Title: Watch The Fireworks
Info: The former singer of The Delgados releases her debut solo album.

Title: Confessions
Info: Among the producers and guest vocalists appearing on Usher's fourth album are Ludacris, Nelly, Jermaine Dupri, The Neptunes, and Jimmy Jam & Terry Lewis.

Title: Angles
Info: The Strokes' self-produced fourth album strikes a neo-garage rock chord with the past, recalling the early sounds of their 2001 debut.

Title: Uncaged
Info: Amos Lee and Trombone Shorty guest on the latest album from the country band.

Title: Unmap
Info: Justin Vernon (of Bon Iver), Jon Mueller, Chris Rosenau, Jim Schoenecker, Daniel Spack, and Thomas Wincek of Collections of Colonies of Bees join up to release their debut together as Volcano Choir.

Title: Satan's Graffiti or God's Art?
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Atlanta rock band was produced by Sean Lennon.

Title: Right Thoughts, Right Words, Right Action
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Scottish indie rock band was self-produced.

Title: The Fame
Info: The debut album for the songwriter includes songs written and produced by RedOne and Space Cowboy.

Title: Do You Wonder About Me?
Info: The second full-length release for the New York indie rock duo was produced by Christopher Daly.

Title: Dimensional People
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the German electronic duo features contributions from such artists as Sam Amidon, Amanda Blank, Eric D. Clarke, Zach Condon, Aaron and Bryce Dessner, Ensemble Musikfabrik, Lisa Hannigan, Spank Rock, Swamp Dogg, and Justin Vernon.

Title: Good Evening New York City
Info: The three-disc set (two CDs and a DVD) features a recording of the ex-Beatle's three-night concert in New York City's Citi Field on July 17, 18, and 21, 2009.

Title: Talk To La Bomb
Info: This is the second album for the eclectic, multi-lingual New York band that, despite its name, is largely male and definitely not Brazilian.

Title: Closure/Continuation
Info: This is the first full-length studio release for British rock band Porcupine Tree since 2009's The Incident.

Title: Shape the Future
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for George Evelyn features guest appearances from Allan Kingdom, Andrew Ashong, LSK, Mozez, Jordan Rakei, Kuauhtli Vasquez, Sadie Walker, and Wixarika Tribe.

Title: The Echo of Pleasure
Artist: The Pains of Being Pure at Heart
Info: The fourth full-length release for the New York indie pop band led by Kip Berman was produced by Andy Savours and features guest appearances from A Sunny Day in Glasgow's Jen Goma, Jacob Danish Sloan, and Kelly Pratt.

Title: Champ
Info: The Canadian four-piece returns with another album of catchy post-punk tunes, complete with the high energy and quirkiness Tokyo Police Club has cultivated throughout the years.

Title: Fading Parade
Info: This is the fourth album for the indie project led by Jason Robert Quever.

Title: AudioLust & HigherLove
Info: The second full-length solo release for British producer SG Lewis features guest appearances from Channel Tres, Lucky Daye, Tove Lo, Ty Dolla $ign, and Charlotte Day Wilson.

Title: Or Give Me Death
Info: 'Death' is the third album for Seattle's David Terry, who almost single-handedly is Aqueduct.

Title: Rocket Juice & the Moon
Info: After much delay due to their other projects, Damon Albarn of Blur and Gorillaz, Red Hot Chili Peppers' Flea, and Tony Allen's super group formed in 2008 finally releases its debut album featuring guest appearances by Erykah Badu, Fatoumata Diawara, M.anifest, M3nsa, and Cheick Tidiane Seck.

Title: Gutter Rainbows
Info: The latest solo album for the Brooklyn rapper was originally set to be a self-released digital-only album (Duck Down signed on to release the physical version). It features production from Ski Beatz, S1, Marco Polo, M-Phazes, 88-Keys, Shuko, 6th Sense, E. Jones, Nick Speed, KYRYSIS!, Blaq Toven, Oh No, and Maurice Brown.

Title: Breakfast
Info: The debut full-length release for the British trio that includes Pete & The Pirate's singer Thomas Sanders was produced by Bernard Butler.

Title: Wrote a Song for Everyone
Info: Foo Fighters, Jennifer Hudson, Kid Rock, Miranda Lambert, My Morning Jacket, Brad Paisley, Bob Seger, and Keith Urban are some of the guests helping the Creedence Clearwater Revival singer cover some of his songs.

Title: The Final Frontier
Info: The heavy metal legends return with their 15th studio release, still reinventing rock 35 years into their careers.

Title: Higher Than The Stars [EP]
Artist: The Pains of Being Pure at Heart
Info: The four-track EP features a song remixed by Saint Etienne.

Title: Mirror Mirror
Info: The Scottish rock band's first album since 2008's The Gift was produced by JD Twitch.

Title: Echoes, Silence, Patience & Grace
Info: Producer Gil Norton returns for the Foo Fighters' sixth album.

Title: Hurts 2B Human
Info: Th eighth full-length release for the pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Cash Cash, Khalid, Chris Stapleton, and Wrabel.

Title: Joke in the Hole
Info: The latest solo release from the Black Dice founding member expands the experimental dance style he begun on 2011's Limbo with samples and beats.

Title: White Fence Is Growing Faith
Info: Darker My Love's Tim Presley releases his second solo album.

Title: Mr. Love & Justice
Info: The 12th album for the musician was released both with and without his backing band, The Blokes.

Title: The  Keychain Collection
Info: Will Ozanne's debut album as Gang Colours features a mix of downtempo and UK garage music.

Title: Rockferry
Info: "Mercy," the single from Duffy's debut album, made her the first female Welsh singer to hit number one on the UK pop charts in over 20 years.

Title: The Planet
Info: The six-track min-album is the first credited to the Brooklyn-based duo's new name of Young Ejecta after a legal dispute over the name Ejecta with a similarly named DJ Ejeca.

Title: Television of Saints
Info: The self-released seventh solo album for the Seattle-based singer-songwriter was funded by fan donations.

Title: Precious Memories
Info: The country star covers 15 classic gospel hyms with this acoustic collection.

Title: Kidnapped By Neptune
Info: The English singer-songwriter has drawn comparisons to PJ Harvey, Cat Power and even Kurt Cobain for her sometimes abrasive, sometimes minimal, bluesy sound.

Title: Heritage
Info: The Swedish metal band's 10th studio album is the last with keyboardist Per Wiberg.

Title: The First Days Of Spring
Info: The second album for the band features a film directed by the band's lead singer, Charles Fink.

Title: End Times
Info: The latest release for Mark Oliver Everett is what he calls his "divorce album."

Title: Girl
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie-pop trio was produced by Ash Workman.

Title: Praxis Makes Perfect
Info: The life of Italian publisher, Giangiacomo Feltrinelli is the concept behind the second release from Gruff Rhys and Boom Bip.

Title: Gods Of The Earth
Info: This is the sophomore album for the metal band from Austin, Texas.

Title: Amber
Info: The third album for the British band (now down to three members) was co-produced by Steve Osborne and Jim Abbiss along with Clearlake frontman Jason Pegg.

Title: Forth
Info: The English rock band reunites after its 1999 split to release its fourth album.

Title: An Awesome Wave
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the British quartet who met at Leeds University.

Title: Tracer
Info: The second full-length release for the electronic duo of Nick Weiss and Logan Takahashi features guest appearances by Kelela, Panda Bear, Laurel Halo, and Romanthony.

Title: That's How We Burn
Info: After catching the ear of Sub Pop with its self-released album There's No Sky (Oh My My), the Milwaukee, Wisconsin, quartet recorded its major label debut with Justin Perkins.

Title: Communion
Info: The two-disc set for the Swedish rock band is its fifth studio album.

Title: March Of The Zapotec/Holland [EP]
Info: The first of the double EP set, March of the Zapotec, features Mexican music influences, whereas the second, Holland, includes songs made by Zach Condon under the name Realpeople.

Title: Alone II: The Home Recordings
Info: The second set of demos from the Weezer singer ranges from 1993 to 2008.

Title: The Delivery Man
Info: Elvis has returned to the land of rock--or at least, country-flavored rock, as he's joined on several tracks by Lucinda Williams and Emmylou Harris. It's his second disc to feature (and first to credit) his new backing band, The Impostors, who look an awful lot like his former backing band, The Attractions, save for the addition of bassist Davey Faragher.

Title: Little Heart's Ease
Info: The Toronto lo-fi indie-rockers, led by Will Oldham-esque singer-songwriter Aaron Riches, make their Sanctuary debut with this third album.

Title: Split The Difference
Info: The UK five-piece worked with producer Tchad Blake for this fourth LP.

Title: Summer Make Good
Info: On their third full-length, the Icelandic band Mum continues to blend pastoral electronica with the distinctive vocals (think The Cranes as a comparison) of Kristín Anna Valtýsdóttir.

Title: The Duel
Info: The country singer's fourth studio album and Sugarhill debut was recorded in just two weeks with returning producer R.S. Field.

Title: Wherever I Am I Am What Is Missing
Info: The London, England band's fourth LP finds them stripping away some of the layers (and extra musicians) found on previous outings for a more organic trip-hop approach.

Title: Loose Screw
Info: The band's first album of new songs since 1999's Viva el Amor contains 12 mostly reggae-tinged tracks.

Title: Sugar Ray
Info: The fourth album for the Orange County frat-rockers.

Title: Elan Vital
Info: Guitarist Nathan Thelen is out, and keyboardist Leona Marrs is in, for the third LP from the Andrea Zollo-fronted band.

Title: Totale Nite
Info: The five-track EP from the Tampa indie rock trio is its first release on the Night people label.

Title: I Predict a Graceful Expulsion
Info: The debut release for the Canadian-born, London, England-based singer-songwriter Al Spx was produced by Jim Anderson.

Title: Moody Motorcycle
Info: The Canadian duo of Jim Guthrie and Islands singer Nick Thorburn release their debut album as Human Highway.

Title: Raise The Dead
Info: The fourth studio album for the Southern California band is based on Alex Greenwald's ideas about spending time with a fictional cult.

Title: Uncle, Duke & The Chief
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band was produced by Richard Swift.

Title: Out in the Light
Info: After the breakup of Port O'Brien, Van Pierszalowski traveled and eventually decided to return to Oslo to work on this debut solo release.

Title: Keeper
Info: John Doe coproduced his latest solo album with Dave Way, which features guest appearances from Howie Gelb, Patty Griffin, Smokey Hormel, and Jill Sobule.

Title: Interpreting The Masters, Volume 1: A Tribute to Daryl Hall And John Oates
Info: Inara George and Greg Kurstin cover eight Hall & Oates classic songs, including one original song influenced by the duo.

Title: Secret House Against The World
Info: The Canadian semi-rapper (think more Beck than Eminem) returns with his first album of all-new material in two years, which includes contributions from DJ D Styles, Chicago post-rockers Tortoise and singer Lesley Feist.

Title: Television Man
Info: The second full-length release for the Olympia, Washington, garage-punk band was self-recorded.

Title: Simone Felice
Info: This is the debut solo release for Simone Felice, singer for The Duke & The King and former member of The Felice Brothers.

Title: Under And Under
Info: The latest album from the Brooklyn-based artist also known as Mike Sniper, who's real identity remains mysterious.

Title: Foreverly
Info: The collaboration between Green Day frontman Billie Joe Armstrong and Grammy-winning singer Norah Jones is their take on the collection of reinterpreted Americana songs recorded by The Everly Brothers in 1958.

Title: ununiform
Info: The 13th full-length release for the British trip-hop artist features guest appearances from Asia Argento, Francesca Belmonte, Terra Lopez, Avalon Lurks, Mina Rose, Scriptonite, Smoky Mo, and Martina Topley-Bird.

Title: Vide Noir
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie band led by Ben Schneider (who also produced the album) was mixed by Dave Fridmann.

Title: How to Solve Our Human Problems, Pts. 1-3
Info: The 15-track release for the Scottish indie pop group led by Stuart Murdoch was produced by Leo Abrahams. It collects the songs from three earlier EPs released in December, January and February into one full-length album.

Title: Sagara
Info: Producer Joachim Dyrdahl's music was commissioned for Norway's Oye festival, which this third album contains.

Title: Content
Info: The English post-punk legends release another album of minimalist dance punk; their first collection of new material in 16 years.

Title: Go Fly a Kite
Info: The fifth solo album for the Texas-based singer is his first on his own label, The Noise Company.

Title: Tell Me if You Like To
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Tarek Musa.

Title: Summertime: Willie Nelson Sings Gershwin
Info: Produced by Buddy Cannon, the country singer-songwriter covers songs by the Gershwin brothers features guest appearances from Cyndi Lauper and Sheryl Crow.

Title: Bury Me in My Rings
Info: This is the third album for the side project led by Blake Sennett, the guitarist for Rilo Kiley.

Title: Internal Logic
Info: The second full-length album from trio from San Francisco is its first on their own label.

Title: Holograms
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Swedish post-punk rock band.

Title: Still Night, Still Light
Info: The third album for the all-girl trio from Brooklyn, New York.

Title: You Know Who You Are
Info: The eighth full-length release for the New York indie rock band was produced by Tom Beaujour.

Title: Damage
Info: Described as an adult breakup album by lead singer Jim Adkins, the eighth studio release for the Arizona rock band was produced by Alain Johannes.

Title: Department of Disappearance
Info: The latest solo album for the former frontman of Grandaddy was recorded at his home studio in Montana.

Title: The OF Tape, Vol. 2
Info: The latest album from the Los Angeles hip-hop collective led by Tyler, The Creator includes all 11 members.

Title: Live It Out
Info: This is the second full-length for the Toronto group fronted by Emily Haines, who is also a member of Broken Social Scene.

Title: Made of Bricks
Info: After the success of the single "Foundations," her debut album was released five weeks early and opened as the number-one album in the UK.

Title: MOSS
Info: The second full-length release for actress/singer-songwriter Maya Hawke features a guest appearance from Will Graefe.

Title: Lust for Youth
Info: The latest release for the Scandinavian synth/electro-pop duo of Hannes Norrvide and Loke Rahbek was produced by Malthe Fischer.

Title: Parallels
Info: The fourth full-length release for Jason Chung as Nosaj Thing features guest appearances from Kazu Makino, Zuri Marley and Steve Spacek.

Title: Young Narrator in the Breakers
Info: The debut full-length release for the Brooklyn-based experimental pop quintet was co-produced by Danny Molad and Sam Cohen.

Title: This Path Tonight
Info: The first solo release in 14 years for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Shane Fontayne.

Title: Five American Portraits
Artist: The Red Krayola With Art & Language
Info: The latest from Red Krayola and Art & Language features five tracks about the following people: Wile E. Coyote, President George W. Bush, President Jimmy Carter, John Wayne, and artist Ad Reinhardt.

Title: S-M Backwards
Info: The Norwegian rock band releases a collection of songs previously only available in Norway.

Title: Varcharz
Info: This more typically abstract effort for the German duo is their first release for Ipecac and their first album since 2004's poppier 'Radical Connector.'

Title: In A Safe Place
Info: Classically-trained guitarist Jimmy LaValle, who has played on albums by Tristeza and Black Heart Procession in addition to his own Album Leaf project, traveled from San Diego, CA to Iceland to record this third Album Leaf disc as a guest of Sigur Ros. Members of Sigur Ros, Mum, and Black Heart Procession appear on the album.

Title: To The 5 Boroughs
Info: The B-Boys, who have moved back to New York from their temporary home of Los Angeles, return with their first album in six years and their second to utilize the beats of Mixmaster Mike. These 15 tracks are all self-produced by the band (a first) and recall the style of their earliest work.

Title: blink-182
Info: Definitely not your typical blink-182 album, this eponymous release finds the once-juvenile band finally showing a mature side, and winning critics over in the process. The Cure's Robert Smith guests on one track.

Title: Shock'n Y'All
Info: The country singer seeems to enjoy pushing buttons (albeit with a sense of humor), and he continues his recent forays into politicized music with this latest LP, which features songs such as "American Soldier" and "The Taliban Song."

Title: Coral Fang
Info: The punk outfit led by Brody Armstrong (oops--make that Brody Dalle, now) makes its major-label debut with 'Coral Fang,' the band's third release overall.

Title: 3D
Info: The two surviving members of the popular R&B trio completed this long-delayed fourth album after the early 2002 death of cofounder Lisa "Left Eye" Lopes.

Title: Gorillaz
Info: Forget concept albums; this is a concept band. Formed by Dan "The Automator" Nakamura, Del tha Funkee Homosapien, Blur's Damon Albarn, Cibo Matto's Miho Hatori, and the Tom Tom Club's Tina Weymouth and Chris Frantz (with visuals by "Tank Girl" creator Jamie Hewlett), the Gorillaz are a "virtual" hip-hop outfit of cartoon characters based somewhere in the future. Hey, we don't make this stuff up; we just report it.

Title: Beautiful Thing
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the Hot Chip co-founder was produced by Tim Goldsworthy.

Title: New Facts Emerge
Info: The latest studio release for the British post-punk band led by Mark E. Smith was produced by Kieron Melling and Smith.

Title: Turn Ons
Info: Supergrass' Gaz Coombes and Danny Goffey team up to form The Hot Rats and release a debut album of covers produced by Nigel Godrich.

Title: Pinewood Smile
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British glam-metal band is its first with new drummer Rufus Tiger Taylor (son of Queen's Roger Taylor) and was produced by Adrian Bushy.

Title: Natural Forces
Info: The latest album for the country singer-songwriter was produced with Billy Williams.

Title: How Did We Get So Dark?
Info: The second full-length release for the British rock duo was first written instrumentally in sessions in Brighton, Los Angeles and Nashville before being recorded (with vocals) in Brussels.

Title: Pure Beauty
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the New York City indie rapper features contributions from such artists as Chase, Ricky Dubs, Donnie Fontaine, Brady James, Joe Hov, Marie Matusz, New York, San Holo, Steel Tipped Dove, Wonder Breed, and Zois.

Title: Another Country
Info: Merritt's third full-length studio album was produced by George Drakoulias.

Title: Mission Control
Info: This is the sophomore album for the indie rock band from Athens, Georgia.

Title: Georgia Gothic
Info: The third full-length release for the Atlanta-based duo Mattiel was mostly recorded in Northern Georgia.

Title: At Hope's Ravine
Info: The debut full-length release for the Scottish rock quartet was produced by Jon Schumann.

Title: Hyperview
Info: The third full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Will Yip.

Title: bounty
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Swedish electronic project of Jonna Lee and Claes Björklund contains music from videos released on YouTube before 2012's kin.

Title: The Weighing of the Heart
Info: The first release for French artist Cecile Schott since 2007’s Les Ondes Silencieuses was self-produced.

Title: I Will Set You Free
Info: The former member of Magazine and Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds releases his 10th solo album.

Title: Animal Lover
Info: The mysterious San Francisco-based artists--who have been at it now for over 30 years--return with a collection of vaguely animal-themed tracks.

Title: With Teeth
Info: Trent Reznor finally returns with a follow-up to 1999's 'The Fragile.' Dave Grohl guests.

Title: Thr33 Ringz
Info: The third album for the Florida artist features guests such as Chris Brown, Akon, Ludacris, Lil Wayne, Kanye West, Mary J. Blige and T.I.

Title: Circular Sounds
Info: The San Francisco-based singer releases his latest album on the Sub Pop label.

Title: Scramble
Info: The second album for the Atlanta-based female rock band.

Title: Voxtrot
Info: Victor Van Vugt produced this long-awaited full-length debut for the Austin, Texas group, who previously generated some buzz with a series of EPs.

Title: Ego Trippin'
Info: The ninth studio album includes guest artists such as Charlie Wilson, Too Short, Raphael Saadiq, and Pharrell.

Title: Teenager
Info: The Irish band's third album and is again produced by Tony Hoffer.

Title: Let It Beard
Info: The side project of Robert Pollard release a double album of power pop, the ninth album in three years.

Title: Dystopia
Info: This is the debut album for the Australian-based electronic band.

Title: How You Sell Soul to a Soulless People Who Sold Their Soul?
Info: The New York rap group's latest album.

Title: Lollipop
Info: The legendary rock trio returns with a new album on Megaforce Records.

Title: Backtracks
Info: The box set includes rare singles, live tracks from 1977-2000, and a music video DVD.

Title: Optical Delusion
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for electronic duo features guest appearances from Coppe, Dina Ipavic, Penelope Isles, The Little Pest, The Mediaeval Baebes, Anna B Savage, and Sleaford Mods.

Title: All My Relations
Info: The second release for Lightning Bolt's Brian Chippendale as Black Pus was produced by Keith Souza and Seth Manchester.

Title: Trustfall
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for pop artist P!nk features guest appearances from First Aid Kit, Chris Stapleton and The Lumineers.

Title: Baby 81
Info: After sitting out an album, drummer Nick Jago rejoins his BRMC bandmates, who return with a harder-edged recording than their 2005 acoustic departure 'Howl.'

Title: Rain
Info: Joe Jackson's first record in four years was recorded in Germany.

Title: Fight Softly
Info: The third album for the New Zealand-based indie band led by Ryan McPhun is its first on the Sub Pop label.

Title: reputation
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Future and Ed Sheeran.

Title: Arm's Way
Info: The sophomore album for the Montreal-based indie group is its first on the Anti- label.

Title: Mondo Amore
Info: Along with Atkins' hauntingly hypnotic voice, her new album bursts with booming percussion, piano-driven pop ballads, and swirling string-heavy songs.

Title: so sad so sexy
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Swedish singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Aminé and Rostam Batmanglij.

Title: English Little League
Info: Robert Pollard continues his prolific release of music with the indie band's fourth album since reuniting in 2012.

Title: Goodbye Killer
Info: After writing a novel and a soundtrack for it, Joe Pernice returns to the Pernice Brothers to record the band's first album in four years.

Title: Standing in the Breach
Info: This is the first release of new songs from the singer-songwriter since 2008's Time The Conqueror.

Title: For Your Entertainment
Info: The runner-up in season eight of American Idol releases his debut album.

Title: The  Mountain Moves
Info: The debut release for the London-based folk-rock band was recorded in Malibu and produced by Noah Georgeson.

Title: Advance Base Battery Life
Info: Owen Ashworth latest album is a collection of singles and compilation tracks released between 2005 and 2008.

Title: I
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Chilean duo recorded their parts individually and then had Uwe Schmidt to assemble them into four tracks.

Title: The Big Day
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Chicago rapper features guest appearances from Taylor Bennett, Francis And The Lights, Ben Gibbard, Gucci Mane, John Legend, Megan Thee Stallion, Shawn Mendes, Nicki Minaj, Smino and Justin Veron.

Title: One People One World
Info: The 10th full-length release for the saxophonist (and oldest son of Afrobeat artist Fele Kuti) was recorded mainly in Lagos with his band Positive Force.

Title: Glory
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the pop artist features a guest appearance from G-Eazy as well as contributions from Dan Book, Burns, Cashmere Cat, Andrew Goldstein, Ian Kirkpatrick, Mattman & Robin, Mischke, Nick Monson, Justin Tranter, and Tramaine "Young Fyre" Winfrey.

Title: Atheist's Cornea
Info: The first release in five years for the Japanese post-rock/hardcore quintet is its shortest at 43-minutes long.

Title: No Control
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Tennessee band features production by Patrick Carney on two tracks.

Title: Acoustic Dust
Info: The acoustic release from the former Sonic Youth guitarist was recorded live in Barcelona.

Title: Oui Oui, Si Si, Ja Ja, Da Da
Info: This is the 10th studio album for the British ska band.

Title: Bardo Pond
Info: The Philadelphia-based psychedelic rock band releases its first album on the Fire Records (UK) label.

Title: Sand+Silence
Info: Ivan Howard and Kelly Crisp worked with Justin Vernon on their sixth full-length release.

Title: Bossalinis & Fooliyones
Info: The official studio release for the Oakland, California rap duo of Squadda B and MondreMAN features guest appearances from DaVinci, Gucci Mane, Mon$ta, and Shady Blaze.

Title: Time's All Gone
Info: The latest album for the Los Angeles-based singer was inspired by 1950s rock 'n' roll and R&B.

Title: III/IV
Info: Adams' fifth album with The Cardinals was recorded during the 2007 Easy Tiger sessions and is now being released as this double album. The two-disc effort is full of guitar-driven hard rock, as well as more downbeat, melodious tracks.

Title: Rather You Than Me
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Dej Loaf, Future, Gucci Mane, Anthony Hamilton, Jeezy, Meek Mill, Nas, Raphael Saadiq, Chris Rock, Scrilla, Ty Dolla $ign, Wale, Yo Gotti, and Young Thug.

Title: Ultra
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British electronic artist features collaborations with Banshee, Burial, Darkstar, and Rezzett.

Title: The Night Creeper
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British psychedelic metal band was inspired by Italian slasher films and was produced by Laim Watson.

Title: Love, Angel, Music, Baby
Info: The solo debut for the No Doubt vocalist features an eclectic group of guests, including Martin Gore, Andre 3000, The Neptunes, New Order, Wendy & Lisa and Dr. Dre.

Title: Trading Snake Oil For Wolftickets
Info: Available for several years on his own website, Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter Gary Jules' second album finally got a major-label release in 2004 thanks to the unexpected success of one of its tracks--a cover of Tears For Fears' "Mad World"--that appeared on the Donnie Darko soundtrack.

Title: Quebec
Info: The eighth studio album for Gene and Dean Ween is their strangest (and definitely most eclectic) in quite some time. (And many Ween fans will probably see that as a good thing.)

Title: Anthem
Info: The Florida ska-punk band's third major-label release includes a cover of Cheap Trick's "Surrender."

Title: Chinatown
Info: This is the second album for the alt-folk trio from Vancouver, Canada.

Title: Diorama
Info: The former Australian teen grunge stars (whose 1995 debut was released when they were just 15) are still together, and this album marks their fourth release, highlighted by a more mature, refined sound.

Title: Son Of Evil Reindeer
Info: The creation of Snow Patrol's Gary Lightbody, the Reindeer Section is a Scottish indie-pop supergroup. For this sophomore effort, the Section includes appearances from a whopping 27 people, including members of Belle & Sebastian, Arab Strap, Astrid, Mogwai, Mull Historical Society, Idlewild and Teenage Fanclub.

Title: Cover Magazine
Info: As you may have guessed from the title, this is an album of covers by Howe Gelb, mainly recorded with Calexico's Joey Burns and John Convertino. The ten studio tracks and three live performances include versions of Sonny Bono's "The Beat Goes On," Grandaddy's "Blue Marble Girl," and Black Sabbath's "Iron Man."

Title: Goodbye Country (Hello Nightclub)
Info: The official follow-up to 1999's 'Vertigo' finds the London duo collaborating with Richie Havens, Nile Rogers, Tim Hutton and Jeru Tha Damaja. The lead single is "Superstylin."

Title: Aaltopiiri
Info: The latest release from the band formerly known as "Panasonic."

Title: Occult Architecture, Vol. 2
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Oregon psychedelic duo explores the light side on this second of a two-part concept that explores dark and light/ying and yang energies.

Title: Fragrant World
Info: The third release for the Brooklyn rock trio was self-produced.

Title: Lightbulbs
Info: This is the third album from the English electronic quartet.

Title: Cherish the Light Years
Info: The New York-based synth pop group -- which began as Wesley Eisold's (American Nightmare, Some Girls) solo project -- release their full-length debut.

Title: Every Kingdom
Info: This is the debut folk rock album for the British singer-songwriter.

Title: Bella
Info: The son of the British folk duo Richard and Linda Thompson releases his fifth album of folk pop, complete with rich harmonies and catchy melodies.

Title: Beacons Of Ancestorship
Info: The rock band releases its first album of new material since 2004's "It's All Around You."

Title: Any Day
Info: The first new release in six years for the Chicago indie rock band is its first without bassist Eric Claridge.

Title: Alexander
Info: Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros' lead singer, Alex Ebert, releases his debut solo album.

Title: The Classic
Info: Produced by Tyler Wood, the fourth full-length studio release for Joan Wasser features guest appearances from Joseph Arthur and Reggie Watts.

Title: L'Aventura
Info: The sixth full-length release for the French pop artist was influenced by Brazilian music.

Title: Ropechain
Info: The second full-length release from the San Francisco-based duo of  Ripley Johnson and Sanae Yamada was inspired by Ralph Waldo Emerson's essay of the same name.

Title: Circles
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Australian singer-songwriter.

Title: Slow Gum
Info: The fifth studio album for the rapper features guest appearances by such artists as Andre 3000, Dr. Dre, Drake, Jay-Z, Meek Mill, Ne-Yo, Omarion, Usher, and Wale.

Title: God Forgives, I Don't
Info: Tom Jenkinson's latest album as Squarepusher returns to electronica with a release created with a visual component for his live shows.

Title: Ufabulum
Info: The live album for the duo of Kim Gordon and Bill Nace was recorded at Knoxville's 2014 Big Ears Festival.

Title: No Waves
Info: The latest album by California noise rock band Thee Oh Sees led by John Dwyer was recorded in Sacramento and features a 14-minute song.

Title: Warm Slime
Info: The debut full-length album for the New York indie rock band was produced by Chris Zane.

Title: Technicolor Health
Info: The debut solo release for the lead singer of Supergrass was produced by Sam Williams.

Title: Presents...Here Come the Bombs
Info: The Boston rapper releases his third full-length album featuring Bahamadia, Dumbtron, and Vinnie Paz as guest artists.

Title: I Heard It Today
Info: Produced by John Congleton, the third release from the San Francisco indie rock band includes Joanna Newsom as a guest singer on one track.

Title: We the Common
Artist: Thao & the Get Down Stay Down
Info: This is the fourth album for the Brooklyn noise-rockers.

Title: Broken Ear Record
Info: The collaboration between Jarvis Cocker and Chilly Gonzales is a song cycle about the various famous people who have stayed at Los Angeles's Chateau Marmont.

Title: Room 29
Info: The first release in 11 years for the British garage rock band led by Carl Barât and Pete Doherty.

Title: Anthems for Doomed Youth
Info: The debut full-length release for the Australian post-punk band was mixed by Nigel Lee-Yang of HTRK.

Title: The Unsemble
Info: The debut release for the trio formed by the Jesus Lizard's Duane Denison, Einsturzende Neubaten's Alexander Hacke, and Silver Jew's Brian Kotzur includes five improvised tracks.

Title: Dungeonesse
Info: Dance and R&B influences the full-length debut from Wye Oak's Jenn Wasner and Art Department's Jon Ehrens.

Title: Mungodelics
Info: The Norwegian electronic duo follow-up to their 2011 album Schlungs is a collection of original tracks and songs they remixed for other artists.

Title: Air Museum
Info: The ambient duo of Brendon Anderegg and Koen Holtkamp releases its second album.

Title: Not Music
Info: The 10th studio album from the British post-rock band sticks to the formula that contributes to its longevity--synth-laden instrumentation and experimental dream-pop over delicate female vocals, containing tracks from previous sessions.

Title: II
Info: This is the second album for the two Norwegian artists together.

Title: Peachtree Road
Info: The veteran singer's first completely self-produced album is his first studio recording since 2001's 'Songs From The West Coast.'

Title: The Ownerz
Info: This is the first album in five years for the duo of DJ Premier and Guru.

Title: Deja Entendu
Info: This sophomore disc finds the young emo band expanding on its sound with the help of producer Steven Haigler (Pixies, Quicksand).

Title: Skimskitta
Info: Perhaps finding "Chantal Passamonte" too dull a name for an experimental electronica artist signed to Warp Records, the former Warp publicist adopted the Mira Calix moniker prior to her 2000 debut. This is her second full-length release.

Title: Always Got Tonight
Info: Chris Isaak's eighth album is his first since the disappointing sales of 1998’s 'Speak of the Devil,' but also his first since he took to the small screen in a Showtime comedy series.

Title: Comfort Eagle
Info: This is the fourth album for the Sacramento-based alternative rockers best known for their hits "Never There" and "The Distance."

Title: Faith In The Future
Info: The debut album from California electronic artist Timothy Wiles includes collaborations with Beenie Man and Davey Dave.

Title: Party Store
Info: Paying tribute to the techno pioneers of Detroit,  the garage rock band out of Michigan delve into a bit of disco and dance music with the reinterpretation of programmed drums and synths on their latest release.

Title: Coco Beware
Info: This debut album for the New York City-based indie pop quintet was produced by Nick Stumpf.

Title: Perch Patchwork
Info: Maps & Atlasesâ€™ second EP, You and Me and the Mountain, found the band moving in a lighter direction than the mathematical frenzy of their first EP Trees, Swallows, Houses. Their first full-length sees them fully morphed into a sophisticated indie pop group. Perch Patchwork is a bold debut, filled with bombastic arrangements, twisting modal progressions, and percussive layers. The skill set is high, but itâ€™s far less showy. Guitarists will still be enthralled by Dave Davidson's and Erin Elders' fingertapping, but acoustics take precedent, and moderately slow tempos maintain the album's balladic feel. If Trees, Swallows, Houses felt like a cousin to Don Cab or Hella, their first Barsuk outing has adapted the organic spirit of their Northwestern labelmates (particularly that of Menomena, the Long Winters, and John Vanderslice.) Of course, with Maps & Atlases' virtuosic chops and syncopated leanings, they kind of resemble BLK JKS or Minus the Bear, albeit with a Jethro Tull influence. Trendy South African rhythms and austere strings spin a web around Davidsonâ€™s poetic lyrics, and in this intricate, introspective setting, their talent becomes very clear. ~ Jason Lymangrover

Title: Once Upon A Time In The West
Info: The follow-up to their hit debut album for the British indie-rock group.

Title: Everybody Loves Sausages
Info: The first covers album for the Los Angeles grunge/metal band includes guest appearances from such artists as Mudhoney's Mark Arm, Jello Biafra, Neurosis' Scott Kelly, Melvins Lite, and J.G. Thirlwell.

Title: Pigeonheart
Info: The second full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter from Buffalo was co-produced with Ben Hillier.

Title: Hunger
Info: The debut album for the British band was produced by Edwyn Collins.

Title: Folkocracy
Info: The latest full-length release from Rufus Wainwright features folk cover songs with guest appearances by Anohni, Andrew Bird, David Byrne, Brandi Carlile, Sheryl Crow, Madison Cunningham, Susanna Hoffs, Chaka Khan, Lily Lanken, John Legend, Anna McGarrigle, Van Dyke Parks, Nicole Scherzinger, Chris Stills, Chaim Tannenbaum, Martha Wainwright, and Lucy Wainwright Roche.

Title: Sholi
Info: The debut full-length album for the trio from Davis, California was produced by Greg Saunier (Deerhoof).

Title: Langhorne Slim
Info: This is the sophomore album for the folk singer from Pennsylvania.

Title: Warm Blanket
Info: The third full-length release for the Mississippi artist was recorded in a haunted Victorian house in St. Augustine, Florida.

Title: Sudden Elevation
Info: The third full-length release for the Icelandic singer is her first entirely sung in English.

Title: Pleasure
Info: Formerly known as Pure Ecstasy, Pure X's debut full-length album was recorded live.

Title: Repentless
Info: Produced by Terry Date, the 11th full-length studio release for the California trash metal band is the first with Exodus guitarist Gary Holt who took over from co-founding guitarist Jeff Hanneman who passed away in 2013.

Title: Boys Don't Cry
Info: The second release from Rumer is a covers album of 1970s songs originally sung by such artists as Isaac Hayes, Bob Marley, Jimmy Webb, and Townes Van Zandt.

Title: Strangers to Ourselves
Info: This is the first full-length studio release from alternative rock band led by Isaac Brock in eight years.

Title: The 2nd Law
Info: The sixth album for the British rock band features bassist Chris Wolstenholme on lead vocals for two tracks he wrote.

Title: Mean Old Man
Info: The rock-and-roll legend's latest release is his second album of duets with such artists as Eric Clapton, Sheryl Crow, Merle Haggard, John Fogerty, Kid Rock, Kris Kristofferson, John Mayer, Willie Nelson, Keith Richards, and Slash.

Title: Red Yellow & Blue
Info: The third album for the indie rock band from Canada.

Title: A Corpse Wired for Sound
Info: The Tampa band is back to a trio (Carson Cox, Dave Vassalotti, and Pat Brady) for its second full-length on the 4AD label and was for the first time recorded partly in a studio.

Title: Exo
Info: The New York industrial electronic duo of Aaron David Ross and Matthew Arkel releases their debut full-length on the Hippos In Tanks label.

Title: Meet Glen Campbell
Info: The country singer releases a covers album featuring songs from contemporary rock groups such as U2 and Green Day as well as classic artists such as John Lennon and Velvet Underground.

Title: Agony & Irony
Info: The latest album for the punk rock trio from Illinois was produced by Josh Abraham.

Title: Kick Up The Fire And Let The Flames Break Loose
Info: This is the second album for the Reading, England rock band.

Title: This Is Really Going To Hurt
Info: The second full-length British indie trio was recorded in Los Angeles with Justin Raisen, Andrew Sarlo  and mixing engineer Ali Chant.

Title: Lovelaws
Info: The debut full-length solo release for Warpaint guitarist Theresa Wayman was co-produced with her brother Ivan, Dan Carey and Money Mark.

Title: Inner Journey Out
Info: The fifth full-length release for the New York duo features a guest appearance from Hope Sandoval.

Title: The Lexicon of Love II
Info: Martin Fry worked with Anne Dudley on the sequel to his 1982 album The Lexicon Of Love.

Title: Man Plans God Laughs
Info: The 13th release for the rap group led by Chuck D was produced by Gary "G-Wiz" Rinaldo.

Title: It's a Pleasure
Info: This is the fourth full-length release for the son of British rock artist Ian Dury.

Title: Bored Nothing
Info: The debut release for the solo music project from Australian Fergus Miller collects tracks he recorded at home and released independently.

Title: Blown Away
Info: The fourth studio album for the Grammy-winning country singer was produced by Mark Bright.

Title: Asylum
Info: Chicago's hard rock arena-headliners return with another album of heavy metal hits that recall early Metallica and Iron Maiden while maintaining their trademark dark sound.

Title: Crash Love
Info: The eighth full-length album for the rock band was produced by Joe McGrath and Jacknife Lee.

Title: Rockwell
Info: The debut full-length album for the singer was produced by Steve Albini.

Title: Memory Man
Info: London-based singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist Matt Hales returns with a second album following two years of touring in support of his debut 'Strange And Beautiful.'

Title: Shine
Info: Brendan O'Brien produced the singer's first post-Phish solo record.

Title: Vol. 4 :: Slaves of Fear
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles noise rock band was produced by Lars Stalfors.

Title: Woodstock
Info: The eighth full-length release for the indie rock band was recorded twice [they discarded a majority of the first session] with production from Danger Mouse, John Hill, Mike D, and Ammar Malik.

Title: Ladyhawke
Info: The debut album for the New Zealander Pip Brown.

Title: Twilight Of The Innocents
Info: The fifth and last full album for the UK band. In the future they will release only singles.

Title: Human Energy
Info: The latest full-length solo release for Travis Stewart as Machinedrum features guest appearances from Tosin Abasi, Jesse Boykins III, D?WN, Kevin Hussein, Rochelle Jordan, MeLo-X, and Ruckazoid.

Title: Red
Info: This is the second full-length album for the Norwegian electronic duo.

Title: In the Blue Light
Info: The latest release for the singer-songwriter features new arrangements on 10 songs that span his career and features contributions from such artists as Jack DeJohnette, Bill Frisell, Steve Gadd, Wynton Marsalis, and yMusic.

Title: Stone Temple Pilots
Info: The Grammy-winning California rock band led by Scott Weiland returns with its first album in nearly a decade.

Title: Estoile Naiant
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British electronic producer is his first on the Wrap label.

Title: In The Absence Of Truth
Info: This fourth LP for the metal band follow's 2004's acclaimed 'Panopticon' as well as an opening slot on Tool's latest tour.

Title: How We Operate
Info: The UK rockers' fifth studio album is their first to utilize an outside producer, Gil Norton (Pixies, Foo Fighters).

Title: Gold Medal
Info: The Donnas' second major-label effort was produced by Butch Walker (Avril Lavigne, Injected).

Title: 21st Century Breakdown
Info: The eighth studio album for the band was produced by Butch Vig.

Title: You Hear Georgia
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Atlanta rock band was produced by Dave Cobb and features guest appearances from Jamey Johnson and Warren Haynes.

Title: Buoys
Info: The sixth full-length solo release for Noah Lennox as Panda Bear was co-produced and co-mixed with Rusty Santos.

Title: Icarus Falls
Info: The second full-length solo release for the former One Direction singer features guest appearances from Nicki Minaj and Timbaland.

Title: Felt
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian quartet was self-produced and mixed by John Congleton.

Title: Blast Off Through the Wicker
Info: The full-length debut release for the side project of Here We Go Magic's Luke Temple was recorded on a four-track tape recorder and was inspired by his move to California.

Title: The  Divine Feminine
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Pittsburgh rapper feature gusset appearances from Bilal, CeeLo Green, Ariana Grande, Kendrick Lamar, Njomza, Anderson .Paak, and Ty Dolla $ign.

Title: Monolith of Phobos
Info: The full-length debut from the collaboration between Primus bassist Les Claypool and Sean Lennon was written over two weeks at Claypool's house in Northern California.

Title: Keep It Together
Info: The third full-length release for the sister duo was produced by Paul Mahern.

Title: Discreet Desires
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the German electronic producer.

Title: Hermits on Holiday
Info: This is the debut release for the collaboration between Cate Le Bon and White Fence's Tim Presley.

Title: Sonic Soul Surfer
Info: Self-produced, the seventh full-length studio release from the blues artist features contributions from Luther Dickinson, Georgina Leach, Dan Magnusson, and Ben Miller.

Title: Tracker
Info: The eighth full-length solo release for the former Dire Straits lead singer was produced with Guy Fletcher.

Title: Playland
Info: The second full-length solo release for The Smiths' former guitarist was written while he was on tour.

Title: Favorite Waitress
Info: The tenth release for the upstate New York folk quintet was produced by Jeremy Backofen in Omaha, Nebraska.

Title: Sky Swimming
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British duo of Amelia Rivas and Christian Pinchbeck.

Title: Caramel
Info: The second full-length release for the New Zealand singer includes influences from funk, jazz, and psychedelic pop.

Title: Golden Suits
Info: The debut solo release for the Department of Eagles co-founder Fred Nicolaus was produced with Fraser McCulloch.

Title: Walk Through Exits Only
Info: The debut solo project from the Pantera and Down frontman with Bennett Bartley, Jose Manuel "Blue" Gonzales, and Marzi Montazeri as The Illegals was co-produced with Michael Thompson.

Title: Oak Island
Info: This is the second solo release for The War On Drugs' Dave Hartley as Nightlands.

Title: Dear...
Info: The debut album for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in his bedroom.

Title: New Blood
Info: The former Genesis singer rerecorded some of his songs with a 46-piece orchestra conducted by Ben Foster.

Title: Black and White
Info: The second album for the British rapper features guest appearances by Etta Bond, Chipmunk, Example, Darren B, Alex Mills, Daley, and Ed Sheeran.

Title: Together/Apart
Info: Benjamin Laub, aka as Grieves, releases his third album produced by Budo.

Title: Helioscope
Info: The post-rock band from Leeds, England, releases its second album produced by John Congleton.

Title: Factorycraft
Info: The Scottish trio that won a Scottish BAFTA for its cybraphon (an interactive "mechanical band in a box") releases its third album.

Title: Foreign Landscapes
Info: The follow-up to the German artist's 2008 album Ferndorf was recorded with San Francisco's Magik*Magik Orchestra.

Title: The Big Black And The Blue
Info: This is the debut album for the Swedish teenage sisters.

Title: Something For All Of Us...
Info: Broken Social Scene cofounder Brendan Canning releases his first solo album as a part of the "Broken Social Scene Presents" series.

Title: Backwoods Barbie
Info: Dolly Parton's first record on her own label features songs that will appear in the musical version of "9 to 5."

Title: Invitation Songs
Info: The Seattle-based band featuring ex-Pretty Girls Make Graves' Derek Fudesco releases their first album.

Title: The Inspiration
Info: The Atlanta rapper's second Def Jam album includes contributions from Three 6 Mafia, Timbaland, Ludacris, T.I., and Young Buck.

Title: Death In The Garden, Blood On The Flowers
Info: This is the second LP for the five-piece California indie pop band.

Title: Master Of Disaster
Info: Jim Dickinson produced this 21st album for Hiatt, which finds him backed by members of the North Mississippi Allstars.

Title: Faded Seaside Glamour
Info: 'Glamour' is the debut disc for the English band led by singer Greg Gilbert, whose voice has drawn him numerous comparisons to the Cocteau Twins' Liz Fraser (as odd as that may sound).

Title: Shadows Collide With People
Info: The Red Hot Chili Peppers guitarist returns with a follow-up to his 2001 solo release, 'To Record Only Water For Ten Days.'

Title: Team Boo
Info: This is the third album from the husband-wife duo of Kori Gardner (keyboards) and Jason Hammel (drums). Spoon's Jim Eno produced, along with John Croslin.

Title: Oaklandazulasylum
Info: This solo release from the anticon collective's Jonathan Wolf (aka Why?), also a member of cLOUDDEAD, sees the experimental rapper mixing in a healthy dose of indie guitar with beats and samples that venture from lo- to hi- fi.

Title: Keep On Your Mean Side
Info: "Coincidentally" released on the same day as the fourth album by the White Stripes, to whom the Kills are frequently compared, 'Mean Side' is the debut full-length for the UK blues-rock duo of VV (aka Alison Mosshart) and Hotel, who are backed by a drum machine (a la the Raveonettes).

Title: Daybreaker
Info: The English singer-songwriter's third LP features quite an array of guests, including Ryan Adams, Emmylou Harris, and the Chemical Brothers (who have utilized Orton's vocals on several of their own albums). Another longtime collaborator, William Orbit, appears for one track, with the remainder of the mixing duties falling to Everything But The Girl's Ben Watt.

Title: By The Way
Info: Although their ride has been rocky at times, the Los Angeles band is nearing its 20th anniversary. (And if you grew up listening to the band, doesn't that make you feel old.) This, their eighth album, finds the Chili Peppers working with producer Rick Rubin.

Title: Loudboxer
Info: The Netherlands-based techno artist returns with his fifth album, which is less experimental than previous efforts, instead offering a seamless set of hardcore techno.

Title: In The Afternoon
Info: The third and final album by the current lineup of this Chicago-based indie band (band member and Aesthetics label head Ken Dyber is leaving the group) includes 10 new tracks, featuring the alternating male/female vocals of Joseph Costa and Lindsay Anderson alongside the band's moody, haunting sound.

Title: Buzzkunst
Info: The Buzzcocks are back. Well, almost. Pete Shelley and Howard Devoto, founding members of that seminal punk band, have recorded together for the first time in over 25 years, resulting in these 14 brand-new electronica-laden tracks.

Title: The Lemonheads
Info: The Evan Dando-led band (now down to a trio) returns with its first studio disc in ten years. J Mascis guests.

Title: Painting of a Panic Attack
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Scottish indie rock band was produced by The National's Aaron Dessner.

Title: Minor Love
Info: Heavily influenced by the likes of Lou Reed and the Velvet Underground, Adam Green (the alternative-folk singer/songwriter better known for his stint with the lo-fi indie group Moldy Peaches) returns with his sixth studio album.

Title: Takes
Info: The third album for the London artist features covers of songs by such artists as Bjork, Aphex Twin, and PJ Harvey.

Title: Unorthodox Jukebox
Info: The second full-length release for the singer-songwriiter/producer includes production by Jeff Bhasker, Diplo, Paul Epworth, Mark Ronson, The Smeezingtons, and Andrew Wyatt.

Title: Buck The World
Info: Eminem, Dr. Dre, 50 Cent and Hi-Tek are among the producers on the rapper's second LP. Young Jeezy, T.I. and Snoop Dogg also guest.

Title: Strange Pleasures
Info: The second release for the London-based indie pop band led by Greg Hughes was influenced by 1980s pop music.

Title: Free To Stay
Info: 'Free To Stay' is the second record for the indie-pop duo of sisters Chloe (drums) and Asya (keyboards, vocals), who have opened for Death Cab for Cutie, Pearl Jam, Sufjan Stevens, The Go! Team and others, and who just happen to be 12 and 14 years old.

Title: Long Wave
Info: The ELO frontman releases a covers album of songs that inspired him, including Bobby Darin's "Beyond the Sea," Fain & Webster's "Love Is a Many Splendored Thing," Etta James' "At Last," Rodgers and Hammerstein's "If I Loved You," Rodgers & Hart's "Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered," and the Rolling Stones' "Mercy, Mercy."

Title: Kelis Was Here
Info: The singer's fourth album features production from will.i.am, Cee-Lo, Linda Perry, Max Martin and Raphael Saadiq (but, for the first time, not the Neptunes). Husband Nas also guests.

Title: Release Me
Info: Lyle Lovett's final album with Curb Records features guest appearances from k.d. lang, Kat Edmonson, and Sara and Sean Watkins.

Title: Sketches from the Book of the Dead
Info: The Australian artist releases his first solo album since leaving the Bad Seeds.

Title: Computers & Blues
Info: Mike Skinner had announced this fifth album would be his last as The Streets.

Title: Pajama Club
Info: Neil Finn and his new band, featuring his wife Sharon, release their debut album.

Title: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)
Info: The French duo expand on the score they created for the restoration of Georges Melies' silent short film Le Voyage dans la Lune in this full-length soundtrack.

Title: Sensuous
Info: Eclectic Japanese indie-rocker Keigo Oyamada returns with his first Cornelius album in five years.
The second full-length release for the pop group formed during the second season of The X Factor features guest appearances from Missy Elliott, Fetty Wap, and Ty Dolla Sign.

Title: Interiors
Info: The electronic second release for Cameron Mesirow was inspired by her move to New York.

Title: Amanda Leigh
Info: The latest album for the actress/pop singer was produced with Mike Viola and on her manager's new record label.

Title: The Ghost in Daylight
Info: Nick Talbot's fourth album on Warp sees the singer-songwriter moving back to a more folk-based sound.

Title: Alpinisms
Info: The debut album for the band led by ex-Secret Machines member Benjamin Curtis.

Title: Delirium
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British pop singer features production from Greg Kurstin, Max Martin, Ilya Salmanzadeh, and Ryan Tedder.

Title: Nina Revisited: A Tribute to Nina Simone
Info: The tribute album to the High Priestess of Soul was co-executive produced by Lauryn Hill and Robert Glasper with artist such as Mary J. Blige, Common, Lalah Hathaway, Gregory Porter, Lisa Simone, Alice Smith, Jazmine Sullivan, and Usher covering her standards.

Title: Dark Eyes
Info: The debut release for the Montreal indie rock band was co-produced by  Daniel Lagac and Nygel Asselin.

Title: The  Lion the Beast the Beat
Info: The fourth album for the band was produced by Jim Scott and includes several tracks written by Dan Auerbach of The Black Keys.

Title: Space Ducks
Info: The soundtrack to the singer-songwriter's comic book of the same name released at SXSW in 2012 features songs by Deer Tick, Eleanor Friedberger, Fruit Bats, Lavender Diamond, and Unknown Mortal Orchestra.

Title: The Babies
Info: The indie rock band formed by Cassie Romone of Vivian Girls and Kevin Morby of Woods releases its debut album.

Title: Temporary Pleasure
Info: The latest album for the electronic duo includes The Gossip's Beth Ditto, Hot Chip's Alexis Taylor, Super Furry Animals/Neon Neon's Gruff Rhys, Yeasayer's Chris Keating, Telepath, and Jamie Lidell as guest singers.

Title: In Our Bedroom After The War
Info: The fourth album for the Canadian indie rock band.

Title: Light At The End Of The World
Info: Gareth Jones produced this ten-song set from the duo of Vince Clark and Andy Bell.

Title: The Garden
Info: The electro-pop duo's third album once again features vocals by Sia Furler.

Title: U&I
Info: The fourth album for the electronic producer/artist who has worked with Bjork features Mt. Sims.

Title: Make Do With What You Got
Info: The singer tackles songs penned by the likes of Bob Dyland and Van Morrison on this Don Was-produced disc.

Title: Fever Dream
Info: The third full-length release for the Icelandic band was co-produced with Rich Costey.

Title: La La Land
Info: The second album for the Canadian indie rock band was recorded in Montreal and Paris, France.

Title: Himalayan
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British alternative rock trio was produced by Nick Launay.

Title: Non Stop Erotik
Info: Frank Black of The Pixies releases his latest solo album coproduced with Eric Drew Feldman.

Title: Passion, Pain & Demon Slayin'
Info: The sixth full-length release for the hip-hop artist features guest appearances from André Benjamin, Travis Scott, Willow Smith, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Braver Than We Are
Info: Produced by Anthrax's Paul Crook, the 13th full-length release from the singer-songwriter/actor sees the return of songs written by Jim Steinman.

Title: Back on the Planet
Info: The latest release for the Los Angeles producer is an instrumental album.

Title: No Need To Be Downhearted
Info: This is the third album for the English band led by brothers Alex and Tom White, who are also members of the band Brakes.

Title: 24K Magic
Info: The third full-length release for the R&B singer-songwriter was produced by Shampoo Press & Curl.

Title: Tonight: Franz Ferdinand
Info: The third album for the UK rock band was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Plays the Songs of Daniel Johnston
Info: After working as part of the backing band for Daniel Johnston's 2017 tour, the trio (Doug Martsch, Jason Albertini and Steve Gere) recorded an 11-song tribute album to the singer-songwriter.

Title: Moonlight
Info: The third full-length release for the San Francisco-born artist was produced by Dan Auerbach.

Title: Hypnotized
Info: The debut release for the side project for The Men's Nick Chiericozzi and Mark Perro was produced by Kyle Keays-Hagerman.

Title: This Is All Yours
Info: The follow-up to the British indie rock trio's Mercury Prize-winning debut was produced by Charlie Andrew and is its first without bassist Gwil Sainsbury, who left the band for personal reasons.

Title: I Want That You Are Always Happy
Info: The debut full-length album for the indie Australian group was coproduced with Mike Myers and recorded between touring.

Title: The Deep Field
Info: Connecticut singer-songwriter Joan Wasser returns with her third studio album of soulful songs.

Title: I Remember
Info: The second full-length release for the British electronic duo features guest appearances from Dreezy, Leikeli47, Pell, Popcaan, and ZUH.

Title: Shallow Bed
Info: The debut album for the folk-rock band led by Norwegian singer Peter Liddle was produced by Peter Katis.

Title: World Wide Funk
Info: The first full-length studio release for the funk artist in six years features guest appearances from Stanley Clarke, Manou Gallo, Alissia Benveniste, Big Daddy Kane, BlvckSeeds, Buckethead, Dennis Chambers, Chuck D, Tyshawn Colquitt, Dr. G., MC Eiht, Dru Down, Doug E. Fresh, Eric Gales, Justin Johnson, Mr. Talkbox, Musiq Soulchild, Snowbunny, October London, Kali Uchis, World-Wide-Funkdrive, Victor Wooten, Bernie Worrell, and X-Zact.

Title: Silfra
Info: American violinist Hilary Hahn improvised tracks with Hauschka (German pianist Volker Bertelmann) on this release recorded in Iceland.

Title: Mockingbird Time
Info: This is the first album to reunite the entire original lineup of the rock band since its 1985 release, Tomorrow the Green Grass.

Title: To Dreamers
Info: The San Francisco-based singer-songwriter releases his eighth album.

Title: Another Eternity
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Canadian electronic pop duo of Megan James and Corin Roddick.

Title: House on the Hill
Info: The second full-length release for the indie rock band featuring Vivian Girls' Cassie Ramone and Woods' Kevin Morby was produced by Rob Barbato.

Title: Go! Pop! Bang!
Info: The debut full-length release for the Baltimore club rapper features guest appearances by Akon, Robyn, Tyga, and Porcelain Black.

Title: Old Money
Info: The debut album for the Mars Volta guitarist.

Title: Fire On Corridor X
Info: The Alanta-based trio releases its debut album produced by Ben H. Allen.

Title: I'm Not Dead
Info: The Indigo Girls guest on the pop singer's first album since 2003.

Title: Undermind
Info: The Vermont jam band has announced that 'Undermind,' their 11th studio effort, will be their last. Tchad Blake produced.

Title: Buzzcocks [2003]
Info: Does the world really need another Buzzcocks album? Well, this new LP from Pete Shelley and Steve Diggle (which includes two tracks co-written by fellow original Buzzcock Howard Devoto), the band's fourth since re-forming in 1989, may be their best in many years.

Title: Ether Song
Info: The English band's second LP was recorded in Los Angeles with engineer Tony Hoffer (Beck, Air).

Title: Whip It On
Info: A male-female duo a la the White Stripes, Denmark's The Raveonettes make their debut with this brief disc of 8 neo-garage tunes.

Title: Where You Stand
Info: Produced with Michael Ilbert, the Scottish alternative rock band returns with its first studio release in five years.

Title: Good Grief
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn indie folk five-piece led by Jess Wolfe and Holly Laessig was produced by Shawn Everett.

Title: One Track Mind
Info: The fourth release for the New York experimental rock band includes produced by Royal Trux’s Neil Hagerty.

Title: Time Capsules II
Info: The full-length debut for Brad Oberhofer was produced by Steve Lillywhite.

Title: Ride Your Heart
Info: The full-length debut for Los Angeles-based sisters Jennifer and Jessie Clavin was influenced by 1970s punk and Southern California pop-rock.

Title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon [OST]
Info: The soundtrack to the second movie of the teen vampire book series features a remixed song from Muse's current album "The Resistance" and new songs from Death Cab For Cutie, The Killers, Bon Iver, St. Vincent, Thom Yorke, Lykke Li, Anya Marina, Black Rebel Motorcycle Club, Hurricane Bells, Sea Wolf, OK Go, Editors, and Grizzly Bear featuring Beach House's Victoria Legrand.

Title: The Pinkprint
Info: The third full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from  Beyoncé, Chris Brown, Drake, Ariana Grande, Skylar Grey, Jeremih, Lil Wayne, Lunchmoney Lewis, and Meek Mill.

Title: Berlin: Live At St. Ann's Warehouse [Live]
Info: The live album features Reed, for the first time in 30 years, singing songs from "Berlin" at St. Ann's Warehouse in Brooklyn, New York over five nights in December 2006.

Title: The Air Conditioned Nightmare
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Canadian producer/songwriter Arick Woodhead.

Title: Ski Mask
Info: This is the fifth release for the indie rock band led by Nick Thorburn.

Title: Three Men and a Baby
Info: In 1999, Mike Kunka of godheadSilo and the Melvins (King Buzzo, Dale Crover, and Kevin Rutmanis) were set to release an album together when it was sidelined by a variety of factors. 16 years later, they reunited to complete the album.

Title: Bloodlines
Info: On his second full-length release, British singer-songwriter James Mathé introduced drum machines, keyboards, and synths to the largely acoustic sound he had established on his debut disc.

Title: These Walls of Mine
Info: The experimental release sees the musician mixing various pieces of his own voice rapping, talking, and singing with music.

Title: King For A Day
Info: The eccentric Chicago artist returns with his first disc in three years.

Title: Madame X
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the pop artist features guest appearances from Anitta, Maluma, Quavo, and Swae Lee.

Title: Lost Friends
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Australian indie pop trio of Hannah Joy, Tim Fitz (who also produced) and Harry Day.

Title: Remember Us to Life
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was produced by Leo Abrahams.

Title: Saturdays=Youth
Info: The fifth album for the French electronic group led by Anthony Gonzalez was produced with Ken Thomas and Ewan Pearson.

Title: Widow City
Info: Thrill Jockey releases the New York duo's sixth album.

Title: Diluvia
Info: The second release for the indie pop quintet from New York was produced by Shane Stoneback.

Title: Maybach Music Group Presents: Self Made, Vol. 2
Info: The second volume of the rap release from the Maybach Music Group features tracks with Rick Ross, Wale, Meek Mill, T.I., Nas, Stalley, Omarion, Wiz Khalifa, and T-Pain.

Title: Phosphene Dream
Info: The Austin rock band that gained mainstream exposure on the UNKLE song With You in My Head featured in the film "The Twilight Saga: Eclipse," releases its third album on new label Blue Horizon.

Title: Axes
Info: The Brighton, England band re-teams with producer Steve Albini, but downplays the vocals of prior outing 'The Power Out' in favor of a mainly instrumental approach similar to that of their debut.

Title: Sunlight Makes Me Paranoid
Info: Another of the new new wave of New York bands, Elefant is fronted by Diego Garcia, who despite being born in Detroit and raised in Argentina, sounds awfully British on this short, ten-track debut.

Title: Record Collection
Artist: Mark Ronson and the Business Intl
Info: The DJ-turned-producer, who has worked with everyone from Lily Allen to Amy Winehouse, returns with his third studio album under his new moniker, with impressive dance-floor, disco-pop jams.

Title: Adiós
Info: Recorded in 2012-2013, the 64th and final studio album for singer-songwriter (who was diagnosed with Alzheimer's in 2011) features guest appearances from Roger Miller, Willie Nelson, and Vince Gill.

Title: Rad Times Xpress IV
Info: Jennifer Herrema returns with RTX's Nadav Eisenman, Brian Mckinley, Kurt Midness, and Jaimo Welch under the name Black Bananas.

Title: Eugene Mcguinness
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the singer-songwriter from England.

Title: FutureSex / LoveSounds
Info: Timbaland, will.i.am and Rick Rubin are among the producers on the singer's second solo set.

Title: Living Things
Info: The singer-songwriter (who also appears in the group The Thorns) releases his first official solo disc since 1999's 'In Reverse.' Van Dyke Parks guests.

Title: Hymns Of The 49th Parallel
Info: The Canadian singer-songwriter's Nonesuch debut features covers of songs by other Canadian singer-songwriters, including Neil Young, Leonard Cohen, Ron Sexsmith, Jane Siberry, and William Shatner. (OK, so maybe not the last one.) There's also one lang original for good measure.

Title: Lay Of The Land
Info: This loud but eclectic disc marks the debut for the sextet from Nottingham, England.

Title: Start Something
Info: This is the second album for the nu-metal band out of Wales.

Title: Fire
Info: Featuring guitarists named Rock and Roll Indian and Surge Joebot, the latest indie-rock sensation to come out of Detroit combines punk, new-wave and disco on this debut full-length. Included here is a new version of their hit single "Danger! High Voltage" with the White Stripes' Jack White on backing vocals.

Title: Demolition
Info: As the title implies, this is not a true follow-up to 2001's 'Gold,' but rather a collection of demo recordings--13 never-before-released tracks (down from a rumored four-CD set!) captured on tape during spare moments while on tour.

Title: Provisions, Fiction and Gear
Info: This is the Cincinnati, Ohio band's major label debut.

Title: Go Plastic
Info: This is the fifth full-length release from Tom Jenkinson (aka Squarepusher). "My Red Hot Car" is the lead single.

Title: The Electric Mile
Info: The first album from the Philly trio since 1999's Philadelphonic features guest appearances from Medeski Martin & Wood keyboardist John Medeski and Morphine drummer Billy Conway.

Title: Off With Their Heads
Info: The follow-up to the Leeds rock band's top selling sophomore album features Lily Allen and New Young Pony Club as guests.

Title: The Color Before the Sun
Info: The eigth full-length studio release for the alternative/progressive rock band is its first not tied to the Sanchez's conceptual Amory Wars story.

Title: Who Cares?
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter Rex Orange County features a guest appearance from Tyler, The Creator.

Title: Òran Mòr Session
Info: The Scottish band re-recorded its 2014's release Nobody Wants To Be Here And Nobody Wants to Leave acoustically at Glasgow's Oran Mor.

Title: Mad Love
Info: Pete Kember returns as producer on Christopher Porpora's album based on letters from an schizophrenic to her husband while she was in a German asylum.

Title: Stereo Typical
Info: This is the debut album for the British rap duo of Jordan "Rizzle" Stephens and Harley "Sylvester" Alexander-Sule that grew up together and met again in college.

Title: Six
Info: This is the latest album for the San Diego-based indie rock band.

Title: Fish Outta Water
Info: The Jurassic 5/Ozomatli member releases his debut studio solo album featuring such artists as Beenie Man, Anthony Hamilton, Talib Kweli, Damian "Jr. Gong" Marley, and Stephen Marley.

Title: Family
Info: Leann Rimes 12th album features Bon Jovi and Reba McEntire as guests.

Title: Play It As It Lays
Info: E Street Band member and the wife to Bruce Springsteen releases her third solo album.

Title: Octopus
Info: The eclectic UK band self-produced this third album in their Isle of Wight studios.

Title: Noctunes
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Washington state-based artist is his first with indie label Tender Loving Empire.

Title: Archive 2003-2006
Info: This collection from Daniel Rossen (Grizzly Bear) and Fred Nicolaus contains B-sides and songs from the never released 2006 second album "The January Sessions."

Title: Valhalla Dancehall
Info: Famous for its live performances, the indie rock band--based out of Brighton, England--weaves together atmospheric sounds to create an innovative new album.

Title: The North
Info: The sixth full-length album for the Canadian indie rock band was produced with Graham Lessard and Marcus Paquin.

Title: Actual Life 3 (January 1 - September 9 2022)
Info: The third release for British songwriter/producer Fred again... is the final part of his Actual Life trilogy of albums that features voice recordings and music samples.

Title: Chunky Shrapnel [Live]
Info: The live release features tracks from the Australian psychedelic rock band's 2019 tour.

Title: Antarctica
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles trio led by Will Ivy was recorded by Steve Albini.

Title: Revelations
Info: The third full-length release for the Las Vegas singer-songwriter was self-recorded and mixed.

Title: Chinese Fountain
Info: This is the fifth full-length release from the self-described "beach goth" California band.

Title: Sparks
Info: The fourth solo release for the British singer-songwriter includes guest appearances from deadmau5 and Vishal-Shekhar.

Title: Four (Acts of Love)
Info: Romantic love is the theme behind the sixth solo release for the former Bad Seed member that includes collaborations with PJ Harvey and covers of songs by Van Morrison, Roy Orbison, and The Saints.

Title: Ghost Town
Info: This is the sixth solo album for Mike Kinsella under the name Owen.

Title: Monuments to an Elegy
Info: The tenth full-length studio release from the alternative rock band led by Billy Corgan includes Mötley Crüe's Tommy Lee on drums.

Title: For Crying Out Loud
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British rock quintet was produced by the band's lead singer, Serge Pizzorno.

Title: For All Kings
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the trash metal band led by Joey Belladonna was produced by Jay Ruston and is its first with Jon Donais of Shadows Fall taking over lead guitars from Rob Caggiano.

Title: B'Day
Info: Beyonce's second album features production by Rodney Jerkins, Sean Garrett, the Neptunes, Rich Harrison and Swizz Beatz and a guest appearance by Jay-Z.

Title: Night of Hunters
Info: The singer-songwriter takes inspiration from classical music to create a "21st century song cycle" for her 12th album, released on the world-renowned German classical label, Deutsche Grammophon.

Title: World Wide Pop
Info: The second full-length release for London-based indie pop band Superorganism features guest appearances from Boa Constrictors, Dylan Cartlidge, CHAI, Gen Hoshino, Stephen Malkmus, and Pi Ja Ma.

Title: Snaxx
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based electronic/hip-hop producer features guest appearances from Jon Bap, Asal Hazel and Pink Siifu.

Title: Modern Blues
Info: The first studio release since 2011 from the band led by Mike Scott was recorded in Nashville.

Title: Vol. 1
Info: Singer-songwriter Colin Caulfield's second full-length album and his first with a full band was produced by John McEntire of the Sea and Cake.

Title: Best Behavior
Info: The Brooklyn trio blend dance and indie rock music together for a 1980s feel on its second album.

Title: This Is Not a Safe Place
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the British shoegaze band was produced by Erol Alkan and mixed by Alan Moulder with Caesar Edmunds.

Title: Zeroes QC
Info: The debut album for the Montreal experimental rock quartet was produced with Jace Lasek of The Besnard Lakes.

Title: Knowle West Boy
Info: The British rapper's eighth album was named in part after the area he grew up in.

Title: Sugar at the Gate
Info: The third full-length release for the Montreal indie pop band was recorded in a former brothel in the Los Angeles area.

Title: The Infamous Mobb Deep
Info: The eighth studio release for the rap duo of Havoc and Prodigy features guest appearances from Bun B, Busta Rhymes, French Montana, Juicy J, The Lox, Nas, Snoop Dogg, and Mack Wilds. It also includes a disc of unreleased tracks from 1995's The Infamous sessions.

Title: The Evening Descends
Info: The sophomore album from the Oklahoma indie rock band.

Title: Within and Without
Info: Ernest Greene releases his first full-length of dreamy synth-pop under his Washed Out moniker.

Title: Former Lives
Info: The debut solo release for the Death Cab For Cutie singer under his name (he released a solo album under the name All-Time Quarterback! in 1999) features a duet with Aimee Mann.

Title: Danger Days: The True Lives of the Fabulous Killjoys
Info: My Chemical Romance's latest release -- four years after the last album -- reveals a slightly different sound and style for the band while keeping its recognizable emo meets rock-and-roll spirit.

Title: Deap Lips
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the collaboration between Deap Vally and The Flaming Lips' Wayne Coyne & Steven Drozd.

Title: Loud Hailer
Info: The first studio release in six years for the the British guitarist was produced with Filippo Cimatti and features Rosie Bones and Carmen Vandenberg.

Title: The Ridge
Info: The second full-length release for the Arcade Fire band member features Jeremy Gara on drums.

Title: MG
Info: The debut full-length studio release for Depeche Mode's Martin Gore contains 16 instrumental electronic tracks.

Title: Amen & Goodbye
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn-based band features guest appearance by Suzzy Roche of The Roches and was produced by Joey Waronker.

Title: Earth
Info: The debut full-length solo release for Radiohead guitarist Ed O'Brien features guest appearances by Laura Marling and Portishead's Adrian Utley.

Title: Human Again
Info: Producer David Kahne worked on the singer-songwriter's fifth album.

Title: All Jacked Up
Info: Album number two finds the Nashville star reuniting with songwriter John Rich in an attempt to duplicate the mega-success of her debut, 'Here For The Party.'

Title: Tha Blue Carpet Treatment
Info: Dr. Dre, Timbaland and the Neptunes are among the producers for an album that finds Snoop joined by The Game, Stevie Wonder, Ice Cube, R. Kelly, Brandy, and others.

Title: Shoot For The Stars Aim For The Moon
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper is also a posthumous album following his death in February 2020. It features guest appearances from 50 Cent, DaBaby, Future, Karol G, King Combs, Lil Baby, Lil Tjay, Quavo, Roddy Ricch, Rowdy Rebel, Swae Lee, and Tyga.

Title: Future Hndrxx Presents: The WIZRD
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from Gunna, Travis Scott and Young Thug.

Title: Intuit
Info: Menomena's Brent Knopf releases the first album of his solo project, Ramona Falls, which features more than 30 guests musicians.

Title: Atlantis: Hymns For Disco
Info: Toronto's Kheaven Brereton returns with his third studio album of indie hip-hop mixed with a variety of other genres.

Title: Pray for the Wicked
Info: The sixth full-length release for Brendon Urie was written after his stint in Broadway's Kinky Boots and was produced by Jake Sinclair.

Title: When We Stay Alive
