Info: The fourth full-length release for the Minneapolis band features songs written while frontwoman Channy Leaneagh was recovering from a back injury.

Title: Sequitur
Info: The second solo release from the Emeralds' Steve Hauschildt was recorded with nearly 20 different instruments.

Title: ...And Then You Shoot Your Cousin
Info: The concept album about violence in America for the hip hip group features guest vocals from Black Thought, Michel Chion, Patty Crash, Raheem DeVaughn, Dice Raw, Mercedes Martinez, Greg Porn, Nina Simone, and Mary Lou Williams.

Title: Damage and Joy
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Scottish alternative rock band was produced by Youth and is its first new studio album in 18 years.

Title: Shine Your Light
Info: The second release for Gabe Fulvimar was produced by Conspiracy of Owls' Bobby Harlow.

Title: Dry Land is Not a Myth
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles five-piece includes influences from rock, electronic, and world music.

Title: Issa Album
Info: The debut studio release for the Atlanta rapper features production from DJ Mustard, Jake One, Metro Boomin, Southside, and Zaytoven.

Title: A  World Out of Time
Info: The second release in 2012 for the Portland psychedelic rock band was recorded in its entirety instead of select tracks from hours of recording sessions.

Title: Busting Visions
Info: This is the second album from the Canadian indie rock band led by Broken Social Scene singer-songwriter Jason Collett.

Title: Sex Therapy
Info: The fourth album for the R&B singer features such guests as Estelle, The Game, Jay-Z, Kid Cudi, and Snoop Dogg.

Title: That Lucky Old Sun
Info: The ex-Beach Boys singer releases his latest solo album, which he produced himself.

Title: Sob Rock
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the pop singer-songwriter was co-produced with Don Was.

Title: Let Me Come Home
Info: The second album for the Scottish indie rock band was produced by Tony Doogan.

Title: Ultraviolet
Info: The debut album for the rap artist features guest appearances by David Banner, Estelle, Kanye West and Too Short. It was originally scheduled to be released as "Dream Date" in 2008.

Title: This Addiction
Info: Produced and recorded by the band along with the helping hand of producer Matt Allison, the Chicago punk-rock natives' seventh studio album, This Addiction, is the band's first release on their label Heart & Skull and their first with Epitaph Records.

Title: These Days...
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Black Hippy rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Action Bronson, Asaad, Danny Brown, Jay Rock, Kendrick Lamar, Lupe Fiasco, Rick Ross, Schoolboy Q, and SZA.

Title: Welcome the Worms
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles-based band that includes sister Jennifer and Jessie Clavin was co-produced by Joe Chiccarelli and Carlos de la Garza.

Title: Cope
Info: The fourth studio release for the Atlanta-based indie rock band was produced with Dan Hannon.

Title: The Red Light District
Info: Trick Daddy, Nate Dogg, DMX and Nas guest on the latest from the Atlanta-based rapper, with production from Timbaland, among others.

Title: The Boy Who Knew Too Much
Info: The second album for the London-based singer was produced with Greg Wells and features Imogen Heap and Final Fantasy's Owen Pallett as guests.

Title: Magnifique
Info: The fifth full-length release for the electronic duo of Mike Stroud and Evan Mast features a cover of Springwater's "I Will Return."

Title: Semicircle
Info: The fifth full-length release for the band led by Ian Parton features contributions from Amber Arcades, Detroit Youth Choir, Lispector, and Darenda Weaver.

Title: Scaled and Icy
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Ohio was produced and recorded remotely.

Title: Think of Spring
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter is a Billie Holiday covers album.

Title: Candid
Info: The third full-length release for the band features covers of songs from such artists as David Byrne, John Denver, Kelela, Moondog, Labi Sif, and SWV as well as a guest appearance from Waxahatchee.

Title: Beneath the Eyrie
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the alternative rock band was produced by Tom Dalgety.

Title: Chrissybaby Forever
Info: The third solo album for the ex-Girls frontman was co-produced with JJ Wiesler and was a surprise release on Bandcamp.

Title: The Golden Echo
Info: The second full-length release for the New Zealand-born singer-songwriter was produced by Rich Costey.

Title: 9 Songs
Info: The debut full-length release (which only contains eight songs) for the Southern California duo of Matt Pulos and Evan Laffer was produced by Foxygen's Jonathan Rado.

Title: Last Patrol
Info: The ninth studio full-length release for the New Jersey stoner rock band was produced by band members ave Wyndorf & Phil Caivano.

Title: Bitter Rivals
Info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn duo includes influences from pop and R&B music with a majority of the melodies written by singer Alexis Krauss.

Title: Hail to the King
Info: The first release with new drummer Arin Ilejay of Confide [takes over for James "The Rev" Sullivan, who passed away in 2009] for the California heavy metal band was produced by Mike Elizondo.

Title: Fantasy
Info: This is the third full-length release for the side project for Black Mountain band members Amber Webber and Josh Wells.

Title: Division Street
Info: The more rock-flavored second solo release for the son of Paul Simon was co-produced with Tom Rothrock.

Title: Krieg und Frieden (Music for Theatre)
Info: The 10th release for Sascha Ring as Apparat was originally commissioned for 2012 Ruhr Festival's stage production of Tolstoy’s War and Peace directed by Sebastian Hartmann.

Title: The Salesman and the Shark
Info: The third release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Woody Jackson and features guest vocals by Inara George, Petra Haden, and Isobel Campbell.

Title: Welcome To: Our House
Info: The second full-length release from the rap supergroup features guest appearances from Eminem, Busta Rhymes, Skylar Grey, Cee-Lo Green, and Swizz Beatz.

Title: Island Fire
Info: The fourth album for the British pop singer was written while she was sidelined in Australia by Icelandic ash in 2010.

Title: Radiosurgery
Info: The Florida pop-punk band's seventh album was produced by Neal Avron and is about the different emotions that occur when a relationship ends.

Title: In Light
Info: The full-length debut release for the Louisiana indie pop band was produced by Ben H. Allen.

Title: Liquid Love
Info: The electronica duo from Brooklyn, New York, releases its fourth full-length album.

Title: ...And the Ever Expanding Universe
Info: David Newfeld produced the Canadian indie rock band's third album.

Title: Secret, Profane & Sugarcane
Info: T Bone Burnett returns as producer for Elvis Costello's latest album, featuring an acoustic strings band.

Title: Honey From The Tombs
Info: The Stars vocalist makes her solo debut, backed by members of that band as well as of Broken Social Scene, Do Make Say Think, and Metric.

Title: Dimmer.
Info: 'Dimmer' is the Thrill Jockey debut for British ex-pat and current Chicagoan Jim Elkington.

Title: Emblems
Info: This is the fourth release for the chamber-pop outfit led by--yes--Matthew Pond and based in--you guessed it--Pennsylvania (Philadelphia, to be exact).

Title: Get Born
Info: 'Get Born' marks the debut of the Australian garage-rock quartet Jet.

Title: Fatherfucker
Info: Fresh off the electroclash touring circuit (and apparently in need of a good shave), ever-vulgar Canadian Merrill Nisker (aka Peaches) follows her 2000 debut 'The Teaches of Peaches' with 12 new tracks, including a duet with Iggy Pop.

Title: How I Learned To Write Backwards
Info: The Bay Area indie-pop band returns with their third album (and first in three years).

Title: American IV: The Man Comes Around
Info: Johnny Cash, still going strong at age 70, returns for a fourth album with producer Rick Rubin. Like the previous three pairings, this disc mixes Cash originals with unlikely covers, which this time out include Depeche Mode's "Personal Jesus," Nine Inch Nails' "Hurt," and Simon & Garfunkel's "Bridge Over Troubled Water." Fiona Apple, Nick Cave, and Don Henley are among the guests.

Title: Pretty.Odd.
Info: The follow-up to their platinum debut album finds the band dropping the exclamation point from their name.

Title: Heavy Rocks
Info: The Japanese experimental band's 16th album shares the same release date as Attention Please and seeks to redefine heavy music.

Title: Anything In Return
Info: The third full-length release for Chaz Bundick was inspired by his recent move from South Carolina to Berkeley, California.

Title: Songs
Info: The second album from dubstep producer/DJ Christopher Mercer, aka Rusko, features influences from pop, R&B, house, reggae, dancehall, and garage music.

Title: Coming Out of the Fog
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Baltimore psych-folk rock band led by Dave Heumann includes a guest appearance by Dave Hadley.

Title: Exit Strategy Of The Soul
Info: The latest album for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Martin Terefe.

Title: Just Who I Am: Poets & Pirates
Info: The 11th album for the Knoxville, Tennessee-born country singer.

Title: Smoke
Info: Cleveland-based Joe Williams' debut album was recorded in Ohio, New York, and California.

Title: Let Love
Info: The 12th full-length studio release from the rapper/actor features guest appearances from A-Trak, BJ The Chicago Kid, Leon Bridges, Daniel Caesar. Leikeli47, Jonathan McReynolds, Samora Pinderhughes, Jill Scott, and Swizz Beatz.

Title: Hippies
Info: The second full-length for the Austin trio features 16 tracks and is their first for Matador Records.

Title: Rosegold
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for the Nashville singer-songwriter features contributions from Tyler Cain, Nathan Chapman, Jake Mitchell, Niko Moon, Mikey Reaves, Jordan Reynolds, and Ben West.

Title: Joan Of Arc, Dick Cheney, Mark Twain...
Info: No, it's not a Jeopardy answer meriting the response "Who are three people who have never been in my kitchen?" but rather the latest noise-fest from Tim Kinsella & co.

Title: Guilt Show
Info: This is the fourth album for the Kansas City (Mo.)-based emo band.

Title: Comfort Woman
Info: The soul singer's fifth LP is less political than previous efforts, as may be expected from a disc that lists three tracks titled "Love Song."

Title: Passionoia
Info: This is the third LP for the English trio of vocalist Sarah Nixey, former Auteurs frontman Luke Haines and former Jesus & Mary Chain member John Moore. Together, they sound a bit like Saint Etienne, but with a much more political and satirical approach to their lyrics.

Title: The Thorns
Info: The Thorns is a collaboration between singer-songwriters Matthew Sweet, Shawn Mullins and Pete Droge, with this disc marking their first release together.

This debut disc for the New York duo of Warren Fischer and Casey Spooner was originally released in 2001 on Germany's International Deejay Gigolos label and immediately generated such buzz (partly due to the album's infectious 'electroclash' sound, and partly due to the pair's notoriety in the fashion scene) that English label Ministry Of Sound snapped up the album (and the duo) for a reported £2 million.

Title: Tulsa For One Second
Info: The latest full-length from the Chicago-based multimedia collective is a big step forward for the group, adding more vocals and an emotive indie-pop feel to their experimental electronic sound. Recommended for fans of the latest releases by bands such as Dntel, Hood, and Boards of Canada.

Title: The Instigator
Info: This solo set by the frontman of the (still intact) Old 97s was produced by Jon Brion, and ventures away from the alt-country sound of that group's work.

Title: Trouble in Shangri-La
Info: The first solo album in seven years for the Fleetwood Mac vocalist was partially produced by Sheryl Crow. Sarah McLachlan lends her voice to one track. Other guests include Macy Gray and Natalie Maines from the Dixie Chicks.

Title: Alone With Everybody
Info: The debut solo release from The Verve frontman Richard Ashcroft.

Title: Grand
Info: This is the second album for the duo from Brooklyn.

Title: The Boombox Ballads
Info: Welsh indie artist Stephen Black worked with arranger Paul Jones for his fifth release.

Title: The Forgotten Arm
Info: Produced by Joe Henry, Mann's first studio disc in three years is a concept album about the life of a boxer during the 1970s.

Title: High Off Life
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from DaBaby, Doe Boy, Drake, Future, Lil Baby, Lil Durk, Lil Uzi Vert, Meek Mill, Travis Scott, YoungBoy Never Broke Again, and Young Thug

Title: Kids in L.A.
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles duo of Jesse Kivel and Zinzi Edmundson was produced by Pete Wiggs and Tim Larcombe.

Title: For the Good Times
Info: The Little Willies with Norah Jones on vocals and piano return with their second disc of country covers song by such artists as Loretta Lynn, Dolly Parton, Johnny Cash, Cal Martin, Scotty Wiseman, Dangerous Curves, and Lefty Frizzell.

Title: Pop Voodoo
Info: The first new music from the band in over 20 years reunites Shaun Ryder and Kermit on an album produced by Youth.

Title: Wild Strawberries
Info: The latest release from the Oregon-based psych rockers was recorded in a cabin near Mount Hood.

Title: Sounds Of The Universe
Info: The first album to be released by EMI in the US (previously Warner Music had US rights) for the English alt-electronic band.

Title: Elegies to Lessons Learnt
Info: Sigur Ros producer Ken Thomas helped mix iLiKETRAiNS' first studio album.

Title: Collections from the Whiteout
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter  was produced with The National's Aaron Dessner.

Title: Be Myself
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was co-produced with Jeff Trott and Tchad Blake.

Title: Monterey
Info: The third full-length release for the California folk duo was recorded live on tour at the venues they would later performed on.

Title: Dedicated: A Salute to the 5 Royales
Info: The guitarist best known for working with Booker T & the M.G.'s releases a tribute album to the R&B band The 5 Royales.

Title: Running For The Drum
Info: This is the first album in over 17 years for the native american singer-songwriter.

Title: E Volo Love
Info: The fourth album for the Bristol, England-based indie pop band led by Frenchman Francois Marry is its first on the Domino label.

Title: Clear Heart Full Eyes
Info: The debut solo album of The Hold Steady's Craig Finn includes elements of country music.

Title: Tomorrow Morning
Info: This is the final section of the Eels' concept album trilogy, which began with last year's Hombre Lobo and End Times.

Title: All Love's Legal
Info: The third full-length release for Berlin-based Jam Rostron (formerly Janine Rostron) includes themes about gender equality and identity.

Title: Grace Around the World
Info: The CD/DVD set collects some of the performances the singer-songwriter gave during his world tour to promote his debut album, "Grace," from 1994 to 1996.

Title: Audio, Video, Disco
Info: The second full-length studio album for the French electronic duo features guest appearances by Ali Love, Morgan Phalen, and Vincent Vendetta.

Title: Pretty Ugly
Info: The debut album from Leon "Scratcha DVA" Smart features guest appearances by Natalie Maddix, Muhsinah, A.L. Zaki Ibrahim, Vikter Duplaix, Fatima, and Cornelia.

Title: In My Own Words
Info: The 22-year-old writer of songs for the likes of Mary J. Blige steps into the spotlight with his debut as an R&B artist.

Title: Trouble Maker
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Berkley punk band led by Tim Armstrong was produced by Brett Gurewitz.

Title: Windy City
Info: The country covers release for the multiple Grammy-winning singer was produced by Buddy Cannon.

Title: Ghostory
Info: The third album for the dream pop group is its first without Claudia Deheza and it tells a story about the ghosts that surround a girl named Lafaye.

Title: Keep It Simple
Info: The latest release for the Northern Irish singer is his first album with all original songs since 1999's Back on Top.

Title: Death of a Bachelor
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the rock band-turned-solo-act featuring Brendon Urie was produced by Jake Sinclair.

Title: Day & Age
Info: The Las Vegas band returns with its its third studio album produced by Stuart Price.

Title: Tutti
Info: This is the first full-length release in nearly 40 years for the British avant-garde artist.

Title: Masana Temples
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Japanese psychedelic rock band was recorded in Lisbon and was produced by Bruno Pernadas.

Title: The Mystery Lights
Info: The full-length debut release for the Brooklyn-based garage rock band led by Mike Brandon and LA Solano was produced by Wayne Gordon.

Title: To Where the Wild Things Are
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Swedish psychedelic dream-pop duo of Marleen Nilsson and Anders Hansson.

Title: Blood Speaks
Info: This is the second full-length album of folk and blues music from Katherine Blamire and Jessica Davies.

Title: Optica
Info: Self-produced (with some help from Johannes Berglund) by the band, the fourth release for the Swedish indie pop five piece was recorded over a year and half.

Title: Girl on Fire
Info: The fifth release for the R&B singer features co-written with such artists as Babyface, Gary Clark Jr., Dr. Dre, John Legend, Bruno Mars, Frank Ocean, and Emeli Sandé.

Title: The Inner Mansions
Info: This is the second release in 2012 for the Canadian electronic artist, Matt Halversen.

Title: Pre Language
Info: The third album for the Chicago indie rock band is the first with Sonic Youth drummer Steve Shelly.

Title: Point of Go
Info: Jonquil's third album sees the band downsized to a quartet with three members leaving to form the band Trophy Wife.

Title: Perfect Darkness
Info: The Brighton-based trio, led by producer and former DJ Fin "Fink" Greenall, release a fourth album of folk-y electro-pop.

Title: The Hymn of a Broken Man
Info: This is the debut album for the band, which features Adam Dutkiewicz and Jesse Leach of Killswitch Engage.

Title: Exclusive
Info: The sophomore album from the R&B artist features guest appearances by Big Boi, the Game, Lil Wayne, and Kanye West.

Title: Something To Tell You
Info: The second full-length release for the trio of sisters was co-produced with Ariel Rechtshaid and features contributions from Rostam Batmanglij and Dev Hynes.

Title: Music For Men
Info: Rick Rubin produces the band's major label debut album.

Title: Thank You for Today
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the indie rock band was produced by Rich Costey.

Title: Jaded & Faded
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn punk band was produced by Dave Sitek.

Title: Make My Head Sing...
Info: The third full-length release for the singer-songwriter was co-produced with her husband, Jesse Newport.

Title: The Captain & The Kid
Info: This ten-song effort is a sequel to the singer's 1975 album 'Captain Fantastic And The Brown Dirt Cowboy.'
This is the purple one's second straight set of mainstream music, following 2004's 'Musicology,' which itself followed a string of more esoteric releases.

Title: CrasH Talk
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Southern California rapper features guest appearances from 21 Savage, 6LACK, Kid Cudi, Lil Baby, Travis Scott, Ty Dolla $ign, and YG.

Title: Comfort
Info: The debut full-length release for the alt-rock band formed in England by Australian Sasha Carlson was produced by band member Toto Vivian.

Title: Tempest
Info: This is the fourth release for the instrumental rock band led by Nathan Burazer.

Title: First Impressions Of Earth
Info: The Strokes have abandoned longtime producer Gordon Raphael (well, for all but three tracks) in favor of David Kahne (Sugar Ray) for their third album.

Title: We're All Alright!
Info: The 18th full-length studio release for the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame rock band was produced by Julian Raymond.

Title: New Skin
Info: The debut full-length release for the side project of The Strokes' guitarist Nick Valensi was produced by Queens Of The Stone Age's Josh Homme.

Title: Our Pathetic Age
Info: The double album from the hip-hop DJ/producer features instrumentals in the first half and hip-hop collaborations that include such artists as De La Soul, Dave East, Ghostface Killah, Inspectah Deck, Nas, Pharoahe Monch, Pusha T, Raekwon, Run The Jewels, and Wiki in the second half.

Title: The Waves Pt. 1
Info: The latest full-length solo release for the Bloc Party frontman was self-produced.

Title: The  Past, The Present, The Future
Raw Solutions
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Russian-born New York-based electronic artist and producer.

Title: Infinite Arms
Info: The third album for the rock band led by Ben Bridwell is its first on Columbia and for new members Tyler Ramsey and Bill Reynolds who joined after the release of 2007's Cease to Begin.

Title: Motion To Rejoin
Info: The second album on Matador Records for the band based in New Mexico.

Title: The Diet
Info: The second full-length solo release for the ex-Smith Westerns frontman was recorded with Taylor Locke in Los Angeles.

Title: Girl at the End of the World
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Max Dingel.

Title: The Origin of Love
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British pop singer features guest appearances by Priscilla Renea and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Mouseman Cloud
Info: Robert Pollard follows his Guided By Voices' album with his latest solo album produced by Todd Tobias.

Title: Nights in the Dark
Info: The second full-length release for the Massachusetts rock band led by Lemmy Gurtowsky features the addition of Zack Brower.

Title: Catching a Tiger
Info: The Midwestern country-folk singer's full-length debut mixes twangy music from her hometown heartland with rock and pop into a catchy combination.

Title: VIEWS
Info: Originally titled Views From The 6, the fourth full-length studio release for the Canadian rapper features guest appearances from Kyla, Pimp C, Popcaan, and Wizkid.

Title: The House
Info: Mixed by Chris Coady, the third full-length release for the Aaron Maine's project features contributions from such artists as Jason Arce, Bea1991, Bryndon Cook, Alexander Giannascoli, Dev Hynes, Maya Laner, Kaya Wilkins, and Cameron Wisch, as well as his own father.

Title: Pink Sunset for No One
Info: This is the eighth full-length release for the solo electric guitar project of Sarah Lipstate.

Title: Life After Defo
Info: This the debut full-length electro-pop release for Daniel Woolhouse.

Title: Walking With The Beggar Boys
Info: On this sixth album, the Athens, GA band's lineup has been expanded to include guitarist Eric Harris (Olivia Tremor Control) and bassist Craig McQuiston (The Glands). Vic Chesnutt guests on the title track.

Title: Bad Timing
Info: The classic rock-influenced New York City group led by singer/songwriter Bill Whitten returns with its third album, produced by Mercury Rev's Dave Fridmann.

Title: Wiretap Scars
Info: This is the debut LP from the Texas band, which features three former members of At The Drive-In (including guitarist Jim Ward).

Title: On A Wire
Info: The third LP for Kansas City's Get Up Kids follows after endless touring with the likes of Weezer and Green Day, and sees the emo band moving in a new direction, thanks in part to producer Scott Litt (R.E.M.).

Title: Common Era
Info: The second album for the duo from New Orleans sees their music move toward a more pop sound while retaining their ambient style.

Title: Slaughterhouse
Info: The debut album for the rap group composed of Joe Budden, Crooked I, Joell Ortiz, and Royce da 5'9.

Title: Pyramids
Info: This is the debut album for the Denton, Texas, metal band.

Title: Clay Class
Info: Tobin Prinz and Suzi Horn's follow-up to their self-titled debut continues their sparse indie rock sound.

Title: Longtime Companion
Info: The latest release for the band led by Sonny Smith is an album of  songs influenced by country music and Smith's break up with his girlfriend of ten years.

Title: War Room Stories
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie electronic band was recorded at an old Soviet radio studio in East Berlin.

Title: Scars
Info: The fifth studio album for the electronic duo features such guest singers as Kelis, Santigold, Sam Sparro, Yo! Majesty!, and Yoko Ono.

Title: Nocturnes
Info: The second release for the British electro-pop singer Victoria Hesketh as Little Boots was produced by Tim Goldsworthy with contributions from Andy Butler of Hercules and Love Affair and James Ford of Simian Mobile Disco.

Title: Butter
Info: The third album from the Nashville, Tennessee rock quartet led by Jonas Stein was produced by Jim Eno of Spoon.

Title: Strapped
Info: The southern Californian indie rock quartet releases its follow-up to its self-titled debut.

Title: Summer Of Hate
Info: The debut album for the indie-rock duo from San Diego who were previously members of The Plot to Blow Up the Eiffel Tower.

Title: Cry Pretty
Info: The sixth full-length release for the country/pop artist features a guest appearance from Ludacris and was co-produced with David Garcia.

Title: Positive Songs for Negative People
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British folk-punk artist was produced by Butch Walker.

Title: Hush
Info: The third album for the New York indie-rock band was produced by Chris Zane.

Title: Without Your Love
Info: Following two EPs on the Tri Angle label, San Francisco-based electronic producer Chris Dexter releases his debut full-length album on his own label.

Title: Eleventh Hour
Info: Del returns from recording his albums with the Hieroglyphics and being featured on the Gorillaz's "Clint Eastwood" to release his fifth solo album.

Title: Father Divine
Info: Professor Ladd's second 2005 release is a punk concept album about religious leader George Baker.

Title: Croweology
Info: Released in conjunction with the band's 2010 farewell tour, this double-disc acoustic album features new recordings of the Black Crowes' classic hits, as well as revised versions of rarities and deep cuts.

Title: Dead Hand Control
Info: The third full-length solo release for the Vampire Weekend bassist was recorded in London and Los Angeles.

Title: The Search Engine
Info: Strictly Kev releases the first full-length DJ Food release in more than 10 years.

Title: Bring Ya To The Brink
Info: The eighth studio album sees the '80s star returns  with new dance music.

Title: Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds
Info: Noel Gallagher of Oasis returns with his debut solo album, which also includes Mike Rowe, former keyboardist for Oasis; Jeremy Stacy of The Lemon Trees; Lenny Castro; and the Crouch End Festival Chorus.

Title: Music for Dogs
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles-based duo of Chris Lynch and Adam Rasmussen was produced by Jacob Portrait.

Title: Bachelorette
Info: This is the latest album of electronic pop for the New Zealand-born Annabel Alpers.

Title: Halcyon
Info: The second release for the British pop singer was produced by Jim Eliot.

Title: Freeze, Melt
Info: The Australian indie electronic band's sixth full-length studio release was mixed by Christoffer Berg.

Title: Street of the Love of Days
Info: This is the debut album for the collaboration between Clientele frontman Alasdair MacLean and Lupe Nunez-Fernandez of Pipas.

Title: 12 Desperate Straight Lines
Info: The second full-length release was produced by Chris Walla.

Title: Calico Review
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles garage rock/psychedelic pop band was produced by Kyle Mullarky.

Title: Forced Witness
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian indie singer-songwriter features a guest appearance by Angel Olsen and was produced with Foxygen's Jonathan Rado.

Title: ArrangingTime
Info: The first solo release in six years for the singer-songwriter was produced by R. Walt Vincent.

Title: Pray for Rain
Info: The second full-length release for the Portland, Oregon-based duo of Sarah Vesprille and Daniel Hindman duo was produced by John Congleton.

Title: A Chorus of Storytellers
Info: Recorded in Seattle but remixed in Iceland by Jón Birgisson of Sigur Rós, A Chorus of Storytellers is the fifth album led by multi-instrumentalist Jimmy LaValle of the Album Leaf.

Title: Fortress
Info: The Arizona indie rock band's second album was produced by Chris Chu of the Morning Benders.

Title: Tell 'Em I'm Gone
Info: The first release in five years for the artist formerly known as Cat Stevens was produced by Rick Rubin.

Title: Original Colors
Info: The alternative rock duo's third studio album was recorded at its Los Angeles home.

Title: Seraph
Info: The debut full-length release for Thomas Arsenault as Mas Ysa features a guest appearance from Hundred Waters’ Nicole Miglis.

Title: Take Me To The Sea
Info: The debut album for the indie-rock band that features ex-members of the Blood Brothers and Pretty Girls Make Graves.

Title: Volume X
Info: The tenth full-length release for the post-rock trio from Maryland was self-produced and recorded in San Francisco.

Title: Music for Insomniacs
Info: The latest release from the British actor/musician was inspired by his inability to sleep and was recorded at night in his flat.

Title: Bob Dylan in the '80s, Vol. 1
Info: Some of Bob Dylan's songs from the 80s are covered by such artists as Blitzen Trapper, Bonnie “Prince” Billy, Carl Broemel Of My Morning Jacket, Built To Spill, Deer Tick, Craig Finn Of The Hold Steady, Aaron Freeman of Ween, Glen Hansard, Dawn Landes, Langhorne Slim, Lucius, and Slash.

Title: Adult Film
Info: The former Cursive singer is backed by Sara Bertuldo, Nate Kinsella, Patrick Newbery, Dylan Ryan, and Laura Stevenson on his second solo studio release.

Title: Trials & Tribulations
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the rapper includes guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Birdman, DJ Khaled, French Montana, Future, Anthony Hamilton, Lil Wayne, Meek Mill, Rick Ross, T.I., Wiz Khalifa, and Betty Wright.

Title: Curiosity
Info: The debut full-length release for the Portland, Oregon, duo of Rocky Tinder and Eric Phipps was produced by Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Jacob Portrait.

Title: Dreams and Nightmares
Info: After a number of well-received mixtapes, the Philadelphia rapper releases his debut full-length studio album featuring guest appearances by Mary J. Blige, Drake, Kirko Bangz, John Legend, Louie V, Nas, Rick Ross, Trey Songz, and Wale.

Title: The Abandoned Lullaby
Info: Soul singer Aaron Livingston and hip-hop producer RJD2 team up to release their debut album together as Icebird.

Title: Evening Tapestry
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the Philadelphia psychedelic pop band.

Title: Depart From Me
Info: The third album for the New York rapper features production by El-P, Aesop Rock, and F. Sean Martin.

Title: Hey Everyone
Info: The debut album for the Glasgow-based indie-rock band was produced by Machine.

Title: Perfectly Clear
Info: The seventh album for the pop artist is her first country album.

Title: Shelter From The Ash
Info: The 10th album for Ben Chasny's experimental rock band.

Title: Western Xterminator
Info: 'Xterminator' is the second album for Jennifer Herrema's post-Royal Trux project.

Title: Stand Still, Look Pretty
Info: This is the debut album for the country-pop duo of Michelle Branch and Jessica Harp.

Title: Throw Down Your Arms
Info: O'Connor's first studio album since "retiring" from the music business consists of covers of a dozen reggae classics, including songs by Burning Spear, Peter Tosh and Lee "Scratch" Perry.

Title: Yr Atal Genhedlaeth
Info: This Welsh-language disc marks the solo debut for the Super Furry Animals frontman.

Title: Join The Dots: B-Sides And Rarities, 1978-2001
Info: This 70-track, 4-disc collection is just what the title says: every Cure B-side and compilation track, in chronological order, from 1978-2001, each newly remastered and accompanied by extensive liner notes by Robert Smith.

Title: Low Kick And Hard Bop
Info: Solex is Amsterdam-based songwriter Elisabeth Esselink, and this is her third album for Matador. Like her previous albums, 'Low Kick' is filled with dozens of eclectic samples pulled from albums found at Esselink's record shop.

Title: Sneak Attack
Info: KRS-One returns to the solo recording scene with his first new album since 1997's 'I Got Next.'
The alt-country singer-songwriter covers every song on Taylor Swift's 2014 pop album.

Title: Smokey Rolls Down Thunder Canyon
Info: The latest album from the Texas-based artist includes guest appearances by Gael Garc?a Bernal, Nick Valensi of The Strokes, and Rodrigo Amarante of Los Hermanos.

Title: Rapprocher
Info: The debut full-length album for the Brooklyn electro-pop band led by Elizabeth Harper.

Title: Wildewoman
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Brooklyn-based indie pop band led by Jess Wolfe and Holly Laessig.

Title: Stars Are Our Home
Info: This is the debut release for the collaboration between Neil Halstead of Slowdive and Mojave 3, Nick Holton of Holton's Opulent Oog, and Mark Van Hoen of Seefeel.

Title: Alpine Static
Info: The Seattle instrumental quartet is back with a second Sub Pop release.

Title: Sleepwalkers
Info: The second full-length solo release for The Gaslight Anthem frontman was produced by Ted Hutt.

Title: Illuminated By The Light
Info: This is the third LP for the band featuring members of the Make-Up and Scene Creamers.

Title: Sunday At Devil Dirt
Info: This is the second collaboration with ex-Screaming Trees singer Mark Lanegan.

Title: Don't You Think You've Had Enough?
Info: The third full-length release for the sister duo of sisters Jennifer and Jessie Clavin was produced by Shane Stoneback.

Title: Roll with the Punches
Info: The latest release for the Belfast-born singer-songwriter features five originals and 10 covers with contributions from Jeff Beck, Georgie Fame, Chris Farlowe, Paul Jones, and Jason Rebello.

Title: Hard Bargain
Info: The legendary country singer's 21st studio album, featuring many of her original songs.

Title: The Uglysuit
Info: The debut album for the six-piece indie rock band from Oklahoma City.

Title: Sleep Forever
Info: Simian Mobile Disoc's James Ford produces The Crocodile's follow-up to its 2009 debut album, Summer of Hate.

Title: Tidelands
Info: The second album for the Seattle-based four-piece band was produced with Erik Blood.

Title: Be Brave
Info: The follow-up to their 2009 debut full-length sees a new lineup, with Mika Miko's Jenna Thornhill and Seth Densham joining, while Darker My Love's Tim Presley also appears on this release.

Title: Carry Me Back
Info: Ted Hutt produced the fourth release for the Americana band that welcomes back Critter Fuqua and features final appearances of Willie Watson, who parted with the band in January 2012.

Title: Whorl
Info: The fourth full-length studio release form the British electronic duo was written over three days and recorded at a show near the Joshua Tree National Park.

Title: Untilted
Info: The experimental electronica duo of Rob Brown and Sean Booth return with eight new tracks.

Title: Majid Jordan
Info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian duo of Majid Al Maskati and producer Jordan Ullman features a guest appearance by Drake.

Title: Dark Red
Info: The second full-length release for Henry Laufer as Shlohmo features a guest appearance from D33J.

Title: Modeselektor Proudly Presents Modeselektion, Vol. 2
Info: The Berlin-based duo's latest release is 18 tracks of experimental electronic music from such artists as Addison Groove, Clark, Lazer Sword, Martyn, Monolake, Phon.o, and Prefuse 73.

Title: The General Strike
Info: Political themes continue to influence the latest album from the punk rock band from Pennsylvania.

Title: Light the Horizon
Info: The Canadian reggae/ska band returns with a new drummer by the name of Sekou Lumumba and a new producer, King Britt, for its fourth album.

Title: Send Away The Tigers
Info: Dave Eringa produced the politically-charged eighth studio album for the Welsh rockers.

Title: Annabel Dream Reader
Info: The debut full-length release for the British rock trio of Kristian Bell, Daniel Rumsey, and Gianni Honey was produced by Bell and Bill Ryder-Jones.

Title: Notes on a Conditional Form
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British rock band features guest appearances from Phoebe Bridgers, Cutty Ranks, FKA Twigs, Tim Healy, and Greta Thunberg.

Title: Michael
Info: This is the debut solo dance side project release for Toro y Moi's Chaz Bundick.

Title: Seeker Lover Keeper
Info: The Australian singer-songwriter trio of Sarah Blasko, Holly Throsby, and Sally Seltmann releases its first album together.

Title: Mobile
Info: The third solo recording for the drummer for Wilco and Loose Fur is an all-percussion affair, featuring eight original compositions.

Title: Glazin'
Info: The Miami-based band releases an album of garage punk songs.

Title: Anastasis
Info: The Australian duo of Lisa Gerrard and Brendan Perry return with their first album since 1996's Spiritchaser.

Title: Shakira
Info: The first English-language release since 2009's She Wolf for the Colombian singer features guest appearances from Magic!, Rihanna, and Blake Shelton.

Title: In Colour
Info: Mike Mogis produced this second set from the Swedish act.

Title: Damage
Info: No, Jon Spencer hasn't left the blues trio, but they have officially shortened their name for their seventh release (their first for Sanctuary after a long stay at Matador). With all the money they saved by cutting out those extra two words, they were able to afford an all-star team of producers, including David Holmes, Alan Moulder, DJ Shadow, Dan The Automator and Steve Jordan.

Title: From The Double Gone Chapel
Info: The electronica duo of Andrew Weatherall and Keith Tenniswood return with 12 new tracks, featuring both vocals (from Weatherall) and live instrumentation (from Tenniswood) and departing significantly from the techno of past albums.

Title: All About Chemistry
Info: The third full-length from the Minneapolis band.

Title: White Is Relic/Irrealis Mood
Info: Kevin Barnes moved away from live band recording for the indie rock band's 15th full-length stdio release.

Title: Nightlife
Info: This is the third EP for the New York electronic rock duo of Sarah Barthel and Josh Carter.

Title: N.E.W.
Info: The Detroit garage/hard rock band's remaining members of Bobby Hackney, Dannis Hackney, and Bobbie Duncan recorded songs written by the late David Hackney as well as new songs for its first new recordings since 1976.

Title: Kill the Lights
Info: The fifth full-length release for the country singer features a duet with Little Big Town's Karen Fairchild.

Title: Dystopia
Info: The 15th studio release for the Los Angeles metal band features new guitarist Kiko Loureiro and Lamb Of God's Chris Adler on drums.

Title: Showtunes
Info: This 26-track set compiles works composed by the Magnetic Fields leader for three separate Chen Shi-Zheng operas.

Title: Unpatterns
Info: James Ford and Jas Shaw's third studio album as Simian Mobile Disco is a mix of house and techno electronic music.

Title: Value
Info: The second full-length release for the British grime artist features a guest appearance from Rolynne.

Title: Old Growth
Info: The Washington D.C band returns as a three piece with its latest album.

Title: What Is This Heart?
Info: The second full-length release for Tom Krell was produced by Rodaidh McDonald.

Title: Guilt Mirrors
Info: The first release in seven years for the New Zealand artist Nick Harte was influenced by the 2011 Christchurch earthquake .

Title: Black Ice
Info: The hard-rock band's first album in eight years was produced by Brendan O'Brien.

Title: What Will We Be
Info: The first album on his new label for the folk singer was co-produced with Paul Butler.

Title: Awake
Info: The addition of Zac Brown and Rory O’Connor turns Scott Hansen's solo project into an ambient trio for its third full-length release.

Title: When You See Yourself
Info: The first full-length release since 2016's Walls for the Southern rock band was produced by Markus Dravs.

Title: Given to the Wild
Info: The third album for the British indie rock band was recorded over two sessions with producers Tim Goldsworthy, Bruno Ellingham, and Jag Jago.

Title: Wu Block
Info: The collaboration between Ghostface Killah and Sheek Louch features guest appearances by Cappadonna, Erykah Badu, as well as members of Wu-Tang (GZA, Inspectah Deck, Masta Killa, Method Man, Raekwon) and The Lox/D-Block (Styles P and Jadakiss).

Title: Corinne Bailey Rae
Info: The Leeds, England neo-soul singer makes her debut with this self-titled album, on which she also handles the instrumentation and songwriting duties.

Title: Blue Album
Info: After 15 years and six albums, the brothers Hartnoll are calling it quits with this final release. Lisa Gerrard (Dead Can Dance) guests on one track, with The Sparks collaborating on another.

Title: Underneath
Info: The three Hanson brothers (now ranging in age from 19 to 24) return with their third album, a full seven years after first hitting the pop charts.

Title: Sha Sha
Info: A musician since his early childhood, 20-year-old Texan Ben Kweller experienced some minor success with the band Radish in the late 1990s before embarking on a solo career highlighted by 'Sha Sha,' his debut full-length for Dave Matthews' label Ato.

Title: Take off Your Pants & Jacket
Info: This is the follow-up to 1999's 'Enema Of The State.' If you like them, then don't worry--they haven't grown up. If you don't like them, well... they haven't grown up.

Title: Woman Worldwide
Info: The live versions of songs from 2007's Cross; 2011's Audio, Video, Disco; and 2016's Woman were recorded in the studio for this 15-track release.

Title: Elemental Themes
Info: Morgan Z's debut release is an instrumental album of music inspired by electronic film scores of the past.

Title: Here Comes the Cowboy
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based Canadian singer-songwriter was co-mixed with Joe Santarpia.

Title: Tallies
Info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian indie pop quartet founded by Sarah Cogan and Dylan Frankland was co-produced Frankland and Josh Korody of Beliefs.

Title: Pete Yorn
Info: The singer-songwriter and guitarist's self-titled album follows his collaborative effort with actress Scarlett Johansson and features famed Pixies frontman Frank Black as a producer of his straightforward pop rock.

Title: Terraplane
Info: The singer-songwriter turns to the blues for his 16th studio release that was written in five weeks while he toured Europe by himself.

Title: Electrified
Info: The fourth album from the Denver indie-pop band led by Tammy Ealom is a sugary 12-song set.

Title: Fantastic Playroom
Info: The debut album for this indie electronica band from London, England.

Title: Damnesia
Info: Chicago's pop punk band returns with a collection of unplugged versions of favorite tracks.

Title: Golden Worry
Info: The six-track album introduces Emmanuel Nicolaidis, who joins the Baltimore, Maryland-based trio as its new drummer.

Title: Frank Black Francis
Info: This unusual set from the Pixies frontman includes a disc of demo solo recordings dating from 1987, and a second disc of new studio recordings of an assortment of Pixies songs by Black with collaborators such as Pere Ubu and Two Pale Boys.

Title: Labyrinth
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the London-based producer/videographer who has who has collaborated with likes of Björk, Arca and FKA twigs.

Title: Creation
Info: This is the fifth studio release for the New York-based sister duo of Allison and Catherine Pierce.

Title: New York in the '70s
Info: This is the third and final part of the psychedelic concept trilogy from the British artist who previously was a member of The Auteurs, Baader Meinhof, Black Box Recorder, and The Servants.

Title: Some Things Never Stay the Same
Info: The second release of 1970s rock-inspired music from the collaboration between Heidecker & Wood includes guest appearances from Mike Bloom, Jason Boesel, Mike Green, Eric Johnson of The Shins, Aimee Mann, and Rilo Kiley’s Pierre de Reeder.

Title: Tomorrow Today
Info: The debut album for the electronic duo of Tim Felton and Billy Bainbridge.

Title: From the Corner to the Block
Info: The sixth CD from the New Orleans funk/jazz outfit includes guests Lyrics Born, The Coup's Boots Riley, Digable Planets' Ladybug Mecca, Juvenile, Jurassic 5's Chali 2na, Mr. Lif, and Gift of Gab from Blackalicious.

Title: Absolute Garbage
Info: A best-of collection from the band led by singer Shirley Manson.

Title: Life In Slow Motion
Info: This is the British singer-songwriter's first album in three years, and it finds him working with an outside producer (Marius De Vries) for the first time.

Title: Mind of Mine
Info: The debut solo full-length release for the former One Direction singer features production from Levi Lennox and Malay.

Title: Platinum Tips & Ice-Cream [Live]
Info: The 12 live tracks were recorded from the alternative rock band's two reunion concerts in California and New York in 2015.

Title: Zero
Info: More than 35 years after the Scottish punk band released its debut album Can't Stand the Rezillos in 1978 (and then split up four months later), the sophomore release features three of the original members, who reformed in 2001.

Title: Paperwork
Info: Executive produced by Pharrell Williams, the ninth studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Iggy Azalea, Chris Brown, Skylar Grey, Jeezy, Victoria Monet, Pharrell, The-Dream, Trae tha Truth, Usher, Watch The Duck, and Young Thug.

Title: Remember Me
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the San Francisco Bay Area rapper features guest appearances from Jay Ant, August Alsina, Eric Bellinger, Iamsu!, Kool John, and Shady Bo.

Title: GB City
Info: This is the debut for the garage rock duo from Mississippi and was produced by Ross Robinson.

Title: Ready For The Flood
Info: The ex-Jayhawks team up again as a duo on their first album together in over ten years.

Title: Songs For Silverman
Info: Folds' second solo outing actually finds him working once again in trio format, now joined by drummer Lindsay Jamieson (Departure Lounge) and bassist Jared Reynolds (who, like Folds, contributed to the recent William Shatner album).

Title: It's What I'm Thinking, Pt. 1: Photographing Snowflakes
Info: Damon Gough's latest release is the first of a planned trilogy of albums.

Title: Flesh & Machine
Info: The latest experimental ambient release from the producer features sounds formed from human voices, piano, bass, drums, steel and electric guitars.

Title: Ricky Music
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Aaron Maine project was co-produced by Jake Portrait and features contributions from Dev Hynes, Peter Maine, Mitski, and Zsela.

Title: Which Side Are You On?
Info: Pete Seeger guests on DiFrancho's cover of his song Which Side Are You On? on her 16th studio album.

Title: Everything Last Winter
Info: This debut full-length for the British five-piece offers ten tracks of shoegaze- and folk-influenced indie rock. (We also detect a little Snow Patrol and Broken Social Scene in there.)

Title: Nevermen
Info: This is the debut full-length release from the project formed by TV on the Radio frontman Tunde Adebimpe, Adam Drucker (Doseone), and  Mike Patton.

Title: Black Gives Way To Blue
Info: The band's first album in more than 14 years was produced with Nick Raskulinecz and features new lead singer William DuVall (original singer Layne Staley died in 2002).

Title: Closing In
Info: This debut LP from the guitar/drums duo of Mike Conte and Adam Bennati is defintely harder and heavier than your typical Matador release.

Title: Back To Basics
Info: The dancehall artist returns with a more genre-consistent (and yes, back to basics) album, with a lone Timbaland-produced crossover track, "All Girls Party."

Title: Lovebox
Info: The London-based duo of Tom Findlay and Andy Cato return with their fourth LP, named after one of their club nights.

Title: Iron Flag
Info: RZA and company return to their hardcore roots for this, Wu-Tang's fourth album together.

Title: Do It!
Info: The Liverpool quartet known for wearing surgical masks releases its fifth studio album.

Title: Mark Kozelek
Info: The latest solo release for the San Francisco singer-songwriter features a guest appearance on drums from Steve Shelley and was primarily recorded in two San Francisco hotels.

Title: Excerpts From The Diary Of Todd Zilla [EP]
Info: This seven-track mini-album is intended to hold fans over until the Modesto, California band return with their next LP in early 2006.

Title: ACR Loco
Info: The first new studio release in 12 years for the British post-punk band features contributions from Gabe Gurnsey, Mike Joyce, Eric Random, and Sink Ya Teeth (Maria Uzor and Gemma Cullingford).

Title: Spin
Info: Produced by Will Yip, the fifth full-length release for the Pennsylvania rock band shrunken down from a five-piece into a duo that consists of Ben Walsh and Brianna Collins.

Title: Lex Hives
Info: The fifth album for the Swedish garage rock band was self-produced.

Title: Embracism
Info: The debut solo release for the guitarist for Mercy Arms was produced by Kim Moyes.

Title: Two Gallants
Info: The self-titled album is the third for the San Francisco duo.

Title: Cold Roses
Info: Credited to Ryan Adams & The Cardinals, double album 'Cold Roses' is the first of three planned 2005 releases for the prolific singer-songwriter. Tom Schick produced.

Title: West
Info: The singer-songwriter co-produced her eighth album with veteran Hal Willner. The Jayhawks' Gary Louris is among the musicians lending a hand.

Title: White Lies For Dark Times
Info: Ben Harper's latest album is the first album to be credited with the Relentless7.

Title: Disconnect from Desire
Info: On their second album, School of Seven Bells cast themselves as an update of a specific kind of misfit band. Alpinisms reconstituted late-â€™80/early-â€˜90s shoegaze. Disconnect from Desire, however, updates the sound of a kind of band that would have opened for Peter Gabriel and Eurythmics, or headlined over Revolver, rather than tour with the likes of Lush, Ride, and Pale Saints. Here, a focused songcraft and central placement of the Deheza twinsâ€™ alluring vocals -- which tend to be lower and more earthly than they were on the debut -- disallow School of Seven Bells from being squarely shoegaze. At the same time, the band is too left of center, too odd, to be considered anywhere near the mainstream. Their cleaner, less wispy, more muscular sound, combined with more traditional songwriting, is not that radical a change. Itâ€™s closer to a slight shift that registers after a couple spins, once it becomes apparent that deeply emotive and relatively sparse songs like â€œI L U,â€ â€œJoviann,â€ and â€œThe Waitâ€ would have made excellent tracks buried throughout Sireâ€™s Just Say series. They have shoegaze lyric-generator staples like wind, waves, ocean, storms, and even talk of â€œslipping away.â€ And yet, the words are not merely functional, written solely for the sake of complementing the sound as an additional instrument. Theyâ€™re either poetically vague or vaguely poetic -- stuff like â€œLet me will the dial to turn and gild the air with silver pearls of rainâ€ and â€œWhenâ€™s the wait a cradle in which youâ€™re lulled from time to time, soundly spun into an insensate lie.â€ The thicker, more driving songs resemble a polished, warm Curve, whipping up squalls of noise over robust played-and-programmed rhythms that soar more often than batter. No matter the amount of layering, not a single element is obscured. This vivid directness suits them very well. ~ Andy Kellman

Title: I NEVER LIKED YOU
Info: The latest full-length release for Atlanta rapper Future features guest appearances from Drake, EST Gee, Gunna, Kodak Black, Tems, Kanye West, and Young Thug.

Title: More
Info: The third full-length release for Alexis Georgopoulos is more pop than his previous two synth-based albums.

Title: True
Info: The debut studio release for the Swedish EDM DJ/producer Tim Bergling as Avicii includes guest appearances from such artists as Aloe Blacc, Mike Einziger of Incubus, Adam Lambert, Audra Mae, Nile Rodgers, and Dan Tyminski of Union Station.

Title: The Days Run Away
Info: The second release for the British indie pop band was produced by Bernard Butler.

Title: Ghosts I-IV
Info: Nine Inch Nails releases a mostly instrumental album, with some tracks falling under the Creative Commons License instead of being copyrighted.

Title: Mostly No
Info: The second album for the band led by Martin Cohen was recorded at his house.

Title: The Messenger
Info: The Smiths' guitarist wrote and produced his debut solo release.

Title: Cry
Info: The second full-length release for the Texas dream pop was recorded at night in Mallorca.

Title: Forcefield
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian indie rock quartet was produced by Doug Boehm and the band's lead singer, David Monks.

Title: Freedom
Info: The first release in 17 years for the Swedish punk band features production from Michael Ilbert, Nick Launay, and Shellback.

Title: So Long, See You Tomorrow
Info: Produced by lead singer Jack Steadman, the fourth release for the indie band was written while traveling in Asia and Europe.

Title: Vitriola
Info: The eighth full-length release for the rock band led by Tim Kasher sees the return of drummer Clint Schnase and was co-produced by Mike Mogis.

Title: My Best Friend Is You
Info: The second album for the British singer-songwriter was produced by ex-Suede guitarist Bernard Butler.

Title: D-Sides
Info: The latest, two-disc album from one of Damon Albarn's bands contains remixes and demos.

Title: Good Apollo, I'm Burning Star IV, Volume Two: No World For Tomorrow
Info: The album features Taylor Hawkins on drums after Josh Eppard left the band.

Ethan Johns produced the singer-songwriter's third and final release of 2005, which unlike its predecessors is a stripped-down solo affair consisting of nine lengthy story-songs each representing a year of Adams' life during his twenties.

Title: All City
Info: Slapped with the label "the female Beastie Boys" after their 2003 debut, the New York all-girl rap outfit make their major-label debut with 'All City,' which includes collaborations with Har Mar Superstar, ?uestlove and DJ Muggs.

Title: Honkin' On Bobo
Info: The latest LP from Steven Tyler & co. includes just one original ("The Grind") with the remainder of the tracks occupied by covers of blues standards.

Title: Lucky
Info: The veteran singer-songwriter was forced by Island to re-record the songs for this eighth album three times, before the label finally approved a release. This final version was recorded with producer John Shanks (Alanis Morissette) and marks the first of her albums to include songs not written by Etheridge.

Title: Hard Candy
Info: Only the band's fourth studio recording in their 10+ year existence, 'Hard Candy' offers up 13 new tracks, including the single "American Girls" and "Butterfly Reverse," which was cowritten by Ryan Adams. Steve Lillywhite produces.

Title: Wood/Water
Info: The fourth album from the Milwaukee emo band is their first with veteran producer Stephen Street, who gives the album a more expansive sound.

Title: Become You
Info: This is the first new album in three years for the folk-rock duo of Emily Saliers and Amy Ray.

Title: Rock Steady
Info: The follow-up to 'Return of Saturn' finds Gwen Stefani & co. working with a variety of producers (Sly and Robbie, Ric Ocasek, William Orbit) in a variety of styles.

Title: Lenny
Info: Lenny Kravitz's sixth album features a mix of retro rock and mid-tempo ballads.

Title: York Blvd
Info: The Los Angeles indie band returns with its second album for Vapor Records, following 1997's 'Acetone.'

Title: Golden Greats
Info: The second LP from former Stone Roses frontman Ian Brown.

Title: Yungblud
Info: The third full-length release for British pop-punk artist Yungblud features a guest appearance from Willow.

Title: New Maps of Hell
Info: The hardcore, often political rockers return with their 14th studio album.

Title: Rescue
Info: The Canadian post-hardcore band releases its fifth studio album.

Title: Solar Power
Info: The New Zealand pop star's third studio album finds her working again with producer Jack Antonoff. For environmental reasons, she has opted against a physical CD release in favor of a digital download.

Title: Journey To The West
Info: Damon Albarn produced and wrote the music for the adaptation of a 16th Chinese book into a stage opera.

Title: NY's Finest
Info: The hip-hop producer's latest album includes guests such as Redman and Raekwon.

Title: Fast Cars, Danger, Fire And Knives [EP]
Info: This seven-song EP includes production work from Rob Sonic and Blockhead. El-P also appears.

Title: Internationally Unknown
Info: The second full-length release British punk band features guest appearances from Aimee Interrupter and Rancid's Tim Armstrong (who also produced the album).

Title: To The Sea
Info: Hawaiian native and unofficial kingpin of beachside pop rock, Jack Johnson's newest delivery of breezily spun folk songs capture the mellow mood of Johnson's previous albums, complete with a sunny surf vibe.

Title: Days of Abandon
Artist: The Pains of Being Pure at Heart
Info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn indie pop band led by Kip Berman was produced by Andy Savours.

Title: In the Belly of the Brazen Bull
Info: Dave Fridmann and Steve Albini helped produce the fifth studio album for the British indie rock band that returns as a trio after Johnny Marr left to pursue his own solo work.

Title: Tres Cabrones
Info: The latest release for the sludge metal band led by Buzz Osborne features the return of original drummer Mike Dillard, with Dale Crover taking over bass duties.

Title: Ride Out
Info: The 17th studio release for the rock singer features both originals as well as four covers of songs including Steve Earle’s “The Devil’s Right Hand," and Kasey Chambers’ and Shane Nicholson’s “Adam & Eve.”

Title: Classics
Info: Anyone disappointed by the last Daft Punk album might enjoy this funky, largely instrumental second album for the New York duo.

Title: Oh! Mighty Engine
Info: The sophomore solo album for the Mojave 3 and Slowdive member.

Title: Both Sides Of The Gun
Info: Harper's first album in three years is split into a disc of uptempo rockers and a second disc of acoustic ballads.

Title: This Machine Kills Artists
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Melvins' Buzz Osborne is an acoustic 17-track album.

Title: Rufus Does Judy At Carnegie Hall
Info: The live album of Rufus Wainwright's recreation of Judy Garland's 1961 concert at Carnegie Hall.

Title: Black Pompadour
Info: John McEntire produced this third album for the Chicago indie rockers led by Jim Elkington.

Title: Interview Music
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Scottish rock band was recorded in Los Angeles and Scotland with producer Dave Eringa.

Title: Warm on a Cold Night
Info: The debut full-length release for the London-based duo of Andy Clutterbuck and James Hatch features a guest appearance from Izzy Bizu.

Title: Range of Light
Info: The second full-length solo release for the Bon Iver drummer includes a guest appearance from Justin Vernon.

Title: Kleerup
Info: The Swedish producer, who has worked with Lykke Li and Robyn, releases his debut album.

Title: Finally Famous
Info: The debut from the Detroit rapper features executive producers Kanye West and No I.D.

Title: Hideaway
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the San Diego rock band led by Nathan Williams was produced by Dave Sitek.

Title: Petra Goes to the Movies
Info: Petra Haden returns with a follow-up to her 2005 a capella album of The Who Sell Out with an album of a capella movie themes.

Title: American Doll Posse
Info: The singer-songwriter-pianist's ninth studio album is political, confrontational, and lengthy (at over 20 tracks)--and also falls under the dreaded "concept album" category, as its songs come from the viewpoints of five different characters.

Title: World Be Gone
Info: The 17th full-length studio release for the synthpop duo was said to be inspired by the current political climate in the UK and US.

Title: Petits Fours
Info: The first album for the rock band featuring Black Francis and his wife Violet Clark.

Title: Back to Forever
Info: The second full-length studio release for the California singer-songwriter was produced by Garret "Jacknife" Lee.

Title: To The Races
Info: This is the second solo outing for the former Archers Of Loaf and Crooked Fingers frontman.

Title: Tea for the Tillerman 2
Info: The latest release for the singer-songwriter credited under the names Yusuf/Cat Stevens features re-recordings of the songs from his 1970 album Tea For The Tillerman with new interpretations and arrangements.

Title: Hard Love
Info: The fourth full-length release for indie rock artist Tim Showalter was produced by Nicolas Vernhes.

Title: Pattern of Excel
Info: The second full-length release for the California hip-hop producer features influences from R&B, drum 'n' bass, and ambient music.

Title: Model of You
Info: The second full-length release for the British duo of Sam Ricketts and Tom Clarke was produced by Andy Savours.

Title: Weird Drift
Info: The second full-length release for the Mike Paradinas project features vocals from Vezelay (Matthieu Le Berre).

Title: Glow
Info: This is the first release in eight years for French electronic artist, Jackson Fourgeaud.

Title: She Paints Words in Red
Info: The British indie rock band led by Guy Chadwick releases its second album since returning in 2005.

Title: A Sleep & a Forgetting
Info: The fourth album for the Canadian pop-rock band was written while singer Nicholas Thorburn was recovering from a breakup in Los Angeles.

Title: Red Velvet Snowball
Info: The psychedelic pop duo releases its sophomore album.

Title: Holy Ghost!
Info: The New York-based electro pop group made up of two friends, Alex Frankel and Nick Millhiser, release their debut album of dancefloor, disco jams.

Title: Welcome To The Walk Alone
Info: The second album for the British group was produced by Mark Ronson.

Title: Life For Rent
Info: The British singer sticks to the successful formula established on her 1999 debut "No Angel" for this sophomore effort.

Title: The Art Of Losing
Info: This is the sophomore release for the Boston-based alt-rockers.

Title: Beautifulgarbage
Info: Another eclectic offering from Shirley Manson and Garbage, their third album and first since 1998.

Title: The Menace
Info: The long-awaited follow-up to the band's 1995 eponymous debut features a guest contribution from The Fall's Mark E. Smith and a cover of Trio's 'Da Da Da.'

Title: Mysterious Phonk: The Chronicles of Spaceghostpurrp
Info: The debut full-length studio album for the Miami-based producer/rapper who also worked with A$AP Rocky and Wiz Khalifa, contains new material and re-recorded tracks from his mixtapes.

Title: Changing Horses
Info: The fourth studio album for the ex-Radish member is said to have some country elements.

Title: The  Other I
Info: This is the second release for the London-based sister duo of Colette and Hannah Thurlow.

Title: Sweet Sour
Info: The second studio album for the British rock trio was produced by Ian Davenport.

Title: Strange Creatures
Info: The third full-length release for the British rock duo of Eoin and Rory Loveless was produced by Ross Orton.

Title: Anian
Info: The third full-length release for the Welsh folk rock band includes a disc featuring non-Welsh language interpretations of its songs by such artists as Peter Gabriel, Rhys Ifans, and Maxine Peake.

Title: Mwahaha
Info: The debut full-length release for the Oakland-based experimental psychedelic pop band produced by Eli Crews is reissued with two additional tracks.

Title: Clash the Truth
Info: The second full-length release for Dustin Payseur as Beach Fossils was produced by Ben Greenberg.

Title: We Are Born
Info: Famous for her soaring vocals, Sia's new release brings brilliance to the modern pop track, with catchy grooves, soulful song arrangements, and a few synth-heavy dance beats that are playful and party friendly.

Title: Starz
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Swedish rapper features a guest appearance from Ariel Pink.

Title: Carnation
Info: The third full-length release for the Pennsylvania singer-songwriter was produced with Randall Dunn.

Title: Longwave
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Detroit indie rock band.

Title: Honkytonk University
Info: Merle Haggard guests on the country star's follow-up to 'Shock'n Y'all.'

Title: Nothing's Lost
Info: What happens when you team Death Cab For Cutie's Ben Gibbard with a cutting-edge electronica artist? Sure, you have the Postal Service, but you also have this new full-length from Arne Van Petegem's Styrofoam, which features multiple contributions not only from Gibbard, but also from Valerie Trebeljahr (Lali Puna), Andrew Kenny (American Analog Set), Markus Acher (The Notwist) and rapper Alias.

Title: Out of Love
Info: The debut album for the supergroup consisting of Man Man's Ryan Kattner, Islands' Nicholas Thorburn, and the Shins' Joe Plummer is influenced by doo-wop music.

Title: Courage
Info: The first English-language release in six years for the Canadian pop singer features contributions from David Guetta, Greg Kurstin, LP, Sia, Sam Smith, and Björn Yttling.

Title: The  Blessed Unrest
Info: The singer-songwriter's fourth full-length studio release was produced by Mark Endert, John O'Mahony, and Kurt Uenala.

Title: How I Knew Her
Info: One-half of the indie duo Pomplamoose, Nataly Dawn releases her debut autobiographical solo release that was produced by her Pomplamoose partner Jack Conte and funded by Kickstarter donations.

Title: You Can't Teach An Old Dog New Tricks
Info: This is the first album from the Blues singer from California on Third Man Records, Jack White's label.

Title: The Will To Death
Info: The stripped-down 'The Will To Death' is not just the second solo disc in 2004 for the Red Hot Chili Peppers guitarist, but marks the first of a whopping six planned albums for Record Collection this year.

Title: Amazing Grace
Info: A quick follow-up by Spiritualized standards, 'Amazing Grace' finds Jason Pierce with a new record label (his own Spaceman Records imprint) and a more immediate, less orchestral sound than on 2001's 'Let It Come Down.'

Title: Heathen
Info: Bowie's first studio album in three years (and first for his new label ISO Records, distributed by Columbia) finds the older white duke working with producer Tony Visconti for the first time since 1980's 'Scary Monsters.' Pete Townsend and Dave Grohl guest on guitar on a track apiece.

Title: Long Distance
Info: This is the third album from the New York-based trio, led by French singer Dominique Durand and it finds the group adding a bit of trip-hop into the mix. The album includes a cover of the Blow Monekys' "Digging Your Scene."

Title: We Are Undone
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the San Francisco indie rock duo of Adam Stephens and Tyson Vogel was produced by Karl Derfler.

Title: Why Are You OK?
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Seattle rock band was produced by Jason Lytle and features guest appearances from Sera Cahoone, Jenn Champion, and Dinosaur Jr.'s J. Mascis.

Title: Hairdresser Blues
Info: Seth Bogart returns as Hunx but without his backing band for his solo album produced by Ivan Julian.

Title: Harry Styles
Info: The debut solo release for the former One Direction band member was produced with Jeff Bhasker.

Title: Drone Trailer
Artist: MV & EE With The Golden Road
Info: This is the first release on DiCristina Stair for Matt "MV" Valentine and Erika "EE" Elder.

Title: Eat the Elephant
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the rock supergroup is its first album of new material in 14 years.

Title: Voyager
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the French electronic producer features guest appearances from Mark Kerr, Miss Kittin, and David Shaw And The Beat.

Title: Somewhere Else
Info: This is the third release from the Swedish electro-pop duo of Johan Agebjörn and Sally Shapiro.

Title: Blue Songs
Info: The second album for the New York-based musical group was produced with Patrick Pulsinger.

Title: Peace Queer
Info: The first album of a planned trilogy from the Oregon-born singer/songwriter.

Title: Libertad
Info: Scott Weiland and company return with their second album.

Title: Pink Friday
Info: After making an explosive debut appearing on other artist's songs, rapper Nicki Minaj finally releases her debut of electro-infused, bold, and hook-heavy hip-hop.

Title: Come Back as Rain
Info: This is the third album for the indie folk-rock trio from Philadelphia.

Title: Underrated Silence
Info: German producer Ulrich Schnauss worked with fellow Engineers' bassist Mark Peters on this minimalist electronic album.

Title: 24-7 Rockstar Shit
Info: The seventh full-length release for the British indie rock band began as four songs recorded with producer Steve Albini in 2011 and now includes six songs they created over three days five years later.

Title: Everything Is
Info: This is the debut album for the neo-grunge outfit based in Manchester, England.

Title: Li(f)e
Info: The fourth full-length studio album for the rapper from Rhode Island features songs co-written with such artists as Tim Fite, Death Cab For Cutie’s Chris Walla, Califone’s Tim Rutili, Grandaddy’s Jason Lytle, and Sparklehorse’s Mark Linkous.

Title: Sweet Heart Rodeo
Info: This is the third full-length album for the Brooklyn-based Kentucky-born singer-songwriter.

Title: Arthur Buck
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between singer-songwriter Joseph Arthur and R.E.M. guitarist Peter Buck was written while in Mexico.

Title: Fetty Wap
Info: The debut full-length release for the New Jersey rapper who first gained fame with his "Trap Queen" single features guest appearances from M80, Monty, and Remy Boyz.

Title: Rewild
Info: The debut full-length album for the Brooklyn quintet.

Title: Live Life Fast
Info: The latest full-length release for the Compton rapper features guest appearances from 21 Savage, Fivio Foreign, Jamie Foxx, Future, Gunna, Alex Isley, Kodak Black, Lil Baby, Takeoff, and Ty Dolla $ign,

Title: Kunk
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Baltimore noise rock band features some songs from Lifer's recording sessions.

Title: Quarters
Info: Each of the four tracks on the sixth release for the Australian psychedelic pop band are exactly 10:10 minutes long.

Title: Infinity Pool
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Danish quartet features a guest appearance from Killer Mike.

Title: Ghostdini: Wizard Of Poetry
Info: This Wu-Tang Clan member's latest album features John Legend, Fabolous, Raheem DeVaughn, Lloyd, and Estelle as guest singers.

Title: The Exchange Session Vol. 1
Info: This is the first of two releases from an improvised collaboration between pop and jazz drummer Reid and folktronica artist Hebden (Four Tet, Fridge).

Title: Young & Old
Info: The second album for the husband-and-wife duo was produced by The Black Keys' Patrick Carney.

Title: Hal
Info: The Dublin-based quartet debuts with a record filled with echoes of California circa the 1960s and 70s (think Brian Wilson) rather than Ireland.

Title: Magnetic Man
Info: The electronic trio consisting of dubstep regulars Skream, Benga, and Artwork releases its first album together.

Title: Nosebleed Weekend
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Atlanta punk trio was produced by Nic Jodoin.

Title: Nostalgia
Info: Produced with Mike Stevens, the covers album from the former Eurythmics singer includes such classics as "Summertime,"  “Georgia on My Mind and "I Put a Spell on You."

Title: Forfeit/Fortune
Info: The fifth album for the Seattle, Washington-based band was produced by Mark Nevers, Alex McManus, and Eric Bachmann.

Title: Days Run Away
Info: 'Days' is the first album in over a dozen years for the reunited London-based alt-rockers, and is their first to include both original guitarists (Guy Chadwick and Terry Bickers) since 1989.

Title: Love in the Modern Age
Info: The 12th full-length release for the singer-songwriter was influenced by 1980s pop/rock and was self-produced.

Title: Wayward Fire
Info: The third album for the Colorado-based artist Kamtin Mohager is heavily influenced by 1980's dance music.

Title: The Game of Monogamy
Info: This is the debut solo album for the lead singer of Cursive and The Good Life.

Title: Does You Inspire You
Info: The Brooklyn-based band formed in Colorado releases its debut album.

Title: Born Again
Info: The debut full-length release of Canadian singer-songwriter Linnea Siggelkow was produced by Jake Aron.

Title: The Sun & The Neon Light
Info: The German duo releases its third album, produced by Arno Meriziger and Walter Krammermeier.

Title: Business Casual
Info: The electro-funk duo returns with its third album of new wave-inspired songs and crooning synthesizer-heavy jams.

Title: Electronic Projects for Musicians
Info: This is a collection of B-sides and rare songs from 1995 to 2007.

Title: Twelve Carat Toothache
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for rapper Post Malone features guest appearances from Doja Cat, Fleet Foxes, Gunna, Roddy Ricch, The Kid Laroi, and The Weeknd.

Title: Then Came the Morning
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based trio was produced by Aaron Dessner of The National.

Title: Entanglements
Info: The band from the Everett, Washington area  releases its third album with new label, Tomlab.

Title: Aquaria
Info: The debut full-length release for the artist best known for his producing work on FKA Twigs' M3LL155X and Beyoncé's self-titled albums, features a guest appearance from Angel Deradoorian.

Title: Sonic Highways
Info: Each song on the eighth full-length release for the rock band led by Dave Grohl was recorded in a different city: Chicago, Austin, Nashville, Los Angeles, Seattle, New Orleans, Washington, D.C., and New York, which is documented in the HBO TV series of the same name.

Title: Elect The Dead
Info: The System of a Down singer's solo debut album features fellow bandmate John Dolmayan on drums, along with players from Primus and opera singer Ani Maldjian.

Title: Jet Lag
Info: The fourth solo release for Rhye's Mike Milosh was co-produced with his wife, actress Alexa Nikolas.

Title: Shotter's Nation
Info: Pete Doherty tries to get out of the tabloids and into critic's hearts with his latest album.

Title: Makers
Info: This is the fourth solo album for the former Waxwing member.

Title: Broken Hymns, Limbs, And Skin
Info: The third album for the New York quintet was produced with Alex Newport.

Title: DSVII
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the French electronic project of Anthony Gonzalez is a sequel to 2007's Digital Shades Vol. 1 and was inspired by 1980s sci-fi and fantasy movies as well as video game soundtracks.

Title: Divine Ecstasy
Info: The second release for Chicago-based production duo of Mike Perry and Austin Kjeultes features guest appearances from Poliça's Channy Leaneagh, Mahaut Mondino, Haleek Maul, and Shy Girls.

Title: III
Info: This the Brazilian producer's third full-length release of techno electronic music.

Title: Sky Full of Holes
Info: The ‘90s power-pop band releases a new album.

Title: Ash & Ice
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie rock duo was produced by guitarist Jamie Hince and John O'Mahoney.

Title: Two Thousand
Info: Doug Boehm returns as producer for this ten-track set.

Title: In the Rainbow Rain
Info: The latest release for the rock band led by Will Sheff, who produced the album with Shawn Everett, was recorded with Benjamin Lazar Davis, Will Graefe, Sarah Pedinotti, and Cully Symington.

Title: Spend the Night With…
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the punk band formed by Pharmakon's Margaret Chardiet, Anasazi's Keegan Dakkar, Walker Behl and Eugene Terry of Crazy Spirit and Hank Wood & the Hammerheads's Logan Montana.

Title: Animal Nature
Info: This is the second full-length studio release for the New York neo-disco/funk band founded by producers Eugene Cho and Dan Balis.

Title: Maze of Woods
Info: This is the second release from the collaboration between Matthew Cooper and Mark T. Smith.

Title: Ternion
Info: The second album for the British trio sees the band expanding its indie dance sound.

Title: Dracula
Info: The third album for the Portland, Oregon, indie rock band was partially recorded in an isolated cabin on the Oregon coast before being mixed by Scott Colburn and Julian Martlew.

Title: Freight Train
Info: The multi-award-winning country singer-songwriter releases his latest album, which includes a duet with Lee Ann Womack on the cover of Vern Gosdin's "Til The End."

Title: Bazooka!!!
Info: Signed to a major-label deal after just one single, New York punk foursome The Star Spangles make their full-length debut with Bazooka!!!

Title: Airs Above Your Station
Info: The Seattle-based experimental space-rock outfit returns with their sophomore LP, following their 2001 debut 'Be Gentle With the Warm Turtle.'

Title: The Amalgamut
Info: Filter's third LP finds the band moving in a less industrial/electronic direction.

Title: C'mon
Info: 'C'mon' is the third full-length release for the experimental Chicago-based instrumental quartet.

Title: End It All
Info: Brooklyn-based rapper returns with his fourth album of raw emotion and dark, heavy beats.

Title: Skull Worship
Info: The first release in five years for the Los Angeles psychedelic rock band led by Bobby Hecksher includes a new lineup with J.C. Rees, Earl V. Miller, Chris Di Pino, and George Serrano.

Title: Demonstration
Info: The second full-length studio release for the British rapper features guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Dizzee Rascal, Labrinth, Laura Mvula, and Emeli Sandé.

Title: Here's Willy Moon
Info: The debut release for the New Zealand singer is a 1950s-inspired rock album with some hip-hop and dance music influences.

Title: Oh, Fortune
Info: The third album for the Canadian folk singer was produced by Colin Stewart.

Title: Feel Something
Info: The second full-length release for the British rock quintet was produced with Charles Reeve and Joshua Third of The Horrors.

Title: Too Beautiful to Work
Info: The indie pop band from Montreal releases its first album on the Dead Oceans label.
