Title: Sigh No More
Info: Produced by Markus Dravs, the debut album for the folk rock quartet went platinum in the UK.

Title: Critical Equation
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Philadelphia indie band was produced by Gus Seyffert.

Title: Something's Changing
Info: The third full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was inspired by her tour of Latin America and features contributions from Chris Boot, Ben Daniels, Matthew and The Atlas' Emma Gatrill, Marcus Hamblett of Bear's Den, The Staves, and Daughter's Elena Tonra.

Title: Bad Penny
Info: Louis Jones' debut release of pop rock was produced by Richard Formby.

Title: Midwinter Graces
Info: The latest album for the singer-songwriter is 12 tracks (14 on the deluxe edition or 15 with the iTunes bonus track) of traditional and original holiday songs.

Title: Future Breeds
Info: The latest album for Canada's Hot Hot Heat is its first since leaving Warner Music and since bassist Dustin Hawthorne's departure from the band.

Title: Lazarus
Info: Gym Class Heroes' Travie McCoy releases his debut solo album featuring guest appearances by Cee Lo Green, Bruno Mars, Tim Williams, Colin Munroe, T-Pain and Young Cash.

Title: 10,000 Days
Info: The dark, proggy, hugely-popular alt-metal outfit fronted by Maynard James Keenan returns with that rarest of things: a new Tool album. It's the band's first release in five years and just their fourth full-length in their 16-year history.

Title: Indigo Meadow
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Texas-based psychedelic rock band was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Prior To The Fire
Info: The Canadian rock band releases its second album produced by David Schiffman.

Title: Friendly Fire
Info: The singer's first album in eight years includes instrumental help from Jon Brion and Matt Chamberlain, as well as guitarist Harper (son of Paul) Simon.

Title: My Best Human Face
Info: This is the second collaboration between Moonface (aka Spencer Krug) and the Finnish band Siinai.

Title: Communion
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the London-based electro-pop trio of Olly Alexander, Mikey Goldsworthy, and Emre Turkmen.

Title: And It's Still Alright
Info: The first full-length solo release in over six years for the singer-songwriter was co-produced with James Barone and Patrick Meese.

Title: Tosta Mista
Info: The second album from the Canadian group was inspired by end of the romantic relationship between band members Daniel Lee and April Aliermo.

Title: For All I Care
Info: The jazz trio introduces vocals by Wendy Lewis on its latest album of cover songs.

Title: Right About Now
Info: Mos Def and Jean Grae guest on Kweli's third solo outing.

Title: Motordrome
Info: The third full-length release for the Danish artist MØ features production from Ariel Rechtshaid, Jam City, SG Lewis, Lotus IV, Sly, Stint, Ronni Vindahl, Linus Wiklund and Yangze.

Title: Out of All This Blue
Info: Featuring influences from country, hip-hop and R&B, the two-disc release for the British band led by Mike Scott was recorded in Dublin and Tokyo.

Title: Too Old To Die Young
Info: The sophomore album for the Brooklyn, New York band now includes Ryan Sawyer as its full-time drummer.

Title: Animal Heart
Info: The former A Camp and Cardigans singer releases her first solo release under her real name.

Title: The Abbey Road Sessions
Info: The pop singer reworked some of her biggest hits with an orchestra at London's Abbey Road Studios.

Title: Ukulele Songs
Info: There is no irony in the title of Eddie Vedder's first solo album: These are indeed songs performed on a ukulele.

Title: You Can't Take It With You
Info: This is the second album for the Long Island indie rock band.

Title: Hidden City
Info: The tenth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Bob Rock.

Title: All We Are
Info: The debut full-length release for the British-based trio of Luís Santos, Guro Gikling, and Rich O'Flynn was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Mind Chaos
Info: This is the debut album for the Portland, Oregon rock band.

Title: Directions To See A Ghost
Info: The sophomore album for the Austin, Texas band was produced by Erik Wofford.

Title: Freak Puke
Info: The Melvins' King Buzzo and Dale Crover team up with Mr. Bungle bassist Trevor Dunn as Melvins Lite for this release.

Title: Pluto
Info: The debut studio album for the Decatur, Georgia-born rapper features guest appearances from Drake, R. Kelly, Juicy J, T.I., Trae, and Snoop Dogg.

Title: Everybody's a Good Dog
Info: The second full-length release for Foxygen drummer Shaun Fleming as Diane Coffee was inspired by his move to Bloomington, Indiana.
The English singer was named the Brit Awards' Critics' Choice even before her debut album was released.

Title: The Desaturating Seven
Info: The first full-length studio release in six years from the San Francisco-based alternative rock band led by Les Claypool and its first with original drummer Tim Alexander since 1995's Tales From The Punchbowl.

Title: Eucalyptus
Info: The second full-length solo release for the Animal Collective co-founder was recorded by Josh Dibb (Deakin) with contributions from Angel Deradoorian, Eyvind Kang and Jessika Kenney,

Title: Between Places
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Norwegian pop group that can include up to twelve band members.

Title: All Across This Land
Info: The eighth full-length release from the Portland, Oregon quintet was inspired by classic and southern rock.

Title: Brokeback and the Black Rock
Info: Douglas McCombs of Tortoise returns to his side project with a new band that includes Pete Croke, Chris Hansen, and James Elkington for his fourth release.

Title: Confection
Info: The fifth full-length release for the electronic French artist is a largely instrumental album that includes contributions from Cassius producer Phillipe Dzar and drummer Tony Allen.

Title: Songs for the Ravens
Info: This is the debut album for Julie Ann Baenziger, who wrote, sang, and played all the instruments on the release.

Title: America Give Up
Info: This is the first full-length release for the Minnesota rock band led by Jordan Gatesmith.

Title: West Ryder Pauper Lunatic Asylum
Info: The third studio album for the British band was produced by Dan the Automator.

Title: Where Did The Night Fall
Info: The latest album for the British electronic duo features guest appearances by Mark Lanegan, Gavin Clark, Elle J, South's Joel Cadbury, Celebration's Katrina Ford, Autolux, Sleepy Sun, The Black Angels, and Big In Japan.

Title: Head First
Info: The latest studio album for Alison Goldfrapp and producer Will Gregory finds the duo moving away from the more ambient sound of 2008's "Seventh Tree."

Title: Wavvves
Info: This is the first release on Fat Possum Records for the San Diego-based indie-rock artist.

Title: Emerald Valley
Info: The second full-length release for the indie rock supergroup that includes Kurt Bloch, Peter Buck, Scott McCaughey, Linda Pitmon, and Corin Tucker was co-produced by Bill Rieflin.

Title: Varshons 2
Info: The second collection of covers by the Boston alternative rock band led by Evan Dando was produced by Matthew Cullen.

Title: Language
Info: The debut full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Hailee Steinfeld.

Title: Jungle Rules
Info: The second full-length studio release for the New York City-based rapper features guest appearances from Alkaline, Marc E. Bassy, Chinx, Fe, Future, Kid Daytona, Max B, Ziico Niico, Quavo, Travis Scott, Rae Sremmurd, Swae Lee, T.I., The Weeknd, Pharrell Williams, and Young Thug.

Title: Theyesandeye
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter features a cover of xx's Angelsand was produced with Simon Byrt.

Title: Condemned To Hope
Info: The second full-length release for the British metal band was produced by James Sclavunos.

Title: Naomi
Info: The fourth release from the Seattle indie folk rock band was produced by Phil Ek.

Title: No Compass Will Find Home
Info: Conrad Lambert worked with producer Matthew Herbert on his fourth full-length release.

Title: Take Me Home
Info: The British boy band releases its second full-length release featuring production and songs written by such artists as Ed Sheeran, Carl Falk, Rami Yacoub, Savan Kotecha, Max Martin, and Dr. Luke.

Title: R.E.D.
Info: The fifth release for the R&B singer features guest appearances by Tim McGraw and Wiz Khalifa.

Title: Cruel Summer
Info: This studio compilation album features artists from the G.O.O.D. Music label and guest appearances from others including: Kanye West, Jay Z, Ghostface Killah, Raekwon, Push T, R. Kelly, Common, Kid Cudi, 2 Chainz, Big Sean, DJ Khaled, Ma$e, and Teyana Taylor.

Title: Black is Beautiful
Info: The British duo of Dean Blunt and Inga Copeland releases its fourth album together.

Title: Welcome Reality
Info: The electronic UK producer duo of Joe Ray and Dan Stephens, with guest vocalist Alana Watson, releases its debut full-length album.

Title: My ______ Is Pink
Info: Human sexuality and reproduction are the central themes of the concept album from the Oklahoma rock band led by Ryan Hendrix.

Title: Palace
Info: The debut album for the British indie quintet was produced by Paul Epworth.

Title: Invented
Info: Jimmy Eat World's seventh album was produced by Mark Trombino, who also produced 1999's Clarity and 2001's Bleed American.

Title: Ivory Tower
Info: The latest album for Jason Beck and produced with Boys Noize shares the same name as the film starring his alter ego Chilly Gonzales, Feist, Peaches, and Tiga.

Title: Sort Of Revolution
Info: Fin Greenall releases his third album under the alias Fink.

Title: Ellipse
Info: This is the third solo album for the British singer-songwriter.

Title: Apple's Acre
Info: This is the latest album for the indie rock trio from Portland, Oregon.

Title: Mythomania
Info: The second album for the experimental rock trio was recorded near Yosemite.

Title: Defying Gravity
Info: The latest album for the New Zealand-born country singer was produced with Dann Huff.

Title: Songs And Other Things
Info: 'Songs' (one of two April 2006 releases) is the former Television frontman's first vocal release in sixteen years. Television's Fred Smith guests.

Title: Me & Mr Johnson
Info: The guitarist pays homage to legendary bluesman Robert Johnson with these 14 covers.

Title: Let It Be... Naked
Info: Originally intended as a loose, spontaneous recording called 'Get Back,' 'Let It Be' was eventually released (after the band's breakup) after being shelved and then reproduced/enhanced by Phil Spector, leaving many fans (and an angry Paul McCartney) wondering, "what if?" This new release answers that question to a certain extent, with an altered track listing (which adds "Don't Let Me Down") containing some de-Spectorized versions as well as some originals that have been remixed and remastered.

Title: Bare
Info: The former Eurythmics' singer's third solo album is her first collection of original songs since 1992's 'Diva.'

Title: Trouble No More
Info: The Indiana rocker returns with his very first covers album, with versions of 12 roots/blues tunes.

Title: Not Too Late
Info: M. Ward and the Kronos Quartet are among the guests on the singer's third album.

Title: Nancy Sinatra
Info: A better album title would have been 'Nancy Sinatra & Friends,' as the 64-year-old singer collaborates with fans such as Morrissey, Pulp's Jarvis Cocker and Richard Hawley, Sonic Youth's Jim O'Rourke and Thurston Moore, Jon Spencer, Pete Yorn and U2.

Title: New Chain
Info: The Brooklyn rock band's full-length debut was written and recorded in Delaware.

Title: Crime Pays
Info: The sixth studio album for the New York rapper features Byrd Lady, Skitzo, 40 Cal., C.O., and Sky Lyn as guests.

Title: Let's Face the Music and Dance
Info: The latest release from the country singer with his backing band, the Family, includes covers of classic country and standard songs.

Title: Liquid Cool
Info: Ramona Gonzalez first release in four years as Nite Jewel was self produced and on her own label.

Title: Lambs Anger
Info: This is the fourth studio album for the French music producer.

Title: Traffic And Weather
Info: Band member Adam Schlesinger produced FOW's long-awaited fourth studio album, which follows four years after their breakthrough hit 'Welcome Interstate Managers.'

Title: Perfect View
Info: This is the third full-length release for the electronic producer Hannes Norrvide.

Title: Melbourne
Info: The debut release for the North Carolina singer includes influences from kraut, pop, psych and punk music.

Title: Return Of The Wu & Friends
Info: The latest compilation features rare and unreleased remixes produced by Mathematics.

Title: Diamond Rugs
Info: Adam Landry and Justin Collins produced the debut album from the indie "supergroup" that includes John McCauley and Robbie Crowell of Deer Tick, Steve Berlin of Los Lobos, Hardy Morris of Dead Confederate, Ian Saint Pe of the Black Lips, and Bryan Dufresne of Six Finger Satellite.

Title: The  Sun Dogs
Info: Elements of folk-rock, psychedelic rock, Persian, Indian, and Eastern European music are found on the debut full-length release from the Seattle rock septet led by Chris Cheveyo and produced by Randall Dunn.

Title: Sob Story
Info: The second full-length release for the indie band led by Louis Jones was produced by Girls bassist, JR White.

Title: A Productive Cough
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie punk band led by Patrick Stickles features a cover of Bob Dylan's "(I'm) Like a Rolling Stone" and was produced by Kevin S. McMahon.

Title: Work
Info: The third album for the Swedish indie rock quintet was produced by Phil Ek.

Title: Come And Get It!
Info: Ever since the dawn of the electric guitar, white boys have sung the blues, some with considerably more success than others. Eli â€œPaperboyâ€ Reed is part of that long tradition, but he stands apart from the pack as much as he belongs to it, due in large part to his age. Raised on CD reissues of classic blues and soul -- he was not even 10 when the first Complete Stax/Volt Singles box came out -- Reed has absorbed the sound and sensibility of classic â€˜60s soul but sings without any white-boy blues affectations, totally comfortable in his own skin because nobody else his age, of any race, was attempting to make this kind of music. This can cause a kind of a disconnect -- Reed sounds so white when he sings, itâ€™s disarming -- but he pours on the passion and has fully absorbed the tight turns of Stax and loves the sound as much as the structure, so much so that Come and Get It -- his third LP and first for a major label -- feels a bit like an unearthed relic, built on songs and sounds that could pass for unheard gems if it wasnâ€™t for Reedâ€™s unapologetically white voice, free of affectations and ticks. Some of that may be due to producer Mike Elizondoâ€™s work -- he manages to make this sound like a throwback without being stiff, and without having a hint of Mark Ronsonâ€™s hipster retroism for Amy Winehouse -- but heâ€™s just articulating Reedâ€™s gifts, letting the songs stand front and center. And thatâ€™s whatâ€™s remarkable about Come and Get It: this is not a modern-day blues album, itâ€™s a classic soul album, with almost all the tracks clocking in at 3:30 or less, leaving very little room for showboating solos. All concentration is on the tunes themselves, with the band kicking them toward kineticism, Reed channeling all his energy into making the songs sing, and they wind up sticking, sounding a bit like forgotten classics upon first listen, then winding up as familiar favorites upon the second. If there is any fault here, itâ€™s that Reedâ€™s voice remains perennially boyish, sometimes preventing this from achieving a level of gravity, but thereâ€™s no attempt to hide this: itâ€™s an honest reflection of who Reed is, a young kid from Boston in love with the Southern sounds of the â€˜60s and intent on carrying them on, even if he invites ridicule or scorn. He believes it, man, and based on Come and Get It, itâ€™s hard not to believe it too. ~ Stephen Thomas Erlewine

Title: Trigga
Info: The sixth full-length studio release album for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Justin Bieber, Juicy J, Mila J, Nicki Minaj, and Ty Dolla $ign.
The debut release from the British sisters Hannah and Colette Thurlow was produced by Rob Ellis.

Title: Colour Trip
Info: The Texas trio's debut album is dreamy mix of shoegaze, noise pop, and heavily-textured rock, drawing comparisons to My Bloody Valentine and The Jesus and Mary Chain.

Title: Who Killed Harry Houdini?
Info: The sophomore album for the Swedish band was produced by Emanuel Lundgren and Fabian "Phatfabe" Torsson.

Title: Suitcase 2: American Superdream Wow
Info: This companion to the original 'Suitcase' continues where that box set left off, packing 100 more GBV rareties and outtakes from the now-disbanded group onto four discs.

Title: Lonesome Dreams
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Ben Schneider folk rock project.

Title: The Place We Ran From
Info: Snow Patrol's Gary Lightbody gathers together fellow band member Iain Archer, R.E.M.'s Peter Buck, Scott McCaughey, Belle & Sebastian's Richard Colburn, Garret "Jacknife" Lee, and Troy Stewart to record a country-inspired album.

Title: Lion The Girl
Info: Steve Fisk produced this sophomore set for the--dare we say it--cinematic Los Angeles-based band, now a four-piece after the departure of co-founder Jason Hammons and the addition of two new members.

Title: Last Year Was Complicated
Info: The third full-length solo release for the pop singer features guest appearances from Big Sean, Tove Lo and Ty Dolla $ign.

Title: Odulek
Info: The debut solo release for the Doves frontman was produced with Dan Austin.

Title: Pint of Blood
Info: The Texan folk singer--one of the founding members of The Be Good Tanyas--returns with her fourth studio album, which combines traditional folk with country and rock.

Title: Born Again Revisited
Info: The Ohio's trio's latest album was recorded on VHS tape.

Title: Crawling Up the Stairs
Info: The second full-length release for the Austin trio was written while singer/guitarist Nate Grace was recovering from a serious leg injury.

Title: Across Six Leap Years
Info: The 10th studio release for the indie rock band is an album of re-recordings of older rare tracks.

Title: Go Away White
Info: The first album in over 20 years for the British rock band is also their last.

Title: Rhythm and Repose
Info: Produced by Thomas Bartlett, Glen Hansard returns after his success with Frames, the Swell Season, and the Once soundtrack/musical score, with his first solo album.

Title: The Tourist
Info: Alec Ounsworth, the sole member of the indie rock band remaining, worked with Nick Krill on the CYHSY's fifth full-length release.

Title: Incredibad
Info: The people (Akiva Schaffer, Jorma Taccone, and Andy Samberg) behind the "Dick In A Box" song/video on Saturday Night Live releases their debut album.

Title: Has Been
Info: Yes, it 'has been' a long time since the last William Shatner album (and with good reason), but the veteran recording artist returns for this collaboration with Ben Folds. Other guests include Joe Jackson, Aimee Mann and Adrian Belew, but sadly, no Leonard Nimoy.

Title: Stone Love
Info: The soul singer's latest release marks her 25th year as a recording artist (she made her debut in 1979 as a member of the first female rap group ever, Sequence). Guests here include Missy Elliott, Floetry and Snoop Dogg.

Title: Evil Heat
Info: Bobby Gillespie and co. follow 2000's widely acclaimed 'XTRMNTR' with a similar blend of Stooges-style rock and electronica, thanks to the production work of semi-official Primal Scream member Kevin Shields (formerly of My Bloody Valentine) and Andy Weatherall. Tracks include first single "Miss Lucifer," "City," a remake of a Gillespie-sung track on David Holmes' most recent album, and "Some Velvet Morning," sung as a duet with supermodel Kate Moss.

Title: Justified
Info: Aw... little Justin's all grows up. First Mickey Mouse Club, then 'NSync, and now this, his solo debut. Can he be a success on his own? Well, having Timbaland and The Neptunes along as his producers certainly won't hurt.

Title: Highly Evolved
Info: 2001 gave us The White Stripes and The Strokes; 2002 gives us The Hives and The Vines. This Australian four-piece outfit is the latest rock band to be hyped to stratospheric proportions (and an instant major-label contract) by the UK rock press, who compared the Vines to Nirvana (the band, not the concept). But although the Aussies did indeed get their start as a Nirvana cover band, there is a bit more to their debut album 'Highly Evolved' than Grunge, Part 2.

Title: Fever
Info: This high-energy dance album from the Australian veteran includes the UK hit single "Can't Get You out of My Head." It is her first American release since 1988, although she has retained her popularity in Europe and her native Australia since the 1980's, updating her sound along the way.

Title: Hyacinths and Thistles
Info: The Magnetic Fields' Stephin Merritt returns with a second disc under The 6ths nameplate (following 1995's Wasps' Nests). Like its predecessor, this album features original Merritt compositions sung by guest vocalists, including Gary Numan, Sarah Cracknell, Marc Almond, Bob Mould, and Sally Timms.

Title: Move Like This
Info: After ending a 22-year hiatus in 2010, the legendary rock band returns on this reunion album, featuring their familiar mix of psychedelic pop and new wave.

Title: Telekinesis!
Info: The debut album for the rock band led by Michael Benjamin Lerner was produced by Death Cab For Cutie's Chris Walla.

Title: Fold Your Hands Child, You Walk Like A Peasant
The Turning Year
Info: The first full-length solo release on Deutsche Grammophon for British composer/pianist Roger Eno features the German string ensemble Scoring Berlin.

Title: Animator
Info: The sudden death of a close friend was an influence on the follow-up to the Canadian band's 2011 Polaris Music Prize long-listed debut release, Too Beautiful to Work.

Title: Underwater Cinematographer
Info: This is the debut for the Toronto six-piece led by Adrian Jewett.

Title: Believe
Info: Big Sean, Drake, Ludacris, and Nicki Minaj guest on the third full-length album from the Canadian pop singer.

Title: Hands
Info: The debut album for the singer-songwriter was produced with Greg Kurstin and Joe Goddard.

Title: Aimlessness
Info: The fourth release for Jimmy Tamborello as Dntel includes guest vocals from Will Wiesenfeld (also known as Baths) and Nite Jewel.

Title: Songs Of Mass Destruction
Info: Glen Ballard produces the ex-Eurythmics singer's fourth album.

Title: Time as We Know It: The Songs of Jerry Jeff Walker
Info: The latest album from Todd Snider is a tribute album to Jerry Jeff Walker.

Title: Walk the River
Info: After a successful solo turn, lead singer Fyfe Dangerfield returns to his indie rock band to release its third full-length release.

Title: Rehumanizer
Info: The latest release for the Athens, Georgia-based post-rock quartet was self-produced by the band and recorded by Mike Albanese.

Title: Under the Covers, Vol. 3
Info: The third set of covers from Matthew Sweet and Susanna Hoffs is a collection of songs from the 1980s including covers of R.E.M.’s “Sitting Still,” The Smiths' “How Soon is Now,” and Kirsty MacColl’s “They Don’t Know.”

Title: The Century Of Self
Artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
Info: The sixth full-length album for the rock band from Texas is its first on the Richter Scale/Justice label.

Title: Roadkill Overcoat
Info: Los Angeles rapper Regan Farquhar returns with an album produced by Boom Bip and DJ Nobody.

Title: Hurley
Info: As its first independently released album, Weezer still remains true to form with a collection of Pinkerton-esque pop rock.

Title: The Fragile Army
Info: This third LP is the first release since 2004 for the Texas-based choral/symphonic rock group fronted by Tim DeLaughter.

Title: The Family Jewels
Info: The Wales-born Greek singer-songwriter releases her debut full-length album.

Title: EVOL
Info: The fourth full-length release from the Atlanta rapper features a guest appearance by The Weeknd and was a surprise release after announcing it two days prior.

Title: Cotillions
Info: The second full-length solo release for The Smashing Pumpkins lead singer under his full name was recorded in Chicago and Nashville.

Title: The Laughing Apple
Info: The 15th full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Paul Samwell-Smith and features guitarist Alun Davie, who both worked on some of the artist's 1970s albums released under the Cat Stevens name.

Title: Chapter V
Info: The fifth studio album for the R&B singer features guest appearances  from Diddy, Lil Wayne, Meek Mill, Rick Ross, T.I., and Young Jeezy.

Title: Drastic Fantastic
Info: "Drastic Fantastic" is KT's studio follow-up to her successful debut CD.

Title: Rebel Heart
Info: The 13th full-length studio release for the pop artist features guest appearances from Chance The Rapper, Nicki Minaj, Nas, and Mike Tyson.

Title: The Blue Ridge Rangers Rides Again
Info: The ex-Creedence Clearwater Revival guitarist releases his latest solo album, a sequel of sorts to his first solo album (he doesn't play all the instruments himself as he did in his debut.)

Title: Ratworld
Info: The debut full-length release for the indie duo of Ryan Needham and Liza Violet was produced by MJ of Hookworms.

Title: Peanut Butter And Jelly Live At The Ginger Minge
Info: This is the third studio album (don't believe the title) for the San Francisco punkers.

Title: No Fun Mondays
Info: The covers album from the Green Day frontman features songs he released during the COVID-19 lockdown on YouTube.

Title: Basses Loaded
Info: The latest release from the sludge-metal pioneers features six different bassists: current drummer Dale Crover, Mr. Bungle's Trevor Dunn, Redd Kross' Steven McDonald, ex-Nirvana Krist Novoselic, Butthole Surfers' Jeff Pinkus, and Big Business' Jared Warren.

Title: Chasing Yesterday
Info: The second full-length solo release was self-produced by the former Oasis singer/guitarist and features a guest appearance from Johnny Marr.

Title: Mexico
Info: The ninth full-length release [and its third for Kompakt] for the Icelandic electronic quartet includes influences from synth pop, trance and UK garage music.

Title: Still Within the Sound of My Voice
Info: Produced by Fred Molin, the latest release from the singer-songwriter features guest appearances from such artists as Joe Cocker, David Crosby, Art Garfunkel, Amy Grant, Kris Kristofferson, Lyle Lovett, Graham Nash, Carly Simon, Keith Urban and Brian Wilson.

Title: The Chair In The Doorway
Info: The New York band returns after five years to release its fifth album.

Title: Mastermind
Info: The sixth solo studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Big Sean, French Montana, Jay-Z, Lil Wayne, Meek Mill, Scarface, The Weeknd, and Kanye West.

Title: Fire In The Hole
Info: This is the fifth LP in 15 years for the veteran hip-hop unit of Grand Puba, Lord Jamar and Sadat X.

Title: Forget Yourself
Info: This is the veteran Australian band's 17th album.

Title: Imperial
Info: 'Imperial' marks the first-ever solo release for the Cocteau Twins' guitarist (who also runs record label Bella Union, works as a record producer, and is one-half of the band Violet Indiana). This ten-track instrumental disc sounds a lot like his work with that earlier band.

Title: Group Therapy
Info: This is the first album in nine years for the reunited Los Angeles alternative act, featuring three original members Johnette Napolitano, Jim Mankey and Harry Rushakoff. The 12 new tracks here include "Roxy," a tribute to Roxy Music.

Title: 10,000 Hz Legend
Info: The French indie-electronica band made waves with their 1998 debut 'Moon Safari,' but since then their only release has been the motion picture score to Sofia Coppola's "The Virgin Suicides." The wait for their true sophomore album is over with the release of '10,000 Hz Legend,' which includes guest vocal contributions from Beck and Buffalo Daughter.

Title: Hello Happiness
Info: The first new studio release of new songs from the Chicago R&B/funk artist since 2007 was co-produced by Sarah Ruba and David "Switch" Taylor.

Title: Von
Info: The Icelandic band's 1997 debut album received its first international release in 2004.

Title: Terrible Human Beings
Info: The third full-length release for the Chicago-area garage rock band was produced by Jim Abbiss.

Title: Subtitulo
Info: The Nebraskan singer-songwriter recorded this seventh album in his new home of Spain.

Title: Self Help Serenade
Info: Rob Schnapf and Jon Brion produced the for the Los Angeles band (and by "band" we really just mean Evan Slamka).

Title: In the Pursuit of Leisure
Info: This lengthily-titled album marks a reunion for the band with producer David Kahne. Included here is a cover of Joe Jackson's "Is She Really Going Out With Him?"

Title: Eve-Olution
Info: Eve's third album finds the popular Philly rapper working with producers Dr. Dre, Irv Gotti and Swizz Beatz. Alicia Keys guests on one track.

Title: Iowa
Info: Produced by Ross Robinson, 'Iowa' is the metal band's third album.

Title: Just Enough Education To Perform
Info: This is the third full-length for the British threesome. It debuted at #1 on the UK music charts.

Title: Lysandre
Info: The debut solo release for the former frontman for the indie band Girls traces the long-distance relationship he had with a woman named Lysandre.

Title: Man Of Aran OST
Info: The rock band releases a soundtrack to the 1934 movie "Man of Aran."

Title: Dos!
Info: The second of Green Day's 2012 trilogy produced by Rob Cavallo is said to have garage rock influences.

Title: Black and White America
Info: The funk rock singer and multi-instrumentalist releases his ninth studio album.

Title: Sam Baker's Album
Info: This is the second full-length album for the hip-hop producer.

Title: Kaleidoscope Heart
Info: Having been compared to everyone from Norah Jones to Billy Joel, this singer-songwriter returns with her sophomore release that further exemplifies her musical talent and bold lyricism.

Title: Time Is Over One Day Old
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn rock band was produced by band leader, Jon Philpot.

Title: Love at the Bottom of the Sea
Info: Synthesizers and Stephin Merritt return to the Magnetic Fields with the first album of new material for the band since 1999's 69 Songs.

Title: Father of All…
Info: The 13th full-length studio release for the Northern California punk trio was produced with Chris Dugan and Butch Walker.

Title: Otherness
Info: The second full-length solo release for Adam Bainbridge features guest appearances from Ade, Devonté Hynes, Kelela, M.Anifest, Robyn, and Tawiah.

Title: V for Vaselines
Info: The third full-length studio release from the Scottish indie pop band was self-produced.

Title: Decimation Blues
Info: This is the sixth release for the indie project formed by Raymond Raposa.

Title: Colored Emotions
Info: Originally released on Bandcamp in 2011, the debut full-length release for the Minneapolis indie rock trio was rerecorded by producer Thom Monahan for its release on the Domino label.

Title: Gangs
Artist: And So I Watch You from Afar
Info: The second album for the Belfast rock band was produced with Ricky O'Reilly.

Title: Gloria
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for British singer-songwriter Sam Smith features guest appearances from Koffee, Kim Petras, Jessie Reyez, and Ed Sheeran.

Title: Truth Is a Beautiful Thing
Info: The second full-length release for the British trio features production from Tim Bran, Paul Epworth, Jon Hopkins, Roy Kerr and Greg Kurstin.
The band, originally started as a side project, releases it's second album.

Title: Free Your Mind
Info: Inspired by the Summer of Loves (1967 in San Francisco and 1988-89 in the UK), the fourth full-length release for the Australian dance-rock quartet was mixed in New York by Dave Fridmann.

Title: Innocence Reaches
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the Kevin Barnes-led indie rock band was inspired by music from such artists as Arca, Chairlift, and Jack Ü.

Title: Valentina
Info: The first album in four years for the rock band led by David Gedge was produced by Andrew Scheps.

Title: Strange Desire
Info: The debut solo project for fun.'s Jack Antonoff was co-produced by John Hill and features guest appearances from Grimes and Yoko Ono.

Title: Dark Light Daybreak
Info: The band's third album finds producer/songwriter Andy LeMaster once again joined by Azure Ray's Orenda Fink and Maria Taylor, plus drummer Clay Leverett.

Title: Self Entitled
Info: The 12th studio album for the California punk rock band was produced by Bill Stevenson.

Title: Imperfect Harmonies
Info: The former System of a Down singer once again merges progressive rock with orchestral magnificence to create a symphony of electronically influenced sound on his follow-up solo album.

Title: Intersection
Info: Nanci Griffith's 20th album was recorded at her Nashville home with co-producers Maura Kennedy, Pete Kennedy, and Pat McInerney.

Title: The Good Life
Info: The son of Grammy-winning singer Steve Earle releases his debut album.

Title: Monkeytown
Info: The Berlin duo's third album includes Radiohead's Thom Yorke as a guest vocalist.

Title: Echo Kid
Info: Jonas Stein returns to his side project after leaving Be My Own Pet.

Title: Masters Of The Burial
Info: The second album for the Stars/Broken Social Scene singer features guest appearances by Stars' Evan Cranley, The Stills' Liam O'Neil, and Feist.

Title: Shots
Info: This is the debut album for the Canadian indie rock quartet from Vancouver.

Title: Of The Blue Colour Of The Sky
Info: The latest album for the rock band from Chicago features the track "Shooting The Moon" which appeared in the "New Moon" movie soundtrack.

Title: Enjoy the Company
Info: The fourth release for the Athens, Georgia rock band was produced by John Agnello.

Title: Testing
Info: The third full-length studio album from the New York rapper was a surprise release and features guest appearances from FKA twigs, French Montana, Juicy J, Kid Cudi, Kodak Black, Moby, Frank Ocean, Skepta, and T.I.

Title: Our Country: Americana, Act 2
Info: The Kinks frontman's follow-up to his 2017 Americana features The Jayhawks, as well spoken word, and reworked versions of some of his work with the Kinks and as a solo artist.

Title: La  Petite Mort
Info: Produced by Max Dingel, the 13th full-length release for the Manchester band was written after the passing of Tim Booth's mother and best friend.

Title: G I R L
Info: Miley Cyrus, Daft Punk, JoJo, Alicia Keys, and Justin Timberlake are featured guests on the second full-length solo release for the rapper/producer that includes the Academy Award-nominated song "Happy" from the Despicable Me 2 soundtrack.

Title: Inspiral Carpets
Info: The Manchester rock band reunited with singer Stephen Holt return with its first release in 20 years.

Title: Starboy
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Canadian artist features guest appearances from Daft Punk, Lana Del Rey, Future, and Kendrick Lamar.

Title: Our Version of Events
Info: This is the debut album for the singer-songwriter who won the Brit's Critic Choice Award for best new artist in 2012.

Title: B.O.A.T.S. II: #METIME
Info: The second solo full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Drake, Fergie, Lil Wayne, Ma$e,  Chrisette Michele, Pharrell, Pusha T, and T-Pain.

Title: High Life
Info: Two months after the release of the first collaboration between Brian Eno and Underworld's Karl Hyde (Someday World), the duo release a second disc of songs recorded soon after the announcement of the first.

Title: Kingdom Come
Info: Forget retirement. The legendary rapper and Def Jam head has resurfaced after a three-year hiatus, with an album that finds him joined by some of the biggest names in hip-hop (Dr. Dre, Timbaland, Pharrell Williams, Kanye West) and alt-rock (Coldplay's Chris Martin).

Title: Close to Home
Info: The debut full-length release for the British rapper features guest appearances from by Ashanti, Bakar, Mastermind, New Machine, Ed Sheeran, and AJ Tracey.

Title: Volume 3
Info: Tom Hagerman of Devotchka, Pierre de Reeder of Rilo Kiley, Joey Spampinato of NRBQ, Tilly and the Wall, and Mike Watt are some of the guest musicians on the third release for the indie pop duo of M. Ward and Zooey Deschanel.

Title: Meantime [EP]
Info: The four-track EP from producer Kwes. is his first on the Warp label.

Title: King Con
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the Detroit indie pop singer-songwriter.

Title: Waiting In Vain
Info: The artist previously known as Wooden Wand releases his debut solo album.

Title: Paper Monsters
Info: The Depeche Mode vocalist's first solo release finds him working with Sigur Ros producer Ken Thomas.

Title: Animositisomina
Info: Al Jourgensen is back, and, apparently, angrier than ever. Included here on the industrial band's eighth album is a cover of Magazine's "The Light Pours Out of Me."

Title: X
Info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features collaborations and production from Benny Blanco, Johnny McDaid, Pharrell Williams, and Rick Rubin.

Title: Soft Money
Info: A member of Subtle, Themselves and 13 & God, Jel (aka Jeffery James Logan) makes his true solo LP deubt with this 12-track effort. Ms John Soda's Stefanie Bohm, Fog's Andrew Broder, and cLOUDDEAD's Odd Nosdam are among the guests.

Title: Rebel Soul
Info: The Twisted Brown Trucker band return on Kid Rock's ninth studio release that he also produced himself.

Title: Was I the Wave?
Info: The sophomore album for the indie Canadian band led by Graham Van Pelt is its first in more than four years.

Title: Ghetto Classics
Info: Jadakiss guests on the R&B vocalists third disc.

Title: Monster
Info: The 20th studio release for the rock band led by Gene Simmons and Paul Stanley was recorded on analog equipment.

Title: Real Life
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the British electronic trio of Kev Kharas, Pat King, and Tom Watson.

Title: From the Very Depths
Info: The 14th studio release for the British black metal trio was produced by the band's bassist Cronos.

Title: Jordin Sparks
Info: The latest "American Idol" winner releases her debut album.

Title: I Thought I Was Over That: Rare, Remixed And B-Sides
Info: The title tells the story of this two-disc set, which includes remixes by Dntel, Boom Bip and Two Lone Swordsmen.

Title: World's Apart
Artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
Info: This is the fourth album for the critically-acclaimed Texas-based band.

Title: The Fall
Info: The digital-only album was recorded by Damon Albarn on his iPad while on tour in 2010 is released on CD.

Title: Ruby Red
Info: More than 20 musicians contributed to the third release from North Carolina-based Stuart McLamb's music project, The Love Language.

Title: Victory For The Comic Muse
Info: The title of this ninth Divine Comedy album for Neil Hannon echoes back to the band's debut, 'Fanfare For The Comic Muse.'

Title: Future
Info: The fifth full-length studio release fro the rapper includes production from DJ Khaled, DY, Metro Boomin, Southside, Tarentino, Tre Pounds and Zaytoven.

Title: Scintilli
Info: This is the sixth album for the IDM duo of Ed Handley and Andy Turner.

Title: We Are The Night
Info: The sixth album from the veteran electronica act includes guest appearances by Willy Mason, The Klaxons, Fatlip and Midlake.

Title: Asiatisch
Info: The debut release for the Senegal-born and now Brooklyn-based artist is a concept album of a futuristic China.

Title: Enemy Chorus
Info: This is the second LP for the ever-growing prog-rock collective that calls both England and Texas home.

Title: Free Time
Info: The Japanese trio releases its latest album of punk rock music.

Title: White Trash With Money
Info: The country singer's latest is his first collaboration with producer Lari White, and also marks his first release on his new record label (Show Dog).

Title: The Singles
Info: The Brooklyn, New York, band releases its first full-length album of singles, B-sides, and remixes.

Title: Continuum
Info: The singer-songwriter's first album in three years was produced by Steve Jordan and, for the first time, by Mayer himself.

Title: Happy Now
Info: The ninth full-length release for the British post-punk band led by Andy Gill was co-produced with Ben Hillier and Ross Orton.

Title: Bazaar
Info: The second full-length release from the Portland-based band was produced by Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Jacob Portrait

Title: Friendly Bacteria
Info: British DJ/producer Andy Carthy's latest release as Mr. Skruff  features vocals from Vanessa Freeman and Robert Owens.

Title: Imperium
Info: Produced by band member Jacob Portrait, the second full-length release sees the Portland indie trio moving away from drum machines and synths to a more guitar-oriented sound.

Title: Tell Tales
Info: The debut album for the quartet of Marie Nixon of Kenickie, Jennie Redmond, Cath Stephens, and Liz Corney was co-produced with Peter Brewis.

Title: All of Me
Info: The third album for the British singer features guest appearances by Chris Brown, Janelle Monae, Rick Ross, and Trey Songz.

Title: Lucky One
Info: After two cover albums, the former Mavericks singer releases his first album of original songs on the Fantasy Records label.

Title: The Way Of All Flesh
Info: The fourth album for the French metal band features Lamb of God's Randy Blythe as a guest vocalist on one track.

Title: Actual Fucking
Info: This sixth album for Rjyan Kidwell's Cex project finds him joined by Joan of Arc's Cale Parks and his wife Roby Newton.

Title: Big Whiskey And The GrooGrux King
Info: The rock band's latest album was produced by Rob Cavallo and is its first album without saxophonist LeRoi Moore, who died in the summer of 2008.

Title: Tomorrow, In A Year
Info: The Knife, along with Mt. Sims and Planningtorock, created a 90-minute opera about Charles Darwin.

Title: Joanne
Info: The fifth full-length release for the pop artist features a duet with Florence Welch.

Title: Out of Touch
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for the Berlin-based Finnish artist was inspired by his time in Greece.

Title: Yung Rich Nation
Info: the debut full-length major studio release for the rap trio features guest appearances from Chris Brown and Young Thug.

Title: Prospekt's March [EP]
Info: The eight-track EP contains songs from the "Viva La Vida" sessions, including one track featuring Jay-Z.

Title: Blame Confusion
Info: This is the full-length debut release for the Montreal duo of Xavier Germain-Poitras and Louis Guillemette.

Title: Iradelphic
Info: Chris Clark's sixth album featuring Martina Topley-Bird and acoustic guitars was recorded around the world, including Australia, Belgium, Germany, Norway, and the UK.

Title: Van Weezer
Info: The 15th full-length studio release for the alternative rock band finally arrives after being delayed by nearly a year.

Title: Organ Music Not Vibraphone Like I'd Hoped
Info: Spencer Krug (of Wolf Parade fame) releases his solo album under his Moonface moniker.

Title: Can I Keep This Pen?
Info: The Long Island trio moves away from a major label for this album.

Title: Firewater
Info: The hip-hop trio's first album in five years is also their final outing as a group.

Title: Sweat
Info: Released on the same day as 'Suit,' 'Sweat' is the more club-oriented of the pair, with production handled by The Alchemist, The Neptunes, and more. Christina Aguilera, Mobb Deep and Missy Elliott guest.

Title: Heavier Things
Info: The Atlanta-based singer-songwriter (who is frequently compared to Dave Matthews) attempts to duplicate the unexpected success of 2001's 'Room for Squares' with this third album.

Title: The Magic Magicians
Info: The duo of 764-HERO guitarist/vocalist John Atkins and Black Heart Procession drummer Joe Plummer return with a second LP.

Title: Smash Mouth
Info: This self-titled effort is the California band's third album.

Title: Life On A String
Info: This is Laurie Anderson's first music release since 1994's 'Big Red.' Originally conceived as a studio verision of her recent theatrical production "Songs and Stories from Moby Dick," the thirteen-song album contains only three tracks from that show, supplemented with newer material. Guest musicians include Lou Reed, Dr. John, Bill Frisell, Mocean Worker and Van Dyke Parks.

Title: Repo
Info: The second album on the Paw Tracks label for the Brooklyn-based experimental group.

Title: Night People
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Jacquire King.

Title: Overdrive
Info: This is the 19th full-length studio release from the Japanese pop punk trio.

Title: What Did You Expect from the Vaccines?
Info: The debut album for the British indie rock band was produced by Dan Grech.

Title: Mind Over Matter
Info: The second release for the Southern California indie rock band was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.

Title: Songbird
Info: Youngster Ryan Adams produced this 11-song mix of originals and covers, which also includes musical backing from Adams' band The Cardinals.

Title: Radlands
Info: The British indie rock band's fifth album was recorded in Austin, Texas and was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Friends for Now
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the San Francisco psychedelic rock quintet.

Title: Reformation Post T.L.C.
Info: The Mark E. Smith-led band's 26th studio album (give or take) features yet another new lineup of musicians (who also play in Los Angeles outfit Darker My Sweet), as the previous set mutinied on tour last year.

Title: Dark Hearts
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Norwegian pop artist is her first in 11 years and was produced by Stefan Storm.

Title: Bell House
Info: Kyle Little and Ross Brown join Collin Rausch, Kyle Rausch and Konnor Ervin for to the group for Kansas City indie rock band's second full-length release.

Title: Stateless
Info: This is the sixth and final release for the experimental project of Alex Zhang Hungtai.

Title: Fire Songs
Info: This is the first album on the Vanguard label for the Los Angeles-based band who had previously worked with Jenny Lewis.

Title: Antemasque
Info: This is the debut release for the project from Cedric Bixler-Zavala, Omar Rodriguez-Lopez, Dave Elitch, and Flea on this new release.

Title: For True
Info: The second album for the New Orleans jazz artist who not only plays the trombone, trumpet, piano, and drums, but also sings features such guests as Jeff Beck, Warren Haynes, Kid Rock, Lenny Kravitz, and Ledisi.

Title: Sounds Good Feels Good
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian pop-punk band features songs co-written by such artists as Duran Duran, All Time Low's Alex Gaskarth, Good Charlotte's Benji and Joel Madden, with production by John Feldmann.
Atlanta's Usher Raymond returns with his third studio release. The Neptunes, Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis are among the producers.

Title: "Pussy Cats" Starring The Walkmen
Info: The indie rockers' second release of 2006 is a song-for-song recreation of Harry Nilsson's alcohol-fueled, John Lennon-produced, 1974 album.

Title: 100 Percent Publishing
Info: The seventh studio album by the English producer and rapper was written, produced, and mastered entirely by Wiley.

Title: Milk White Sheets
Info: James Iha (Smashing Pumpkins) guests on the former Belle & Sebastian singer's second solo outing, which finds her reworking traditional British folk songs.

Title: Season High
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Swedish electronic quartet was produced with James Ford.

Title: Miracle Mile
Info: The third release for Josh Hodges' indie electronic project was written collaboratively between the Portland, Oregon-based band members.

Title: The Hurry and the Harm
Info: The fourth studio release for former Alexisonfire singer Dallas Green as City And Colour was produced by Alex Newport.

Title: Heartbeat Radio
Info: The fifth album for the Norwegian singer-songwriter was produced by Kato Adland.

Title: Loud
Info: The Barbadian pop star's fifth album is boasted as her rebirth, showcasing her vocal and lyrical range as a versatile artist. It carries more than just club-ready cuts and includes collaborations with Nicki Minaj and Eminem.

Title: Femme Fatale
Info: The famous pop artist's seventh album promises a sleekly produced, seductive sound, perfect for a disco party with her signature dance floor pop.

Title: Nehruviandoom
Info: This is the debut release from the collaboration between from Bishop Nehru and MF Doom.

Title: The Beautiful Lie
Info: This is the fifth solo album from the prolific English singer-songwriter.

Title: Love Sign
Info: The second release for the Philadelphia rock quintet was produced by John Agnello.

Title: The Host
Info: Producer Barry Lynn, who is better known under his Boxcutter alias, releases his first album under the Host name.

Title: The Way
Info: The ninth studio release for the British punk band was produced with Dave M. Allen.

Title: Breakfast
Info: This is the debut release for Philadelphia alternative rap group Chiddy Bang.

Title: Landing
Info: The fourth album for the rock band includes the Wire's Colin Newman, Scanner's Robin Rimbaud, and former members of Minimal Compact, Malka Spigel and Max Franken.

Title: Time Traveller
Info: The sophomore album for the Los Angeles-based group is led by Jack Splash.

Title: Omnibus
Info: Before he was in The Decemberists, singer-songwriter Colin Meloy fronted a Montana alt-country/alt-rock outfit known as Tarkio. This set collects that band's entire output of 27 tracks.

Title: A People's History Of The Dismemberment Plan
Info: This final release from the now disbanded Washington, D.C. group is a remix album, but with a twist: all of the tracks were remixed by fans in response to an invitation on DP's website, with the best entries selected for inclusion on this disc.

Title: Beautysleep
Info: The former member of Throwing Muses, Belly, and the Breeders returns with her second solo album, following 1997's 'Lovesongs for Underdogs.'

Title: All I Need
Info: The second full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features songs co-written by Babyface, Kid Harpoon, and Bastille's Dan Smith.

Title: Hot Motion
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British psychedelic rock trio was recorded at the home studio of band's singer James Bagshaw.

Title: We Got a Love
Info: The second full-length release for the Irish electronic producer Marcus Lambkin features contributions from Holly Backle. the Rapture's Luke Jenner, Museum of Love, Lidell Townsell, Nancy Wang, and Reggie Watts

Title: High Hopes
Info: Produced with Ron Aniello and featuring Rage Against The Machine's Tom Morello on guitar, The Boss' 18th studio release includes covers, outtakes, and new takes of previously released songs.

Title: The Archer Trilogy, Pt. 3
Info: This is the final release of the Swedish electro-pop duo's Archer trilogy.

Title: 2014 Forest Hills Drive
Info: The third studio release for the rapper was named after the address of his childhood home in North Carolina and was self produced with !llmind, Cardiak, CritCal, Omen, Phonix Beats, Vinylz, and Willie B.

Title: Ducktails III: Arcade Dynamics
Info: This is the first solo release on Woodsist for the Real Estate guitarist Matthew Mondanile.

Title: Noah's Ark
Info: Their second album finds sisters Bianca and Sierra Casady joined by Antony and Devendra Banhart.

Title: Who Loves The Sun OST
Info: This all-instrumental disc is the score for the upcoming Canadian film of the same name.

Title: The Secret Life Of The Veronicas
Info: Australian identical twin sisters Jess and Lisa Origliasso make their teen-pop debut as The Veronicas with this 12-track set, produced by Max Martin (Britney Spears), Clif Magness (Avril Lavigne), and others.

Title: Fifth
Info: The fifth release from the the side project of Wilco members John Stirratt and Patrick Sansone includes contributions from  James “Hags” Haggerty, Greg Wieczoreck, and John Pirrucello.

Title: Pure & Simple
Info: The 43rd full-length studio release for the country singer-songwriter was self-produced and features songs with writing credited solely to her.

Title: Triage
Info: The third full-length release for the Australian pyschedelic pop/rock band was produced and recorded by its lead singer Jake Webb.

Title: Push The Heart
Info: The moody Los Angeles-based four-piece returns with a fourth album.

Title: The Virgins
Info: The debut album for the New York City-based band was produced by S*A*M* and Sluggo.

Title: Mockingbird
Info: Shelby Lynne's sister releases a covers album of some of her favorite female singers.

Title: Hard Islands
Info: This is the second full-length album for the British electronic artist.

Title: Tongues
Info: This third collaboration between jazz drummer Reid and Four Tet's Hebden was again recorded live, without any edits or overdubs.

Title: Me. I Am Mariah... The Elusive Chanteuse
Info: The first original studio release in five years for the R&B/pop singer features guest appearances from Fabolous, Miguel, Nas, Wale, and her twins.

Title: Let It Reign
Info: The debut release for the Libertines' co-frontman's side project Carl Barât & The Jackals was produced by Joby Ford of the Bronx.

Title: Drawing Restraint 9 OST
Info: Enlisted as composer for boyfriend Matthew Barney's latest experimental film (which loosely concerns whales and Japan), Bjork responded with a largely instrumental score. Will Oldham guests.

Title: Outer South
Artist: Conor Oberst And The Mystic Valley Band
Info: Conor Oberst's latest solo album is the first to be credited with The Mystic Valley Band.

Title: Bodies
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the California rock quartet led by Davey Havok was produced by the band's guitarist, Jade Puget.

Title: Heartbreaker Please
Info: Recorded in Brooklyn, the sixth full-length solo studio release for the British singer-songwriter is his first since 2011's Bella.

Title: Head Over Heels
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Canadian electro-funk duo features guest appearances from D.R.A.M., French Montana, Amber Mark, Stefflon Don, and The-Dream.

Title: Risk To Exist
Info: The sixth full-length release for the British rock quartet was co-produced with Tom Schick.

Title: Lemon Memory
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Ryan Needham and Liza Violet was recorded with Ross Orton.

Title: The Pace of the Passing
Info: The debut full-length solo release for Ed Nash, the bassist of Bombay Bicycle Club, features guest appearances from Tom Fleming, Marika Hackman, Liz Lawrence, and The Staves.

Title: Youth Is Only Ever Fun in Retrospect
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Oscar Lulu was produced by Larry Hibbitt.

Title: Friends
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British trio was self-produced while the band was without a label.

Title: A Youthful Dream
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Danish pop-punk band.

Title: Moth Boys
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced with Dev Hynes, Duncan Mills, and Adam Jaffrey.

Title: Darlings
Info: The second full-length solo release for the Broken Social Scene frontman was co-produced with Dave Hamelin.

Title: Twin Forks
Info: The debut full-length release for the folk-inspired rock band led by Dashboard Confessional's Chris Carrabba was produced by Ammar Malik and Robopop.

Title: Maui Tears
Info: The fourth full-length release for the San Francisco psych rock now led by Bret Constantino was produced with Tim Green.

Title: AGE
Info: The sixth studio release for the Canadian indie pop collective led by Joel Gibb is its first in five years.

Title: Tears on Tape
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Finnish alternative rock band was produced by Hiili Hiilesma.

Title: Welcome to Mikrosector-50
Info: The latest release for Belfast-based producer Jack Hamill is a concept album about Mr. 8040 and his return to his home planet Mikrosector-50.

Title: Back into the Woods
Info: The sixth full-length release from the British singer-songwriter was recorded in one day at Abbey Road.

Title: Songs for Imaginative People
Info: The second release from the New York indie pop artist was self-produced in Asheville, North Carolina.

Title: Contrast
Info: The debut release for the 19-year-old British pop singer features guest appearances by Ne-Yo, Rita Ora, and Pharrell.

Title: Out of the Black
Info: The third full-length studio release for the German-born electronic producer Alexander Ridha features Snoop Dogg as a guest artist.

Title: These Friends Of Mine
Info: Sufjan Stevens, David Bazan, and Damien Jurado are among the numerous guests on the Seattle singer-songwriter's fourth album, which includes a cover of R.E.M.'s "The One I Love."

Title: Into The Blue Again
Info: TAL's fourth disc is almost a Jimmy LaValle solo recording, with the band leader handling the bulk of the instrumentation, vocals, and production.

Title: Tender Madness
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the collaboration between former Girls drummer Darren Weiss and Daniel Presant.

Title: Big Bells and Dime Songs
Info: The Nashville-born and New York-based folk singer releases his debut album recorded by Kyle Spence of Harvey Milk.

Title: The Ways We Separate
Info: After two EPs, the Brooklyn duo of Thomas Mullarney and Jacob Gossett releases their debut full-length of R&B-influenced electro-pop.
The second album for the British rock band is its first with new lead singer Henry Tremain (Stuart Smart left in 2011). The band announced they were transitioning to the name TTNG with this record.

Title: New Love
Info: The quartet led by Freddy Ruppert that includes Zola Jesus/Nika Roza Danilova, Xiu Xiu's Jamie Stewart, and Yasmine Kittles releases its second album together.

Title: Full Circle Nightmare
Info: The second full-length studio release for Portland, Oregon-based indie rock singer-songwriter was produced by Chris Funk of the Decemberists.

Title: Scorpion
Info: The 25-track fifth studio release for the Canadian hip-hop artist features guest appearances from Jay-Z and Ty Dollar $ign as well as vocals from Michael Jackson and Static Major.

Title: This Is Acting
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Australian singer features songs originally written for other artists such as Adele, Beyoncé, and Rihanna.

Title: Nine
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the pop-punk trio features production by John Feldmann, The Futuristics and Tim Pagnotta.

Title: The Ecleftic 2 Sides II a Book
Info: The second solo release from the former Fugee features guest appearances by Mary J. Blige, Youssou N'Dour, and Kenny Rogers (yes, that Kenny Rogers).

Title: American Classic
Info: The country singer latest album features American jazz standards with Norah Jones and Diana Krall as guest singers.

Title: Back To The Web
Info: This is the eighth album for the Elephant 6 affiliated band from Athens, Georgia.

Title: The  1975
Info: The debut full-length release for the British alternative rock band from Manchester was produced by Mike Crossey.

Title: Aphrodite
Info: The Australian pop singer returns with more dance-floor slammers and pure pop hits that have kept her career going for over twenty years.

Title: Hamburg Demonstrations
Info: The second solo release for the Babyshambles/The Libertines frontman was produced by Johann Scheerer.

Title: Another Day, Another Time: Celebrating the Music of "Inside Llewyn Davis"
Info: The two-disc compilation features songs from a one-night concert of songs from the Coen brothers film "Inside Llewyn Davis" by such artists as The Avett Brothers, Joan Baez, Elvis Costello, Rhiannon Giddens, Colin Meloy, The Milk Carton Kids, Keb Mo, Marcus Mumford, Punch Brothers, Dave Rawlings, Secret Sisters, Willie Watson, Gillian Welch, and Jack White.

Title: Memphis
Info: After gaining attention with their vinyl single Hey Boy, the Tennessee five-piece band releases its debut album produced by Shane Stonebeck.

Title: Survival Skills
Info: KRS-One and Buckshot team up for their first album together.

Title: Out Of Exile
Info: Rick Rubin produced this second album for the Chris Cornell-meets-Rage Against The Machine supergroup.

Title: Angels & Ghosts
Info: This is the second collaboration between the Depeche Mode frontman and the British electronica duo Soulsavers.

Title: Subjective Concepts
Info: The debut full-length release for the alternative rock trio from Olympia, Washington, was produced with Jackson Long.

Title: Sweatbox Dynasty
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Pennsylvania producer was recorded on cassette and then into a sampler to create the 12 tracks.

Title: Magic Hour
Info: The alternative rock trio returns with its Pledgemusic fan-funded release produced by Beastie Boy Adam Horovitz.

Title: Yours Truly, The Commuter
Info: The ex-Grandaddy singer releases his debut solo album.

Title: Strange Weather, Isn't It?
Info: Following the influence of artists such as Iggy Pop and David Bowie, !!! went to Berlin to produce their texturally full-bodied--pop yet still heavily brooding--new album.

Title: Aureate Gloom
Info: The 13th full-length release for the indie rock band led by Kevin Barnes was influenced in part by his separation from his wife and 1970s music in New York.

Title: Into The Wild
Info: Pearl Jam's lead singer goes solo with music based on his works for the film of the same name.

Title: Scratch My Back
Info: "Scratch My Back" is Peter Gabriel's first album in eight years--and the first in a series of releases--in which Gabriel covers the works of his favorite artists in exchange for his own collection of covers by those artists in the forthcoming album, "I'll Scratch Yours." The tracklist includes Arcade Fire's "My Body Is a Cage," Bon Iver's "Flume," David Bowie's "Heroes," Lou Reed's "The Power of the Heart," Paul Simon's "The Boy in the Bubble," and Radiohead's "Street Spirit (Fade Out)" to name a few.

Title: Coming On Strong
Info: This debut full-length for the London group headed by Joe Goddard and Alexis Taylor is a (semi-)tongue-in-cheek mix of diverse styles such as fake-gangsta-rap, R&B, soul, electronica, and more.

Title: Darwin Deez
Info: The debut album for the New York indie pop artist finally reaches the US after a successful release in the UK in 2010.

Title: 57th & 9th
Info: The 12th solo release for the British rock artist was produced by Martin Kierszenbaum and is his first pop/rock album since 2003's Sacred Love.

Title: Seth Avett and Jessica Lea Mayfield Sing Elliott Smith
Info: Seth Avett and Jessica Lea Mayfield's cover album features 12 songs from Elliott Smith's seven releases.

Title: Infinity Overhead
Info: The fifth album for the indie rock band led by Jake Snider was produced by former keyboardist Matt Bayles.

Title: Hypnotic Nights
Info: Dan Auerbach of the Black Keys produced the seventh album for the garage rock duo.

Title: Our Earthly Pleasures
Info: Gil Norton produced this second album for the Paul Smith-fronted UK rock outfit, who debuted in 2005 with the Mercury Music Prize-nominated 'A Certain Trigger.'

Title: The Trinity
Info: This is the third album for the Jamaican dancehall star.

Title: The Girl In The Other Room
Info: New husband Elvis Costello co-wrote six of the tunes on this latest disc from platinum-selling jazz vocalist Diana Krall.

Title: Attention
Info: The Icelandic band is quite a bit different from the one that released 1999's varied 'This Is Normal,' losing most of its members and changing its name (now, officially, "gusgus") and record label in the interim. Now consisting of just 4 members--three DJs and a new vocalist--gusgus offer up a more focused sound on 'Attention,' which tends toward stripped-down electronica and early-'80s electro sounds.

Title: Word Of Mouf
Info: The second full-length from the Atlanta rapper features contributions from Timbaland, Swizz Beats, Nate Dogg, Mystikal, Jagged Edge and Twista.

Title: Digital Bullet
Info: Robert Diggs, aka Bobby Digital, aka RZA, aka (well, we could go on... but we won't), best known for his production work with Wu-Tang Clan and the Gravediggaz,  returns with his second solo album.

Title: Beck Song Reader
Info: Originally released in 2012 as a collection of sheet music, this studio recorded version includes vocals from Beck, Jack Black, Jarvis Cocker, Bob Forrest, Eleanor Friedberger, Fun., Jason Isbell, Gabriel Kahane, David Johansen, Norah Jones. Juanes, Lord Huron, Laura Marling, Marc Ribot, Sparks, Moses Sumney, Swamp Dogg, Tweedy, Loudon Wainwright III, and Jack White.

Title: Under The Covers Vol. 1
Info: Singer-songwriter Matthew Sweet joins The Bangles' Susanna Hoffs for a collection of 15 covers, including takes on Bob Dylan, The Who, The Bee Gees and the Velvet Underground.

Title: Uno!
Info: The first release in a planned trilogy for the punk rock band was produced by Rob Cavallo.

Title: Hexadic
Info: The latest release from the Ben Chasny solo project is based on a new composition method Chasny invented.

Title: Nightcrawler
Info: Dave Grohl and the Dixie Chicks guest on the singer-songwriter's third album.

Title: The Ghost of the Mountain
Info: This is the second full-length release for the indie folk band that includes Iain Archer, Peter Buck, Richard Colburn, Jacknife Lee, Gary Lightbody, Scott McCaughey, and Troy Stewart.

Title: How to Become Clairvoyant
Info: The former Band guitarist returns with an album that looks back on his five-decade long career, featuring guests such as Eric Clapton, Steve Winwood, Tom Morello and Trent Reznor.

Title: The Adventures Of Bobby Ray
Info: The debut full-length release for the Atlanta, Georgia, native features guest appearances from such artists as Lupe Fiasco, T.I., Weezer's Rivers Cuomo, Paramore's Hayley Williams, and Eminem.

Title: Snowflake Midnight
Info: The seventh album for the New York rock band was produced with Dave Fridmann.

Title: Eyes Open
Info: Martha Wainwright and Ken Stringfellow are among the guests on Gary Lightbody's fourth Snow Patrol album.

Title: Major Key
Info: An Apple streaming exclusive for two weeks before releasing wider (and physically) on 12 August, the ninth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Chris Brown, Busta Rhymes, J. Cole, Drake, French Montana, Future, Gucci Mane, Jadakiss, Jay Z, Jeezy, Jeremih, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne, Nicki Minaj, Nas, Rick Ross, Meghan Trainor, YG, Yo Gotti, Wale, and Wiz Khalifa.

Title: Dead Zone Boys
Info: The David "Moose" Adamson-led band changes its name to just Jookabox for its third album.

Title: Keep On Loving You
Info: The first album on the Valory label for the queen of country was produced by Tony Brown and Mark Bright.

Title: Everything She Touched Turned Ampexian
Info: The fifth album for Prefuse 73 was recorded on analog tape first.

Title: Move Through the Dawn
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the British indie rock band was produced with Rich Turvey.

Title: No More Idols
Info: The second album for the British electronic duo features such guests as Plan B, Tinie Tempah, Dizzee Rascal, Cee-Lo Green, and White Lies.

Title: Venus Doom
Info: The Finnish hard rock band's sixth album includes one song that is over 10 minutes long.

Title: Outside
Info: The second full-length release for Montreal electronic producer Michael Silver was inspired from his travels.

Title: Trick
Info: The second full-length solo release for Kele Okereke was recorded in London and New York.

Title: Sir
Info: The fourth full-length release for the electroclash duo was produced by R.E.M.'s Michael Stipe and features guest appearances from Andy LeMaster, Johnny Magee, Holly Miranda, and Caroline Polachek.

Title: Lifetime of Love
Info: The full-length solo release for Deerhoof drummer Moses Archuleta was written after the end of his marriage and recorded over a 10-year period.

Title: Kintsugi
Info: Produced by Rich Costey, the eighth full-length release for the alternative rock band is its last with Chris Walla, who left the group in September of 2014.

Title: Hard Believer
Info: The sixth full-length release for the folk band led by Fin Greenall was produced by Billy Bush.

Title: It's a Corporate World
Info: The Detroit duo of Joshua Epstein and Daniel Zott release another album of psychedelic indie pop.

Title: Mugiboogie
Info: This is the third album for the Icelandic artist.

Title: Belladonna of Sadness
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was produced by James Ford and Alex Turner.

Title: Bones
Info: This is the fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn trio led by Ryan Lott.

Title: Bruiser
Info: The third album for the British indie rock band was produced by Andrew Scheps.

Title: The Most Incredible Thing
Info: This is the soundtrack for the ballet based on a Hans Christian Anderson story.

Title: Howl
Info: Produced by Howard Bilerman, the third full-length release for the Chicago R&B/soul band introduces rock and pop sounds.

Title: Imposter
Info: The third full-length release for the collaboration between Dave Gahan and Soulsavers is a rock covers.

Title: Ivywild
Info: The second full-length release for the music project of Winston Yellen features influences from R&B and electronic pop.

Title: I Thought the Future Would Be Cooler
Info: The sixth full-length release for the now Los Angeles-based electro-pop duo was produced by Jona Bechtolt and Rob Kieswetter.

Title: Acoustic at the Ryman [Live]
Info: The ten-track live acoustic release from the indie rock band features songs recorded at Nashville's Ryman Auditorium in April 2013.

Title: The Slideshow Effect
Info: This is the debut full-length album on Sub Pop for the Canadian dream pop duo.

Title: Recordings Of Music For Film
Info: Best known for his film career ("Buffalo '66," "Trouble Every Day"), actor Vincent Gallo has also released a low-fi indie rock album (2001's 'When') and scored several films. This 29-track effort compiles all of his previous recordings for various indie film soundtracks.

Title: Music to Make Love to Your Old Lady By
Info: "Nathaniel Merriweather" is merely the latest incarnation of producer Dan "The Automator" Nakamura, best known for his work with Dr. Octagon and the Gorillaz. Merriweather was last seen on 1999's Handsome Boy Modeling School debut, and here he is joined in his new band, Lovage, by Kid Koala, Damon Albarn, Prince Paul, Faith No More's Mike Patton, and the Elysian Fields' Jennifer Charles, among others.

Title: Time Bomb
Info: The sophomore effort from the Los Angeles rockers.

Title: God Bless The Blake Babies
Info: Juliana Hatfield and company reunite for their first album in 8 years.

Title: Right On!
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the bassist of Warpaint was co-produced with Norm Block.

Title: Wait 'Til Night
Info: The second full-length release for the British dance artist features influences of R&B, reggae, and synthpop.

Title: Surfing
Info: Devendra Banhart and Priestbird's Greg Rogove join up to release their debut album.

Title: Forever Hasn't Happened Yet
Info: The X frontman's fifth solo disc features guests Neko Case, Grant-Lee Phillips, Dave Alvin and Kristin Hersh.

Title: Learn To Live
Info: The Hootie & the Blowfish singer's sophomore solo album was produced by Frank Rogers.

Title: The  Mountain Will Fall
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the DJ/producer features guest appearances from Bleep Bloop, Nils Frahm, Ernie Fresh, Matthew Halsall, G Jones, and Run the Jewels.

Title: Richer Than I Ever Been
Info: The latest full-length studio release for rapper Rick Ross features guest appearances from 21 Savage, Yungeen Ace, Benny The Butcher, Blxst, DreamDoll, Willie Falcon, Future, Wiz Khalifa, Major Nine, Jazmine Sullivan, The-Dream, and Wale.

Title: Joyride
Info: Originally announced in 2015, the second full-length studio release for the R&B artist features guest appearances from French Montana, Future, Little Dragon, Offset, and Ty Dolla $ign is finally out.

Title: Taiga
Info: The fifth full-length release for singer-songwriter Nika Roza Danilova was co-produced with Dean Hurley.

Title: Blood From A Stone
Info: The latest album for the Norwegian singer-songwriter.

Title: Go Go Smear The Poison Ivy
Info: The Icelandic group releases their fourth album.

Title: Hot Fuss
Info: 'Hot Fuss' marks the debut for the Las Vegas-based garage rockers led by 22-year old vocalist/songwriter Brandon Flowers.

Title: Dos
Info: The second full-length studio album for the quartet from San Francisco.

Title: Hopeless Fountain Kingdom
Info: The second full-length release for the alternative pop artist features guest appearances from Cashmere Cat, Fifth Harmony's Lauren Jauregui and Migos' Quavo.

Title: The State vs. Radric Davis
Info: The second album for the Alabama-born rapper features such guest artists as Lil Wayne, Jadakiss, Piles, Rick Ross, Soulja Boy Tell 'Em, and Usher.

Title: 4 x 4 = 12
Info: The Canadian DJ who is known for his mouse-head costume releases his third full-length album.

Title: Breakthrough
Info: The debut full-length release for William Bensussen as The Gaslamp Killer features guest appearances from such artist as Gonjasufi, Shigeto, Samiyam, Miguel Atwood-Ferguson, and Daedelus.

Title: Hearts That Strain
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in Nashville and features guest appearances from Dan Auerbach (on guitar) and Noah Cyrus.

Title: Never Never Land
Info: U.N.K.L.E. is the pet project of Mo'Wax label head James Lavelle, whose successful 1998 album 'Psyence Fiction' included notable contributions from DJ Shadow, Thom Yorke and Badly Drawn Boy. Guests this time out include Josh Homme (Queens Of The Stone Age), Robert "3D" del Naja (Massive Attack), Brian Eno, Ian Brown (Stone Roses), Mani (Stone Roses/Primal Scream) Joel Cadbury (South) and Jarvis Cocker (Pulp).

Title: The DEFinition
Info: The rapper's eleventh album includes six tracks produced by Timbaland. R. Kelly also guests.

Title: Sacred Love
Info: Did you know this guy used to be in the Police?

Title: Say You Will
Info: If you prefer your Fleetwood Mac songs written by Lindsey Buckingham, your 16-year wait is over. Joining Buckingham on this brand-new, 18-track album are Stevie Nicks, Mick Fleetwood and John McVie.

Title: Open
Info: The first album of new material in three years for the ever-consistent Cowboy Junkies.

Title: Two Vines
Info: The third full-length release for the Australian electronic duo was produced with Peter Mayes and Jonathan Sloan.

Title: Mentor Tormentor
Info: The Los Angeles band's follow-up to their 2004 release, Treble & Tremble.

Title: Lifeblood
Info: The Welsh band's seventh studio disc was produced by Tony Visconti and Greg Haver.

Title: Magpie and the Dandelion
Info: Recorded and produced by Rick Rubin at the same sessions as 2012's The Carpenter, the eighth release for the folk rock band is said to be more of a "youthful wonder" feel.

Title: A Thousand Suns
Info: Linkin Park team up again with legendary producer Rick Rubin for its fourth album in attempt to create a genre all of its own.

Title: Kiss Me Once
Info: The Australian pop singer worked with Enrique Iglesias, Greg Kurstin, MNEK, Ariel Rechtshaid, Sia, and Pharrell Williams on her 12th studio release.

Title: Xscape
Info: The posthumously released eight-track album from the pop singer features unreleased songs completed between 1983 and 1999 with new production from executive producer L.A. Reid, as well as Jerome "J-Roc" Harmon, Rodney Jerkins, John McClain, StarGate, and Timbaland. A deluxe edition includes a disc of songs without the current producers input.

Title: Get the Money
Info: The third full-length release for the Foo Fighters drummer with the Coattail Riders features guest appearances from Dave Grohl, Chrissie Hynde, Perry Farrell, Duff McKagan, LeAnn Rimes, Roger Taylor, Joe Walsh, and Nancy Wilson.

Title: Arrows
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie-pop singer was written in  Berlin, England (London & Norfolk), and France.

Title: Shapes & Shadows
Info: Gomez guitarist Ben ottewell releases his debut solo album produced by Will Golden.

Title: Seeing Eye Dog
Info: The band fronted by Page Hamilton includes yet another new line-up for its seventh studio album.

Title: Exquisite Corpse
Info: The fourth album for the Los Angeles-based electronica producer finds him joined by guests MF Doom, Mike Ladd and Prefuse 73.

Title: Everything Now
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Canadian indie rock band was co-produced with Daft Punk's Thomas Bangalter, Portishead's Geoff Barrow, Markus Dravs, and Pulp's Steve Mackey.

Title: Fatherland
Info: The third full-length solo release for the Bloc Party lead singer (though the first under his full name) features guest appearances from Olly Alexander and Corinne Bailey Rae.

Title: Film School
Info: The San Francisco post-punk band's second album follows five years after their debut.

Title: Sundark and Riverlight
Info: Patrick Wolf re-recorded some tracks from his various releases, with the double album split with darker songs on one side and the more hopeful tracks on the other.

Title: Music For Listening To Music To
Info: The fourth full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Ryan Adams.

Title: Ready to Die
Info: The first studio release since 1973's Raw Power to be credited under Iggy & The Stooges, reunites Iggy Pop with James Williamson, Scott  Asheton, and new bassist Mike Watt (Ron Asheton passed away in 2009) for the band's fifth studio album.

Title: Total
Info: The French electro and house music producer/remixer releases a debut full-length album.

Title: Eskmo
Info: Brendan Angelides releases his debut full-length album as Eskmo.

Title: A Time To Love
Info: The legendary singer's first album in ten years combines R&B, soul and hip-hop. Guests include Paul McCartney, Prince and India.Arie.

Title: MTV Unplugged [Live]
Info: The latest MTV Unplugged release is from Florence + the Machine and it includes a cover of Jackson with Josh Homme.

Title: American Goldwing
Info: The Portland folk-rockers return with a new album of psychedelic roots music.

Title: Still Not Getting Any
Info: Bob Rock (Metallica) produced this sophomore album for the Montreal-based pop-punk band.

Title: The Massacre
Info: The rapper's second album was "executive" produced by Dr. Dre, Eminem and 50 himself and includes the singles "Piggybank" and "Disco Inferno."

Title: Everything Goes Wrong
Info: This is the second album for the Brooklyn-based indie rock trio.

Title: Just Like You
Info: The top female finisher on the eighth season of American Idol releases her debut album.

Title: The Hunger For More
