Info: This is the solo debut for Banks, a member of G Unit.

Title: Kamikaze
Info: The Chicago rapper's long-awaited follow-up to 'Adrenaline Rush' features contributions from Kanye West, Toxic, Cee-Lo and R. Kelly.

Title: Leave Your Name
Info: This electronic-rock effort marks the full-length solo debut for Omaha, Neb.-based Denver Dalley of Desaparecidos.

Title: The Phoenix Album
Info: Don't confuse The Warlocks of the 1960s (who later became the Grateful Dead) with the new band of the same name, who only sound like they come from the 1960s. This Los Angeles-based group favor lengthy, droning songs, evoking groups such as the Velvet Underground and Jesus & Mary Chain.

Title: Reptile
Info: This new 14-track set from Eric Clapton features a mix of originals and covers (including songs by Stevie Wonder and James Taylor).

Title: Inside Llewyn Davis [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
Info: The soundtrack to the Coen Brothers film about the the Greenwich Village folk music scene in the early 60s includes production from T-Bone Burnett and songs sung by the actors (Oscar Isaac, Carey Mulligan, Stark Sands, Justin Timberlake) of the film.

Title: Raven in the Grave
Info: The Danish duo's fifth studio album showcases much of their original sound -- dark, droning, distorted guitar pop.

Title: Pale Fire
Info: This is the fourth full-length studio release for the Sweden's Sarah Assbring as El Perro Del Mar.

Title: Mo Beauty
Info: The Clap Your Hands Say Yeah's frontman releases his debut solo album produced by Steve Berlin.

Title: I Look To You
Info: The multi-award winning singer returns to release her first album in seven years.

Title: Two Lanes of Freedom
Info: The 12th studio release for the country singer is his first on the Big Machine label and it includes guest appearances from Taylor Swift and Keith Urban.

Title: Happy People / U Saved Me
Info: The R&B singer's latest is a double album, confining the two sides of his personality to separate discs: the radio- and club-friendly 'Happy People' is backed by the religious-themed 'U Saved Me.'

Title: Per Second, Per Second, Per Second... Every Second
Info: The Massachusetts-based trio's fourth album is their first for a major label. Dave Fridmann produces.

Title: Rock'n'Roll
Info: Recorded in just two weeks after Adams (rather, his record company) scrapped plans to release 'Love Is Hell' as his official follow-up to 'Gold' (the former will instead appear as a 2-part EP), 'Rock'n'Roll' features guest appearances from Billie Joe Armstrong (Green Day), Melissa Auf Der Mauer (Hole) and Parker Posey (every indie film in the last 15 years).

Title: Demon Time
Info: The third full-length release for British electronic producer Mura Masa features guest appearances from BAYLI, Erika de Casier, Leyla, Lil Uzi Vert, Lil Yachty, Isabella Lovestory, Midas The Jagaban, Pa Salieu, PinkPantheress, Shygirl, Skillibeng, Slowthai, Tohji, and Channel Tres.

Title: Notes And The Like
Info: This is the second full-length for the German indie-electro-pop duo of Stephanie Bohm (also in Couch) and The Notwist's Micha Acher.

Title: Winchester Cathedral
Info: The distinctive Liverpool-based band returns with a third studio LP.

Title: Beast Moans
Info: 'Beast' marks the debut for Swan Lake, the new collaboration between Destroyer's Dan Bejar, Wolf Parade's Spencer Krug and Frog Eyes' Carey Mercer.

Title: Southern Voice
Info: The latest album for the actor/country singer from Louisiana features a song co-written by Brett James and Nickelback's Chad Kroeger.

Title: Everywhere At Once
Info: The San Francisco Bay Area native releases his third album, his first on Epitaph Records.

Title: White Women
Info: The fourth release for the Canadian electronic duo features guest appearances from Ezra Koenig, Solange and Toro Y Moi.

Title: Love & Evol
Info: The latest full-length release from the Japanese noise-rock group is its first on the Third Man label.

Title: Girl
Info: The second full-length Columbia Nashville release for the country singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Brothers Osborne and Brandi Carlile.

Title: Callus
Info: The third full-length release for the California artist was self-produced and features contributions from the Cure's Pearl Thompson.

Title: World of Joy
Info: Produced by Chris Heidman, the second full-length release for the Minneapolis rock band is its first with new drummer Rory MacMurdo.

Title: Leave No Trace
Info: The sophomore album from the Los Angeles quintet fuses Afropop with '80s new wave.

Title: Dig Out Your Soul
Info: The British rock band releases its seventh album, produced by Dave Sardy.

Title: The Bravery
Info: Another hot, retro-sounding band based in New York? Is there some sort of factory churning these bands out? (Or in the case of The Bravery, a Factory?) The band's self-titled debut, preceded by the requisite buzz, utilizes a new wave-flavored sound which is also reminiscent of, oh, let's just say New Order and The Cure.

Title: As I Am
Info: Alicia Keys' third album includes guest vocalists Marsha Ambrosius, John Mayer, and Linda Perry.

Title: Stones
Info: The four-track release from Mats Gustafsson and Colin Stetson was recorded live at the Vancouver Jazz Festival in 2011.

Title: Everybody
Info: This is the foruth album for the New York-based singer-songwriter.

Title: From This Moment On
Info: The Canadian singer/pianist tackles American standards, backed by a big band on most of the tracks.

Title: Chase This Light
Info: Butch Vig produces their sixth studio album.

Title: Joy
Info: The second collaborative album by Ty Segall and White Fence features 15 tracks that range from 16 seconds to over five minutes long.

Title: This is PiL
Info: This is the first album in 20 years for the band led by the Sex Pistol's John Lydon. The line-up includes Bruce Smith, Lu Edmonds, and Scott Firth.

Title: Come of Age
Info: This second album for the London quartet was produced by Ethan Johns and recorded at ICP Studios in Brussels, Belgium and the Distillery in Bath, England.

Title: Year In The Kingdom
Info: The sixth solo album for the Fleet Foxes member is his second album for the year.

Title: The Only Place
Info: Produced by Jon Brion, the second album for Best Coast is its first since drummer Ali Koehler was let go by the indie pop duo.

Title: Jet Black
Info: The second release on Arts & Letters for the Canadian singer, who also appeared in John Cameron Mitchell's movie Shortbus.

Title: Good Graces
Info: The third solo release for the singer-songwriter features guest vocals from frequent collaborator, Jenny Lewis.

Title: Trespassing
Info: The sophomore release for Adam Lambert features production and co-written songs by Nikka Costa, Dr. Luke, Claude Kelly, Bruno Mars, Sam Sparro, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Build with Erosion
Info: The band formed by drummers Shane Aspegren and Lori Sean Berg releases its third album recorded in Paris, France, with Antoine Gaillet.

Title: Jesus Piece
Info: The fifth studio release for California rapper The Game features guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Chris Brown, J. Cole, Common, Jamie Foxx, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne, Rick Ross, Tyga, Kanye West, and  Wiz Khalifa.

Title: Pedestrian
Info: This is the second full-length solo release for the former Yuck frontman.

Title: Earth Junk
Info: Neil Michael Hagerty's latest band releases its sixth album, which is only 33 minutes long.

Title: The Cover Up
Artist: I Am The World Trade Center
Info: The 80s-influenced laptop-pop duo of Dan Geller and Amy Dykes return with their third LP.

Title: Waves Are Universal
Info: The current Mojave 3 and former Slowdive member makes her long-awaited solo debut with 'Waves Are Universal,' which features production by David Naughton and drumming by Ashley Bates (Chapterhouse).

Title: Fulfilled/Complete
Info: This is the second solo disc for Faint bassist Joel Petersen. Mike Mogis produces.

Title: Pole
Info: Following a series of three glitchy, minimalist electronica albums entitled "1," "2," and "3," respectively, producer Stefan Betke (aka Pole) changes course and heads into experimental hip-hop and dub on this latest LP, even enlisting Ohio-based rapper Fat Jon for vocals on several tracks.

Title: From the Cradle to the Rave
Info: Full of futuristic synthesizer sounds and analog arrangements, Irish-born Marcus Lambkin's album of house jams features guest vocals from Hot Chip and LCD Soundsystem.

Title: The Naked Truth
Info: The soon-to-be-incarcerated (for perjury) rapper offers a fourth solo disc. Kanye West and Scott Storch are among the producers.

Title: Wash the Sins Not Only the Face
Info: This is the second full-length release from the Brighton indie rock trio.

Title: 100 Miles from Memphis
Info: Sheryl Crow's seventh album takes a soulful musical direction for the singer-songwriter and features guest appearances from Justin Timberlake and Keith Richards.

Title: Up From Below
Info: This is the debut album for the 11-piece indie rock band led by Alex Ebert.

Title: BRVNX (V)
Info: The fifth full-length (non-Mariachi) release for the Los Angels punk band was produced by Rob Schnapf.

Title: Youth Authority
Info: The first new studio release in six years for the pop-punk band led by Joel and Benji Madden was produced by John Feldmann and features guest appearances from Sleeping With Sirens's Kellin Quinn and Biffy Clyro's Simon Neil.

Title: Between the Walls
Info: The third release for the experimental rock side-project that included Spiritualized's John Coxon, Hot Chip's Alexis Taylor, and Pat Thomas, is the last with This Heat's Charles Hayward.

Title: Never Trust a Happy Song
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie rock quintet.

Title: Rain Machine
Info: Kyp Malone who has appeared on TV On The Radio and Iran's albums, releases his debut solo album.

Title: Crayons
Info: The first album of new songs in over 15 years from the queen of disco.

Title: The Capitol Studios Sessions
Info: Recorded live in studio with an audience, the debut full-length release for the actor/jazz pianist with his band, The Mildred Snitzer Orchestra and features guest appearances from Till Bronner, Imelda May, Haley Reinhart, and Sarah Silverman.

Title: Icky Blossoms
Info: The debut album for the indie pop trio was produced by Dave Sitek.

Title: Say It
Info: The Canadian indie rock trio releases the follow-up to the band's 2008 debut, Red, Yellow & Blue.

Title: Please Be Honest
Info: The latest release from the indie rock group features Robert Pollard playing all the instruments on the album.

Title: Angel Guts: Red Classroom
Info: Produced by John Congleton, the ninth full-length release for the Jamie Stewart project was influenced by his move to Los Angeles and a Japanese erotic film of the same name as the album.

Title: Places Like This
Info: The Australian band's follow-up after its remix album, "We Died, They Remixed."

Title: As Light Return
Info: The ninth full-length release for the British psychedelic/space rock bandled by Stephen Lawrie features guest appearances from the Scottish band St Deluxe.

Title: Sings the Great Diva Classics
Info: Co-produced by Clive Davis, Babyface, and Antonio Dixon, the singer known as the Queen of Soul returns with a covers album of songs from such artists as Adele, Etta James, Alicia Keys, Gladys Knight, Sinead O'Connor, Diana Ross, Barbra Streisand, The Supremes, with guest appearances from Cissy Houston, and Tawatha Agee.

Title: A Perfect Contradiction
Info: The third studio release for the British singer includes songs written by Mr. Hudson, John Legend, Plan B, Raphael Saadiq, Diane Warren, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Idiots
Info: Chris Hughes and Mark Frith return to produce the fourth release for the British indie pop band led by brothers, Alex and Thomas White.

Title: Head in the Dirt
Info: The second release for the California singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Auerbach.

Title: Life on a Rock
Info: Co-produced with Buddy Cannon, the country singer's latest release includes eight songs written by Chesney and features guest appearances from Elan, Willie Nelson, and The Wailers.

Title: What Kind of World
Info: The fifth solo album for the Raconteurs band member is his first on his own label, Readymade Records.

Title: Stage Whisper
Info: The double album from the French singer features an 11-track live set and seven unreleased studio tracks, many of which were produced by Beck for Gainsbourg's 2009 release IRM.

Title: Alive As You Are
Info: Recorded at San Francisco's legendary Hyde Street Studios, this Los Angeles quintet's third album continues to cross genres with punk-infused psychedelic jams.

Title: Islands
Info: The Swedish band returns with its second full-length album.

Title: One Love
Info: The fourth album for the French producer/DJ features such guests as Kelly Rowland, Akon, will.i.am, Ne-Yo, and Estelle.

Title: Octahedron
Info: The fifth album for the rock band is its first with Warner Bros.

Title: Magnolia
Info: The debut album for the new band led by Andrew Kenny of American Analog Set.

Title: Such Fun
Info: The sophomore album for the North Carolina indie rock band was produced with Jacquire King.

Title: Warnings/Promises
Info: The fourth album for the Scottish band was recorded in Los Angeles with producer Tony Hoffer (Air, Beck).

Title: Room Noises
Info: This is the debut album for the Texas teenage home-schooled Christian indie-rock band made up of three DuPree sisters, one DuPree brother, and the other guy, who already have two EPs and a tour supporting Coldplay under their belts.

Title: Don't Climb On And Take The Holy Water
Info: Leaving Sub Pop behind for a different Northwest label (Strange Attractors), the Seattle band returns with a collection of new studio recordings, rehearsal sessions, and a 30-minute live track.

Title: Phantom Planet
Info: Jason Schwartzman has departed, but the Los Angeles band continues on with a third album.

Title: The Other Side Of Daybreak
Info: This compilation consists chiefly of alternate versions of tracks from her recent LP 'Daybreaker,' including live recordings and remixes by Two Lone Swordsmen and Four Tet.

Title: Yes New York
Info: This compilation (whose name borrows from the similar 1978 Brian Eno-curated disc 'No New York') contains 16 tracks from artists at the forefront of the current New York indie scene, including The Strokes, Interpol, The Natural History, Radio 4, The Walkmen, The Rapture, Calla, Longwave, Ted Leo & The Pharmacists, Yeah Yeah Yeahs (credited to "Unitard") and The Rogers Sisters.

Title: Drukqs
Info: This 30-track, 2-disc set from Richard D. James is his first Aphex Twin album in five years.

Title: A Rock In The Weary Land
Info: This is the first album for Mike Scott and company (well, basically just Mike Scott) since 1993's 'Dream Harder,' although Scott did have two solo albums in the interim.

Title: Siberia
Info: The Ian McCulloch-led band are re-teamed with producer Hugh Jones (1981's 'Heaven Up Here') on this next step of their reunion.

Title: I'm Not Bossy, I'm the Boss
Info: Produced by John Reynolds, the 10th release for the singer-songwriter is a collection of love songs from different female point of views.

Title: PersonA
Info: The fourth studio release for the indie-folk group led by Alex Ebert was recorded in New Orleans.

Title: Slow Air
Info: The fourth full-length release for the synthpop duo of Greg Hughes and Tessa Murray was written and recorded in just three months.

Title: Breakin' Point
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Swedish trio features production from Patrick Berger, Paul Epworth, Emile Haynie, Greg Kurstin, Thom Monahan, and Pontus Winnberg.

Title: Angus & Julia Stone
Info: The third full-length release for the Australian brother-and-sister duo was produced by Rick Rubin.

Title: Galore
Info: The debut full-length release for the British duo of Marcus Pepperell and John Hamson, Jr. was produced with David Kosten.

Title: Made In Brooklyn
Info: Members of the Wu-Tang Clan guest on their fellow member's second solo disc. The roster of producers includes Pete Rock and MF Doom.

Title: It Won't Be Soon Before Long
Info: It has been five years, but Maroon 5 finally return with a follow-up to their huge-selling 2002 debut 'Songs About Jane.' The producers include Mike Elizondo, Mark "Spike" Stent, and Eric Valentine.

Title: Campfire Songs [Reissue]
Info: This is the reissue of Animal Collective's 2003 five-track album.

Title: Preliminaires
Info: Hal Cragin produced the rock legend's latest album, influenced by jazz music.

Title: For Screening Purposes Only
Info: This debut (and, it turns out, final album) from the noisy London trio was produced by James Ford (Simian).

Title: I Love You, It's Cool
Info: The third album for the Brooklyn synth-psychedelic rock band was produced by David Wrench.

Title: Power of Peace
Info: The debut release for the collaboration between The Isley Brothers [Ronald and Earnie Isley] and and Santana features 13 R&B cover songs made famous by such artists as Marvin Gaye, Billie Holiday, Curtis Mayfield, Dionne Warwick, and Stevie Wonder.

Title: White Knight
Info: The latest release for the Philadelphia producer/singer-songwriter features guest appearances by Moe Berg, John Boutte, Dam Funk, Donald Fagen (of Steely Dan), Daryl Hall, Michael Holman, Bettye LaVette, Trent Reznor, Robyn, Atticus Ross, Joe Satriani, Bobby Strickland, Joe Walsh (of The Eagles), and KK Watson.

Title: Digital Native
Info: This is the debut full length dance release for Italian producer Egisto Sopor.

Title: Johnny Foreigner vs Everything
Info: This is the fourth full-length album for the British rock band.

Title: In The Zone
Info: The Pepsi spokesperson's fourth LP includes guest vocals from Madonna (on lead single "Me Against The Music") and production work from Moby, R. Kelly, the Matrix, and Guy Sigsworth (but no Max Martin).

Title: American Supreme
Info: Legendary 1970s NYC electro-punk duo Suicide, hugely influential on the synth-pop, industrial, and electroclash movements to come in later decades, return with their first new album in ten years.

Title: Long Trip Alone
Info: This is the third album for the country singer who gained stardom following the release of 2005's 'Modern Day Drifter.'

Title: Talahomi Way
Info: This is the first album in four years for the London-based indie pop group led by Sean O'Hagan.

Title: It's Only Me
Info: The third full-length studio release for Atlanta rapper Lil Baby features guest appearances from EST Gee, Fridayy, Future, Jeremih, Pooh Shiesty, Rylo Rodriguez, Nardo Wick, and Young Thug.

Title: IC-01 Hanoi
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Oregon-based New Zealand psychedelic rock band was recorded during the same session as Sex & Food.

Title: Fixion
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Danish electronic artist features vocals from Marie Fisker, Lisbet Fritze, and the Savages' Jehnny Beth.

Title: The  Golden Age
Info: The debut full-length release for Yoann Lemoine, best known as the director of videos for Katy Perry and Lana Del Rey, is a concept album about the life of a young boy.

Title: The Best Damn Thing
Info: Rob Cavallo and Butch Walker are among the numerous producers on the Canadian pop singer's third album, which is preceeded by the single "Girlfriend."

Title: Nightingale Floors
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie rock band led by Zach Rogue was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Leisure Seizure
Info: It's been more than six years since Tom Vek released his well received debut album, We have Sound.

Title: In My World
Info: This is the second full-length release for Los Angeles producer Matthew McQueen.

Title: Shangri La
Info: The second release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Rick Rubin in Malibu.

Title: Some Sweet Relief
Info: The second album for the rock band headed by Marie-Claire Balabanian and Karl Briedrick.

Title: The Getaway
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the alternative rock band was produced by Danger Mouse.

Title: V
Info: This is the third full-length studio release for the Swedish dream pop duo.

Title: La Sera
Info: Katy Goodman, bassist and backing vocalist of the Vivian Girls, releases her first solo project of dreamy, ethereal rock.

Title: Stay Trippy
Info: The third solo release for the Three 6 Mafia rapper features guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, A$AP Rocky, Big Sean, Chris Brown, Lil Wayne, Trey Songz, Justin Timberlake, Wale, Wiz Khalifa, Yelawolf, and Young Jeezy.

Title: Echo Ono
Info: The latest album for the Virginia psych-rock band formed by brothers Jennings, Lain, and Van Carney was recorded at their rebuilt studio using only analog equipment.

Title: The Golden Mile
Info: The Welsh indie rock band that includes Rhys Ifans and Super Furry Animals' Dafydd Ieuan releases its debut album.

Title: Inside/Absent
Info: The Faint's Joel Petersen returns with his third Broken Spindles album.

Title: Plans
Info: The Ben Gibbard-led group makes its major-label debut with this 11-song disc, produced by band member Chris Walla.

Title: Tyranny
Info: The debut release for the rock band led by The Strokes frontman with Jake Bercovici, Alex Carapetis, Jeramy Gritter, Jeff Kite, and Amir Yaghmai was produced by Shawn Everett.

Title: Belladonna
Info: This solo instrumental disc from the Brian Eno collaborator and U2 producer includes contributions from pianist Brad Mehldau and drummer Brian Blade.

Title: Drawing Down the Moon
Info: Orenda Fink and Maria Taylor return to release the duo's fourth studio album after disbanding in 2004.

Title: Earth
Info: The latest release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was recorded during his 2015 tour with The Promise of the Real and features overdubbed sounds of animals and insects.

Title: Hanna
Info: The Chemical Brothers bring their electronic skills to the soundtrack of the 2011 film.

Title: Common as Light and Love Are Red Valleys of Blood
Info: The eighth full-length release for Mark Kozelek's music project features songs about a variety of events and issues that occurred in 2016.

Title: Apparitions
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the Chicago-based foursome.

Title: My Love is a Bulldozer
Info: The 26th release for the Canadian electronic artist Aaron Funk is his first full-length in four years.

Title: The  Lives Inside the Lines in Your Hand
Info: Indie rock singer-songwriter Matt Pond drops the PA suffix on his ninth full-length release.

Title: An Other Cup
Info: Yusuf Islam (who seems to have lost the "Islam" portion of his name), better known by his former name of Cat Stevens, returns with his first album of pop songs since 1978.

Title: The Tourniquet
Info: This is the second album for Norwegian singer-songwriter Even Johansen, who records under the name Magnet.

Title: Lioness: Hidden Treasures
Info: The final album from Amy Winehouse was compiled by producer Salaam Remi from demos, covers, and, outtakes recorded from 2002 to March 2011

Title: Long Gone Before Daylight
Info: This is the fifth album (and first in six years) for the Swedish outfit led by vocalist/lyricist Nina Persson and guitarist Peter Svensson.

Title: Ima Robot
Info: The roster of this Los Angeles outfit (who make their debut with this self-titled release) includes members of Beck's touring band (Medal-Johnsen and Joey Waronker).

Title: X.O. Experience
Info: This is the first album for the West Coast production team / hip-hop outfit formerly known as Tha Alkaholiks (and their fourth album to date, including that previous incarnation). Xzibit, Rockwilder, Kurupt and Busta Rhymes are among the guest contributors.

Title: The Search
Info: Frontman Jay Farrar produced the band's fifth album.

Title: Dreams
Info: Following Johnny Cash and, more recently, Tom Jones, the legendary crooner creates his own rendition of his favorites in this collection of covers by artists such as Leonard Cohen, the Beatles, and even his own classic tunes.

Title: Angelheaded Hipster: The Songs of Marc Bolan & T. Rex
Info: The tribute album to Marc Bolan and T. Rex's music from the late producer Hal Willner (who passed away in April 2020) features Marc Almond, Devendra Banhart, BØRNS, John Cameron Mitchell, Nick Cave, Helga Davis, Elysian Fields, Perry Farrell, Father John Misty, Gavin Friday, Emily Haines, Jessie Harris, Joan Jett, David Johansen, Elton John, Charlotte Kemp Muhl, Kesha, King Khan, Julian Lennon, Sean Lennon, Maria McKee, Gaby Moreno, Nena, Beth Orton, Todd Rundgren, U2, Lucinda Williams, and Victoria Williams.

Title: Talk a Good Game
Info: The fourth solo release for the former Destiny's Child singer features guest appearances from Beyoncé, Michelle Williams, Kevin Cossom, Wiz Khalifa, and Pusha-T.

Title: Is This Hyperreal?
Info: Alec Empire and Nic Endo, the remaining two members of the German band, have reunited to release another album of electronic punk rock.

Title: Santana IV
Info: The guitarist is reunited with the 1970s band members Michael Carabello, Greg Rolie, Neal Schon, and Michael Shrieve along with current members Karl Perazzo and Benny Rietveld on the Latin rock group's latest studio release.

Title: The  L-Shaped Man
Info: The fifth full-length release for the San Francisco Bay Area post-punk rock group was influenced by lead singer Ross Farrar's recent breakup.

Title: The  Gifted
Info: The third full-length studio release from the Washington D.C. rapper features guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Cee Lo Green, Lyfe Jennings, Meek Mill, Nicki Minaj, Ne-Yo, Rihanna, Rick Ross, Jerry Seinfeld, Wiz Khalifa, and Yo Gotti.

Title: Soft Metals
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Portland, Oregon, electronic duo.

Title: High On Jackson Hill
Info: The fourth album for the Canadian indie-rock band was recorded in Brooke Gallupe's parent's house.

Title: Feel.Love.Thinking.Of.
Info: This is the second studio album for the Canadian rock band.

Title: A Weekend In The City
Info: Kele Okereke & co. try to avoid the sophomore slump with this highly-anticipated follow-up to their acclaimed debut 'Silent Alarm.'

Title: Kasabian
Info: Named after Charles Manson's getaway driver, the British quartet Kasabian drew comparisons to The Stone Roses, Happy Mondays, and Primal Scream with this debut LP.

Title: Initiation
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between husband-and-wife duo of Dee Dee of Dum Dum Girls and Brandon of Crocodiles was mixed by Jorge Elbrecht.

Title: Delta Machine
Info: The 13th studio release for the synth-pop trio was produced by Ben Hillier and mixed by Flood.

Title: Alpha Games
Info: The first full-length studio release in six years for British indie rock band Bloc Party was produced by Nick Launay and Adam Greenspan.

Title: You Can Do Better
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock band is its first with second guitarist Lewes Herriot.

Title: Machines That Make Civilization Fun
Info: The first album of new material from the rapper in seven years tackles political issues.

Title: You & I
Info: The fourth album for the folk rock duo of sisters was produced by Guy Berryman of Coldplay and Rik Simpson.

Title: Joy
Info: The jam rock band's latest release was produced by Steve Lillywhite.

Title: Music's Not for Everyone
Info: This is the second full-length album for the rock band led by an Ian Svenonius.

Title: Now Is The Time!
Info: This is the fourth quirky release for the exclamation-point-loving, Devo-esque, Tokyo-based band.

Title: Back From The Dead
Info: The 2-disc set is the rock band's third actual album.

Title: Xoxo Panda & The New Kid Revival
Info: Marc Bianchi releases his latest album under the Her Space Holiday name.

Title: Touching Down
Info: Breaking away from the Reprazent collective he headed, Bristol, England junglist Roni Size returns with his first true solo album, with no collaborators (or vocalists, for that matter) in sight on these 16 drum'n'bass tracks.

Title: Revolverlution
Info: This 15th anniversary release for the rap veterans includes nine new tracks, supplemented by live recordings, remixes, and skits.

Title: G-Sides
Info: This disc collects remixes and B-sides (album title notwithstanding) culled from the singles generated by the animated supergroup's international hit debut album. The 9 songs here (totalling just 38 minutes) include two previously unreleased tracks.

Title: Manic Expressive
Info: This is Marc Bianchi's second LP as Her Space Holiday, which also includes his girlfriend, Keely.

Title: Everybody Wants To Know
Info: This is the sixth album (and third on Beggars Banquet) for San Francisco's Swell, which now is a one-man band consisting entirely of David Freel.

Title: Black Market Music
Info: This is the third album from London glam-rockers Placebo. The U.S. release adds two bonus tracks: a new version of "Without You I'm Nothing" with David Bowie guesting on vocals, and a cover of Depeche Mode's "I Feel You."

Title: Songs From An American Movie, Vol. 2: Good Time For A Bad Attitude
Chaosmosis
Info: The 11th full-length release for the Scottish rock band features guest appearances from Haim, Sky Ferreira, and Rachel Zeffira.

Title: Devastator
Info: The second release for the Illinois indie-rock band led by George Hunter.

Title: Will The Guns Come Out
Info: The debut full-length album for the San Francisco-born artist features Her Space Holiday as a guest.

Title: Unplugged
Info: The singer's not-quite-acoustic MTV session includes two new songs and collaborations with Common, Mos Def, Damian Marley and Adam Levine.

Title: Light Asylum
Info: This is the debut full-length electronic-based album for the Brooklyn duo of Shannon Funchess and producer Bruno Coviello.

Title: Dark Matter: Moving At The Speed Of Light
Info: The legendary DJ and musician's first studio album in four years includes an appearance from Gary Numan.

Title: Passover
Info: The sixth full-length release for Alexander Shields was produced and mixed by Misha Hering.

Title: Yeah Right
Info: The Philadelphia indie pop band Reading Rainbow returns with a new name and two new members: Greg Frantz and Al Creedon.

Title: Sleep Forever
Info: The sophomore album for the Brooklyn rock band is their first on Frenchkiss Records.

Title: The Beekeeper
Info: The singer-songwriter returns with her first album of original material in three years, a conceptual work centering on the title character, with its 19 songs divided into six thematic "gardens." Damien Rice guests on one track.

Title: Rush!
Info: The third full-length release for the Italian rock band Måneskin features a guest appearance from Tom Morello.

Title: Await Barbarians
Info: This is the second full-length solo release for the Hot Chip singer/guitarist.

Title: Sawdust
Info: The collection of b-sides and remixes also features Lou Reed on one track.

Title: The Journey Man
Info: The latest release for the British drum and bass artist features a guest appearance from José James.

Title: Mylo Xyloto
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the alternative rock band is a concept album about the love story of Mylo Xyloto, set in an alien dystopia.

Title: Talk About Body
Info: After four years of being a Brooklyn-based band, the art/music collective formed by Le Tigre's J.D. Samson finally release their debut album of disco punk with a socio-political message.

Title: Spirit
Info: The season three "The X Factor" winner's first album debuted as the number one album in the UK.

Title: Mind Trap
Info: The second release for Turner Prize-winning artist was co-produced with Andy Knowles and Nick McCarthy.

Title: Chocolate Factory
Info: Beseiged by legal problems (he was arrested in Chicago on child pornography-related charges) and rampant bootlegging of an earlier effort ('Loveland') that forced him to abandon that project, Kelly finally returns with a follow-up to 2000's 'TP-2.Com.'

Title: Kicks
Info: The second album for the Scottish band was produced by Bernard Butler and is the first album with Dino Bardot, who replaced Jamie McMorrow.

Title: Digi Snacks
Info: The third album for the Wu-Tang Clan member as Bobby Digital features Thea and George Harrison's son as guest artists.

Title: Bigfoot
Info: Produced by Richard Swift, the debut release for the indie pop band led by Zach Yudin was influenced by rock of the 1960s and 70s.

Title: Gallery [EP]
Info: This seven-track EP from the Northern California indie pop band led by Justin Vallesteros is a follow-up to its 2011 debut full-length, Idle Labor.

Title: Don't Act Like You Don't Care
Info: Here We Go Magic's Luke Temple releases his third solo album.

Title: Sound City: Real to Reel
Info: The songs on the soundtrack to Dave Grohl's documentary about Sound City Studios (Fleetwood Mac's Rumours, Rage Against The Machine's self-titled debut, Pat Benatar's Crimes of Passion, and Nirvana's Nevermind were recorded there), were composed and recorded with its own 24-hour session using the Neve 8028 recording console from the legendary Los Angeles studio with such artists as Josh Homme, Paul McCartney, Stevie Nicks, Cheap Trick's Rick Nielsen, Trent Reznor, Rick Springfield, Slipknot’s Corey Taylor, Fear's Lee Ving, members of the Foo Fighters, and surviving members of Nirvana.

Title: Freedom's Road
Info: The rocker's first album of originals in six years includes the Chevy Trucks themesong "Our Country."

Title: Kiss & Tell
Info: The all-female Scandinavian quartet return with a disc produced by Pelle Gunnerfeldt (The Hives), their third album overall and first for new label RCA.

Title: La Bella Mafia
Info: The third solo album from the former Junior M.A.F.I.A. member utilizes production and vocal contributions from Swizz Beatz, Missy Elliott, Timbaland and Method Man.

Title: Oxeneers Or The Lion Sleeps When Its Antelope Go
Info: The Seattle band (who apparently suffer from either an unusual genetic problem or severe hallucinations) make their full-length debut with this disc.

Title: Appeal To Reason
Info: The fifth full-length album for the Chicago punk rock band was produced by Bill Stevenson and Jason Livermore.

Title: Better Nature
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based alternative rock band was produced by Jacknife Lee.

Title: Love & Devotion
Info: The debut release from Planet Mu founder Mike Paradinas and his wife Lara Rix-Martin features Gravenhurst's Nick Talbot on four tracks.

Title: An End Has A Start
Info: The Birmingham, England group tries to escape the sophmore slump and comparisons to other bands with their second album.

Title: The Golden Age of Knowhere
Info: The Los Angeles five-piece--named after a song by the Cure--deliver their debut album of catchy punk rock.

Title: dios (malos)
Info: Phil Ek produced the second album for the band (formerly known as Dios) fronted by Joel Morales.

Title: Superhero Brother
Info: The third album on Jack Johnson's Brushfire label for the Philadelphia trio.

Title: Two-Way Mirror
Info: The Los Angeles rock quintet releases its second full-length album produced by Mars Volta's Isaiah "Ikey" Owens.

Title: The House
Info: The fourth studio album for the Georgian-born British singer-songwriter was produced by William Orbit.

Title: The Hunting Party
Info: The sixth studio release for the nu metal group was co-produced by band members Brad Delson and Mike Shinoda with guest appearances from Page Hamilton, Daron Malakian, Tom Morello, and Rakim.

Title: Pagans in Vegas
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Canadian indie rock band is its first in three years with another album scheduled for 2016.

Title: Temple of I & I
Info: The 10th full-length release for the Washington D.C. electronic duo features guest appearances from Lou Lou Ghelichkhani, Shana Halligan, Raquel Jones, Mr. Lif, Elin Melgarejo, Notch, Puma, and Zee.

Title: 9 Dead Alive
Info: Recorded in Mexico by Fermin Vasquez Llera, the first release of new material in five years from Rodrigo Sanchez and Gabriela Quinetro was self-produced.

Title: Feelin' Good
Info: The latest release for British DJ George Evelyn includes influences from funk, hip hop, jazz, reggae, and soul music.

Title: The  Still Life
Info: The third full-length release for Alessi Laurent-Marke was produced by Andy LeMaster.

Title: Free Dimensional
Info: The second electro-pop album from John O'Regan as Diamond Rings was co-produced with Damian Taylor.

Title: Into the Murky Water
Info: This is the second album for the British folk rock band twice nominated for the Ivor Novello award for songwriting.

Title: Punctuated Equilibrium
Info: Scott "Wino" Weinrich, former member of such bands as The Obsessed, Saint Vitus, Spirit Caravan, Place of Skulls, and The Hidden Hand, releases his debut solo album.

Title: Life With You
Info: The Scottish group returns with its seventh studio album.

Title: Kevin Michael
Info: Michael's debut album features Wyclef Jean, Lupe Fiasco, Saigon, and Q Tip.

Title: Improvisations
Info: The debut full-length collaboration between The Heat's Charles Hayward and Sonic Youth's Thurston Moore was recorded in an afternoon in London.

Title: Law Of The Playground
Info: The second album for the English indie-rock duo.

Title: Klang
Info: The third album for the British indie-rock band was recorded in Berlin.

Title: Court Yard Hounds
Info: The Dixie Chicks' Emily Robison and Martie Maguire record a side project as a duo.

Title: The Evolution
Info: The R&B singer's second album is laced with spoken-word interludes. 50 Cent, Lil Jon, and Chamillionaire lend a hand.

Title: This Is Gap Dream
Info: The third full-length release for Gabe Fulvimar under the name Gap Dream was recorded over a two year period in California.

Title: Those The Brokes
Info: The poppy British quartet are joined by a nine-piece orchestra on their sophomore effort.

Title: Outrage! Is Now
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Canadian punk rock duo sees Sebastien Grainger and Jesse F. Keeler dropping the 1979 suffix (which was added in 2004 due to a dispute with DFA Records) from the band name.

Title: 99 Cents
Info: The all-girl German group's third disc includes collaborations with Peaches and Miss Kittin, plus a remake of the Tom Tom Club's "Wordy Rappinghood."

Title: Under My Skin
Info: Ditching the production team (The Matrix) who made her first album a hit, Lavigne turned to fellow Canadians Chantal Kreviazuk and Raine Maida to write and produce this sophomore disc.

Title: Baby Blue
Info: The Boston-based singer-songwriter's second studio album features songs written by Nick Saloman (aka the Bevis Frond), as well as covers of Pink Floyd's "Fearless" and Pete Ham's "Baby Blue."

Title: Volcano, I'm Still Excited!!
Info: This self-titled disc marks the debut for the quirky Austin/Brooklyn indie-rock trio, whose guitar-keyboard-drums sound is sometimes reminiscent of Spoon.

Title: Politics Of The Business
Info: A veteran of such hip-hop acts as Stetsasonic and Handsome Boy Modeling School and producer of such legendary albums as De La Soul's '3 Feet High and Rising,' Prince Paul returns with his third solo release. Almost a meta-concept album, it is loosely based on Paul's dealings with his (former) record company regarding his previous release, the 1999 concept album 'A Prince Among Thieves.' Among the guests here are Chuck D, Erick Sermon and Ice-T.

Title: You Can Play These Songs With Chords
Info: This collection of B-sides, alternate versions and rarities contains 18 tracks, including an early cover of the Smiths' "This Charming Man."

Title: The Brave And The Bold
Info: The first collaboration between singer-songwriter Will Oldham and Chicago instrumental post-rockers Tortoise features 10 covers, including takes on songs by Elton John and Bruce Springsteen.

Title: Lynn Teeter Flower
Info: The Azure Ray singer's second solo set was recorded with Spoon's Jim Eno and Now It's Overhead's Andy LeMaster as well as Memphis producer Doug Easley. Conor Oberst guests.

Title: A Forest of Arms
Info: The sixth studio release for the Canadian folk rock band led by Tony Dekker was partially recorded in Ontario’s Tyendinaga Caverns and Caves.

Title: Save Your Season
Info: This is the second release for the husband and wife team of Keith and Hollie Kenniff.

Title: Our Bright Future
Info: The latest album for the Grammy-winning artist was produced with Larry Klein.

Title: Made In Sheffield
Info: The man behind the UK hit ‘Is This The Way To Amarillo’ is back with his latest album which features songs written by Richard Hawley, Jarvis Cocker and the Arctic Monkeys' Alex Turner.

Title: Cosmic Egg
Info: The second album for the Australian rock band was produced by Alan Moulder.

Title: Speed of Darkness
Info: Ryan Hewitt produced the Celtic punk rock band's fifth studio album, which was recorded at a church-turned-recording-studio.

Title: Welcome Joy
Info: The second album for the Seattle-based indie rock band was produced by Colin Stewart.

Title: Mama, I'm Swollen
Info: The sixth studio album for the Omaha, Nebraska-based indie-rock band.

Title: Rise To Your Knees
Info: The rock band reunites (with a new drummer) for a new album.

Title: Songs of Patience
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based indie rock band led by Petter Ericson Stakee and Terry Wolfers took three years and three producers to make.

Title: Art of McCartney
Info: The two-disc tribute album to Paul McCartney songs features such artists as Harry Connick, Jr., Alice Cooper, Roger Daltrey, Def Leppard, Dr. John, Bob Dylan, Barry Gibb, Heart, Billy Joel, Kiss, Jeff Lynne, Steve Miller, Willie Nelson, Corinne Bailey Rae, Smokey Robinson, and Brian Wilson.

Title: Best of Times
Info: The third studio release for the British indie rock band led by Ed Wallis was mixed by Larry Crane.

Title: Word of Mouth
Info: The seventh release for the British folk artist was recorded in a Cornish church.

Title: My Shame Is True
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the punk rock trio was produced by Bill Stevenson and Jason Livermore.

Title: The Duckworth Lewis Method
Info: The debut album for the Irish band formed by Neil Hannon and Thomas Walsh was inspired by the game of cricket.

Title: Wonder
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter features a duet with Justin Bieber.

Title: Planet Earth
Info: Prince returns with his 24th studio album--but not without a bit of controversy.

Title: Four
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the London-based pop band features songs co-written by Ed Drewett, Wayne Hector, Jamie Scott, and Ed Sheeran,.

Title: Green Imagination
Info: This is the second album for the group led by Bill Doss (formerly of Olivia Tremor Control), which mixes psychedelia and pop.

Title: St. Anger
Info: As the title implies, the metal band is just as, well, angry as ever on their first new studio album since 'Load' and 'Reload' appeared in 1996 and 1997. Just don't try downloading it for free--then you'll see some real anger.

Title: Love & Distortion
Info: This is the sophomore release for San Francisco's atmospheric noise-pop band led by vocalist Chris Streng, whose previous band shared members with Black Rebel Motorcycle Club.

Title: Exciter
Info: This is the first album of new material since 1997's 'Ultra' for Depeche Mode, which again sees the band as a trio (consisting of David Gahan, Martin L. Gore, and Andy Fletcher) but also sees them experimenting more with a wider variety of sounds, including acoustic guitar. It is DM's first time in the studio with producer Mark Bell, who has previously worked with Bjork and was a member of the early-90s techno outfit LFO. The lead single from the 13-track album is "Dream On."

Title: El Rey
Info: The band led by David Gedge releases its latest album, produced by Steve Albini.

Title: X
Info: Kylie returns after her battle with breast cancer with her latest album.

Title: Let There Be Morning
Info: 'Morning' marks the U.S. debut for the Swedish four-piece, who originally formed in 1997.

Title: Omni
Info: Joe Chiccarelli produced the Seattle-based rock group's fourth album on new label Dangerbird Records.

Title: Without Feathers
Info: This long-overdue second album finds the Montreal band shedding its dark, Joy Division-influenced sound for one that more closely resembles classic rock.

Title: Different Gear, Still Speeding
Info: With frontman Liam Gallagher taking the reins sans brother Noel, the debut of the Steve Lillywhite-produced album combines psychedelic rock with Beatles-sounding Brit-pop that shows remnants of early Oasis in it's sound.

Title: Strange Clouds
Info: The second album for rapper B.o.B. features guest appearances from Morgan Freeman, Taylor Swift, Chris Brown, Lil Wayne, Nicki Minaj, Ryan Tedder, Trey Songz, and T.I.

Title: Crush Songs
Info: The debut full-length solo release for the Yeah Yeah Yeahs singer was originally recorded in 2006-07.

Title: The Blueprint 3
Info: After seven years, the final album of his Blueprint series is finally released.

Title: Greedy Baby
Info: The British electronica duo of Ed Handley and Andy Turner team with visual artist Bob Jaroc for this combination of music and video.

Title: Transfixiation
Info: The fourth full-length release for the noise rock band is its first with new drummer Robi Gonzalez.

Title: Everybody Loves A Happy Ending
Info: A reunited Curt Smith and Roland Orzabal return with their first Tears For Fears album together in 15 years.

Title: R.E.M Live
Info: The first live album for R.E.M. is a recording of the band's Dublin concert in 2005.

Title: Gauntlet Hair
Info: The Colorado duo of Andy R. and Craig Nice releases its debut full-length album.

Title: Before This World
Info: The first release of original material from the multiple Grammy winning singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Sting and was produced with Dave O'Donnell.

Title: Success
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Canadian noise rock trio was produced by Steve Albini.

Title: Quarters
Info: The debut full-length studio release for British electronic producer James Welch was recorded in four different locations in Berlin.

Title: Kiss Land
Info: After a trilogy of mixtapes, the Canadian artist releases his debut studio release that includes a guest appearance from Drake.

Title: All Hell Breaks Loose
Info: The debut release for the hard rock band formed by Thin Lizzy guitarist Scott Gorham with Ricky Warwick, Jimmy DeGrasso, Marco Mendoza, and Damon Johnson was produced by Kevin Shirley.

Title: Candela
Info: The seventh release for the band led by Adam Pierce sees the group adding more pop elements to the other music styles heard on previous albums.

Title: This Is Christmas
Info: Ash singer Tim Wheeler and his singer/songwriter girlfriend, Emmy the Great, wrote this album of Christmas songs after being trapped at an airport by a snowstorm.

Title: In the Grace of Your Love
Info: The New York trio releases their fourth album of dance punk.
This is the debut album for the Brooklyn-based trio.

Title: A Guide to Love, Loss & Desperation
Info: The debut album from the three-piece from Liverpool, England.

Title: There's No 666 In Outer Space
Info: The Sacramento duo has transformed into a full five-piece band, fronted by new singer Aaron Ross, for this new LP.

Title: 4:21 ... The Day After
Info: The Wu-Tang star's fourth solo album includes contributions from Ol' Dirty Bastard, RZA, Ginuwine and Raekwon.

Title: It Ain't Safe No More
Info: Busta is back with 19 new tracks, including collaborations with Mariah Carey, Carl Thomas and The Neptunes.

Title: Mind Elevation
Info: The British techno pioneer(s) (now down to just one founding member, George Evelyn), return with their first studio album in three years.

Title: Strange Little Girls
Info: Yes, it is a covers album, but with a bit of a twist: all the songs were originally written and performed by men, and Amos has reinterpreted them from a woman's standpoint. This eclectic collection (12 tracks in all) includes versions of Depeche Mode's "Enjoy The Silence," Eminem's "97' Bonnie and Clyde," 10cc's "I'm Not In Love," Neil Young's "Heart Of Gold," Slayer's "Raining Blood," and the Boomtown Rats' "I Don't Like Mondays."

Title: Hard Candy
Info: The queen of pop's latest and last release on the Warner Brothers label was produced in part by Nate "Danja" Hills, Timbaland, Justin Timberlake, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Pocketful of Sunshine
Info: The sophomore album for the English singer.

Title: The Alchemy Index Vols. I and II: Fire and Water
Info: The first of two volumes of EPs produced by their guitarist Teppei Teranishi.

Title: Wanderlust
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British indie singer was co-written and produced by Ed Harcourt.

Title: Konk
Info: The sophomore album was produced by Tony Hoffer. The British band recently lost its bassist Max Rafferty, who quit earlier this year.

Title: Forever
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the San Francisco-based cousins Reese Donohue and Christopher Prudhomme.

Title: L.A.X.
Info: The third album for the rapper from California features guest artists such as Common, Ice Cube, Lil Wayne, Ludacris, Nas, Ne-Yo, and Travis Barker.

Title: From the Hills Below the City
Info: The debut release for the folk rock quartet from New Albany, Indiana (near Louisville, Kentucky) was produced by Kevin Ratterman.

Title: Here I Stand
Info: The fifth album for the R&B singer features Young Jeezy, will.i.am, Jay-Z, Jermaine Dupri, Beyoncé, and Lil Wayne.

Title: Native
Info: This is the third full-length studio release for the pop rock band led by singer-songwriter/producer Ryan Tedder.

Title: Avril Lavigne
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Canadian pop singer features songs co-written with her husband, Chad Kroeger of Nickelback.

Title: Negotiations
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Portland, Oregon indie folk duo was writtened, recorded and produced by The Helio Sequence.

Title: Ursa Major
Info: The fourth album for the alternative rock band from San Francisco is its first album since being dropped by Atlantic Records (which had taken over Elektra's roster of bands).

Title: Shake the Shudder
Info: The seventh full-length release for the dance-punk band was produced by Patrick Ford.

Title: Spills Out
Info: The third album for the Brooklyn quartet sees the band turn toward a more pop sound.

Title: Meds
Info: Michael Stipe and VW (The Kills) guest on the UK band's first album in three years.

Title: Relaxer
Info: The third full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by Charlie Andrew.

Title: Love 2
Info: The French duo worked with drummer Joey Waronker on their latest studio album.

Title: Birds In The Trap Sing McKnight
Info: The second full-length studio release for the rapper is an Apple exclusive and features contributions from such artists as André 3000, Kid Cudi, Swizz Beatz, Blac Youngsta, Cassie, 21 Savage, Kendrick Lamar, Bryson Tiller, Young Thug, Quavo, The Weeknd, K. Forest and Nav.

Title: Original Machines
Info: The debut full-length release for the lead singer of ...And You Will Know Us By The Trail Of Dead was written partially while on tour and traveling through Cambodia.

Title: When The World Comes Down
Info: The third album from the Oklahoma rock band was produced by Eric Valentine.

Title: Around
Info: One of two April 2006 releases for the former Television guitarist, 'Around' is a 16-track instrumental release.

Title: Out West
Info: This double-live album was recorded during a three-night stand at the Fillmore in San Francisco in early 2005.

Title: 12 Memories
Info: The fourth album from the Glaswegian rock band is their darkest to date.

Title: At Sixes And Sevens
Info: This is the debut solo release for former Sebadoh drummer/songwriter Jason Loewenstein. On these 14 tracks, J.Loew handles all instruments and songwriting duties himself.

Title: Cake & Pie
Info: The singer-songwriter's third album (which comes a full five years after her second, 1997's 'Firecracker') features 12 new tracks, including "We Could Still Belong Together" from the "Legally Blonde" soundtrack.

Title: Vision Valley
Info: This is the third album for the Australian rock band, now down to a trio after the departure of bassist Patrick Matthews.

Title: Chinese Democracy
Info: The long-gestating Guns N' Roses album finally sees the light of day.

Title: Anxiety
Info: The second full-length album for the New Zealand singer-songwriter Pip Brown was produced Pascal Gabriel.

Title: Here I Am
Info: The former Destiny's Child singer puts out her third solo effort.

Title: Mixed Race
Info: Tricky is a highly acclaimed musician and producer whose eighth album crosses genres by mixing reggae, rap, jazz and rock to blur the lines of definition.

Title: Continental
Info: 'Continental' is the second solo album for the former Cocteau Twins guitarist.

Title: Stockholm
Info: The debut solo release for the Pretenders lead singer features guest appearances from Neil Young and John McEnroe as well as production from her co-writer, Björn Yttling.

Title: Louder Now
Info: Eric Valentine (Queens Of The Stone Age) produced the emo band's third studio album and major-label debut.

Title: The End of That
Info: The third full-length album for the Canadian indie rock band was recorded in Paris, France.

Title: That's Why God Made the Radio
Info: The first new album in over 20 years with all of the Beach Boys' original surviving members is produced by Brian Wilson and Mike Love.

Title: Hourglass
Info: This is the second solo album for the Depeche Mode singer.

Title: Light We Made
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Pennsylvania rock band was produced by Will Yip.

Title: The Modern Age
Info: The first full-length studio release in nearly 22 years for the Britpop band was recorded by producer Stephen Street.

Title: Dead Blue
Info: This is the third full-length release for the dream-pop duo of Greg Hughes and Tessa Murray.

Title: Intensive Care
Info: The British singer's latest was produced by Stephen "Tin Tin" Duffy.

Title: Songs of Innocence
Info: The surprise release of the Irish rock band's 13th studio album on iTunes features production from Danger Mouse, Paul Epworth, Flood, and Ryan Tedder. A physical release is scheduled for 14 Oct 2014.

Title: Battle Born
Info: The fourth release for the Las Vegas pop band features production from Daniel Lanois, Steve Lillywhite, Brendan O'Brien, Stuart Price, and Damian Taylor.

Title: Musik, Die Schwer Zu Twerk
Info: The debut release for the prog-rock side project of The Flaming Lips' Steven Drozd and Wayne Coyne with backing by Nashville psychedelic rock band Linear Downfall was produced by David Fridmann & Scott Booker.

Title: Dr. Dee
Info: The soundtrack to Damon Albarn's opera about Dr. John Dee, a 17th century mathematician, astronomer, and advisor to Queen Elizabeth I, includes influences from West African, modern folk and classical music.

Title: Field Manual
Info: Death Cab for Cutie member and producer releases his debut solo album.

Title: Brand New By Tomorrow
Info: Producer and Beastie Boys collaborator Mark Ramos-Nishita returns with a solo vocal-driven album, his first release in nearly six years (and his first output for Jack Johnson's label).

Title: Hungry Bird
Info: The alt-country indie-rock band led by Eef Barzelay returns with its long-awaited album, completed back in 2006.

Title: Plastic Fang
Info: The New York trio is back with their fifth album for Matador (and first since 1998). Here, they work with veteran rock producer Steve Jordan and get some help from Bernie Worrell and Dr. John.

Title: The Impossible Thrill
Info: The English electronica duo return with an atmospheric collection of 12 lounge/trip-hop tracks, with vocals provided by Wendy Stubbs, Helen White, and Martin Barnard.

Title: Halfway Between the Gutter and the Stars
Info: The follow-up to 1998's hugely successful 'You've Come A Long Way, Baby' features guest appearances by Macy Gray, Bootsy Collins, and (via sampling) Jim Morrison.

Title: Fifth Harmony
Info: The third full-length release for the pop quartet features a guest appearance from Gucci Mane and is its first since Camila Cabello left at the end of 2016.

Title: My God Is Blue
Info: The fourth album from the French electro-pop singer-wongwriter was produced by DJ Mr. Flash.

Title: The Flexible Entertainer
Info: This is the first album since Rob Doran left the group in 2008 as Pit Er Pat continues on as a duo with remaining members Butchy Fuego and Fay Davis-Jeffers.

Title: Fellow Travelers
Info: The cover release from the indie band includes songs with artists they have toured with but not on their own songs including The Baptist Generals, David Thomas Broughton, Clinic, Coldplay, Sharon Van Etten, Folk Implosion, Wye Oak, and Xiu Xiu.

Title: Kill Them With Kindness
Info: The indie-pop trio from Illinois--making their debut with 'Kindness'--features former members of Maserati and Absinthe Blind.

Title: Oblivion With Bells
Info: After five years of working on other projects, including film scores, Underworld returns with their fifth album.

Title: Wildness
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the rock band led by Gary Lightbody is its first in seven years and was produced by Jacknife Lee.

Title: Return to Ommadawn
Info: The 26th full-length release for the British folk-rock artist is the sequel to his 1975 album, Ommadawn.

Title: English Heart
Info: The latest solo release from the lead singer of the Ronettes features covers of 1960s British rock songs from such artists as the Animals, the Bee Gees, The Kinks, and the Rolling Stones.

Title: This Is Another Life
Info: The second full-length release from the solo project of singer-songwriter Jesse Lortz was produced by Greg Ashley and features a guest appearance by Marissa Nadler.

Title: This River
Info: Co-produced with Dan Prothero, this is the eighth release for the Florida blues/funk/soul singer JJ Grey with his band Mofro.

Title: Diver
Info: The second release for the Brooklyn-based indie dance trio was co-produced by Le Chec.

Title: Arrows & Anchors
Info: The fourth album for the Texas rock band was produced by Joe Barresi.

Title: Light Of X
Info: The second full-length album for the model/actor-turned-singer from San Francisco.

Title: Skin Of Evil
Info: The second full-length solo album for Frog Eyes/Swan Lake's Carey Mercer.

Title: Tree City
Info: This debut LP for the New York quartet has drawn numerous comparisons to Spoon.

Title: Crimes of Passion
Info: The fourth full-length release for the San Diego duo of Charles Rowell and Brandon Welchez was produced by Sune Rose Wagner of The Raveonettes.

Title: The Exchange Session Vol. 2
Info: This is the second of two releases from an improvised collaboration between pop and jazz drummer Reid and folktronica artist Hebden (Four Tet, Fridge).

Title: Snapshot
Info: The debut full-length release for the Irish blues-rock band was produced by Chris Thomas.

Title: Here Lies Love
Info: David Byrne works with Fatboy Slim for his concept album about the life of the former First Lady of the Philippines, Imelda Marcos. The two-disc set includes singers such as Tori Amos, Steve Earle, Sharon Jones, Cyndi Lauper, Natalie Merchant, Allison Moorer, Santigold, St. Vincent, Martha Wainwright, and Florence Welch.

Title: Penny Sparkle
Info: The alternative rock trio's eighth album was produced by Van Rivers and the Subliminal Kid.

Title: Sisyphus
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between  Serengeti, Son Lux, and Sufjan Stevens (previously known as s/s/s)  was commissioned by the Walker Art Center and the Saint Paul Chamber Orchestra’s Liquid Music series in Minneapolis/St. Paul.

Title: Off the Record
Info: Using material from 1975 to 1993 Bartos created 12 new songs, the latest solo release for the former Kraftwerk member was conceived after techno label Bureau B inquired about archival material he might want to release.

Title: Oh No
Info: Tore Johansson (Franz Ferdinand) produced this second album for the Chicago power-pop outfit.

Title: Regional Surrealism
Info: This is the debut electronic album for Scottish graphic artist/producer Tom Scholefield as Konx-Om-Pax.

Title: No, No, No
Info: The first release in four years for the indie folk band led by Zach Condon, who found inspiration again with a new girlfriend and spending time in Turkey.

Title: The Ride
Info: The first new release in five years for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Until The Earth Begins To Part
Info: The debut album for the Scottish septet was produced by producer Ian Caple.

Title: Mind Body & Soul
Info: ?uestlove, Angie Stone and Nile Rogers guest on the 18-year-old soul singer's sophomore effort.

Title: Something for Everybody
Info: Devo, the New Wave group from Ohio returns with its first album in over 20 years. It not only includes classic Devo but modern dance styles.

Title: A Long Way to Fall
Info: The synthesizer is a major component in the first solo album in six years for the German (now London-based) electronic artist.

Title: E=MC2
Info: The follow-up to 2005's "The Emancipation of Mimi" features T-Pain, Damian Marley, and Young Jeezy as guests.

Title: Bloodlust
Info: The sixth full-length release for the rap-metal band led by Ice-T features guest appearances from Dave Mustaine, Max Cavalera and Lamb Of God's Randy Blythe

Title: Love Story
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Alabama rapper features a guest appearance from Eminem.

Title: I Get Wet
Info: This big-budget debut album from 22-year-old Detroit-raised rocker Andrew WK took the UK (well, at least its music press) by storm in late 2001.

Title: Human
Info: The debut full-length release for the 2017 BRITs Critics' Choice Award winner Rory Graham was produced by Jonny Coffer, Mark Crew, and Two Inch Punch.

Title: Funplex
Info: The first studio album for the band since 1992's "Good Stuff" was produced by Steve Osborne.

Title: Tre!
Info: The final album in the ¡Uno! ¡Dos! ¡Tré! trilogy for the punk rock band.

Title: See You On The Other Side
Info: The Matrix co-produced the band's first album since 2003.

Title: Hang Cool Teddy Bear
Info: The latest album for the artist was produced by Rob Cavallo and features such guests as American Idol judge Kara DioGuardi, Queen's Brian May, Steve Val, The Darkness' Justin Hawkins, and Jack Black.

Title: Now Or Heaven
Info: The sophomore album for the indie rock band based in Los Angeles.

Title: Super Extra Gravity
Info: The veteran Swedish band's sixth studio album was finally released in the U.S. in September 2006, nearly one year after it first surfaced in Europe.

Title: In Guards We Trust
Info: This is the second release for the Brooklyn indie rock band led by Richie Follin.

Title: Only Run
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Philadelphia-based indie pop band led by Alec Ounsworth features guest appearances from Kid Koala and Matt Berninger from The National.

Title: System
Info: Seal's first studio album since 2003 includes a duet with his wife Heidi Klum.

Title: The Antidote
Info: The electronia outfit's fifth studio recording features new vocalist Daisy Martey (who replaces Skye Edwards).

Title: Three
Info: The third full-length release for the New York duo of Sarah Barthel and Josh Carter features contributions from Darby Cicci of the Antlers, Matt Chamberlain, Ricky Reed (aka Wallpaper), and Dan Wilson of Semisonic.

Title: Reality Killed The Video Star
Info: The former Take That singer releases his latest solo album produced by Trevor Horn.

Title: The Battle at Garden's Gate
Info: The second full-length release for the Michigan rock band was recorded with producer Greg Kurstin.

Title: Music To Be Murdered By
Info: The surprise release from the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Anderson.Paak, the late rapper Juice WRLD, Q Tip, and Ed Sheeran.

Title: Barbara
Info: The latest album for the indie rock band We Are Scientists is its first with ex-Razorlight drummer Andy Burrows.

Title: La Costa Perdida
Info: The first album in eight years for the alternative rock band was self-produced and influenced by their California roots.

Title: Como te Llama
Info: The sophomore release for the Strokes guitarist was recorded in five weeks.

Title: Paper Gods
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the British pop rock band features guest appearances from Jonas Bjerre, John Frusciante, Kiesza, Lindsay Lohan, Janelle Monáe, Mr Hudson, and Nile Rodgers.

Title: The Bronx III
Info: This is the third album for the Los Angeles punk rock band.

Title: Welcome to the Fishbowl
Info: Tim McGraw and Grace Potter guest on the 15th studio album from the country singer.

Title: Black Rainbows
Info: The fourth solo album for the former frontman of Suede was coproduced with Leo Abrahams.

Title: Hello Everything
Info: This is Tom Jenkinson's first new album in two years, and the English electronica artist's tenth disc overall.

Title: Myself in the Way
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Virginia rock band was recorded with Will Yip over two sessions.

Title: SPARK
Info: The latest full-length release for Chicago duo Whitney was written in Portland, Oregon and features production from John Congleton and Brad Cook

Title: Minnesota
Info: The latest album for the Hawaii-born singer-songwriter was self-produced.

Title: Portamento
Info: The Brooklyn indie poppers releases its sophomore album.

Title: Lights Out
Info: The debut album for the duo of American-born Kacey Underwood and London-native Alice Costelloe was coproduced with Dean Reid.

Title: Starting from Nowhere
Info: This is the debut release for Tim Heidecker and Davin Wood, who work together on the TV show Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!

Title: All Night Long
Info: The fifth album from this Los Angeles-based band is filled with straightforward rock-and-roll anthems.

Title: Take My Breath Away
Info: The second album on Kompakt for the Brazilian electronic music artist/producer.

Title: Closer
Info: This is the fourth album for the New Orleans-based trio. It is their first release on indie Beyond Music, after being dropped by Elektra for disappointing sales.

Title: The Saga Continues
Info: Not an official Wu-Tang Clan album (thus the shorten name), the release produced by Mathematics does feature many of its members with guest appearances by Cappadonna, Ghostface Killah, Hue Hef, Inspektah Deck, Mzee Jones, Killa Priest, Steven Latorre, Masta Killa, Method Man, R-Mean, Raekwon, Redman, RZA, Sean Price, Streetlife, and Swnkah.

Title: Hot Hot Heat
Info: The final release for the Vancouver band is its first in six years and features songs written between 2011 and 2014.

Title: City Of Refuge
Info: The fourth album for the indie rock band features guest appearances by Jana Hunter, Sufjan Stevens, Dawn Smithson, Scot Tuma, and Ero Gray.

Title: The Road, Pt. 2: Lost Highway
Info: The second of a planned trilogy of concept albums from the British electronic group led by James Lavelle features guest appearances from Dhani Harrison, Keaton Henson, Mick Jones, Mark Lanegan, Wil Malone, Miink, Liela Moss, Elliott Power, Philip Sheppard, and the Editors' Tom Smith.

Title: Ultraista
Info: Nigel Godrich, producer to Beck and Radiohead, heads up this debut release with Laura Bettinson, and Joey Waronker.

Title: History of Modern
Info: The first album in 14 years for the Liverpool, England, musicians who are best known in the US for the song If You Leave from the movie Pretty in Pink.

Title: Thunderheist
Info: The duo of producer Grahm Zilla and rapper/singer Isis releases their debut full-length album together.

Title: The Amazons
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Matt Thomson was produced by Catherine Marks.

Title: City of Vultures
Info: This is the debut album for the British metal band led by Austin Dickinson, the son of Iron Maiden's Bruce Dickinson.

Title: 9th Ward Pickin' Parlor
Info: Recorded in New Orleans prior to Hurricane Katrina, this diverse set finds the singer-songwriter dabbling in everything from gospel to country, and folk to blues-rock.

Title: Brain Thrust Mastery
Info: The California-based indie rock band, which has had more luck in the UK, releases its latest album.

Title: Conditions of My Parole
Info: The second studio album for the Maynard James Keenan project was recorded in Arizona.

Title: Permalight
Info: Formed in Oakland, California by Zach Schwartz, the indie rock band releases its fourth full-length album and its first with Cameron Jasper who replaced Patrick Abernethy (who took over for Evan Farrell when he left the band in 2007) on bass.

Title: The Believer
Info: The second solo disc from the Old 97s frontman includes contributions from Rachael Yamagata and Jon Brion.

Title: The  Big Dream
Info: The second full-length solo release from the film director includes a cover of Bob Dylan's "The Ballad of Hollis Brown and a guest appearance from Lykke Li.

Title: Graffiti on the Train
Info: The eighth studio release for the Welsh indie rock band was co-produced with Jim Lowe.

Title: In the Cool of the Day
Info: Daniel Martin Moore's latest solo album includes a selection of songs influenced by classic gospel.

Title: Where Were You When It Happened?
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the Israeli rock band.

Title: Church Gone Wild / Chirpin Hard
Info: The Sacramento, Calif. noise-rock duo of Spencer Seim and Zach Hill each claim a disc to themselves on this 2-CD third album.

Title: Beautiful Future
Info: The latest album from the alt rock group from Scotland was produced in part by Bjorn Yttling.

Title: On The Outside
Info: Rob Schnapf produced album number three for the James Walsh-led band.

Title: Yucca
Info: Black Alp's bassist Martin Cohen delivers his solo debut of pop music.

Title: Towards
Info: This is the full-length release for the French indie experimental pop trio of Fabienne Débarre, Michael Liot, and William Serfass.

Title: Savages
Info: The ninth studio release for the metal band led by Max Cavalera is the first with his son Zyon on drums and includes guest appearances from  Clutch's Neil Fallon, I Declare War's Jamie Hanks, and Napalm Death's Mitch Harris.

Title: Rip This
Info: The third full-length release for the duo of John Barrett and Len Clark was produced by Jacob Portrait.

Title: In Love And Death
Info: This is the third album for the Utah emo-rockers.

Title: Sleeping With Ghosts
Info: The UK glam-punk band returns with their fourth album.

Title: Velocity of Sound
Info: This is the Denver indie-pop band's first new album since 2000's 'The Discovery of a World Inside the Moone.'

Title: Seeing Sounds
Info: This is the third album for the trio of Pharrell Williams, Chad Hugo, and Shae Haley.

Title: They Were Wrong, So We Drowned
Info: The New York punk outfit moves even further away from the mainstream on this sophomore effort (a concept album about witch trials), which also sees them with a new rhythm section.

Title: Don't Believe The Truth
Info: Liam and Noel's sixth album is preceded by the single "Lyla." 'Truth,' produced by Dave Sardy, represents the band's second attempt at recording this album; original sessions recorded with Death In Vegas in 2003 were scrapped.

Title: Banjo or Freakout
Info: The London-based producer, Alessio Natalizia’s project is dreamy and symphonic, with trip hop style drum beats and chill-out grooves.

Title: Head Carrier
Info: The sixth full-length release for the alternative rock band was produced by Tom Dalgety and is its first with bassist Paz Lenchantin as a full-time member.

Title: Cheek to Cheek
Info: The jazz standards release from Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga followed their collaboration on a track off Bennett's 2011 album, Duets II.

Title: Yell Fire!
Info: Pink and Sly & Robbie guest on the latest Spearhead offering, which was produced by Michael Franti with Mario Caldato Jr. (Beastie Boys) and mixes reggae, hip-hop and R&B.

Title: Working Girl
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British electro-pop artist features production from Com Truise, Patrick Lukens, Ariel Rechtshaid, Jas Shaw of Simian Mobile Disco, and MNDR's Pete Wade.

Title: Life Processes
Info: The sophomore release for the band from Leeds was produced by Matt Bayles.

Title: Fluorescence
Info: This is the fourth full-length studio album for the indie quartet.

Title: Talk That Talk
Info: The Barbados-born singer's sixth studio album features guest appearances by Calvin Harris and Jay-Z.

Title: Greendale
Info: Credited to Neil Young & Crazy Horse (expect electric rather than acoustic), this latest offering by the 57-year-old rocker is a 10-song concept album about the lives of the fictitious Green family.

Title: The Blueprint 2: The Gift & the Curse
Info: A sequel to his critically-acclaimed 2001 album 'The Blueprint,' Jay-Z's new two-disc set is all over the map in the course of 110 minutes and 25 tracks. The roster of producers and guests includes (but is by no means limited to): The Neptunes, Lenny Kravitz, Big Boi, Dr. Dre, Timbaland, Heavy D, Rakim, Beyonce Knowles, Faith Evans,  Notorious B.I.G. and Scarface.

Title: Big TV
Info: The changing dynamics of the relationship between a small town couple when they move to the big city is the concept behind the third full-length release for the British rock band led by Harry McVeigh.

Title: We Started Nothing
Info: The single "Shut Up and Let Me Go" from the debut album for the British duo was used in an Apple commercial.

Title: Lost Highway
Info: Nashville producer Dann Huff helmed Bon Jovi's first album-length stab at country-rock. LeAnn Rimes and Big & Rich guest.

Title: Caveman
Info: The second release for the New York indie band was produced by Nick Stumpf.

Title: Distortland
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the alternative rock band was recorded in Courtney Taylor's basement on cassette before being mixed by Jim Lowe.

Title: All Around Us
Info: The second full-length release for the Seattle artist was recorded in Iceland with producer Alex Somers.

Title: Reality Check
Info: The debut album for the French indie-pop trio based in London, England.

Title: True Romance
Info: The end of the British artist's four-year relationship was an influence on her fourth full-length release.

Title: Forever So
Info: The debut full-length album for the Australian folk quartet was produced by Noah Georgeson.

Title: Careless World: Rise of the Last King
Info: The second album for the Compton, California, rapper features guest appearances by Busta Rhymes, Nicki Minaj, Nas, Robin Thicke, and Wale.

Title: Poor Moon
Info: This is the debut full-length release from the side project of Fleet Foxes members Christian Wargo and Casey Wescott.

Title: Traps
Info: The third album for the indie pop band from Milwaukee (who previously were called Jail) was recorded in the basement of lead singer Vinnie Kircher.

Title: Portrait of an Ugly Man
Info: The third full-length release for the Minnesota emo band was produced by lead singer, Erik Paulson.

Title: Sinematic
Info: The first solo release from The Band guitarist since 2011's How To Become Clairvoyant was inspired in part by his work on the score for Martin Scorsese's The Irishman and features contributions from such artists as Doyle Bramhall II, Citizen Cope, Glen Hansard, DJ Howie B, Van Morrison, and Derek Trucks.

Title: Kubrick
Info: The second release for the British electronic duo is an instrumental album inspired by Stanley Kubrick's films.

Title: Rodeo
Info: The debut full-length studio release for Houston hip-hop artist features guest appearances from  2 Chainz, Justin Bieber, Chief Keef, Juicy J, Swae Lee, Quavo, Toro y Moi, The Weeknd, Kanye West, and Young Thug.

Title: Vicissitude
Info: The third full-length release from indie electronic artist James Chapman was self-recorded.

Title: Gordian
Info: This is the second full-length release for the Berlin-based Romanian techno producer.

Title: In Animal Tongue
Info: This is the third album for the Carla Bozulich-led project under the name Evangelista.

Title: The  Appeal: Georgia's Most Wanted
Info: The third studio release for the rapper features guest appearances by Bun B, Swizz Beatz, Ray J, Nicki Minaj, Pharrell, Wyclef Jean, and Estelle.

Title: No Guts. No Glory.
Info: The Australian rock band formed by brothers, Joel and Ryan O'Keeffe releases its second full-length studio album.

Title: Everything's The Rush
Info: The third album for the British four-piece group is their first on the Fiction label.

Title: Music Is My Savior
Info: This debut for New York rapper Shawn Mims--which includes his hit single "This Is Why I'm Hot"--was produced by Miami's Blackout Movement.

Title: The Emancipation Of Mimi
Info: The singer wrote many of the songs appearing on 'Mimi,' and even produced one cut, with the remainder of the production duties falling to Jermaine Dupri, the Neptunes and Kanye West. Also appearing are Nelly, Twista and Snoop Dogg.

Title: The Richest Man in Babylon
Info: The Washington D.C.-based production duo of Rob Garza and Eric Hilton are back with their third proper LP, following 2000's 'The Mirror Conspiracy.' Like its predessor, 'Babylon' is a multicultural mix of down-tempo instrumentals and vocal tracks, with Pam Bricker, Lou Lou, Notch, Emiliana Torrini, Sleepy Wonder and Shinehead providing the voices.

Title: Til The Casket Drops
Info: Pharrell Williams returns to produce (and also guest on) the rap duo's third album.

Title: My December
Info: The singer's third disc was produced by David Kahne and features an unlikely contribution on bass from Mike Watt (The Minutemen).

Title: AmeriKKKant
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the industrial metal band led by Al Jourgensen is its first without guitarist Mike Scaccia, who passed away in 2012.

Title: Where the Messengers Meet
Info: The Seattle indie rock quartet returns with its sophomore disc less than two years after debuting its self-titled album.

Title: Last Light
Info: The seventh album for the indie rock band.

Title: Blood Red Shoes
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British duo was self-produced and recorded in Berlin.

Title: Blue Film
Info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles artist Matthew Hemerlein was written and recorded while traveling between his parents house in Maryland, Nashville, Asia, and Europe.

Title: Battle Studies
Info: The singer-songwriter's latest album was co-produced with Steve Jordan.

Title: Lift Your Spirit
Info: The third full-length solo release for the retro-soul singer features production from DJ Khalil, Theron Feemster, Rock Mafia, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Introducing Joss Stone
Info: Despite the title, this is the third album for the young British soul singer. Raphael Saadiq produces, with Lauryn Hill and Common guesting.

Title: Yours to Discover
Info: The pop-influenced second solo release for the Death from Above 1979 drummer/singer is his first in five years.

Title: Rituals
Info: This is the full-length debut for the rock band formed by former M83 member Nicolas Fromageau.

Title: Ye
Info: The seven-track release from the rapper was streamed live from Wyoming and featured guest appearances from 070 Shake, DeJ Loaf, Jeremih, Kid Cudi, John Legend, Nicki Minaj, PARTYNEXTDOOR, Ty Dolla $ign, Valee and Charlie Wilson.

Title: Endless Wire
