Info: The legendary band's first studio album since 1982 includes a full version of their mini-opera "Wire & Glass," which was recently released (appropriately enough) as a mini-album.

Title: Simulation Theory
Info: The eighth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Rich Costey, Mike Elizondo, Shellback, and Timbaland. The deluxe and super deluxe editions feature alternate versions of several of the album's tracks.

Title: CCCLX
Info: The debut full-length release for the Montreal electronic producer features guest appearances from Syv De Blare, Denzel Curry, CJ Flemings, J.K. The Reaper, King Mez, Le1f, Mike Dean, Nell, Sophie, and Speng.

Title: Motorizer
Info: The British heavy metal band releases its latest album, produced with Cameron Webb.

Title: Thumbtacks and Glue
Info: The sixth full-length release from the Canadian folk-pop band led by Mark Andrew Hamilton was produced by Arran Fisher.

Title: Love Is a Four Letter Word
Info: The fourth album from the singer-songwriter was produced by Joe Chiccarelli.

Title: Songs of Experience
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the Irish rock band was delayed after recent political changes in the world caused the band to change it from being a planned companion album to the more personal Songs of Innocence to a more political one.

Title: Hitting The Ground
Info: The Violent Femmes' leader emerges with his very first solo release some 20 years after that band's formation. Here, Gano is joined by a star-studded cast that includes John Cale, They Might Be Giants, Mary Lou Lord, Lou Reed, Linda Perry, PJ Harvey and Frank Black.

Title: C'mon C'mon
Info: Sheryl Crow's fourth album features guest appearances from Emmylou Harris, Don Henley, Lenny Kravitz, Liz Phair and Stevie Nicks.

Title: Sound of a Woman
Info: The debut full-length release for Canadian artist features guest appearances from Mick Jenkins and Joey Bada$$.

Title: The Dangermen Sessions, Vol. 1
Info: The veteran "nutty" ska band's first album since their 1999 reunion disc 'Wonderful' is a collection of 13 covers, including their takes on classics "Lola" and "Israelites."

Title: Golden
Info: The 14th full-length studio release for the Australian pop artist features influences from country music, with three tracks recorded in Nashville and a guest appearance from Jack Savoretti.

Title: There's A Fire
Info: John Leckie produced this second major-label release for the now five-member New York band led by Steve Schiltz.

Title: Honey
Info: The third full-length release for the British pop singer  features guest appearances from such artists as Craig David, Floating Points, Four Tet, Geeneus, Kaytranada, Major Lazer, and Novelist.

Title: Some Loud Thunder
Info: Dave Fridmann produced the acclaimed indie band's second LP, which again is self-released in the U.S.

Title: Straight No Chaser
Info: The second album for the British singer was produced with Kanye West, who also appears as a guest artist.

Title: Do The Bambi
Info: This is the first Kill Rock Stars release for the Berlin-based pop duo of Francoise Cactus and Brezel Goring.

Title: Scatter the Rats
Info: The first studio release in 20 years for the Los Angeles grunge/punk band was produced by Norm Block and Nick Launay.

Title: Chroma
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Purpose
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Canadian pop singer features guest appearances from Big Sean, Diplo, Halsey, Travis Scott, and Skrillex.

Title: Gardens & Villa
Info: The debut album for the Santa Barbara-based indie pop band was produced by Richard Swift.

Title: Teenage Emotions
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from Diplo, Evander Griiim, Grace, Migos, Stefflon Don, and YG.

Title: Heavy Blanket
Info: J Mascis formed the band in high school with Pete Cougar and Johnny Pancake, however due to unfortunate circumstances they did not record together until reunited in 2011.

Title: Erotic Reruns
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Brooklyn experimental rock band the was self-recorded and produced.

Title: Black Acetate
Info: A bit more rock-oriented than its predecessor, 'Acetate' is nevertheless another experimental effort from the now-63-year-old Cale.

Title: Detour
Info: The pop singer-songwriter covers country songs for her 11th full-length studio release with guest appearances from Vince Gill, Emmylou Harris, Jewel, Alison Krauss, and Willie Nelson.

Title: It's About Time
Info: The first Chic album in over 25 years features guest appearances from Cosha, Craig David, Danny L Harle, Lady Gaga, LunchMoney Lewis, Vic Mensa, Mura Masa, NAO, Philippe Saisse, Emeli Sandé, Hailee Steinfeld, and Stefflon Don.

Title: Drift
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Brooklyn post-punk band was recorded with Travis Harrison.

Title: Revolutions
Info: The roster of guests for the turntablists' fourth LP includes Cypress Hill, dead prez, Ghostface Killah, Black Thought (The Roots), Slug (Atmosphere) and Blue Man Group.

Title: Printz
Info: This U.S. debut disc for the genre-mashing Australian brother-sister duo of Chris and Vila Colonna (who appended the "81" to their name to avoid conflicts with a similarly-named children's music band) combines tracks from their EP "White Printz" and their UK single "Red Printz."
Album number five finds the singer-songwriter seemingly entering an early mid-life crisis, as she dives headfirst into commercial teen-dance-pop territory.

Title: Red Letter Days
Info: The fourth album from Jakob Dylan & Co. includes lead single "When You're on Top" and a bonus cover of Elvis Costello's "(What's So Funny 'bout) Peace, Love & Understanding." Long-time guitarist Michael Ward has left the group, leaving room for Pearl Jam's Mike McCready to provide some of the lead guitar on the album.

Title: We Are A & C
Info: The third U.S. release for the eclectic Amsterdam-based duo (following 2001's import-only release 'Sound Shopping') contains 14 equally eclectic tunes, including highlights "Dirty Robot" and "5th Dimension."

Title: We Are Young Money
Info: The collaboration project from Lil Wayne features Drake, Guycci Mane, Lloyd, Tyga, Shanell, Birdman, Shawt Dawg, Nicki Minaj, T-Streets,  Lil' Chuckee, Lil' Twist, Jae Millz, Gudda Gudda, and Mack Maine.

Title: Wasteland, Baby!
Info: Te second full-length release for the Irish singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Mavis Staples.

Title: Everybody's Dying To Meet You
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie pop trio was produced by Brian O'Shaughnessy.

Title: Dark Black Makeup
Info: The debut full-length release for the punk trio of brothers from Missouri was produced by Ross Orton.

Title: Galapagos
Info: This is the second release for the British rock band led by Simon Critten.

Title: Kiss
Info: The second studio album from the Canadian vocalist features Justin Bieber and Owl City.

Title: Forget Tomorrow
Info: You wouldn't know it from their album covers, or their music, but this indie-rock four-piece hails from Athens, Georgia, not Tokyo. 'Tomorrow' is their third full-length and first in five years (four, if you include their collaboration with Bedhead).

Title: Yesterday Was Forever
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was funded from a Kickstarter campaign.

Title: Purple Noon
Info: The fourth full-length release for Atlanta-based chillwave producer Ernest Greene was mixed by Ben H. Allen.

Title: Rewolf
Info: The fourth full-length album for the New York City-based band features reworkings of some of its previously released songs.

Title: Didn't It Rain
Info: Joe Henry returns as producer for the second jazz/blues release for actor-singer Hugh Laurie.

Title: Hands All Over
Info: In 2008, Maroon 5 released a remix album with the help of several different DJs and producers. The group then spent most of the following two years working with a different producer -- famous rock/country-pop architect Robert John "Mutt" Lange -- on Hands All Over, which marked the band's third studio offering of rhythmic, soulful pop songs.

Title: Chuck
Info: The Canadian punk-pop outfit returns with a fourth LP, produced by Greig Nori. The disc is named after a UN worker (Chuck Pelletier) who helped the band escape violence in the Congo while they were there shooting a film.

Title: Amerikaz Nightmare
Info: The duo of Prodigy and Havoc are assisted by guests such as 50 Cent, Nate Dogg, R. Kelly, Jadakiss and Nelly on this disc co-produced by The Alchemist.

Title: Vehicles & Animals
Info: This debut disc for the South London, England quartet (originally released in the UK in 2003) was produced by Victor Van Vugt (Beth Orton) and gained a Mercury Music Prize nomination.

Title: Let It Rain
Info: On her sixth studio album, the singer-songwriter works with producer John Parish (PJ Harvey) for the first time.

Title: The Age Of Miracles
Info: The latest album for the Grammy-winning singer-songwriter features Vince Gill and Alison Krauss as guest singers.

Title: Funny Looking Angels
Info: The Editors lead singer Tom Smith and former Razorlight drummer Andy Burrows team up to release an album of classic and original Christmas songs.

Title: Here We Go Again: Celebrating the Genius of Ray Charles
Info: Willie Nelson and Wynton Marsalis return to work together on this Ray Charles tribute with Norah Jones recorded in February 2009 at the Rose Theater.

Title: The Bright Lights Of America
Info: The ninth album for the quartet from Pittsburg, Pa., was produced by Tony Visconti.

Title: Breathing Statues
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn trio-turned duo of Isaac Emmanuel and Melati Malaywas was recorded while on tour.

Title: Beat The Devil's Tattoo
Info: With new drummer Leah Shapiro (who replaced Nick Jago), the rock band from San Francisco works to mix its rock side with the country/acoustic sound it revealed in 2005's Howl.

Title: As U Were
Info: The latest album for the Bay area hip-hop artist features guest appearances by Lateet, Sam Sparro, Joyo Velarde, Trackademicks, Clyde Carson, The Gift, and Francis and the Lights.

Title: Julian Plenti Is... Skyscraper
Info: Interpol's Paul Banks releases his debut solo album under the name Julian Plenti.

Title: Version
Info: The second artist album from the acclaimed DJ and producer (Amy Winehouse, Lily Allen) is filled with covers, as Ronson takes on works by artists as diverse as Radiohead, The Smiths, Britney Spears, Coldplay and Ryan Adams. Both Winehouse and Allen guest, along with Robbie Williams, Phantom Planet and Kasabian.
This is the fourth LP for the underground rap trio of Evidence, Rakaa and DJ Babu.

Title: Through the Night
Info: Ren Harvieu is the latest British singer to release a debut album influenced by the sounds of the 1960s.

Title: LP
Info: Vampire Weekend's Rostam Batmanglij and Ra Ra Riot's Wes Miles team up to release their first album together.

Title: Wildflower
Info: This is the singer's first album in three years.

Title: Only By The Night
Info: The fourth album for the rock band from Tennessee was produced by Angelo Petraglia and Jacquire King.

Title: All Delighted People EP
Info: Before the October 12th release of Sufjan Steven's full length album The Age of Adz, the artist released this eight-track EP as a digital download.

Title: Songs for Our Mothers
Info: Drugs, murder, and abusive relationships are some of the dark subjects of the second full-length release from the British band.

Title: The Devil You Know
Info: The members of Black Sabbath (without Ozzy Osboune) return as Heaven & Hell to release its first album under the name.

Title: I'm with You
Info: The California rock band releases their 10th album produced by Rick Rubin and the first since 2006 and with new guitarist Josh Klinghoffer, who replaced John Frusciante.

Title: Stranger
Info: The third full-length studio release for the Swedish rapper was recorded in Miami and was produced by Yung Gud, Yung Sherman and White Armour.

Title: Say Yes!: A Tribute to Elliott Smith
Info: The latest tribute release to the singer-songwriter features covers of his songs by such artists as Julien Baker, Lou Barlow, Tanya Donelly, William Fitzsimmons, Swervedriver's Adam Franklin, Juliana Hatfield, Jesu/Sun Kil Moon, J. Mascis, Amanda Palmer, Wild Sun, Waxahatchee, and Yuck.

Title: Glow & Behold
Info: The British indie rock band returns as a trio for its second studio release after lead singer Daniel Blumberg left the band to pursue his own music.

Title: VII
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Portland, Oregon-based experimental folk band is its first on the Vagrant label.

Title: The Curse Of Blondie
Info: 'Curse' marks the eighth studio album for Deborah Harry & co., and their first since their 1999 comeback effort 'No Exit.'

Title: The Fire Theft
Info: Former Sunny Day Real Estate members Jeremy Enigk, William Goldsmith and Nate Mendel make their debut as The Fire Theft with this 13-track disc, co-produced by Brad Wood.

Title: Learning From Falling
Info: Who is Lamya? Born in Africa, educated in England, and later residing in the U.S., she is a classically-trained opera singer who embarked on a pop career, first serving as lead vocalist for Soul II Soul and later as a backup singer for Duran Duran and David Bowie. For this solo debut, she wrote, produced, and composed each of the 12 tracks.

Title: Satan's Circus
Info: The duo's fourth album departs from previous outings, taking an all-instrumental (and guitar-free) approach rather than relying on guest vocalists. Think Kraftwerk and you won't be too far off.

Title: Yes, It's True
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the indie choral pop band Tim DeLaughter was co-produced with Eric Drew Feldman and Tim Palmer.

Title: Fly Yellow Moon
Info: The debut album for the Guillemots singer-songwriter was produced by Adam Noble .

Title: Sun, Sun, Sun
Info: Rilo Kiley's Blake Sennett returns with a sophomore set for his side project, The Elected. Contributors include members of Eisley and Bright Eyes, as well as Rilo Kiley bandmate Jenny Lewis.

Title: Double Up
Info: Apparently no longer trapped in the closet, the crooner enlists Young Jeezy, Snoop Dogg, Ludacris and T.I. to help enliven this upbeat successor to 2005's 'TP.3 Reloaded.'

Title: The Glass Passenger
Info: The sophomore album for the rock band started by Something Corporate's Andrew McMahon.

Title: Global Warming
Info: Christina Aguilera, Chris Brown, Enrique Iglesias, Jennifer Lopez, The Wanted, and Usher are some of the guests on the seventh studio album for the Miami rapper.

Title: Recovery
Info: Eminem continues his forward momentum with confrontational, angst-ridden rap that digs deep into the psyche on his new album.

Title: Stand Up
Info: 'Stand Up' is the band's first studio album in three years and finds them working for the first time with producer Mark Baston (50 Cent, Beyonce).

Title: Keep the Village Alive
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Welsh alternative rock band led by Kelly Jones was produced with Jim Lowe.

Title: There Is a Way
Info: The second album for the Scottish rock band was produced by Ross Robinson.

Title: Eat Me, Drink Me
Info: Album number six is the first new release in four years for the shock-rocker, who recorded the disc with guitarist Tim Skold.

Title: TLC
Info: The first album for the R&B group in 15 years features the two surviving members: Tionne “T-Boz” Watkins and Rozonda “Chilli” Thomas, and a guest appearance from Snoop Dogg.

Title: X
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Jhené Aiko, Akon, Brandy, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne R. Kelly, Rick Ross, Trey Songz, Tyga, and Usher.

Title: Saturday Nights & Sunday Mornings
Info: The fifth album is split in two parts, with one half produced by Gil Norton and the other half by Brian Deck.

Title: Dip
Info: L(ucky) Pierre is the alter-ego of former Arab Strap member Aidan Moffat, and the cinematic, instrumental 'Dip' was recorded shortly before that band's breakup.

Title: Be As You Are (Songs From An Old Blue Chair)
Info: The country singer's latest is a bit of a departure, taking the form of a concept album about, well, relaxing on a Caribbean beach.

Title: I Am Gemini
Info: Matt Bayles produced the concept album for the rock band led by Tim Kasher, about two twins, one evil and the other good, who are separated at birth and reunited.

Title: Evanescence
Info: Nick Raskulinecz produced the third album for the rock band that sees only singer Amy Lee as the remaining original member.

Title: Laws of Illusion
Info: Continually redefining herself in the realm of folk-pop singer/songwriters, McLachlan's latest delivery after seven years is filled with thoughtful lyrics and impassioned vocal harmonies, making the album worth the wait.

Title: Donkey
Info: The sophomore album for the Brazilian indie-rock band was produced by band member Adriano Cintra.

Title: Fated
Info: The third solo release for Los Angeles producer Jason Chung features guest appearances from Chance the Rapper, Maceo Haymes, and Whoarei.

Title: Fever
Info: Don Gilmore produced the third album for the Welsh heavy-metal band.

Title: Everything Is Borrowed
Info: Mike Skinner has said this fourth album would be his second-to-last album as The Streets.

Title: Isles
Info: Reggae and pop come together on the debut release from the Chicago-based brother-and-sister duo of Natalie and Elliot Bergman.

Title: Not Your Kind of People
Info: The fifth studio album for Garbage is its first release in over seven years.

Title: Time
Info: The first album of original songs written by the British rock singer  was inspired after completing and publishing his autobiography in 2012.

Title: Heirs
Artist: And So I Watch You from Afar
Info: This is the fourth full-length release for the Belfast post-rock quartet.

Title: Ludaversal
Info: The first studio release for the rapper/actor since 2010 features guest appearances from Jason Aldean, Big K.R.I.T., CeeLo Green, John Legend, Miguel, Monica, Rick Ross, and Usher.

Title: Re-Mit
Info: This is the 30th studio release for the British post-punk band led by Mark E. Smith.

Title: Higher Than The Eiffel
Info: After scrapping some previous tracks, the electronic duo sat down and finished fourteen fresh tracks in six months for the band's first release in five years.

Title: Dive Deep
Info: The English band continues without Skye Edwards, who was asked to leave the group, with several artists taking turns on lead vocals.

Title: Pocket Symphony
Info: Nigel Godrich produced this latest set from the French duo, who are joined by guest vocalists Jarvis Cocker (Pulp) and Neil Hannon (Divine Comedy).

Title: All The Roadrunning
Info: The dozen tracks (ten written by Knopfler, two by Harris) on the pair's first collaboration were recorded over a seven-year span.

Title: Laws Of Illusion
Info: Continually redefining herself in the realm of folk-pop singer/songwriters, McLachlan's latest delivery after seven years is filled with thoughtful lyrics and impassioned vocal harmonies, making the album worth the wait.

Title: The Great Gatsby [Music from Baz Luhrmann's Film]
Info: Overseen by Jay-Z, the soundtrack to Baz Luhrmann's adaptation of F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel features original songs from Fergie, Florence and the Machine, Gotye, Jay-Z, Nero, Sia, will.i.am, and The xx. It also includes covers of Amy Winehouse's "Back To Black" performed by Beyoncé and Andre 3000; Lana Del Rey's "Young and Beautiful" performed by Bryan Ferry; Beyoncé's "Crazy In Love" performed by Emeli Sandé; and "U2's "Love IS Blindness" performed by Jack White.

Title: Gemini
Info: The second solo release for the Seattle rapper features guest appearances from  Abir, Dan Caplen, Dave B, Skylar Grey, Kesha, King Draino, Lil Yachty, Donna Missal, Eric Nally, Offset, Reignwolf, Saint Claire, Otieno Terry, Travis Thompson, and Xperience.

Title: Flaws
Info: Covers of John Martyn's Fairytale Lullaby and Joanna Newsom's Swansea are included in the British band's acoustic second album.

Title: Unleashed
Info: Oklahoma's Toby Keith returns with 12 new tracks, including a duet with Willie Nelson.

Title: Music Of The Spheres
Info: Former Stone Roses frontman Ian Brown returns with his third solo album, following 2000's 'Golden Greats.' The first single is "F.E.A.R."

Title: Maybach Music Group Presents: Self Made, Vol. 1
Info: The debut release from Rick Ross' new label features Meek Mill, Pill, Teedra Moses, and Wale.

Title: Whispers
Info: The sixth release for the British singer-songwriter Mike Rosenberg was produced by Chris Vallejo.

Title: Dangerously In Love
Info: This is the solo debut for former Destiny's Child member Beyonce Knowles.

Title: HITnRUN: Phase Two
Info: Released on Tidal, the surprise album features songs he recorded in analog over a period of four years. [CD release: 29 Jan 2016]

Title: The  Weight's on the Wheels
Info: The Canadian band that began as a solo project for Matthew Hart releases its fourth full length album.

Title: The Cross Of My Calling
Info: The fifth studio album for the Swedish rock band was produced by Rick Rubin.

Title: Beneath the Skin
Info: The second full-length release for the Icelandic folk rock band was produced with Rich Costey.

Title: The Ark Work
Info: This is the third full-length release for the Brooklyn self-described transcendental black metal quartet.

Title: Hubba Bubba
Info: This is the debut solo release for the solo electronic pop project of Thee Oh Sees' John Dwyer.

Title: W:/2016ALBUM/
Info: The Canadian electronic producer admitted on Twitter he had a love/hate thing for his eighth full-length studio release that features a guest appearance from Grabbitz.

Title: The Unforgiving
Info: The fifth album for the Dutch metal band was released in conjunction with a comic book and short films that illustrate the story within the concept album.

Title: Falcon
Info: The follow-up to the band's gold album "St. Jude" was produced by Ed Buller.

Title: All Years Leaving
Info: This debut LP for the Liverpool band was released in the U.K. in early 2004 and made its way to the States a year later.

Title: Strangest Things
Info: 'Strangest Things' is the second album, and first for a major label, for Longwave, who got their big break opening for fellow New Yorkers the Strokes (although their sound veers much closer to that of 80s-influenced Interpol than the neo-garage of the Strokes). Dave Fridmann produces.

Title: Under The Iron Sea
Info: Album number two for the stadium-friendly, piano-led British trio follows two years after the unexpected mega-success of their debut 'Hopes And Fears.'

Title: Lovers Rock
Info: This is the eighth full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band led by Murray Lightburn and Natalia Yanchak.

Title: Battlefield
Info: The sophomore album for the American Idol winner was produced by Ryan Tedder.

Title: Instant O In The Universe [EP]
Info: This five-song EP represents the first new studio material for the once prolific English band in two years (and first since the death of longtime member Mary Hansen). A new LP awaits in early 2004.

Title: Between The Senses
Info: This debut album for the British quartet was produced by The Smiths' Johnny Marr.

Title: Date Of Birth
Info: Brooklyn underground rappers the Arsonists are back with their self-produced second album, following their 1999 debut "As The World Burns," which was also on indie-rock label Matador. The group is now a trio, following the departures of Freestyle and D-Story.

Title: Pelo
Info: The Chicago group's fourth full-length was produced by John Herndon (Tortoise, Isotope 217).

Title: Skeletons
Info: The rock band formed by two (barely) teenaged siblings releases its second album.

Title: As I Call You Down
Info: The debut release for the supergroup includes Ben Harper, Joseph Arthur, and George Harrison's son, Dhani Harrison, as well as nine acoustic tracks.

Title: Cee Lo's Magic Moment
Info: The pop-soul singer and since 2011, vocal coach/judge on NBC's The Voice releases a Christmas album featuring Christina Aguilera, The Muppets, Straight No Chaser, Rod Stewart, and Trombone Shorty as guest singers.

Title: Last Night
Info: The latest album for the electronic artist includes an appearance by MC Grandmaster Caz of "Rapper's Delight" fame.

Title: Runddans
Info: The debut collaboration between Todd Rundgren, Hans-Peter Lindstrom and Emil Nikolaisen was recorded in Norway.

Title: Hellbilly Deluxe II
Info: Produced by Zombie himself, Hellbilly Deluxe 2 is a follow-up to his 1998 debut solo effort called Hellbilly Deluxe.

Title: Flavors Of Entanglement
Info: The Canadian singer releases her latest album, produced by Guy Sigsworth.

Title: Time To Die
Info: The third album for the rock band was produced by Phil Ek.

Title: Paper Tigers
Info: The Swedish power-pop band's fourth album includes a remixed version of "Jerk It Out," better known as "that song in the iPod Shuffle commercial."

Title: Drones
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the British alternative rock band was produced with Robert John "Mutt" Lange.

Title: Rehearsing My Choir
Info: Siblings Matt and Eleanor Friedberger are joined by their 83-year-old grandmother (!) on their latest eclectic release.

Title: Times Infinity, Vol. 2
Info: The follow-up to 2015's Vol. 1 for the Montreal band was from the same recorded session as the previous album.

Title: Living Fields
Info: Portico Quartet becomes a trio named Portico on this release that features guest appearances from Alt-J's Joe Newman, Jono McCleery and Jamie Woon.

Title: Youth
Info: The debut release for the Nashville-via-Brooklyn five-piece band led by Keegan DeWitt was self-released in the UK in 2012.

Title: Apocalyptic Love
Info: The second solo album from Slash features Myles Kennedy of Alter Bridge on vocals and was produced by Eric Valentine.

Title: Beaus$eros
Info: The Los Angeles rapper's latest album is his first on FakeFour Inc. and is self-described as avant-garde.

Title: Work (Work, Work)
Info: The London-based duo completed its second album after the death of its bassist.

Title: Red River Blue
Info: The country crooner, and judge/coach on NBC's The Voice, releases his latest album.

Title: Nightmare
Info: Following the unexpected death of drummer Jimmy Sullivan, the metal band's latest release is a reflection on death and despair that fits the menacing mood, which has shaped its sound over the years.

Title: All The Plans
Info: The fourth album for the British rock band was produced by Steven Osbourne.

Title: Walking Cloud And Deep Red Sky, Flag Fluttered And The Sun Shined
Info: This third album from the Japanese instrumental post-rock outfit was recorded by Steve Albini.

Title: Fear Yourself
Info: The latest release from the prolific indie-rocker and artist was recorded with Sparklehorse's Mark Linkous.

Title: White Noise
Info: This second album for the Manchester (by way of  Germay) electronica/Krautrock duo features guest vocals from Brian Molko (Placebo).

Title: The Ragpicker's Dream
Info: This is the third (non-soundtrack) solo album for the Dire Straits leader, and finds him in a somewhat acoustic, American roots style.

Title: Get Hurt
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the New Jersey rock band was produced by Mike Crossey.

Title: Radioactive
Info: Yelawolf's debut album on Eminem's record label features Kid Rock, Gangsta Boo, and Lil John.

Title: Beacon
Info: The second release for the Northern Irish indie rock trio was produced by Jacknife Lee.

Title: Kisses on the Bottom
Info: Eric Clapton, Stevie Wonder, and Diana Krall contributed to Paul McCartney's collection of classic vocal standards produced by Tommy LiPuma.

Title: Heavy Mood
Info: The Omaha, Nebraska indie pop band returns with a more rock oriented sound for its fourth release.

Title: Kids in the Street
Info: The fourth album for the alternative rock band from Oklahoma was produced by Greg Wells.

Title: Complete Me
Info: Vincent Frank's debut album was coproduced with Stuart Price.

Title: Divide
Info: The third full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features songs co-written with such artists as Steve Mac, Ryan Tedder and Jessie Ware.

Title: The Outsider
Info: Following acclaimed, sample-driven efforts 'Endtroducing' and 'The Private Press,' 'The Outsider' detours DJ Shadow into more conventional hip-hop, with rappers such as David Banner and Q-Tip guesting.

Title: All Visible Objects
Info: The latest full-length release for the electronic artist features contributions from Apollo Jane, Boogie, Mindy Jones, Linton Kwesi Johnson, and Dead Kennedys drummer D.H. Peligro.

Title: Sebastien Grainger & The Mountains
Info: Sebastien Grainger, the Ex-Death from Above 1979 singer/drummer, releases his debut solo album.

Title: Nothing
Info: N.E.R.D.'s fourth album takes a new direction by adding psychedelic rock influences to their mad-scientist mix of hip-hop, along with the addition of a new female vocalist to the original Virginia trio.

Title: Where Wilderness Grows
Info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Felix Bush was produced by Neil Comber and features a guest appearance by Wolf Alice's Ellie Rowsell.

Title: Kiss the Ring
Info: DJ Khaled's sixth album features appearances from 2 Chainz, Ace Hood, Big K.R.I.T., Big Sean, Birdman, Chris Brown, J. Cole, DJ Premier, French Montana, Future, Jadakiss, Kirko Bangz, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne, Mack Maine, Mavado, Meek Mill, Nicki Minaj, Nas, Plies, Rick Ross, Scarface, T.I., T-Pain, Tyga, Wale, Kanye West, and Wiz Khalifa.

Title: 24 Hours
Info: The first album of new material in more than 15 years in the US for the Welsh singer was produced by Future Cut.

Title: Paper Walls
Info: Yellowcard's follow-up to 2006's "Lights and Sounds," again produced by Neal Avron.

Title: Live From Rome
Info: Nope, it's neither of those things. The anticon rapper's third LP is a studio recording from the East Bay, with Odd Nosdam providing the beats.

Title: MPLSound
Info: After releasing Planet Earth for free in the United Kingdom, the singer-songwriter's three albums (one by new artist Bria Valente) are packaged together as a Target store exclusive in the United States. As the title implies, it contains some of the funk rock sounds he created.

Title: Monsoon
Info: The band's sophomore disc includes guest appearances by Wilco and Scott McCaughey (Minus 5).

Title: Goddess In The Doorway
Info: Guests on the Rolling Stones frontman's fourth solo album include Bono, Lenny Kravitz, Wyclef Jean, Pete Townshend, Rob Thomas, and Joe Perry.

Title: Morning View
Info: The Los Angeles-based funk-metal band returns with a follow-up to 1999's 'Make Yourself.' Scott Litt (R.E.M.) returns as producer.

Title: Dark End Of The Street [EP]
Info: The EP contains six songs from the "Jukebox" recording sessions.

Title: Finally Rich
Info: The debut full-length studio album for the Chicago rapper includes guest appearances from such artist as 50 Cent, French Montana, Lil Reese, Rick Ross, Wiz Khalifa, and Young Jeezy.

Title: Dead
Info: The British noise-rock band had artists as Andy Bell, Factory Floor, Hookworms and Mogwai's Stuart Braithwaite remix its 2015 debut release, Dying.

Title: Stronger
Info: The first American Idol winner returns with her fifth album.

Title: Crazy Clown Time
Info: Film director David Lynch releases a solo album of electro-pop featuring Karen O of the Yeah Yeah Yeahs as a guest singer on one track.

Title: Earth Sound System
Info: The Portland art rockers release their latest album of improvisational, experimental space-y jams.

Title: When The Deer Wore Blue
Info: Jeremy Lemos worked on the third album for the Denmark band.

Title: Born to Die
Info: The full-length debut for the New York singer features the single Video Games, which appeared on the CW TV series Ringer.

Title: Ersatz G.B.
Info: This is the latest album for the British post-punk band led by Mark E. Smith.

Title: Glowing Mouth
Info: This is the debut full-length album for the Brooklyn-based band led by Kyle Wilson.

Title: Karmacode
Info: The Italian goth-metal outfit fronted by Cristina Scabbia attempts to make it big in the U.S. with this fourth album.

Title: Sugar
Info: The second full-length album for the Athens, Georgia-based alternative rock band was produced by John Agnello and features Dinosaur Jr.'s J. Mascis as a guest artist.

Title: Feel That Fire
Info: The Arizona country singer releases his fourth studio album with Capitol Nashville.

Title: Let's Bottle Bohemia
Info: Disc #2 for the Irish band was produced by Dave Sardy (Marilyn Manson), with Peter Buck and Van Dyke Parks helping on a track apiece.

Title: The Looks
Info: This is the full-length debut for the new duo of Death From Above 1979's Jesse Keeler and that band's producer, Al-P.

Title: Quiero Creedence
Info: The Latin tribute album to Creedence Clearwater Revival features songs covered by such artists as Enrique Bunbury, Andres Calamaro, El Tri, Juan Gabriel, Los Lobos, Los Lonely Boys, Ozomatli, ZZ Top's Billy Gibbons and La Santa Cecilia's La Marisol.

Title: Lip Lock
Info: The hip hop artist's first studio release since 2002's Eve-Olution includes guest appearances from Missy Elliott, Juicy J, Chrisette Michele, Pusha T, Dawn Richard, and Gabe Saporta from Cobra Starship.

Title: From the Top of Willamette Mountain
Info: The third release for the folk singer was produced by Richard Swift.

Title: Christmas In The Heart
Info: This is the first Christmas album for the singer and proceeds will be donated to the charities, Feeding America, The World Food Programme, and Crisis UK.

Title: Big
Info: The soul singer's first album in four years includes production work from will.i.am and Justin Timberlake and appearances by Fergie, Nas and Natalie Cole.

Title: Three's Co.
Info: The Los Angeles-based California-rock outfit led by Darren and Ann Do Rademaker returns with a third album.

Title: Auf Der Maur
Info: This is the solo debut for Melissa Auf der Maur, who served as bassist for both Smashing Pumpkins and Hole. Chris Goss produced the disc, which also features appearances from Josh Homme (Queens of the Stone Age), Brant Bjork (Kyuss) and James Iha (Smashing Pumpkins).

Title: Lucky Day
Info: Second only to Bob Marley in number of total reggae albums sold, international superstar Shaggy returns with his second album for MCA.

Title: Believe
Info: The Chicago alt-metal band follows their 2 million-selling debut, 'The Sickness,' with this sophomore effort, working once again with producer Johnny Z.

Title: TA
Info: The ever-changing Washington D.C. outfit dives completely into the realm of 80s-style electro-synth pop (complete with vocals) for this, their sixth album.

Title: Baby
Info: The debut album for the British rock quartet from Camden shows influences from The Pixies, Britpop, and '90s alternative rock.

Title: Bittersweet World
Info: Jessica Simpson's younger sister releases her third album produced by Timberland, The Neptunes' Chad Hugo, Kenna, and Jack Joseph Puig.

Title: The Portrait Is Finished & I Have Failed To Capture Your Beauty...
Info: The debut album for Dan Bejar's other side project (Destroyer being the first) with his girlfriend, Sydney Vermont.

Title: ...And Star Power
Info: The third full-length studio release for the California psych rock band formed by Sam France and Jonathan Rado features contributions from such artist as Wayne Coyne, Of Montreal’s Kevin Barnes, Tim Presley of White Fence, and Bleached.

Title: Speak Your Mind
Info: The debut full-length release for the British pop artist features a guest appearance from Marshmello.

Title: Mumps, Etc.
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie quartet was recorded on  tape before being mixed by Graham Marsh and Yoni Wolf.

Title: There Are Rules
Info: The Missouri band that helped put emo on the map in the mid-'90s is back with its fifth studio album of its distinctive, emotionally driven rock sound.

Title: Mr. Impossible
Info: The Brooklyn experimental rock trio releases its sixth studio album.

Title: Selling My Soul
Info: The third solo release for the Wu-Tang Clan member features guest appearances from Kurupt and Ol' Dirty Bastard (posthumously).
The fifth full-length release for the British indie rock band includes a near seven-minute track.

Title: Abnormally Attracted To Sin
Info: The latest release for the singer-songwriter is her first independent album after ending her contract with Epic Records.

Title: Blitzkrieg Pop
Info: Berlin-based noiseman Marco Haas' third album as T Raumschmiere features vocals by Ellen Allien.

Title: Beautiful Trauma
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the pop artist features a guest appearance by Eminem.

Title: Stranger Things
Info: The third full-length release for the indie rock band and its second since lead singer Daniel Blumberg left in 2013 was self-produced.

Title: Symphonicities
Info: A companion CD to Sting's 2010 world tour, this album pairs the artist's greatest hits with new symphonic arrangements. Multiple conductors lend their help to the project, which also includes orchestral versions of Police songs.

Title: More!
Info: The electronic duo from Germany release their fourth studio album.

Title: Smoke & Mirrors
Info: The New Zealand rock band returns with a third album.

Title: Giving Up The Ghost
Info: The four-piece post-rock outfit now based in Philadelphia continue to fill out their sound on this follow-up to 'We Fight Til Death.'

Title: Love Lust Faith + Dreams
Info: The fourth full-length release for the rock band led by Jared Leto was co-produced with Steve Lillywhite.

Title: The Less You Know, The Better
Info: The fourth studio album for the hip hop producer/electronic artist features guest appearances by Afrikan Boy, Posdnuos, Talib Kweli, Tom Vek, and Yukimi Nagano of Little Dragons.

Title: This Is What the Truth Feels Like
Info: The third full-length solo studio release for the pop singer features a guest appearance from Fetty Wap and production from Greg Kurstin, Mattman & Robin, JR Rotem and Stargate.

Title: Devil's Music
Info: The Swedish band releases its sixth album of electro-punk, featuring such guest artists as Cee Lo and the B-52s.

Title: This Is Hope
Info: Colin McIntyre returns with his third album in as many years, like its predecessors a bit, well, strange.

Title: Body Language
Info: The dance-pop diva, still going strong at 35, returns with a new album.

Title: Birth Of A Prince
Info: The Wu-Tang producer returns to his RZA moniker with this latest solo release, after two previous albums under the "Bobby Digital" name.

Title: Meteora
Info: This long-awaited follow-up to 2000's 'Hybrid Theory' contains 12 new tracks co-produced by Don Gilmore.

Title: Tweekend
Info: This long-awaited follow-up to the Los Angeles alternative-electronica band's 1997 debut, 'Vegas,' features guest appearances from members of Rage Against The Machine and Stone Temple Pilots as well as Jon Brion.

Title: We're All Somebody from Somewhere
Info: The Aerosmith frontman goes country on his first solo release features production from T Bone Burnett, Dan Huff, Marti Frederiksen, Cadillac Three’s Jaren Johnston as well as a cover of "Janie's Got a Gun."

Title: Sexor
Info: This debut artist album from the veteran Montreal-based DJ includes a cover of Talking Heads' "Burning Down The House."

Title: Ripe
Info: The Australian singer's sixth album features a duet with Mandy Moore.

Title: Kratitude
Info: This is the second album for the trio of Brian Chase (Yeah Yeah Yeahs), Zach Max (Ex Models) and Jeannie Kwon.

Title: Too Much Information
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British rock band led by Paul Smith was self-produced with additional production from The Invisible’s Dave Okumu and from Field Music’s David and Peter Brewis.

Title: If Songs Could Be Held
Info: This is the third album for the Seattle-based singer-songwriter. Ed Harcourt guests on one track.

Title: Justice
Info: The sixth full-length release for the pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from BEAM, benny blanco, Burna Boy, Chance The Rapper, Daniel Caesar, Giveon, Dominic Fike, Khalid, and The Kid LAROI.

Title: Up To Now
Info: The two-disc compilation album features three new tracks.

Title: Feed Me Diamonds
Info: The debut full-length release for Amanda Warner was produced by Peter Wade.

Title: Ripples
Info: The seventh full-length solo release for the former The Stone Roses frontman was self-produced.

Title: Beautiful Imperfection
Info: The soulful singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist releases her sophomore album.

Title: Killer Sounds
Info: The third studio album for the British indie rock band was coproduced by lead singer Richard Archer with Grey Kurstin, Alan Moulder, and Stuart Price.

Title: Listening Tree
Info: The third album for the English electronica artist and producer.

Title: Haiku from Zero
Info: The fifth full-length release for the indie electronic band led by Dan Whitford was produced by Ben Allen.

Title: Suit
Info: Think of 'Suit' as 'The Love Below' to 'Sweat's 'Speakerboxxx.' Where 'Sweat' is the more party-oriented of the two discs simultaneously released by Nelly, 'Suit' showcases the rapper's gentler side, and includes collaborations with Snoop Dogg, Tim McGraw (!), Mase and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Audioslave
Info: After frontman Zack de la Rocha left Rage Against the Machine in 2000, the remaining members of that Los Angeles band enlisted former Soundgarden leader Chris Cornell, and together they formed Audioslave. This is their debut release.

Title: I'm Lonely (And I Love It) [EP]
Info: A five-track EP from the band featuring Christopher Ewen and the Magnetic Fields' Stephin Merritt and Claudia Gonson. Like all previous FBH releases, it features a mix of the song "Hopeless."

Title: Happiness Ltd.
Info: The Canadian band's third studio album.

Title: How Does It Feel
Info: The second full-length release for the indie pop duo of Lizzy Plapinger and Max Hershen was recorded in Los Angeles and New York.

Title: Freedom of Speech
Info: This is the follow-up to her 2009 Mercury Music Prize-winning self-titled debut album.

Title: Ibifornia
Info: The first new studio release in nearly a decade for the French house duo features guest appearances from the Beastie Boys' Mike D, Portugal. The Man's John Gourley, Jaw, Cat Power, Ryan Tedder, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Before I Self Destruct
Info: The fourth album for the rapper is finally released and features appearances by Eminem, Ne Yo, Lloyd Banks, and R. Kelly.

Title: Pray IV Reign
Info: The fourth album for the New York rapper features guests such as Ludacris, Ryan Leslie, Juelz Santana, and NOE.

Title: Jet Lag
Info: The debut full-length solo album for the Why? band member was written after his 11-year relationship ended and he left California.

Title: eMOTIVe
Info: Tool frontman Maynard James Keenan tackles a variety of covers on this latest from his side project, A Perfect Circle, including versions of songs by Depeche Mode ("People Are People"), Devo ("Freedom Of Choice") and Marvin Gaye ("What's Going On"). Also included are two originals.

Title: Porcelain
Info: The El Paso, Texas four-piece (featuring those members of At The Drive-In who didn't join the Mars Volta) return with a second full-length, produced by Mike Major.

Title: Oskar Tennis Champion
Info: Scotland-born Nick Currie recorded this latest collection of strange pop tunes in his new home of Tokyo, then handed them off to John Talaga (Super Madrigal Brothers) for remixing.

Title: Built From Scratch
Info: The sophomore effort for the New York turnablists (following 1997's 'X-Pressions') features 20 tracks of scratching and DJ wizardry, coupled with live drums and guitar and vocals from guests such as the Large Professor.

Title: Her Loss
Info: The debut full-length studio release from the collaboration between rappers Drake and 21 Savage was delayed by a week when producer Noah "40" Shebib contracted COVID-19.

Title: The Dream
Info: The latest album from the electronic group features guests Steve Hillage, Eric Walker, Aki Omori, Andy Caine, and Juliet Roberts.

Title: Wild Things
Info: The Los Angeles-based New Zealand pop artist Pip Brown re-recorded material for her third release as she felt the songs were too dark and "didn't feel like" her anymore.

Title: Water for Your Soul
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter features influences from hip hop and reggae.

Title: Paralytic Stalks
Info: The latest album for indie group Of Montreal was recorded with a group of session musicians at Kevin Barnes' studio in Athens, Georgia.

Title: Tomorrow's World
Info: Frankmusik produced the first studio album for the synth-pop duo in over four years.

Title: In Your Dreams
Info: The legendary singer, and bewitching front-woman for Fleetwood Mac, collaborates with Eurythmic’s Dave Stewart and Glen Ballard for her first solo album release in over a decade.

Title: Press Play
Info: The artist currently known as Diddy's first release in five years features production by will.i.am, Pharrell, Just Blaze and Kanye West, with a huge roster of contributors including Christina Aguilera, Brandy, Jamie Foxx, Big Boi, Nas, Mary J. Blige, and Fergie.

Title: JackInABox
Info: The British folk-pop duo of Olly Knights and Gale Paridjanian return for a third album.

Title: R.O.O.T.S
Info: The follow-up to the rapper's debut album "Mail On Sunday," features the number one single 'Right Round.'

Title: The Best Little Secrets Are Kept
Info: This is the debut full-length for the bawdy San Diego, Calif. rock outfit led by Jason Hill and Brian Karscig.

Title: Free Somehow
Info: The 10th album for the Georgia jam band is the first featuring new guitarist Jimmy Herring.

Title: Go With Me
Info: The debut album for the Seattle indie rock trio was recorded at their home.

Title: The Good Feeling Music of Dent May & His Magnificent Ukulele
Info: Signed to Animal Collective's Paw Tracks label, the artist releases his first full-length album.

Title: Panic Movement
Info: They may sound like Brit rockers (Oasis comes to mind), but this four-piece led by singer Adrian Barrera comes from Atlanta. Owen Morris (Oasis) produced this debut disc.

Title: Beg For Mercy
Info: Rapper 50 Cent's backing posse attempts to capitalize on the runaway success of their leader's 'Get Rich or Die Tryin' with this, their own debut LP (which does indeed feature 50 Cent on each and every track).

Title: Do Rabbits Wonder
Info: Championed (and signed) by the White Stripes' Jack White, this spare, Michigan-based keyboard-bass-drums trio has been labeled by Rolling Stone as this generation's Devo. White produced this debut LP, which was mixed by Mercury Rev's Dave Fridmann. And why the album title? According to the band's website, "We all love rabbits."

Title: The Listener
Info: Giant Sand's Howe Gelb returns with his second solo album for Thrill Jockey. Recorded half in Denmark and half in his native Arizona, 'The Listener' features appearances by members of Calexico and Handsome Family.

Title: Slicker Than Your Average
Info: The 21-year old DJ turned-international R&B superstar from England returns with his second LP.

Title: Oh Land
Info: This is the Danish singer-songwriter's second full-length album.

Title: The Sun And The Moon
Info: Brendan O'Brien produced this second album for the New York band.

Title: I Am the West
Info: As one of the most well-known West Coast MCs, Ice Cube's ninth studio album heralds his love of California and his hometown of Compton.

Title: Blame It on Baby
Info: The second full-length release for the rapper features guest appearances from A Boogie wit da Hoodie, Ashanti, Future, jetsonmade, London On Da Track, Megan Thee Stallion, Quavo, Roddy Ricch, and YoungBoy Never Broke Again.

Title: 1000 Palms
Info: The third full-length release for the indie rock band was self-recorded and produced.

Title: The Other Side of Zero
Info: The Brooklyn rock trio worked on its album for only one month with producer Tony Berg.

Title: Free Your Mind And Win A Pony
Info: The debut album for the duo from Baltimore and Sweden.

Title: Hey People!
Info: This is the debut album for the four-piece garage-rock band fronted by Kpt.Michi.Gan's Michael Beckett.

Title: Draw The Line
Info: The latest album for the British singer-songwriter was produced by the artist himself.

Title: Do Things
Info: The ukulele is absent from the second album for the singer-songwriter from Mississippi.

Title: I Am Not a Dog on a Chain
Info: The 13th full-length solo release for The Smiths frontman was produced by Joe Chicarelli.

Title: XI Versions of Black Noise
Info: The remix album of the electronic artist's 2009 album features production by such artists as Animal Collective, Four Tet, and Moritz Von Oswald.

Title: Love + Fear
Info: The fourth full-length album by Marina Diamand is the first with her shortened name (previously under Marina And The Diamonds) features a collaboration with Clean Bandit and Luis Fonsi.

Title: Two
Info: This is the second album from the French electronic artists.

Title: Alphabutt
Info: One half of The Moldy Peaches returns with her latest album of funny children's tunes.

Title: Thankful
Info: Yes, well, she does have a lot to be thankful for, doesn't she. This hit debut album is a direct result of the singer's victory on the first installment of Fox TV's "American Idol" talent competition in 2002. Judging from the album's credits, just about every musician and producer in the industry seemingly worked on the disc, although Clarkson did manage to co-write four out of the dozen songs.

Title: Do You Know Squarepusher
Info: Why yes, yes we do. His real name is Tom Jenkinson, he dabbles in experimental electronica (a la Aphex Twin, who signed him to his first record deal), and this is his sixth album. Included among the seven new tracks here (totaling just 35 minutes) is an unexpected cover of Joy Division's "Love Will Tear Us Apart."

Title: The Great Depression
Info: The fourth album for east coast rapper sees Black Key and DMX himself taking over the production reins from Swizz Beatz on all but two tracks.

Title: Wake Up And Smell The Coffee
Info: Yes, apparently they ARE still around. This is the Irish group's sixth album since 1993, and their first with original producer Stephen Street in some time.

Title: Someday World
Info: The collaborative release from Brian Eno and Karl Hyde was produced by Eno and Fred Gibson.

Title: Fall to Grace
Info: The second studio release for the British singer was produced by Nellee Hooper and Jake Gosling.

Title: Turning the Mind
Info: James Chapman releases his follow up to his Mercury Music Prize-nominated album, "We Can Create."

Title: Blood
Info: The band's thrid album, "Tonight" is dub remixed by producer Dan Carey.

Title: Cyr
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the alternative rock band was produced by the band's frontman, Billy Corgan.

Title: Robotique Majestique
Info: The Austin, Texas group known more for its live performances releases its third album.

Title: Sing Into My Mouth
Info: Ben Bridwell of Band Of Horses and Iron & Wine collaborate on a covers albums that includes songs originally sung by JJ Cale, El Perro del Mar, Bonnie Raitt, Ronnie Lane, Marshall Tucker Band, Sade, Pete Seeger, Spiritualized, Talking Heads, Them Two, and Unicorn.

Title: Andy and His Grandmother
Info: Recordings made by the actor/comedian between 1977 to 1979 were edited and compiled by Rodney Ascher and Vernon Chatman with narration by Bill Hader.

Title: A New Testament
Info: The second full-length solo release for the former Girls frontman was recorded with producer Doug Boehm.

Title: Encyclopedia
Info: The third full-length release from the Brooklyn-based indie rock band that is now a duo of Jonny Pierce and Jacob Graham after Connor Hanwick left in late 2012.

Title: Who Killed Sgt. Pepper?
Info: The 11th album for the Anton Newcombe-led rock band features the return of bassist/guitarist Matt Hollywood, who left the group in 1999.

Title: Not Without A Fight
Info: The debut album on the Epitaph label for the pop-punk band from Florida is also their first studio album in nearly three years.

Title: The Open Door
Info: Fans of the Grammy-winning band have waited three years for them to return with a second album, which returns Dave Fortman as producer but no longer includes guitarist-songwriter Ben Moody.

Title: Quicken The Heart
Info: The third album for the English indie rock quintet.

Title: Boys and Diamonds
Info: The husband-and-wife duo releases its debut full-length album of African and Middle Eastern-influenced music.

Title: 22-20s
Info: Brendan Lynch produced this debut for the English blues-rock band, who are named after a Skip James song.

Title: We Can Do Anything
Info: This is the first full-length studio release in 16 years for the band led by Gordon Gano and Brian Ritchie with Dresden Dolls' Brian Viglione taking over on drums from Victor de Lorenzo.

Title: I Had the Blues But I Shook Them Loose
Info: The debut album for the British rock quartet was produced by Jim Abbiss.

Title: Surgery
Info: The L.A. psych-rock band's third disc was produced by Tom Rothrock (Beck).

Title: PlectrumElectrum
Info: One of two Prince albums released on the same day, it features the all-female trio 3rdEyeGirl.

Title: Ghost Stories
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the alternative rock band led by Chris Martin was influenced in part by Martin's relationship with Gwyneth Paltrow.

Title: Don't You
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the New York trio of Kelly Zutrau, Joe Valle, and Marty Sulkow.

Title: Soft Control
Info: The full-length debut release for the British pop artist features contributions from Babydaddy, Amanda Ghost, Robin Hannibal, Emile Haynie, Dev Hynes, John Legend, and Johnny Rockstar.

Title: Unapologetic
Info: The seventh studio release for the pop singer features Chris Brown, Eminem, Future, and David Guetta as guests with No I.D., Nicky Romero, StarGate, and The-Dream contributing to production.

Title: Walk It Off
Info: The sophomore album for the indie rock quartet from Minnesota was produced by Dave Fridmann.

Title: Black Panties
Info: The R&B singer's 12th full-length studio release features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Ludacris, Kelly Rowland, and Young Jezzy.

Title: How to Get To Heaven From Scotland
Info: This is the debut album for the rock quartet led by Aidan Moffat.

Title: Human Conditions
Info: This is the second solo outing for the former Verve frontman.

Title: Music for Courage and Confidence
Info: This covers album from the former American Music Club leader includes versions of songs by everyone from Culture Club ("Do You Really Want To Hurt Me?") to Glen Campbell ("Gentle on My Mind").

Title: Under Rug Swept
Info: Morissette's third studio album is the first one the 27-year-old Canadian songwriter has produced herself.

Title: In Space
Info: The band's first studio LP in 30 years features the most recent touring lineup of original members Alex Chilton and Jody Stephens with Posies Jon Auer and Ken Stringfellow.

Title: Sleep Through The Static
Info: The singer from Hawaii returns with his latest album, which was recorded on solar-powered equipment.

Title: The Difference Between Houses And Homes: Lost Songs And Loose Ends 1995-2001
Info: This disc compiles 10 tracks from the Tim Kasher-led band's early 7-inch singles, and adds two previously unreleased cuts.

Title: Edward Sharpe & the Magnetic Zeros
Info: The third full-length release from the band led by Alex Ebert was partially recorded at the same time as 2012's Here.

Title: A List of the Burning Mountains
Info: The 12th full-length studio release for the Brooklyn rock group consists of two nearly 20-minute long tracks.

Title: Global
Info: This greatest hits/mix disc by the German DJ/producer includes two previously unreleased tracks. The accompanying DVD, culled from over 40 hours of footage, is part travelogue and part behind-the-scenes documentary of Van Dyk in action.

Title: The  Sound of the Life of the Mind
Info: The fourth studio album for the indie rock band is its first release of new music in 13 years.

Title: The Mix-Up
Info: Money Mark guests on this all-instrumental, post-punk-influenced, 12-track set for the veteran hip-hop outfit.

Title: Here We Stand
Info: This is the sophomore album for the Scottish indie rock band.

Title: Doo-Wops and Hooligans
Info: The Hawaiian-born producer's move to making pop music as a solo artist has proven successful, as his new album is an innovative mix of tribal beats, reggae, and club-worthy jams that show his range as a songwriter.

Title: The Seven Autumn Flowers
Info: Robert Wratten (Field Mice) is joined by singers Beth Arzy and Anne Mari on this fifth TBS release.

Title: Meteorites
Info: The 12th studio release for the British band led by Ian McCulloch was produced by Youth.

Title: Victorious
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Australian hard rock band led by Andrew Stockdale was produced by Brendan O'Brien.

Title: The Ascent
Info: The ninth studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from such artists as  Far East Movement, French Montana, Ghetts, Kano, Lethal Bizzle, Ms D, Emeli Sandé, Tinchy Stryder, and Tulisa.

Title: Break the Spell
Info: Howard Benson returns to produce the third full-length album for the band led by former American Idol contestant, Chris Daughtry.

Title: Destroyed
Info: Described by Moby himself as a "soundtrack for empty cities at 2 a.m.," the electronic artist's 10th album was recorded while on tour.

Title: Mirror Eye
Info: The second full-length album for the New York experimental rock band.

Title: Emotional Technology
Info: This is the fourth album for house music producer Brian Transeau, who has faded from the limelight a bit since his heyday in the mid-to-late 1990s, although has produced hits for the likes of Britney Spears and *NSync. Collaborators here include Rose McGowan, Scott McCloud (Girls Against Boys), and Guru (Gang Starr).

Title: Discipline
Info: Janet Jackson's 10th album features Ne-Yo and Missy Elliot.

Title: In The Maybe World
Info: Johnny Marr guests on the singer-songwriter's first album in three years and her first disc for the Young God label.

Title: Grand Romantic
Info: The debut solo release for the Fun. frontman was produced by Jeff Bhasker and Emile Haynie.

Title: NYC
Info: Four Tet's Kieren Hebden and drummer Steve Reid team up for the fourth time on this album about New York City.

Title: The Friends [EP]
Info: The Pennsylvania band releases the EP in advance of a full studio album in the fall.

Title: Primus & the Chocolate Factory with the Fungi Ensemble
Info: The tribute to the 1971 film Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory from the San Francisco Bay Area-based band sees the return of Tim Alexander on drums.

Title: Bangerz
Info: Executive produced with Mike Will Made It, the hip-hop-influenced fourth studio release (and her first on the RCA label) for the former Disney star features guest appearances from Big Sean, French Montana, and Britney Spears.

Title: LotusFlow3r
Info: After releasing Planet Earth for free in the United Kingdom, the singer-songwriter's three albums (one by new artist Bria Valente) are packaged together as a Target store exclusive in the United States.

Title: We'll Live and Die in These Towns
Info: Formally known as The Bridges, the British band returns with a label, a new name, and a new album.

Title: Left
Info: Ken Thomas (Sigur Ros) produced this sophomore effort for the anthemic UK rockers.

Can he do it again? Coming a full three years after his surprise megahit 'Play,' this new album from Richard Melville Hall attempts to repeat that disc's success with (surprise) 18 new tracks, including collaborations with Angie Stone, Sinead O'Connor, Azure Ray and MC Lyte.

Title: Help Wanted Nights
Info: Originally conceived as a solo project for Cursive's frontman Tim Kasher, the Omaha band now releases its fourth album.

Title: Still Got That Hunger
Info: The sixth overall release from the 60s' British psychedelic rock band is its second since reforming in 2011 and was funded via Pledge Music.

Title: OX 2010: A Street Odyssey
Info: Cannibal Ox's Vast Aire releases his latest solo album.

Title: Blackout
Info: Britney newest release includes tracks written by T-Pain and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Dignity
Info: This is the third album for the actress/pop star.

Title: Solarized
Info: The fourth solo disc for the former Stone Roses singer includes a collaboration with Noel Gallagher.

Title: Yours Truly, Angry Mob
Info: Stephen Street produced the British band's second album, which follows their acclaimed 2005 debut 'Employment.'

Title: Polly Scattergood
Info: The debut album for the English singer, who attended the BRIT school (other famous alumni include Amy Winehouse, Leona Lewis, and Adele.)

Title: These Systems Are Failing
Info: The 13th full-length studio release for the electronic artist is the first credited under the name Moby & The Void Pacific Choir.

Title: We The Best Forever
Info: The LA-based band releases its sophomore full-length of noise-driven, psychedelic rock.

Title: Ruins
Info: The fourth album for the Portland duo of Lisa Molinaro and Kevin O'Connor is the first on Isaac Brock of Modest Mouse fame's label.

Title: Remember My Name
Info: This is the debut full-length studio release for the Chicago rapper.

Title: Secrets Are Sinister
Info: The fourth album for the New York indie-pop band was produced with Peter Katis and Dave Fridmann.

Title: Sleep Mountain
Info: The second full-length album for the Danish band was produced by Peter Katis.

Title: Legendary Weapons
Info: The follow-up to 2009's Chamber Music, the album is a compilation of Wu-Tang and affiliates, minus GZA.

Title: Screamworks: Love in Theory and Practice
Info: Finnish goth-rock outfit, HIM returns with its seventh studio album on Sire Records.

Title: For Me It's You
Info: The San Francisco band's fourth studio album was produced by Brendan O'Brien and includes a cover of Sugar's "If I Can't Change Your Mind."

Title: How To Destroy Angels
Info: Trent Reznor along with his wife Mariqueen Maandig and Atticus Ross join to release their debut album as the band How To Destroy Angels.

Title: Push and Shove
Info: The first album in 11 years for the Southern California band led by Gwen Stefani features Busy Signal and Major Lazer as guests on the title track.

Title: Blood for the Master
Info: The fifth album from the New Orleans black metal band was produced by Erik Rutan.

Title: Clothes Drop
Info: The Black Eyed Peas' will.i.am guests on the dancehall star's sixth studio album.

Title: Live Like You Were Dying
Info: 'Dying' once again finds the country star backed on record by his touring band, the Dancehall Doctors.

Title: You Can Feel Me
Info: Picture a white man singing R&B. Picture a white man singing R&B while stripping down to his underwear. Picture an average-looking, slightly pudgy white man singing R&B while stripping down to his underwear. That's Har Mar Superstar, and this is his second album.

Title: Charango
Info: The English trip-hop outfit's fourth studio album features unlikely guest vocal appearances from rapper Slick Rick and Lambchop's Kurt Wagner.

Title: Modulate
Info: Indie rock legend Bob Mould (Hüsker Dü, Sugar) returns with his fifth solo album, and first for his brand new record label (Granary Music). In another first, Mould delves into electronica for the first time as well, abandoning traditional instruments for synths and computers on half of the album.

Title: You & I
Info: The debut full-length album for the New Zealand quartet was produced by Bernard Butler.

Title: Later...When the TV Turns To Static
Info: The third full-length release for Scottish indie rock quartet was produced by frontman James Allan.

Title: Futuristically Speaking...Never Be Afraid
Info: The debut full-length album for the rap duo from Florida was produced by Hard Feeling UK.

Title: Dynamite
Info: The U.K. pop-funk outfit led by Jay Kay returns with a sixth album.

Title: Let Them Talk
Info: The actor best known for his roles on the TV shows House and Jeeves and Wooster releases his debut album of blues music produced by Joe Henry.

Title: Donker Mag
Info: The third full-length release from the South African duo of Ninja and Yo-Landi features a guest appearance from DJ Muggs.

Title: Some Devil
Info: The first solo release for Dave Matthews (that's right, it's not the Dave Matthews Band this time out) finds him working with artists such as Tim Reynolds and Trey Anastasio (Phish).

Title: The Last DJ
Info: The latest from Tom Petty is a concept album (or diatribe, if you will) about/against the domination of popular music by large, greedy corporations. It was released on October 8, 2002 by a large, greedy corporation.

Title: The Carnivorous Lunar Activities Of Lupine Howl
Info: Featuring former members of Spiritualized (who were fired by Jason Pierce before the recording sessions for 'Let It Come Down'), Lupine Howl offers up nine tracks on this debut album, including previously-released singles "Vaporizer" and "125."

Title: Return Of Dragon
Info: This is actor-singer Sisqo's sophomore effort, following his 1999 debut 'Unleash The Dragon.' (Sense a pattern here?) Teddy Riley produced the lead single, "Can I Live."

Title: A New Tide
Info: The sixth album for the British indie-rock band was produced with Brian Deck.

Title: Rainbow Edition
Info: The latest release for the experimental electronic project is said to not involve Dean Blunt and Inga Copeland.

Title: Big Mess
Info: The second full-length solo release for the prolific film and television composer was written during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Grateful
Info: The 10th full-length studio release for the rapper/producer features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Beyoncé, Justin Bieber, Big Sean, Chance the Rapper, Drake, Fat Joe, Future, Calvin Harris, Jadakiss, Jay Z, Alicia Keys, Kodak Black, Lil Wayne, Migos, Nicki Minaj, PARTYNEXTDOOR, Pusha T, Quavo, Raekwon, Rihanna, Rick Ross, T.I., Travis Scott, Bryson Tiller, Yo Gotti, and Young Thug.

Title: Distortion
Info: This 26-minute disc is the first solo album for the Run-D.M.C. M.C., who is better known these days as the Run in MTV's reality show "Run's House."

Title: ARTPOP
Info: The third studio release for the dance pop artist features guest appearances from R. Kelly, T.I., Too Short and Twista as well as production from David Guetta, Infected Mushroom, Madeon, Rick Rubin, DJ White Shadow, will.i.am, Zedd, and Zisis.

Title: Dynamics
Info: This is the second release for the Brooklyn duo of Alex Frankel and Nick Millhiser.

Title: The Last Kiss
Info: The rapper's first release in five years features guests such as Mary J. Blige, Nas, Styles P, Ghostface Killah, Raekwon, Ne Yo, Lil Wayne, Young Jeezy, Pharrell, and Faith Evans.

Title: Winter Women / Holy Ghost Language School
Info: This double album marks the first solo release for the "brother" half of the brother-sister duo Fiery Furnaces. While the 'Holy Ghost' disc is as bizarre and experimental as recent Furnaces releases, 'Winter Women' marks a detour into more accessible pop.

Title: Broken by Desire to Be Heavenly Sent
Info: The second full-length release from Scottish singer-songwriter Lewis Capaldi features Pointless, a song co-written by Steve Mac, Johnny McDaid and Ed Sheeran.

Title: My Mind Makes Noises
Info: The debut full-length release for the British indie pop band led by Heather Baron-Gracie was co-produced by The 1975's Matty Healy and George Daniel (as well as Jonathan Gilmore and the band's drummer  Ciara Doran).

Title: Timez Are Weird These Days
Info: The Brooklyn-based rapper makes his major-label debut, with producers Dave Sitek and John Hill.

Title: ...Ya Know?
Info: Joan Jett and Steven Van Zandt guested on Joey Ramone's second posthumously released solo album that includes demos and unreleased recordings.

Title: Human Bell
Info: This is the debut album for the side project of David Heumann, lead singer of Arboretum and Lungfish's bass player Nathan Bell.

Title: The Return Of Dr. Octagon
Info: Kool Keith's second Dr. Octagon album follows a full decade after his first, with production this time handled by One Watt Sun.

Title: Out Of Nothing
Info: The fourth album for the Britpop band includes a track ("Gravity") co-written by Coldplay's Chris Martin.

Title: Howling... It Grows And Grows!!!
Info: The Seattle-based punk band returns with their third album.

Title: Stills
Info: The second full-length release from the Denver band formed by Andy Rauworth and Craig Nice was produced by Jacob Portrait.

Title: Galore
Info: The dance group, comprising three Canadians and a Brit, releases its debut album stateside.

Title: Rokstarr
Info: The London-based producer/singer-songwriter who worked with such artists as Omar, Sugababes, Cheryl Cole, Kesha, McFly, and Kylie Minogue releases his second album.

Title: Black Laden Crown
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the metal band features four different drummers (Joey Castillo, Johnny Kelly, Karl Rockfist and Dirk Verbeuren).

Title: Moment Bends
Info: The Australian avante-garde group release a fourth album of inventive and diverse dance-punk merged with an indie-pop sound.

Title: Invisible Ones
Info: The singer follows the lead of her Azure Ray bandmate Maria Taylor (whose '11:11' came out in May) with this solo debut, co-produced by Andy LeMaster (Now It's Overhead).

Title: Spine Hits
Info: Produced by Dave Catching, the third album from San Francisco psychedelic rock band is its first since Rachel Fannan left the group.

Title: A.M.
Info: This is the debut full-length album for Swervedriver's Adam Franklin and Interpol's Sam Fogarino.

Title: The Monsanto Years
Info: The Canadian singer-songwriter's concept album about the dangers of the business practices of the Monsanto Company (especially genetically modified seeds) features the band Promise of the Real with Willie Nelson's sons Lukas and Micah.

Title: Glorious
Info: The debut full-length release for British pop singer-songwriter  Louisa Rose Allen, who won a Grammy for her work on Zedd's Clarity.

Title: Tim Robbins and the Rogues Gallery Band
Artist: Tim Robbins & the Rogues Gallery Band
Info: The Oscar-winning actor and his backing band release an album of folk rock tunes.

Title: Fasciinatiion
Info: The first album released on their new label Blank.wav was written and produced by the band.

Title: T.I. Vs T.I.P.
Info: The fifth studio album for the Atlanta rapper includes Alfamega, Busta Rhymes, Jay-Z, Eminem, and Nelly as guests.

Title: Prism
Info: The fourth studio release for the pop singer includes production from Dr. Luke, Greg Kurstin, Max Martin, StarGate, and Greg Wells.

Title: Bicycles & Tricycles
Info: Yes, for those of you keeping score at home, Alex Paterson is indeed still recording as The Orb, with 'Bicycles' marking the once trailblazing electronica group's sixth studio release.

Title: Hopes And Fears
Info: Yes, you'll see the word "Coldplay" in nearly every review for this debut disc, but the UK trio stand out from the crowd with their unconventional lineup of vocals, drums, and piano.

Title: Bounce
Info: Just when you feared the New Jersey hair band would never release another album, they did. Oh joy.

Title: From Here On In
Info: Procuded by Mo'Wax label head James Lavelle (U.N.K.L.E.), the debut album from London's South mixes electronica and indie rock, drawing comparisons to everyone from the Stone Roses and Happy Mondays to Badly Drawn Boy and DJ Shadow.

Title: Mechanical Wonder
Info: The fifth album from the British rockers is their first U.S. release in five years.

Title: The Fabled City
Info: The sophomore solo album for Rage Against the Machine's Tom Morello was produced with Brendan O'Brien.

Title: Queen of Me
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for Canadian country artist Shania Twain features a guest appearance from Tyler Joseph of Twenty One Pilots.

Title: When It Was Now
Info: This is the full-length debut release for the Adelaide, Australian indie pop band.

Title: Pacifica
Info: The first release in four years for the Australian electro-pop duo of Julian Hamilton and Kim Moyes.

Title: War Stories
Info: The electronic duo's new album includes guests such as Josh Homme (Queens of the Stone Age), Ian Astbury (The Cult), The Duke Spirit, and Autolux.

Title: Certified Lover Boy
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Canadian rapper features guest appearances from 21 Savage, Future, Giveon, JAY-Z, Kid Cudi, Lil Baby, Lil Durk, Lil Wayne, Project Pat, Rick Ross, Tems, Travis Scott, Ty Dolla $ign, and Young Thug.

Title: He's Got the Whole This Land Is Your Land in His Hands
Info: The latest release for the Chicago indie rock band led by Tim Kinsella was self-produced by the band.

Title: Blue Record [EP]
Info: The five-track EP for the band led by Ruban Nielson is an acoustic release with three songs from its second full-length album and two cover songs: Dirty Projectors' "Swing Lo Magellan" and Beck's "Puttin' It Down."

Title: The 20/20 Experience 2 of 2
Info: Drake and Jay-Z appear as guests on the second half of The 20/20 Experience project co-produced with Timothy Mosley and Jerome "J-Roc" Harmon.

Title: Seven Rainbows
Info: The debut album for the British pop singer was produced by Dan Carey.

Title: Dumb Luck
Info: This second Dntel LP for Jimmy Tamborello (also of the Postal Service and Figurine) features guest vocalists Jenny Lewis, Conor Oberst, Mia Doi Todd, and members of Lali Puna and Fog.

Title: Christmas Songs
Info: The Los Angeles punk band led by Greg Graffin releases a nine-track Christmas album.

Title: Listen
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British rock band was produced by Inflo, a British hip-hop producer.

Title: Shobaleader One: d'Demonstrator
Info: This concept mini-album consists of nine tracks performed by a mysterious quartet named Shobaleader One.

Title: Flashy
Info: The fifth album for the Detroit rock band features a reference to its 2003 hit 'Gay Bar.'

Title: Everything Is Boring & Everyone Is a F--king Liar
Info: Naeem Juwan returns as Spank Rock, and his second album features such guests as Santigold, Big Freedia, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: One Plus One Is One
Info: Apart from demonstrating that his addition skills are as poor as Radiohead's, 'One Plus One' finds Damon Gough returning to the more low-key, lo-fi sound of his earlier work after the much glossier 'Have You Fed The Fish?' failed to win the British singer-songwriter new fans in 2002.

Title: Vulnerable
Info: If declining sales and waning critical support are any indication, then yes, Tricky is probably feeling quite vulnerable at this stage of his career. But that didn't stop him from releasing this seventh LP, which includes covers of The Cure's "Love Cats" and XTC's "Dear God."

Title: The Art of Love and War
Info: The fourth album for Stone was recorded at Marvin Gaye's original LA studio.

Title: Living Things
Info: Personal relationships influenced the lyrics on the fifth album produced with Rick Rubin for the alternative rock band.

Title: Glee: The Music, Volume 1
Info: The soundtrack features songs from the first season of the TV show.

Title: Entertainment
Info: The New York duo's third album was produced with Jeff Saltzman.

Title: Stone Temple Pilots [2018]
Info: The second self-titled release for the alternative rock band is the first to features former The X Factor contestant Jeff Gutt as its lead singer.

Title: The Oracle
Info: The fifth studio album for the metal band is its first in nearly five years and its third release to debut at number one on the Billboard 200 chart.

Title: Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz
Info: The surprise release from the pop singer was a collaboration with the Flaming Lips' Wayne Coyne.

Title: Kings & Queens
Info: The Chicago-based outfit led by Neil Rosario and Mark Henning return with a Prince-esque sophomore set.

Title: Thank You
Info: The first new full-length studio release in more than 20 years for the artist known as Queen of Motown was produced with Jack Antonoff.

Title: Peaceful, The World Lays Me Down
Info: This is the debut album for the British quartet led by Charlie Fink.

Title: Sixes & Sevens
Info: The fifth solo album for the Moldy Peaches member.

Title: Corazón
Info: The largely Spanish-language Latin release from the guitarist features guest appearances from such artists as ChocQuibTown, Lila Downs, Gloria Estefan, Juanes, Los Fabulosos Cadillacs, Ziggy Marley, Miguel, Niña Pastori, Pitbull, Samuel Rosa, Wayne Shorter, Soledad, and Diego Torres.

Title: All of Us, Together
Info: This is the debut full-length studio album for the Canadian electronic artist.

Title: Black Letter Days
Info: Recorded direct to two-track, 'Black Letter Days' features a stripped-down sound for the former Pixie and his current band. And if the 18 new tracks here (including not one but two covers of Tom Waits' "The Black Rider") aren't enough for you, there's even more on the companion release, 'Devil's Workshop.'

Title: Some Nights
Info: The band's first album on the Fueled By Ramen label was produced by Jeff Bhasker and features Janelle Monae on its single We Are Young.

Title: A  Joyful Noise
Info: Brian Higgins produced the fifth album for alternative rock band led by Beth Ditto.

Title: Dead Drunk
Info: This is album number three for the side project band for Animal Collective's Dave Portner (aka Avey Tare) and Black Dice's Eric Copeland.

Title: Breaking Up
Info: 'Breaking Up' is the English trio's debut album.

Title: Gavin DeGraw
Info: The sophomore studio album for the artist best known for the theme song from the TV series "One Tree Hill."

Title: Thank You
Info: Executive produced by Ricky Reed, the second full-length major studio release for the pop singer-songwriter feature guest appearances from LunchMoney Lewis and Yo Gotti.

Title: Y Not
Info: The latest solo album for the Beatles drummer features Paul McCartney on the track "Walk With You," as well as guest vocals from Joss Stone, Ben Harper, and Richard Marx.

Title: When Your Heart Stops Beating
Info: This is the first release for the new project from blink-182's Travis Barker and Mark Hoppus.

Title: The Ride
Info: The second full-length release for the Welsh alternative rock band was produced by Dave Sardy.

Title: American Standard
Info: The singer-songwriters latest full-length release features some musical and jazz standards from such shows as Breakfast at Tiffany’s, Brigadoon, Guys and Dolls, Oklahoma!, and Show Boat as well as songs made famous by Billie Holiday and Glenn Miller.

Title: Music and Words
Info: British visual artist David Shrigley's words were turned into music by Arab Strap co-founder Malcolm Middleton in this collaboration that also features Bridget McCann, Gavin Mitchell, and Scott Vermeire.

Title: Storytone
Info: The deluxe two-disc set from the singer-songwriter features one disc with a 92-piece orchestra and choir plus a disc of solo versions of the same songs.

Title: Labrinth, Sia & Diplo Present LSD
