Info: Delayed from its planned November 2018 release, this 10-song set marks the first collaborative album from the new "supergroup" consisting of British musician Labrinth, singer-songwriter Sia, and proudcer Diplo.

Title: Symphonica
Info: A collection of ten covers and seven original songs from the pop singer's 2011-12 orchestral tour.

Title: Patience
Info: Patience is indeed a requirement for fans of the former Wham! member, as this is just his fourth solo album of original material and first in eight years.

Title: X
Info: X marks the veteran English arena-rock band's tenth album.

Title: Music Kills Me
Info: The French electronica duo Rinocerose gained notice for their 1999 debut 'Installation Sonore.' This sophomore effort features 12 new tracks of guitar-infused house.

Title: Chops
Info: Gorky's Zygotic Mynci frontman Euros Childs makes his solo debut with this 14-song effort.

Title: Decent Work For Decent Pay
Info: The Grammy-nominated (for producing M.I.A.'s "Paper Planes") DJ Wesley "Diplo" Pentz releases his latest remix album, featuring works from a variety of indie-rock bands such as Bloc Party, CSS, and Spank Rock.

Title: The Remedy
Info: The second album for the British singer was produced by Flood.

Title: Sheezus
Info: The third studio release for the British pop singer was produced by DJ Dahi, Greg Kurstin, and Shellback.

Title: Under The Boards
Info: The rock band latest album is the second in a planned triology.

Title: Invaders Must Die
Info: The first album for the electronic duo in four years features Dave Grohl and James Rushent as guest musicians.

Title: Smoke + Mirrors
Info: The second full-length release fro the Las Vegas rock band was produced with Alex Da Kid.

Title: In a World Like This
Info: The eighth studio release for the pop group is its first with Kevin Richardson since he left the group in 2006 and also includes production from Max Martin, Morgan Taylor Reid, and Martin Terefe.

Title: The Third Hand
Info: The hip-hop producer attempts a "pop" album for the first time on this third release, utilizing all live instrumentation and even singing on almost all of the tracks.

Title: Black Ghosts
Info: The British duo of Theo Keating and Simon Lord releases their first full-length album together.

Title: Casino Twilight Dogs
Info: The Australian band's second album was produced by Wayne Connolly (The Vines) and includes their cover of Alphaville's "Forever Young."

Title: Year Of The Dog... Again
Info: The rapper's sixth album includes production work from Scott Storch and Swizz Beatz.

Title: The Complex
Info: The multimedia collective known as the Blue Man Group, who can be seen and heard in ongoing theatrical productions in several cities, in television commercials for Intel, and even on a previous instrumental album 'Audio,' have released here something akin to a real rock'n'roll album. Their assortment of invented instrumentation is now accompanied by more traditional instruments, and vocals are provided by an array of guests, including Dave Matthews, Spalding Gray and Tracy Bonham. Included also are covers of "White Rabbit" and "I Feel Love."

Title: Devil's Workshop
Info: One of two simultaneous releases (Black Letter Days being the other), Devil's Workshop is perhaps the more straightforward of the pair, although like its companion it was recorded direct to 2-track, representing a back-to-basics approach for Black and Co.

Title: Reanimation
Info: Not quite the next Linkin Park album, 'Reanimation' is instead a remix of their entire debut album, 'Hybrid Theory' (actually, a remix of the Japanese version, which contained extra tracks). The 19 songs here have been reinvented by an array of alternative and hip hop musicians and producers, including members of Korn, Jurassic 5, Orgy, and Staind, and given cryptic new titles such as "Rnw@y" and "My{Dsmbr." (You'd think with all the money they're making they could at least buy a vowel.)

Title: Threes
Info: This is the third album for project that began as a spin-off from At The Drive-In but has since lost founding guitarist Paul Hinojos (who is replaced for this album with Denali's Keeley Davis).

Title: Morning Tide
Info: The debut album for the indie pop band from California.

Title: Jackie
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Missy Elliott and Pitbull (as well as Joe Jonas on the Deluxe edition).

Title: Satellite Flight: The Journey to Mother Moon
Info: Originally an EP, the 10-track album was a surprise midnight release for the hip hop artist.

Title: Paley & Francis
Info: Black Francis and Reid Perry worked together on an album produced by Jon Tiven.

Title: Lucky Old Sun
Info: The latest album for the multiple award-winning country singer features guest appearances by Dave Matthews, Mac McAnally and Willie Nelson.

Title: St. Jude
Info: The debut album for the British quartet was produced by Stephen Street.

Title: Release Therapy
Info: Kanye West, Pharrell Williams and Timbaland are among the producers on the rapper's fifth disc, which also includes appearances by Nelly and R. Kelly.

Title: Inherit
Info: This is the third album for the band led by Sonic Youth's Kim Gordon and Pussy Galore's Julie Cafritz.

Title: Secondhand Rapture
Info: This is the debut full-length debut for the New York duo of Lizzy Plapinger and producer Max Hershenow.

Title: Own the Night
Info: The Nashville country music trio releases their third studio album.

Title: We Sing, We Dance, We Steal Things
Info: The third album for the San Diego-based singer-songwriter includes songs that first appeared on three EPs.

Title: Red
Info: This is the sophomore album for the British indie pop rock band led by Fyfe Dangerfield.

Title: Strangeland
Info: Dan Gtech produced the fourth studio album for the British rock quartet that sees the band returning to emotional, piano-based songs.

Title: Space Settings
Info: 'Space Settings' is the debut from the hip-hop side project for Jimmy Tamborello (Postal Service, Dntel), who along with Plug Research artists Allen Avanessian, Daedelus and John Tejada (plus Thomas Fehlmann), provides the musical backdrop for an array of MCs that includes Beans and Rocmon.

Title: Glass Floor
Info: This is the full-length debut from the four-piece consisting of Dismemberment Plan bassist Eric Axelson, former Promise Ring members Davey von Bohlen and Dan Didier, and Jawbox founder J. Robbins.

Title: Night On Fire
Info: The Louisville, KY retro-electronica outfit, who drew numerous Daft Punk comparisons with their 2002 EP 'Le Funk,' have transitioned into a dance-punk sound with this full-length debut.

Title: Merry Christmas II You
Info: The second Christmas album for the pop singer includes four new songs and a rerecording of her 1994 Christmas song "All I Want for Christmas is You."

Title: A Better Tomorrow
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the rap group was executive produced by RZA and is its first in seven years.

Title: Ices
Info: The third full-length release from the now Northern-California-based singer-songwriter was produced by Benny Sagittarius and Clams Casino.

Title: Ancient Mars
Info: This is the second release for the Canadian indie rock duo of Tom Dobrzanski and Zach Gray.

Title: There's Me And There's You
Info: This is the second album for the artist under the Matthew Herbert Big Band name.

Title: Tangerine Reef
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the experimental pop band is an audiovisual album developed in collaboration with Coral Morphologic and is its first without Panda Bear.

Title: Bye Bye 17
Info: Sean Tillmann's fifth full-length release was co-produced with Jim Eno and recorded with a full band.

Title: Start and Complete
Info: Alexis Taylor of Hot Chip fame leads this group of innovative, improvisational electro-pop on their second release.

Title: Fantasy Ride
Info: The third album for the Atlanta, Georgia singer features guest appearances by Missy Elliot, Justin Timberlake, The-Dream, Ludacris, Chris Brown, and Young Jeezy.

Title: Disgraceland
Info: The second full-length release for the Chicago quintet includes production from Dave Sitek, Chris Coady, and Jim Abbiss.

Title: Now What
Info: The singer's second solo disc includes six tracks co-written with Linda Perry as well as a cover of Don Henley's "Dirty Laundry."

Title: The Adventures Of Ghosthorse And Stillborn
Info: The experimental folk-rock duo of Brooklyn-based sisters Sierra and Bianca Casady return with a third album.

Title: Talking To You, Talking To Me
Info: Hailing from Los Angeles by way of Kentucky, Chandra and Leigh Watson--aka the Watson Twins--follow up 2008's "Fire Songs" with "Talking to You, Talking to Me." It features members of Everest and My Morning Jacket's Bo Koster.

Title: Razorlight
Info: Chris Thomas (U2, Pulp) produced this brief, self-titled follow up to the Johnny Borrell-led band's 2004 debut 'Up All Night.'

Title: Mink Car
Info: The band's first major release since 1996's 'Factory Showroom' features 17 new recordings (including some songs that originally appeared on 1999's self-released 'Long Tall Weekend.').

Title: Drops Of Jupiter
Info: This is the major-label debut for the San Francisco adult alternative band.

Title: TP.3 Reloaded
Info: A thematic departure from his 2004 double album, TP.3 includes appearances from Snoop Dogg, The Game, Twista and Nivea.

Title: The Past Presents The Future
Info: Marc Bianchi's latest album of electronica-infused indie-pop was recorded in "extreme isolation" in California.

Title: We Can't Fly
Info: This is the first and final album for the DJ/producing duo of Vita Deluca and Stephen Fasano. Aeroplane became a solo project for Deluca after Fasano's amicable departure in June.

Title: Paul McCartney: Ocean's Kingdom
Info: The Beatle was commissioned by the New York City Ballet to compose the score for the romance between a water princess and a land-based prince.

Title: Folker
Info: No, it's not a folk album, but Westerberg does handle all of the instruments himself on this latest solo release. (We suppose that it's hard to find replacements for The Replacements.)

Title: Funk Wav Bounces, Vol. 2
Info: The sixth full-length release for Scottish electronic producer Calvin Harris features guest appearances 6LACK, 21 Savage, Busta Rhymes, Chlöe, Donae'o, Halsey, Latto, Coi Leray, Lil Durk, Dua Lipa, Normani, Offset, Pusha T, Charlie Puth, Shenseea, Jorja Smith, Snoop Dogg, Stefflon Don, Swae Lee, Justin Timberlake, Tinashe, Pharrell Williams, and Young Thug.

Title: Grey Oceans
Info: The French-based sister duo releases its first album on Sub Pop records after the previous three were released by Touch and Go Records.

Title: Trilla
Info: The Florida rapper's sophomore album includes guest appearances by Jay-Z, R. Kkelly, Nelly, Lil Wayne, and T-Pain.

Title: Temper Temper
Info: Don Gilmore returns to produce the fourth studio release from the Welsh metal band.

Title: You Gotta Go There To Come Back
Info: The Welsh band self-produced this fourth studio album.

Title: American Life
Info: Madonna's second collaboration with French electronic producer Mirwais includes the lead single title track as well as her recent James Bond theme, "Die Another Day."

Title: Dirty Dancing
Info: The London-based electronica duo move toward a darker, dirtier, more electroclash-oriented sound on this third studio album.

Title: Song Yet To Be Sung
Info: This is the debut solo release for former Jane's Addiction/Porno For Pyros frontman Perry Farrell. Many of the tracks are more electronic in nature than his previous output with the two bands. Dave Navarro, Jon Brion, and the Mad Professor are among the guest contributors.

Title: A Head Full of Dreams
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Rik Simpson and Stargate with guest appearances from Beyoncé, Merry Clayton, Noel Gallagher, Tove Lo, Gwyneth Paltrow, and Annabelle Wallis.

Title: Limits of Desire
Info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn synth-pop band led by Josh Kolenik was self-produced.

Title: Back On My B.S.
Info: The first album on the Universal Motown label for the rapper features guest artists such as Lil Wayne, Jadakiss, T. Pain, Pharell, Akon, T.I., Estelle, Mary J Blige, J. Foxx, J. Legend, and Common.

Title: Love Hate And Then There's You
Info: The third studio album for the band is its first on the Majordomo label.

Title: Fearless Love
Info: The multiple-award winning singer-songwriter works with producer John Shanks on her latest album, which also features vocals from Joss Stone and Natasha Bedingfield.

Title: Killing Time
Info: The first full-length album for the punk pop rock band that includes members from the indie pop band Magic Bullets.

Title: Stars Dance
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Disney actress/singer is her first as a solo artist and includes contributions from The Cataracs, Desmond Child, Ester Dean, Mike Del Rio, Dreamlab, David Jost, The Monsters and the Strangerz, Rock Mafia, and Stargate.

Title: 55 Cadillac
Info: The fourth album for the California-born artist features solo piano pieces.

Title: Low in High School
Info: The 11th full-length solo release for the British indie rock singer-songwriter was produced by Joe Chiccarelli.

Title: All Wet
Info: The sixth full-length release from French filmmaker/electronic producer Quentin Dupieux features guest appearances from Boys Noize, Charli XCX, Mocky, Peaches, Phra, Siriusmo, Skrillex, and Tetanos.

Title: Out Of The Vein
Info: The third album for the radio-friendly San Francisco-based alt-rockers is almost a concept album about breaking up with Charlize Theron, which--lest you think the band was getting wacky all of a sudden--band leader Stephan Jenkins actually did do recently.

Title: Deathsentences of the Polished & Structurally Weak
Info: Part book, part CD, this latest effort from the Bay Area collective was inspired by a trip to an auto junkyard. The jokes, satire, and subversion found in previous releases is absent this time around, instead replaced by a collection of letters and writings found in the auto wrecks presented in a 64-page full-color book, and, on the CD, a lyric- and melody- free noise assault that, as the band suggests, is the sound of their studio being destroyed in a car crash.

Title: Happy People
Info: This is the second full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Harry Koisser.

Title: Tides End
Info: Produced by Mark Verbos, the second full-length release for Shaun Kilfoyle became a solo project after Amalie Bruun left to join Ex Cops.

Title: Majenta
Info: Sexual themes continue to dominate the third release for the Detroit producer/photographer/electronic artist.

Title: Rolling Papers
Info: The debut from the Pittsburgh rapper features the biggest-selling hip-hop single of 2010, Black and Yellow--a track that became the unofficial anthem for the Steelers in Super Bowl XLV.

Title: Bigger Love
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the R&B singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Jhené Aiko, Camper, Gary Clark Jr., Koffee, and Rapsody

Title: Father Of Asahd
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from 070 Shake, 21 Savage, J Balvin, Beyoncé, Justin Bieber, Big Sean, Buju Banton, Chance the Rapper, Chris Brown, Cardi B, Future, Gunna, Jay-Z, Jeremih, Jeezy, John Legend, Lil Wayne, Lil Baby, Mavado, Meek Mill, Nas, Nipsey Hussle, Post Malone, Quavo, Rick Ross, Travis Scott, Sizzla, and SZA.

Title: In Plain Sight
Info: The third full-length release for the indie rock project from Stina Tweeddale was produced by John Congleton.

Title: Simple Minds Acoustic
Info: The first acoustic album for the Scottish rock band features a guest appearances from KT Tunstall.

Title: Heavy Entertainment Show
Info: The 11th full-length studio release for the British pop singer features songs written with such artists as Brandon Flowers, Serge Gainsbourg, Jewel, The Killers' Dave Keuning, Ed Sheeran, and Rufus Wainwright.

Title: Powerballin'
Info: Janet Jackson, Nate Dogg and R. Kelly guest on the St. Louis rapper's second album.

Title: Land Air Sea
Info: Originally self-released in March 2003, 'Land Air Sea' returns in 2004 in a resequenced and remixed version (on Epitaph) for this side project from members of Weezer and Rocket From The Crypt.

Title: Trinity (Past, Present and Future)
Info: The Detroit hip-hop trio returns with a sophomore LP, following a well-received 2000 debut album. Founding member Jay Dee is no longer with the group (and has been replaced by rapper Elzhi), although he guest produces three tracks.

Title: This Way
Info: The singer-songwriter's third album contains 12 new studio tracks and two bonus live tracks.

Title: Malpractice
Info: Redman's long-delayed fifth album was produced by Erick Sermon and features 23 new tracks. Guests include George Clinton, Missy "Misdemeanor" Elliott, Method Man, and Scarface.

Title: Grrr...
Info: This is the third full-length for the Brooklyn, New York, indie-rock band.

Title: Uncanney Valley
Info: The first release in 12 years for the Washington DC rock quartet led by Travis Morrison was produced by the band's guitarist, Jason Caddell.

Title: Stay Together
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Brian Higgins.

Title: Something for the Rest of Us
Info: The Goo Goo Dolls worked with several producers--including Butch Vig, Tim Palmer, John Fields, and Rob Cavallo--on the ninth studio album for the rock band from Buffalo, New York.

Title: So Amazin'
Info: Young Jeezy and the Three 6 Mafia guest on the R&B singer's third album.

Title: New Danger
Info: 'New Danger' is the second solo hip-hop album (and Geffen debut) for the rapper and actor.

Title: Education, Education, Education & War
Info: The fifth studio release for the rock band was produced by Ben H. Allen III and is its first without Nick Hodgson who left in December 2012 (Vijay Mistry takes over on drums).

Title: Getting Over the Storm
Info: The second release with new lead singer Duncan Campbell for the reggae band includes covers of country classics as well as five original tracks.

Title: Cosy Moments
Info: The sixth full-length release for the Seattle rock band is its first in over five years and its debut on the Kill Rock Stars label.

Title: Roses
Info: Stephen Street produces the first album for the Irish rock band since 2001's Wake Up and Smell the Coffee.

Title: Never Cry Another Tear
Info: This is the debut album for the rock band formed by three members of New Order, Jake Evans, and Blur's Alex James appears as a guest.

Title: Under The Covers Vol. 2
Info: Sid 'n Susie (Matthew Sweet and Susanna Hoffs) team up together once again to cover the music of the 1970s.

Title: Nostradamus
Info: Rob Halford leads the metal band's latest release, a concept album based on the prophet Nostradamus.

Title: Welcome To The Dollhouse
Info: The sophomore album for MTV's "Making the Band 3" group features Missy Elliot on one track.

Title: A Drink & A Quick Decision
Info: The second album from the UK duo.

Title: Everyday I Said A Prayer For Kathy And Made A One Inch Square
Info: The Massachusetts band--now down to the duo of Scott Levesque (vocals, guitars) and Brendan Harney (drums)--returns with their first album in four years.

Title: Hello Waveforms
Info: This is the artist/producer's first solo album in six years. Finley Quaye and the Sugababes guest.

Title: Man Vs Machine
Info: This is the fourth album from the successful West Coast rapper.

Title: Pain Is Love
Info: Released after a string of successful singles and albums (including 2000's 'Rule 3:36' LP), 'Pain Is Love' features contributions from Jennifer Lopez, Missy Elliott, and 2Pac.

Title: Glitter
Info: Originally due in August 2001, Mariah Carey's debut for Virgin Records was delayed due to the singer's recent hospitalization, stemming from a nervous breakdown. It is her first album since 1999's 'Rainbow,' and it serves as the soundtrack to the movie of the same name (a 1980s period-piece also starring Carey). The disc includes two covers: "I Didn't Mean To Turn You On" and "Last Night a DJ Saved My Life."

Title: Delta
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British folk rock band was produced by Paul Epworth.

Title: Lightning
Info: The fourth release for Brooklyn duo was self-produced and recorded in their former apartment in New York.

Title: Dead Son Rising
Info: The album of songs that grew from unused demos from his previous works was produced by Ade Fenton.

Title: New Eyes
Info: The debut full-length release for the British quartet known for its fusion of classical and electronic music features guest appearance from artists such as Jess Glynne, Love Ssega, Stylo G, and Elisabeth Troy.

Title: This Unruly Mess I've Made
Info: The second full-length release for the hip hop duo features guest appearances from such artists as Anderson .Paak, Leon Bridges, Chance The Rapper, DJ Premier, Idris Elba, KRS-One, Kool Moe Dee, and Ed Sheeran.

Title: In The Dark
Info: The third album for the Athens, Georgia rock band was produced with Ben Allen and  features new bassist Tim Deaux.

Title: Recess
Info: The debut full-length release for the Grammy-winning electronic artist includes guest appearances from Chance the Rapper, Diplo, Ragga Twins, and Alvin Risk.

Title: No Mercy
Info: Written while serving his nearly year-long stint in federal prison, the Atlanta rapper’s seventh studio album features contributions from Kanye West, Drake and others stars.

Title: Born Villain
Info: The eighth studio album from Marilyn Manson was produced with Chris Vrenna.

Title: America's Sweetheart
Info: The (we hope) ironically-titled 'America's Sweetheart' marks the solo debut for the former Hole leader, who co-wrote this album with Linda Perry and Elton John lyricist Bernie Taupin.

Title: Counterfeit 2
Info: The Depeche Mode songwriter's second solo album is just like his first (1989's 'Counterfeit'): all covers. Here, he tackles Brian Eno's "By This River," The Velvet Underground's "Candy Says" (oh my), Nick Cave's "In My Time of Dying," Iggy Pop's "Tiny Girls," and seven other works by your favorite artists.

Title: Level II
Info: The newly-reformed Teddy Riley creation returns with its fourth album.

Title: Storytelling OST
Info: The Glasgow band's fifth album serves as the soundtrack to the Todd Solondz film of the same name--in theory, that is, as only a few minutes of this new material is actually used in the movie (in fact, much of the album was recorded after the movie was released). However, as with a typical soundtrack album, expect snatches of dialogue and numerous instrumental tracks interspersed with fully-developed songs.

Title: Judgement Days
Info: This is the U.K. rapper's second album.

Title: Ultra Payloaded
Info: The debut album for Perry Farrell's new band includes contributions from Peter Hook, Fergie, Thievery Corporation, Flea and John Frusciante.

Title: Early 21st Century Blues
Info: The Canadian band's latest includes two originals and nine covers, including versions of songs by U2, Bob Dylan and Bruce Springsteen.

Title: Let's Go Sunshine
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British indie pop band led by Luke Pritchard was produced by Brandon Friesen and Chris Seefried.

Title: >Album Title Goes Here<
Info: The latest release from the Canadian electronic producer features guest appearances from Cypress Hill, Wolfgang Gartner, Imogen Heap, Chris James, and Gerard Way of My Chemical Romance.

Title: Silesia
Info: The Swedish post-rock band blends ambient melodies with orchestral-like arrangements on its third release.

Title: Liverpool 8
Info: Ringo returns to Capitol Records to work with long-time producer Mark Hudson. But after a falling out, David A. Stewart, formerly of the Eurythmics, ends up finishing the record.

Title: Young Adults Against Suicide
Info: This is the debut LP for the Toronto indie-rap collective (excuse us, the "positive hardcore dance-rap band") led by Matt Collins.

Title: Girl Who Got Away
Info: The fourth studio release for the British singer-songwriter was co-produced with her brother Rolo Armstrong and includes contributions from such artists as Brian Eno, Greg Kurstin, Kendrick Lamar, and Rick Nowels.

Title: On My One
Info: The third full-length release for the British indie singer-songwriter features three songs co-produced with Jacknife Lee.

Title: 200 Years
Info: This debut album is the collaboration between Ben Chasny of Six Organs of Admittance and Elisa Ambrogio of Magik Markers.

Title: The Meth Lab
Info: The first full-length solo release for the Wu-Tang rapper in nine years features guest appearances from Carlton Fisk, Donny Cacsh, Chedda Bang, Dro Pesci, Eazy Get Rite, Hanz On, Hue Huf, Inspectah Deck, iNTeLL, Kash Verrazano, Killa Sin, Masta Killa, Mack Wilds, Raekwon, Redman, Streetlife, and Uncle Murda.

Title: Lights And Sounds
Info: The emo-pop-punk-with-violin outfit expands their sound for their second major-label release. The Dixie Chicks' Natalie Maines guests.

Title: LP1
Info: The UK singer-songwriter releases her fifth studio album of soulful songs, produced by Dave Stewart.

Title: ...it falls apart
Info: The fourth album from the Bay Area indie rockers (led by singer-guitarist Carlos Forster) is their first in three years.

Title: Writers Without Homes
Info: The London-based collective is joined this time out by the likes of Simon Raymonde (Cocteau Twins), John Grant (The Czars) and Paul Anderson (Tram).

Title: Cry
Info: This is the first new album in three years for the country superstar.

Title: The Seventh Seal
Info: The rap artist releases his first solo album in ten years.

Title: Leave This Town
Info: The American Idol contestant returns with his band's follow-up to its Grammy-nominated self-titled debut.

Title: Mr. Brown
Info: This is the debut LP for the Atlanta-based singer best known for his work with OutKast and as a member of the Organized Noize crew.

Title: Yeah Ghost
Info: The fourth album for Henry Binns and Sam Hardaker features a new singer, Eska Mtungwazi (longtime contributor Sia has branched off to her own solo career).

Title: TheFutureEmbrace
Info: The Smashing Pumpkins/Zwan leader's solo debut includes a cover of the Bee Gees' "To Love Somebody." Jimmy Chamberlin and Robert Smith guest.

Title: Bread & Circuses
Info: The latest album for the indie rock band was produced by Youth.

Title: Unbroken
Info: Some of the third studio album for the former star of Sonny With A Chance and the Camp Rock movies was recorded after she sought treatment for self-harm and bulimia.

Title: La Liberacion
Info: The Brazilian band releases their third album of party pop and electronic rock.

Title: Midnight Memories
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British/Irish pop quintet is said to be more "rockier" and features songs written by the band as well as with such artists as Tom Fletcher, Danny Jones & Dougie Poynter of McFly, Jacknife Lee, Gary Lightbody of Snow Patrol, and Ryan Tedder of OneRepublic.

Title: Equals
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was influenced in part by his marriage, the birth of his daughter and the death of a friend.

Title: Night Train [EP]
Info: The British rock band releases its EP featuring K'Naan and Tigarah as guest artists, as well as one song with the band's Tim Rice-Oxley on lead vocals.

Title: In This Light & On This Evening
Info: The third album for the British rock band was produced by Flood.

Title: Echo
Info: The second album for the "X Factor" winner features production help from a variety of people including Justin Timberlake, Ryan Tedder, John Shanks, and Max Martin.

Title: The Deadbeat Bang of Heartbreak City
Info: The fourth full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock band led by James Alex features contributions from  former Replacements bassist Tommy Stinson.

Title: I Love You
Info: The debut full-length album for Philadelphia-based rapper who is also involved with the groups Spank Rock and Sweatheart.

Title: Title
Info: The debut full-length release (not to be confused with herr 2014 EP of the same name) for the pop singer-songwriter who gained fame with her single "All About That Bass," features guest appearances from John Legend and Shy Carter (on the deluxe edition).

Title: Endlessly
Info: The funky and soul-filled Welsh singer's second album blends soft ballads with upbeat pop tracks, revealing a range of influences from the retro 1960's to modern day disco sounds.

Title: BE
Info: The second release for the band led by Liam Gallagher was produced by Dave Sitek.

Title: Unfamiliar Faces
Info: The California-born singer's follow-up to his 2006 record was produced by No Doubt guitarist Tom Dumont.

Title: Remind Me Where The Light Is
Info: The second album for the Los Angeles indie-rock duo was produced with Michael Patterson and Nic Jodoin.

Title: Love The Future
Info: The duo of D.A. Wallach and Max Drummey release their debut album on Pharrell Williams' label after a bidding war by Kanye West's and Jermaine Dupri's own labels.

Title: Fast Man Raider Man
Info: The typically prolific Black returns with a 27-song, two-disc set produced by Jon Tiven. Among the many musicians lending a hand are Spooner Oldham and Levon Helm (The Band).

Title: Sweet Disarray
Info: The debut release for the Liverpool-based singer-songwriter was self-produced.

Title: Island Universe
Info: The second full-length release for the Orange County psych-rock band was produced by Hanni El Khatib and Johnny Bell of Crystal Antlers.

Title: Anna
Info: The third full-length release from the Manchester indie rock band adds dance elements to their sound.

Title: Again and Again
Info: The indie pop band from San Francisco releases another album of catchy, lo-fi tunes.

Title: In Our Space Hero Suits
Info: The debut album for the Swedish all-girl indie pop band.

Title: Getting Away With Murder
Info: The Northern California alt-metal band returns with a third album.

Title: Flamingo
Info: Known as the frontman for Las Vegas-based rock group, The Killers, Brandon Flowers ventures out on his own with a solo debut that sounds achingly similar to the melodic, Vegas-themed music of his band but with a more self-conscious approach.

Title: I Created Disco
Info: The debut album for the Scottish-born musician, who most recently worked on Kylie Minogue's comeback album.

Title: Sequel to the Prequel
Info: Produced by Stephen Street, the third full-length studio release from the indie rock band led by Pete Doherty is its first release since 2007's Shotter's Nation.

Title: Form & Control
Info: This is the second studio full-length album for the New York collective.

Title: Soul
Info: Seal sings some classic soul songs on his sixth album produced by David Foster.

Title: Mondo
Info: The debut full-length album for the Los Angeles-based indie duo of Asa Taccone (co-writer/producer of "Dick in a Box") and Matthew Compton was produced by Danger Mouse.

Title: Hit the Waves
Info: The third full-length release for the Swedish indie-pop quartet is its first in five years and was produced with Daniel Lissvik.

Title: The  Duke
Info: Joe Jackson tribute album to Duke Ellington includes guest appearances by such artists as Iggy Pop, Sharon Jones, Regina Carter, ?uestlove, Christian McBride, and Steve Vai.

Title: You Have No Idea What You're Getting Yourself Into
Info: This is the debut album for the electronic rock quartet from Reading, England.

Title: Let's Just Be
Info: This is the singer-songwriter's first album with new backing band The Lonely Astronauts.

Title: Shaman
Info: Attempting to duplicate the unexpected mega-success of 1999's 'Supernatural,' the rock veteran returns with the formula intact, loading this disc with numerous guests from various musical genres to appeal to as many potential fans as possible. The list of contributors reads like the introductions to some televised awards show: Michelle Branch, Nickelback's Chad Kroeger, Seal, Macy Gray, Musiq, Placido Domingo, Ozomatli, Dido and P.O.D. (What, no Ozzy Osbourne?)

Title: Dead Media
Info: Following 2000's 'We Love The City,' the self-produced 'Dead Media' is the UK band's fifth album in just four years.

Title: Natural Rebel
Info: The fifth full-length solo release for the British rock artist was produced with Jon Kelly and Emre Ramazanoglu.

Title: Mania
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Chicago pop-punk band features a guest appearance from Burna Boy.

Title: Grasque
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Danish project of Jannis Noya Makrigiannis features a variety of influences including Danish pop, hip-hop, R&B, and techno.

Title: Blurred Lines
Info: The sixth full-length release for the R&B singer features guest appearances form 2 Chainz, Kendrick Lamar, Pharrell, and T.I.

Title: Zeitgeist
Info: The Smashing Pumpkins return from a seven year hiatus with their latest album. Best Buy, Target, and iTunes will each have CDs with different tracks from those available at other retailers.

Title: Sing-Sing And I
Info: This is the second album for the duo of Emma Anderson (Lush) and Lisa O'Neill. Mark Van Hoen returns as producer.

Title: With a Little Help from My Fwends
Info: The Wayne Coyne-led band covers The Beatles' 1967 album Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band, with guest appearances from such artists as Julianna Barwick, Black Pus, Miley Cyrus, Dr. Dog, Electric Würms, Foxygen, J Mascis, Moby, My Morning Jacket, Phantogram, and Tegan and Sara.

Title: Collections
Info: The second release from the British indie dance trio includes influences from R&B and hip hip.

Title: This New Day
Info: This fifth album for the Brit rockers was produced by Youth.

Title: The Beat Is...
Info: The Danish group returns with its second album on new label Polydor.

Title: Overlook
Info: The Azure Ray singer self-produced her fourth solo album.

Title: Legion Of Boom
Info: The third album for the Los Angeles-based electronica duo of Ken Jordan and Scott Kirkland includes guest appearances by Wes Borland (Limp Bizkit), Lisa Vennum-Kekaula (The BellRays), Jon Brion and Milla Jovovich.

Title: The Music
Info: They may not be easy to look up in search engines, but this very-much-rock quartet from Leeds, England could be found in all the UK music magazines, thanks to a much sought-after EP and this debut album.

Title: Beat 'Em Up
Info: This is Iggy Pop's first album since 1999's poorly-received 'Avenue B.'

Title: Red Pill Blues
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles rock band led by Adam Levine features guest appearances from ASAP Rocky, LunchMoney Lewis, Julia Michaels, and SZA.

Title: Lateness of the Hour
Info: The debut album for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Diplo and Switch.

Title: Wallflower
Info: Postponed from its October 2014 release due to pneumonia, the 12th full-length studio release from the Canadian jazz singer features songs that inspired her and was produced by David Foster.

Title: Hope St.
Info: The debut album for the Scottish alternative folk band was produced by Thomas McNeice (they originally worked with Jim Abbiss).

Title: Jennifer Hudson
Info: The debut album for the for the "American Idol" finalist features Ludacris, T-Pain, and Fantasia as guests.

Title: Blue Slide Park
Info: The debut full-length album for the Pittsburgh rapper follows the release of his 2010 mixtap K.I.D.S.

Title: Lies For The Liars
Info: The Utah emo band's third disc is their first since the departure of drummer Branden Steineckert.

Title: Venom
Info: The fifth full-length for the Welsh metal band was produced by Carl Bown and Colin Richardson

Title: Chaos and the Calm
Info: The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter who won the 2015 Brits Critics' Choice award was produced by Jacquire King.

Title: Dope Don't Sell Itself
Info: The latest full-length release for Atlanta rapper 2 Chainz features guest appearances from 42 Dugg, Beatking, Jacquees, Swae Lee, Lil Baby, Lil Durk, Major Myjah, Moneybagg Yo, Roddy Ricch, Sleepy Rose, Stove God Cooks, Symba, and YoungBoy Never Broke Again.

Title: Anywhere I Lay My Head
Info: The debut album by actress Scarlett Johansson was produced by TV on the Radio's Dave Sitek.

Title: Luciano Berio: Laborintus II
Info: Mike Patton's latest solo album is a tribute to Luciano Berio's  Laborintus II, created in 1965 to celebrate the 700th anniversary of the birth of Dante's Alighieri.

Title: Euphoric Heartbreak
Info: The second album from the alternative rock band from Glasgow was produced by Flood.

Title: Fist Of God
Info: The Toronto duo's latest album feature guests such as E-40, Ghostface Killah, and John Legend.

Title: KHALED KHALED
Info: The 12th full-length studio release for the hip-hop artist features guest appearances 21 Savage, A Boogie Wit da Hoodie, Justin Bieber, Big Sean, Bounty Killer, Buju Banton, Capleton, Cardi B, DaBaby, Drake, James Fauntleroy, H.E.R., Jay-Z, Jeremih, Lil Baby, Lil Durk, Lil Wayne, Meek Mill, Megan Thee Stallion, Migos, Nas, Post Malone,, Puff Daddy, Roddy Ricch, Rick Ross, Bryson Tiller, and Justin Timberlake.

Title: Carl Barat
Info: The Libertines/Dirty Pretty Things singer releases his debut solo album.

Title: Now
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Canadian country singer-songwriter is her first studio album in 15 years.

Title: Glitterbug
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British indie rock band was inspired by trips to Los Angeles.

Title: In Between Dreams
Info: The mellow singer-songwriter re-teams with producer  Mario Caldato Jr. for this follow-up to 'On And On.'

Title: Scab Dates
Info: This live set from the neo-prog outfit was recorded on the road between May 2004 and May 2005.

Title: Evolution
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Chicago heavy metal band led by David Draiman was produced by Kevin Churko.

Title: Theme Park
Info: The debut full-length release from the British indie pop trio was produced by Luke Smith [Ed Macfarlane of Friendly Fires produced  "Tonight"].

Title: New Life
Info: The seventh album for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Brandy, Mary J. Blige, and Wale.

Title: Harmonies For The Haunted
Info: This is the second album for the 80s New Wave-influenced outfit fronted by Shawn Christensen.

Title: Supermodel
Info: The second full-length release for the indie pop band led by Mark Foster was produced by Paul Epworth.

Title: Autobiography
Info: A bit more "rock" than her older sister Jessica, the 19-year-old former ("7th Heaven") and current (her own MTV reality show) TV star makes her recording debut with these 11 tracks produced by John Shanks.

Title: Indicud
Info: The third full-length studio release for the producer-rapper features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, Michael Bolton, Haim, Father John Misty, King Chip, Kendrick Lamar, RZA, and Too Short.

Title: Fallen Empires
Info: The sixth album for the Northern Ireland alternative rock band was recorded in California and features Lissie, R.E.M.'s Michael Stipe, and Queens Of The Stone Age guitarist, Troy Van Leeuwen as guests.

Title: Live: Uurop VIII-XII/Places in Sun & Winter, Son
Info: The 12th live release for the band contains tracks from its European tours between 2008-2012.

Title: Born Into This
Info: The latest album from the British metal band and its first on Roadrunner Records.

Title: Bunkka
Info: Legendary producer/remixer/DJ Paul Oakenfold (Happy Mondays, Perfecto Records) has finally gotten around to releasing an album as an artist. Vocals on this 11-track set come from the likes of Hunter S. Thompson, Nelly Furtado, Tricky, Perry Farrell, Grant Lee Phillips, and Emiliana Torrini.

Title: 2000 Years of Human Error
Info: The first release from the D.C. band since they became the first group signed to Marilyn Manson's Posthuman Records. Includes a cover of the Beatles' "Eleanor Rigby."

Title: Return To V
Info: There's at least one guest vocalist on each of the 18 tracks on this latest solo outing from electronic producer Roni Size.

Title: The High End Of Low
Info: Twiggy Ramirez returns to the band on its seventh studio album, produced with Sean Beavan and Chris Vrenna.

Title: 31 Minutes To Takeoff
Info: Known as "Baby Timberlake," this Duke University student is a pop singer who stands on his own, going from a dorm-room mixtape to potential stardom with his new album.

Title: Goodbye Lullaby
Info: A divorce and two-year break left Lavigne with plenty to ponder, and her newest album is one of her most personal and introspective albums to date.

Title: Young the Giant
Info: The debut album for the indie rock band from California was produced with Joe Chiccarelli.

Title: Alter The Ending
Info: The latest album for the Chris Carrabba-led band was produced by Butch Walker and Adam Schlesinger.

Title: The Lost Tapes II
Info: The second collection of unreleased tracks from the rapper's last four albums features guest appearances from Keyon Harrold, Al Jarreau, J. Myers, David Ranier, RaVaughn and Swizz Beatz.

Title: Free Spirit
Info: The second full-length release for the R&B artist features guest appearances from John Mayer and SAFE.

Title: Curtis
Info: The rapper's first album in two years includes appearances by Eminem, Justin Timberlake, and Mary J. Blige and production from Timbaland and Dr. Dre.

Title: K 2.0
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British band led by Crispian Mill is its first in six years.

Title: Big Love
Info: Produced by Andy Wright, Mick Hucknall returns with the 11th studio album for the British soul-pop band.

Title: Embrace
Info: This is the first release in eight years for the British indie rock band led by Danny McNamara.

Title: Swings Both Ways
Info: Produced by Guy Chambers, the swing covers and duets album from the British pop singer features guest appearances from Lily Allen, Michael Bublé, Kelly Clarkson, Olly Murs, and Rufus Wainwright.

Title: Cave Rave
Info: The second release for the British trio influenced by Spanish, Mexican, and African music was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.

Title: Credo
Info: This is the first album in more than a decade for the English trio.

Title: Emotion & Commotion
Info: The first studio album in nearly 10 years for the Grammy winner features Imelda May, Olivia Safe, and Joss Stone as guest singers.

Title: David Archuleta
Info: The American Idol runner-up releases his debut album.

Title: Romance At Short Notice
Info: The sophomore album for the indie rock band from England headed up by ex-Libertines guitarist Carl Barat.

Title: Live From Dakota
Info: This double-disc live set was recorded during the band's 2005 world tour.

Title: A Hyperactive Workout For The Flying Squad
Info: The seventh album for the British rockers includes appearances by Jools Holland and Paul Weller.

Title: Weezer (Teal Album)
Info: The surprise release from the alternative rock band that includes covers of songs made famous by a-ha, Black Sabbath, Electric Light Orchestra, The Eurythmics, Michael Jackson, Ben E. King, Tears For Fears, TLC, Toto, and The Turtles.

Title: I Love You, Dude
Info: The second album for the German electronic duo features a track co-written by Julian Casablancas of The Strokes.

Title: The Sweet Escape
Info: The singer's second solo set features production work by Nellee Hooper, The Neptunes, Swizz Beatz and Dave Stewart.

Title: Pop Psychology
Info: The third full-length release for the Utah band was influenced by the therapy sessions of lead singer, Tyler Glenn.

Title: Doggumentary
Info: The legendary rapper's release is his self-proclaimed sequel to his 1993 debut, Doggystyle, and features a slew of guest artists, from Kanye West to Willie Nelson.

Title: Senor Smoke
Info: The Detroit band returns with a second album.

Title: Borrowed Heaven
Info: The Irish quartet returns with their first studio disc in four years, which sees them working with producer Olle Romo for the first time. Ladysmith Black Mambazo guest on the title track.

Title: D12 World
Info: The Eminem-led collective (whose 2001 debut was a huge commercial success) returns with a second full-length, with production from the likes of Dr. Dre, Mr. Porter, Eminem and Kanye West.

Title: Baby Monkey
Info: Voodoo Child is the electronic dance music alter-ego for Moby, and this is his first full album under that name, after a series of singles released during the 1990s.

Title: It's All In Your Head
Info: This is the third album for the Los Angeles alt-rock trio led by singer Max Collins (who lately is best known for an indecent exposure incident in a Pittsburgh hotel lobby).

Title: On And On
Info: Professional surfer-turned-rocker Jack Johnson returns with his second LP of mellow alt-rock.

Title: I
Info: This is the first album in over three years (and first for new US label Emperor Norton) for the all-girl Japanese indie-electronic-rock-pop outfit. Money Mark and John McEntire make appearances here, although Cornelius does not.

Title: The Take Over
Info: The rap duo from Oakland, California releases its latest album on the Gold Dust Media label.

Title: Mr. A-Z
Info: Steve Lillywhite produced this second album for the singer-songwriter.

Title: Freedom
Info: The third album for the Grammy-winning singer/producer features guest appearances by Lil Wayne, T-Pain, Young Jeezy, and Wyclef Jean.

Title: Big Talk
Info: The Killers' drummer Ronnie Vannucci releases a solo album.

Title: Old Sock
Info: JJ Cale, Chaka Khan Paul McCartney, and Steve Winwood guest on the British singer/guitarist's covers album that includes two original songs.

Title: Best Night of My Life
Info: The fourth album from the stand-up comedian, actor, and singer features club bangers and his recognizable brand of R&B. It also guest stars Justin Timberlake, Ludacris, Soulja Boy, and others.

Title: The Sellout
Info: After a three-year hiatus, Macy Gray delivers soulful vocals, storytelling lyrics, and sparkling melodies on her latest album.

Title: I Think We're Gonna Need A Bigger Boat
Info: Norman Cook (also known as Fatboy Slim) releases his debut album under the alias The BPA.

Title: Happiness
Info: The debut album for the duo from Manchester, England, features Kylie Minogue on one track.

Title: To Lose My Life
Info: The debut album for the London trio was produced by Ed Buller and Max Dingle.

Title: The Dutchess
Info: The Black Eyed Peas singer's solo debut (which is produced largely by her bandmate will.i.am) includes her hit single "London Bridge."

Title: The Path of Totality
Info: On its 10th studio album, the West Coast nu metal band experiments with dubstep, collaborating with several on-the-rise producers, including Skrillex, Datsik, Kill the Noise, and 12th Planet.

Title: A French Kiss In The Chaos
Info: The second album for the rock band led by Jon McClure was produced by Jagz Kooner.

Title: Twelve Stops And Home
Info: This is the debut album for the London-based pop-rock five-piece.

Title: Schizophrenic
Info: The former member of *NSync makes his solo debut with 'Schizophrenic,' working with a range of producers including Basement Jaxx.

Title: Know Your Enemy
Info: The first album from the Manics in three years features the singles "Found That Soul" and "So Why So Sad."

Title: Crooked Shadows
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the emo band led by Chris Carrabba is its first in eight years.

Title: Again & Again
Info: This is the second album for the band formed in Berlin and named after the New Order song.

Title: Wikked Lil' Grrrls
Info: Andre 3000, Sean Lennon and Cee Lo guest on the first album in seven years for Canadian singer Jen-Bea Englishman.

Title: The Real Feel
Info: Pavement's Scott Kannberg returns to music as Spiral Stairs after a five-year hiatus.

Title: Slow Motion Daydream
Info: Art Alexakis & Co. finally return with a successor to 2000's 'Songs From An American Movie' pair of albums... but is anyone still listening?

Title: Songs From an American Movie Vol. One: Learning How to Smile
Language. Sex. Violence. Other?
Info: The UK rockers' fifth album is the first to feature new drummer Javier Weyler.

Title: Ferrari Boyz
Info: A collaborative effort from Gucci Mane and Waka Flocka Flame falls between a mixtape and an official release.

Title: Blaster
Info: The new solo project for the Stone Temple Pilots and Velvet Revolver singer features a new backing band called the Wildabouts.

Title: This Is War
Info: The Jared Leto-led rock band releases its third album produced with Flood and Steve Lillywhite.

Title: Is the World Strange or Am I Strange?
Info: This is the second album for the American-born and UK-based singer-songwriter.

Title: Native To
Info: The British trio, known for wearing masks, releases its debut full-length album of indie dance tunes.

Title: Often Lie
Info: Occasional Saddle Creek-er Denver Dalley returns with a second Statistics album.

Title: Korn III: Remember Who You Are
It Is Time For A Love Revolution
Info: Kravitz's eighth studio album was written and produced by Lenny himself.

Title: Breakthrough
Info: The second album for the California-born pop singer was produced by John Shanks and her father, Ken Caillat.

Title: Uncle Dysfunktional
Info: The Happy Mondays featured in the film "24 Hour Party People" release their first studio album since 1992

Title: Nobody's Daughter
Info: The band officially disbanded in 2002, but it's been more than 12 years since the Courtney Love-led rock band recorded "Celebrity Skin." A new lineup greets listeners as original members Eric Erlandson and Melissa Auf der Maur do not return.

Title: Velvet Changes
Info: This is the debut full-length pop release for Phil Jones as Dog Bite.

Title: Eats Darkness
Info: Broken Social Scene's Andrew Whiteman leads the indie rock trio with its third full length album.

Title: Crossing The Rubicon
Info: The third album for the Swedish five-piece rock group.

Title: Stir The Blood
Info: The third album for the New York City-based rock band was produced by John Hill.

Title: Odditorium Or Warlords Of Mars
Info: The Portland, Ore. band's follow-up to 'Welcome To The Monkey House' was co-produced by frontman Courtney Taylor(-Taylor) and Gregg Williams.

Title: How to Compose Popular Songs That Will Sell
Info: The fifth solo album for The Boomtown Rats singer is his first since 2001's Sex, Age & Death.

Title: A Fool for Everyone
Info: This is the second album for the guitarist-singer.

Title: Welcome Back
Info: He's gone from working with Puff Daddy to working with... uh, God, but ordained minister Mase is back to the rap game (albeit with fewer references to sex and violence) after a five-year absence.

Title: Human After All
Info: The French electronica duo's third LP is closer in sound to their first than to 2001's 'Discovery.'

Title: Rules
Info: The second album for the German-based band led by Kings of Convenience's Erlend Oye.

Title: 18 Months
Info: The third full-length release from the Scottish producer includes already released hit singles from Rihanna, Kelis, and Ne-Yo, as well as new tracks featuring guest artists such as Florence Welch, Dizzee Rascal, Ellie Goulding, Tinie Tempah, and Example.

Title: The Boy With No Name
Info: The fifth studio album for the Scottish four-piece includes production work from Nigel Godrich and Brian Eno.

Title: Born In The U.K.
Info: Lemon Jelly's Nick Franglen produced Damon Gough's fifth Badly Drawn Boy album.

Title: Soulsville
Info: From the early '80s on, this San Francisco-based band has had a slew of hits and, with the latest album, continues to experiment with vintage soul and rock.

Title: Suite #420
Info: The Houston rapper returns with his latest album, which coincidently is named Suite 420 and was released on April 20th.

Title: No. 6 Collaborations Project
Info: The fourth full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from 50 Cent, A Boogie wit da Hoodie, Justin Bieber, Camila Cabello, Cardi B, Chance the Rapper, Dave, Eminem, H.E.R., J Hus, Khalid, Paulo Londra, Ella Mai, Bruno Mars, Meek Mill, PnB Rock, Travis Scott, Skrillex, Chris Stapleton, Stormzy, Yebba, and Young Thug.

Title: Something To Be
Info: The Matchbox 20 frontman's first solo outing includes appearances by John Mayer and Robert Randolph.

Title: Another Country
Info: The 29th full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter follows 2013's Time with another album of originals songs (except for a cover of Steve Harley's "A Friend for Life").

Title: The Spirit Indestructible
Info: Furtado's first album after a six-year absence, The Spirit Indestructible was produced by Rodney "Darkchild" Jerkins and features a cameo appearance by Nas.

Title: So Long, Astoria
Info: Named after the setting of the 1985 film "The Goonies," 'So Long Astoria' is the major-label debut (and fourth studio LP) for the power-pop five-piece. Included here is a cover of Don Henley's "Boys of Summer."

Title: Let Love In
Info: Glen Ballard produced the band's eighth studio album.

Title: No Pier Pressure
Info: The latest solo studio release for the Beach Boy was produced with Joe Thomas and features guest appearances from Blondie Chaplin, Peter Hollens, Mark Isham, Al Jardine, David Marks, Kacey Musgraves,  Nate Ruess, Sebu Simonian, and She & Him.

Title: The Alphabet Of Hurricanes
Info: The Mercury Prize-nominated singer-songwriter releases his first album on the Cooking Vinyl label.

Title: Jigsaw
Info: The British rapper releases her second album on her own label, Midget Records.

Title: The Handler
Info: Har Mar's third disc features contributions from Northern State and members of the Yeah Yeah Yeahs and was produced by John Fields (Andrew WK).

Title: Paris
Info: The heiress and reality television semi-star covers Rod Stewart's "Do Ya Think I'm Sexy" (answer: no) and duets with Jadakiss on her recording debut.

Title: No Love Lost
Info: The third solo release for the Slaughterhouse rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Lloyd Banks, Fabolous, French Montana, Lil Wayne, Omarion, Royce Da 5'9", Twista, and Wiz Khalifa.

Title: Changes
Info: The first full-length studio release in nearly five years from the Canadian pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Clever, Kehlani, Lil Dicky, Post Malone, Quavo, Travis Scott, and Summer Walker.

Title: North
Info: The alternative rock band returns with its first full-length studio album in ten years.

Title: Tinted Windows
Info: The debut album for the band comprised of Taylor Hanson of Hanson fame, Cheap Trick's Bun E. Carlos, Fountains of Wayne's Adam Schlesinger and ex-Smashing Pumpkin James Iha.

Title: Golden Delicious
Info: Doughty's second studio album was produced by Dan Wilson, who cowrote songs with the Dixie Chicks.

Title: The New Folk Implosion
Info: Lou Barlow (Sebadoh) is still the heart of The Folk Implosion, but on the lo-fi band's fourth full-length release, his supporting cast has changed. Gone is co-founder and writing partner John Davis; in his place are Sebadoh drummer Russ Pollard and Alaska guitarist Imaad Wassif.

Title: The Last Temptation
Info: The hugely successful rapper returns with another Irv Gotti-produced effort, with guest appearances from Ashanti, Nas and Bobby Brown.

Title: Motion
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Scottish DJ/EDM producer features guest appearances from All About She, Big Sean, Ellie Goulding, Haim, Theo Hutchcraft of Hurts, John Newman, Gwen Stefani, and Tinashe.

Title: Live on I-5
Info: Soundgarden's first live release was recorded during their tour for Down on the Upside, shelved until their 2010 reunion.

Title: California Son
Info: The covers album from the former Smiths frontman was produced by Joe Chiccarelli with guest appearances from Billie Joe Armstrong, Ed Droste, Ariel Engle, Sameer Gadhia, Petra Haden, and Lydia Night.

Title: YOKOKIMTHURSTON
Info: Yoko Ono collaborates with Sonic Youth's Kim Gordon and Thurston Moore on this avant-garde release.

Title: Coup de Grace
Info: The third full-length solo release for the former frontman of The Rascals features songs co-written with fellow The Last Shadow Puppets member Zach Dawes, Jamie T, Lana Del Raye, and Mini Mansions' Tyler Parkford.

Title: Raditude
Info: The latest album for the California rock band features a guest appearance by Lil Wayne.

Title: Trill O.G.
Info: The third and final album from Bun B's Trill trilogy features such guests as Drake, Gucci Mane, Twista, Trey Songz, T-Pain, and Young Jeezy.

Title: Ten$ion
Info: The South African trio releases its second studio album on its own label, Zef Recordz, after leaving Interscope over the direction of its music.

Title: Heart Blanche
Info: The first full-length solo release of original songs from the Atlanta artist in five years features a tribute to the late Robin Williams.

Title: Magnetic
Info: The tenth full-length studio release for the alt-rock band led by  John Rzeznik was produced with Gregg Wattenberg, Rob Cavallo, John Shanks, and Greg Wells.

Title: Wake Up
Info: The debut full-length release for the California indie pop band includes four tracks from their 2012 self-titled EP.

Title: Weapons Of Mass Destruction
Info: The "Pimp My Ride" host returns to rapping after a two-year layoff, but without long-time producer Dr. Dre.

Title: Awake Is The New Sleep
Info: You may remember him as Australia's youngest rock star, but Ben Lee is a bit older (well, he's 26) and wiser (well, he's smart enough to date Claire Danes) now for his sixth album, produced (like his debut) by Brad Wood. Rilo Kiley's Jenny Lewis guests.

Title: Electra Heart
Info: The second album for Marina and the Diamonds includes production from  Greg Kurstin, Rick Nowels, Dr Luke, and Liam Howe.

Title: Lasers
Info: The Chicago rapper returns with his third album of slick, electronic beats and rhythms, featuring appearances by Skylar Gray and Trey Songz.

Title: Streetlights
Info: The rapper returns to release his latest solo album after working with DJ Quik on  BlaQKout.

Title: Happy Xmas
Info: The Christmas album from the British guitarist features one new original song and an electronic-inspired version of "Jingle Bells" dedicated to Avicii.

Title: Global
Info: The latest solo studio release for the Hawaiian-based Pennsylvania producer/musician features influences from electronic, rock, and soul music.

Title: Greatest Story Ever Told
Info: The fifth album for the rapper includes Akon, Chris Brown, Chamillionaire, Lil Wayne, Snoop Dogg, UGK, and Yung Joc as guests.

Title: Songs in the Key of Animals
Info: The second full-length release for the North Carolina singer-songwriter was recorded over a two year period.

Title: Cocky
Info: The Detroit rap-rocker may be feeling a bit like his album title after his previous effort, 1998's 'Devil Without a Cause,' went platinum. (Actually, he was feeling like that even before that happened.) Snoop Dogg and Sheryl Crow guest on a track apiece on this, his fifth album of new material.

Title: Wonders of the Younger
Info: The sixth-studio album from the Chicago-area rock band was produced by Ian Kirkpatrick.

Title: Satisfied at Last
Info: This is Joe Ely's first album since 2007's Happy Songs From Rattlesnake Gulch.

Title: Trash, Rats & Microphones
Info: This debut album for the New York-based electro-rock group is led by Heloise Williams and released on Elijah Wood's label.

Title: Peace Trail
Info: Recorded over four days, the 37th full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter features Jim Keltner on drums and Paul Bushnell on bass.

Title: Fireflies
Info: Byron Gallimore and Dann Huff produced the country singer's follow-up to 2002's "Cry."

Title: If Only You Were Lonely
Info: The big-selling indie emo band from Dayton, Ohio returns with a second album.

Title: Loud Like Love
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the alternative rock trio was produced by Adam Noble.

Title: Carry On
Info: The second solo disc from former Audioslave and Soundgarden frontman Cornell was produced by Steve Lillywhite and includes a cover of Michael Jackson's "Billie Jean."

Title: So-Called Chaos
Info: The Canadian singer-songwriter returns with ten new songs, co-produced by Morissette with John Shanks and Tim Thorney.

Title: Terra Incognita
Info: Juliette Lewis goes solo with this record produced by Omar Rodriguez-Lopez.

Title: Modern Rituals
Info: The debut album for the quartet from California-based indie rockers who met at New York University was produced by Emery Dobyns.

Title: rEvolver
Info: The latest album for the rapper includes guest appearances by Lil Wayne, Pitbull, Lily Allen, Wiz Khalifa, Chris Brown, and Ne-Yo.

Title: Weapons
Info: The fifth studio album for the Welsh hard rock band was produced by Ken Andrews.

Title: The Time Is Now
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Britihs R&B singer features guest appearances from Bastille, Chase & Status, JP Cooper, Goldlink, Ella Mai, and AJ Tracey.

Title: Travistan
Info: The leader of the now-defunct Washington, D.C. outfit The Dismemberment Plan makes his solo debut with this disc, produced by Death Cab For Cutie's Chris Walla. John Vanderslice guests.

Title: Until The End
Info: The third album for the all-girl Canadian metal band was produced by Steve Thompson (Anthrax, Korn).

Title: Mi Reflejo
Info: Mainly consists of Spanish-language versions of the songs from her hit debut album.

Title: Why You So Crazy
Info: This is the 10th full-length studio release for the Portland, Oregon alternative rock band.

Title: Sweet Talker
Info: The third full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, De La Soul, Ariana Grande, Nicki Minaj, and Lindsey Stirling.

Title: Peroxide
Info: The debut full-length release for the Scottish singer-songwriter was produced with Iain Archer and Jake Gosling.

Title: Rise Up
Info: The first album in six years for the rap group features Audioslave/Rage Against The Machine's Tom Morello and Linkin Park's Mike Shinoda as guest artists.

Title: These Are The Good Times People
Artist: The Presidents Of The United States Of America
Info: The first album in four years for the alternative rock band and the first with Andrew McKeag on the guitbass.

Title: Imaad Wasif
Info: Guitarist Wasif, who has performed with alaska!, Folk Implosion and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs, makes his solo debut.

Title: Seal IV
Info: Never one for original album titles, Seal returns with just his fourth LP in his 12+ year recording career. Trevor Horn produces.

Title: Oracle
Info: The all-girl metal band's sophomore effort (and no, we're not referring to their high school class) includes a cover of Pink Floyd's "Run Like Hell."

Title: Live at the Mark, Tom & Travis Show (The Enema Strikes Back)
Slash
Info: The debut solo album for the Velvet Revolver/ex-Guns N' Roses guitarist was produced by Eric Valentine and features guest appearances by Chris Cornell, Adam Levine, Dave Grohl, Kid Rock, Iggy Pop, and Fergie, as well as former Guns N' Roses members, Izzy Stadlin, Duff McKagan, and Steve Adler.

Title: Let the Bad Times Roll
Info: The first full-length studio release since 2012 for the Southern California punk band led by Dexter Holland was produced by Bob Rock.

Title: Dirty Vegas
Info: Who are Dirty Vegas? Chances are you have heard one and only one song from this UK poptronica trio: the track "Days Go By," used as the soundtrack to an overplayed Mitsubishi car commercial. This debut album features that song (twice) and ten others which have yet to appear on the telly.

Title: Artwork
Info: The rock band's fourth album produced by Matt Squire, is the first with new drummer, Dan Whitesides.

Title: Asleep In The Bread Aisle
Info: The debut album for the 23-year-old rapper from the suburbs of Philadelphia.

Title: Drogas Light
Info: The first of a planned trilogy of albums for the rapper features guest appearances from Big K.R.I.T., Gizzle, Victoria Monet, Rondo, Rick Ross, RXMN, Salim, Simon Sayz, Bianca Sings, Jake Torrey, and Ty Dolla $ign.

Title: Scars & Stories
Info: The third full-length album for the Colorado alternative rock band was produced by Brendan O'Brien.

Title: The Dark Leaves
Info: The latest album from the rock band was produced with Chris Hansen. Three of the songs were released on the three-part The Threep EPs released between November 2009 and March 2010.

Title: Lotus
Info: Cee Lo Green and Blake Shelton, co-judges on The Voice guest on the pop singer's latest studio release that also includes production from Alex da Kid, Jayson DeZuzio, Max Martin, and Shellback.

Title: Smalls Change (Meditations Upon Ageing)
Info: The debut solo release for the Spinal Tap bass player features guest appearances from Jeff "Skunk" Baxter, Gregg Bisonnette, Larry Carlton, David Crosby, Donald Fagen, Taylor Hawkins, Jim Keltner, Danny Kortchmar, Russ Kunkel, Michael League, Steve Lukather, Jane Lynch, Judith Owen, Phil X, Joe Satriani, Paul Shaffer, Chad Smith, The Snarky Puppy Horns, Steve Vai, Richard Thompson, Waddy Wachtel, Rick Wakeman, and Dweezil Zappa.

Title: Bridge
Info: The band's sixth album is their first since the death of bassist Bobby ("Brooklyn Bob") Sheehan and serves as a tribute to him.

Title: Bionic
Info: Feisty and futuristic, the platinum-blond pop singer's first album in four years features collaborations with Sia, Le Tigre and Ladytron, as well as other indie artists, to create a sonic landscape of sound unlike anything she's done before.

Title: If I Kill This Thing We're All Going to Eat for a Week
Info: Produced by Toshi Kasai, the debut full-length solo release for Foo Fighters/Sunny Day Real Estate bassist Nate Mendel features contributions from Sunny Day Real Estate's Jeremy Enigk, Helmet's Page Hamilton, The Head and the Heart's Josiah Johnson, Modest Mouse's Joe Plummer, and Foo Fighters' Chris Shiflett.

Title: Jason Derulo
Info: This is the debut album for the singer-songwriter who wrote songs for a variety of artists, such as Cassie, Danita Kane, Lil Mama, and Sean Kingston.

Title: The  Brink
Info: The second full-length release for the Australian indie quartet was produced by Dan Grech-Marguerat.

Title: Nothing But the Beat
Info: The French producer/DJ releases his fifth album which includes guest appearances from such artists as Flo Rida, Nicki Minaj, Taio Cruz, Ludacris, Usher. will.i.am, Chris Brown, Lil Wayne, Akon, Timbaland, Jennifer Hudson, Jessie J, and Sia.

Title: Closer Than Together
Info: the 10th full-length studio release for the folk-rock band was produced by Rick Rubin.

Title: At The End Of Paths Taken
Info: The veteran Canadian band led by songwriter Michael Timmins and singer Margo Timmins return with an 11-track disc of originals.

Title: The  Sound of Sunshine
Info: The artist's latest album with the band Spearhead continues his melding of hip-hop, reggae, and rock music.

Title: Tranquilizers
Info: With the addition of Woody Shortridge and Tak Takemura, the second release finds the band led by Phil Jones expanded to a quartet.

Title: Death to False Metal
Info: This collection of unreleased songs recorded by the band during the past 15 years was released the same day as the rerelease of 1996's Pinkerton.

Title: The Fray
Info: The follow-up to the Colorado quartet's twice-platinum debut album was produced by Aaron Johnson and Mike Flynn.

Title: Unbreakable
Info: The sixth studio album does not include Kevin Richardson, who left the group.

Title: End Titles: Stories For Film
Info: The latest album from the London electronic group features Josh Homme, Gavin Clark, Joel Cadbury, Philip Sheppard, Black Mountain, and Abel Ferrara as guest artists.

Title: The Temper Trap
Info: The second full-length album from the Australian indie rock band was produced by Tony Hoffer.

Title: Bleed Like Me
Info: 'Bleed' marks Shirley Manson and Butch Vig's first Garbage album since 2001. Dave Grohl guests on one track.

Title: Everything To Everyone
Info: The witty Canadian band with a devoted fanbase is back with their first album since the poorly-received 'Maroon.' Ron Aniello (Guster, Lifehouse) produces.

Title: The Golden D
Info: The second solo effort from Blur guitarist Graham Coxon, following 1998's 'The Sky Is Too High.'

Title: The Time Of The Assassins
Info: While waiting for the Strokes to return to the recording studio, bassist Nikolai Fraiture formed a side project and released this band's debut album.

Title: Haunted Cities
Info: This is the second album from the punk trio which features members of blink-182 (Travis Barker) and Rancid (Tim Armstrong).

Title: Painting
Info: This is the tenth studio release for the British rock band led by Steve Craddock.

Title: Stripped
Info: The 22-year-old pop star's second English-language album includes 20 new tracks, most penned by Aguilera herself, although suddenly ubiquitous Linda Perry assists on four songs. Guests include Alicia Keys, Redman, and Dave Navarro.

Title: Break The Cycle
Info: This is the sophomore major-label release for the New England alt-metal band.

Title: Morningwood
Info: Gil Norton (Pixies) produced this debut album for the New York-based punk/new wave outfit.

Title: Purple Naked Ladies
Info: The debut disc for the duo of Odd Future DJ Syd tha Kid and Matt Martians incorporates jazz, hip-hop, and R&B.

Title: Staind
Info: The Massachusetts nu-metal band release their seventh studio album.

Title: Testify
Info: Glen Ballard produced the nu-metal band's fifth album.

Title: Amber Headlights
Info: 'Headlights' includes songs first written by Greg Dulli (Afghan Whigs, Twilight Singers) in 2002. Petra Haden guests.

Title: The Black Magic Show
Info: The 1980s-alt-rock-influenced, Diego Garcia-led band returns with a second album.

Title: Operator
Info: The first new full-length release in five years for the Canadian electronic duo of Jesse F. Keeler and Al-P guest vocals from Chain And The Gang's Ian Svenonius.

Title: V
Info: The fifth full-length release for the Los Angeles rock band features a guest appearance from Gwen Stefani.

Title: Music of the Spheres
Info: The latest full-length release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Max Martin and features guest appearances from  BTS, Jacob Collier, Selena Gomez, and We Are KING.

Title: Mainstream Sellout
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for Machine Gun Kelly was produced by Travis Barker features guest appearances from  Landon Barker, blackbear, Bring Me The Horizon, Iann Dior, Gunna, Lil Wayne, Willow, and Young Thug.

Title: Mount Ninji and Da Nice Time Kid
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the South African rave-rap trio features guest appearances from Jack Black, Lil Tommy Terror, Sen Dog, and Dita Von Teese.

Title: Man of the Woods
Info: The fifth full-length solo studio release for the pop artist features guest appearances from Alicia Keys and Chris Stapleton.

Title: Head Above Water
Info: The first full-length studio release in over five years for the Canadian pop-rock artist features a guest appearance from Nicki Minaj.

Title: Give More Love
Info: The 19th full-length studio solo release for the former Beatles drummer features guest appearances by fellow bandmate Paul McCartney on bass on two tracks, ELO's Jeff Lynne, Greg Leisz, Eagles' Joe Walsh, and Don Was.

Title: Afterglow
Info: The Canadian singer-songwriter emerges from a period of inactivity with her first album of new material since 1997's 'Surfacing.' Frequent collaborator Pierre Marchand returns as producer.

Title: New Earth Mud
Info: Black Crowes frontman Chris Robinson takes leave from his band for this debut solo release.

Title: Full Speed
Info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles rapper features guest appearances from Bricc Baby Shitro, Chris Brown, Dej Loaf, R. Kelly, Migos, Tinashe, Trey Songz, Usher, and Young Thug.

Title: @Reverend_Makers
Info: The third release for the indie rock band led by Jon McClure was produced by James Dring and Youth.

Title: Medicine
Info: This is the third solo album for Jonathan Levi as Pop Levi.

Title: Enemies Like This
Info: This concise fourth album finds the New York band working with a new producer, Jagz Kooner (Sabres of Paradise).

Title: Based on a T.R.U. Story
Info: The Georgia rapper formerly known as Tity Boi releases his debut album on Def Jam and it features guest appearances from Drake, John Legend, Lil Wayne, Nicki Minaj, Mike Posner, Scarface, The-Dream, and Kanye West.

Title: Hymns
Info: Kele Okereke and Russell Lissack return with a new line-up for the indie rock band's fifth full-length release.

Title: Hold My Home
Info: The fifth full-length studio release from the indie rock band led by Nathan Willett is its first with new drummer, Joe Plummer.

Title: The Silver Lining
Info: The Dave Pirner-led band's first album in eight years includes tracks recorded with the group's late bassist Karl Mueller as well as The Replacements' Tommy Stinson (who, yes, served as a replacement).

Title: Kylie Christmas
Info: The Christmas album from the Australian pop artist features three originals and guest appearances from James Corden, Iggy Pop, and (with some technological help) Frank Sinatra.

Title: All Our Favourite Stories
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Nottingham indie pop quintet.

Title: Electronic Earth
Info: Emeli Sandé and Tinie Tempah appear as guests on the debut release from producer Timothy McKenzie.

Title: Free
Info: The Scottish rock band's second album was produced by Gil Norton.

Title: Mine Is Yours
Info: On its third album, Long Beach's indie rock quartet takes a more personal approach lyrically and gets a little more blues oriented musically--all while retaining its modern-rock sound.

Title: Hologram Jams
Info: The second album produced by John Goodmanson for Jaguar Love finds the band now just a duo comporised of ex-Blood Brothers/Pretty Girls Make Graves band members Johnny Whitney and Cody Votolato after J. Clark left the band in 2009.

Title: Gettin' In Over My Head
Info: These thirteen tracks mark just the third solo disc for the former Beach Boys songwriter, and include songs that Wilson has written over the past two decades. Paul McCartney, Eric Clapton and Elton John guest. (Sorry, no Snoop Dogg or Missy Elliott.)

Title: Blood Money
Info: Now backed by 50 Cent and his G-Unit, the duo of Prodigy and Havoc return with a follow-up to 2004's 'Amerikaz Nightmare.'

Title: Jekyll + Hyde
Info: The fourth major label studio release for the Grammy-winning band includes influences of rock, hip-hop, gospel, and big band with guest appearances from Sara Bareilles and Chris Cornell.

Title: Darkel
Info: 'Darkel' marks the solo debut for Air's JB Dunckel.

Title: Simpatico
Info: The veteran British rockers take a detour into reggae on their latest release.

Title: Havoc and Bright Lights
Info: The first album in four years for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Guy Sigsworth and Joe Chiccarelli .

Title: Amarantine
Info: The singer's first album in five years finds her once again collaborating with producer Nicky Ryan and lyricist Roma Ryan, and includes three songs in her new made-up language Loxian.

Title: The  Great Escape Artist
Info: The alternative rock group returns with its first album since 2003's Strays, with Dave Sitek joining the three original members on the Rich Costey-produced release.

Title: Sad Sappy Sucker
Info: This "lost album" from Modest Mouse was originally recorded in 1994 to be the band's debut album, but was eventually shelved. This release contains additional tracks recorded during the same time period as the original 'Sad Sappy Sucker.'

Title: Terror of Cosmic Loneliness
Info: The latest project for Super Furry Animals' Gruff Rhys has him teaming up with Brazilian artist Tony Da Gatorra. The making of the album is the subject of the documentary, Seperado.

Title: Life In Cartoon Motion
Info: Lebanon-born, London-based 23-year-old singer-songwriter Michael Holbrook Penniman makes his debut with this campy LP produced by Greg Wells.

Title: Music For The People
Info: The second album for the alt-rock band was recorded in analog.

Title: The Weight of Your Love
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Jacquire King and is its first without guitarist Chris Urbanowicz.

Title: Enclosure
Info: The latest solo release for the former guitarist of the Red Hot Chili Peppers was recorded at the same time as his collaboration with the Black Knights.

Title: No Boys Allowed
Info: With such guests as Rick Ross and Chris Brown featured on her album, the R&B songstress's sophomore album contains both club hits and seductive ballads.

Title: White Lilies Island
Info: Natalie Imbruglia's second album is a follow-up to her 1998 international hit debut, 'Left Of The Middle.' Ian Stanley and Pascal Gabriel are among the producers working on this disc.

Title: Timbaland Presents Shock Value
Info: The Hives, Fall Out Boy, Elton John, Justin Timberlake and Nelly Furtado are among the guests on the prolific hip-hop producer's latest solo disc.

Title: Somebody's Miracle
Info: After the critical lashing for her previous pop-oriented album, the singer-songwriter enlisted John Alagia (Dave Matthews Band, John Mayer) to produce this follow-up set.

Title: Animal
Info: The debut album for the singer who appeared on the Flo Rida single "Right Round."

Title: Payable On Death
Info: The born-again Christian rap-metal band returns with a follow-up to their 2001 hit 'Satellite.' Jason Truby replaces departed guitarist Marcos.

Title: Wild Ones
Info: The latest album from the rapper Flo Rida features guest appearances by Georgi Kay, LMFAO, Sia, and Jennifer Lopez.

Title: Something to Die For
Info: The Swedish dance-rock band brings the brilliance of new-wave revivalism to its new album.

Title: Overexposed
Info: The fourth full-length studio album for the rock pop band led by Adam Levine includes production from Benny Blanco, Max Martin, J.R. Rotem, Shellback, Ryan Tedder, Brian West, and a guest appearance by rapper Wiz Khalifa.

Title: Play On
Info: The third album for the multi-award winning country singer was again produced by Mark Bright.

Title: Look to the Sky
Info: Karen O, Tinted Windows bandmate Adam Schlesinger, Television guitarist Tom Verlaine, the Cardigans' Nina Persson, Tegan and Sara's Sara Quin, and Yeah Yeah Yeahs' guitarist Nick Zinner are some of the gust musicians on the former Smashing Pumpkins guitarist's follow-up to his 1998 solo debut, Let it Come Down.

Title: Strange Folk
Info: The British psychedelic rock band's third album was produced by Tchad Blake and Chris Sheldon.

Title: Mail On Sunday
Info: The debut album for the rapper includes such guests as Lil Wayne, T-Pain, Timbaland, and will.i.am.

Title: Godfather Buried Alive
Info: The B.I.G. soundalike has managed to generate a great deal of buzz for his second solo disc, chiefly by being behind bars, where he's serving out a ten-year prison term resulting from a bad night on the town with P Diddy. The vocals on one track were literally phoned in from prison, while production is handled by Kanye West, Swizz Beatz, Just Blaze and more.

Title: Are You Passionate?
Info: This mellow, soulful effort features backing from Booker T & the MG's as well as a single track with Crazy Horse.

Title: I Dreamed A Dream
Info: The Britain’s Got Talent runner-up releases her debut album produced by Steve Mac.

Title: Strength In Numbers
