Info: The third album for the UK band was produced by Flood and Paul Hartnoll.

Title: Wilder Mind
Info: The third full-length studio release for the British folk rock band was produced by James Ford.

Title: At Your Inconvenience
Info: The second studio album by the British rapper features appearances by Ed Drewett, Fink, Emile Sande, and others.

Title: Down To Earth
Info: The Welsh-born singer releases her follow-up to her 2004 debut, "Finally Woken."

Title: Old Boots, New Dirt
Info: The sixth full-length release for the country singer was produced by Michael Knox.

Title: Blacc Hollywood
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Grammy-nominated rapper features guest appearances from Curren$y, Ghost Loft, Juicy J, Nicki Minaj, Nas, Project Pat, Rick Ross, ScHoolboy Q, Snoop Dogg, Ty Dolla $ign, and Chevy Woods.

Title: Getting Away With It... Live
Info: This double-disc live album was recorded on the band's farewell tour in Manchester in 2001. Among the 22 tracks are most of the group's hits, including "Sit Down," "Laid," and "Born of Frustration."

Title: Diary
Info: This is the second release for the Mike Skinner and The Music's Rob Harvey collaboration.

Title: Prophets of Rage
Info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Tom Morello, Tim Commerford and Brad Wilk of Rage Against The Machine, Chuck D and DJ Lord of Public Enemy and B-Real of Cypress Hill was produced by Brendan O'Brien.

Title: Earth vs. the Pipettes
Info: The second album for the British indie pop band is its first with a new lineup, which consists of Gwenno and Ani Saunders.

Title: Bitchin'
Info: The seventh album for the California-based band.

Title: The Rainbow Children
Info: This religion-themed concept album is the artist's first official release in 10 years under the Prince name.

Title: Saints Of Los Angeles
Info: The metal band's first studio album since 2000's "New Tattoo" includes the album title song, which is available for use in the game Rock Band.

Title: It's Alive!
Info: Only guitarist Elliot Easton and keyboardist Greg Hawkes return from the Old Cars (well, actually, just the Cars), with frontman duties falling to Todd Rundgren after Ric Ocasek (wisely) said no. The album itself features three new studio tracks and a slew of re-recorded Cars classics.

Title: Hood Billionaire
Info: The seventh studio release for the rapper and his second in 2014, features guest appearances from Boosie Badazz, Big K.R.I.T., Jay-Z, K. Michelle, Project Pat, R. Kelly, Snoop Dogg, Whole Slab, and Yo Gotti.

Title: Boomkatalog One
Info: The brother-sister duo of Kellin and Taryn Manning was signed to a major-label deal in part on the strength of Taryn's burgeoning acting career, which has seen her in roles on TV's "Boston Public" as well as "crazy/beautiful" and "8 Mile."

Title: The Raven
Info: Available in two different versions, the latest from Lou Reed is based on the writings of Edgar Allen Poe. The 2-CD set includes tracks with readings of Poe by various actors (such as Willem Dafoe, Steve Buscemi and Amanda Plummer), backed by Reed, while the single-disc set pulls only the more song-oriented pieces from the longer version. Hal Willner produces.

Title: Junk of the Heart
Info: The English indie rock band return after a three-year hiatus with a new album.

Title: Planta
Info: Produced by David Sitek, the fourth full-length release for the Brazilian indie band is its first without bassist Adriano Cintra, who left the band in late 2011.

Title: Full Circle
Info: The hugely successful R&B group's first Arista release is typical Boyz II Men, meaning plenty of vocal harmonies and ballads.

Title: Everyday Demons
Info: The Northern Ireland rock band releases its first album in North America after featuring a track on the video game Guitar Hero: World Tour.

Title: Music From Another Dimension!
Info: Carrie Underwood and Johnny Depp appear as guests on the rock band's first studio album of new music in 11 years.

Title: Christopher
Info: The fourth release for the indie pop band led by Ryan McPhun was written after breaking up with his girlfriend and was inspired by the winter in Norway.

Title: Jesus Is King
Info: After several delays, the ninth full-length studio release for the rapper is set to be released on the same day as his concert film of the same name.

Title: In The City
Info: The debut album for the Miami-based artist features Lil Wayne, Nas and Rick Ross as guests.

Title: The Chronicles Of Life And Death
Info: The twentysomething pop-punkers attempt to move past their past TRL success with a more mature follow-up to 2002's 'Young And The Hopeless.'

Title: Damita Jo
Info: The nipple-baring superstar's first album in three years features production from Dallas Austin, Babyface, Kanye West, and Jimmy Jam & Terry Lewis.

Title: Communicate
Info: The trance DJ duo return with a two-disc mix set.

Title: HitNRun: Phase One
Info: Exclusively released on Tidal, the album co-produced by Joshua A. M. Welton features guest appearances from Curly Fryz and The Voice contestant Judith Hill.

Title: Wiped Out!
Info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles rock quintet led by Jesse Rutherford was produced by Justyn Pilbrow.

Title: Going Back
Info: With the help of three of the surviving Funk Brothers, Phil Collins recorded some Motown favorites for his first studio album in nearly 10 years.

Title: Dangerous Dreams
Info: This debut album for the Los Angeles-based '80s revivalists will give your favorite indie rock critics another excuse to practice typing "Gang of Four."

Title: Ocean Eyes
Info: This is the second full-length album for the Minnesota-born electronic artist.

Title: souljaboytellem.Com
Info: The sophomore album for the crunk- and snap-influenced rapper features Arab and I-15.

Title: Weezer [Black Album]
Info: The 13th full-length studio release (and sixth self-titled) for the Los Angeles alternative rock band was produced by Dave Sitek.

Title: The Illusion Of Progress
Info: Staind returns with its sixth album, produced by Johnny K.

Title: Anthem of the Peaceful Army
Info: The debut full-length release for the Michigan rock band was recorded by Marlon Young, Al Sutton and Herschel Boone in Nashville and Michigan.

Title: Witness
Info: The fifth full-length release for the pop artist features guest appearances from Skip Marley, Migos, and Nicki Minaj.

Title: Testimony: Vol. 1, Life & Relationship
Info: The neo-soul singer-songwriter's belated third album includes a cover of Don Henley's "The Heart of the Matter."

Title: Light
Info: The third album for the New York-based reggae artist was produced by David Kahne.

Title: Reincarnated
Info: Executive produced by Diplo and Major Lazer, the debut release for rapper Snoop Dogg under his new name was influenced by reggae and dancehall.

Title: Silence Is Easy
Info: The sophomore effort for the English quartet includes two tracks produced by the legendary (and allegedly homicidal) Phil Spector, with the remainder handled by John Leckie and Danton Suppie.

Title: Acoustic Sessions
Info: This is the debut acoustic album for Sean Lennon and his girlfriend Charlotte Kemp Muhl.

Title: Nightbird
Info: 'Nightbird' marks the first disc of original songs from the duo of Andrew Bell and Vince Clarke in five years.

Title: Dangerous And Moving
Info: Three years after their sensational debut (and we don't use that adjective in the way that means "outstanding"), it turns out that they aren't schoolgirls, and they aren't lesbians. But what the Russian duo does have on this second album is Sting. Now that's edgy!

Title: Rudebox
Info: William Orbit, Mark Ronson, Lily Allen and the Pet Shop Boys are among the collaborators on Williams' eclectic seventh studio disc, which finds him experimenting (never a good sign) with electronica and even hip-hop.

Title: We Don't Need To Whisper
Info: The first post-Blink-182 recording for Tom DeLonge finds the singer-guitarist in a new group with members of The Offspring and The Distillers.

Title: Business Casual
Info: 'Business Casual' is the debut LP for the dance-oriented Nebraska four-piece, who are frequently compared to some combination of Wire, XTC and Gang Of Four and don't sound an awful lot like any of the other bands on Saddle Creek's roster, save for maybe The Faint.

Title: Gold Cobra
Info: The nu-metal Florida quintet releases its sixth studio album; the first in more than a decade with the original lineup.

Title: All The Lost Souls
Info: The English singer wrote half of the songs while at Ibiza.

Title: Escapology
Info: UK pop star Robbie Williams follows the success of Sing When You're Winning with this, his fifth and most adult-sounding LP.

Title: Fly from Here
Info: The legendary English prog-rock band releases its 21st studio album, the first to feature Canadian singer Benoit David.

Title: Faith
Info: The second posthumous release for the rapper features guest appearances from 21 Savage & 42 Dugg, Beam, Bizzy Banks, Chris Brown, Future, Kid Cudi, Kodak Black. Dua Lipa, Pharrell, Pusha T, Quavo, Rah Swish, Rick Ross, Takeoff, The-Dream, TRAVI, and Kanye West.

Title: State
Info: The latest solo release for the rock singer/producer was recorded on a laptop and integrates electronic music elements to rock and soul music.

Title: Every Man For Himself
Info: The unfortunately-named Agoura Hills, Calif. rockers--now down to a trio after losing their bassist--return with a third album.

Title: Super Animal Brothers III
Info: The Baltimore via North Carolina duo release their latest album.

Title: Palookaville
Info: Damon Albarn and Bootsy Collins guest on Norman Cook's fourth Fatboy Slim album, which includes a cover of "The Joker" by the Steve Miller Band.

Title: Love, Shelby
Info: The Grammy-winning artist follows her 2000 hit 'I Am Shelby Lynne' with ten new tracks produced by Glen Ballard (Dave Matthews Band, Alanis Morissette), including a cover of John Lennon's "Mother."

Title: Donda
Info: The 10th full-length release for the rapper was originally announced to be released in July 2020.

Title: Heaven & Earth
Info: Produced by Roy Thomas Baker, this is the latest release from the progressive rock band with its new lead singer, Jon Davison.

Title: Make a Scene
Info: The fourth album for the British pop singer features guest appearances by Armin van Buuren, Freemasons, and Junior Caldera.

Title: Matinee
Info: The debut album from the British singer was produced by Jim Abbiss.

Title: Animal Ambition: An Untamed Desire to Win
Info: The first album in five years for the rapper features guest appearances from Guardan Banks, Jadakiss, Kidd Kidd, Mr. Probz, Prodigy, Schoolboy Q, Styles P., Trey Songz, and Yo Gotti.

Title: The DeAndre Way
Info: Titled after his birth-given name, Soulja Boy's third album is filled with catchy hooks and speaker-busting beats, keeping him one of the most ringtone-ready recording artists in the rap game.

Title: Trust Me
Info: The British singer's fourth album features a song sampling David Bowie's 'Let's Dance.'

Title: Always Outnumbered, Never Outgunned
Info: Once one of the top dance/electronica acts in the world, The Prodigy topped the UK charts in 1997 with 'The Fat of the Land' and then... nothing. Until now. After their 2002 comeback single "Baby's Got A Temper" flopped, Prodigy leader Liam Howlett scrapped the album in progress, jettisoned vocalists Keith Flint and Maxim Reality, and took a second stab at recording, enlisting Liam Gallagher, Twista and Juliette Lewis to sing, rap, and howl over what eventually became 'Always Outnumbered.'

Title: Bring on the Comets
Info: Bring on the Comets is the third album from the Louisville, Kentucky natives.

Title: Universal Mind Control
Info: The rapper's eighth album features Pharrell Williams, Cee-Lo Green, and Kanye West as guests.

Title: Make Believe
Info: Rick Rubin produced album number five for the Rivers Cuomo-led band.

Title: The Circle
Info: The New Jersey rock band releases its latest album produced with John Shanks.

Title: Keys To The World
Info: This is the third solo album for the former Verve frontman.

Title: Seventy Two & Sunny
Info: Kenny Chesney guests on '72 & Sunny,' the third solo disc for the Kid Rock protege.

Title: Slipway Fires
Info: The third album for the British quartet was produced by Mike Crossey.

Title: Back Home
Info: The guitarist's first album of original material in four years includes collaborations with John Mayer, Steve Winwood and Billy Preston.

Title: Sounds from Nowheresville
Info: The second album for the British duo was written on tour and recorded in Spain and Germany.

Title: Pressure Chief
Info: The Northern California band's fifth album in ten years includes a cover of Bread's "Guitar Man."

Title: This Is Me... Then
Info: Actress/singer J.Lo returns with 12 new tracks, including "Jenny from the Block," featuring guest appearances from Jadakiss and Styles. Lopez is also planning her first-ever tour in support of the album in 2003.

Title: Devil's Playground
Info: The 80s star returns with his first album in a dozen years.

Title: Client
Info: The female UK synth pop duo of Client A and Client B (we presume those are pseudonyms, but one never knows) make their debut with this self-titled effort, the first release for the new record label from Depeche Mode's Andy Fletcher.

Title: SuperHeavy
Info: Mick Jagger, Joss Stone, Dave Stewart, Damian Marley, and A.R. Rahman make up this rock supergroup, showcasing a wide range of musical genres.

Title: The  Incredible Machine
Info: Singer-songwriters Jennifer Nettles and Kristian Bush make up the country music duo, and their fourth studio album is influenced by the "steampunk movement" in science fiction.

Title: Latest Record Project, Vol. 1
Info: The 28-track release from Northern Irish singer-songwriter features songs about such topics as social media and the COVID-19 lockdown.

Title: Brave
Info: After the Spanish-only album "Como Ama Una Mujer" earlier this year, Jennifer Lopez returns with her latest English-language album.

Title: Size Matters
Info: The metal band returns after a seven-year recording hiatus with this new disc, produced by band leader Page Hamilton (the only original member here) with Jay Baumgardner and Charlie Clouser.

Title: Astronaut
Info: 'Astronaut' marks first album by Duran Duran's original lineup since 1983's 'Seven And The Ragged Tiger.' Dallas Austin and Don Gilmore are among the producers.

Title: New Glow
Info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Brooklyn indie-pop duo is their first on Harvest Records.

Title: Unpredictable
Info: The actor's second solo album (and first in over a decade) finds him joined by Mary J. Blige, Common, Timbaland, Snoop Dogg, Twista, The Game, and more.

Title: 20 Y.O.
Info: Jermaine Dupri co-produced the latest studio disc for his current girlfriend, the most-assuredly-not-20-year-old Janet Jackson. Nelly guests.

Title: The Declaration
Info: The fourth album for the R&B singer is her first album of new songs since 2004's "Concrete Rose."
Nelly returns with his sixth album, which is titled 5.0 in acknowledgement of his love of the Ford Mustang; it features collaborations with the Neptunes, Jermaine Dupri, Akon, and several others.

Title: Driving A Million
Info: The second album from the Los Angeles-based power trio (coming a full six years after their 1995 debut, 'Magnosheen').

Title: Dark Light
Info: This is the first U.S. release for the popular Finnish goth-rock band (the initials stand for His Infernal Majesty) fronted by Ville Hermani Vallo.

Title: Rise And Fall, Rage And Grace
Info: The first album in over four years for the California punk band was produced by Bob Rock.

Title: In My Mind
Info: One-half of the superstar production duo The Neptunes, Pharrell steps into the limelight with this long-delayed solo debut, which mixes both rap and R&B and includes collaborations Kanye West, Gwen Stefani, and Jay-Z.

Title: City Beach
Info: This is the first solo album for the former member of Luscious Jackson and Kostars.

Title: Black Swan
Info: The fourth album for the British indie rock band was produced by Tom Rothrock.

Title: F.A.M.E.
Info: The singer known for being constantly steeped in controversy turns the spotlight back on music with up-tempo R&B on his latest 13-track release, cowriting the majority of the record and incorporating a synth-pop sound.

Title: Destiny Fulfilled
Info: Despite her burgeoning solo career, Beyonce Knowles has rejoined bandmates Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams for the first Destiny's Child album in 3 years.

Title: Teenage Dream
Info: The Grammy Award-nominated singer's sophomore release is full of pop-rock gems and features guest appearances from Snoop Dogg and Rivers Cuomo.

Title: Rebirth
Info: Big Boi, Timbaland and Rodney Jerkins are among the producers for J.Lo's first album in three years. Other guests include Fat Joe, Fabolous and Marc Anthony.

Title: Fake Songs
Info: Best known as the co-creator of MTV's cult hit sock puppet show "Sifl and Olly," Liam Lynch has also studied music at Paul McCartney's academy and is a published writer. 'Fake Songs,' his first album, includes "United States of Whatever" (the most popular song from S&O and now a minor alternative radio hit) and such tracks as "Fake David Bowie Song," "Fake Pixies Song," and "Fake Depeche Mode Song."

Title: The Others
Info: This is the full-length debut for the London band led by 22-year-old Dominic Masters.

Title: Break Up
Info: The album of songs about a rocky love affair was recorded in 2006 (before Scarlett's 2008 covers album).

Title: The Pick Of Destiny OST
Info: The second album for the tongue-in-cheek rock duo of Jack Black and Kyle Gass serves as the soundtrack to their movie of the same name.

Title: Coming Up for Air
Info: The second full-length release for the Irish rock quartet was produced by Jacknife Lee.

Title: The Block
Info: Fourteen years since their last studio record, the Kids are back with their newest album on the Interscope label.

Title: Chapter II
Info: The Irv Gotti-created superstar returns with a quick follow-up to her hit 2002 self-titled debut.

Title: Street Dreams
Info: The sophomore release for the Brooklyn rapper features appearances by the ubiquitous Missy Elliott, Ashanti, M.O.P., Mary J. Blige and Snoop Dogg.

Title: Invincible
Info: The King of Pop's first full album of new material since 1992's 'Dangerous' features 16 tracks.

Title: Rebelution
Info: The fourth album for the Miami-based rapper is his first on J Records and features such guests as Akon and Lil Jon.

Title: Simple Plan
Info: The third album for the Quebecois punk-pop band was produced by Dave Fortman, Danjahandz, and Max Martin.

Title: The Fifth
Info: The fifth full-length release for the British grime rapper features  guest appearances from Bun B, Jessie J, Sean Kingston, Tinie Tempah, will.i.am, and Robbie Williams.

Title: Brett Anderson
Info: This is the solo debut for the former frontman of Suede and The Tears.

Title: Sticks + Stones
Info: The debut release for the British singer/rapper who appeared on the 2010 UK version of the X Factor show was produced by RedOne. The US edition has two songs that are different than the UK 2011 release.

Title: Untitled
Info: Drummer Terry Bozzio only features in half of the tracks on Korn's eighth album, which ends their current contract with Virgin.

Title: Todd Smith
Info: Mary J. Blige, Ginuwine, Juelz Santana, Timbaland, Pharrell, and other stars guest on the latest release from the veteran rapper known to his parents as James Todd Smith.

Title: Alive & Amplified
Info: The New York indie four-piece team up with, of all people, producers The Matrix on this follow-up to 'Electric Sweat.'

Title: Funstyle
Info: Liz Phair left Capitol Records in 2008. She released her latest batch of songs on the Internet in July 2010. The CD release includes the Girlysound Tapes, which are some of her earliest cassettes recordings.

Title: Listen
Info: The sixth full-length studio release for the French DJ/producer features guest appearances from Afrojack, Ladysmith Black Mambazo, John Legend, Magic!, Sam Martin, Nicki Minaj, Nico & Vinz, Bebe Rexha, Emeli Sandé, The Scipt, Sia, and Ryan Tedder.

Title: Grown & Sexy
Info: The R&B singer's first album in four years was produced by Gregg Pagani (LeAnn Rimes, Will Smith).

Title: Shaka Rock
Info: Chris "Frenchie" Smith produces the Australian hard rock band's third album.

Title: Days Go By
Info: The ninth full-length studio album for the punk rock band was produced by Bob Rock.

Title: See My Friends
Info: The first tribute collection of Kinks covers featuring participation from the leader who penned the pop hits himself -- Ray Davies.

Title: The Snare
Info: Looper's third album (and first for Mute Records) finds Stuart David & co. adopting a darker tone for these ten tracks, which are closely integrated with the band's new live show and promotional materials to tell the story of two characters named  Evil Bob and Peacock Johnson.

Title: The  Sea of Memories
Info: The English post-grunge group release their fifth studio album, produced by Bob Rock.

Title: Beerbongs & Bentleys
Info: The second full-length release for the rapper features guest appearaces from 21 Savage, G-Eazy, Swae Lee, Nicki Minaj, Ty Dolla $ign, and YG.

Title: Candy Ass
Info: The American Music Club frontman's latest solo release, like 2001's 'Invisible Man,' finds him dabbling with electronica.

Title: Clear as Day
Info: The debut album for the 10th season American Idol winner was produced by Mark Bright.

Title: I Am Not a Human Being II
Info: 2 Chainz, Drake, Future, Soulja Boy, and Trina are some of the guests on the 10th full-length studio release for the New Orleans rapper.

Title: Twisted Angel
Info: Little LeAnn Rimes, the former 13-year-old country sensation, has been remade as a teen pop star with this latest release, thanks to a new team of producers and songwriters. But will the teen pop buyers of the world accept the new LeAnn Rimes? If only we had the time to worry about such things.

Title: Until The End Of Time
Info: A double album of previously unreleased tracks from the late rapper Tupac Shakur, bringing his total of posthumous releases to four (with a fifth planned for Fall 2001). The songs were recorded during the sessions for 1996's 'Makaveli.'

Title: My Bloody Underground
Info: The 13th album from the group formed in San Francisco is its first in more than four years.

Title: A Moving Picture
Info: The second full-length studio release from the British grime artist features guest appearances from Katy B, Diane Birch, Etta Bond, Chasing Grace, Ed Sheeran, and Wretch 32.

Title: Here and Now
Info: Producer Mutt Lange returns to produce the Canadian hard rock band's seventh release, having previously worked on its 2008 album Dark Horse.

Title: Come Home the Kids Miss You
Info: The second full-length studio release for Kentucky rapper Jack Harlow features guest appearances from Drake, Lil Wayne, Justin Timberlake, and Pharrell Williams.

Title: Who You Are
Info: The Essex-born pop singer, Jessie "J" Cornish, makes her debut and has already created a buzz as the the recent Brit's "Critics Choice" winner.

Title: These People
Info: The fourth full-length solo release for the former Verve lead singer was co-produced with Chris Potter.

Title: Body Faucet
Info: The full-length debut for the Athens, Georgia, indie rock band named after a character from the animated series Rugrats was produced by Ben H. Allen.

Title: Up Guards and at 'Em
Info: The British rock band's third album was produced by Justin Gerrish.

Title: Turn It Up
Info: The debut album for the British singer/actress has already spawned a number one single in the UK.

Title: Doll Domination
Info: The sophomore album for the dance pop group includes guest appearances by Snoop Dogg, R Kelly, Missy Elliot, and Polow da Don.

Title: Don't Tread On Me
Info: The Omaha, Nebraska alt-rockers return with an eighth album.

Title: Tical 0: The Prequel
Info: Wu Tang Clan's Clifford Smith (aka Method Man) interrupts his budding acting career to return with his first solo disc in five years (and fourth overall). The guest roster includes Missy Elliott, Ludacris, Snoop Dogg, Ghostface, Redman, Busta Rhymes and RZA.

Title: Rotten Apple
Info: This second solo disc for the G-Unit rapper includes contributions from 50 Cent, Young Buck and Mobb Deep.

Title: Winning Days
Info: Working once again with producer Rob Schnapf (Beck, Guided By Voices, Elliot Smith), the Aussies return with a second LP.

Title: Time Changes Everything
Info: The guitarist for the legendary Manchester outfit The Stone Roses emerges with his very first solo album (after the breakup of his less successful second band, the Seahorses). It also marks the first appearance of Squire as a vocalist, as he sings on each of these 10 tracks.

Title: Lions
Info: 'Lions' continues to build on the sound established in 1999's 'By Your Side,' with this outing produced by Don Was.

Title: Matricidal Sons Of Bitches
Info: The latest solo release from the Fiery Furnaces musician was inspired by the low-budget films made by smaller Hollywood studios between the 1920s and the 1950s.

Title: Lil Boat 2
Info: The second full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Jban$2Turnt, K$upreme, Lil Baby, Lil Pump, Offset, PnB Rock, Quavo, Tee Grizzley, Trippie Redd, Ugly God, and YoungBoy Never Broke Again.

Title: A Little More Personal (Raw)
Info: The actress' second album rocks a bit more than her first, and includes covers of songs by Cheap Trick and Stevie Nicks.

Title: Lost And Found
Info: The actor and MC reunites with DJ Jazzy Jeff for several tracks on his ninth album, which also includes appearances from Mary J. Blige, Timbaland and Snoop Dogg.

Title: The  Runaway
Info: This is the third album for the two sets of brother and sisters produced Romeo Stodart with Valgeir Sigurosson.

Title: Revival
Info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Beyonce, Skylar Grey, Alicia Keys, Kehlani, Phresher, Pink,  Ed Sheeran, and X Ambassadors.

Title: More Than You Think You Are
Info: Still lowercase, the alt-rock band led by Rob Thomas (who is perhaps more famous for "Smooth" on Santana's 1999 album) returns with their third album, the first on which the band shared songwriting duties as a unit.

Title: Light After Dark
Info: Fraser T. Smith produced the debut album from the British singer who was discovered on MySpace.

Title: Necessary Evil
Info: The former Blondie lead singer releases her fifth solo album.

Title: This Machine
Info: The eighth studio album for the alternative rock band The Dandy Warhols was produced with Jeremy Sherrer.

Title: WZRD
Info: The debut album for the rock project from Kid Cudi and producer Dot da Genius features Empire of the Sun as special guests.

Title: Songs From Black Mountain
Info: Going on 15 years of recording, the once-popular Ed Kowalczyk & co. return with a follow-up to 2003's 'Birds Of Pray.'

Title: Everybody Hertz [EP]
Info: This ten-track release (officially, an E.P.) contains remixes drawn from the French duo's 2001 album '10,000 Hz. Legend.' There are three versions each of "Don't Be Light," "People In The City," and "How Does It Make You Feel," as well as the previously unreleased "The Way You Look Tonight."

Title: What About Now
Info: The 12th studio release for the New Jersey rock band was produced with Jon Shanks.

Title: Eminem Presents: The Re-Up
Info: Originally intended as an underground mixtape, this Eminem-curated disc--which includes 7 songs performed by Mr. Mathers himself, as well as cuts featuring 50 Cent, Lloyd Banks, Obie Trice and Bizarre--wound up with an official release.

Title: Birds Of Pray
Info: Ed Kowalczyk & co. return for their sixth album, produced by Jim Wirt (Incubus, Something Corporate).

Title: Blood Sport
Info: The band that gave us alt-radio hit "6 Underground" returns with a third album, although their second (1999's 'Splinter') failed to secure U.S. distribution. Guitarist Chris Corner now handles lead vocals, replacing the departed Kelli Dayton.

Title: Shock Value II
Info: The third solo album for the producer features appearances by Brandy, Miley Cyrus, Chris Daughtry, Drake, The Fray, Keri Hilson, Chad Kroeger, Katy Perry, and Justin Timberlake.

Title: Hotel California
Info: The third studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from such artist as 2 Chainz, Chris Brown, Jadakiss, Lil Wayne, Rick Ross, Game, and Wiz Khalifa.

Title: The Bridge: Concept of a Culture
Info: The first studio album from the rapper in over 20 years features guests such as Big Daddy Jane, Busta Rhymes, KRS One, Q-Tp, and Snoop Dogg.

Title: Underclass Hero
Info: The punk pop band releases its fifth studio album.

Title: Theology
Info: This unusual double-disc set pairs two albums with almost identical tracklistings. One (the "Dublin Sessions") is an acoustic set, while the second disc ("London Sessions") was recorded with a full band.

Title: #willpower
Info: The fourth solo studio release for the Black Eyed Peas members includes guest appearances from Justin Bieber, Chris Brown, Miley Cyrus, Skylar Grey, Nicole Scherzinger, Eva Simons, and Britney Spears.

Title: Chocolate Starfish and the Hot Dog Flavored Water
Dark Horse
Info: The Canadian rock band releases its sixth album produced with Mutt Lange.

Title: Switzerland
Info: The Detroit party-rockers return with a third album.

Title: All Things Bright and Beautiful
Info: The third studio album from Adam Young's Minnesota-based one-man band is melodic synth-pop laptop electronica.

Title: Gemstones
Info: The singer-songwriter (formerly of The Moldy Peaches) follows his acclaimed set 'Friends Of Mine' with this disc produced by Dan Myers.

Title: Borrell 1
Info: Backed by a three-piece band called Zazou, the debut release for the former Razorlight frontman was recorded in France before receiving more production work Trevor Horn.

Title: Paula
Info: The seventh full-length studio release for the R&B singer was dedicated to his wife, Paula Patton.

Title: Total Xanarchy
Info: The debut full-length release for the rapper features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, $teven Cannon, Diplo, and YG.
The debut full-length collaboration between Sting and Shaggy features contributions from DJ Agent Sasco, Aidonia, Morgan Heritage, Dominic Miller, and Robbie Shakespeare.

Title: Take A Look In The Mirror
Info: The California nu-metal band offers a back-to-basics approach on this sixth LP.

Title: Elixer
Info: The debut album from the new singer was packaged together with two albums by her producer, Prince.

Title: Guilt
Info: The New York rapper's second album features guest appearances by former Destiny's Child member LeToya Luckett, Ky-Mani Marley, Tech N9ne, J. Holiday, and Nice & Smooth.

Title: Moon Landing
Info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter includes production from Steve Mac, Tom Rothrock, Ryan Tedder, and Martin Terefe.

Title: P.D.A.
Info: This is the first full-length album for the San Francisco-based duo of Will Schwartz and Tomo Yasuda.

Title: Can't Be Tamed
Info: Miley breaks free from her role as Hannah Montana on Disney with a third CD of big ballads and dance beats.

Title: I Love You
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie rock quintet led by Jesse Rutherford.

Title: Second Round's On Me
Info: Eminem, 50 Cent, and Nate Dogg are among the guests on the Detroit rapper's second release.

Title: Stealing Of A Nation
Info: This third album for the Brooklyn five-piece post-punk/dance-punk outfit was produced by Max Heyes (Ocean Colour Scene, Doves).

Title: The King & I
Artist: Faith Evans and the Notorious B.I.G.
Info: Busta Rhymes, Jadakiss, Lil' Kim, Mama Wallace (Biggie's mother), Snoop Dogg, Styles P, and Jamal Woolard are some of the guests on the Faith Evans album that integrate some of the late rapper's material from previously released tracks into the 25-track release.

Title: Monkey Business
Info: Guests on the R&B outfit's latest include Jack Johnson, Justin Timberlake and James Brown.

Title: Streets Of Gold
Info: The Boulder, Colorado-based duo's third album of house party hits and pulsating electro-pop features Ke$ha as a special guest.

Title: Sex Dreams And Denim Jeans
Info: It's been three years since Uffie took the electro underground music scene by storm with her beats and rhymes. Her much anticipated new album promises to deliver even more modern dance club music and dubstep jams.

Title: Wanderlust
Info: The ex-Bush frontman returns with his first solo album produced by Bob Rock.

Title: Star Wars Headspace
Info: Executive produce by Rick Rubin, artists such as Baauer, Bonobo, Flying Lotus, Galantis, Kaskade, Royksopp and Rustie include sounds and/or dialogue from the Star Wars films on 15 tracks for this electronic compilation.

Title: If Not Now, When?
Info: The California band releases its sixth full-length studio album of soulful alternative rock.

Title: Beyond The Neighbourhood
Info: The third album from the UK group was self-produced by the band.

Title: Studio 150
Info: The veteran singer jams through covers of songs by the likes of Neil Young, Bob Dylan, and, er, Sister Sledge.

Title: Chapter V
Info: The band's fifth album was produced by David Bottrill (Tool).

Title: Louder
Info: The debut solo pop release for the Glee actress includes production from Chris Braide, Kuk Harrell, Anne Preven, John Shanks, and Stargate.

Title: Jordi
Info: The seventh full-length release for the Los Angeles pop-rock band led by Adam Levine features guest appearances from Bantu, blackbear, H.E.R., Juice WRLD, Megan Thee Stallion, Stevie Nicks, Nipsey Hussle, and YG.

Title: Yours Truly
Info: The Long Beach ska rock band, which disbanded in 1996 after the death of Bradley Nowell, returns with a new lead singer in Rome Ramirez on the debut album for newly renamed trio produced by Paul Leary of the Butthole Surfers.

Title: Songs from the Sparkle Lounge
Info: The 14th studio album for the rock band features Tim McGraw on one track.
The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Jeff Beck and Johnny Depp features 11 covers and two original songs.

Title: Evolve
Info: The third full-length release for the Las Vegas rock band features production from Alex da Kid, Jayson DeZuzio, John Hill, Joel Little, and Mattman & Robin.

Title: Brooklyn's Don Diva
Info: The rapper from Brooklyn releases her much-delayed follow-up to 2001's "Broken Silence."

Title: The  Beginning
Info: The album following The E.N.D., The Beginning is the sixth studio album from the hip-hop, dance-pop quartet.

Title: Sorry for Party Rocking
Info: The dance pop duo are back with their sophomore album of party anthems.

Title: Outta Sight / Outta Mind
Info: The New Zealand rockers return with a second album, produced by Led Zeppelin's John Paul Jones.

Title: Screaming Bloody Murder
Info: The Canadian rock band releases their fifth album of catchy punk songs and even some crossover pop jams.

Title: Pullhair Rubeye
Info: This is the first album-length collaboration for the married duo of Animal Collective's Avey Tare and Mum's Kria Brekkan. No, you are not crazy; every song is indeed (intentionally) played backwards.

Title: Everybody Wants To Be On TV
Info: Andy Green returns as producer for the second album for the British indie rock band.

Title: One Of The Boys
Info: Once upon a time a Christian rock singer, the now-pop singer releases her second album, produced by the likes of Butch Walker, Dr. Luke, Max Martin, Dave Stewart, and Greg Wells.

Title: Eureka
Info: Rooney's third album is its first on the band's own label and the last with bassist Matt Winter, who left the band to pursue a career in medicine.

Title: Big Bad World
Info: The fifth album for the rock band from Illinois, who's single 'Hey There Delilah' (off their 2005 album "All That We Needed" and re-released as a single in 2007) was nominated for a Grammy in 2008.

Title: This Is Forever
Info: The sophomore album for the Southern California-based group.

Title: Concrete Rose
Info: This third album for the Murder Inc. singer includes an appearance from Ja Rule.

Title: Have Mercy
Info: This long-delayed fourth album sees the New York garage rockers jumping to a new label.

Title: Life Love & Hope
Info: The first new studio album for the rock band led by Tom Scholz in 11 years includes three songs (2 are remixed songs from 2002's Corporate America) from the late-Brad Delp.

Title: Types Of Wood
Info: The spastic, Michigan electro-rock trio returns with a second, slightly more accessible, full-length.

Title: In a Perfect World
Info: This is the debut full-length release for the Irish rock quartet.

Title: Other People's Songs
Info: What could possibly be more relevant in 2003 than an 80s band covering their favorite hits of the 60s, 70s, and 80s? Tracks here include Peter Gabriel's "Solsbury Hill," Buddy Holly's "Everday," and The Buggles' "Video Killed the Radio Star."

Title: Hotel
Info: The latest from the New York-based techno guru eschews samples for live instrumentation and vocals (by the bald one himself), and is backed by a second disc of ambient works.

Title: Margins
Info: Margins is the solo debut from Maximo Park frontman Paul Smith. Spirited.

Title: Tourist
Info: This is the second album for the South London four-piece.

Title: Love?
Info: Jennifer Lopez returns after twins with a deeply personal seventh album, featuring collaborations with The-Dream and Tricky Stewart, Pitbull, and RedOne.

Title: Authentic
Info: The actor/rapper's first release in four years features guest appearances from such artists as Travis Barker, Bootsy Collins, Chuck D, Monica, Tom Morello, Brad Paisley, Seal, Snoop Dogg, Eddie Van Halen, and Charlie Wilson.

Title: Pull The Pin
Info: The Welsh band's sixth album was coproduced by Kelly Jones and Jim Lowe.

Title: The  Devil's Rain
Info: The first album in eight years for the punk rock group was produced by Ed Stasium.

Title: Earth To The Dandy Warhols
Info: The sixth album for the Portland, Oregon, rockers includes guest appearances by Dire Strait's Mark Knopfler and the Heartbreakers' guitarist Mike Campbell.

Title: Chapter 1: Snake Oil
Info: The country-inspired release from the DJ/producer features guest appearances from Danielle Bradbery, Blanco Brown, Zac Brown, Ben Burgess, Cam, Clever, Noah Cyrus, Jonas Brothers, Julia Michaels, Orville Peck, Thomas Rhett, Morgan Wallen, and Young Thug.

Title: Weird Revolution
Info: The first album in three years from the always bizarre Texans includes about two-thirds of the tracks from their unreleased 1998 effort "After The Astronaut."

Title: One More Light
Info: The seventh full-length release for the rock band features guest appearances from Kiiara, Pusha T and Stormzy.

Title: Harverd Dropout
Info: The second full-length release for Miami rapper features guest appearances from the 2 Chainz, Lil Uzi Vert, Lil Wayne, Offsett, Quavo, Smokepurpp, Kanye West & YG.

Title: (Together) [EP]
Info: This EP of remixed and extended versions of songs from the album Burst Apart features guest spots from Neon Indian, Bear in Heaven, and Nicole Atkins.

Title: My Conscience And I
Info: The London-based pop singer's debut album.

Title: Lulu
Info: Lou Reed and Metallica collaborated on this two-disc set of music based on Frank Wedekind's LuLu plays.

Title: True Magic [First Version]
Info: Kanye West and Pharrell Williams are among the producers for the rapper's follow-up to 2004's 'The New Danger.' This version of the album is no longer officially available for sale; a second version with new artwork and a new tracklisting will be released in the spring of 2007.

Title: Shape Shifter
Info: The majority of the songs on Carlos Santana's first album on the Starfaith label is instrumental.

Title: Guitar Heaven: The Greatest Guitar Classics of All Time
Info: Chris Cornell, Scott Weiland, Rob Thomas, India.Aire, Chris Daughtry, Nas, Chester Bennington, Joe Crocker, Gavin Rossdale, Pat Monahan, Yo-Yo Ma, Johnny Lang, Ray Manzarek and Jacoby Shaddix guest on the Clive Davis-produced covers album featuring Santana.

Title: Billy Talent III
Info: The third studio album (under the Billy Talent name) for the Canadian band was produced by Brendan O'Brien.

Title: Some Kind of Trouble
Info: The UK's singer-songwriter returns with an album of crooning love-tinged lyrical gems sung over melodious piano chords and guitars.

Title: A.K.A.
Info: The eigth studio release for the pop singer features guest appearances from French Montana, Iggy Azalea, Pitbull, Rick Ross, and T.I.

Title: Memphis Blues
Info: Superstar of the early MTV era, Cyndi Lauper is still a girl who just wants to have fun on her new album, featuring her unique style of sultry singing and guest appearances by BB King and Jonny Lang.

Title: Blood In My Eye
Info: 'Blood' represents the New York rapper's attempt to lash back at 50 Cent, who has spent the better part of the past year targeting Rule.

Title: T.O.S. (Terminate On Sight)
Info: The sophomore album for the New York rap group features Young Buck.

Title: All That I Am
Info: Why change a successful formula? Once again, the guitarist finds himself paired with a variety of all-star guests, including Michelle Branch, Joss Stone, Sean Paul, Aerosmith's Steven Tyler, Big Boi and Mary J. Blige.
The eighth full-length studio release for the Southern California alternative rock band was co-produced by Dave Sardy and Sonny John Moore (aka Skrillex), who also mixed the album.

Title: Como Ama Una Mujer
Info: "How A Woman Loves," J.Lo's first Spanish-language disc, is co-written and co-produced by her husband, Marc Anthony.

Title: Democrazy
Info: This limited-edition release from the Blur frontman consists of 14 original solo demos (recorded in hotel rooms during a recent tour) spread over four sides, each one clearly a work in progress.

Title: Good Morning Revival
Info: Twins Joel and Benji Madden lead the Maryland pop-punk outfit through 13 tracks on this delayed fourth album.

Title: Hell in a Handbasket
Info: The 12th album for rock singer/actor Meat Loaf was produced by Paul Crook and features guest appearances by Chuck D, Lil John, Mark McGrath, John Rich, and Patti Russo.

Title: Hannicap Circus
Info: The D12 member's debut set features appearances by Big Boi, Raphael Saadiq, Erick Sermon and Obie Trice and production from Eminem and Hi Tek.

Title: Generation
Info: This is the second album for the London-based electronica duo.

Title: Charmbracelet
Info: After proving that all that Glitters is not gold, can the best-selling female artist of the 1990s manage a hit in the 21st century?

Title: Crown Royal
Info: The legendary rappers' first album since 1993's 'Down With The King' includes guest appearances from Limp Bizkit's Fred Durst, Third Eye Blind's Stephen Jenkins and Sugar Ray.

Title: The Rebirth Of Venus
Info: Brad Wood returns to produce the Australian singer's seventh studio album.

Title: Memories: Do Not Open
Info: The debut full-length release for the electronic duo of Alex Pall and Drew Taggart features guest appearances from Jhené Aiko, Coldplay, Florida Georgia Line, Louane, and Emily Warren.

Title: I Am Me
Info: The second album by "singer" Ashlee Simpson was produced by John Shanks.

Title: Baptism
Info: Kravitz handled virtually all of the instruments for this seventh album, which features a guest appearance from Jay-Z on the track "Storm."

Title: Scream
Info: The latest solo album for the singer/guitarist was produced by Timberland and Jerome "J-Roc" Harmon.

Title: Jewellery Quarter
Info: This is the second album for the Birmingham, England-based rock band.

Title: It Had to Be You... The Great American Songbook
Info: With a title like that, you pretty much know what to expect from Mr. Stewart on this outing, which includes standards such as "They Can't Take That Away from Me" and "I'll Be Seeing You." To make matters worse, Dave Koz and Arturo Sandoval guest.

Title: iSouljaBoyTellem
Info: The follow-up to Souljboytellem.com was produced with producer Mr. Collipark and Polow Da Don.

Title: Cosmos Rocks
Info: The debut album for Paul Rogers as the lead singer is Queen's first album of new material in more than 10 years.

Title: Somethin' 'Bout Kreay
Info: The Oakland rapper's debut full-length studio release features such guest artists as 2 Chainz, Diplo, and Kid Cudi.

Title: What The...
Info: The first release of new material from the punk band founded by Greg Ginn since 1985 includes Ron Reyes and new drummer Gregory Amoore.

Title: Hoodstar
Info: Timbaland, Jermaine Dupri, and Kwame are among the producers on the rapper's third album, which also includes an appearance by Three 6 Mafia.

Title: Super Collider
Info: The first release away from Roadrunner Records for the metal band led Dave Mustaine was produced by Johnny K.

Title: All The Right Reasons
Info: The Canadian alt-metal outfit returns with a self-produced fourth album.

Title: 14 Shades Of Grey
Info: The alt-metal band returns with a follow-up to their 2001 megahit, 'Break The Cycle.'

Title: A Lively Mind
Info: 'A Lively Mind' is the second artist album for the veteran DJ, producer and remixer. Guest vocalists include actress Brittany Murphy, Pharrell Williams and Grandmaster Flash.

Title: Never Gone
Info: This is the first album in five years for the boy- er... man-band.

Title: Liz Phair
Info: The far-from-prolific singer-songwriter's fourth album finds a 36-year-old Liz Phair trying to be... Avril Lavigne? Yes, her sound has changed quite a bit since her acclaimed 1993 debut 'Exile in Guyville,' taking on a glossy pop sheen on this release, thanks to production by the Matrix (as well as Michael Penn and Pete Yorn, we might add--but the Matrix????).

Title: Jagged Little Pill Acoustic
Info: To celebrate the 10th anniversary of her debut, 'Jagged Little Pill,' the Canadian singer-songwriter has re-recorded all of that album's songs using acoustic instruments. (It's certainly easier than writing new songs!)

Title: Graffiti
Info: The third album for the R&B singer features Game, Lil Wayne, Lupe Fiasco, Plies, Swizz Beatz, Trey Songz, Eva Simons, and Tank as his guest singers.

Title: BAYTL
Info: This is the debut album for the collaboration between Atlanta rapper Gucci Mane and Bay Area-based V-Nasty.

Title: United Nations of Sound
Info: The British band, formed by former Verve frontman Richard Ashcroft, features production by hip-hop virtuoso No ID and crosses musical genre borders.

Title: (One)
Info: Three former members of Jane's Addiction--including guitarist Dave Navarro--are joined by singer Steve Isaacs for this new project.

Title: DUMMY BOY
Info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from  A Boogie wit da Hoodie, Anuel AA, Gunna, Tory Lanez, Lil Baby, Nicki Minaj, Murda Beatz, Bobby Shmurda, DJ Spinking, TrifeDrew, and Kanye West.

Title: Fortune
Info: The fifth album for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Sabrina Antoinette, Big Sean, Nas, Kevin McCall, Sevyn, and Wiz Khalifa.

Title: Life On Display
Info: The Nirvana-esque four-piece returns with a follow-up to their 2001 major-label debut 'Come Clean.'

Title: Slick Dogs And Ponies
Info: The sophomore album for the quartet from San Diego.

Title: Nine Track Mind
Info: The debut full-length release for the pop singer-songwriter who co-wrote the Wiz Khalifa song “See You Again,” features guest appearances from Selena Gomez and Meghan Trainor.

Title: Rebirth
Info: On his seventh album called Rebirth, Lil Wayne fuses rock with his rap lyrical flow and features guest appearances from Eminem, Shanell (aka SNL), Kevin Rudolf, Nicki Minaj, and others.

Title: One
Info: The UK dance trio returns with a sophomore release, adding more guitars into the mix in the process.

Title: Testify
Info: Phil Collins returns with his first album of new material in six years, but will anyone care other than the guys on South Park?

Title: Famous First Words
Info: The debut album for the British pop rock band, which was originally known as Brother, was produced by Stephen Street.

Title: Results May Vary
Info: The critics were not kind to this follow-up to 'Chocolate Starfish...,' which sees the band with a new guitarist (who won the slot in a competition held at various Guitar Centers!) replacing the departed Wes Borland.

Title: Playing With Fire
Info: Now that Britney has dumped him, all he has is his music. Ouch.
